From pushing on a pen hard enough on my leather case to damage the screen underneath, to an unexpected swim in the toilet, I've broken a few. The second to last found me buying the Kindle Fire. Sure, the web browsing, colorful and glass (ugh) screen were nice. The biggest drawback was the battery that just didn't last and would run out when I wanted to read something the most. Did I mention I break things? Yup, that one still works.....if you can see through the cracks in the glass.I finally wised up and got what I realized I needed: a lightweight basic reader that holds all my content and the battery seems to last forever. It's not pretty, and sometimes it gets a little tricky to change pages as the ""swipe"" isn't as crisp as the others I have had. Still, there is no glare like the Fire can have on sunny days. It's small, yet easy to read, with or without reading glasses as the font is adjustable. I use a light leather cover and it's held up very well, even to my standards.If you are looking for all the bells and whistles, keep looking. If you are looking for a portable, easy to use and see companion for your everyday travels and don't want to worry about your battery crapping out, then this model is something you'll appreciate. Great, functional tool for the job.","Lightweight, no nonsense reader for a practical guy.";;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"After using this for over a month I've come to hold the opinion that the older Kindle models were much better.  I like to write notes, lists, etc. while I read and now that Amazon has disabled active content, I have to keep pen and paper near at hand.  I also like to read outside, or rather, I used to.  The touchscreen can be triggered by flies, so when I set my kindle down for a minute I often find I've lost my place because a fly had landed on the screen.  There are a few other quirks that are mildly annoying.  On the positive side, the battery life is good.  I wouldn't waste your money on this device, you'd be better off buying a cheap Android tablet and running the Kindle app on it.Update: The update issued in early 2016 has made the device defective.  After 1 hour, 46 minutes with support, they acknowledged the defect and I was told there was nothing they could do.  Basically, the made my device defective then refused to repair or replace it.  This company seems to have shifted from caring about whether or not you were satisfied with your purchase to getting every last penny they can out of you.",I much prefer the older models;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I love it, however, I wish the screen was bigger. I couldn't find a glare free version with a bigger screen.I love my kindle. If I forget to take the hard copy of lecture notes with me to school, I know I have my kindle with me. I'd send the pdf version to my kindle.","I won't panic, if I forget my notes.";;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"Not user friendly like the Kindle keybad version.  YOu have to scroll through a long user guide to find a topic.  It is not intuitive at all, like how to get the desired icon to show.  Like how to make it appear by swiping.  I need to work with it more to see if I can understand but may return it.It would be nice if I could get a hard copy version of the user guide.",Not user friendly like the Kindle keybad version;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"This was my first Kindle purchase, and I ended up returning it after a two-week trial period. Here's why: 1) Yes, I am one of those people who was disappointed that there was no brightness control; I found the screen far too dim much of the time
Review: no matter what font I chose. 2) For me
Title;;;;;;: the interface was awkward and not enjoyable to use;" it simply didn't have the intuitive feel of other devices I'm used to. 3) Perhaps most importantly
column4: I don't consider the $79 price to be """"cheap
column5: " as many other reviewers find it. Especially when the Kindle Fire HD 6 is only $20 more and offers TONS more functionality. For what it does (and what it doesn't do) $79 is no bargain. If it were offered at half that price
column6: I might consider it
column7: though even then the lack of brightness control would probably be a deal-breaker.""
column8: Too little product for too much money";;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this Kindle for myself, and it is a great reading tool that makes my life much easier. Usually, I used my iPad to read some ebooks, but this kindle is better for reading. Unlike my iPad, I do not have to worry about running down my battery after hours of reading. It's also good and easy on my eyes since the device has the same brightness with everything else , so no adjustments of eyes are needed. More importantly, I love Word Wise, which automatically shows simple definitions above difficult words, so I do not have to check the dictionary. Overall, it is a light, easy to use  and convenient reading device for everyone.",A great reading device that makes my life easier;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm disappointed that I've lost my bookmarks and highlights on the 300 or so books that I had on my old Kindle as well as syncing to furtherest point read. This device would be fine for someone just starting out with a Kindle, but frustrating for an existing user. At this point, I'm reading new books on the new device and I'm reading my older books on my old Kindle. There may be a way of fixing my problem with bookmarks, etc., but if so, it doesn't happen automatically. I do like that it's lighter than my old Kindle.",Disappointing;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Here's a short reviewLoving to read on a device is what the kindle is MEANT TO DO.Texture - The kindle 6"" has a rough/smooth back finish and smooth all around the front and reading on this device is one of the MOST PRACTICAL things I can do on my free time as it offers glare free screen, it doesn't strain my eyes, and I can pull it out of my pocket anytime I would like to read.Features - The home interface is simple and choosing one of my books is as easy as pressing and tapping. My favorite feature of the kindle is that it has a dictionary I can check for words I do not understand but it only works when it is connected to the wifi network.Durability - I've dropped  the kindle once the day after I got it and it just BOUNCED and it landed without scratches or dents. I believe it's made of high quality plastic that can absorb shockCON - The speed at which a page loads when you flip a page is not as snappy as you would have on a smartphone. That's the only minor problems this has but I guess it wouldn't be considered a problem to everyone else.",Small and compact;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I like the touch screen but in all honesty would give it up in a heartbeat for the battery life these used to have,  I went from charging my old one once a month to charging this one almost every day.  I don't expect it to last more than a year because rechargeable batteries have a limit how many time they can be charged, most of them 500 times.  When the battery is gone I will probably switch to reading on the kindle app on my phone.  To be honest I don't even use this that much and the wifi is never on unless I am downloading something.  I don't suspect that this would even last an hour between charge for most people.",Touch screen is nice..Battery life is horrible;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"My dad has always has a passion for reading. Due to macular degeneration he is losing his sight and gave up on reading. I thought why not try a kindle, I was afraid it would be to techy for him and since he lives in another state I wouldn't be able to assist him.  Well he loves it. He reads one to two books a day. I know because his kindle is linked to my account so I have been paying for them. I don't have the heart to tell him so I will continue to pay for them. He did pay for all my books while I was growing up and I got my love for books from him so is a small price to pay. If you have someone in your life with low vision try a kindle. My dad calls at least once a week to thank me and it's been six months.",He did pay for all my books while I was growing up and I got my love for books from him so is a small price ...;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"-- Pros --1. Since the Kindle PaperWhite is only a fraction of an inch smaller than this Kindle, then this product can fit into a PaperWhite case as long as it's not a snap-in case (which is really handy because it's almost impossible to find cases for this one.  See Con #1).  It's a bit snug and the auto on/off won't work because the PaperWhite mechanism is different, but at least it fits.  Amazon itself has made cases that fit this kindle, but as far as I know there's only about 6.2. Pretty much everything advertised.3. I can go on my library website and borrow kindle books for free.  Works so easily and I've used it several times.  Just get a library card from your local or main branch and find your library on Overdrive.com (At least, that's the site my library is on.  Just ask a librarian if yours is different).-- Cons --1. Like I mentioned before, it's almost impossible to find a case specifically for this Kindle.  Why?  Because it's only called ""Kindle.""  And all the other Kindle models -- whether it be Fire, Paper White, Voyage, Touch, or another -- are also called ""Kindle.""  All these models (especially Fire, which is also in its 7th generation) are significantly more popular than this very good though rather badly titled model.  Therefore, it is impossible to find the very few accessories for this Kindle while they drown helplessly amid the several hundred results for the Kindle Anything-Else-But-This-One. ;)  Like I mentioned;" it's a very good product.  It's just fallen victim of a rather obvious but still painfully detrimental marketing misstep.2. It glitches every once in a while if I try to push too many buttons
Review: and then I loose info like how many ages I read in FreeTime that day
Title;;;;;;: but that's pretty rare.3. The battery only lasts weeks if you keep it on Airplane mode
column4: which is usually fine because it really only uses internet when you're shopping.***6 MONTH UPDATE***Con #2 is becoming a bit more prevalent.  What does the glitch look like?  Well
column5: the Kindle stops responding without for a few seconds.  I usually notice when I go to turn a page and nothing happens.  A moment later the screen spasms in a display of black-and-white rectangles before going white.  Another moment
column6: and I see the """"loading up"""" screen
column7: which is a picture of a boy sitting under a tree with a progress bar in the foreground.  After about 10-20 seconds
column8: everything is normal except for the fact that it's forgotten my page number and has returned me to the spot I left off the day before.My Kindle glitches several times a week (I use it every day) and it almost invariably looses my place in whatever book I'm reading.  It's not that big of a deal to find my place again
column9: but it is a bit disappointing.""
column10: Great Product With One Rather Sad Marketing Error";;;;

Rating: 2.0 out of 5 stars,"I have been a happy Amazon customer for over a decade, with a purchase history of six kindles for myself and family, but this touchscreen display kindle is NOT in any way an ""upgrade"" from the previous version with buttons on the console.First, the kindle will, for no reason whatsoever, simply change the font size, usually from my preferred third smallest to the largest or, occasionally, again for no reason whatsoever, to the absolute smallest. It's a PIA.More an obstruction, however, is the sensitivity of the touchscreen. You can touch the right hand portion of the screen with your finger, in order to advance to the next page, but if your finger hovers a second over the screen, it will quickly advance numerous pages (as much as 10-20 pages), which makes determining where the hell you were immensely difficult. I am in the habit of reading my daily New York Times on the kindle, and this causes perennial problems.Another troubling aspect with sensitivity is how, by just holding the kindle, if your thumb or a finger touches the screen, you change the page or call up some feature.The touchscreen is such a problem that I have considered buying a used older version (that no longer is offered new), but the battery would be so old that battery life would likely be almost non-existent. I know that you can buy replacement batteries but that is a lot of work just to get a decent previous version of a kindle because the newer version is sub-standard.Amazon, you aren't Apple. I won't be buying your technology if it's introduced faulty from the get-go, especially when I can use other readers to do what the kindle does.I am leaving this review with two stars, not because I am pleased with the reader, which I have had for two months, but because I am managing to still use it, despite the impracticalities, although I will buy either a new non-Amazon replacement or an Amazon working upgrade soon.Caveat emptor.",Trouble in the Kindle Paradise;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I give the reader four stars only because I give five stars only for a product that is truly outstanding. This Kindle reader is very good...but not outstanding. That said, it delivers for the price. Previously I bought the Kindle Voyage and own both an iPad and an android tablet. Without going into detail, each has a use for me (except for the old iPad). I felt I needed reader but did not feel like paying the price of another Kindle Voyage. This Kindle gives value for the price. A feature I like about both the Kindle and the Kindle Voyage is their size. I can stuff them into the pockets of just about any of my trousers, just as I used to do with my soft back books as a kid, and pull them out at any time. Navigating them is easy, however I have to say that I find my android tablet much more functional in this regard. But one must keep in mind, this is a reader, not a tablet. One needs ambient light to read, not with the Voyage, though, but cannot surf the net or take or download pictures as one does with a tablet. On the other hand, the Kindle sips energy. I am a voracious reader, so I had to charge my tablet daily. Not the Kindle reader. I can drag the thing with me wherever I go and pull it out anytime anywhere, confident that I will be able to tune out and read. I admit I do bang it around. Did the same thing with my books as a kid. Still, I did not buy the cover as I did with the Voyage. I wanted to cut down on its weight. This has proven to be a good call. At first glance, the screen seems miniscule, but after use one finds it quite sufficient. The font can be modified as well as the size of the print. To my delight, the Kindle also has the dictionary function that I used so much in my Voyage and tablet. I would recommend the old Kindle as an everyday knockabout reader to anyone.",The Kindle delivers for the price;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I wanted to love the Kindle. I really did. I am a book restorer so I did not go into this lightly. I spent hours researching the pros and cons of e-readers, comparing various e-readers, etc. Amazon happened to be offering a monthly payment plan so that kind of sealed the deal for me. A little over $10 a month until it was paid off, excellent! Totally manageable. And at first the Kindle was wonderful. I took it with me everywhere. I got a sturdy case and took good care of it, but it was my constant companion.Then, a few months after I purchased it, just after I finished paying it off, it broke. I went through the troubleshooting process and the rep determined I needed a new one. No problem, these things happen. I get a new one almost immediately and ship the old one back.Then, another few months later, it breaks again. This kindle sat on my bookshelf unless I was reading it because I was so scared it would break like the last one. What is the point of a kindle if you have to leave it on the shelf and never take it out of the house?In under a year I have had two Kindles break. I have spent the past few hours chatting with different reps trying to find a solution to this problem and I just got apologies and a small credit to my account. While appreciated, it doesn't do much. Actually, I was promised a certain dollar amount for my credit and have received only half of what was promised. My warranty expires in 8 days and then, when this next kindle they are sending me inevitably breaks from the extreme wear and tear it gets ON MY SHELF, I will be left to either buy a new one or forget the Kindle entirely.Honestly, the nook is looking really good right now.",I wanted to love the Kindle;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"No flip page buttons, no options for orientation. no charger, no support for active content, lower quality finish... A good value only at $49 during Black Friday.The touch screen is ok, although is easier to skip pages unintentionally. Easier to use the on-screen keyboard with touch than with the ""joystick"" of the previous version.Different dimension then the previous version, so a new cover is required - not from Amazon though, they are charging nearly as much for the cover as for the device! - and the same goes for the charger.Speaking of dimensions: it is a bit shorter and much thicker, feels quite chunky. Lower quality finish, the rubberized back is gone, edges are barely rounded.Still, beats anything else in bright light, so try to get it on sale.","Less features, higher price? Buy it only on sale, $49 is about right for it.";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I have had this kindle for a few weeks now. I have grown to appreciate it for what it is. What I mean by that is this device met most of my expectations but I have found that I may have had unrealistic expectations. I had expected that it would have the capability to display books in color. It never occurred to me that a device made in this day and age would have a black and white ONLY display. This is not a complaint as such, just heads-up for others who might not have considered this. I re-read the description of this device on amazon and did not find any reference to it being black and white only. I could have missed it or they may have rectified it by now.It is, however, fantastically suited for text-based book reading which is, of course it's primary function. The fonts are a little chunky when viewed up close, but resolve themselves very nicely when viewed at normal reading distance. If the font size is increased slightly, it becomes very comfortable for my ""mature"" eyes to read. It is useful even on low-light situations. It is easily much more legible than a book for reading in any given situation. It is much more comfortable to hold than most books. (I find myself over-bending the spine on my paperbacks so that I can clearly read the print that is near the fold.)The experimental browser has worked moderately well for basic internet browsing but is, of course also hobbled by the fact that the device is only black and white.I paid $20 for the ad-free version but received the one with ads. I contacted amazon and got an almost instant reply with an offer to refund the $20 or send me another. I opted for the $20 refund and am glad I did. The ads don't bother me at all and if I truly don't want to see them I can turn it off. I would almost say it is an advantage to have the advertising because it gives me ideas on what to read next.As a side note, I will post a picture that fans of the hitchhiker's guide will appreciate as soon as I finish my current project. :-)",The facts as I see them in black and white;;;;;;

Review: This is a really neat device but is way more complicated than the older versions. It is not totally obvious how it works and the directions are too long and complicated. Also I think that it is ridiculous that the plug is not included you have yo buy it. That is crazy but I do have a spare. Very small and light. May be a little too small although the screen side is the same I think. What is upsetting is every time you have to get a different Kindle the size changes so you cannot use your previous cover!
Title;;;;;;: This is a really neat device but is way more ...;;;;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my second Kindle Touch. I lost my original one, which was a first or second generation model.  I was disappointed when I received the new one - the exterior has a cheap feel to it, and it lacks some of the features my first one had - like the ability to store and play mp3s, and having a 'text-to-speech' feature that allowed it to read to you.  Usually the later versions of Kindles improve on the earlier versions.  This one went backwards.",I was disappointed when I received the new one - the exterior ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"The digital age of book reading has been great for me, a voracious reader since the age of seven. To be able to find, download, and begin to read a book within a matter of minutes is nothing short of amazing. When it happened, I could not make the switch from paper books to the digital variety fast enough.I purchased my first Kindle years ago. While I enjoyed reading books on it, the screen left much to be desired. Amazons early Kindle operating system was faulty in that it didnt always recognize input when touching the screen. The new version for 2014 has rectified many of those issues, while maintaining its very small form factor, but it has not all together eliminated the touchy OS problems. There is still a notable lag when pressing a button on-screen, and there is also a delay in showing text while typing on the virtual keyboard. None of these or other minor flaws takes away from how great the Kindle is.IMG_5325The latest Kindle sports a 6-inch non-glare screen, in a very thin, small form-factor that is perfect for people who dislike bulky tablets. It has Wi-Fi, plus a 20% faster processor than the Kindle from 2013. A speedier processor means pages are redrawn faster on screen, giving an even more like a book feel to the Kindle.IMG_5326The Kindle on top of the iPad Air 2 for size comparisonThe improved battery lasts, and lasts, and lasts. From the time I started testing this Kindle to when I needed to plug it in for a charge was almost two weeks. Two weeks! Amazing.It is, however, not easy for me to recommend the standard Kindle priced at $79 when you can move up to a Kindle Paperwhite for less than twice the price. The KindlePaperwhite has a back-lit, or glowing, screen, meaning you can read it in a dark area. Not so with this basic Kindle review unit, which needs exterior illumination.pageA great Kindle feature is that all your books can stay on the same page, no matter if you are using Kindle hardware or a Kindle reader app on your iPad, iPhone, etc.While the text is not as crisp as I would like, it is still easier to read long-form than on a tablet, thanks to the E-Ink display. I get eye strain from looking at my iPad for long periods of time, but never with the Kindle.In the context of contemporary devices that do everything, its nice to have a purpose built Kindle that is designed to do one thing and do it very well: let you read! The Kindle family has seen many changes over the years, and keeps getting better and better. For the price, the Kindle is an easy choice to buy. If you use Amazon, and are a Prime member, there really is no excuse not to have a Kindle. Just save for the superior Kindle Paperwhite.MyMac.com review rating: 8 out of 10",My MyMac.com Review;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I got this for Christmas, so have been using it for about 3 months. I really enjoy reading most books on the Kindle. The text is very clear and, as advertised, works in bright sunlight. The screen also is designed so that you don't really notice smudges or fingerprints while reading. It's much lighter and smaller than a paper book so it's perfect for reading on the bus and I love that I can get ebooks from my library straight to my Kindle. The battery life is incredible (I can read quite a few novels before needing to recharge) and one of the biggest selling points of the device.However, it is not a robust device. I bought a sleeve for it to protect the screen and kept my Kindle in the sleeve whenever I was taking it anywhere. I still ended up with 3 scratches on the screen in less than 3 months. So I've had to put a screen protector on my Kindle, which means I no longer have a glare-free screen. It seems like it's either keep the Kindle screen as is, unprotected, and enjoy the glare-free matte finish but have lots of scratches or use a screen protector and read with glare but no scratches (except the ones that are already there from the 3 months without a screen protector). I am very disappointed that my screen scratched so easily because I was quite careful with my Kindle in general. Another thing that I find irritating is that lint seems to get stuck between the screen and the black plastic casing and is very hard to remove. This is more of a nuisance than a real issue until you go to put a screen protector on, then the lint creates air bubbles.Overall, I would cautiously recommend a Kindle to someone looking for an ereader, but I'm very glad I didn't spend more than $59 on it (bought during Christmas promotions). I would advise anyone to buy some sort of sleeve or case for your device immediately and use it diligently to avoid scratches on the screen. I'd also advise getting a screen protector--but give yourself a few days to enjoy how great reading on the Kindle is before compromising the reading experience with a screen protector.",Great for reading but screen is VERY delicate!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Being my first Kindle, I chose the entry level priced model and am very happy with it.  I don't mind that it is not lit as I don't need to read it in the dark.  I love being able to download books to take with me on a trip - although I still take physical books with me too, can't help mysef :) - and I especially love being able to send my own material, either saved pdfs or inspirational material I've written for myself, to my Kindle via my Kindle email address as an attachment with CONVERT in the title.  I can't remember where I picked up this tip but it's a fantastic service.  I always keep my Kindle in my handbag because my idea of hell is being somewhere - even for ten minutes - without somewhere to read, lol.  I bought a Kindle cover locally and like that I can hold it more like a book, plus it's protected in my bag.  I've looked at the fancier Kindles but at this stage and very happy with this one.","Love having a Kindle, this one is an excellent beginner's model";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I won a Kindle 6"" at an Awards Dinner, (as a door prize) ..... Lucky Me...  So I opened the sealed box and the unit was already turned on and was in Spanish .... It took me over an hour to get it back to US English,  since I can't read or speak Spanish.  I have an  8"" tablet before this came along, so it's not new to me.  The thing I did like, with this, the battery last a long time, and it's smaller then my tablet and handier to read with, and use. The app used in his Kindle wasn't the best for selections of reading material.... I wanted to get magazines subscriptions just for the kindle.... but of course the app didn't or couldn't go there.  So then, I had to go on line with the computer, to check them out ....  After you set up your account  and register your Kindle with Amazon, You can buy your books and reading material and have it sent directly to your Kindle  (over Wi-Fi to your Kindle email address)  to read and have.  The Kindle will down load it on the unit for you to read... I thought was really pretty cool...A friend of mine said there where places or websites where you could get free books to read, so I am going to look into that soon, after I read the ones I have...Overall:  I think this the right size (6"")  to have.... about the size of a paperback book.  The print can be changed to bigger or smaller so it's not a problem to read.  Easy to carry around and use. I love mine.  It's better then a tablet, because it doesn't light up the screen. The battery last a lot  longer then a tablet.  Thanks,  and Enjoy the Happy Reading...","Just Like Having The Public Library, In Your One Hand ... (Holds that many books)";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I was a legend in Elementary School for the number of books I read and spent hours upon hours of each day reading. I eventually taught myself to speed read in 3rd grade, and from 3rd to 6th grade I read nearly 1/2 of the books in the school library. I was a true book worm and have the plaques and rewards from my 6th grade teacher buried somewhere in a basement. As time went on I grew out of reading. Actually, I grew into other things. I still loved to read however needed to go to school, work 2 jobs, etc etc.Things in the real world have slowly returned to a calmer flow for me and I have really been having the craving to start reading again. I mentioned this and my wonderful, lovely fiancee ordered me a Kindle for Christmas. I have powered through 5 books since then and figured I have used it enough to write a review.My first impression when unboxing and feeling this, my first e-reader, I was shocked at the weight (very light) and the screen (not glossy in the slightest). It came with battery so I pressed the button on the bottom and it powered up. The screen flashes each time it redraws the image displayed, which was weird at first but now I really like it. Gives some feedback as to when you actually press the screen while reading.The screen is nice. Textured smoothly yet it isn't glass smooth like the Fire or Android tablets. Feels like a plasticy paper basically. I like this as well. Helps to remind of the old analog medium. There is some glare (or wash out perhaps?) when a very white light is shone directly on to the screen (IE: LED flashlight/lantern) however you can mitigate this by using a light that is not as bright.No backlight, no problem. I wanted something that was more like a book, not another gosh darned gadget. I have like 4000 different screens I stare at all day long and wanted something that didn't feel digital. I use an old school book lamp which is awesome considering I have had it since the late 90s.The Kindle daily deals are great. Tons of books, changed daily for like 2 bucks. How can you go wrong with that. The lending library is also quite nice, just one more reason to go with the Amazon reader vs the others.The only negative I have about this reader is that my fiancee has requisitioned the use of it as of this past Sunday and told me I can have it back when she is done. I do not know when she will be done with it, so I am ordering another one for me, and one each for my mom, sister, dad, and brother.Overall, I am sold on the e-reader wave. I'll definitely keep buying these things.Also, the Roocase for the Kindle Paperwhite fits this thing wonderfully and is WAY WAY cheaper than the Amazon case.",So good I ordered 5 more LOL;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I wasn't too keen on the idea on getting an e-reader. Call me a romantic but I do love holding a physical books since it comes with perks that e-readers don't (ie: they smell nice, never die out on you, look beautiful on shelves in your room, can bookmark pages with awsome bookmarks,etc). But I've had to change my view on things since I've actually run out of room for all my books. My father had bought me a nook when those first came out but the screen made my eyes sore and it wasn't as enjoyable. And also my brother and me ended up completely ruining it, so it was time for a change. I chose the most basic of the kindles since all I really want to do is read and save space and money. I'm also super bad with technology and don't really need anything fancy. This kindle does the job. I absolutely love it. It's got so many cool features that blow my mind. It's feather light and super thin. So it takes up zero space. I can take it with me everywhere and so it allows me to read whenever I have time. This is honestly a pretty good investment if you are an avid reader with a book wish list that never ends. With the kindle you have a bunch of books at hand at a size smaller than a paperback.",Call me a romantic but I do love holding a physical books since it comes with perks ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"While I have a 5.5"" smartphone and have used it with the Kindle Android reader app, I am finding that this Kindle is a more immediate media, and easier to read in very bright light, I am doing more reading of e-books.  This in combo with Overdrive access to library e-books, and the many e-books available on Amazon, especially samples (which give me a preview for books I'm waiting for), loaners, and freebie..I now have a wealth of material both downloaded and stored on the Amazon cloud.  The experimental browser is especially handy for reading news web sites and my e-mail accounts.  I'm hoping to see future updates that will make it more efficient in accessing all online material.  The unit is fast for reading, I like the link to Goodreads, the dictionary is handy, text options are adequate, the monthly free purchase of one pre-released e-book was an unexpected surprise, and the ads are not distracting...I appreciate that with the addition of ads the reader more affordable and available at a price point that made it attractive to me.  For night reading I can use my smartphone and the syncing feature keeps my reading progress seamlessly coordinated between the two devices.  For accessories, I also purchased a Verso E-Reader Clip Light offered on Amazon for $8.99, a discount available in one of those reader ads..it works great for both reading and as a handy bedside night light.  I also got the  FYY Classic Slim Fit Folio Leather Case for Kindle at $6.88 on Amazon..I figured it would protect the unit while I used it traveling.  The landscape features of the case will not be used because this Kindle does not have screen rotation, and is only used in a portrait orientation.  I'm hoping I can read it in-flight with just the overhead cabin seat-light, I'll update this review once I had the opportunity. Overall with the flexibility it offers, I am glad I made the purchase.",First impressions of this reader are positive!;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I liked many features of this. I just wanted a basic device and according to the description this would be it. It would hold a lot of books, though I only read one at a time. It has a bookmark feature. You swipe to turn the page. So far, so good.Once I charged it and loaded books on, I found that I was having difficulty reading even next to a lamp. Changing the font didn't help. This version advertised that it was like reading the printed page- not so. The background of the page is gray. The text is a very dark gray, not quite black.I compared this with a paper book I'm reading and the difference was startling. The paper book was black-on-white. That's what I consider normal. Even an old paperback with yellowed pages has more contrast than this gray-on-gray device.There was no way to change it, so I'm sending it back and getting an earlier model Paperwhite.And before someone asks, yes, I did know this version wasn't lighted. But with an actual white background and crisp black text I wouldn't have needed a light, since I can read a real paperback just fine.",Difficult For Me To Read;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I tend to get frequent headaches, I'm not sure why I am so sensitive to things but such is life so things like tablets and e-readers I am very picky about. If something is too bright or has a weird look to the text I get a headache. I also read nonstop, I LOVE to read. I needed something to satisfy my need to take my library everywhere and something that wouldn't leave me with a migraine at the end of the first chapter. This Kindle was amazing for both! It is super light weight and portable, I've been able to fit it into relatively small wristlets and clutches. I take this everywhere with me and I don't have to carry a large purse to do so!! Not only that but I love the ink technology when reading. It looks like an actual page and sometimes I forget it isn't. All in all I love Kindle and this Kindle was perfect for me!!",Five Stars;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this for my wife who hates reading on the iPad.  She absolutely loves this thing and can hardly put it down.  So far, she's read 4 books on this Kindle and has only used half of the battery life.  I'm even amazed at how much the screen looks just like the page of a book.  I highly recommend this product!!!",The Right Touch.;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I had the original glare free kindle that gave me the lines of death. I loved it. This one has almost no battery life. I have to go to the cloud and download everything to my kindle. It's thicker, and more cumbersome than the original. I do not like the page turn function in comparison to the original. This one will jump multiple pages every time I set it down even momentarily. I do not consider the more updated version to be equal to the original.",I loved it. This one has almost no battery life;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"My first Kindle was the Kindle 2. It was still pretty expensive back then, but I loved it! At the time, I was doing a bit of travelling back and forth between coasts and I was always either lugging a bunch of heavy books with me, or spending too much money at the airport for more. So, the price was justified at the time.My first upgrade from the K2 was the first generation kindle fire that I received as a gift for Christmas 2011. I was impressed at the time that the fire was a fraction of the price and was also a tablet.Unfortunately, my eyes just didn't like constantly reading on a backlit device, and i wanted more freedom in my tablet experience and passed that on to one of the kids.I eventually got an iPad mini and decided that I wanted to go back to a regular e-ink kindle, no frills. So, here we are.I love this kindle, because I wanted simple, no frills, no lights and that is exactly what this is. If I absolutely need a light, I use a clip on book light, or my iPad (which I can handle using the kindle app in short doses)I thought I would miss the keyboard and page turn buttons from the K2, but i don't. Flicking the screen or pressing the side work just fine for me.I also have back one of the features that I missed when using the kindle fire or kindle app - COLLECTIONS! I have all of my collections neatly ordering all of my books instead of a giant list or that annoying carousel. I am so happy the collections feature is still a thing on the e-ink kindles!",Know what you're buying - Five Stars for The Kindle being EXACTLY what the product page says it is.;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a good replacement for my old Kindle (which last about 5 years), BUT it is missing the audio component of the last Kindle.Fewer features for the exact same price.As it happens, I had one Audio book, and so the loss was not that great. But I don't recommend it for people who have many Audiobooks.",Not recommended for people who are replacing a Kindle that has lots of Audiobooks.;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I've had a Kindle Keyboard for years and when it quit on me I bought the new Generation 7 touchscreen. I wish you still made the Kindle Keyboard. I am not at all happy with the new one. The new way you have set up to deal with collections sucks. If you are holding the device in your left hand you have to turn the page with your right hand. That's just a couple of the problems with the generation 7. I talked to one of your chat line people and was told that there have been a lot of complaints about the new ""7"" and that the engineers are working on a software update to fix some of the problems. My recommendation to you is to make a ""New Generation"" Kindle Keyboard and make it EXACTLY like the original. You would sell them like hotcakes. I would personally buy a half dozen just so I would never have to go through this again.",I am not at all happy with the new one;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I have a kindle Paperweight 2, a Nook Simple Touch, a Kindle Keyboard and now This Basic Kindle touch.Right off the bat I will say that this is the worst e-reader I have used.Why I dislike it:1. Its light but feels cheap, really cheap. It's boxy and ergonomically awkward to hold.2. The background screen is white, which is good but the font is somewhat blurry and smeary compared to my Kindle Keyboard which has sharper fonts and better overall contrast.3. Backround bleed. You can see previous page shadows on screen. The page sometimes doesn't fully refresh. I have tried looking under settings to solve this issue to no avail. Customer support says this is ""normal"" My Kindle Keyboard and Nook Simple Touch do not not have this problem.4. Sensitive touchscreen. I love touch screens and i prefer them to buttons. I have no issues with this version not having page buttons like so many people demand. I personally don't care but the touchscreen is way too sensitive and glitchy. Any little slight touch will jump pages, bring up the menu and cause a complete distraction if your really deep into a book. Not cool.These are my main gripes with this particular Kindle Device. Yes, it is very basic and I do like that it has 4GB of storage as opposed to last year's model which has only 2GB (not that you will likely ever need 4GB but still). I do enjoy the lightweight factor but I think that anyone interested in an entry level e-reader should really consider getting a good second hand Kindle Keyboard or Nook Simple touch. I personally love the Nook Simple Touch and believe is better than this Kindle in every way imaginable although I would advise to stay away from the new Nook Glowlight as that device is severely limited unless you are completely immersed into the Barnes & Noble ecosystem.This Kindle is not bad but considering this is Amazon's 7th generation Kindle offering, I expected sharper fonts and better functionality, not to mention a MUCH better design. Yes this is basic but that doesn't mean it has to be cheaply made which this device definitely is. I love Kindle and although they don't support expansion SD slots, I love the Amazon ecosystem and their customer service is second to none, this is what keeps me coming back to them.",Unacceptable for a 7th Generation Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"After a few years of using a Kindle Fire primarily for reading - and finding that impractical due to its weight and screen glare - and after months of going back and forth on whether a plain old Kindle would be worth the investment, I took the plunge.  Why did I wait so long?!I love how light it is. I love being able to read in direct light again! I love the integration between Amazon and my library system so now borrowing books is a two-click process (I remember having to use a USB cable for the first few years they offered digital books, ugh!). I adjust the text size frequently depending on what or where I'm reading (at 41, I've discovered my eye sight is not what it used to be, and sometimes needs a little boost), I look up words on the fly... It's almost always in my purse since it takes up so little room and adds so little weight.Seriously, I love this little piece of technology.",Only wish I'd bought it sooner!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"i love this! simple e-reader, unbeatable for the $60 price. who cares if i can't use apps and has limited internet capabilities -- i already have enough devices that do those things. i LOVE the book-like print.i thought it would be nice if there was a backlight for reading at night, but after researching the print technology which makes it viewable even during the brightest hours of the day, i realized that doesn't matter. a simple booklight works just fine to resolve that issue, and there is NO GLARE when you use a light on it. plus, a backlight would not only drain the battery insanely faster, but would make it more like reading a tablet or laptop, increasing eye strain. i like that this looks just like a book when reading. i appreciate that it does not contribute to the eyestrain one experiences from staring at electronic screens all day.",love it!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Great for travel, but I still prefer my Kindle Fire HD!!  I purchased this basic Kindle in preparation for a vacation.  I knew I'd be out in the sun a lot and my Kindle Fire screen just isn't conducive to reading in sunlight.  I chose this version of the Kindle because I knew I'd have my Fire HD for reading at night, so didn't want to spend the extra money for the backlight (although I bought a Voyager for my mom and she is really enjoying it).This basic Kindle was just what I needed for the trip.  I spent several hours over a couple of weeks using this without having to re-chare and was able to stay up on my reading.  It's lightweight and fits great in a pocket.  Interestingly, I think the Kindle app features are better than the ones on this basic unit.  Still I would recommend this to anyone who needs something lightweight and convenient for reading out of doors.","Great for reading in sunlight, but I still prefer my Kindle Fire HD!";;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I didn't keep it...it was not in any way like my first Kindle which finally died after 5 years or so. Amazon was great, took it back and I will buy another as soon as I decide. I bought this touch since it wasn't back lit and I have read enough about electronics and lighted things to know they are not conducive to good sleep, but I really didn't like it. It constantly changed font sizes when I was dozing and touched it. I would be on strange pages for no reason except for dozing and touching random things. It would probably be good for someone who had not had a really good early one, but not for me.  So for now I do not have a Kindle. I am looking.",Gave it an Ok but sent it back.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my second Kindle.  I had bought the 2nd generation Kindle in 2009.  But I love this one more.  The small size, so much lighter, and I can read my books a lot better!  I bought the $79 version and I do not mind the ads or suggestions at all. In fact I welcome the suggestions for books to read.  The ads do not get in the way of your reading experience so save the $20 bucks!  This Kindle is meant for reading only and that is why I bought it.  If I wanted to play games or web search, I would have bought the Kindle Fire.  I just want to read and this Kindle is just made for that.  Love how it fits in my purse and doesn't take any room!  I am really happy with Kindle, they are the best in e-readers!",Best choise I made was the $79 Kindle!;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"Have had many kindles ( the original, the fire and the paper white) bought this one to replace the original just to read on the beach - it loosesIt's place - the fonts jump out every few pages and very often it takes way too many swipes to get to the next page....would notRecommend it - wish I had purchased another paperwhite.  One other complaint. Can't down load the few games that I like on to it.",Not a good kindle !;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"It's great for reading in normal lighting conditions. I knew it didn't have a back light when I bought it and although having one would be nice it isn't necessary for me. I got it to supplement my iPad and iPhone to take on trips and in public when I want to read without either draining my phone battery or carrying a heavy old iPad2. It's very sensitive to touch/pressure on the screen, I'm still getting used to if I put it face down or it brushes my shirt it changes the page, which is a little annoying. Overall I'm happy with the purchase and it does what I wanted it to do. If I use it enough I may upgrade to a backlit one in the future.",Great for reading in normal light;;;;;;
5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my Kindle.  I have hundreds of books on my computer;" for several years now
Review: but until I bought the Kindle
Title;;;;;;: I didn't have a comfortable manner in which to read them.  I'm retired so I have plenty of time to read and I've made good use of my Kindle in the short time I've had it.  I consider it one of the best investments I've made in many years.""
column4: Best investment I've made in years";;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I previously had a Kindle Keyboard that served me dutifully for five years. That is, until my habit of reading in bed before falling asleep ended up with me planting my knee right in the screen in the middle of the night and cracking it.Looking for a replacement, I didn't really want anything fancy. I just needed a simple e-reader that wouldn't hurt my eyes with the ridiculous amount of time I spend glued to the screen.This kindle isn't all that different from my previous version. I do notice the text seems crisper and consequently slightly easier on my eyes. No, this doesn't have a back light. But I don't really want one. If there's not enough light to read by comfortably, I probably shouldn't be reading in the first place;" my eyes get enough abuse as it is.The page turn buttons are gone
Review: but I don't really miss them. It's actually easier to lightly tap the screen as opposed to the buttons on my previous kindle
Title;;;;;;: and makes for a more fluid reading experience.I'm also slightly thankful my old kindle broke and I could justify the purchase of a new one. The touchscreen makes everything so much simpler and faster
column4: especially typing. Thank goodness they don't make the keyboard anymore
column5: haha. Even if I do leave fingerprints everywhere.The internet browser
column6: while hideously slow and really not meant for browsing the internet
column7: is also a bit faster than the previous version. But this is an e-reader. If you're looking for something that does it all
column8: I'd look at the more expensive models. For my purposes
column9: when I just want to look up an article online that I meant to read later
column10: it does just fine.Navigation through the different features is straightforward. Everything's easy to find. Plenty of storage too.One thing I do miss is the ability to listen to audiobooks. It doesn't seem to have any audio output at all.So for an entry level e-reader
column11: this is great
column12: and the price is reasonable.""
column13: If there's not enough light to read by comfortably
column14: I probably shouldn't be reading in the first ...""";;;;;

Review: Very much disappointed with my new kindle! I got this in my mail last Thursday afternoon.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Even though I didn't realize ""Includes Special Offers"" meant advertising would appear on my Kindle, I still love it! The ads, which appear as Screensavers when I'm not using my Kindle, don't bother me at all - neither do the small banner ads that occasionally appear at the bottom of the screen.Wi-Fi connected effortlessly, as did my hundreds of great FREE book downloads from Amazon, and I just love the simplicity of barely moving a muscle to touch the screen to turn pages. I also really love the ability to just touch a word to see its definition, and to have a listing of all the new words I've learned - amazing! Bookmarks are also wonderful, allowing me to be reading several books at a time without ever losing my place. I have so many great books downloaded I feel like a kid in a candy shop hurrying from one delicious confection to another and not being able to decide which one I like the most!I have spent many relaxing hours reading my Kindle so far and felt no eyestrain whatsoever. I am surprised and delighted at how much I am enjoying electronic delivery of books - I really thought I would not like using an e-Reader and knew I could just send it back if I didn't like it. I am elderly and beginning to have difficulty holding up books and the size and weight of my new 'Kindle, 6"" Glare-Free Touchscreen Display, Wi-Fi' is just perfect!Once again, I have been completely amazed at the delivery speed of Amazon.com. I live in Hawaii where shipping times can be ridiculous, but never with Amazon. Orders always arrive just as estimated or even before.I also ordered the new NuPro folio type cover to protect my Kindle while travelling - it was $10 less than its Kindle counterpart and I am very happy with it.My only difficulty has been in finding out how to use all the amazing capabilities of this little gadget - Amazon's online instructions are somewhat cumbersome to use and I had trouble finding the instructions on my Kindle until I did some experimenting. Kinda wish there was a hard copy booklet included. But I am terrifically happy that I made this purchase (with small monthly payments), and I know I will treasure and enjoy my Kindle for a long time to come.",Love It!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I have several Kindles. The original one, two Kindle Fires and I bought this one to use as a reader only. It works great and is easy to see outside in the sunlight which is what I was looking for.  I'm very happy with itas I am with my Kindle Fire HDX.",Great for outside reading;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"If you're buying this for a kid, don't get the one that includes special offers - the titles that roll through the screen are not age appropriate.  I had to upgrade it to without the special offers.  It may be that this was mentioned in a review before - but I didn't scroll through all the reviews.","If a gift for a kid, don't get the cheaper one with the special offers ads";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've been watched Kindle for a long time, which was almost 1 year ago. My friends and colleagues have different kinds of Kindle: basic, paperweight or voyage. Finally I decide to get it because of a promotion at that time and I was happy with my purchase. I am not a native speaker, while Kindle helps me learn and explore more books in English. I like the size and weight of Kindle, as well as how easy and convenient to do reading anytime anywhere. My only complain is that the books need to be bought separately and some of them are not very cheap. Overall, I love it!","Awesome, love it!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"The new Kindle e-reader was, and is, exactly what I expected. I purchased it to replace my old e-reader, which no longer worked. Because I got such good service from the old one, I declined the upgraded readers that were offered at discount, and instead ordered the closest thing to my old e-reader. When the new one came, I quickly put it to work, only to discover that it was defective, and worked no better than the old one. I printed a postage-free label online, making a request that it be replaced, not refunded. But when I got the confirmation, it noted that a refund would be given as soon as the returned item had been received. Because I wanted a replacement, not a refund, I called Amazon customer service to straighten it out. The response was swift, and exceptional. The representative not only understood where the mistake had been made, but corrected it, and then ordered a replacement. This was on a Friday. Two days later, on Sunday, the new e-reader was in my mailbox. Quick service is one thing, Sunday delivery quite another. But that's what the representative specified, and that's what I got. The new reader has new features that set it apart from the old. Chief among these is a very easy-to-use touch screen for changing pages, as well as for a number of other functions. The glare-free screen sets it apart from tablets, providing a high quality of readability, even in direct sunlight. This was true of the old one, too, and was a major reason I chose to go with an option close to what I had before. The touch screen eliminates the old page-change buttons, which means fewer moving parts to break, though that never was a problem with my old one. Over all, I have to say I am delighted both with the product, and with the service. The failure of the first reader was unfortunate, but those things happen from time to time with new products. The level of service after the sale was so good that it removed any negative effects the failure of the first product might have left. The replacement e-reader was in my hands well before Amazon received my returned item back, which shows a high level of concern for providing Amazon customers the best possible service. Well done, and I am greatly enjoying the new e-reader.","Excellent Product, Even Better Service";;;;;;
3.0 out of 5 stars,"You get what you pay for, the more expensive models have better features. The touch screen isn't best;" a little sensitive
Review: pages turn at the slightest graze and it tends to flip multiple pages at a time. Some pros are its size and battery life. Its small enough to carry anywhere and the battery can go weeks without needing a charge.""
Title;;;;;;: the more expensive models have better features. The touch screen isn't best";;;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"It has a scratch on the screen. The thing is usable, but just not the one you would be happy with...",scratch on the screen;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I love the paper white e-reader. I got this one for my birthday just a day ago and while the touch-screen is neat I really do not care for it much. I bought the first edition of the kindle with the keyboard and the side buttons to turn pages and it felt as close to reading a book as I could possibly imagine on an electronic device. Your finger could just rest on the button and you 'turn the page', now you have to tap, which that itself isn't a deal breaker, I can handle that, but the device also lost a great feature with the case I had for my old one that snapped right into a cover and had a light that went off the battery of the kindle. Perhaps there is something out there like that, and I hope there is but I was hoping to use the one I had, it was very nice quality. I highly prefer the old version of the kindle, I didn't buy this kindle to play games, or ooh and awe at the 'advanced' technology. All I wanted was a device that would hold my books that I could take anywhere and read whatever I wanted at any time. Instead they try to make this e-reader into some type of tablet. I don't consider it a tablet, I don't want a tablet, if I did the paper white kindle would be the last thing I would choose",Touch Kindle is ok by disapointing.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love all the kindles.  This was a present for my 80 year old mom.  She is getting the hang of it bc sometimes she doesn't want to get out of the house and go to the public library, bad weather or not feeling up to par.  She doesn't do all the adding of books and taking care of the small details that goes into checking out and returning books (I do that) but for reading it, she likes it fine.  The kindle fire makes her eyes red and puffy as the screen is hard on her eyes but the e reader does not.I also have one but it is an older model.  Love my e-reader.  Nothing is better.","Love the Kindle E-reader, nothing better";;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I received my Kindle, 6"" glare-free, on time. While setting up the Kindle the 'touchscreen' would not let me select not to accept a 30-day free trial of Kindle Unlimited. I had to accept it, then go into myaccount and cancel. Not sure if this was a 'glitch' or a ploy by Amazon. I mainly purchased this Kindle in order to read outside in sunlight (pool, park, etc). My very first time I used the Kindle outside I had a problem with the touchscreen ... I would 'tap' in the area for next page, and 'font size' would pop-up instead. I was no where near tapping the top of the kindle page where you would get change font size menu. I had not had this problem inside. I considered returning the Kindle, but continued to use it. To date the problem has not reoccurred. Hopefully, I haven't screwed myself and down the line it returns. I find the resolution/readability of this kindle as borderline. It is definitely difficult trying to determine which book is which in the library, especially when a book series has pretty much the same cover with a different title. Once a book is selected the reading is acceptable. However, if I had it to do over again I would probably buy the Kindle 6"" Paperwhite for the resolution and backlighting.",Resolution Borderline Acceptable;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I was using the same Kindle for about 5 years and it was the original gray screen with the letters buttons on the bottom.  Although it still worked, it was cracked and bruised from falling off a car, etc.  I didn't need anything high tech as I have a tablet, but I don't like reading on the tablet, so I bought this new Kindle before vacation.  It has some nice upgrades from my prior kindle, feels sturdier and is easy to hold and read on the BEACH.  Love it!",Love my new Kindle!;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I wanted something light to use for traveling that can hold my books. I purchased my Kindle from amazon.com and registered it on the US Kindle store.PROS:- light, easy to use, long battery life- screen has no glare and you still need a reading light which I don't mind- it is easy to flip pages with one hand holding the Kindle from either side- the special ""offers' I was worried about, only display on the screen when the Kindle is turned off so it's not as intrusive as I expected. I expected annoying pop-ups so this is definitely better- good value, I got it on sale and you couldn't beat the price for any other e-reader- comes with a built-in 'experimental' browser but it loads very slow and I would not recommend this be used for browsing the internet as a tablet.CONS:- very difficult to browse Kindle store directly from device. Unable to sort titles by price. They are displayed only by popularity, rating and release date. As it is not as responsive as a tablet, having to click on every title to see the price turns browsing for books into a long ordeal. I recommend browsing and buying ebooks on a desktop/laptop- does NOT allow you to purchase books from your US-based Kindle store while abroad! This is very important to those customers that are buying this for travel. You will be forced to change your home country in the settings and will have access ONLY to that country's Kindle store with the prices and product availability on there. Next day you're in a different country, same thing. If you don't download your books ahead of time, you can just pretty much forget it. If this would have been communicated to customers on Amazon, I would have skipped buying the Kindle- inaccurate product description ( see point above)- terrible customer service for any issues you have with Kindle (being told by email to call instead of receiving help over email while you're abroad is not good service)- black and white display only ( if you plan to order magazines through Kindle you will lose a lot of the experience in the black/white colours).",Cute and light e-reader but not practical for traveling due to download issues with US Kindle store;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I am SO happy with my Kindle!!! I love everything about it - I can read in bed, while traveling (because it just so cutely fits in my coat pocket!). I love the paperwhite edition even more because it's glare-free and that really does the trick.The only thing that I would recommend Amazon to work on is possibly the touchscreen because it is not very touch sensitive. But that's just a minor defect in compared to how amazing the Kindle is overall. I am so glad that I got this because I get to now catch up with my reading even during my super hectic work schedule. Would totally recommend it!",I am SO happy with my Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first Kindle.  I think I have the slowest internet service in the US and it still downloads a 500+ page book in about ONE minute!!I received this 3 days ago, and have read 2 complete books, and done some research on the web.  It is exactly what I expected after reading other reviews.  It has everything needed to be a great reader, enough features to make it a great tool for internet surfing, and the size/weight are great for portability.READ before you buy, so you understand the different features available on each model.  I did not want the ads, so I paid a little more to get mine without the special offers.  This unit is NOT lighted.  If a basic uncluttered reader is what you want, this is a great unit for you!",SUPER pleasantly surprised by the speed of downloads!;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I had the awesome keyboard kindle that had 3g wireless and suddenly it froze and stopped working. So I went to replace it and this is what came up as the replacement. I'm not a real touch screen person because if you handle this kindle anywhere except on the edges...the thing advances or backs up! I also didn't see the small print that said this replacement or ""upgrade"" kindle was wi-fi only which is a pain when traveling and the wi-fi needs to log in even in ""free"" wi-fi zones. Without the 3g (which is 3 times as expensive as my original keyboard kindle and this wi-fi only reader),  I have to really plan ahead when purchasing my books and cant just order up the next book any time anywhere. This kindle has the ability to read the screen in the sun, but I don't think this is close to being an improvement on the keyboard kindle that I adored.",I had the awesome keyboard kindle that had 3g wireless and suddenly it ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had an older Kindle that was wonderful, but it was a little ""clunky"" (in that it was - GASP - about the same ""footprint"" size as my iPad Mini). After I poured coffee on it in a crazy accident at a conference, it was heartbroken. For our anniversary, my wife bought me this new Kindle.I love it! Here's a quick breakdown, staring with the piece I worried most about...I was afraid of the ads being obnoxious and intrusive, but they are almost invisible to me as someone who sees much, much more distracting things on the internet daily. The ads are for books, so it's not like I'm getting things pitched to me that are outside of my realms of interest. For all the scariness of thinking I'm going to get ads consonantly shot at me, it's no problem for me.What's GREAT is everything else. The touch screen is responsive but not ""hair trigger."" The display is as clear as anything. The controls all hide themselves when I don't want them, and the spring into visibility when I need them. It's light and fits easily into a bag or even a pocket on a jacket or cargo pants. So yes, I 100% recommend this if you're looking for a Kindle!",This is the BEST (Special Offers Included!);;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love, love, love my Kindle.  This thing is fabulous.  I did not need anything fancy - just something to read on that did not bother my eyes.  This is just the ticket!!!!  I have already been reading more since I have purchased it.","Love, love";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a VERY BEST entry level e-Readers. If you are on the fence for an e-Reader world entry, jump in.I got this eReader for pretty cheap on the Thanks giving sale(including the KindleUnlimited 6 months deal).My kid uses computer for the homework and reading books etc.. but he spends a lot of time on youtube and on other sites.At the same time, he likes reading books(more comic books at this moment though).So, I have decided to give a kindle for this Christmas as a gift to him. I have the gift early in December.Kid is happy and I am happy.I got several hundreds of Kindle books in my amazon account.Overall, the device is real good concept(for the price and for the features). Very easy to use. I am getting this used to my 85 years old Mom, who doesnt no technology except a wrist watch.If you want to give a good and useful gift to your kid, consider this cheapo device.. it would give a great ROI(Return On Investment) in the form of your kid's elevated knowledge without the issue of them in getting onto Youtube/other sites while the reading is the sole purpose of their activity. Amazon, please come up with Kid-centric products. They would fall in with your brand name and mind it, today's kids are tomorrow's amazon customers. :-)",Christmas gift to my kid..;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"All the reading I'm doing on lighted devices is killing my eyes. This is the convenience of an e-reader with the non-lighted service of a printed page. Much easier on your eyes and you can change the font size to suit you, look words up and search Wikipedia with ease in a pop up window then get back to your book. The touch screen does take a little getting used to if you are used to older Kindles but I think it's great they still offer a nonlighted version.",Non-backlit Kindles Rule;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchased my Kindle 6"" at Best Buy a week or two ago for $59.99.  The same price that it was on Amazon the same day but I wanted it ""now"", so I went there instead.The Kindle is a little odd if you are used to an iPad or other tablet and are 'expecting more', however, it does exactly what it is designed to do.1)  Provide you with wifi to access your Kindle cloud books2)  Easily allow you to search and purchase Kindle books on amazon3)  eInk, no glare (my big issue) with no backlight (thank you Jesus)Of course there are a few advanced features such as the dictionary, but that is pretty much it.  This little device has got me excited to read more which is awesome.  I just finished my first Kindle experience and I must say, my eyes did not grow tired at all (as they do on ipad, phone, or laptop).",Does what it is supposed to;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I just received my Kindle today. It's my first one. I'm impressed. It's small, light and, aside from a few minor kinks, really easy to use. Being new to Kindle, I don't see what the issue is with the lack of buttons for turning pages. I did some research before my purchase and that seemed to be a problem. Well, it turns out you don't even have to swipe the screen to turn the page; just tapping the screen does the job. Ultimately
Review: the only thing I had to change was the special offers feature. I bought mine with them; and to be fair
Title;;;;;;: they were largely unobtrusive. After a while
column4: however
column5: I opted to pay the $20 fee to unsubscribe from them. I think it's just me
column6: but the device now seems more like my own. Having special offers made it feel like I was renting my Kindle from Amazon. Aside from that
column7: it's been smooth sailing. I hope to use this Kindle for years to come;" and though I still like the feel of a real book
column8: it definitely beats lugging them around.""
column9: A solid alternative to traditional books";;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"The touch screen seems to be extremely sensitive when you don't want it to be. I was constantly finding that I had been jumped backward or forward half a dozen pages, and the font size kept jumping up to maximum.I also had problems with it randomly freezing and then rebooting. Amazon tech support suggested a number of things, none of which helped. I finally returned it for a refund. This was my 3rd Kindle ebook reader, but now I'm a Kobo Glo HD owner. It was less expensive than a comparable Kindle and also makes it easier to download and read ebooks from my local library.",Moving away from Kindle?;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"this replaces one of the original Kindles.  It's taken some getting used to. It's thicker than my old one, but smaller overall.  I like that I can change the font size.  The touch screen is a little too touchy though.  If my thumb happens to be over the edge when I'm reading, the heat from my thumb turns the page when I'm not ready to turn.  I do like the other a aspects of it, although now I have to buy another case as the ones I have are now too big for this one.  Overall so far I like it, but I wish my old one had not died!",I like that I can change the font size;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I love it, EXCEPT when I do something that brings up a popup and scroll down in the popup. Then it likes to lock up and I have to reboot Kindle. That's a bit maddening. P.S. As of Nov. 18 I am no longer having a problem with locking up when scrolling popups. A pleasant surprise.",Solid Value and great except ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought one of these and now carry it almost everywhere I go. Stuck waiting in line or at the doctor's office or somewhere else unexpectedly? You are prepared!  I am not sure what the max capacity is for one of these, but it's in the thousands of books.  If I were to be marooned on a deserted island, I'd want one of these, loaded with all the reading material that I'd want for the rest of my life (along with a solar charger, of course).",Get one!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've had 3 different models of kindles, from one of the earliest with the keyboard and Wifi+3G to the paperwhite with the lit back to this one, and my opinion of them remains unchanged: they are the best thing to happen to people that love reading. And honestly, this is the best model for most people. This is why:  TOUCH SCREEN - nearly everyone is used to touch screens by now, and this kindle is no different. It's easy to turn the pages, but now it is also easy to type notes or search a book, even compared to the older models with a full keyboard since I'm so used to touch typing. And one smaller thing, turning the pages via the touch screen means i don't have to reach to the corner of the device to turn the page as I did with the older model with the edge buttons.  E-INK DISPLAY - look like a real book, seriously. It's only 167 ppi, but that's part of the reason it does! In most of the paperback and hardcover books I've read in the past, the font was always almost a bit grainy, just naturally due to the printing process at the time. And I know this isn't intentional here with the kindle, but that's what it reminds me of, and why it feels like a real book.  NO BACK LIGHT - not a downside to me, since any place I read I would have enough light anyway. I have a lamp at home, planes have individual lights, and my office has plenty of lighting. Studies have even shown that reading in low light does not damage eyes, it only strains them temporarily. And finally, and this is huge if you read before bed, the lack of a back-light means less blue light directly into your eyes to affect your brain's sleep cycle, so you'll fall asleep more readily.  CRAZY BATTERY LIFE - definitely related to the e-ink display and lack of a back-light, the kindle will stay in standby mode FOREVER. Seriously, I charge it once every month or two when I use it sparingly, and when I take it on 1-2 week vacations I never have to charge it. This is honestly the best thing about it, since sure you could use your smartphone/tablet to read books, but both of those will rarely if ever last as long as the kindle, and that's assuming you have them in airplane mode at the lowest brightness. It's nice to have a device that you can pick up always knowing it's got charge.  SLIGHTLY THICKER/HEAVIER - I say this since compared to the older hard buttons entry level model, it's a tiny bit thicker as well as heavier. This is insignificant to me, but it's definitely noticeable. Likely due to the added hardware of a touchscreen display.  WIFI ONLY - Obviously used to sync book, and it works great at that and quickly since books are pretty small in file size. You can even look up your kindle email address in your Amazon account and mail yourself personal PDFs or documents. There's also a web browser in the Kindle though, so you could use this device as a last resort if your smartphone/laptop/tablet are out of battery!  FILE STORAGE - this is actually really nice since you can save files just as if it was a USB flash drive onto the kindle, as well as manually load books from your PC if you have any available.Overall, this is an amazing device and indispensable for those that love reading but don't have space or money for a library. Also great for travelers who like to pack light such as myself!",Handheld Library w/ Near Infinite Battery Life;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"When did the Kindle change to a piece of garbage? This is my fifth, yes FIFTH, Kindle. I'll admit, I left one on a plane and I accidentally packed one in an outer luggage pocket but the other two just died. I'm not even mad about that. After owning and using them as long as I had, I understand it can't last forever. However, my last one just stopped working (yes, I recharged it) and, rather than trying to get a replacement, I decided to just pay $80 for a new one. What did I receive? A giant piece of garbage. It's ounces heavier, it's thicker, it's casing is straight up cheap and it lacks the basic functions. I'm ready to start using the Nook I received years ago as a gift and walk away from Kindle and Kindle Unlimited.",When did the Kindle change to a piece of garbage?;;;;;;

Review: I'm glad I finally switched from reading books on my iPhone and iPad to an actual eBook reader. There isn't anything I can say that hasn't said before about this. The screen is great for reading. I read about 4-5 hour a week on my Kindle and my eyes don't hurt like they did when I read on my iPad and iPhone. I can read while waiting for the bus and it's light and compact to fit into my bag easily and quickly.The lack of backlight doesn't bother me because if it's dark I just turn on a light as if I was reading an actual book.
Title;;;;;;: I'm glad I finally switched from reading books on my iPhone ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm a die-hard reader, like 2-3 a week, and have been known to dig into a book and never come out of it until the book is done!  LOVE reading.  I wasn't sure I'd like the Kindle, because I love everything about paperback books.  The first book I read on mine was a little awkward, I'll admit.  But once I got through it, I was hooked.  I don't use any of the extra features except the font style and size, but I re-size according to reading environment.  For instance, I read every night before I go to sleep.  If it's a little dim in the room, I just enlarge the font and I'm good to go.  I would definitely buy this again.  And, FYI, you can now borrow books from your library's website and load them right onto the kindle.  I can check out a book from my library at midnight if I want (and have).  It just doesn't get any better than that.",like 2-3 a week;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"My granddaughter is 12 and loved the book ""Kellie's Diary"" I bought her for Christmas.  Unfortunately, the rest of the series are only available on Kindle.  Kindle was having a deal where it was only $50-$59.  I bought one for her so she could read the rest of the series and any other books she wanted.  After all, the digital books are cheaper.  She can put what she wants on her wish list and this Grandma will oblige her.  She had the Kindle for a week before the screen frozen.  I have sent it back.  Will go one step up and get ther the HDX Fire 6 "" and see how that works.  I've told all my grandkids that if they read I will always buy them a book if they want.",Screen Froze in less than one week.;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I had an OLD original-type kindle with the keyboard at the bottom, and the screen messed up. This new one is more like an iPad - touch screen, cloud storage, etc. I asked and asked about getting the categories, books, games, etc transferred to the new kindle - no help there. I was told everything will be available - no it's not. I don't care for it, the actual reading screen is a little smaller, all my books are in the 'cloud,' my categories are gone, and none of my games transferred. I have been unable to get  any real help from the customer service people.
