They only speak broken English and don't understand what I am asking about and put down in their notes a problem that is what not what I said at all.  The games I had were Scrabble, kindle word games, and solitaire games. I've tried to purchase new games, but I've been unable to get them for the new kindle. Everything is for the older one. I can't even find where I had customer service add the new device and mark the old one as gone, deleted, etc.If you've never had a kindle, this would be fine. If you like an older kindle, it is not the same. I have an iPad and wonder if I would be better off getting the kindle app for it.",This new one is more like an iPad - touch screen;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a good deal for the most basic of Kindle devices. You can flip the pages reasonably faster than previous models, although I have seen it lock up and need to be reset after flipping the pages ""blazingly fast"" as was claimed to be able. I was also surprised to see that it had no speakers or headphone jack;" I have come to expect those as basic features on a Kindle. Aside from that
Review: it is pretty easy to control
Title;;;;;;: and the User's manual and tutorials do a good job of explaining how to use the basic controls. The screen looks clear and has good contrast
column4: and there are several fonts to choose from. One thing that was annoying is that if you turn off the WiFi to conserve battery power
column5: it complains and asks for you to connect for nearly EVERYTHING besides selecting a different book. I also would like the FreeTime setting to include the ability to store things BESIDES direct Kindle-purchased electronic books
column6: such as pdfs
column7: and other documents.""
column8: Good for a cheap e-reader";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love reading, but I am consumed by a digital age. I spend so much time playing video games and on social media, I hardly give myself the time to sit down with a good book.I have a phone, a computer, and a tablet, each with access to the kindle app, but the lights can often cause extreme fatigue when reading for long periods of time.I could pick up physical copies of books and read those, but often times the font is too small for my bad eyesight, and larger books can be hard to read due to the pages curving.Enter the Kindle. This ingenious little device fixes every problem I have experienced with digital and physical reading.Because it does not light up, I do not experience the same fatigue as when reading on my other devices.I have the ability to increase font size all the way to the point of each letter being about 1/2"" tall. The flat design makes it easy to read in any position, I can even put it on a tablet stand and read hands-free!It is extremely light-weight and does not cause my arms to become tired like large hardcover books do in some positions.The library of books is incredible! I can read almost any book I want, though there are many that are not yet on the kindle store.The battery life is phenomenal. I haven't charged it in 2 months and am just now getting a low battery alert! It takes a standard MicroUSB connection.Over all, this is an excellent device and encourages reading in the digital age.",Excellent for people with poor vision;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I already have a larger Kindle, but I wanted a smaller one to carry around for when I have to wait somewhere.  This one fits the bill. I just got a soft sleeve for it, rather than a case, like my other Kindle, because I wanted to keep it light and simple.  It has some extra features, like share, which I do not use.  I read the instructions to figure out how those features work, and how to avoid them, because I don't use them, This is one powerful reading machine in a small form.  I like the lack of a physical keyboard on this model, because I rarely use the keyboard feature, and not having a physical one reduces the size and weight of the unit. In less space than a paperback, I can carry several books depending on what reading mood I'm in.  Well done, Amazon.",A great reader in a small form.;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"UPDATED REVIEW.  After 6 months, the touch screen is getting touchy.  It doesn't just turn a page. It may skip pages.Instructions suck, but once you figure it out, it works fine.  A lot of help posted on Google doesn't apply to this model.  I like being able to adjust the fonts easily.  This one doesn't have a back light, so it's not going to work well if you read in the dark or low light situations. I can't read in bed without the lamp on.","Nice size, not the best choice for low light situations.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This a an excellent little device. I've had it for 2 months and I love it. I have used a Paperwhite and thought it was excellent and would get one of those if I wanted to spend that much, but for the price this represents an excellent value. The design is great and I think it feels higher end. The touch screen is wonderful and the lack of buttons gives it a clean look that I really like. The battery life is likewise amazing and is measured in weeks as opposed to hours or days. I prefer the E-ink display over that of a tablet because it helps with eye fatigue. I always get headaches if I stare at a tablet or computer screen for too long but don't have that issue with the Kindle. In short, if you want something to read books with buy this device, you won't regret it.",Great for reading books;;;;;;

Review: I had a first generation Kindle and broke it this past summer.  I really like the touch screen on this one.  I am enjoying the 30 day free trail of books as well.  My 11 year old daughter really likes the option of  pushing on a word and seeing the definition when reading.  So happy with my purchase.
Title;;;;;;: I really like the touch screen on this one;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Grabbed this when it hit a low ball price on Amazon and have not been disappointed. My ""main"" Kindle it the color one but his one is great as a ""grab and go"" and I like how much longer the battery lasts and enjoy the ability to synch my reading progress across both machines and several books.",Super capabilities for the price.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am tickled pink. I love my Kindle Fire HD 8.9. I really do. BUT (and these are really big buts for me):1. It is heavy to pack in my purse. Like REALLY EXCRUCIATING after an hour.2. It is a battery hog. And that is an  understatement.3. Even with the amoled screen, the glare is piercing to my eyes in bright sunlight.This little reader solves every single complaint I have with my fire. I still will use the fire... At home. And at night the fire beats this.The screen, even under direct light, has no glare. It is like looking at the page of a paper book. Battery life? Wow! And is it lightweight? Uh, YEAH! Furthermore, the touch screen means you can easily read with one hand AND turn the page. What more could I ask for. A light. Yeah, but I have my fire for that.The only drawback I can honestly see is that when delivered, mine had a small smudge. This drives me nuts, so they are replacing it... I think the screen might be kind of fragile, so I am buying a case to protect it.",Ah-mazing;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought the kindle for my son who has dyslexia.  Being able to adjust the font is very helpful for him.  I sent a request to Amazon to consider adding the dyslexia font to the Kindle and you DID!!  This font is really miraculous for people with dyslexia.  My son's reading speed is about twice as fast with this font and his love of reading is multiplied by about a million.  Also, we have 3 more of these kindles for the other readers in the family and we all love it.  I didn't think i could make the transition from paper but I might like the kindle even better.  It's so light in my hand and the appearance of the screen is very similar to paper.  Personally, I wouldn't want one that is back lit since it would be like reading on a tablet, which I think is wearing on the eyes after a while and is stimulating rather than relaxing when reading before bed.  THANK YOU AGAIN AMAZON!",THANK YOU AMAZON!!!!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I ordered the glare-free Kindle basically to use outdoors since my Kindle Fire is very difficult to use outside because of the glare on the screen.  This simple Kindle has exceeded my expectations.  It's very lightweight, making it easy to slip into my purse and take anywhere.  It connects to my other Kindle so I can read from either one and it will know my location in the book.  I would highly suggest it for the person who loves to read outside to enhance the Kindle experience.",Great outdoor reader;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"The ads are annoying and the only way to retrieve the book one is reading is to turn the machine off and then one is able to swipe the ad away.  If this Kindle is for a senior citizen, do not purchase as it is confusing on how to get rid of the ad.  Instead of just leaving the book and able to turn it back on later to where you left off, there are annoying ads to bet rid of.  My mother is 80 years old and cannot figure out how to use the Kindle without my assistance.  In hindsight I should have purchased another Kindle type without ads.",The ads are annoying and the only way to retrieve the book one ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"It's been over a year since my Kindle Paperwhite quit on me, and I haven't read a book in that time, even though I love reading. When I saw this for $49 I decided I get it, so that I could hopefully get back into reading instead of spending all my free time online. It came with a month of Kindle Unlimited, but I haven't used it enough yet to comment on it. I've had it a few days, and I've only read one book so far, which really wasn't that good, but this does remind me of how much I've missed having a Kindle.I wish I would have found these when my Grandpa was alive, as he loved old westerns and had a massive collection of books. It was getting darn near impossible to find him a western he hadn't read, and I think this would have helped out a lot.Reading on this is so similar to looking at a piece of paper in a frame it's almost eerie. It still fascinates me and if it wasn't for having to tap an edge to turn the page, and accidentally tapping edges while I'm reading, I'd forget I was on an electronic device.You need light with this one just like you would with a regular book, but I can't say that is a downfall as like I said, it's the same with a regular book.The only thing keeping me from giving it 5 stars is that sometimes when I'd tap to turn the page it would turn multiple pages and I'd have to start scrolling back to find where I was at.All in all, it's a good product at a good price, and I'm pleased with the purchase.",even though I love reading. When I saw this for $49 I ...;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I loathe this device. When you don't intend to touch it, it does something. When you do intend to touch it to turn the page or go back or get a definition, it does nothing. Since Amazon is now only offering touch devices, I believe I am done with Kindle readers. As the multiple Kindles that I have die off, I will use my PC and/or my iPad to read Kindle books - that is assuming that Amazon works out the bugs in those apps. Failing that, I guess I will go back to physical books. It was nice while it lasted but Amazon has gotten too far off track for me.",Not good;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"The kindle is a great product;" I really like the touchscreen interface and how easy it is to move back and forth between pages and books.  The organization system is nice and I like having access to the unlimited library for $10/month.  I ended up buying the ad-free after purchase because it really was a little annoying.  I'd recommend getting that right off-the-bat.  My only major complaint is that to turn the Kindle on when it's been off or asleep for more than a few minutes
Review: you have to hold the tiny button on the bottom for a solid 15-20 seconds.  It's kind of annoying but not enough for me to give up the benefits of the touchscreen.  I hope they fix that in the next iteration.""
column4: readability is awesome
column5: ads were annoying
column6: power button is a hassle""";;;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"I am not a ""touch screen"" person and find it hard to manipulate.  I have yet to get my settings the way I prefer them.  I would be much happier with the original ""vanilla"" verson of Kindle.","I would be much happier with the original ""vanilla"" verson of Kindle";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I like to read but since I am retired I have only been able to afford paperbacks.  Since my eyesight is not what it used to be, the contrast and clarity of paperback printing is not consistent and can cause eye strain.  However, the Kindle is a perfect answer to my problem.  The contrast and clarity of the words allow me to read without eyestrain .  Also, kindle books are reasonably priced and I can check out books on line from my local library through Overdrive.",Easy to Read;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I don't like the touch screen, I miss real buttons, I miss the keyboard,  I have the second generation kindle,  I say go back to the original drawing board, get back to basics, and make it the way it was.  At least you stuck to the real e-ink on this one,.",I don't like the touch screen;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I like the Kindle, but I really should have opted for the Paperwhite.On the plus side, I do find the Fonts crisp and clear. and have no problem reading them once a suitable in a size that suits me is decided upon. There is a reasonable selection of Fonts.The slightest movement of my hand, or re-positioning in my chair requires an adjustment of the lamp's position. Also, I have found the screen far too responsive. All too often, not meaning to, I cause the menu's to appear, or the page to turn, when I had no intention of doing so. I also find it rather difficult to discern the titles of books in my library when they are displayed as covers. Very small images, in greyscale are not the best way  to find things. And I have found no way to alter the size of those images. The alternate view of titles is just a list. I tend to recognize not only the title, but the blurbs which remind me why I wanted to read that book. I really wish there was a way to display those covers in larger scale.But all in all, I am glad I finally got my Kindle. Have been reading every day and adjusting to the downsides mentioned.","Glad, with reservations.";;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"This is not as good as previous versions. I really miss the brightness control, but my main complaint is it is just finicky. If I move it, sometimes it just cuts out and gives me the ads screen and I have to go back in to where I was. Sometimes, it's just not responsive and I have to completely reboot it. I think this would be okay if it wasn't inferior to all the other Kindles I had before. And not just a little bit. This spontaneous cut out is reminiscent of my cellular service where I can't make a phone call from my living room and have to go out on the back deck. If I touch this Kindle wrong, it defaults to the advertising screen.",This is not as good as previous versions;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love it . It is easy to set up and fun to read. It lives up to it's non glare screen. Purchasing an e-book  was fun and easy. Did not want to stop reading last night (The first night with the Kindle) it was so comfortable holding it, and of course the story that I was reading was interesting, but mostly it was the novelty of the Kindle, obviously my first one. Anyway the bottom line is that I really do love it and how did I ever live without it for so long. Thank you Amazon for the great sale price, too.",My first love!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm so pleased I bought this Kindle. For me its hard to convince myself that a Kindle is needed in addition to my laptop, smart phone, and just hard copy books in general. But I've been proven sorely wrong on those objectives. I will stop at work sometimes and read from this Kindle because my eyes start to hurt from looking at my computer screen all day. The special tinted screen is excellent at protecting your eyes, and the tablet is small and lighter than most books! Battery life is long, I have gone months without needing to charge mine due to the device's minimal use of battery.As for the functionality of the Kindle its better than any hard copy book (although it doesn't have the refreshing smell of a new book!). From your home screen you have the option to select a book (you can have more than one book on your kindle at once) you can also search for or select a book ad that amazon offers you on your Kindle (if your Kindle is connected to a wifi) and buy it on your Kindle from your Amazon account. While reading your book you can tap words and get definitions of the words, you can also tap characters in your book and the Kindle will give you a quick background on who the character is and their part in the story. You can highlight parts of your book as well as leave notes in certain places that you can look back at later.You can also buy a book on your laptop or any device that you can use Amazon on and it will upload the book to your Kindle when your Kindle accesses internet. If you want to demo a book to read a sample and see if you like it Amazon will send you a sample for free that you can read on your Kindle as well. If you have Amazon Prime, there are excellent deals on Kindle books as well as a whole library of free books you can read.","A Worth While Investment! Convenient Size, Long Battery Life, and Unique Capabilities";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love this reader. My favorite part is that you can highlight a character and it gives you a description. Would be nice if it were personalized to wherever you were in the book, do it doesn't spoil anything for you, but it's not that bad. Battery life is awesome, too. It kind of sucked finding a case for it, because it's just called kindle not paperwhite or anything. But I found a nice one for like $5  that was universal. Overall in very happy with it",Love this reader;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a great basic reader.  I love the book marking, the dictionary, how easy it is to buy and download books.  It's easy to read.  The ads aren't intrusive.  I've had mine for a week now and I am excited to read again.I took off one star for some annoyances for the way the device responds.  Sometimes if you have a book open, and the screen locks, it doesn't easily unlock.  Other times it doesn't always sense when your finger taps the screen. I'd say this happens about 10% of the time or less.  It's not a deal breaker but it can drive you a little crazy.By the way, it comes with a cable that you can plug into your computer and charge, so you don't need to buy anything extra.",This is a great basic reader;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"As a basic e-reader the latest Kindle does a great job. I have no complaints for what it was meant to do but there is one thing that bothers me and that is the battery life. After only about a week of using it, it seems half my battery is drained after reading through 300 pages.Naturally I was thinking that maybe I've gotten a faulty battery. There was no manual or technical details in the Amazon description to see the battery capacity. I then saw some very small wording on the back of the Kindle itself to see ""input 5.25v max 500mA"". It hit me, I've been using too high of a current to charge my battery and as a result have deteriorated the battery health. The charger that Amazon suggests to use has a 1A output, or 1000mA.In my opinion, Amazon is pulling some form of planned obsolescence. Not only is 1A the most common output for a usb charger, but it's next to impossible to find one with a ""slower"" charge. I'm going to end up charging my Kindle from my computer whenever I'm already on it from now on in efforts to keep the longevity of the battery. (Computer usb 2.0 ports output a maximum of 500mA)",Less battery life than I thought;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"If you want to read books on something cheap, but have access to hundreds and hundreds of books you like, and not have to carry the physical book, this is a great thing to have. Only issue I had was you must have a light source if you want to read at night. I knew that when I bought it, so it is not the Kindle or Amazon's fault. That one is on me. Of course, you can download the app for your tablet for free. I love these things. They were designed and built just for me!",Gotta Have Thing!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"If I had read/researched more carefully I wouldn't have bought this and just bought another Kobo. No epub! That means to read any of my current 1600+ library I have to convert them. Also no PDF. The ad at the bottom of the fist screen is very annoying and the ad on sleep screen is annoying. Other than that it is ok for what it does. Clear text, lightweight, good size.  It has a nice feature where you or anyone you pre-allow can email you documents to read. But not PDF... I'm just rating it down 1 for the ads and not using all common formats.","Works well, easy to read, no epub or PDF";;;;;;

Review: This is without doubt the worst kindle I have ever used.It has touch screen controls that are frustrating to use.  Constantly distracting the reader with unintentional changes caused by the slightest whisper of contact.  Even contact with the frame alone will sometimes result in unintentional activation of some of the features (e.g. change font size) on this reader.  Then often requires repeated contacts to activate a wanted feature (e.g. change font size).Perhaps someway to program and lock in some features like font size would make this more user friendly.  Why does Amazon would sell such a product?Perhaps they need some of us to go back to paper - I know I look for real books much more frequently now!Steve
Title;;;;;;: Promotes reading books printed on paper!;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am new to these e-readers. Just bought a Kindle reader. I love it. It's small enough to carry in a purse even with my nice padded case. Of course, I love being able to download and store a lot of books. But, I,also, love being able to change the font and print. There is the ability to book mark  a page and change the margin. I haven't tried reading in the bright outdoors, yet, because it's winter here. But, I love to read on my porch during the summer. So, the glare free feature will be nice. At first, I regretted not having a built in light, but reading in the dark with a light is not good for the eyes. However, that feature might be handy if I am traveling on a plane when I don't want to disturb those around me. In a case like that, I'll just have to get a book light.I purchased a nice padded case that has a sleeper feature that helps me save my place. One tap of the lock screen, and I'm where I left off. That's right. One tap or swipe turns the page. Lastly, the price was affordable. I have a new iPhone, a new tablet, and now my new e-reader. Of the three, this reader is my favorite electronic device.",Love this device;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my third Kindle and I have liked all of them, but I LOVE this one. My daughter convinced me to get this one and I am glad she did. I have RA so books can be hard for me to hold. That is one reason I love Kindles. I love how lightweight this one is. I love that if I don't know a word I can just look it up on the kindle. Before I had to make a list to look up on the computer later and that was a pain. I love the screen and how easy it is to use. I love that I am not constantly hitting buttons on it. Weather it is the page buttons or the keyboard or whatever button got in my way at the time. The one complaint I have is that there is not a case with a light available for it. So if books are hard for you to hold and you understand technology well enough then I highly recommend this kindle for you! I think it is the easiest one to use so far, but I have never owned a Kindle Fire.",Love It!!!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"as good as the original kindle, maybe better.  I had my other kindle for 8 years, and i dropped it in the bathtub.........fried it!!  i love the fact that there is NO glare, so i can use it out in bright sunlight.  don't spend the extra 20 bucks for the 'no advertising', because it's no big deal.....it's just advertising for other books available (that might be useful)........small, great clarity, and just a great little device!",as good as the original ....maybe better!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"My Kindle paperwhite stopped working last month for no reason..which bothers me but I still liked the product but decided to go for unlit version. I thought it would be exactly the same just w/o the light but it's actually slightly thicker and plain plastic shell so I see why many users added padding/stickers to help grip it. Had I known this I probably wouldn't have bought this version but since I have it now, I'm perfectly satisfied with it.",which bothers me but I still liked the product but decided to go for unlit version;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I am disappointed in the quality of this product vs. the older generation Kindle that I had to replace. The materials are cheaper feeling and I already feel like I can't expect this one to last as long as the one I previously had for many years. The touch screen is interesting, though it takes some getting used to, and it can be a bit difficult to navigate.",Not as Nice as the Older Generations;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this kindle for my 10 year old reluctant reader to keep her focused on reading and not playing games that you get on a tablet or searching the internet. By getting her this, I know when she has it, she's reading and is not distracted by apps and games.",Very Nice;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I like the paperwhite screen, it is easier on the eyes then reading on a tablet or computer.  It is lightweight and holds a charge forever.  However it is only really good for text, for music books or text books any graphics are virtually illegible.","Good for text, easy on the eyes, poor for textbooks or music books.";;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I never had a Kindle before, or anything like it,  and this was a birthday present.  With absolutely no instructions on how to even turn it on, I was at a loss to start with. There was nothing I could find that actually told me what type of Kindle I had.  I spent hours on Amazon and anywhere else I could find trying to find out what version it was and how to work it.  No one to talk to, no basic instructions anywhere and I was about to just get rid of it.  Finally was able to get it working but the manual was of little help to me because I needed basic steps to even get started.  Your Customer Service online helped somewhat but still left holes on what I needed to actually use the Kindle.  Finally found your videos and they were helpful but when I went back to gather further info, the videos were no where to be found.  It took me 2 weeks before I could finally load and start to read a book.  Not everyone is technologically savvy and some basic instructions in the box would be a great help to those of us who are starting from scratch.","or anything like it, and this was a birthday present";;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I got this as a gift b/c I won it from a school raffle.  At first it seems great.. but the wifi on it is extremely slow and most of the time it's not even working.  If you want to do something simple on the experiemental browser like checking your email or going on to amazon... don't even think it will always work, because it crashes most of the times and EXTREMELY SLOOOWWWWw.  To send your document files over transferring to PDF the sizes and format is all bonkers after it converts for you.  However, if you save your DoCx as a PDF file and then send it to the kindle, it's viewable, just very very small fonts versus the DOCx extreme crazy huge fonts LOL.  Even then, the kindle decides when it wants to save the file and when it will not.. for instance sometimes I send the file over to the device... and keep pressing the sync button to update and show the file?? It doesnt work.. keeps saying ""NO NEW FILES"" wth?? SO you wait like maybe when it's in a good mood then it will download the file.  NOT SURE IF I GOT A LEMON but this was a brand new kindle out of the box.  They purchased at full cost.  Other than that, their promotion features of this kindle having the easy navigation to skip pages DOES NOT WORK with every file or every book.  Some of them does not allow you to use that feature sadly.  All in all it was quite a disappointment to think I could use this to study my notes instead of printing out notes to save trees and cost.  I've read books from here too.  I do like the older version of the kindle with the buttons.  At least they are functional unlike this one.  Gets frustrating sometimes.",KRAZY KINDLE - a mind of it's own;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"My 5-button Kindle died, so this replaced it.  I like the touch screeneasier to enter text for searches, etc.  It is a bit thicker than my old 5-button kindle, though, and the edges aren't quite as rounded.  Good replacement, though.",Next-gen is pretty nice;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I have the original Kindle Keyboard and love reading on it but dislike how cumbersome it is to navigate or type using the keyboard and buttons. The screen is also so yellow that it can be hard to read (I'm 50, if that helps). When I saw the ad for this new Kindle (7th gen) it said the font was darker and the pictures of it show a whiter screen. I was thrilled that it had a touchscreen as well.Well the screen is actually MORE yellow than my original Kindle Keyboard! Also, the font used on the Home page list of books is so fine and pale that it's really hard to read (and you can't change it). The Keyboard's Home list is dark and clear. Highlighted sentences are REALLY hard to read, unlike the Keyboard. I was so disappointed to see all this and am puzzled as to why Amazon would take a giant step backwards in the non-touchscreen aspects.I also don't like how slippery it is to hold. I like to use my Kindle ""naked"" since it keeps it lightweight. The original Keyboard had a slightly rubberized back. (It also looked a lot nicer, but that alone wouldn't turn me off the new one.)I only paid $50 for mine on a Black Friday special, but it's going back. It's not worth buying a new Kindle just to have a touchscreen. It sounds like the PaperWhite is probably a better match for me if it truly has a whiter screen, but $119 is way too much for me.",Disappointing.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've had a kindle since they came out, and have never been disappointed.  The main and most important feature for me is to read in broad daylight, outside on the patio, at the beach, in my chair or anywhere.  Beside all of the other features of Amazon, this is what sold me.  When my kindle-keyboard screen cracked, I went without for a while, but decided I missed having my library with me and looked at all the (numerous) versions of kindle out now.  Not like when I first bought one.  But it all came back to the ease of reading and the portable size.  The one feature I always thought the kindle should have, touch screen to turn pages, this one had, so I tried it.  I love it.  Same  clear, good reading and the added feature of touch-screen. Sometimes I miss the free 3g for browsing and downloading books anywhere, but nowdays I'm usually fairly close to a free wi-fi connection so it's not a big deal.  It also seems that they eliminated the earphone jack and the text-to-speach feature on this kindle, but I rarely used those features anyway.  I bought a kindle to read and it works for me.  I would order this version of kindle again",and have never been disappointed. The main and most important feature for me ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've only had this for 2 weeks, but absolutely love it so far, and this is coming from a dedicated hardcopy book reader! Maybe its because I'm reading in a digital format as opposed to a physical one, but having the kindle makes me excited to rrad again. It's super light weight, and I really like the handy dictionary tools among its other features. Super happy that I bought this. I only wish I bought it sooner ^ - ^",Excited to read again;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I really miss the kindle that was not touch screen.  This is fine, and I can read clearly, but occasionally I touch the screen or it gets heated up and clicks when I dont want it to.  It works fine, but its mildly annoying.",Mildly annoying for a heavy reader.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought 3 of this. I like it better than the new ones. The new one has glare, direct light to my eyes, make my eyes tired easily.  Kindle, 6"" Glare-Free Touchscreen just like reading books without the weight of a think book. We all love it!",Just like reading papers. No direct light to my eyes!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I really never saw myself as wanting one of these type devices.  I've always been a hard-core 'real' book person.  However, after reviewing this particular device, and catching it on sale ($59) I decided to take the plunge.  I love this reader!  It is very simple and straightforward: easy to navigate.  I've not purchased any books yet, but did 'borrow' a few from my public library.  Transfer rate was very quick. Amazon is the middle man on this, so you do need an Amazon account to borrow books.Some of the reviews I read mentioned that they did not like the touch screen vs. older versions having buttons.  Personally, I like the touch screen.  The other issue folks talked about was the device not having a back light; again I don't see any problems with this.This unit features 8 different font sizes
Review: 6 different fonts and 3 different display settings for line spacing and margins
Title;;;;;;: respectively.  I did some tweaking to suite my personal tastes and have been very happy with the way I can 'read'.  The size is just about right to be held with one hand.  The screen is easy to read
column4: once you get it adjusted to your liking.  The battery
column5: I can't really comment on yet.  I've charged it fully
column6: but not sure of how long it will last.  The only thing I was surprised about was the fact that you cannot completely turn the unit off.  When you hit the power button on the bottom of the unit
column7: you are given 3 options: cancel
column8: restart and screen off.  I have been using the screen off option.  The unit has a nice feature involving a dictionary.  If you touch/highlight a word
column9: you will get a display screen from the on board dictionary;" complete with definition of the word.  There are also links for Wikipedia and Goodreads
column10: to name a few.  For these you need to be connected to Wi-Fi.  This wasn't very  intuitive.  There is a mode called 'airplane mode' in the settings.  When you are in 'airplane mode'
column11: the wi-fi is disconnected.  To connect
column12: simply take the airplane mode
column13: off.As with any device
column14: you have to take in to consideration what you want to device to do for you.  For me
column15: I chose this
column16: not only for the good reviews
column17: but because I was only looking for a device to use for reading books
column20: etc.  This is why I chose this and not a tablet.The only additional purchases I needed to make
column22: were for a case and a power adapter.  This unit comes with a USB charging cable
column23: but I prefer to use a regular wall power adapter.  I found one marked down at Walmart for $10.  The case
column24: I did find on Amazon and will review that separately.""

Review: Got a Kindle on the Amazon Prime sale for my book worm wife. My oldest (9yr old dayghter) whom we have tried to get to read all summer stole the Kindle and has been reading non-stop.  She gets up to to read now.  She even uses the built in dictionary to try and learn unknown words and highlights them for us to teach her the word later if she can't figure it out.
Title;;;;;;: Got a Kindle on the Amazon Prime sale for my ...;;;;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"My kids showed some interest at first, but now they are not using it. I think it's because it lacks backlights (so you cannot read it in the car or some dark places) and sometimes its screen flickers (one per every 6 touches). Now I realized that the backlight at least is an option that you definitely pay some money to.","My kids showed some interest at first, but now ...";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Features: Its awesome being able to select words and have them defined. And amazing that you can select a characters name and it will tell you who that character is. This helps me a lot when I get names mixed up. Its also nice being able to adjust font type and size and see where you are in the book and how long you have left to read.Touch screen: Works great, better then expected. Typing is no problem. It is some times annoying when you turn a page not intending to though. This can happen easily sense this touch screen seems to respond to any pressure, not just finger tips. So anything that touches the screen and pushes down on it will turn the page. I knocked a star off my ratting because this can be really annoying.Battery life: Incredible, I have not charged it sense I got it, and its been 10 days. (I read every day for hours.)Ergonomics: Looks good and feels good. Its possible to do page turns with 1 hand, and I do it, but its not ideal. Normally you have to use your other hand to touch the screen to turn the page. But this hasn't been a problem. And I feel reading is much faster with this. With a real book, I find my self turning over in bed to read the left page, then turning over to read the right page. But with this Kindle I can lay any way I want, and read with out adjusting. Also with a real book, sometimes your arms gets tired, but this thing is so light its not a problem.Glare: I have only had issues with screen glare twice, and both times it was indoors. But for the most part the anti glare screen works great even outside in the sun.Book marks: Its easy to book mark a page, and you can book mark as many spots as you want and jump to them at anytime.Getting books: Its actually harder then I thought, particularly when it comes to sharing books. Maybe I am just still learning? But nothing was as straightforward as I had hoped. I had to have my friend who owns a kindle walk me through how to get a book she shared with me, and I had to do it all on my computer on amazon. I wish when someone shared a book with me it would just pop up on my kindle saying ""so and so share this book with you, accept?"" Wouldn't that be so much easier?",Pretty good;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love this device! When they first came out I was against them. Only recently after watching some videos by others did my interest get peeked enough to write out a pro/con list. The E-Reader won by a lot. Yes, the regular book is very special and unique, a classic always, but the e-reader makes it more efficient and user friendly. The device is very light weight and easy to hold compared to regular paperbacks and hard covers. Two of the best qualities for this device is 1) it can hold several thousands books. No more bulk carrying or having a hard time deciding which book to bring with you out of the house, you bring them all! 2) the built-in dictionary and online wifi ability to search further on words, terms and phrases! Pricing for e-books tied for pro and con as some books can be very cheap while others either the same or more expensive than the actual book. But the other pros outweighs this cons. In the end you will save money throughout buying your collection. You will also never have to buy an addition copy due to losing the book, giving it away or damage that can be very easy. One book I had bought 4 times due to poor binding style. But now I will never have to buy again! I'd highly recommend the E-Reader to anyone. It doesn't mean you will never buy or read a regular book. I still own books, but mostly all my fiction and smaller novels are on e-book format while picture books and larger history, study or research books I buy in regular format.",Best Alternative Device for Books!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Fired this up for the first time. It charged quickly. I haven't had a chance to rate the battery life yet. Don't bother with the $20 USB charging adapter. I used the standard 5 V one that came with my Android phone and it worked perfectly with the USB charging cable that comes with this Kindle. The screen feels different in texture from my first generation Kindle Fire, more texture, less glossy. I do like the E-Ink although the way the text dissolves when I turn a page takes a little getting used to. Not a deal breaker. Books download off WiFi just as fast as they do on my Kindle Fire, so no noticeable difference there. I like how light the unit is. Was pleasantly surprised at the ""Experimental Browser"" under settings. I was able to read articles from the BBC and check my FB page. It is a slow browser and of course everything is in black and white or gray scale. However it will allow me to check my email, top news and social media in the remote small towns of the Maritime's as long as I can find the local public WiFi spot. Since I expected only an e-reader that was a pleasant added value. I left off one star because I think it is switch and bait marketing on the part of Amazon to offer a Kindle at a good sale price and then not ship it with a part needed to charge it that happens to cost as much as the savings from the sale price.",Mostly Impressed;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"Reading on a Kindle has become a tolerable experience. Pages flip with relative ease and there is a minimum of page refresh distraction. Unfortunately, absolutely everything else about the experience ranges from annoying to impossible.On the hardware side, the capacitative touch screen is insensitive and imprecise. Attempting to highlight text, for example, is a fiddly affair, with the position of the cursors, especially the endpoint, often seemingly placed at random. Adjusting the cursors to the desired start and end points can be difficult, even impossible. Every action seems to move at a snail's pace; my original iPad

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love it, love it, love it!!!!  I'm enjoying my new Kindle very much.  I enjoyed the older one with the keyboard as well but unfortunately, it was stolen out of my bag at the West Palm airport.  Purchased this one and it's great!!!  Getting used the much smaller size of the overall Kindle but it's much easier to carry in my pocketbook and I love the touch screen feature as well.  Great job Amazon (as usual)!!!","Love it, love it";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Item came quickly with AMAZON PRIME made for it Citron covered which I will review separately. Just opened it. Set up was a breeze, five minutes. I did expect and hope the screen would be a bit brighter than my old gray screen NOOK, but I knew it didn't have back lighting. I'm new to readers having only had the one other fore mentioned. This item is small and light weight, just what I wanted. I can drop it n my purse or carryall and never be bored again on buses, breaks, appointments. I was disappointed that books I have previously bought on Amazon did not pop up immediately, though books on my wish list did. That tells you that they were intentionally held back. Guess like a previous reviewer said I'll have to pay $2.99 each?  If so, that's trifling of Amazon. (Similar to having pay for some of the older AMAZON movies on PRIME to be streamed to your TV. Thought I could save and not get NETFLIX.)I did not order the bllack cover with my order. I checked first to see if they had any of the colors left that were advertised with the item. Don't know why they offered only black with check out. I waited to order the cover afterward after being sufficiently convinced it was the same one for protection of the device. I took a chance and did not buy the protection plan. Love the $59 dollar price;" glad I didn't shell out the $79 price last month.During set up
Review: AMAZON Introduces you to a number of features of your new device which I found helpful

GLAD I saved my old NOOK LIGHT.  But if you're reading in bright light you won't need it.I was back and forth - NOOK or KINDLE. As far as I know the NOOK does not have a screen password. So if you accidently lay it on the table and walk away

column13: which by the way still works fine. But I buy most of my books on Amazon and had trouble getting them on NOOK.  (I get my Barnes &Noble books on my IPAD KINDLE APP

column15: as well as some books I bought on Amazon. Maybe I'm doing something wrong.) My iPad is too big to carry around comfortably

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have been tempted to get this newer kindle for a while but I could never convince myself to pull the trigger because I already own a Kindle Keyboard which I've had and loved for years. The Prime Day sale finally got me to buy the upgrade and I'm glad I did. It has a noticeably higher resolution screen than the keyboard model which makes the screen easier to look at for long periods of time. It also feels much lighter weight to me, which makes it easier to read in bed when I'm holding the Kindle at sometimes unusual angles. The battery has also been stellar so far, as I haven't needed to charge it after the first charge out of the box and it's been the better part of a month (with relatively light use). It's still sitting comfortably at around 50% battery.If I had to make a complaint, it's that it no longer has the page turning buttons that came on my Kindle Keyboard. It's not exactly hard to just tap the screen (which is surprisingly fingerprint resistant) but this means you have to turn the page with your right hand, because the left side of the screen goes back a page rather than forward. I also realize you get these buttons with the Voyage (along with a higher resolution lit screen) but for the amount that I read, I couldn't justify the large additional cost.All things considered, I am very happy with the new Kindle and I feel the upgrade from my Kindle Keyboard is significant enough to justify the cost.",A Nice Upgrade From My Kindle Keyboard;;;;;;

Review: I got this for my fiance she loves it it actually looks like real paper this is a great product The battery has lasted for a week and a half so far and that is constant use however I did not like that all my information was already on it including my credit card information if I was going to give this as a gift to someone they would have all my information so if you buy this as a gift Open it yourself and take that information out

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"Would like this better if I hadn't owned the previous version. the touch screen doesn't add much for the functionality, and I liked the side buttons better. thinker and heavier, but not bad. not having controls on the bottom makes the screen look smaller and off center, but that is just esthetic.",Miss my old kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"so my kindle 3 finally crapped out on me. It was a sad day since that thing had been handed down to me and gone through a lot. It survived drops, spills, a busted (and twice repaired) USB port, lost buttons, and exposure to the elements. In other words, it was a true workhorse. Unfortunately, one last drop was its untimely end and the screen finally succumbed to the abuse it had handled for 2 and half years.I was a little weary about purchasing a new ebook reader, as I prefer real, concrete pages over electronic data, but I had a lot of good memories with the past kindle and the thing served me well. When Amazon ran a Valentine's Day special for the newest generation at a measly 60 bucks, I couldn't resist.It's true I've had the device for less than 2 weeks, and it's true maybe its quirks will come out later, but I don't see that happening. The kindle 7 is a piece of technological art. It's not pretty in that sense, but it's a work of art in what it does and offers.I mean, it'll hold thousands of books! And the battery will last hundreds of hours! I've used my continuously for a week and the battery is still more than half full. Not only that, but it's touch screen, has wifi and is just the right size. And speaking of right size, the options for text size range from the very minuscule (my favorite) to the ginormous (perfect for when I try to read at the gym). It's super light, intuitive, and insanely easy to use.Yeah, it doesn't have a light. And yeah, it's boring black and white, but you know what? Who cares? It's for books! Books don't have lights. And unless it's a children's book, a coffee table time, or a collectors edition, the novel you just paid 10 dollars for is heavier, takes up more space, and most assuredly isn't in color.Seriously though, this kindle is awesome and I haven't been happier with a technological device since my iPhone 6. Sure, I predict I'll be getting an iPad in the future, but until then, the kindle 7 is my e-reader of choice and worth every penny!",Worth every penny.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchased this model for my mom, to see if she would like it.  (Not big on new technology as a rule.)  She loves it!  Mom enjoys reading on it, even uses it every morning as part of her devotions with her Bible loaded on the Kindle.  It is easy to use, compact, the text display size can be adjusted for her comfort, and I don't think she has missed a day of using it since she received it on Christmas.",Mom Loves It!;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"My kindle died at one year, 3 months  it was replaced.  One year and three months later the same exact thing happened to the new kindle.  Both times, it refused to charge .  The charging port is poorly installed with an inferior design.  The only thing amazon had to offer me was a reconditioned one for 110 dollars or 20 off a 179.00 model.  So figure that you will get two years usage out of a Kindle it is a disposable product.  They won't tell you that but if you google the kindle you will find that everyone knows it.  I am pissed that you can sell something that has failed time and time again and not  admit in your advertising that the design is limited.  Why would you not want to fix an engineering problem so your product lasts longer...oh I know why.. you can sell more that way.  I refuse to buy a new kindle.  I bought a galaxy tablet.  Shame on you Amazon... made in America used to mean something..  no wonder now why our economy sucks.",Amazon has failed me;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Amazon does it again with another great Kindle. The touchscreen is easy to navigate, although I do miss the buttons from the previous generation a little. Great display and stays charged for such a long time!",Kindle is great!;;;;;;

Review: Absolutely love it. I have a Kindle Fire but could not read it outside even if it was cloudy due to the glare. I got my Kindle Paperwhite and started reading outside all the time. NO GLARE perfect for me! I love to be outside in the summer when it is nice and love to sit by the lake and read. Now I can! Anyone that is an avid reader and loves to be outdoors needs this one!!
Title;;;;;;: Absolutely love it. I have a Kindle Fire but could ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchased this Kindle on one of the Black Friday deals.  I have six Kindles, two Paperwhites, 2 earlier e-readers, a Kindle Fire and this one!  Needless to say I like my Kindles! This one has the touch page turner like the Paperwhite at a much lower price, it does not have the lighted display but for the price it's really great, very happy with it.  Needless to say I read a lot so I always have a Kindle ready!",Needless to say I like my Kindles;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I have to say that the way you have turn off the wifi is really bad. To turn off wifi you have to go to the settings and turn ON airplane mode. Come on, that is ridiculous. Not only that, instead of having a sliding switch that points to on or off you have a button. The button reads ON when it is actually off and OFF when it is actually on. Not intuitive. I fly maybe once every 2 years, airplane mode is the last item on the list I want to see when I go to settings, connect. Bad, bad, bad. Early Kindle's way, way, way better!",... way you have turn off the wifi is really bad. To turn off wifi you have to go ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I LOVE my kindle. This is my first kindle ever, and I love it. The only thing I really dislike about it is that the screen is incredibly sensitive and lint always gets caught on the insides of the screen. Had to give it 4 stars because of those two reasons, but other than that I love it. It's so much lighter than having my regular books, especially when it comes to traveling.",Why didn't I buy this thing sooner!!!!!??;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I loved my Kindle Keyboard, but it just died (I have a feeling my two-year-old stepped on the screen), so I needed a replacement.This is the option I went with, and I am very happy with my choice.Before purchasing, I was worried about the touch-screen I thought the screen would get dirty from constant touching, and that it wouldn't be very responsive compare to hard buttons. Neither of these concerns is an issue: the screen stays clean and the touch-screen is VERY responsive  almost shockingly so. I would venture to say it's the most responsive touch-screen I've ever used, on any kind of device. The page-turn time is also shorter, so this device feels fast.I will say that it feels quite a bit cheaper than my previous Kindle. There is no longer the non-slip material on the back (which I miss), now it's all the same hard plastic. It also feels sort of ""hollow"" and flimsy compared to the solid heft of the Kindle Keyboard. It's also kind of boxy. Still feels nice in the hand overall, though, and it's a pleasure to use.Finally (and this is purely based on my memory), I think that the contrast on this might be slightly less than my previous Kindle. But it's close, and certainly isn't an issue.The ""special offers"" are not intrusive at all. Some of them actually are useful (e.g., books I may be interested in, useful accessories, etc.) I wouldn't shy away from saving some money and ""putting up"" with the offers.Overall, a very nice Kindle for the money. Recommended.",Touch screen is fantastic. Special offers are not obnoxious. Very nice reading device for the money.;;;;;;

Review: I purchased the base model for $79 with advertising and in general I am happy.  As many have said the advertising does not really get in the way and currently is just for other books and when the kindle is in standby. I recently purchased Wired to read on the Kindle and discovered I need the Fire.  The Fire is only $20 more so I am wondering should I have made that purchase instead . seems like a great deal compared to any of the tablet prices.  For the most part I am happy but still getting used the gestures .. and making mistakes that turn pages when I don't want to.  Overall not bad but seems this space is moving very fast in price and performance.
Title;;;;;;: ... for $79 with advertising and in general I am happy. As many have said the advertising does not ...;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I've been on something of a minimalist kick as of late, envious of those adhering to the 100 (or sometimes even less) things challenge to eliminate clutter, live more simply, avoid retail therapy, etc. The Kindle has been more or less on my radar since it came out, but around christmas time last year, a special promo sale on this, the most basic model, finally caused me to pull the trigger. For the cost of a few books (or to be fair, the cost of the last technical book I bought), I thought this was a very smart buy. Not only did I have a number of PDFs and Kindle books I had already bought, but I wouldn't worry about my ""things count"" or clutter level when continuing to buy books.This reader is the most stripped down of the Kindle line, possibly ever, though it does include a touch screen. The form factor is good, it's the weight and dimensions it should be. The display is good. I'm surprised when I'm asked about eInk type displays. Many more people than I would have guessed do not realize the difference between a screen like this and phone/ipad display. Amazon probably doesn't help this matter by selling both backlit and Android-derived tablets also under the Kindle name. The screen is worlds easier on your eyes than the laptop/tablet/TV LCDs we're all so used to. The text can obviously be adjusted to where you like it. This must be a godsend for people who would ordinarily seek out large-print books, which are special orders and obviously not available for every book.The touch screen functionality, however, is not that great. It's just not what we're used to, which to be fair, is on much more expensive devices like the iPad. While it works, especially for opening books, changing pages, and such, it's tedious if you try and use it on the browser, for example, the way you might on a tablet. Although it's not perfect, I'd probably rather have this over a physical keyboard a la the early generation Kindles.On that note, the Kindle includes an experimental browser (I think it's quite literally called the Experimental Browser even- which is a good way to manage the expectations of anyone using this feature!). It's an utterly charming way to surf the Internet. If you ever wondered what the web would be like on a compact, b/w Mac from 1991, here it is. For me, it tends to crash a lot as well, but when it's working properly it's pretty cool. Seems to have a good amount of trouble connecting to public wi-fi that sends you to a portal page. I haven't looked into Kindle-friendly web sites yet, but I remain intrigued by this feature and glad it's there.The battery life is excellent. One of the best features for this in a world where noone's anything is ever charged. The ""features"" this particular model lacks only serve to prolong battery life. I also appreciate that when connected to a computer, this shows up as a drive, and files can be dragged and dropped (store purchases just show up when the Kindle is on wi-fi and purchases are directed to send them there). A wise choice considering how frustrating Apple is with regards to the way iTunes is required to manage those devices.All in all, I am really happy with this product.",I thought this was a very smart buy. Not only did I have a number ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my new Kindle.  Is the first I've ever owned so I don't have anything to compare it to and therefore no complaints.  It works well for me and I don't think it moves slowly at all.  I don't mind the special offers because they don't interrupt your reading experience and only appear on the locked screen.I like that there is no back light because they tend to bother me and give me headaches.  However, the screen is darker than I expected so I bought s clip light so I can read in bed.  It's a little heavier than I expected but I love it and I'm reading again.  Like the recommendations, too.  I  really have no place to store books so it's great to have a library without having to find somewhere to put it.  I  wish I could buy one for all my fellow straphangers on the N train.",Get a Kindle and read instead of talking on your cell phone on the train!;;;;;;

Review: Bought this kindle for my non-kindle husband to use.  He had been using my Fire HD and had difficulty with glare.  I hated it when I wanted to play on the Fire HD and he was just reading so I picked this one up at a great price.  Very happy with the tablet as he no longer has been complaining of eye strain headaches.  It is the low end of the kindle line but is a great product for the price.  We can take it with on vacation and not worry so much about it.  It reads well and does everything that we need it to do.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Amazing! I love the kindle the new design is wonderful for children too. It's about the width of a standard pencil, and weighing only 6 ounces, there are no bulky books to carry! As with all Kindles the Kindle 6 is a dedicated e-reader, meaning children will stay focused without the distractions of a computer or internet. Which I think is a great Idea, also most notably, you can comfortably read the Paperwhite in bright sunlight without any glare, which is one of the biggest advantages to using an eBook reader compared to a iPhone. also I love that the amazon book store has there books so cheap like .99-5.99 for some books!, The screen is front lit ,LED lights along the edge of the display shine down onto the digital page not from the back of the screen like many other eBook readers and tablets do. So over all I don't see any cons in this E reader and its budget friendly as well! I recommend this to anyone that likes to read many books but at a great price as well! I recommend this for ages five and up!",Great Budget Friendly E reader!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this to supplement using my iPad Mini as a Kindle. I had resisted buying a Kindle over the years, since I had been using my iPhone and iPad to read my Kindle library. I enjoyed the fact that I could read in the dark and ignored the fact that the sun created blinding glare. To me, the trade off was worth it, though. I liked the fact that I only needed one electronic device when I was on an airplane.To me, it was the best of both worlds.Recently, I needed to rethink my stance on a Kindle, though. A situation came up that required me to leave my iPad and iPhone behind. So, I ordered a Kindle. Fortunately, I ordered it when they went on sale for Christmas, so I only paid $59 for it. What a bargain.Since I received it, I have been extremely happy. Syncing it to both my home WiFi and Kindle account was easy. Downloads are lightning fast. This is probably because all it does is show books, no email or anything else to slow it down. Reading on it has been a breeze- you can customize both the font and font size. Navigation happens by touching one of the edges of the screen. There is a built in dictionary for words I am not familiar with. Overall, this is the perfect gadget for reading. In addition, the black and white rendering of pictures in the books is excellent.The Kindle is very light, so it is easy to hold for extended periods of time. It is similar to (not the same as) the new paperback book size, so it is easy to handle. There is also the added benefit of it not closing in the middle of a paragraph. It synced right up to everything else, so I didn't loose my place in any of the books I was reading.There is a built in web browser. I played with it for about 2 minutes and have never looked at it again. It was slow and the graphics are lacking. This one doesn't play music, take notes, have a voice recorder, or anything like that. There is no built in light, despite the background being pretty white. This is the bare bones model.If you want an e-reader, this is the model I would recommend. If you want a way to browse the web and watch movies, as well as read a book, take a look at a Samsung or an Apple tablet.  This is the one duplicated electronic gadget that I wont mind taking with me on a trip. It is so light, that I'll hardly notice it is there.",Perfect e-reader;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love, love, love this kindle!! I bought two because of the sale one for my daughter and one for me. My daughter loves hers and I can't put mine down! It is such a nice size that it can fit into almost any size purse. It does not light up, but it never claims to in its description plus having no back light is so much easier on the eyes. The touch screen is nice and my daughter and I are having fun with the word wise and the dictionary. It is also nice that it holds your spot, I can jump around to different books and not have to worry about what page I was on. I love that it is just an eReader and that you can't go on any social media with it, it helps you read more by being less distracted by different apps. I also didn't want my daughter having access to the internet I just wanted it to help give her more of a love for reading, not something with games and apps. We are so in love with our kindles it does everything it claims. We took them out side and had no glare, worked perfect! I also love that the books are cheaper and we can carry all our books on this little device. I HIGHLY recommend this kindle if all you are looking for is an eReader!!! If you are looking for a tablet than this is not for you.",Better than I imagined!!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've been debating about getting a Kindle for a long time and finally took advantage of the sale around Mother's Day.  I am thrilled with this product!  I found the first review that was named ""most helpful"" really make up my mind!  I didn't know if I wanted the Paperwhite with the buttons and the built in light but the review was so helpful that I chose this one and am not sorry I did.  Sometimes my eyes are sensitive to the light in the computer and was concerned about that so I thought I can just as easily use a clip on light if I want to read in bed (with husband sleeping).  The prices for reading materials are so much less and I am still learning about getting books from the library, etc.  It's so easy to use and I haven't had any problems tapping the screen to turn pages, etc.  It's a simple device to use and great to take along when I have appointments or just want to read.  I love that it is lightweight.  I only wanted mine for reading purposes and didn't want all the ""bells and whistles.""  I have nothing negative to say about this great device.  I wish I'd gotten one sooner but I did save money on the sale!  If you're debating about getting one for reading books, I highly recommend this one.  Read the one review that is titled ""Know What You are Buying.  I found that so helpful",Sometimes my eyes are sensitive to the light in the computer and was concerned about that so I thought I can just as easily use;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"There's two ways to review this:  as a stand-alone product or comparison to a Nook e-ink reader of the same size.  I'll mainly focus on the comparison:Good:  Syncs easily with Amazon and Prime features open up free options.  The background on the Kindle is slightly lighter than on the nook.  That offers more contrast but really is a matter of personal taste whether you would consider that a good or bad thing.  I've read for hours straight on both and suffer no more or less eye strain on either.  Charging the Kindle is easier and more universal than the Nook.  The Nook requires nook specific charger and even micro usb cable to work properly while the Kindle seems to work regardless of cable or plugging into a number charger types.Less than Optimal:  I have yet to find a battery percentage on the Kindle.  The Nook has the icon and an easy way to get to a screen that shows what percent of the battery life remains.  That little icon on the Kindle doesn't offer enough information to know whether you have 30 or 5% left.Page numbers.  The Nook automatically calculates how many pages your book has based on the font and size you choose and then gives you a display saying page x of y.  The Kindle gives you different options, including page #, but it doesn't give you page x of y.  It'll give you page number and x% complete.  Which again, lacks specificity like the battery meter.  The Nook has a touchscreen like the kindle for page turning but also has 4 buttons that can be configured for one handed reading and page turning without have to touch the screen.  I typically read with the item resting in my left hand, which means to turn the page on the kindle I have to bring my right hand up and either swipe or touch the right side of the screen.  With the Nook, I can set the lower left button, which i can reach with my left thumb, to turn the page forward so my right hand can hold my drink or shoveling chex mix in without worrying about dripping, spilling, or getting the e-reader grubby.Similar:  Screen size, case size, although the Kindle ""feels"" lighter.  I don't have a scale for these light weights and i haven't checked the specs on both to compare but it does feel lighter.  The Nook on the other hand has more of a rounded back which gives it a softer feel.  Again, that is personal preference on whether you would consider that a good or bad option.  In either case, I don't have big hands and they both rest comfortably for long periods of time.The Kindle is a solid performer but if comparing to the Nook, I'd give the Nook a slight edge in the area of form and function.  When it comes to searching for books, the next in the series, and some other software type areas the Kindle wins especially with Prime.",Comparison;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"...Amazon's customer service is fantastic.  The first Kindle I ordered was stolen off of my porch and Amazon replaced it for me, no charge.  The kindle works great, and I normally hate touchscreens.  I'd write a longer review, but there are so many books, I'd hate to take away time from reading them!","The Kindle is great, but...";;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"The screen is great, and it works quickly, but it is not as functional as Amazon's earlier Kindle Touch. Some of it is just a greater familiarity with their older version, but a lot of it is a loss of functionality. For example, it has no audio capability, now takes a couple of different menus to shut off wi-fi and an extra swipe to actually turn-on the device, which I dislike. It is a nice, basic e-reader, which is what I wanted, but it is a shame that Kindle actually seems to be moving backwards in terms of their device capabilities and design.",Not as functional;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I just got this in the last week, but so far I'm in love with it.  It's easy to read on, the letters are very crisp and its easy to turn pages. I don't have very large hands and it's the perfect size, kind of like an actual book, but thinner! I like that I can buy books straight from the kindle, and don't have to go and plug it into my laptop to sync.  It fits easily in my purse or bag and seems pretty sturdy.  I waited a really long time to get an e-reader because I just really like reading on paper better. I'm glad I waited because this version is really great. I still kind of get the feeling of reading on paper, and my eyes don't get tired like they do on my iPad or others. So far, it's been a great addition to my bookshelf!",but so far I'm in love with it;;;;;;

Review: Just got my Kindle today and it is perfect!  It came with all my account info already set and all I had to do was download my books and sign into my Goodreads account.  It is a much better reading experience than my phone and the screen is easy on the eyes.  It charged quickly and the touch screen responds well.  I was very glad I got the version without offers as the screen is too small to find ads not bothersome.  It was certainly worth the $20 to not have to see any ads from the moment I opened the box.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchased this Kindle to read books. It does just that. It doesn't have any other features.I own a tablet that I use for the other functions. I wanted an inexpensive and convenient way to carry a large number of books with me. This fits the bill!  It is light weight and a perfect size that I can slip into my purse and take it everywhere.  Also if I accidentally leave it somewhere I'm not out 100's of dollars like my tablet.This Kindle is perfect for reading outside when we are camping. I struggle to see my tablet in the sun.  This Kindle is not lit so you can't read in the dark. I don't tend to read in the dark, so it is not an issue for me.It all depends on what you want to use it for. If you want a way to just purchase and read books, this is the Kindle for you. If you want to surf the internet or read email, look at another model.The last Kindle I owned was one of the originals and didn't have a touch screen. You had to change pages by pressing a button. This is leaps and bounds beyond!Love it!",Love it!!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I thought I'd never stop reading paper books.  I love the feel of turning the page, and the smell of the paper (the older, the better).  But I read a Kindle-only book on my mom's Kindle HD, and finished reading it on my husband's Kindle e-reader, and I was hooked.  The display is very easy on the eyes, and much better than reading on a phone screen.  It's incredibly portable, and is easy to store on my bedside.  I read a LOT more now than I used to.The touchscreen is sort of annoying sometimes though.  It's hard to ""turn"" the pages with one hand, and if I set it down face-down for a second, then there are several inadvertent page-turns and other adjustments when I pick it back up.  My husband's older-generation non-touch version is easier to handle.  I expect that the next generation will be easier to handle.",Converted me from a paperback lover!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm a life-long avid reader and waited so long to get a Kindle because I didn't think I'd like it. Was I wrong! I used to drag a paperback around everywhere (2 or 3 if I was traveling) & was lost if I finished it before getting home to the stacks of books waiting to be read. But I had not been reading for fun in a couple years and stopped carrying a book with me due to business demands and I've really missed it. Now, this just lives in my purse & I can grab a page or two or a chapter whenever I'm stuck in line or a waiting room or out to eat alone. Turn it on & I'm back into the world of the book at the place I left it. I love it! I'm back home!I've had this for about 6 months and have only had to charge it about once a month. My only regret is that I did not get the Paperwhite so I could read it in darker rooms easier without having to turn lights on or use a booklight. I think that will be my next gift to me. I know I won't be without a Kindle again.",I didn't think I'd like it. Was I wrong!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my very first kindle. I was really not sure what to expect when I ordered it. I had always just read books but I saw how much cheaper e books are and thought I would try it out. I did a lot of research trying to find the Kindle that would be best for me, I don't need a back light or buttons that turn the page when pressed. So this very basic model was perfect for me. I am very happy with my purchase and at only $79 this is a steal.",My First Kindle;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Replaced my original Kindle, which I thought was great. This one not so much. The touch screen is too sensitive. Close the protective cover and the page changes. If I dropped something on the screen, I have to shut the kindle off in order to clean the screen. Don't know how, but the kindle regularly changes the font size, sometimes larger, sometimes smaller. It was much more convenient to have the forward and back page on both sides of the page. Its difficult using my left hand to advance the page. Original software allowed me to organize my books, for me, my wife, what's next to read, what's already been read, etc. Although the new software has 'collections', books are in multiple places. Amazon took a simple, useful product and added too many features. Just because you can, doesn't mean you should.",Not as good as the original;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a great basic reader. It has no bells and whistles, it is not in color, and you can't play games or watch movies on it, which is just what I want. It is small and compact and I can take it with me almost anywhere. It is easy to set-up and easy to use. When you purchase Kindle books you can have them delivered right to it, which is great. It's no glare screen is so nice compared to my iPad which I had been using to read. I can read it at the beach, on the bus, in front of a bright window, really anywhere. There is no back-light, but a simple reading light can help with that. I highly recommend this reader to anyone who wants a good, basic reader.",Great basic reader;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I LOVE this kindle! It's slim, compact and so light to hold. It's great to be able to read clearly when I'm outside with no glare reflecting off the screen.I previously read books using the kindle app on my iPad mini but now I realize how bulky that was and, on sunny days, I had to tip the iPad this way & that to try and find a way to read with no glare, that doesn't happen with my kindle.This kindle does not have a backlight but I'm fine with that as I don't feel the need to read in the dark.",Love my new kindle.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Nice e reader. I do have some thoughts for Amazon though. I work with the elderly and have taught them to use the basic Kindle. A lot of them cannot get used to the new touch screen models. They often hit multiple pages at once, can't figure out how to get to the home page or ge to the book they want to read. You maybe losing some of your market.",Nice e reader;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love how lightweight and small this Kindle is. It's the perfect size for reading on the go or even just lying in bed, almost like reading a small book. The glare-free touchscreen and e-ink combined are very easy on the eyes and allows for long, better reading without headaches or eyestrain.",I love how lightweight and small this Kindle is;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"First off, I bought this at a great price ($49) during the 2014 Holiday Season Deals. I am very happy with this purchase. I have to admit, I haven't read many books in the past. I didn't seem to have the time or want to sit and read a clunky book. I normally get my reading fix from the internet or articles from a newspaper. Since I bought the Kindle, I've found myself reading more and wanting to read more books!The Kindle is light weight and simple to navigate. At a little over six and a half ounces, the Kindle is easy to hold with one hand and when I'm done, it disappears into my cargo pocket. The touchscreen is very responsive and after about five minutes, I knew all I needed to know about navigation and settings. Setting up the Wi-Fi was a breeze even with password protection. Downloading books and pictures were fast and simple, even while using my horribly slow satellite internet service. As for the Special Offers included with my Kindle, I thought that when I bought it I'd be seeing adverts popping up everywhere. The only times I've seen an advert was while it was in stand-by mode, so I don't have a problem with Amazon showing me a few random things from time to time.Another great thing about the Kindle is the battery life. I've only had to charge it once since I bought it and that was 27 days ago!!! That being said, I turn off the Wi-Fi when I'm not downloading books or syncing. I also only read about an hour or two a day, so results may vary for some buyers. Really the only thing I could wish for the Kindle is a Micro-SD slot. I know that it has Cloud storage, but I really would like to have multiple SD-cards for multiple genre categories. It would be nice for my personal preferences. All in all, this Kindle is great and I've recommended it to a dozen people so far. I'm very happy with my purchase and I will continue to use my Kindle for as long as it lasts!",Perfect for my needs;;;;;;
