column13: if I were going to buy an e-reader again
column14: I would still choose this one. I suspect it is the best on the market right now. But I do hope amazon will also continue to work out the kinks in the features.""

column16: but Many Kinks in Using Tool Bar and Keyboard""";;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Finally saw the point of getting a kindle. I was using the android app but decided it was time to use a kindle and saw the battery on my phone for other uses. This paperwhite is light and unobtrusive, no frills and no thrills but it is supposed to emulate a paperback. I kind of wish I had the model with the backlight but for the price I got it for on Amazon's 15th anniversary, I can't really complain. Works seamlessly with your kindle cloud and does everything you need it to. Battery life is great. I haven't charged it yet but I've been reading sporadically for 3 weeks.",Battery life is great. I haven't charged it yet but I've been ...;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"After making this upgrade all my notes and highlights in my most frequented book have been lost. My techie son spent a long time researching this online & trying to beat the problem, but to no avail. What's up with this vaunted whispernet? When are they going to learn what a young Bill Gates figures out long ago--that customers care much more about their data than they do about some factory's next new widget! Disappointed.After submitting this mostly negative review, I was contacted by Amazon asking me to contact their customer support number. After a long discussion with a very helpful agent, they confirmed that when books are updated on their system, personal notes and highlights are lost. They gave me a website where I can go to see them once I'm logged in (https://kindle.amazon.com/your_highlights), but they will never again show up on my Kindle device. Strangely, my old notes & highlights show up on the Kindle app on my iPhone. New notes and highlights show up on my Kindle. But I cannot see all of my notes & highlights on either my Kindle device nor on my iPhone.I asked the Amazon agent if they never thought of allowing customers to elect to upgrade to newer versions of books they own with the declared risk that they may lose their own valuable data. The agent said they will put that into their system for consideration.So, I reiterate what I said before. Personal data is more important that hardware. If Amazon wants us to stick with their hardware platform, they better find a way to protect my data. In the meantime, keep your notes & highlights on paper!",Previous personal notes & underlines won't display!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Simple e-reader. I wanted something that was NOT backlit that I could read before bed, since most lighted electronics can interfere with sleep and melatonin production.The things I like most:Very light--doesn't get wearisome to hold, even after several hoursYou can turn pages with a single hand-awesome for when the other hand is too busy petting a demanding kitty in your lapHolds battery life well--I read about 1-3 hours/night, on average, and I have to charge it maybe every two weeksVery fast response for page turnsThings I don't like:There is a bit of a lag from the time you hit the button on the bottom till the swipe to unlock function pops up (really not a big deal)General slowness of navigation through menus and whatnot--but not in the books themselvesIn low-light conditions, I wish the white part of the ""page"" could be a little whiter--more contrast would make it easier to see. But I think this is a factor of the technology and not this device, and I think that's just life with a non-lit e-reader.Overall, I love it. My husband also bought one, and he loves his, as well. If you want a simple, non-lit e-reader, I don't think you can go wrong with this one.",The things I like most: Very light--doesn't get wearisome to hold;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I prefer the text-to-speech feature of previous Kindle models, I am not a person to just sit and read.  I dearly love the text to speech because of its quirks, and mistakes that the author may make. It also helps me with the pronunciation of the off the wall names that the author gives to their characters.  Not all books are available in audible format.  I do not have to worry that the narrator voice will be unpleasant to my ears, this is the biggest reason I do not order many audio books, I just do not like the narrator. So when you come out with a new kindle that has text-to-speech even if only useable with a head set I will gladly buy one.Your,Judy",Text-to-speech;;;;;;

First, the screen freezes at seemingly random moments, when the backward tap and the menu tap do not work until I have tapped forward once. Second, and more importantly, the Notes function is more difficult to use than it was with my older Kindle, the one with the button keyboard. I use a Kindle for two reasons: convenience, and the ability to increase font size. The old Kindle allowed font size for Notes to be adjusted;" as best as I can determine

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I like this new kindle as I am so accustomed to touch screens I was irritated when I had to use a keyboard on my old second generation. It took no time at all to figure out home, return etc.  I chose to go with the kindle instead purchasing a kindle fire because I like reading outside and a backlit kindle is the only way to do it. They are a special segment of the electronic devices.  This model is smaller without the keyboard which I like for carrying in my purse on airplanes. I didn't like the kindle version of nupro cover that wouldn't stay closed if in a purse. Hated the feel of it, because I would rather be holding a book instead of a tablet so I got one of the leather-like covers made by Elsse. It is really nice and has the front flap pocket for my plane boarding passes. There was some frustration in Amazon's writeup of covers because I didn't know for sure if the cover was for the 6 inch display. They just mentioned 7th generation and I had no idea what generation it was. I noticed they fixed that on one of the pink Elsse covers.  I hope the touch screen works for a long time. My old 2nd gen was typing in U's on the search bar at the bottom covering up the last line of every page so hopefully this one will last as long as it did. Many years, and many books later.",Like the touchscreen.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I think 6"" is too small for a reader. it's hard to hold the thing without turning pages, and its awkward holding it with the edges.  BUT being able to read out in the sunlight is the best and why I gave it 5 stars.  Amazon has made the kindle universe rather convenient for a person that always reads.  I like the kindle apps on my notebook and phone, but I always take the kindle reader with me when I travel.",BUT being able to read out in the sunlight is the best and why I gave it 5 stars;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a whole library that I can hold in one hand!  I love to read but have limited space in my house, so it is really convenient to have this eReader where I can access a world of books.  It has my Bible, dictionary and other reference materials and I can access almost every book ever published.  I also find that many books are not issued in print anymore and I have them in my Kindle collection.THINGS YOU SHOULD KNOW ABOUT BATTERY LIFE.  I love that I can read for weeks with a single charge, but you have to be careful and use a Kindle knowledgeably because there are a few basic rules you must follow to prevent damage to the battery.  Just call Amazon Kindle help before your first use and they will be able to help you get set up safely.  You shouldn't over charge and you shouldn't try to use the Kindle while it is charging.  And you should never let it run completely down.  These things could damage the battery.  You should also know that a wifi internet connection drains the battery very fast.  Only connect to the internet while downloading a book, and when done, disconnect from the internet for low energy reading.  You cannot replace the battery on a Kindle so when you've used up all your charges, you must discard this device and buy a new Kindle.  I think if they wanted to, they could make these to last, but there is no profit in that, so remember that KINDLES ARE DISPOSABLE and your best course of action is to be aware of how to take care of your battery and give it maximum life.Another drawback is that Kindles are TINY.  They are not a good choice for cookbooks or for color magazines or for an atlas that needs a large page size to appreciate.  And Kindles are black & white only.  If you want a large screen and color display, you will have to move up to a tablet, but be aware that Kindle reading is extremely hard on the battery life of a tablet.One of my favorite features is that this particular Kindle is the cheapest because IT HAS NO BACKLIGHT.  This is considered a negative by some people, but I find that hours of staring into a backlit screen causes eyestrain.  This inexpensive Kindle is the easiest for me to read and I wish people could realize what constant backlit screen time does to one's eyes.I dont' think Kindle will ever completely replace print books.  I still have a small collection of my favorites in high quality hardbound editions.  But for general reading, this is an awesome compliment to my print collection.","Great Addition to My Print Library, but Will Never Replace Old Fashioned Books";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"There is no going back to books, this makes reading convenient on the go and while waiting for anything. It's really lightweight and easy to hold (I have small hands so books can actually be cumbersome to hold for long periods of time). Recommended this to my friends and they've all bought one and loved it too. I read on a night flight and the built in light was perfect, because I don't like the overhead lights.",Great buy!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I received the new kindle as a Fathers' Day 2015 gift from our youngest son. He gave me the kindle glare-free touchscreen. It improves reading experience in several ways. It saves reading state more often, allowing me to reliably switch to my old, original kindle--that I still use. The new kindle is more readable and certain commands are more intuitive. It is faster to connect with WiFi and I don't miss the ""experimental,"" ultra slow, and unreliable browser in the old kindle. However, I do miss side mounted page-turn buttons. This old feature allowed page turns forward and backward on both sides of the device, a feature that I've come to depend upon. Otherwise, I am hooked on my kindles. I now read many more books than I had read before I received both as gifts. I will not go back to buying paper books. I have a library that fits in my house rather than one the requires constant culling. Amazon makes book buying and reading the joy it was when I was a kid.",Good and Bad in New and Old Kindles;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I had paper white. Bought this as a gift. But returned because cannot justify giving an obsolete design as a gift, especially if it's for someone near and dear! It was great when there was no paper white. I think it will go out of production pretty soon.","Once you try paper white, you don't go back.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is exactly what I wanted.  My eyes can't see small print as easily as when I was younger. My wrists would be stiff from holding my iPad if I read for any length of time. Also,  Kindle books on my iPad difficult outdoors due to the glare.This device satisfies those three issues I was having.  I can easily adjust the size of the print, reducing my eye strain.  The device is deceivingly light-- a pleasant surprise, and I can comfortably read for hours. In fact, the device is lighter than any paperback book.  Importantly, too,  the device allows me to read outdoors thanks to its glare-free screen.  Overall, it is easy to use. There is no learning curve required to become comfortable with the device;" even my 90 year old mother found it easy to use. Bundling all these benefits together with the rather modest price I paid ($69)
Review: and I think it is an excellent bargain. I strongly recommend it to anybody facing the same issues that I was.""
column4: light weight
column5: glare free
column6: and easy to use-- it meets all my needs!""";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Day one post,will update later if needed.:so far I like my Kindle a lot it is very simple and isn't overly complicated like some other tablets out there and instantly downloads books without any problems, I don't know why people don't like it, it is very simple and quite elegant and extremely light, it's actually lighter than my Samsung s5, I can see myself reading hundreds of books on this thing, and when I'm flying around the country which I do once in awhile it would be nice to have something that won't Eat through a battery in 5 seconds. I highly recommend this eReader.  Definitely get the $10/month Kindle unlimited, and maybe a led headlamp for hassle free nighttime reading.",Awesome Kindle.;;;;;;

Review: I am so glad I got it. I am still trying to learn how to use it. I think I clicked on the wrong thing and I lost one of the books I was reading.  I just wasn't looking where I was going. or I pushed the wrong button. I love it but I had to get something to hold the book for me.. I am 78 years old and can't hold anything too long. I love to read and I wanted something that I could take with me when I go to Doctor or to take my husband to the VA and I can read while I wait for him.I don't like someone to read to me. I like to read the Kindle. I don't like to read books anymore. they are so big and heavy. Now the Kindle is very LIGHT. I knitted a little bag with a handle so I don't have any trouble fumbling in my pocket book. I can just hang it on my arm and I am ready to go. I hope I have helped you in deciding if you would love to have one....like I said I love this new invention...Cheers !
Title;;;;;;: I am so glad I got it;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I liked this device but discovered I had ordered one without a back light. I don't see as well in low light as I used to (one of the irritating things about getting older) so I sent it back and got the one with the back light. It is very light, fits in my purse with no problem and the battery lasts for a long time. It is just a reader so if you are looking for a tablet to do other things, this won't work for you. But it is an awesome e-reader.","Light, long battery and holds a ton of books.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"It's a great upgrade from my Kindle Keyboard!  Pages load faster and it is much lighter.  I think the feature I enjoy the most is the vocabulary builder, as it is helpful in learning new words.  I believe it's worth mentioning that this version does not have the text to speech feature nor a headphone input.  One thing I find questionable is the lack of a power charger, but the kindle charges on my cell phone charger so it's not a problem for me.  Overall, I am very happy with my purchase.",Great upgrade from my Kindle Keyboard;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"Not being a native English speaker, I appreciated a lot the dictionary functionality in my older non-touchscreen Kindle. In the Touchscreen version, however, the re-designed dictionary functionality is much less useful for a number of reasons:Some dictionary articles for derived words are just referring to the main word. For example: the article for ""beheld"" has only this text: ""beheld /bi ' held/ past and past participle of BEHOLD"". Now good luck navigating from here to the ""behold"" article. In the old kindle the dictionary was displayed the same way the book is displayed, with full support for looking up the words in the dictionary, and additionally, the reference to the main dictionary article was actually a hyperlink, and you could just move cursor there and navigate to the ""BEHOLD"" article. In the new dictionary design it is impossible, none of the words in the dictionary popup window is clickable. Some articles are quite strange, for example, the article for ""mine"" has 5 meanings, among which, in addition to ""belonging to me"" and ""mine as in mining"", there is a list of things like ""9th letter of the alphabet"" - so it seems that the dictionary mixes together related word's homonyms (mine is form of ""I"", let's show the other meanings of the word ""I""), which does not make much sense if not confusing.",the re-designed dictionary functionality is much less useful for a number of reasons;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Although I had the first Kindle for at least 5 years, I am trying to give this one a fair trial.  One way that I can't become accustomed to is the way of changing pages.  This Kindle requires the little pen,type thing and even then it is sometimes stubborn.  Another way I find to take some changing, is the way the books are displayed with the book covers.  Since my eyesight is not strong, I liked the titles to be displayed in print.  As it is, I may be required to get a page enlarger/microscope.  Did the developers think of visually impaired people who are trying to read the titles in the contents?  Otherwise, this kindle is acceptable.",Change for the visually impaired could be really good;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Full disclosure-- I previously owned a Kindle Fire HD (that died very suddenly, and inexplicably after 2 years of gentle use), so my opinions on the Kindle Touch is after having owned a fancier model of Kindle.Over all, this is a good little e-reader. It does the job. It's small enough for me to hold & operate one handed (and I have small/medium sized lady hands). The font adjustment options make it easy to find something readable for your own eyes, and the paperwhite screen is wonderful. It's so nice to be able to read outside on a sunny day without glare making it impossible to see the words!! I love how light this little thing is, how portable, and how easy & straight forward to use.My biggest complaint is with the lag in doing... well... anything. Pages do not seamlessly turn, it takes a second or two to utilize the X-ray or dictionary features, etc. It's not a deal breaker, but having come from the Kindle Fire HD it's definitely something that I notice and am mildly irritated by. Also, I sort of hate that it's only black & white. Buying books, and seeing the full-colour covers in my 'library' is something that I miss.In general, this is just a MUCH more basic reading experience than what I experienced with the Fire HD. However, that is to be expected as the price is essentially 1/3 of what the Fire HD cost. Some trade off is to be expected, I suppose. I will say that having a more inexpensive e-reader (though lacking in some bells & whistles that I had grown accustomed to) is nice because I feel less worried about ""being careful"" with it, and babying it. There is a bit more freedom to be found with a device that doesn't cost hundreds of dollars.Over all, I would recommend this e-reader to someone who really just needs a BASIC e-reader that they can take on the bus, traveling, etc. It's portable, it's readable, and it very much does the job. However, if having something fancy & shiny is important to you, you may want to consider one of the Fire series readers.","Good, but basic!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"We got a Kindle Fire HD a while back, but I've always hesitated pulling the trigger on the ""normal"" Kindle readers for some reason...until now.  Bought this during Amazon's ridiculous ""black friday in july"" thing a few weeks ago, and then picked up the complete works of H.P. Lovecraft to read while flying/waiting at the airport.  Absolutely no regrets: easy to setup, easy to customize on the fly, easy to use/place bookmarks, and the battery lasts FOREVER compared to tablets/phones!  I charged it to 100% 2 weeks ago, and it's still >50%, and that's with me reading from it probably 1-2 hours/day.  I wish it was a bit easier to turn off the screen completely (it's easy to go to screensaver), but holding the power button down for 7ish seconds isn't that hard (once I figured that's how you power down the device).Plenty of storage space, and Amazon's cloud makes it fairly easy to move books from cloud to device A to device B, etc.","Small, light, easy to hold, easy to read, and VERY long battery life!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"As always an invaluable toy. I love that it has no backlight and doesn't hurt my eyes, I love that I can tap any word and get the definition straight away. I love that I can tap the screen and get additional information. I love the free lenders library. I love that I can convert from text to talk on any book. I read so much more with this than an actual book and find reading so much more rewarding with the additional features over a book. Love it. Love it. Love it.",Love it. Love it. Love it.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Great product. Can't give it five stars though. Battery definitely does not last weeks. And, just a couple of glitches in the software, like page turns sometimes turn back more than one page. It's easy to rub the screen and the font size will change unexpectedly. Also, I wish you could filter your library by ""Samples"". Also, I wish the store had more of a curated storefront, and when you browse books.What I do like about it:Great product for reading. You get lost in the reading.Pretty darn good interface.Easy to use.Love the dictionary.Touchscreen works great.Great price.I definitely like the product, and the price.",Great product. Can't give it five stars though;;;;;;
4.0 out of 5 stars,"It came as expected.  I was a bit disappointed in the asthetics of the device;" the back of the device is just plastic. The back of my original one (with buttons
Review: but not the one with the keyboard) has a back that is... Different. It's lovely to hold
Title;;;;;;: versus this one. This one feels... cheaper.This device is also heavier than my previous model. All in all
column4: I have no real complaints other than asthetics. It will be going in a case
column5: so all will be well. Functionally
column6: the device works as expected. I just have to get used to not pushing forward or back buttons on the sides!!""
column7: Overall good
column8: asthetics are... Eh.""";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love my new Kindle! I had a first generation 6"" Kindle since they came out and finally had to replace it. I choose the newer one for the same reasons I got the first one, size, ease of use. The touchscreen takes some getting used to as it has such a quick response you can move to far to quickly if you are not very careful. I am sure with use I can master that as I have my other touchscreen devices.The keyboard is much improved and so much better than the pop up keyboard on my old Kindle.If you are looking for a device that is easy to toss in any of your bags/briefcases this is the one.",Love my new Kindle!;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"My original $79 Kindle died last month and this is the new model that replaces it.  My old Kindle (not sure the generation) was about 5 years old and it did not have a touch screen.  This is a very poor substitute.  It is lighter, which is good, but it is made with lightweight plastic, not the metal-like material of my old Kindle.  I suspect this will crack easily. The only accessories that fit this Kindle are covers.  (My old Kindle had a rubber case -- like a skin -- that protected it while also making it easy to read with one hand. If I want to hold a thing with a cover, I can read a book.)  But the worst part is the touch screen.  It seems like it turns the page if you breathe on it.  If you brush it with your sleeve you can wind up in the next chapter.  Be careful when you pick it up or it will change the font.  Ridiculous.  I am now sorry I didn't consider the Voyage model (which does not have a touch screen) more seriously, even though it has an outrageous price.",This is Progress?;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm replacing a white Kindle Keyboard. This is ok and does the job, but I'm very disappointed that it doesn't have a headset Jack. I like to switch between reading and listening. I want the glare free, but I also want the audio.  Also, the older model had small holes in the side that allowed me to attach a slim cover with a LED light. The new model doesn't allow for that option.",Not as good as the old Kindle keyboard.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I finally broke down and purchased a Kindle on sale at xmas.  Since I wasn't sure I would like it, I purchased the least expensive one available.  Let me start off by saying that I read books from the library.  And generally I read hardcovers because the fonts are larger and there is ample vertical spacing.  Paperbacks often have tiny fonts and the lines of text have no vertical spacing and I find it difficult to read.  I read free/library books on the Kindle as I do not purchase books.The internet speed on this device is horribly slow.  Wait, wait, wait.  It loses a star for that.I like that I can select text font and size.  The screen is not white bright so reading at night does not blast my eyes with blue light.  I can read for many hours before the device needs charging which for me is every couple of weeks.  I can read at least 30 hours with a single charge (I have no real data, just guesses).  The UI is easy to use and it's mostly very good.What I don't like about it....  The screen flashes when you change pages and with reasonable sized fonts, one changes pages more frequently than with a book.  I wish I could select the screen area for forward/backward page movement.  If I accidentally touch the screen, the page changes.I can't comment on the features related to using the store to purchase books.I'm a luddite and still like paper books, but the Kindle is OK.It's really not a bad little device for the price.  I",Nice little device;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I replaced my 2nd generation Kindle with this.  I have always loved using a kindle.  It is so easy to carry with me almost everywhere I go.  This version is even more compact.  It's a great size which will fit in most purses.  It is still fantastic for reading inside or outside in the sunlight.  I really like the touch screen, but I wish it didn't require wifi for downloading books.  I just need to make sure I have enough reading material before leaving the house.",I have always loved using a kindle;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is the 2nd reader I've had;" the first one was a Kindle Keyboard. All of my experiences written in this review reflect that these are the only 2 readers I've used.I really like the new OS and I think the features of the 7th Generation are far better than the old Kindle Keyboard. Here are a few things I like.- As with previous versions
Review: you can add several dictionaries. But with this one you can change dictionaries on the fly. You touch and hold a word to pop up the dictionary. Then
column4: you can change dictionaries. This is very helpful when you have a standard dictionary (or two or three)
column5: a Bible dictionary
column6: and something like a tech or medical dictionary. You can easily see what each dictionary says about that word.- On the same pop up as the dictionary is a Wikipedia tab that allows you to see a brief description of what Wikipedia says about that word. That's very helpful especially if none of your dictionaries has a definition for the word.- You can quickly and easily see what books or documents you have on the device vs in the Amazon cloud
column7: and you can easily move items back and forth.- Tapping the Go To tab while in a book allows you to see the various chapters and other divisions that may be built into the book. And
column8: as before
column9: you can go to a particular page
column10: location
column11: etc.- You can """"thumb thru"""" the pages of the book without leaving the page you're on. This is useful if you want to reference something on another page while reading.One thing I don't like is that Active Content cannot be installed on the Kindle 7th Gen. I was very disappointed when I found that out. On my Kindle Keyboard
column12: you can add Active Content like games
column13: address books
column14: notepads
column15: etc. I had a Notepad app on the Kindle Keyboard that I used every day. It contained lists of books that I wanted to read
column16: and other things of that sort. It was very useful to me to have that on the same device that I mainly use to read.Overall
column17: I would recommend this reader unless Active Content is a must for you.""

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm unable to do anything with it. Just read.  I'm unable to use dictionary for my own purpose. When I go to dictionary I'm unable to bring up keyboard.  I would like to transfer everything I had in my old Kindle, I have been unsuccessful there also. Completely frustrated.  I have read your Kindle Manual but I'm not able to go back to the problems I want to address at that one particular time.  I think I'm going back to my old K.  However, its screen has faded, this is the reason why I went for K 6.  On another subject can the screen on my old K be repaired.  I miss my dictionaries, Bible,etc.",I would like to transfer everything I had in my old Kindle;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I have owned a kindle touch approx. 2012, and also a kindle paperwhite 2014.  But this device took away the ""home"" button which is so helpful.  Then they took the screen and shoved it up an inch so the screen is no longer centered on the device.  I hate both these things about this and none of my other covers will fit it anymore because of that stupid wasted space at the bottom.  The guts of the device are still good its just I keep pressing dead space where there should be a home button (which is now only touch available.)  The whole thing is a bad design.  I actually prefer my older model (Kindle Touch- which also has the capacity to convert your books to audio.... a very robotic voice but its still helpful if you need to be hands free.)",I hate both these things about this and none of my ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"bought this as a gift for my nephew as a part of the kids bundle, which is great as it also comes with a 2 year square trade warrantee. I have a few kindles, and have gotten one for my daughter, sister and my mom in the past. we are a kindle family, this one with its protective case is a great value for the teen who isn't always as careful with his electronics, as the warrantee covers breakage, I look forward to him using it for years to come, and being a reader!",love it!!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought this as a gift fro two people. A dear friend and my younger brother. My friend loves it so much that every time I see him, he goes on about how amazing the kindle is and how much he has been able to get more reading done by having this great device. I love seeing my brother use it because he has gotten more into reading and you can never go wrong with that.As for the device itself, it is pretty nice and simple. It's small and lightweight so it's easy to carry around. Reading feels almost like a real book and the only thing I miss when using it is that smell of paper you get when reading a real book but it's nice to save the trees a little. Looking up the definition of words in the book couldn't be easier and having amazon prime, it definitely makes the Kindle a must have device! Only thing is that I wish it had some kind of light because reading at night now requires a book light or external light source. I guess you could always get the newer version if that is a problem but for the price difference, I am definitely happy with this one!","Great device to encourage reading! Small, light and convenient to carry around! Great as a gift or for yourself or friends!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am addicted to my Kindle! I love having a home library, filled with physical books at my fingertips whenever I'm researching. However, having a Kindle is wonderful for reading novels! I never got to read many novels because much of my life has been spent in the textbooks. With the Kindle I am able to pick a textbook or novel out and read it without having to hold up a book and manage the pages and keep it from being at a bad angle. I still prefer physical books for researching, but maybe there is an adjustment period for me. The kindle is always at a good angle, is light weight and the screen is great on my eyes! I have had an astigmatism for most of my life and reading has always caused headaches, so enjoying reading is something I never experienced until having the Kindle. I got this Kindle as a test to see if it would be a good gift for my daughter for Christmas, and we also purchased the paperwhite to see the difference. I, myself, like the basic kindle better than the paperwhite because of the balance to it's weight overall and the screen. However, I decided that I would give my daughter the paperwhite for Christmas this year since she can read things with the light whereas I have a difficulty with lights. My daughter likes to read in bed at night with just a night light and the paperwhite will be perfect for that. She was upset when I told her we could only keep one and the paperwhite had to go back (I really just wrapped it to give it to her after we decided she would enjoy it).After purchasing two kindles, we ended up getting a third one for my mother who loves it as well!",Our family loves having Kindles!;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm still getting used to it.  Biggest problem I have is something popping up unexpectedly while I'm reading.  Apparently I am unknowingly ""tapping"" something.  Hopefully that won't happen as often as time goes on.  Touchscreen may not be best for everyone.  Meanwhile I still love the convenience of reading via a Kindle!",Touchscreen May Not Be For Everyone!;;;;;;

Review: Received on time and was as advertised.  I am pleased with my purchase.  After finally using this Kindle I feel it deserves more than my original 2 sentence review.  I do not like to write reviews but I am so happy with this purchase I wanted to encourage people to consider this item.  I owned the $69 Kindle.  It was my first Kindle and I loved it.  I hesitated buying this one because I felt how different could it be from what I already had.  Well I was wrong.  This was a definite upgrade for me.  I love the touch screen.  I only use my Kindle for reading books and this one makes me feel like I am reading a book.  It is fast and easy to handle.  The price is very reasonable.  You are definitely getting your money's worth.  I spent weeks deliberating should I or shouldn't I and I'm glad I finally said I should.
Title;;;;;;: I am pleased with my purchase;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love it!! I've been a Kindle convert for years and when my last one finally gave out on me I switched over to using my iPad and iPhone in its stay.  After a few months I noticed my eyes straining to read at times and dryness in them I'd never experienced before.  Turns out I was spending too much time staring at a computer at work only to go home and stare a bright screen all night.  The price, as always, is perfect - and I've had zero eye issues since.I love the smaller design and the lightweight feel - so easy to throw into even the smallest bag for a day so I always have my library at my fingertips.","Happy, As Always";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"All three of us enjoy our three Kindles as we all read a great deal. My first kindle is 6 years old and is starting to lose some battery life, I  bought this one to replace the old one.  In retrospect I think I probably should have upgraded to the paperwhite my wife and daughter have.",LIKE ALOT BUT PAPERWHITE NEXT TIME;;;;;;

Review: I really like this Kindle. It is light weight and easy to read. I have a tablet which is very nice but I find myself using the Kindle because it is so comfortable to use. If you are looking for something fancy then this is not for you. It is a great basic reader.  I also like the touchscreen.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I like this kindle. Obviously this is not the backlit version, so don't expect to read it in the dark. Connected to Wifi on first try and loaded my e-books onto it with no issues. Touch screen is fine for me, not too sensitive. I bought the ad-version since it was cheaper, no issues for me. When ads are on the screen, I'm not using the Kindle so it doesn't affect me. I got this on sale for $49, so it was a steal :)Minus 1 star for the plastic backing, which makes it very slippery to hold. I don't plan to buy a case, so this was a negative for me. Perhaps if they used a different material on the back so gripping it wouldn't be so difficult (no, I do not want to buy a case just for this).",Overall Nice :);;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"Part of my disappointment is just my inability to figure out how to use this device.  Does not come with a users' guide because the guide is on the device...not very useful if you can't read the reader!!  Us older folks (at least this one) need more direction than just where the ""on"" button is!  I will figure it out, but feel it should have been much easier and better explained in a ""get started"" booklet, at the very least!  VERY FRUSTRATING!!!  I would (and probably will have to) call customer support, and add the frustration of trying to understand some well-meaning person who cannot speak English!!  YOUR CUSTOMER SUPPORT IS NOT AS GOOD AS YOU THINK IT IS!",Part of my disappointment is just my inability to figure out how to ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"LOVE LOVE LOVE our kindle...this is our 3rd purchase for another family member.  I have personally owned a kindle since the day they launched them many years ago.  Not only do I love that it is like reading off regular paper and print but I can also read it directly in the sunlight just like a real paper book.  Choose a great leather cover and it is even better than a paper book!  As well, Amazon.com has fabulous customer service...any time that I have had an issue with a kindle (which is rare), they immediately solve or replace the device.  BEST purchase ever!",LOVE LOVE LOVE our kindle;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my 4th Kindle. I've only had the keyboard version until now, but I took the chance and ordered one during Prime Day. It's smaller than the keyboard version and I'm just getting used to the new device layout, but so far it's working great. My current Kindle keyboard was purchased used and with Special Offers. I decided to pay to have the offers taken off, so whem]n the time came to choose this model, I paid a little more to get a device without the special offers. The SO aren't intrusive at all, it was just my preference to get a device without them. So fae Im pleased. The touch interface does take some getting used to as I am used to physical keys to turn pages, but so far that's my only complaint.",but so far it's working great. My current Kindle keyboard was purchased used and ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have a Kindle Fire HD and have had a lot of problems reading it in or near direct sunlight.  I bought this (and the case) and it has worked great.  I can even wear polarized sunglasses and read the kindle in direct sunlight.  There really doesn't seem to be much difference between looking at a paper book page and the kindle, so this was a great purchase for me.  Of course, not having the integrated light means that I can't read in low light situations, but that's what I have my Kindle Fire HD for.",Great for reading in direct sunlight (no glare);;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love it!  Very glad I got this version, without the screen light (and without the ads).  I deliberated long and hard comparing this model with the Paperwhite, the Kindle Fire, Nexus, Kobo, Nook, Samsung, etc.  I previously had a 2010 Nook and then later, a 2012 Nexus 7. Comparing the two dedicated e-readers, I like this way better than the Nook.  Battery is far superior, page-turning is better and it's considerably lighter.  I chose to go with this as opposed to a Nexus or Kindle Fire because I didn't really need it for web surfing or email;" I have my smart phone and my 12"""" computer to perform those functions.  I wanted the very best e-reader
Review: with the longest-lasting battery

column16: so this handy device is bound to save me from boredom --because I don't plan to be online much at those prices!  If you just want something for reading books
column17: don't want to spend a fortune and don't want to have to even THINK about your battery
column18: this is the one to get!  By the way
column19: I signed up for Kindle Unlimited at $9.99/month
column20: and I'm absolutely loving it.  It's totally worth it
column21: and it's such a pleasure to """"buy"""" with one click and have it magically appear on my Kindle within less than 30 seconds.  No more downloading
column24: copying and all that.  Just click the book you want on Amazon and presto
column25: it appears on your Kindle and you can start reading.  It really couldn't be easier.""
column26: Battery lasts an unbelievably long time
column27: and it's super thin and light.""";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love this.  I have always prefered the plain Kindle over the color ones, but after reading Kindle books on my touch-screen smart phone I missed the ability to touch a word to find its definition.  This Kindle exactly meets my needs - I can use touch-screen for those features, but it still is small, portable, and one charge lasts several weeks. All the benefits of the original, with a touch-screen - and the right price. I highly recommend it.",I was hoping for this!;;;;;;

Review: I liked my old kindle for reading periodicals and books.  It was not a touch screen and was much easier to navigate than this newer version  with the touch screen.  The screen is as easy to read outdoors and its compact size makes it easy to pack and travel.  My major complaint is that the touch screen is very sensitive causing it to double skip pages and doesn't respond to reversing the error. I also have a Kindle Fire and only use this new Kindle for reading as the display performs better  in the light of outdoors.
Title;;;;;;: New reader not as good as the older model;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've had my new Kindle for a few weeks now, and I LOVE it.I had the 5th generation before, with the side buttons and the ones on the front. It wasn't dying, but I wanted an upgrade and I was able to give my old one to my kid sister so that she could travel with a library in her bag.The only issue I have with the touch-screen Kindle is that it seems to be almost TOO sensitive. I vape, and anytime my ""smoke"" hits the screen, the font size changes. I have no idea why this is, but it happens. The other thing is that anytime I set the Kindle down on a metal surface--like the side of my stove, or the metal wastebasket in my bathroom--it goes into standby mode.Honestly, I find these issues more amusing than anything, so I'm not too bothered by it overall.I am REALLY, REALLY happy with the Goodreads link system and the timer that lets you know how much longer you should expect to be on a chapter or the book entirely. Now when I'm reading a really good book and glance at the clock to calculate how much sleep I'll have before work, I can do it within a smaller margin of error. It helps with my neurosis.Overal, I'm loving this. I would recommend it to everyone. The glare-free screen is perfect. I couldn't do any of the back-lit screens because of my sensitive eyes, and this is a great way to keep my headaches in check and enjoy my favorite books in a light, user-friendly device.",I have an overly sensitive Kindle.;;;;;;

Review: As a big reader I have owned many Kindle. This Kindle is my favorite in size and ease. I love reading outside and with this screen I can see on the brightest day as well as on an overcast day. I have nothing bad to say. Not one to nitpick things I can honestly say there's nothing to nitpick here. I'm sure there are those people that can but why??? This Kindle does exactly what I bought it for... To be able to relax and read with enjoyment. I would recommend this to all that love the joy of reading.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I have a Kindle which I have been using for several years. I use it almost daily, and I have more books in it than I ever could fit into my limited bookcase.Pros: Long battery life; Ease of reading;" Large number of books available
Review: many are either free or less than $5.Cons: Many places I go to still have the old peer-to-peer WiFi
Title;;;;;;: which is completely incompatible with any Kindle. If Kindle doesn't start allowing users to register and manage the installed software through the plug-in to the internet connection
column4: this will be unusable.I want to get a new one
column5: like this
column6: to carry with me in lieu of a book. My Kindle got dropped and the case is cracked
column7: but until this negative is fixed
column8: anyone in my situation will have to either get a 3G Kindle
column9: or go with a different reader.""
column10: Best e-book reader on the market.";;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought this item as a gift. My friend loves to read and takes this on the train with her all the time! If you're thinking about getting one... I suggest purchasing an Amazon Prime Membership as well because it gives you access to over 500,000 books, which is a great compliment to this product.",Get Amazon Prine with this!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This entry level e-reader has a lot offer for Its low price. It has great response time when flipping pages and displays text in high resolution. Due to its use of e-ink, it acts and looks just like a paper book and does not bother one's eyes like traditional LCD displays would. I would recomend this e-reader to anyone who is an avid reader that is looking to transition to e-books.On a semi-unrelated note, I had noticed that there were some reviews on this item that gave it only 1 star. 1 star, not because the device was D.O.A., not charging, not loading books, or freezing. No, they gave it 1 star because: (A) it wasn't backlit, (B) it didn't have page buttons on the side like previous models, or (C) didn't come with directions/wifi.Since some people on here are too incompetent to read a device description about an E-READER, I will list some points to save you money and future regret:1. IT'S NOT BACKLIT!!!!!!!! No where in the description does it say that it's backlit!!!!!! If you want a backlit kindle, you should have purchased the PAPERWHITE OR VOYAGER!2. IT'S A TOUCH SCREEN!!!!! You don't even have to read the description to understand that! The preety product pictures clearly show no page buttons.  The only button on the device is the power button!3. THE DIRECTIONS ARE IN THE KINDLE!!!!!! There are two manuels (books) pre-installed for you that tell you everthing that you would want to know about your kindle. The one labeled ""set-up"" will guid you through the process of setting up your kindle.4. If you don't understand how to setup your kindle, have someone who is tech-savvy do it for you.5. Leaving a 1 star review on a product that is specialy designed for READING,  because you are too incompetent to READ the discription of the device, makes me lose faith in humanity.",Awesome entry level e-reader!!!!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love the Kindle. But Amazon should stop using Lasership. They play your game using Prime saying the package was delivered on time when it's not. I see hundreds of people have been complaining about Lasership since 2010. I had 2 packages in one week that tracked as delivered when they weren't. The Kindle is great, the shipping needs repair.",Great Kindle - Lasership;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"i tried to read on my iPad, Galaxy note 3 phone and 8 inch tablet....glare glare glare!  I purchased this on the not Black Friday Wednesday for $49. It is worth every penny.  I downloaded my library, and bought a light.  Is perfect in every way. As a ebook only.  Is nice and light weight, easy to toss in a bag and go.  Only 4 stars due to the font size continually changes with each opening.",Perfect for vacation at the beach!;;;;;;

Review: By far one of my best purchases! Each of my son's ages 9 and 11 had the Kindle fire and they read on it at home but they also were tempted to play their games on the fire too! This they now can take to school. They have used this so much and they are reading a lot more. I have recommended this to all parents I know.
Title;;;;;;: By far one of my best purchases! Each of my son's ages 9 and ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Had issues with the original one I got. The battery was going down super quickly, and the screen was unbelievably touchy. It was easy to work with Amazon and get a replacement, though. Happy to say the old one must have been a dud, because the new one isn't nearly as bad on the battery!",Love it!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love it. I previously had the kindle keyboard and it finally went kaput on me. I love the e-ink so I went with this one. I was leary of the paper white because of the backlight, I stare at a computer screen all day at work and I didn't want to feel like that was what I was doing at home too.This little gadget is a perfectly portable size, albeit a little thicker than the keyboard version, but nothing you can't get used to in a couple uses. The touch screen is responsive with no over sensitivity uses. I'm really enjoying it so far and the battery is holding up really well, still on the first charge after a week of daily use. I would definitely recommend! :) happy reading!",Perfectly portable;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I really like the Kindle. I've never had an ereader before and frankly didn't see the point of them. The Kindle was only $60 when I got it though so I figured I would give it a try. After using it for a few weeks, I definitely see the appeal. It's extremely light, even lighter than my phone, the screen is great, it really does feel like reading a paper book, and the battery has grew endurance, about 2 weeks on a half charge out of the box. I think I bought this at a perfect time, I get a device with a touch screen and decent resolution for a great price while the old Kindle only had physical buttons or you had to get the more expensive model with a touch screen. The only downsides to the device are the lack of a backlight and the recessed screen tends to gather dust in the seams between the screen and the casing. I really like the Kindle but I think I'm going to exchange it for the paperwhite since I would like to do more reading at night when i get him from work without having the lights on.",I really like the Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"It was easy to set up, it charges quickly and very easy to use. It is lightweight and easy to hold. It is glare free which makes it easy to read without straining my eyes. It fits easily in my purse when I want to take it with me. It comes with nice features. I really like the dictionary. Very happy with my purchase.",Five stars;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first Kindle. I am not sure what i was expecting. It looks like a toy. It is so light and the screen looks like a sticker lol. It is much smaller than I thought it would be. That is not a complaint. Its about the size of the average paperback without the bulk. I love the convenience of book shopping on it. It is a little annoying that it takes up half the screen giving recommendations. I wish it had a more ""bookshelf"" look to it. Battery life seems fantastic and it charges really quickly. It isnt lighted which is something i didnt think i would mind at the moment but i might order a different one or a lighted case. I have wanted one for a while and all and all I dont feel let down. I dont love it and will probably give it to my 8 year old and get myself one with a lighted screen but I really like this Kindle and I dont think i will buy another paperback.",Four Stars;;;;;;

Review: Yes. I know it isn't backlit.  No.  I don't mind thumbing to flip pages.  No I don't like it because my old one (one of the first Kindles) was much more user friendly.  I would love to have one like my old one that finally froze and couldn't come back to life.  I had 70 unread books stored on the old one.  I cannot determine which in my Cloud I've read and which I need to deliver to the new Kindle with few exceptions.  I could deliver the whole Cloud content which would not be any better in trying to determine which I haven't read.  This is a bummer all the way around.
Title;;;;;;: No I don't like it because my old one (one of the first ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love this device! It has given me back the pleasure of reading. I have a form of dyslexia that makes reading black words on stark white pages very difficult (Scotopic Sensitivity Syndrome, or Irlen Syndrome);" this device makes it easy for me to read and comprehend what it is I am reading because it doesn't have that blinding contrast on the page. And it is so convenient
Review: I have so many books on it to compliment my varied interests
Title;;;;;;: and I can carry them all around in my coat pocket. And my Bible is always at my fingertips.Reading a good book is now the pleasure it was intended to be.""
column4: Reading is a convenience and a pleasure.";;;;;

Review: This is my second kindle my (first was the one with buttons 4th generation) very easy to navigate  has a new feature call good reads full of hardcore readers that they think they are expert in writing or something and some casual readers I didn't bother with it much my only problem is that if feels hollow like a big calculator and makes it feel kinda cheap which I understand was to make I light so you need to buy a cover for this to keep it looking good and feel good.
Title;;;;;;: ... (first was the one with buttons 4th generation) very easy to navigate has a new feature call good reads ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've thoughoughly enjoyed two Nook ereaders over the last few years, however, both have eventually broken where the charging cord attaches to the unit.  Very frustrating when I have hundreds of books & samples downloaded on each.  Getting support for Nook is FRUSTRATING.  Very hard to communicate with overseas reps.  I was reluctant to change because of my extensive Nook library, but since I buy everything else on Amazon, this move made sense.  I LOVE MY NEW KINDLE!  It costs less than Nooks, is lighter, holds a charge for over a week, and has some cool features that I like.  Most importantly, you get more extensive definitions when looking up words, and they are then added to your own list of vocabulary words.  Dorky, but fun to look back over and see if I remember what the words I've already looked up mean.  I also enjoy the ""X-ray"" feature. I've compared a couple of ebook prices and they are cheaper through Amazon (than on Barnes &Noble). I was annoyed that Amazon charges for an ad-free version, so I bought the one with ads.  I don't mind them at all, in fact, have even clicked on few.  My ONLY complaint... Come on on Amazon and just include a charger!  That's kind of ridiculous to charge extra for something that should be included.",Switched from Nook to Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am soooo grateful to be able to read in the bright sunlight! I lent my other nonglare ereader to my mom, and past few days have been sunny and gorgeous! I saw the sale, and snapped this up, along with the hard-cover, and the extended ADD insurance. Cost around 80 bucks. I prefer the touch screen, and if you do the demo when you first register this kindle, it is SUPER easy to navigate! I paid the extra for next day shipping, and was super happy with it!",it is SUPER easy to navigate;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"My first kindle died (after I evidently rolled on it a bit too hard). It was a Kindle Keyboard, and I had done over 500 books when it croaked.And now I have the new one, and I love it! Back in the book-reading business!BTW, I do like the interface. More akin to the Fire interface (my wife has one), less like the gopher interface of a long, long time ago, pre-www.",and I love it! Back in the book-reading business;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"Had to replace my old Kindle Touch, which bit the dust after continual issues with the power button sticking and breaking.  Great deal during Black Friday on the new Kindle.  Sadly, the new Kindle (7th gen.) does not have text-to-speech and will not play the active content word games I enjoyed on the Kindle Touch.  I had expected to be able to transfer everything over from the old Kindle, but clearly was mistaken.  BEWARE!",Not up to snuff - less versatile than older models;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Even with the most basic model, Amazon still makes a worthwhile e-reader.  Granted, I bought Kindle Fire HD 6 to be shared with the family, its been passed around so much that by the time it get passed along to me, I don't have much time to read.  I knew it was going to happen eventually, so when it sooner than I expected I settled on a refurbished Kindle Touch.  In this case, ""settling"" turnout to be one the best decisions I made in while.The refurbished Kindle Touch is almost indistinguishable from its ""new"" predecessors except sometime during lifetime it was returned to Amazon for some reason.  The device itself the most basic of e-reader offered by Amazon primarily to get you to buy e-books from their online store but can also be used read e-books borrowed from public libraries and carry around compatible personal documents, pending you don't mind the monochrome presentation.  Resembling a small tablet computer (in alot of respects, it is), an e-reader distinguishes itself from tablets with a monochrome ""electronic ink"" screen that does not refresh itself like other LCD screens and has a lower power consumption rate that can make the battery last for days, weeks between recharges.  This is a dedicated e-reader - there are no apps that can be installed and no speaker or headphone jack to listen to *.mp3s or audiobooks - perhaps more importantly, this model is not aPaperwhiteand you must have yourexternal light sourceto read in low-light situations.As good as it is, there is one major fault that I discovered the hard way.  While Amazon elaborates in alot of official documentation about personal documents and cloud storage, a rather perverse semantics come into play - access to the cloud library is NOT the same as Amazon's Cloud drive.  In other words, if you have personal files stored on Amazon's cloud drive they will not be accessible from this version of the Kindle.  In order to read your personal documents from the Kindle, you must either send them via e-mail or copy them via USB.  As a corollary, by plugging in this Kindle to your computer, it's identified as mass storage device so managing it is not much different from a USB flash drive.If you can keep the above in mind, I think you can really make for you.  I bought the refurbished Kindle primarily to save every cent I could and what I get out of it more than makes up for its limits - you can buy inexpensive generic clip-on spotlight for low-light reading and if all you do to read, the Kindle is more than suited to the task with the durability and ease of use you can only get at these prices.  In addition to buying Kindle, I would recommend buying folio-type cover and screen protector to further increase the longevity of your Kindle.",A E-reader with without the premium pricetag;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Honestly I thought I was getting the newer daylight to dark version of a Kindle. This one is nice enough, but the other would have been greater because I use public transit and standing in the dark with nothing to read is boring. My old Kindle had a light built into the case that I really, really loved. Alas it (the Kindle) died after four years, and the case kept having issues with the little prong breaking off.I love the size of this Kindle;" it fits more easily into my bag. The printing is really  nice. It is good. I just wish I'd scrolled down on the page to find the one I really wanted.""
Review: A good enough Kindle.";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"It doesn't have a light or the ability to turn pages with a squeeze, but otherwise this Kindle has all the very cool features of the more expensive Kindles at a much lower price. I especially like that rather than having to jump around in the book and potentially lose your place, footnotes and end notes open in a window on top of the text. You can also open a window to flip backward and forward through the book's ""pages"" without moving off the page you are on. For reading longer books or nonfiction with footnotes these two features alone make this Kindle a treasure.","All the features at a lower price, including windows that open for footnotes and flipping through pages w/o losing your place";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchased this E-reader on Cyber Monday and thus far, I am very pleased with its performance! If you desire an economical device that provides uninterrupted reading then this device is highly recommended. I like the fact that I can obtain so many free books from Amazon as wells as other sites. While I have several devices, I strictly use this one for the pure enjoyment of uninterrupted reading!",Great Device!!;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"We received the unit on time which is great, however one of the features that my wife loves wasn't available on this unit, mainly audio, that is text to speech feature. As her vision isn't as good as it used to be reading is more difficult and the text-to-speech feature was ideal. Will check to see if this feature is on other Kindles.",Text-to-speech absent;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I do not like this Kindle.  Where are the instructions for use?  I cannot find the archives--saw them once but they were not in list form and the cover picture form is unreadable.  I wish I had my old Kindle back.  Where is the ""back"" button?  When I am shopping in the Kindle store and looking at the array of books, I cannot page forward--whatever I touch goes to that book, not the next page.  Bummer!",Wish i had my old Kindle back!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"My old Kindle (1st gen with keyboard) stopped working when my daughter stepped on it. This new one works well.  Honestly I preferred the hardware buttons for page turning, it was easier for one-handed reading, but I'm getting used to the new one.  I know that touch screens are newer/better, but occasionally when I try to go to the next page it pulls up a word definition.",Pretty good but I miss the physical buttons;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought my mother a Kindle but I resisted buying one for myself for a long time because I like to read eBooks on my iPhone or iPad. However, Amazon offered a deal for Prime members which made this Kindle only $50. I thought it over and decided for that price, it would be nice to be able to read in direct sunlight and not have to worry about running down my battery after a couple of hours of reading, as it does on my iPhone. The Kindle I had bought for my mom was one with a keyboard and side click-buttons. I wasn't that keen on having that type of awkward navigation, but this particular model is a ""touch"" Kindle. When it arrived, I was very pleasantly surprised that it wasn't too different from using my iPhone for navigation (in that you touch the screen to do this or that). I did have to go look at some tutorials online to get the hang of it, but it is fairly simple to use now that I know where to touch the screen for the Home page or forward and back pages. I like the size and weight. It is about like reading a paperback book, maybe even a little lighter. I can almost hold it in one hand and use a finger to turn the pages on the same hand, although it isn't as easy as with the iPhone for that.There are only a couple of things that I find annoying. The on/off button is on the bottom edge of the frame. I tend to hold a book (or Kindle) on the sides or bottom and I have accidentally turned it off while reading because my finger touched the on/off button. The on/off button would be better if it was at the top rather than the bottom. The other thing is that I can't seem to bookmark more than one page at a time. I am in the middle of a project of converting to eBooks more than 50 stories and novels from a series that is long out of print. These stories have been scanned and turned into editable text and proofed mostly on my computer, but I still find typos while reading on the Kindle. I want to be able to put a bookmark on each page that I find a typo on, so I can go to my computer later and fix them all at one time. I think I am supposed to be able to bookmark more than one page, but these eBooks I have converted myself don't seem to let me do that. If anyone knows what I am doing wrong there, let me know.",It is great for reading outside in the hammock;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"There is not really much I can add to the reviews here. The Kindle does exactly what I expected. It is a simple ereader without bells and whistles, which is just what I wanted. Setting it up was easy. One feature I love is that if you are reading a series, it recommends the next one in line. Even with my arthritis, I find it easy to hold. Page turning is as simple as swiping the screen or giving it a light touch. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a basic ereader.This is my first Kindle, although I've been an ebook reader for years. My other ereaders have all been from that huge brick-and-mortar US chain with the green logo. I have no regrets about my investment in hardware or books from there, but I do regret not getting a Kindle sooner.I got my Kindle through a rewards program at work. It came with ""Special Offers,"" but it was worth it to me to pay the $20 to get rid of the ads. They did not intrude on reading in the slightest. I just didn't want to see them. So, if you do get the one with the ads, you can always go back and pay the difference to get them removed.","No bells and whistles, just a good ereader";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I actually like this Kindle very much.  It is easy to read and the battery lasts forever before needing a charge.My problem is not with the Kindle but with Amazon book store.  It is far too easy to accidentally press a button and ""buy"" a book without it asking for confirmation, etc.  I realize that Amazon subsidizes the price of the Kindle but there needs to be a way to require a confirmation to keep from buying a book by accident.  In the end I was able to get a credit but you need to be really careful flipping pages looking at available books.",Good product but be careful.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I been reading a kindle from about second generation and I love these devices. I stare at back lit devices all day at work so the last thing I want to is read off of one at night. The screen is very easy on the eyes and I can read for hours no problem. My only complaints is that some features are lost in the latest generation of my Kindle. Old active content (games mostly) don't work, I can't have blogs delivered, and the text-to-speech feature has been removed.","Lost a few features, but otherwise a good device";;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"It was great for a year. Now it will not load new books. It took 2 hours of online chat to get it to reload the books that I previously bought. I am giving 2 stars because I loved it when it worked, and after working with that amazing chat person,now I can read the prior purchases. But what's the deal with being able to purchase but not download new books? The Kindle has NOT been dropped or in any way abused. It won't hold internet connection, flips back and forth between queued and loading maybe 25-35% of a book. At the same time, the kindle app on iPhone and iPad is totally broken--books were wiped off the devices and cannot be downloaded. I have spent maybe only an hour on calls for this problem, and have gotten nowhere. The chat person said it was not something she could fix. Tech people have not called back as they promised, perhaps because I live overseas. I have done every possible reset, so don't tell me to do that. I have done so multiple times.Follow up months later: After the recent hardware upgrade, I had hopes. A few books downloaded as they should! Now it is back to having to download to computer and then drag to the Kindle. Even the download usually takes 2-3 tries before it is successful. It used to be easy. Now it is not. It is still handy once you get the books on it.",Beware: Only good for one year. Even the app doesn't work consistently anymore.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I resisted eBook reading for years.  I didn't think I would like it and I was positive I would miss the tactile feeling of holding a book.  I am, by nature, a person who loves tradition, and there's a big part of me that doesn't want to see the loss of physical media for our entertainment.  The look, feel, and even smell of those physical objects is part of the experience.  Then I decided to try one.  My fingers were having a reaction to book paper and it was worth a shot.I took my Kindle on vacation and I love it!  Put a cover/case on it and it still feels nice.  The display is amazing and worked perfectly for comfortable reading under dim light, bright sunlight, and even a reading light at night.  I loved being able to zoom the text size in and out so that I could make it whatever was comfortable to read at the distance I wanted (or needed) to hold the Kindle away from me.  I also liked the weight;" it light
Review: but it's substantial enough that I didn't feel as if I were  carrying a toy.  All that plus I got to carry a whole lot of books with me
Title;;;;;;: for a tiny bit of weight tucked in my carry-on laptop case.I'm hooked!""
column4: I didn't think I would like it and I was positive I would miss the ...";;;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"A decent product and works well. However, file organization is difficult:1) all files/documents have to be placed under the folder ""Document""2) If I create sub folder under documents to organize files/documents, it does not work--they all show up at the ""Document"" folder level3) the only way to group files/documents is to use ""collection"" for tag files/documents. But, tagging is not a intuitive way of file organization.Because the limitation of file/documents management, I become overwhelmed when I loaded 30+ files/documents. It became very difficult to find files.Somethings for next firmware release to enhance.","A decent product and works well. However, file ...";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I loved my original Kindle with the keyboard and E ink more than anything. After I broke mine I got this one which is nice too. I like being able to use it as a book and when your outside in the sunlight you can still read it, unlike the shiney more reflective screens. When it is dark you would normally turn on a light to read and you will with this too. I like that> I am old school so the touch screen I am not as thrilled with as I was the key pad and button to push when changing the page. BUT I think I like it, and do use it.",I loved my original Kindle with the keyboard and E ink ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"My 16 yr old loves it. It is easy on the eyes as expected with the natural color. Good quality. Much better than storing a ton of books and easy to take with you. Slim case, easy to use. Love the fact that digital books are cheaper as well Thank you",Great kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"It is perfect for what it is...an E READER!  Sharp clear adjustable fonts, easy to use and featherweight light.  With this device you can have a large number of books at your fingertips.  What every purchaser should know, is that this IS NOT A TABLET and Amazon has never marketed or promoted it as one.  This is a Generation 7 Kindle, it IS NOT a backlit display so you will have to read it in a place with adequate ambient light (just like reading a book) or buy a little clip on reading lamp.  If you are looking for the backlit version you need to buy the Kindle Paperwhite.  Buying new books from the Amazon store is a snap once you have your account set up.  I had an existing account so I simply had to log in.  It is also possible to download kindle format ebooks through your local library (limit 5 at a time) through overdrive.com but you must have a library card and set up a password of your choosing.  Finding and downloading books from the kindle IS NOT the way to go.  It is possible but the kindle browser is slow and difficult to read.  It is far easier to connect the Kindle to your PC and download the Kindle ebook through overdrive.  Overdrive sends it to your Amazon account online.  You just go to your Amazon Bookshelf online and download through your PC to the Kindle.  I bought mine through Amazon, on sale for $49.99.  With my Amazon Credit Visa accrued points I ended up coming out of pocket about $20.00.  I couldn't be happier so far. I hope you will find this review helpful.",Perfect For What it is;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"i loved the original Kindle. This one I hate. You barely touch screen and dictionary or other stuff pops up. Page doesn't always switch, very picky. wish I had my old one back. You can't play games on it either. Missing my Solitaire. GRRRR Don't get this one!!!!",i loved the original Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this kindle for 2 reasons.  1.  It was on sale for $29 and 2. The size.  You cant beat the price and it was a real steal for $29.  I own the original kindle with the keyboard and a kindle fire and absolutely love this one as a backup for days when I want something portable and lightweight for reading only.I agree with other posters that this kindle is not for you if you want the following:  a light, external buttons or anything other than a reading device.  THIS DEVICE DOES NOT HAVE A LIGHT!!!  I bought mine with the clear understanding that if I wanted a light, I would have to buy a kindle paperwhite so please dont be confused.  Personally, it has a better display than my original kindle with the keyboard which looked almost gray and not as bright as this one.  It is pleasant to use this kindle in regular light and there is no glare.  The display is crisp and clean.There are no external buttons except the power button and everything else is touch screen which is what I like.  My only comment is the fact that sometimes there is a tiny microsecond of lag when turning pages but nothing to get upset about.  For the price I paid, Im not complaining.Finally, the thing I like most about this handy little device is the size and portability.  I positioned it next to my iPhone 6 and it is a few inches larger in both directions but not much.  The display is generous and it feels good in my hands while holding it.  I did purchase a case since I didnt want it to get scratched up but overall, well worth the money.  I find myself going for this one before the kindle fire when I dont want to carry the extra weight in my purse.Also, (and I think this goes back to comments from when the kindle was first released) the device comes with a micro-usb charging cable but not a wall plug but if youre like me, youve got 2 or 3 wall plugs already from other devices so no worries there either.",I love it!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm in love.  I've figured out why they call it a KINDLE because it truly rekindled my love for reading.  Its easy on my eyes, unlike my ipad, and simple to throw in my purse, unlike a book.  I am also one of the ADD readers, where I like to read a couple diff genres of book at once.  For example, I'm reading YOU: the owners manual, Lena Dunhams book, a scary thriller and some stupid little fiction I got for free from Amazon.  I would look like a crazy person carrying 4 books around with me, but with my kindle I can.  I really am in love.  Its perfect.",reKINDLED spirit;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"The text is really easy to read.  I went with this one as opposed to the other ones because of the anti-glare, it reads like paper, and the battery life.  I didn't need all of the bells and whistles since I already have a 2-in-1 tablet.  It is very lightweight.",Nice screen.;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"It does what it's supposed to, so that's good.  But it feels kinda cheap next to my old Kindle Touch.  The Touch had a nice smooth finish on the back and a more sophisticated look in general.  The Touch also had little pickups in the back to power an LED light built into the case.  this was a great feature for reading in bed - wish they had carried it over to the new model.",so that's good. But it feels kinda cheap next to my ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This little Kindle is the best E-reader I have seen so far. It's very much like you are holding a book, the print is easy to see-sharp and clear, no glare or shadow. I use mine everyday, and find its in serious competition with regular paper editions of reading material. Downloads are instantaneous, and I also like the fact that everything I download is saved to the cloud, without separate steps involved. Happy I got a good deal, and reading has replaced the TV as a relaxation tool. Very happy with my Kindle.",This little Kindle is the best E-reader I have seen so far;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this Kindle ereader as an upgrade to my older, 3rd gen Kindle ereader. I do love this new, 7th gen ereader and have only one complaint. Scrolling through all my ebooks on the cloud (almost 5000 books) is a long, tedious process to get to the book I want. The search feature doesn't always work well. I think Amazon could do alot better in that area. But, other than that, I do like the 7th gen. It has way more storage and you do have your cloud books available to download easily. The battery charge lasts longer than the 3rd gen and the touch screen works well.",New 7th Generation Kindle Ereader;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my second Kindle!  Yep, Loved my first one to death!!  :)  This replaces my original model KeyBoard Kindle.  I love how easy it is to use and hold in one hand.  Lightweight but sturdy, perfect for this avid reader!  I haven't come close to filling it up with books and love all the different options for font size and sync abilities.  So I recommend this to everyone who wants a reader.  Nothing heavy, nothing over-sized or so many complicated apps and options you  want to scream!  Simple but perfect!",Loved my first one to death;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"The ability to read the text is about the same as my first Kindle, which I still have. But, all the effort to make it more jazzy has resulted in it being harder to navigate. On my keyboard Kindle the books I have active in my library are listed in text. One look and I can see 10 of the books I have that I intend to read.Flip to thr next page and I can see 10 more. All I have to do to call one up is to highlight it and push the OK button. When I'm done and want to archive the boo,k that is easliy done and it no longer appears in the list. If I want to recall an archived book all I have to do is go to the archive listing and recall it. Simple, straightforward. To find a book with the touchscreen display I have to navigate through many books, depicted as book-covers, to find the book I want. If you have a number of books in the queue, that is time consuming and frustrating.  And, I can find no easy way to recall a book that has been deleted from the bookshelf.
