Snazzy graphics but a lot more work. On the plus side, the battery lasts longer. In the end, I like my keyboard Kindle better.",Not an improvement to the user.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Amazon got it right this time! The fonts are crisp, and the page turning is very responsive, not sluggish like the PWs. I just wish they would bring back text-to-speech in an e-ink model again. I know the Fires have them, and I still have an old Touch and KK lying around, but it seems they've abadoned it on newer models. Other than that, it's lovely. Apparently even the high-priced Voyage doesn't have it either. That said, the Kindle is great, and if you're looking for something light and with long battery life to take around with you, you can't go wrong here for the money.",Love it but miss text-to-speech!;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"The Good - We got this item on sale so the overall pricing worked for my family. The adjustable fonts and bookmarks work very well. Like how some books will tell you how much time you have left, at your current pace, till you finish the chapter.The So-So - Every now and again when you turn the page it just gets lost and you find yourself 3-4 pages beyond where you expected. Hard to reproduce this issue but 3 people in my family have had it happened to them.The Bad - This device has a known wifi issue. My netgear wifi spot supports, Compaq XP laptop, HP 7 laptop, Xubuntu laptop, android tablet, chumby, a friends mac book, an HTC rythme and ironically the B&N Nook but this kindle will not connect. Talked with Amazon support and went through the entire process but nothing worked. Has something to do with long passwords and not broadcasting the SSID.  That's why I gave this device 3 stars.We decided to keep it because you can download the books via USB cable and we are going to buy books anyway so the difference in price (paper vs ebook) will cover the kindle in 15 books. Just wish the wifi would work.",The Good - We got this item on sale so the ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This was my original review:Amazon has sent me a Kindle in which all text is in Russian. I called the help desk and a very patient  tech and an increasingly impatient me tried to figure out how to reset this device so that I could use it, unfortunately neither of us speak this language, and the device itself seemed to have a lot of inactive options. It has occurred to me that this device was originally used by a Russian person who sent it back, and that Amazon then sent it to me as 'new'. This Kindle probably didn't work for that Russian guy either, which is why he got rid of it.Then,I called Amazon the same day that I received the above item and they sent out a replacement the next day. Response was prompt and courteous, despite my intemperate review. Received new item within a week of calling. New kindle works fine. Review upgraded to five stars.",Needed to be replaced;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Loved my old Kindle Touch. I feel like I've ""downgraded"" with this. It's much more difficult to sort and access docs and books than in the old system. Don't get me wrong it works fine, but I don't feel that it's nearly as user friendly, which surprised me. You have to choose collections or books by recent you can't get both. Frustrating to me.  I've had 6 Kindles and I am less happy than ever with the newer software and device.  Other than that great battery and other options. Miss the audio as well.",Loved my old Kindle Touch;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"My arthritis in my hands was making it difficult to hold my Kindle Fire HD and even books.  This new kindle is wonderful!  It's easy to hold, super light wait and very easy to read.  This new kindle is now number 4 in my household.  Wonderful product!  Thanks",new kindle 6 inch glare free touchscreen display with WiFi;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"It's so much lighter than either of the previous Kindles I've owned (this is my third -- I had one of the early models, then a Kindle Fire -- which I still use for audio and video), and slightly smaller. Easier to carry around, easier to hold for long periods of reading. With the Wi-Fi off it seems to stay charged for a *very* long time. I normally recharge regularly, but I've had it go several days with heavy reading and no recharge, and the battery icon shows barely any reduction in power. Very pleased with this.",My Favorite Kindle;;;;;;

Review: This was a replacement for my previous kindle which I accidentally broke so I'm already a big fan of these devices. This one contains newer features which makes it somewhat easier to use including swipe technology.

I wanted an e-reader that I could read outside in the sun. This is perfect for that. I do miss having a backlight and may end up getting the kindle paperwhite but for now this is wonderful. I do have a Fire Tablet that I can use indoors in the evenings when the light is dimmer. But the tablet's battery length is not good so I prefer to read with the kindle that has an excellent battery life.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this so that I could read while at the beach and pool on vacation. I love my Ipad, but I can't read it in the sun. The Kindle is very easy to read in even the brightest sunlight. I love the way it seamlessly syncs with my Ipad & Iphone. I would highly recommend it to anyone who might be trying to read outside.",I love my Ipad;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"For the cost, it's a great device.  The only improvement I would make is in the visual quality of the reading material.  It is a bit grainy and so I feel like it somewhat cheapens the subjective experience of reading.  But, for the price, I can't complain too much.  I am very thankful for its affordability.  Still prefer to read from my tablet-quality Nook.",Good for its price;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"We got this for our 5 yr old for Christmas.  I love that she can use her kindle free time on it and read all of those books also.  She's a beginner reader, but she can't put it down and loves it.  This is just a starter one for her, to make sure she will take care of it before we upgrade her.  I really like how I can leave the free time on, so that when she turns it on, it's already on the freetime and she needs a password to get out of it.  Can't make any purchases while its on free time.",love it;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have a Kindle fire and a Kindle HD, neither of which are easy to read outside in full sun light.  With a special offer on the Kindle 6"", I got a very good price for a simple reader that I can take to the beach with me, or outside on my lunch break and read to my heart's content under sunny skies.  I have not yet used all the extras on this one, but it's just what I was looking for.",neither of which are easy to read outside in full sun light;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had to replace my Kindle paperwhite from years ago because it really just died from me using it ALL the time.  I absolutely loved it and because of the Kindle, I enjoyed reading again.  This version is not that different except the fact that it is smaller in size (which is a positive), there is no keyboard on the front and it has improved technology as far as speed and response is concerned.  I am a paper white lover because I can read it inside or on a beach without any glare or restrictions to content.  You can control the font size and spacing which makes it very versatile for readers of any age.  Buying content from Amazon and having it 'whisper' to my device is pure love.  Kindle seriously makes reading on the go fun and simple.  You connect it using your WiFi and you are good to go.  One time connection and you are set.  If you are looking for night reading, you will need to purchase a light attachment as this Kindle does not have a nightlight of any kind.It comes packaged like any other Kindle: stabilized and safe, easy to open, and battery life to get you started.  I actually used my Kindle for weeks on the battery life provided initially.  Talk about unwrap and go!  I did get the one with 'ads' but those do not bother me as my original Kindle had the same thing.  I purchased this for a great price during the Amazon Prime Day and I am loving every second of it.  I also purchased a case to protect it from unnecessary dings when carrying it in my bag.Overall, a great buy and I will have this one until it dies and I am forced to buy another one!",I absolutely loved it and because of the Kindle;;;;;;

Review: I have one of the very first Kindles and I love it!  I have always loved to read and over the years I have kept my Kindle very busy.  I received my Kindle as a gift from my daughter at a time when my eye sight was getting poor.  I was diagnosed with ARMD and was finding it hard to enjoy my books.  Kindle to the rescue!  I was able to go into the kindle and increase the print size to one that I was able to see and I have been able to continue enjoy a hobby I have had all my life and I don't have to go hunting for the books I want to read to be published in to large print format.  I can do it myself and read what ever I want.  I would not give up my Kindle for anything.
Title;;;;;;: ... have one of the very first Kindles and I love it! I have always loved to read and ...;;;;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"I finally bought a kindle after having a nook for several years. As a prime member, I thought this would be a good value.The kindle is composed of a hard slippery plastic with angled edges.  This configuration is unpleasant to hold and requires a cover. The nook has a rubberized back with smooth corners which is comfortable to hold.The touchscreen of this device is not very responsive and requires that the reader forcefully jab the screen. My nook is quite responsive .As a prime member, I looked forward to borrowing books as part of my subscription.  The selection is disappointing.Although I have not used this service yet, borrowing from the public library straight to the device is stated to be easy.  This compares to the nook- books must be downloaded from a PC. All in all, the new kindle is lacking, even compared to a 4 year old nook. I am deliberating returning this device.",I thought this would be a good value. The kindle is composed of a hard ...;;;;;;

Review: I love this thing!!! Great for reading books. No light so it wont hurt your eyes even when reading for hours. If you have wifi you can buy books online and if you have amazon prime you can get a free book every month.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I started with the Kindle Fire and got this second. It's much nicer reading books on this unit!It is lighter. You'll irritate your hands/wrist holding the Fire steady for hours at a time.It doesn't overhead. The fire overheats if you use it for graphics heavy stuff. If you put it in a case so it stays propped up, you can overheat until the unit shuts down.It's smaller than the Fire. Easier for me to grab the unit. MUCH lower risk of dropping it.It's got a glare free screen. Read outdoors in daylight again. Read at night with a reading light the traditional way.No blue light in your eyes at night. I confess. It was affecting me and I refused to believe i was getting insomnia until I switched.Less distracting. The browser is b&w and awkward to use. There are no apps. Finally finish reading those books!Page speed is good. Paging backward is touchy.You touch the top of the screen to call up the controls. This is good. It's less awkward than the Fire where you touched the middle.Reasonable selection of fonts and sizes.Wish listThe black print on gray background isn't high contrast. The better the light, the easier to read. - i wish I'd ordered a paperwhite or I had a decent reading lightBattery life - Unlike the Fire, this battery really hangs onto its charge if unused. It's fine on it's own for a week. Under heavy use (6+ hours/day) you will want to recharge every third day. Just long enough to forget to charge. You can't read and charge if the battery is completely drainedThe width of the plastic edge next to  the screen is just wide enough to make touching the screen for the page turn a bit of a hop for your finger.The library is presented as a list which you can sort by title, author, recent, etc... This isn't all that helpful. The larger your collection, the more you need the book cover to help your memory. You need to open the book to see the cover. A thumbnail would be so useful.The Kindle doesn't always break lines at the most aesthetically pleasing breakpoint. You may be left with half the line empty while the rest of the page is filled.  This is obvious at the larger fonts.The usb cord used for recharging is pretty short. It is difficult to reach most outlets while reading. Charging from a computer is slow.I recommend Calibre (shareware) if you want to read files on your device. Calibre will convert the file to kindle-compatible format and load it onto the machine.So much lighter and less distracting than the Fire. I've left the fire at home for a month now and I don't miss it.Let's face it. I use the fire for playing games now.",This one is for reading.;;;;;;

Review: This device is great and lightweight! I was very interested in purchasing a Kindle when they first came out and I was still in school so I didn't have the funds. I recently received this for my birthday and I was able to use it on my trip out of town. I downloaded a ton of books and was always able to pull it out when I was bored or waiting.
Title;;;;;;: Best thing since since the printing press.;;;;;;

Rating: 2.0 out of 5 stars,"The  new Kindle often does not reopen at the last page read, and does nor always retain the font size that I prefer when I turn it off and reopen it. Both very annoying. My old one never behaved that way. In fact, I complained about it - I think its a defect, and was told someone would get back to me, but nobody ever did.",A major step backward;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Since my oldest Kindle is going on 5 years, I took advantage of Amazon's sale of the basic Kindle to make sure I had a backup. I have been extremely pleased with it and use it for both outdoor and indoor reading. The lack of page turn buttons has not bothered me at all since I have a Kindle Fire for reading in dark places and am used to turning pages without buttons.",Kindle Is A Wonder of Technology at a Low Price.;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I am very, very dissatisfied with this.I purchased it because my faithful no-frills Kindle's page-turning button finally wore out. It has been nothing but trouble since day one.The touch screen is capricious, alternating between overly sensitive and unresponsive.  There are days when it seems like I'm spending more time resetting the text size than I am reading because when I touch to turn the page, the font-size adjust bar comes up instead of the next page. For example, a little while ago I was reading and had to fix the font 14 times over 2 page turns.I really dislike the current layout--it used to be that I could put my items into collections and if I was in collection view,  I could not only see the list of collections but also items that weren't yet in a collection.  Now the only way to see uncategorized items is to put it into the ""all"" view, and the area button is so small that it often takes 10-20 tries to change the view!I hated it from the moment it arrived, and I am so, so sorry I let customer service talk me into keeping it--I would have done better to spend the money to repair the old kindle.",Very unhappy with this product;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchased this from Groupon when it is on sale. Only cost me 70 including shipping. I am very satisfied with this ereader.At first i thought it is going to some cheap plastic uesd on this model, because it looks bad on the picture. However, it neither feels or looks cheap at all. It is very solid and comfortable to hold. And the back does not collect your finger print at all. Personly, I think this is much better than the Kindle Voyage. You don't need a cover for this reader. It gives you a solid feeling that it won't break, and even if it breaks, you can get another one for $79. Unlike the kindle Voyage, which i have to treat carefully because of the piano part can easily get scratched. When you put the Kindle Voyage in a cover, it is going to be heavier than this basic verision.The screen looks amazing. I can't tell the difference between this one and the kindle voyage. The difference is marginal, and for general reading, trust me, you won't need 300ppi.Save $120 on the ereader, and spend them on books!I love this thing. 5 Star!",Don't get tricked by the picture. They are putting high quality plastic on this!;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"This device is impossible to use with one hand unless you don't mind it constantly hitting the floor and giving your fingers a constant work out. the back is made from a cheap plastic that has effectively no friction, which would be okay if you didn't have to remove your thumb (from where in previous version your thumb could both hold the kindle steady and turn pages without ever having to move) from the edge that holds it steady to swipe on the touch screen.The touch zones aren't intuitive, and the fact that you need to cover some of the text with your hand to turn the page is infuriating. Was anyone complaining that the previous screen didn't randomly change font size and page number for your when the the device slipped out of your hand? No? Okay.This is getting returned in a hurry, You're better of buying an older generation that was designed for reading books rather than selling more units.",You're better of buying an older generation that was designed for ...;;;;;;

Review: So convenient!  Love it.  Easy screen to read.  Terrific buy.  I am so glad I was pressured to trade up to the more modern version by the old one developing a blank spot in the upper left hand corner.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had the old, original Kindle and dropped it off the table. I absolutely loved it and mourned it's loss. I upgraded to a Kindle Fire but this Kindle was on sale so I bought this too as a back up / extra for the family. It's better than the ""old"" one since it's touch screen. I sitll use it at times over my Fire since it holds a battery charge longer.",Great Item;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my Kindle. It's so easy for me to carry everywhere. Easy to read under the sun at the beach, great while you are waiting at your doctor's appointment and for me in particular I love to download my college notes into the kindle to take everywhere and study whenever I have the chance without having to carry my computer or have my eyes irritated by the glare of my tablet. I used to have a previous generation kindle and the only complaint I had about it was that it was tedious to go through the words with the up and down arrow to highlight something or write a note. This is solved by this generation with the touchscreen... Such a timesaver.",So happy with the improvements in this generation's kindle;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"This model is pretty much the same as the one I bought 5 years ago. And it does the job - just no frills, a basic kindle. I bought it with a special offer and it was quite inexpensive. The touch screen is very touchy. When I read at night with an itty bitty night light attached to the kindle, tiny flying insects attracted to light land on the screen and have enough ""touch"" to turn the pages. Tapping the screen too hard turns multiple pages at once.",A basic model kindle;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I am really still adapting. I had a kindle a few years ago and it seemed easier to navigate and the pictures were clearer. For night reading I use the iPad kindle app which seems easier to navigate too.So, the big appeal is the non glare screen for now. Great for deck,poolside and the beach.",Love the non glare screen.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first Kindle and I love it!  The screen is great-no glare even in the sun which I appreciated.  The size is handy. I finally ordered a cover to protect it but it seems sturdy in spite of being dropped a couple of times.  The charge lasts for hours.  And, it's easy to download books. One more thing- the touch screen is awesome.",This is my first Kindle and I love it! The screen is great-no glare even in ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Great things really do come in small packages.I own a HD and a HDX, both great learning devices but this simple kindle is what I need.It's easy on the eyes, I can read for hours without eyestrain. Light weight and the ideal size for reading while traveling. Email works, the experimental browser does the job. This little beauty displays exactly like a paperback with the added perk of font enlargement.This is my new best friend, I don't go anywhere without it. Thanks Amazon",This kindle cares about your eyes;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Very good reader. Much faster and easier to use than the old Kindle Touch. Screen is easy to read, but no better than the older Kindle readers. The brighter the light, the better the print shows up. Battery life is really great. I took off one star because it doesn't have an audio capability. (it won't read to you like the Kindle Touch). Remember, this is a reader. If you want the best deal on a tablet, get the Kindle Fire HD6.",Very good reader. Much faster and easier to use than ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this for my nine year old granddaughter, she absolutely loves it. Easy to use for a child no glare the size is great very pleased with this item. This was a Christmas gift. Easy for a nine year old to use. I will probably upgrade when shes a little older to a tablet but this is very good for her age.",Couldn't be more pleased;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have been reading Kindle books on my iPad mini for a couple of years now, and it's OK. Just when I'm outside or at a conference that it's truly horrible. When the e-ink 6"" Kindle went on sale for $50, I jumped on it. Man is that screen nice! I have grown tired of freemium games and don't use Office on my iPad as much as I used to. So, between this Kindle and my cell phone, I really don't have to tote around my iPad as much anymore.Sooo glad I made this purchase!!","Just when I'm outside or at a conference that it's truly horrible. When the e-ink 6"" Kindle went on sale ...";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm not a huge fan of touchscreen devices, though this one has its pluses and minuses.On the Positive Side: it's easy to put items into collections - I wish I could drag/drop items, but being able to click check boxes and easily type is a positive. The ability to select different font types and sizes is nice, and you can easily add bookmarks. My kindle just updated within the past few days and added the ""Bookerly"" font, which is Amazon's font specifically designed for kindle. It's nice, but I prefer Palatino out of the options available, so I stuck with what I already liked. The price is good, and it can hold a LOT of books. The screen is also easy to read, even outside in bright light.On the Negative Side: The touchscreen is really sensitive. If I bump the kindle, all of the sudden my font is huge, and then I have to make it smaller again. Or I'll find myself on another page. I appreciate the ease on turning pages, but constantly having to readjust my font every time my cat decides to bump the kindle, or if I put it facedown on my lap for a moment, is really frustrating. There also isn't a built in light on this model, so you need to get a booklight or make sure that you have adequate light to read with.Overall, it's a good kindle, but I miss my buttons... I just couldn't afford the version of the kindle that actually has buttons now!",A good kindle even though I hate touchscreens;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first Kindle.  Although I have had computers since the mid-'80s, as well as ipods and iphones, I always liked to read books with real paper - I liked the feel of them, to look back at earlier passages at times, in short, to read real books, not online books.  However, I have accumulated too many books, and I've run out of space.  I even developed an allergy to old book dust.  So my dilemma was this:  I joined a book club, and we read some very interesting books, but the last thing I need is more books.  Given all that, I decided to try Kindle.  The glare-free screen seemed like a good idea, since my eyes get tired from too much time on the computer, and I particularly liked not having to charge yet another device daily, so the two+ week battery life time sounded promising.  Both of these features were a good idea, and the price wasn't bad, either.Update:  Some pros and cons that weren't initially apparent:  The screen is a little darker than I had expected (not as bright as a new paperback), but still is very readable.  Free books weren't as available as I had hoped.  I signed up for Kindle Unlimited, but found that none of the book club books were on it.  I then got a library card, and discovered downloads - the first book was found, and I thoroughly enjoyed reading it on Kindle - it made it easy to read just a bit at a time, if I didn't have much time.  Kindle plus an Amazon recommended cover were a bit heavy to hold up in bed, which sometimes affected my wrist/fingers, but I still found it interesting to read in this way.  The next book, however, was much more difficult to access.  It was not on Kindle Unlimited (or the lending library), and although it was in my home library as a download, this kind of Kindle can't read the download -- only Kindle Fire can read it - an Amazon issue  that I wish they would resolve!  I finally went through a lot of trouble and registered for a 3M Cloud account, and was able to download the book to my desktop computer (same issue with Kindle Fire being OK but not this Kindle - but that's no way to read a book!  If I had owned an iPad, that would have worked, but for now, my Kindle is idle.  To be continued.","I mostly like it, but I'm not abandoning books yet!";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I had an older Kindle with a keypad and buttons and I was curious to try out a newer model.  I figured that one could go with me on trips and the other could stay at home.The new charging cord is an annoyance - I much prefer the old (white), long Kindle cord; I could charge the Kindle while reading in bed. Not so with the much shorter (black) cord.  It's not a big deal
Review: but an annoyance.This Kindle works fine and does what it says - I don't see much of a difference from my keyboard version.  The page turning is pretty handy
Title;;;;;;: although it took a while to make it work all the time.  That's not a Kindle problem; that's my problem.One thing that I find very
column4: very annoying is the incredible sensitivity of the screen;" I have had Kleenex tissue hit the screen
column5: and change the page
column6: or
column7: more usually
column8: change the fonts.  I've fallen asleep while reading
column9: and the Kindle hitting the mattress or a blanket hitting the page will bring up a dictionary
column10: or change the fonts or activate something.  I'm used to this behavior
column11: but it is pretty annoying.The only other problem I had was getting my books installed on the Kindle from the Amazon Cloud.  On the old Kindle
column12: everything was sorted into collections
column13: but when I attempted to bring things down on the new Kindle
column14: it was all messed up and confused. This is probably the most serious issue I ran into
column15: but some patient work has things sorted out.""
column16: Good

Review: This is my perfect Kindle and I'm enjoying it as much as i can.  Glare-Free is the one for me.  Sure I had to get a lamp but it's easier on my eyes then that lit screen.  I'm more than happy!  Thanks!

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love it! Ok, I read .... a lot. For me it is an experience. The way a book feels in your hands, the smell of the pages and of course the story itself. This kindle reads very much like a book. While I don't get the full on ""experience"" that I so love ... I still have no complaints about it at all. It cuts down on the clutter to because I don't have so many book shelves of books, how ever I do still buy my favorites as a physical book. Great job Amazon ..... now all it needs is that new book smell. ;"-)""
Review: Much better than reading on a regular tablet ... including the Kindle Fire.";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am in LOVE with my Kindle! I've had it for 24 hours and I cannot put it down! It's lightweight and easy to use. I can navigate through my book list, wish list, and the Special Offers on the Kindle. A cool feature that I found myself using is the Dictionary feature, where I'm able to have a word defined in a matter of seconds. Although it doesn't have the built-in light, the Touch can be used in fluorescent lighting or natural - there truly is no glare.I highly suggest this E-Reader for all readers! From the ""not so much of a reader"" to the ""bookworm"" - it's an amazing product that everyone will fall in love with!",Kindle Touch;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I really like this kindle. It was a great value and meets the need for my reading. It claimed that the screen protects your eyes compared to other screen like iPad. I chose this because of that reason. Though it didn't have led light, I feel it's great for reading under regular light. I don't want to hurt my eyes by reading books without light.The cable is easy to use for charging and transferring files. There are many sources out there for kindle besides Amazon. It is really convenient to buy on Amazon though. You can also send files to the kindle.The capacity is about 4 gigabytes, you can store a lot of books. It is small and light. I like this very much for daily reading!I also used my account and bought a papers white for my roommate. She likes hers too. She likes reading late night that's why she got the paper white. If you don't like to read in dark, you can try this one. It's a great deal.",Good deal;;;;;;

Review: My new kindle is so much lighter than my old one and the plastic case will be good for my fingers in the middle of winter (The metal case of my old one gets really cold).  I really like the new way to turn it off and I have been using it for a couple weeks straight and haven't had to recharge it yet. I am waiting to see how long it will go with one charge.
Title;;;;;;: ... my old one and the plastic case will be good for my fingers in the middle of winter (The ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Easy to read for old eyes. I can set the back-light to high  for maximum contrast, as well as select large font. Better that the paper of a book.I only hope that maps and photos have better clarity than my old Kindle which renders photos and maps unreadable.",Good for us old folks.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I think I had the 4th or 5th GEN device, before a unhappy accident. I got over it though when I got my hands on the 7th GEN. First impressions I thought it felt thicker and a little heavier, which it is and I like lot (+.7 grams makes it perfect). Turning on the device was also noticeably different, same amount of pixels, but the E Ink Pearl, it makes for easier reading, its a win. Whatever is underhood in processing makes for faster page turns. I also read on my phone and tablet when I don't have my Kindle, and reading off those devices for extended periods give me a headache. No headaches with this device. I don't know about all that Blue light research keeping you up, but I try to listen to the experts and since this device is not back lit and requires me to have a reading lamp. I often fall asleep late reading, and all signs point to no deprivation of sleep from my brain being overly active. The technology will only get better as cost for better screens (300dpi) get cheaper, but for now for the cost and what is available books wise this is as good as it gets for an E-Reader!","This is a E-Reader, not a Tablet and this 7th GEN is the best possible Reading experience.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this kindle for me as sort of a new year resolution as I really want to start reading more books. This kindle is very easy to use and it doesn't hurt my eyes as when I read on a computer screen or on a tablet. In fact I just spent last 3 days straight reading a novel on the kindle and I didn't get the red eyes I usually get by staring at a computer screen for a day.Also I would like to comment on Amazon's outstanding customer service. After reading on my kindle for a few days I noticed a small black spot the size of a fruit fly on my screen. After close examination, it turned out to be some dead pixels. I actually bought my kindle from jet.com and not directly from amazon, but figured I'd ask Amazon what to do. They sent me a replacement through 2 day shipping, no questions asked, not even the proof of purchase! Of course I think by my registering my device they probably got all the data yet still, what a piece of mind to know when you buy something from a company who would stand behind their product.","Great product, outstanding customer service";;;;;;

Review: Great little device.  I got it for my elderly mother and the screen seems to be extremely sensitive.  If she barely hovers her finger nail over the screen it will change.  She finds this very frustrating.  I hope they come out with a way to make it not quite so sensitive so those who are older can use it more effectively.  For me it works great!

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I've used the Kindle app on my phone for years, but always found the temptation to do other things too strong, especially when those email notifications pop up.  The glare-free display isn't completely glare-free, but does well--especially compared to the glossy screen on my phone.  The lack of a backlight could be seen as a detriment to some, but I see it as preventing sleeping problems that may be linked to the blue tint of most LED backlights.The ads are not too bad since I have a case, but I still might pay the extra to remove them.  I'm definitely a satisfied customer!",Great for reading books!;;;;;;

Review: Still trying to figure everything out...and I'm not convinced that this will replace books for me...it just doesn't have the weight...but it is very readable and I like being able to increase the font size.

I bought this for my mother in her late 70's and is was too difficult for her to understand and move like the older model.  she liked the page turning of the more manual model and could not chapter tab of close and open without my help.  Too big of a change and confusing for someone her age.
Title;;;;;;: ... was too difficult for her to understand and move like the older model;;;;;;

Review: This was an upgrade for me from the original Kindle. So I am happy! No it does not have a light that's ok.  I do wish since it doesn't have a light  there was a case like the my original one that has built in light in the case it self. That's all.  Its small and light and compact.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"If you haven't used a Kindle before, let me tell you: This device is going to feel weird. It really does look like a paperback book, with the slightly-off-white display. If you're expecting it to look like a tablet, well, it doesn't exactly. No, this device looks like a book - but with electronic programming that allows it to actually be hundreds or even thousands of books.This Kindle was my Christmas present to myself, and I am delighted. I had low expectations as it is a budget device - if you want something with more features, you're going to have to shell out more money. But if you're looking for an inexpensive way to collect books and carry them all in a single pocket, this will get the job done.Edit, for more information:I've been using my Kindle for 16 days now - and still have yet to charge it. For this reason alone, I see it as a valuable investment. It's an electronic, but it's not something I'm going to have to remember to charge. I read almost every night on this thing and I still love it. Every single e-book makes me more satisfied with my purchase.",Great for book lovers!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have enjoyed reading Kindle Books on my iPad and later my iPad Mini for quite some time. My problem with these devices has always been the weight when reclining in bed. This Kindle solves that problem because it is much lighter and with a little ingenuity, I have really improved on it. A Silicon Bracelet fits nicely over one edge to insert my ring and pinky underneath in the back leaving my birdie finger and index to steady the top. My thumb is free to effortlessly turn pages while my left hand can work the menus if needed. I added a matching bracelet to the other side for an even look that doubles as a rubbery protector.",A Great Solution;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've been reading on kindle fire tablets for a few years now, I switched to this because staring at the screen for long periods of time was hurting my eyes. This is definately better on your eyes. I read a lot of complaints about the fact that this one isn't back lit, I haven't found that to be a problem. You can read the screen anywhere you would be able to read an actual book. It's basically a calculator screen, so if you're unsure, get a calculator and try to use it where you plan to be reading, if you can read the screen, you'll be able to read this. The touchscreen works a little bit differently than my kindle fire, but I eventually got used to it. Amazon says that this battery lasts for weeks if you only read half an hour a day. I spend two or three hours a day and I've been charging it once a week or so, the battery is usually down to about 60% by then. All and all, I'm glad I switched to this kindle",A good switch;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this kindle for my mother for Christmas. I didn't want it to have a lot of bells and whistles on it because she is nervous about electronics. She has had it for over a week now and only had to have me come over and ""fix it"" as she says, once. I am very happy that it looks like a real book as she loves to read. It was a good purchase and has made her happy for Christmas. Thank you Amazon for your amazing products.",I am very happy that it looks like a real book as she ...;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Touch screens can be difficult for this elderly person, especially when there isn't a younger generation person close to help teach me. I find that one thing not so easy as on my first Kindle ls the library listing by book covers rather than in print. It will take awhile to be comfortable with it, but the reading is great before all the push to immediately get another from the same author or type.",Difficult for the elderly;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love it! My husband and kids got it for me for mothers day. It is exactly what I wanted in a e-reader. I have had several different tablets including the kindle fire and I just didn't like all the extra stuff. I ended up giving one to my mom and the other to my oldest son. The fire and other tablet i had was too heavy, they were useless if you were outside and I didn't like the constant notifications for games, email, and such. The kindle e-reader is super light weight and very comfortable to hold. It had a generic web browser if you wanted to do minimal web browsing but i see no need to use it. I love love x-ray! i also like the easy access to the store and good reads. If you want movies and games as well the fire is the way to go. we also have the fire kids and my youngest son loves it. I like it as well and you can switch it to an adult tablet which i will use if i want movies and such but that is not too often. However, i do not like all that extra stuff all the time. I want to be able to take my book with me and not have it take up too much room and be able read without interruptions. So if you do not want or need all the extra stuff and simply want to read wherever you go then this is defiantly for you.",I love it! My husband and kids got it for ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"As an avid lifelong reader of books, I wasnt sure Id like the Kindle and was unwilling to invest much. I bought this one during the Black Friday sale for $49.99, a price that finally convinced me to try it. What I like: The light weight and compact size are perfect, and it fits easily into a pocket of my handbag for travel. Page-turning is simple, and the screen is very easy on the eyes in decent lighting. As a senior, I love love love being able to adjust the font size!! The charge lasts a long time, and it recharges quickly using my computers USB port. Buying books on Amazon is very easy.What Im still getting used to: The edges around the screen are narrow except at the bottom, and I havent yet found a way to hold the Kindle comfortably for long periods. Ive come close to dropping it several times, especially if I doze off while reading. It would be nice to have a stretchy fabric strap on the back to slip my hand through. Im not used to touch screens (dont care for them), and the Kindles is very sensitive, so I tend to accidentally activate features I dont want, enter multiples of letters while searching, or send myself to mysterious locations in the book and have to find my way back. I dont use social media or other sharing features. All I do is buy and read, so all in all, its an excellent value for a new user. Four stars instead of five is because of the too-sensitive touch screen.",Great value for entry level;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"The product is a great especially for the price.  This Kindle holds a large number of books, it is touch screen and easy to work, and there was plenty of help from Amazon in getting it set up and working.  The product was delivered earlier than expected, and the battery life of this machine is greater than the earlier model.  My wife has a Kindle Fire because she plays games and looks things up, but I wanted an ebook, and for me, this one, is just great.",The product is a great especially for the price;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"As long as you know how e-books and displays work, this one is quite good.  I've read a handful of books on it in a week and it's easy to read, simple to change anything you wish and goes a long time between charges.  At the price, it's unbeatable.","6"" Kindle - good stuff!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am enjoying the new Kindle. There's some adjustment comparing my old keyboard style with the touch screen. It is smaller so it fits in my purse better. No color but this is for reading only which is what I needed it for. Mine has the ads on it, no problem there either. It syncs in with my Fire and old Kindle. That's convenient but it has been a little confusing to get books on the new one from the old ones. But that may be a matter of getting used to the new system. If you just want to read books, this is perfect. If you want to get on the internet, get the Fire. Both are great.",It is smaller so it fits in my purse better. No color but this is for reading only ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a great device, and worth well above the asking price.I've had a kindle e-reader of some sort ever since the Kindle Keyboard (3rd Gen) came out, and enjoy keeping up with the latest device.  I had recently dis-located my gray kindle touch, and got this as a replacement.  It's way faster than the original touch ever was, and seems to have a much better battery life.  The screen quality seems to be about the same, and the menu's mimic the latest in the paperwhite.For an entry level device, you can't really go wrong.  Sure, there is no backlight, but then they have the paperwhite.","Wow! So much faster than the original kindle touch, and a better value!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've previously owned 2 used 1st Gen. Kindles and loved them until they died for lack of use (too much work, not enough time to read).  I splurged and bought the new Kindle 7, and I love it!  Took it to the lake over the weekend for a picnic and read the whole time.  It was sunny and warm enough for me to get a slight sunburn, but I never had a problem with glare on the screen. The touch screen display is awesome, and takes a little getting used to, but I love that, too.  Could have paid $20 more for the Kindle Fire, but for a person who spends10+ hours a day on a computer, that was the last thing I needed...I just needed a 'book' that didn't weigh 10 lbs (Stephen King) so that I could take it anywhere, anytime.",Love my new Kindle!!!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"For many years I refused to consider purchasing a Kindle reader because holding a book in my hands was a nice familiar routine for me. I eventually gave in and bought this product in late 2015, but still held off on using it until February 2016. Now that I've used it for a month, I wonder why in the heck I waited so long to buy one. I love the convenience of this product! It's lightweight, goes a very long time without the need for charging the battery, and I really like the fact that I can adjust text size for maximum reading comfort. The only thing I had a little trouble getting used to was the fact that there is no brightness adjustment on this model, but I learned that it just takes some time to get accustomed to using it. I'm probably only using a third of its features, but that's enough for me to say that I really like it,and highly recommend it.",Love the convenience and features of this product;;;;;;

Review: I am the wife on the account. I have had several Kindles but this was the worst. Promised new features did not live up to expectations.  Miserable to use by being forced to change pages with one hand.  I have a second generation Kindle that does not have a lot of bells and whistles but  pages can be easily turned with a click of a button from either relaxed hand.  The screen is great and can be read in sunlight. Bring something like it back with all the best new features and then it would be worth buying another

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Really great reader in the sun;" almost think it's a better reader in the sun than in a normally lite room.  Very happy with the basic functionality of this model Kindle.  Have an iPad already and didn't want a reader with Internet access thereby enabling me to stray of course from reading periodically.  Doesn't actually """"flick"""" pages like a book.  Instead there are (3) quadrants that you simply tap to change pages (fwd or back) or pull down main menu.  Overall it meets the needs of this basic reader (myself).""
Review: Solid eReader for the novice book reader";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Tablets are a common sight in our household.  At last count, I think we had over six floating around here.  Yet, my wife was still reading bound books.  She loves reading and cannot fathom giving up the feel of a book in her hands.  But she is open to utilizing a tablet form and has read books with the Kindle app on other branded tablets.  Enter Prime Day and the really good deal that was offered for the Kindle 6"".  I ordered it for her as a ""just because"" surprise, hoping she'd at least be somewhat excited that I thought of her!  She was and has already downloaded her first book and is well into it in just 24 hours!  She loves the ease in holding the unit, the contrast of the screen, and the simplicity of browsing, choosing, and downloading books to read.  She stated that she will always read the traditional book, but this Kindle has certainly opened up many options for her!This is a great item for someone who wants to carry many  (and I do mean many) options with them while travelling or just having it available at your bedside.  So light and easy to balance, so hand cramps are non-existent after a nice relaxed reading period. Battery charge hasn't budged in a whole day, with just over an hour of constant use.  We highly recommend this to any avid reader or perhaps even someone who may need a nudge toward reading more.","Affordability and Practicality Rule This Kindle, Ease of Use and Comfort Explain Why";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've held off for years in favor of traditional books before finally breaking down and getting a Kindle. Granted, it's kinda bottom of the line but I usually start small, taking baby steps and I couldn't pass up the deal of $59 with payments broken down monthly. I mean!Well. After some initial fumbling and poking, I can honestly say ""Where have you been all my life?!?"" This goes just about everywhere with me and it has encouraged me to read more as I'd slacked off more than I was happy with. As a starter, I can tolerate the ads (for now) but my dream is to upgrade to a more substantial model that will allow me to do and see more.I was taken aback at first because, unbeknownst to me, the feature that shows you what other readers have highlighted was enabled, but I poked around some and saw how to turn that bad boy off. It was mildly interesting at first (Hmm... why would someone highlight THAT passage or line?) but quickly grew distracting/annoying. Still in all, I've been very pleased with the experience and have fun loading my Kindle up with all kinds of reading material that I wouldn't otherwise have taken a second look at in a hard copy.  I've also loved the readability of the test and the ability to make the font comfortable for my eyes. Until an upgrade is possible for me (soon pleasepleaseplease!) I will add a clip-on light so that I can read in dimmer light as well.So, if anyone else is still holding out on taking the technological jump into an e-reader, I say go for it! I still miss the smell of a new book at times but I can always go browse in the local mega book emporium.(Oh, and thanks to those who posted in their reviews about trying my phone charger before springing for a separate charger purchase <really Amazon?> because my Android charger works like a charm.)",I Took the Plunge...Finally!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"My daughter is in college and is studying for the GRE. She was going to get the 5 lb GRE study guide (I think that that's what it's called) but hated the thought of lugging it around with her.  She had wanted a Kindle to make that easier, but has trouble sleeping and has been reading articles about how reading backlit devices at bedtime can lead to sleep issues.  This Kindle was the right item at the right time (and right price).  She'll be able to study in bed without staring at the backlit screen.",She was going to get the 5 lb GRE study guide (I think that that's what it's called) but hated the thought of lugging it around;;;;;;

Review: I got my kindle for Christmas and I am absolutely addicted to it. I hadn't researched them before hand and my mom bought me this one so obviously I was a little shocked to see it didn't have a light because I was unfamiliar with them. However it doesn't bother me at all and I think I prefer it instead. Lighted screens make my eyes hurt after a while and I love the look of a real printed book. It is light and a little flimsy feeling but if you just get a case for it it makes it easier to hold and protects it.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Have secretly wanted a Kindle for a long time.  I received one from my son for Christmas and just love it!  No glare, easy to read, great features (I love the x-ray feature especially, and looking up words).  I carry it in my bag and can read my book at any down time--waiting at the doctor's office, or anywhere.  I am really happy with it and know I'll be using it a lot!  It's great to save money, too, since almost all Kindle versions of books are less expensive.",Love it!!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my Kindle. I bought one when the price dropped below $100 back in 2011. A touch screen sounded nice, but physical buttons were OK by me. At $79, the new touch screen Kindle was definitely tempting, but I resisted until Thanksgiving when the price dropped to $49. Two days later I had my new Kindle & my husband had my old one. He's been a read paper books or read on the tablet or phone kind of guy. Two weeks later when the price dropped to $59 I asked him if he wanted Santa to get him one. After comparing the 2, he said yes. So, why this Kindle?Designed for readersPhysical books have dark print on a light background. They don't have built in lights. You sit in a spot with adequate lighting and read them. The same is true of this Kindle. Of course, sometimes it would be nice to be able to read in the dark or see the color in a book. Fortunately Kindle apps are available for almost any device and Amazon syncs across my devices. That means I can switch to using my tablet or phone when I need color or a light. For the record, I don't do that very often.Ease of UseI really didn't mind the physical buttons on my old Kindle. I also don't miss them. It's so much easier to hold the Kindle when I don't have to position my thumb on the edge of the device so I can turn the page. On the relatively rare occasions when I need to type something the keyboard on the new Kindle is incredibly easy to use. Typing on the old one was a pain in the butt. Getting a definition or highlighting a passage is a matter of touching the screen, not repeatedly pushing a button.Adjustable FontsNeed reading glasses? I do.  Sure, I can read normal sized print in physical books, but my Kindle lets me adjust the font size to make reading easier.  This isn't a new feature, but it's easier than it used to be.Battery LifeThe bad news is I don't get the projected month on a charge. The good news is the battery lasts days, not hours. Amazon bases their claim on 1/2 hour of reading per day (15 hours per month)and leaving wi-fi off. I spend an hour or 2 a day reading, so that cuts the estimated battery life at least in half. The Kindle uses battery only for page turns and accessing wi-fi. I leave wi-fi on. I also use a larger font and I read more than 1000 wpm. Google says the average person reads 250-300 wpm. The font size and reading speed mean at least 4 times the estimated page turns.  Battery life may not be what Amazon claims, but it's certainly within expected parameters. And it definitely beats battery life on my phone and tablet.Good ReadsI have't previously used Good Reads, but I do now. I love that it's integrated into this Kindle.Family libraryThis wasn't available on the old Kindle. I like sharing books with my husband. We don't have any children in residence, but the family features sound great.Buying ExperienceBooks don't have to cost money. I usually don't go into a bookstore or a library in search of a specific book. I go to a section and choose from what's available. I do the same on Amazon. I do most of my browsing in the free best sellers list. Since free books don't necessarily stay free, I buy whatever looks like I'd like it. I don't always like them and/or read them but I have more than 800 purchased books, most of them free. And all I have to take with me on the plane is my Kindle. Of course, at the bookstore I can sample the book before I buy it. Amazon lets me download a free sample. Once I buy a book, Amazon downloads it to my Kindle in about the time it takes to read this sentence. Amazing.Other book sources**Public libraries. The selection of ebooks at my library is significantly smaller than the selection of paper books. (No, ebooks don't cost the library nothing. They are actually significantly more expensive.) That said, the selection has definitely improved. Books check out for 1-3 weeks. The process is ridiculously easy. Check out the book & select Kindle. Overdrive takes you to Amazon, where the buy button has been changed to the borrow button. Don't count on finishing the last chapter after lending period ends. The book will stop functioning the second the lending period ends. The good part of that is that there are no fines for late returns.**Prime Lending Library. Check out 1 qualifying book per month with no due date. I have a wishlist of Prime books I want to read. I checked the library for them. Most weren't available,so my free sources don't overlap. This is a nice perk of Prime, but definitely not a reason to sign up. Prime books are only available on Kindle devices, not Kindle apps.**Kindle Unlimited for $9.99/month. I didn't expect to like my free trial, but I did. I could easily find and read more than $10 worth of books per month. Most (all?) of my Prime wishlist is available on Kindle Unlimited. While I like Kindle Unlimited, I have suspended my subscription for the moment. I will probably renew periodically. My husband wasn't impressed with the selection. I browse bookstores. He shops for a specific book. Kindle Unlimited is more suited to browsing.Special OffersAs previously implied, I'm cheap. That said, I did wonder about the Special Offers. Buy the Kindle with SO. Pay the $20 difference later if they bother you. You will see them as a screen saver and at the bottom 1/2 inch of the home page. You do NOT see them when you are actually reading. I don't spend much time on the home screen. I spend even less time looking at the screensaver. I spend most of my time on the Kindle actually reading. Some deals aren't bad, so I occasionally look at the list in the menu.  It's definitely not worth $20 to me to get rid of them.",Definitely an upgrade.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have had a Kindle for over 4 years and used it daily almost.  I used it mostly for reading.  I find I have read over twice as many books since I first got it.  Finally, it just wore out and I purchased my current one.  I purchased it while in Seattle over Christmas vacation and have been reading steadily ever since.  I purchased the smaller one that fits better in my purse or carry-on when I travel.  I'm not one to change whatever if what I had works for me.  I really like the new Kindle and when it wears out, will purchase the new model of KINDLE.",I purchased the smaller one that fits better in my purse or carry-on when I travel;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Best product EVER!  Wonderful!!!  I received a Kindle as a gift and loved it SO MUCH I bought three to give as gifts to three of my favorite people!  I always have six good books loaded and waiting to be read.  No more lugging around books, jamming them into my purse and forgetting them somewhere.  Heaven is having a charged & loaded Kindle!",Best product EVER;;;;;;

Review: I'm happy to have found this and at such an awesome price...getting back into the swing of reading and my tablet was just too cumbersome. This is so lightweight and easier to see in the sunlight. Beach reading is a passion.....
Title;;;;;;: Glare free reading and so lightweight.;;;;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"I finally needed to replace by 6 year old keyboard kindle, and bought this. I am honestly disappointed in all the ADDS!!!! So many adds, recommendations, etc.. taking up the whole screen. Though the touch screen function is nice, it doesn't feel worth all of the advertising pop ups.",disapointed;;;;;;

Review: Prefer my older version without the touchscreen. Difficult to navigate. Cannot go back or forward easily.  It constantly highligths or tries to copy a line--basically because I have not managed to move from page to page. Despite assurances that this was a better choice because of lower price the paper white might have been better. Still cannot read unless there is sufficient light and find the correct font or size for better reading. Not the best for a replacement reader
Title;;;;;;: Rather have my old reader back;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"My wife and I have a couple of kindles, originally I wanted the kindle fire as you could also play Angry Birds on it and occasionally use the internet - but never used it much for this. The kindle fire has a battery that lasts only a day or two, the black and white kindle lasts weeks.Our son gave us for Christmas a year ago a black and white kindle where you have the backlight also.I bought this to replace the lost black and white kindle that my wife lost. After getting it, we realized that this has no backlight, that means no reading at night without a light. My wife loves to read at night and does not want to disturb me, I usually do not read at night, so I took this one and I gave her mine.Maybe it is a good recommendation to buy the more expensive model, but this works fine if you do not plan to read at night without another light source.","Great price, easy to read";;;;;;

Review: LOVE it!  The first thing I love about this Kindle is the glare-free screen.  It allows me to sit in my back yard and read as the sun is high in the sky.  The battery is the second thing that is fantastic.  It lasts unbelievably long.  I read a lot and I have only charged it twice in the month that I've had it.  The size is also perfect.  I can take it in my purse and read it anywhere.I highly recommend this fabulous Kindle!!!

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I and my wife are avid and prodigous readers, I had been reluctant to go from a paper based book to the electronic reader.  I have always enjoyed the weight and feel of a book in my hands; with that being said;" the tremendous advantages of portability and the cvast selection of Kindle Unlimited has more than surpassed my expectations.I travel often for work
Review: and I am looking forward to not having the weight of seven or eight books in my carry-on bag.  It is quite easy to become emeshed in reading whole series of books in an afternoon before you know it.  I am profound and ethusiastic supporter of the Kindle.""
Title;;;;;;: A Whole New Reading World in you pocket!";;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have owned a Kindle in the past. I had the first version that came out. I was excited about the Fire bc it had more features. It was soo buggy that I wanted to throw it against the wall. I abandoned Kindle altogether and just used the app on my iPad. Now that I'm out of grad school and have my summers off, I wanted to revisit Kindle due to the glare factor. I also purchase a lot of books for work and need to reference them often. It is easier to purchase theses on a Kindle as opposed to having them all in hardback. THIS is the Kindle I've been waiting for!!!!Pros:- light weight- no bugs- can read in the sun but still adjust the background for the home- WONDERFUL study features:  - Dictionary: this is my favorite. Simply touch a word you don't know and it brings up the definition  - highlighting : you can go to a feature in the book that will show you every passage you have highlighted. It's the equivalent to putting post-its to mark a page but without the flipping and searching  - X-Ray: this is soo helpful when you are reading a book with a lot of characters or terms. Simple touch the character's name and it will bring up the important information on them!It has other features as well but those are my favorite. You can also organize them now which is also helpful (grouping). The battery life is also wonderful.Cons:- browser is slow. The internet feature sucks so you are better off using a smart device or computer to purchase your books.That's honestly the only con I can think of. I highly recommend this Kindle. It's one of my favorite things!",The Kindle I've been waiting on!;;;;;;

Review: The new Kindle was a huge disappointment as the device no longer supports audio!!  The only device that does both is Fire which does not have the anti-glare screen for outdoor reading that Kindle does..

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I ordered my new Kindle on Monday and received it on Wednesday.  So far, so good.  No problems, it operates pretty much like my old Kindle Touch.  I wore out the Kindle Touch.  It was getting very slow to turn pages and perform other functions, and it had an irritating scratch on the surface from being dropped.  No problem transferring books from the cloud to the new Kindle.  At the price of $59, it was a really good deal.",so good. No problems;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I loved my fourth generation Kindle because it was pretty much a no nonsense little ereader. It was also comfortable to hold for hours of reading pleasure. Unfortunately as such things go, it finally gave up the ghost and it was time for an upgrade. Hence, the seventh generation touchscreen. It's only been a week or so, but I've settled in with this one. The touchscreen is definitely a plus, the screen is crystal clear and glare free. Of course there are a lot more bells and whistles with it, such as Goodreads integration and the quick view. There were times I found such additions a bit fussy, but they're coming around. My biggest complaint is how much more weight this ereader has compared to my first. Even with the thinnest cover I could find, it's still an adjustment. For all that, it's still a nice little machine.",Surprised by the Weight;;;;;;

Review: My husband got me this for Christmas and I love it!!  I've been using the Kindle app on my android devices and pc's for years.  I'm excited to finally have a real Kindle.  =D  I love that it's all touchscreen now.  I don't think I would have liked the ones with the keyboards and buttons after having used touchscreen smartphones and tablets for several years now.  Love my Kindle!  :)

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Works really well during the daytime. It is very simple with user friendly instructions included in the software. I especially appreciate the vocabulary builder. You simply touch the word on the screen, it defines the word and stores it in the vocabulary builder section. Later you can go to the vocabulary builder and refresh your memory.Ron L.",Works really well during the daytime. It is very ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I won this from an AARP contest. I was surprised when I received it and didn't use it for a while. It did come at a perfect time when my large Kindle Fire's battery stopped charging. I love how light weight and thin this is...it easily fits in my purse without weighing it down. I love how there's no eye glare so I can read it at night without the glare keeping me awake for a while. Turning pages is easy by swiping or pressing your finger on the right side of the page, although sometimes by mistake, I press too far to the left or swipe too close to the middle and a word or sentence is underlined and the dictionary pops up or tries to...frustrating. Scoring stars at the end doesn't show up on Amazon so not sure why it's there. Overall, I really like this kindle and suggest it to others, especially for night time reading!",It did come at a perfect time when my large Kindle Fire's battery stopped charging;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my 2nd kindle, I had the first edition kindle for years and left it out in the Sun too long a couple weeks ago. It sadly broke. I immediately went out to purchase another one and I was really happy the quality was still there with a couple new upgrades. I love the glare free screen. My kindle is one of my favorite items, and this didn't disappoint. I will say I think the battery life on this version isn't as great as my first one. Its probably because of the touch screen.",Great product;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I've been a kindle user since the original 1.0 version.  I still remember paying almost $300 for my first one.  I've averaged an upgrade probably every three models.I picked this one up more because it was on sale for AmazonPrime day than anything else. I have been using the previous version with the awkward directional button on the bottom of the screen.  I also use a Paperwhite at night if I'm reading in bed because the glow doesn't overly disturb my wife trying to sleep.For reading outside, this is a great device - I don't think you can beat it, and I don't think you need the paperwhite or voyage in order to enjoy your book.For reading inside, you lose a star.  It just has a ""dark"" luster to it.  I find myself slightly straining my eyes to read it.And the touchscreen is good, and bad.  It is fantastic for whenever you have to type in a keyboard or click a button.  It is okay when you have to turn a page.  My issue is that sometimes I accidentally turn a page because I figit with the device while reading.  Or I want to turn the page with my left hand and can't.  More of a minor annoyance than a defect I think.  I have the same exact experience on my paperwhite, but I can't bring myself to pay the extra money for the Voyager.","Ups and downs.  Mostly ups, especially if you read outside.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my new Kindle!! The display is marvelous and the soul reason I will always stick to Kindle! The touch screen is great, and the whole set up is easy to learn. I wish the home display was was designed differently, but honestly I got it to read books not to stare at a home screen! Would absolutely recommend to everyone!",The bomb!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I use this kindle everyday. It was one of my smartest and most valuable purchases. I enjoy reading more than I ever have and on the plus side even though I read at least an hour everyday the battery lasts me atleast 3 weeks on a single charge, especially because I leave it on airplane mode.",Best Purchase!;;;;;;

Review: This is an upgrade from my older kindle. It has taken me awhile to get used to the touch screen. It seems to easily change the font size on its own. I am not sure why this is happening but it is easy to change it back.
Title;;;;;;: It seems to easily change the font size on its own;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Doesn't have a backlight for reading at night. Can't download and play word games like the original kindle could. But it's great for reading which is what it's intended for. The screen is a little touchy with swiping your finger to turn pages. But it's very easy to use and figure out. The battery lasts a very long time!!!! Would recommend for those who like to read and aren't into games/apps. Plenty of free books to search for when searching the amazon store. If you're upgrading to this device from an old kindle, it can upload previous amazon books you bought when you link your account.",Good for bookworms like myself.;;;;;;

Review: I had a kindle keyboard. it died. My husband said  most people don't use theirs 5 hours a day for 4 years.  This one was hard to get used to. everything worked differently. But after whining and grieving the loss of my last one. I began to put my book into collections. I transferred my older books. I learned to love it.  I did not name it brad. but I thought about it.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a great deal. It helps me go back to reading since its easy to carry and light. I can borrow all the books (if you don't mind waiting for some of the popular books) from the library.  Battery life is reasonable. Though I understand that it isn't possible to read in the dark with this version, I do wish I got the other one instead at night. But overall this is a great buy!","simple, great to read";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I was a little reluctant about getting a kindle. I'm sort of old fashioned and I love the feel of the paper in my hands and the smell of a brand new book.But I am gladly surprised at how much I love my kindle. I carry it with me everywhere. Of course, the main advantage is that I can carry many books with me (stored in my kindle) and it doesn't weight almost anything in my purse.The basic kindle is all that an reader affictionado needs. And, for the price, you can not go wrong.I still need to figure it out how to set the size and pattern of the font in my kindle. Every time I turn it on it chages the size to too big or too small.The only complaint about the purchase was the poor service with deliver. I'm a Prime Member and I was expecting to have it deliver in 2 day which didn't happen. Also, it surprised me that it was sent via snailmail and not UPS. I was very dissatisfied with that.",I caved in and I don't regret it!;;;;;;

Review: My previous Kindles allowed me to press the forward and backward button to page forward or backward. The new Kindle has me swipe the screen to change the page. I prefer the older Kindle as the new one will sometimes page ahead 3-4 pages.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Works as advertised. This is my 2nd kindle. This one has nice touches the other model didn't have, most notably the touch screen, which makes the interface much better. Combined with very good battery life, this is a solid kindle. If you use your kindle for reading rather than surfing, the standard kindle is much better than the colour screen models.",Works as advertised;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Just what I asked for, but a bit of a surprise after all. I use a bright, colorful iPad all day long. The one disadvantage is the glare when I try to read a kindle book outside. Impossible unless you are in the shade. I bought the Kindle for just this purpose. The screen is not back lit (if I wanted that so I could read indoors.... should have bought the other model) and the pages are not pure white... soft grey. But I do like the fact I can increase the type size and adjust the page width for faster reading...It does what it needs to do.","Kindle 6"" does what It's supposed to...but not much more.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This device is exactly what I wanted for reading focus rather than general web searches. This simply takes me where I need to go for book searches (tap magnifying glass on drop down menu and type in search words.)  The keyboard on the bottom half of the screen is nice and I rarely miss a key when tapping.  Searches have been surprisingly quite fast and download speed is faster than expected even for longer books. The scroll bar was tricky at first, swiping down to go up and swiping up to go down!  Light touches to the right of screen take you forward to the next page and to the left of screen take you backward to the page before and these taps need not be hard to get the pages turned. The unlit screen doesn't hurt my eyes since it is lit by any light source outdoors or indoors.  Other features as advertised such as dictionary are useful for quick look up but again, not necessary for reading (since I personally get easily distracted and don't want to look up words all day) and I noticed two dictionaries to choose from.  Love the feature of making words (font size) as big or as small as needed or allowed by putting two fingers apart an inch or two on the screen, then pinching the two fingers to make font smaller or opening fingers wider from a pinch position on the screen, to make font larger (what a snap!)  So, very happy;" recommend added protection for any touch screen devices.""
Review: Modern and Focused Reading From Touch and Sight";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"It's very simple. If you want something just for reading, it will be perfect.No glare screen, I bought a light. Without light, felt, that times I can use it limited.With Prime membership I have good choice or books for myself and my 10 years old child.Compare to other electronic devices, I know, my child can do only reading,  no games or any other distractions exist.",Good device for just reading!;;;;;;

Review: Bought this for my teen aged daughter and she loves it. Also bought the paper white and think it's worth the extra scratch. Go for the paper white it's just more useful with the back lit screen hands down.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Easy to use, font is very clear, it is light weight, and the charge lasts for a long time.The only improvement to the Kindle that I could recommend concerns the charging light. The light is amber while charging and green when fully charged. I am colorblind, so amber and green on the Kindle are one and the same color to me. Perhaps two colors further separated on the color spectrum, like blue and green, would help for someone that is colorblind. That isn't enough to stop me from giving the Kindle 5 stars though. It is a wonderful device and I thoroughly enjoy using it.",Excellent Reading Device;;;;;;

Review: I Have a Kindle Paperwhite and do not recommend it to anyone. I struggle to transfer by books from the computer to the Kindle and there is no support what so ever. I follow exactly what the say on the help tab but it does not work the way they say.Extremely frustrating. WILL NOT RECOMMEND KINDLE OR EVER BUY ONE AGAIN.
Title;;;;;;: I Have a Kindle Paperwhite and do not recommend it to anyone;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Loved this. Ended up breaking and I purchased a replacement, but I don't love the new ones as much as this simple one. Too many options on the new ones for me, the simplicity of this - no color, easy turn pages - were fine.",This was my favorite.;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchased the Kindle 7th Generation after the screen on my 3rd Generation failed. I was an avid reader on my Kindle 3rd generation and was quite disappointed when the screen broke. Knowing how much I enjoyed reading on my Kindle I decided i couldn't go back to regular paper books, so I got the 7th Generation is the other day and to be honest was disappointed to see many of the features are gone. If you are looking for a straight up eReader with no bells and whistles this will work for you...although I'm sure there are cheaper versions or ereaders out there. Features they have taken aways are the speakers, the Kindle will no longer read a book to you which I used to us in the car daily, also there are no games which the 3rd generation allowed you to download, there is no screen contrast, it doesn't even come with a wall charger. Touch screen keyboard is nice, miss the buttons on the side to turn the pages though...guess I have to get used to it. It seems to be a stripped down, bare bones version of past Kindles.Things that have improves: Screen Resolution is greatly improved, goodreads is available, can download easy from the cloud, can see pics of the book covers",Not as good as past Kindle (3rd generation/keyboard);;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I'll start by saying I really love the Kindle e-ink display and wouldn't use any other computer screen or reader. I don't even miss the side buttons, though I did like those on the previous version. My overall complaint is that this model seems much cheaper. The last generation non-touch screen that I had was a joy to hold in my hand, it fit perfectly, and I think the back was rubberized for a better grip and to not slide around on stuff. It was just wonderful to hold. The back plastic on this model is VERY cheap and slick, and while I enjoy the Kindle experience overall, I don't get the joy out of holding this device like I did the previous model. That being said, this version is much easier to use for highlighting and making notes, which is a feature I like and use frequently.","wonderful product, but not as nice to hold as the last model";;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"My one star review is solely based on Amazon's decision to include ""Special Offers"" on their lower priced Kindle Touch (which is still, actually, not super cheap, typically running you about $80). My husband purchased the Kindle Touch for me from a retailer, and so, it automatically included what Amazon refers to as ""Special Offers"" that Amazon claims only kindle users are privy to. At first, the special offers were limited to Amazon products only (Amazon Fire TV stick, chargers, cases, etc) and although I was pretty disappointed to learn that my screen-lock pages consisted of basically a rotation of Amazon ads, it was somewhat tolerable (although I should note that these ""Special Offers"" were not special at all, as the price of each item displayed was actually the same exact price if not CHEAPER on Amazon's main website, which EVERYONE has access to).
