Occasionally, Amazon would throw a few book cover illustrations in the rotation, which was a nicer display (although it still displayed the price of the book so was technically an ad as far as I'm concerned).Then it took a turn for the worst! A few weeks later, my Kindle updated automatically, and with the update the ads became completely out of control. It was no longer limited to Amazon products but instead included ads from Asics shoes, Quaker oatmeal, Vitamin pills, ice-cream, life alert bracelets, and even blood pressure monitoring devices! And it was EVERY SINGLE TIME my Kindle was in screen-lock mode. The one book cover illustration that I did find in this new rotation even had an ad for the Land Rover in the bottom corner! When I unlocked my Kindle and went to the homepage, the same annoying ads were displayed in a banner at the bottom of the screen. Had I been able to return my Kindle, I would have (the retailer we purchased it from has a 14 day return policy). Instead, I took the route that I know Amazon hopes each person that buys the discounted Kindles will take;" I bought my way out of them for an additional $20. And no
Review: you cannot use an Amazon gift card to pay for the ads to be removed from your Kindle
Title;;;;;;: as an Amazon customer service person formally informed me. Fortunately
column4: my Kindle was purchased at a Black Friday special price
column5: saving us about $30 total and making this $20 ad-removal fee a little easier to swallow.That being said
column6: as soon as I paid the fee
column7: the ads immediately disappeared from my Kindle Touch and I am MUCH happier with it
column8: however I am completely appalled and disappointed with Amazon for taking on such shady business practices and making an E-reader that has all of visual appeal of a lame ad-supported free phone app.""
column9: not super cheap
column10: typically running you about $80)""";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am a long time Kindle user who has owned several of the models and bought several others for my family members as gifts.  I think this little Kindle is amazing.  I owned one of the first generation models when they first came out and I loved it and used it for 3 years until I was ready to upgrade to the Kindle Fire.  I was excited about the Kindle Fire and how it was like a tablet but quickly realized I didnt like the tablet part of it or the glass screen with the glare all the time.  Plus, it was really hard to type on the keyboard and on all 3 models of the Fire, the charging port wore out.  That just happened to me again and this time I saw this model on sale for Black Friday for $49 and decided I had nothing to lose trying it out.  It arrived the next day (thanks Amazon amazing customer service!) and was very easy to set up.  It comes with only a charging cord with USB plug now and does not come with the power unit that you need to be able to plug it into an outlet.  All of my other Kindles it was included but now it is sold separately.  Once I got it charged and turned on it only took a couple minutes to set it up and I was reading!  Note: this Kindle is not backlit.  It has no light at all so you do need a light to read in the dark.  I love this Kindle.  It is much lighter than the other models and the touch screen is really nice, you dont have to push a button to turn the page.  If you are an avid reader like me, who uses their kindle mainly for reading, this is a great device.",My favorite Kindle yet!!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I'll be honest, I miss my kindle keyboard.  I miss having a manual page turn, I miss the size and shape and I miss having the music option.  The new kindle touch is lighter, the screen is the same size as the original kindle, so it is slightly smaller lengthwise, but slightly thicker.  The screen itself is definitely better.  It is whiter and reminds me less of an etch-a-sketch. It operates faster, there is no delay in page turns.  It turns on the same way as an iPhone, where you push a button and then have to swipe the screen just right.  Obviously it doesn't have a light, but I don't want a backlit reading experience.As to kindle in general, over books: I love having a kindle and never want to go back.  It reads better than a book because I can adjust the text size.  I don't have to deal with the ink rubbing off like with mass market paperbacks, or having stiff binding or accidentally ripping a page or getting water on it.  It's not waterproof but a couple drops here or there are fine as long as they don't get inside the housing.  I don't have to worry about storing the books I want to reread and having to box them up whenever I move.  I don't have to worry about packing enough books for a vacation and the amount of space they will take up in my suitcase.  Lending books is an issue.  There is some way of lending books electronically, but normally the ones I actually want to lend don't have that option.  Browsing for books is also more frustrating.  Going to a bookstore I can at least verify that an editor has corrected the book for grammar, proofreading and quality, where as in the kindle store that is never guaranteed and you can't always tell from the price.","I miss having physical buttons, but the screen is better.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I did get the kindle with special offers. They honestly do not bother me at all. You don't see anything while reading, only the screen saver. And I'm not upset about it recommending a book or something I might enjoy. I've only charged it once since I got it, used it straight out of the box. I never thought I would be an ereader owner but here I am!",special offers are NBD;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought as a present for my younger brother - he absolutely loves it. Kindle is great and doesn't provide the exposure to blue light that tablets and smartphones do, so it's great for before bed reading. Highly recommend the Kindle as a great e-reader!",Kindle is great and doesn't provide the exposure to blue light that ...;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"Terrible.  The pages turn with the slightest touch and then it is difficult to go back and find where you were.  It is difficult to bring up the top menu and previous book listings.  You don't know how far in the book you are.  I loved the original Kindle with the forward and back pages, along with the keyboard.  You could also play games with the original.  They really need to devise the original style with the paper white light up version. That I would buy 10 times over.",Terrible. The pages turn with the slightest touch and ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"My son took over my Kindle 2nd generation, so I treated myself to a new Kindle. I love the touch screen.  It's easy to use and light enough to carry in my purse.  I have an iPad and a smart phone, but I prefer reading on my Kindle.  It's nice that I can read in sunshine on the Kindle, where I can't on my other two devices.","Lightweight, easy to see in sunlight";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I now have two kindles and was going to give my old one to my wife to use then found out she cannot get Prime benefits on a new account for her,  without paying for another hundred dollar Prime account. I thought that both of us were included on our one account.She hasn't used it in the month we've had it so I transferred the book I am reading over to it and may sell one of them. Likely this one as my other kindle is a button activated one and it seems to read better to me.If you are a first time Kindle buyer this is a great reader. If you are upgrading from the mechanical button basic kindle my advice is to keep your old one, or skip this one and get the Paperwhite with backlight. I haven't tied that one yet, but the backlight and advertised better readability might be worth it.I don't know why but I prefer my old one. We do have three Windows 8.1 Tablets, two 11.6"" ones and one 10.8"" Venue 11 Pro with full HD and IPS screen so we don't need Internet on our readers. And no, I do not like the larger tablets for reading with the outdoor light washing them out in sunlight.So I give this one four stars as a standalone, and one off for not really giving me anything more than my first one which I switched back to. I would take another star off for the Prime not being a real family membership where my wife can have her own account and get the same deals on her books etc. We both watch the streaming on our Fire TV and like it. This Prime thing is like saying that she should not watch too as she does not pay a separate hundred bucks for a Prime account of her own.Of all the transactions I've had with Amazon over the years this one seemed completely out of character. Sure, we can ""pretend they are the same person on them and just load her books on one and my books on the other but why? You guys should allow a family plan which all come from the same IP address or router. Easy enough to check. Maybe limit it to four before we have to lie about it.",Great for a first device.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I like the first one better.  This is a little too wide to fit comfortably in your palm as the other did.  It's way heavier.  The screen is not as bright in dark rooms.  The touch menu is at the top instead of the bottom, and everything's now by touch, so it's easy to accidentally send yourself somewhere you don't want to go.  You can now swipe to turn pages, though I didn't mind squeezing a button on the side to turn a page, since it (the old one) fit comfortably in my hand.  I still give it 4 stars because Kindle readers are great products",Great product but I liked the old model better;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I am very disappointed in Amazon's warranty regarding the Kindle.  My daughter received some ebooks for Christmas and they would not download to her device.  I researched the problem and Amazon's website indicated we should reboot the device.  It has been in a frozen state ever since we tried that.  I called the support line and they tried doing the same things I did and nothing worked. The device is 33 days past the warranty and they will do nothing for us.  We ""get"" to buy a new one if we want to replace it.  I said ""no thanks.""  Very disappointing customer service.",I am very disappointed in Amazon's warranty regarding the Kindle;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I really like this for reading out in the sun, but wish it had a brighter light at times.  Also wish the letters were a little more sharp.  At Best Buy they didn't have any on display so was sort of left to guessing what differences it might have compared to the next model up.Love the size and have figured out how easy it is to down load and transfer books from old tablet.",I really like this for reading out in the sun;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Please make sure to read the product description. Many of the low ratings seem to spawn from not knowing what this is. It is an e-reader, simply put. There are no bells or whistles. It is for reading e-books in the same way one would read a paper book. It is glare-free and easy on the eyes. My otherwise tech-deficient better-half figured it out on the first try. It is simple yet effective and very useful.",Make sure you know what you're buying.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This review is for the 7th generation Kindle, 6"".  First of all let me start by saying it is very important to know what you want to do with your Kindle before purchasing one.  Know WHAT you are buying!  This is a very BASIC Kindle.What it is not:  It does not come with a light  It does not use 3G or 4G and does not have the capability.  It does not allow a user to browse the Internet.  It does not allow a used to play games.  It does not show color.What it is:  It is very lightweight  It uses WiFi to download books  It uses E-ink to display titles, words, etc.  It has a touch screen that is very clearly laid out  It is very easy to use without all the ""clutter"" of apps that comes with Kindles that do have Internet access.  It has extra options on the screen, such as a dictionary, Sync to Furthest Page Read, Note pages, etc.  It has a long battery lifeLet me explain why my ""nots"" do not matter to me.  I never read in a dimly lit area or in the dark, so I did not care about having a light, although if allowed to pick one feature to change, I would probably ask for a light.  However, I do not find it necessary to have one.  With this product a person MUST have WiFi access to download books which is fine for me since I have WiFi at home.  I download all my books at home so that I will have plenty to read before leaving on a trip.  If you want to download books anytime/anywhere, this is NOT the product for you.  If you are wanting to play music, games, tune in to social media, surf the Internet, etc. this is NOT the right Kindle for you.  I use my laptop and smartphone for all the above, but did not want this on my Kindle.Now, let me tell you why I LOVE this Kindle.  This is so lightweight that I feel like I am almost holding nothing even after I put it in a case.  I love the fact that it uses E-ink instead of a backlit screen because my eyes are sometimes a bit sensitive and eyes grow  tired if using my daughter's Kindle Fire to read.  With the E-ink I can read for a longer time.  I really like the touch screen and do not understand the negative comments about not having ""page turners"".  The page can either be swiped to the side to change or the bottom right-hand corner can be tapped to change to the next page.  When the top is tapped a menu to go to the home screen, Amazon shopping cart, search bar, font, and extra options is displayed, which is so easy to use.  I do enjoy the extra options menu because it has just enough extra features without being too many;" like the """"clutter"""" of apps I mentioned in the above section.  Please understand
Review: I enjoy using apps and like them on my smartphone
Title;;;;;;: just not my Kindle.If you are wanting a Kindle that will do everything a computer or tablet will do
column4: then I recommend purchasing another type of Kindle to meet all your needs.  But
column5: if you are just wanting to read books electronically without other stuff to get you sidetracked
column6: then this quite possibly could be the Kindle for you.I love reading books and having the ability to finish a book then download another one immediately as well as storing my previously read books.  I also really like being able to look up the meaning of words found in my book from a dictionary right at my fingertips and never stop reading.  My Kindle is reserved for reading
column7: pure and simple and I am LOVING using it.Hope this helps.  :)""
column8: Wonderful Product If You Know What You Are Buying.";;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I only gave 4 stars, because it is about meeting expectations.  I was thinking I could read crochet books and such on the Kindle, but it really isn't great for detailed drawings.  It isn't a fault of the Kindle, just something I hadn't thought to consider.  It is only a 6"" screen, so there is only so much space available.  I do enjoy reading books on it, and that is really what I bought it for.  It is comfortable to hold, more comfortable than an actual book, especially when my kitty is sitting on my lap.  It is also better than an actual book in that you can adjust the font size;" that comes in handy in a low-light situation.  I like that I can borrow books at my local library for the Kindle without even going there.  There is also a large selection of free and public domain titles to download without charge on Amazon.  I will finally read a lot of the classics I missed.  The battery seems to last a long time.  I only recharged it so far because I plugged it in to check on books to download.  I just wish it came with a good
Review: protective cover
Title;;;;;;: I will have to buy one or make one.  I am a little afraid to take it with me anywhere without one.""
column4: Great Entry-Level e-Reader";;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"This Kindle allowed me to get back my Paperwhite after daughter made off with it to read Heroes of Olympus series books.  With my Kindle, the next volume was readily available so she could keep going without signing up for the waiting list at her library or making a trip to the bookstore.This model is inexpensive and sturdy enough to be appropriate for an older, elementary age kid.  I'm not following her around, taking it away from her while she tries to keep reading through eating and brushing her teeth.The price point allowed a family member to give this as a holiday gift, allowing me to receive my paperwhite (back again) for a second holiday season in a row!  Everyone is happy now.  Daughter is really not interested in the device in any way, only the books on it.  I suggest setting up an account for the recipient, setting up the device, and loading them up with books you know they want ahead of time unless they are fully comfortable doing this on their own.  We did this and carefully returned the Kindle to the original box.  It's really nice for the recipient to turn it on and go, growing comfortable with the Kindle as they use it.The limitations are that this model isn't for reading in the dark (probably just as well) and doesn't seem to have the family sharing feature although you can share if the other Kindle involved does allow that.  The sharing is fairly confusing still, they have work to do there, but it's OK.  The case parts and form factor are not as nice as more expensive models but this is a reasonable trade off for the price.Hate the Facebook Good Reads feature built in.  Dear Amazon, please remove that as part of your OS and make it an optional feature for those who want it.  Super annoying bloatware, not interested.  I recommend keeping junk from other businesses off your clean and simple device.  Yuck.","Good Buy, Especially for Kids";;;;;;

Review: This is my first time owning a kindle ereader. When it first arrived  I was surprised at how high quality the screen was. It reads like an actual book and is very light. I love the new x-ray feature which gives descriptions and background information on each of the characters in a book. It's the perfect size. I hear people saying that the plastic on the back feels cheap but its fine to me and has a nice touch.The only thing I don't like is how easily the kindle can get scratched around the the kindle logo. This amazing for anyone who loves to read but doesn't want to carry a lot of heavy books around.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I like many of the new features: the ""go to"" section for example, But, at this point, in some ways, I'm finding it harder to use than my old Kindle.  Admittedly, I prefer printed using ""real""  books so I'm not getting as much experience as I could.  The features may be there but they're harder to find.  For example, I could see  a list of all the Kindle books I had bought but not yet read.  (This doesn't include the Archived books.)  It's undoubtedly there;"  but I haven't found it. yet.  (I have a list on paper.) When you're reading a whole list of features with instructions
Review: it's hard to remember all the information. So
column4: I miss my old
column5: familiar Kindle
column6: which  lost.""
column7: Lots of good things and some bad";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I just love this.  It doesn't take up much room and holds a charge for days.  On a recent flight I just stuck this in my purse and then reached right in when I got ready to read.  No fumbling around in a carry on!  The glare-free screen was great, too, since I never had to tilt the device to get rid of glare.  I'm very happy with my purchase.",Very pleased with my purchase;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I like my new Kindle very much.  I have had the Kindle keyboard for years now and it was starting to get a little wonky now and then.  I have to restart it a couple times a month when it freezes.  I had put this new Kindle on my wish list ""in case"".  I received a price drop notice and jumped on it.  It is much lighter than the keyboard Kindle and that is a big plus.  Also,  the touch screen is sooo much easier than the keyboard.  It takes some getting used to for page turning, but it's not a big deal.  It is very sensitive to touch, but once you get the hang of it, I think it is fine.  I prefer to read on this type of e-reader as it is so much easier on my eyes.  I also have a Fire but do not like to read books on it.",Very Nice;;;;;;

Review: The good: I love being able to have all of my books in one place whenever I want to read them so this kindle is perfect for me. The text of the books actually makes this kindle look like actual pages in a book. Books download fast and are easily accessible.I would recommend getting kindle unlimited for any book lover.The bad: The only complaint I have about this kindle is the lighting. It is hard to see in dim lighting. Also when reading the books you can see a fade of the prior page in the background.The bottom line: Overall this is a good product. I would suggest getting the paper white version if possible. If you cannot get the paper white I would suggest buying a clip on light if plan on reading it in dim lighting.
Title;;;;;;: Good Kindle but Buy the Paper White if you can;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am old school.  I  honestly think I would not like it.  I like the feel of paper.  I love books.  I now love my Kindle.  I take it everywhere, even to the beach!!  I guess you can teach and old dog new tricks!!  I am hooked.",You can teach old dog new tricks!!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"A fantastic little e-reader.  no glare, no hassles, easy to use easy to read.  What more can you ask for in a simple low cost e-reader?  I do not know.  I, like many of you, have an iPhone and an iPad and I love them, and use them every day, but the simple ease of use and easiness on the eyes Kindle is more pleasant to read, and it is so much like reading a paper back book.  Thank you Amazon for this excellent product... now I have over 900 books on my little Kindle.",Easy on the Eyes...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first Kindle, I found the user interface quite intuitive.  When I read the reviews, so many people said they could not figure it out.  For the life of me, this thing is so simple to use, within 15 minutes, I had it figured out and 10 books loaded on it.  One other common complaint were adds...There are two versions of the machine, one with adds that is cheaper and one without.  If you buy the cheaper version, you are paying a lower price because of the adds.  If you don't want adds, pay the higher price.  Please indulge me on one  final rant, this devise does not have a back light.  That means you need to read it in a lit room or space.  The advantage of this it that it is easy to read outside in sunlight.  If you order one without a back light and complain that you can't read it in the dark....What's a matter wit you???!!!  Read the product description, that is what they are there for.  Not on with my review.  It works.  I can read books on it.  It is easy to use.  .I can read in the bright sun with it and I can't read it in the dark.  This is a good simple devise that does it's job. 'nough.said!",What's a matter wit you???!!!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"In the Box: The Kindle box included the Kindle and a USB cord. It would be nice if they included a wall adapter, but no one does these days. Sigh...Size/weight: It has a decent size display at 6"" and the weight is nice, not too heavy.Feel: I like the feel of the Nook Simple Touch better. Its has a soft and smooth rubber type backing that is easy to hold.The the Kindle is just plastic. This is bad. It slips through my fingers easily and if I am holding it for a long time my fingers sweat (making it more likely I will drop it on my face while laying in bed lol). They seriously need to fix this.Touch Screen: Works great, with a fast response time.Adding books: With the Kindle, if you don't purchase the book from Amazon you can simply email your book to your kindle email address and it's added to your device over wifi. ""WHAT"" you say? YES it's that easy. Man I have been missing out.Deleting Books: You can simply hold and touch the book icon on your Kindle until a screen pops up and select remove from device. Your book is still on your Amazon account and you can re-send it at anytime.Battery Life: You know this one is hard for me to gauge because I really don't pay attention and I read a lot. I started using my Kindle on December 4th and have not been notified to charge it yet so, that is a plus (I have had wifi on the whole time, the charge is getting pretty low though).Other: The Kindle's lack of page numbers is really annoying. I like having the ability to glance down and seeing how far into a book I am. The Kindle does not allow this. HUGE bummer. The Kindle allows you to highlight passages and makes notes. It's a nice feature to have and I have already used it. The Kindle has some quirk I have yet to figure out. When I drop it on my head while reading (yes this does happen often as like I said above, its slippery plastic shell is not cool) or hits something on accident when I set it down, it changes the font size. Kinda annoying. Anyone know if I can turn off what ever feature is causing this? I purchased mine on Black Friday for only $49 with ads. The ads are perfectly fine on there. I am glad i didn't pay more to not have them. I",NEEDS a new housing design.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"First and foremost, everyone needs to understand that this low cost product does NOT have a backlight.  Buy the next model up if you think you want that feature.  I already had a Kindle Fire HD.  I specifically got this Kindle because I wanted to read at night without having a backlight to mess with serotonin levels, which can screw up your sleep cycles.  It works well, and of course works extremely well under daylight conditions.  And now I'm sleeping better at night.  I also like the fact that it doesn't need constant recharging.  A single charge can last for two weeks of reading or more. Not a bad little device, and easy on the eyes.","First and foremost, everyone needs to understand that this ...";;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I started with one of the keyboard 3G kindles, then moved up to a first gen Kindle Fire. I loved both of them. The screen on the keyboard one cracked, so I had to take the fire around with me. It's quite heavy and I had been thinking about getting a regular kindle for the train commute, so I didn't have to carry the fire around. When I saw this one on sale for $49, I took the plunge.Things I don't like about it - the touch screen does seem to be kind of hyper sensitive. Many times, I've touched to change pages and it's jumped ahead several pages. Also, the unit just froze a few times within the first few days of use, and I had to hold the power button in to get it to shut down and then restart it. Upon restarting, it put me back a few chapters. It is hard to see details on the pictures of book covers as you are browsing. The picture is not sharp or focused. I have taken to buying the books on my laptop and loading them onto it because it's useless for browsing. I won't send it back because, for the most part, it serves the purpose for which it was purchased, glitches aside. However, I would not want to have this as my only device to purchase and read books on.The screen is kind of small. Smaller than the keyboard one was. I'm counting that as a neutral point because, although it's annoying to have to change pages more often, it does contribute to the overall compactness of this e-reader. The screen is also dull, which I don't consider a bad thing but you might. I find the lack of back lighting easy on my eyes, however, you can't read it in dim lighting.Things I like about it - It's very light. Probably a quarter of the weight of my Fire. It also starts up instantly. There aren't a lot of bells and whistles, which I like. I bought it so I could read books on the train and it covers that without a bunch of other stuff that could go wrong with it. I like the ability to adjust the font size (you can do this on all Kindles).Overall, I'm satisfied with it for the price. I would be less happy if I had paid the full price for it. For under $50, it was worth it.",Worth buying if you can get it on sale.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Since the first Kindle came out, I've wanted one but never had the ability to get myself one and no one ever gifted me one. So when I found this deal, I jumped at it. And I couldn't be happier with my purchase. It's the only way anyone should read e-books. I have a tablet with the Kindle App on it but I always had a hard time reading anything on it because if I was under a light, the screen would glare, and if I was outside, it was impossible to see anything on my tablet at all! This makes the reading experience of e-books so much more enjoyable. And I love all the graphic screen saver things that appear when I turn my kindle off!","Luv, Luv, Luv it!!! =3";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my 4th Kindle and my least favorite.  It looks and feels cheap.  However, for the price I wasn't expecting a lot, thus 4 stars.  If you expect it to perform like it only cost $79, you'll be happy.  If you buy this version expecting the touch screen to perform like your cell phone or tablet you'll be disappointed.  I found that tapping the screen works better than swiping to turn the page.  If I used my Kindle daily I would want a nicer version.  For reading a couple of days a week this is a great deal.Pros:  It is cheap (I bought it on sale for $59).  It is small and light so it fits easily in my purse.  I like the touch screen well enough, it is fairly responsive for such an inexpensive electronic device.  It is comfortable to hold while reading, a little easier than my Kindle Keyboard because it is lighter and there aren't any buttons to accidentally press while reading.  The screen is fairly responsive when highlighting a word to look up in the dictionary.Cons: This Kindle does not have holes in the side to pop in to a cover;" I like that feature in my previous Kindle Keyboard.  I haven't purchased the cover that is made for it so I can't speak to how well it is designed.  There are no page turn buttons.  Some people might not care
Review: some may.  I thought the screen images would be sharper based on the product description.  Book covers and books with pictures are decent but not as crisp as my Kindle Keyboard.Overall I'd recommend this version to someone looking for a cheap
Title;;;;;;: casual use eReader.  If you are a heavy user or picky about the performance of your electronics I'd upgrade to a different version.""
column4: Good for a cheap eReader";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought this for my mother. She's older and isn't the biggest fan of electronics, a let alone touchscreen devices, but she loves this. One thing to be aware of, however, is that comes pre-loaded with the account from which it's ordered. If it's being given as a gift, you'll want to make sure to correct this.",Bought this for my mother. She's older and isn't ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I have to say, I like this thing, but it would be better- so much so, with more settings, and an ability to turn off the ads that display themselves on it.Namely, it'd be nice to put some books behind a password, to set a cover image for the kindle itself when idle, and to import fonts. At this point it is and will seem to stay something I got for what it was worth when it was on sale earlier this year. (2015)I mean, it's nice. As far as using it though, it can be frustrating for someone with big hands and flat-tipped fingers. Namely, most commands seem to be set up for either a device 1.5 times the size, or for manipulation using only the nail of your finger, if that's even possible. Buttons don't seem to follow the basic logic of finger size in any way. Text links in the browser for instance have no isolation from eachother. Poke one and you may just poke the one near it, or above, even below, or perhaps you'll zoom out instead. I mean, again... I'm glad I got it for what I did. Glad I have it, yeah, but not as glad as I could be.",Worth getting on sale. Like REALLY on sale.;;;;;;

Review: Amazing artifact. You should know that PDFs can be read with this as well.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"My first kindle was the kindle keyboard so my review is in comparison to that. I didn't update until now due to device storage. The other kindles between keyboard and this one were half the storage so no way was I going to do a backwards step. Overall, I really do like this kindle. It is easy to use. I love the anti glare and how the pages look like that of a real book in that off white colour.There are only 2 points in which I don't like about this kindle.1: Collections names with number of items in them take up 2 lines instead of 1, resulting in less number of collections showing on the one screen. There is plenty of room for the name of the collection and for the number of items in each collection to be side by side. By doing this, more collections could be listed per screen/page. In this instance, I prefer the following: Fiction (10) or Fiction - 10. The word item/s after the number is totally optional.2: When viewing All, collections are no longer at the top with all books listed below them. Even then, with the keyboard, the only items showing after the collections were those not place in a collection. Now, whether they are in a collection or not, all are showing. In this instance, I prefer the way it was with my kindle keyboard: Collections at the top, everything else underneath them and any added to collections not show up in the All listing. The reason for this is because I would only place them into a collection after I had read them. If they weren't in a collection then I had not read them. It just made it so much easier to work out what I had and hadn't read. Now, I am wasting time by having to check on goodreads as to whether I've read the book or not.Other than those two points, I am happy with this device.",Good but...;;;;;;

Review: I love my new Kindle.  It is light and easy to read.  I love my Kindle Fire also but wanted a lighter one that is glare-free to use outside so this one will work perfectly for that.  It is also great that when you have two Kindles you can pick up either one to read your book because the books are in the cloud.
Title;;;;;;: Great Kindle for keeping in my purse;;;;;;

Review: Excellent. This is my first reading Kindle and I am not disappointed! Works exactly as described. I have had this for six days and have used about 50% of battery. I have been turning on wi-fi for a few minutes a couple times a day. I have also been reading for one to two hours a day. Happy with battery life.

Rating: 2.0 out of 5 stars,"I never write reviews and feel bad for rating so low, but two things are preventing me from loving it.1) I loved, loved, loved the ""text to speech"" option. I would listen to books throughout the day and I even thought it was helping me improve the speed at which I read. When my Kindle died, I never thought that the new generation Kindles wouldn't have that feature. When I didn't see it on the list, I assumed, wrongly, that it was still there. Someone said in a forum ""make sure you choose the Kindle that's right for you."" I wouldn't have chosen any of the new generation Kindles since none of them have this feature. (I def would have just went with a Kindle Fire assuming that the option is still there.)2) I used to be able to search for and download books anywhere without needing to find a new network. Now, I find that I'm stuck with what I have already downloaded, which is frustrating. I don't always know that I'm going to need to download before I leave home.It's new to me and I want to love it ... maybe I'll feel differently in a matter of months.",Color Me Disappointed;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchased this for my husband for Christmas hoping the glare-free screen would be good for him. Ha! This model has been a huge mistake.  He does not do well with touchscreens as he goes to sleep reading and touches the screen then Kindle changes pages on him. So, he spends a lot of his reading time trying to find where he was in a book - sometimes it's not even the book that is currently showing on the screen. The screen is too easy to change and irritatingly pops up font changes and other garbage. The older models with the side buttons were perfect, easy to use. I have a side button model myself and dread the day when mine decides to quit. Since I can't buy another one on Amazon, I think I'll check out ebay for the old style. Gee, Amazon - good job running off people. PS, their ""customer service""  folks in India have poor English, it's hopeless, too. Don't bother.",A BIG disappointment from Amazon;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have an iPad 2 but it is heavy for carrying when I travel because I also take along my laptop. This stays in my purse at all times because of its compact size so my books are everywhere I am. I did not mind not having the light as I don't read in the dark often, but unlike my iPad, I can read in the SUN with this beauty.",Better for reading than iPads;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first Kindle.  I deliberately waited before writing a review.  I'm not sure that this model is still available, but the model type / features are similar throughout the product line.  I thought I might dislike the transition away from paper books, but it's been very smooth.  I will always have a reverence for ""real"" books, but you simply can't beat the convenience of being able to bring books into your home without having to leave home.",New tricks for an old dog...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"It took me forever to order this because I was overwhelmed by all the choices of Kindles to choose from. I have a 4th generation basic Kindle for years and love it! When I saw the new one on sale, I decided to upgrade, but couldn't decide which one fit my needs the best (Paperwhite, basic, Hire). I really wanted a Kindle Keyboard, but the don't sell them anymore. I only wanted that one because of the audio reading feature, which I could use while folding laundry or taking a bath, etc. The Fire was out because I only want to read on my Kindle. I read in bed every night so the Paperwhite was tempting due to the built in lights. However, the sale price of the basic Kindle was too good to pass up! For what I would have paid for the Paperwhite, I got a new touchscreen Kindle, pretty leather case, and a clip-on Kindle light. I am happy as a pig in mud! The best feature is that the Kindle automatically turns off when I close the case, and on when I open it! Saves battery life. Also, it saves the words you look up to a special Vocabulary Builder on your Kindle so you can review them and learn the words you didn't previously know. I passed my old Kindle on to my daughter, who loves it! I'm extremely happy with this one! Also, I joined Kindle Unlimited and can get up to 10 books at a time, with no due date!! They have a great selection, so for under $10/month it's a great deal!",Love my Kindle!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"So far so good. It is as described. No back light, but the screen looks like a real book which is amazing for technology. I've never had a kindle before, but so far I'm loving it. But one suggestion: before buying this, read the page so you won't be like others complaining about what it is 'missing' when it says it doesn't have it.",So far so good. It is as described;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Page turns slowly... compared to other ebook devices and my ipad.. it really interferes with the flow of reading and can be very annoying. The device is very slow on processing, and it took a very long time for the covers of my downloaded books to show up on the screen. I'm thinking about returning the device or selling it to someone who wants it. It's just too dang slow.",Slowww;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love being able to read a whole library on a small device that doesn't use a backlight. I travel a lot, so this is much more convenient for me. I actually prefer reading on a Kindle rather than an actual book (unless I want to annotate the book) because I don't have to hold the Kindle open like I have to hold the pages of a book open. I can just prop the device up against something while I'm reading and poke it when I want to turn the page. I do have to say that the ""glare-free"" description isn't accurate;" I would say """"glare-resistant"""" is a better description.""
Review: Library on a small device";;;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"I liked the older model better. If you pick up this kindle, or touch a word by mistake it changes pages, or activates other features. I like to sometimes Mark my place for a moment with my finger, or follow the print with my finger. This will not work with this model. I understand progress, but to eliminate the older non touch screen completely was a mistake on the part of Kindle",don't love the touch screen.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I have now had three Kindles. The first one, unfortunately, had problems before I used it. Amazon replaced it immediately and I grew quite fond of it. I was very comfortable with software system. But,alas, the second one died totally unexpected. It wasn't a dead battery. It just simply would not turn on and it,s light was dead. So I ordered a new one. The operating software has been upgraded and I,m not all that pleased with the OS. It used to be that I could call on the dictionaries at any time and look up a word from any other book. The new, third, Kindle does not allow me to do that. Other than that all else is okay. It is some what lighter than the metal cased ones and sometimes the screen freezes up on it and it takes several swipes to get it to respond to a simple page turn. So the OS system is why I gave it a four star rating.",I was very comfortable with software system;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a lightweight Kindle that is really lightweight, I have purchased Kindles and love the screen because I can read outside without glare which I didn't find in the Fire.  This is fantastic for people who love to read on the go and can read anywhere.  I carry it in my bag with me everywhere!!",I have purchased Kindles and love the screen because I can read outside without glare ...;;;;;;

Review: I thought my first Kindle was broke so I purchased another one and after I received it my first one started working again so I go back and forth between them.  I love using my Kindles. I don't think I will ever go back to real books.  If you love to read like I do you can't go wrong with a Kindle e-reader.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"The Kindle is great for avid readers who also advocate reduction of material-use (and ultimately forest conservation). One can have numerous books in a single e-book tablet. Not only does it save physical storage space, the Kindle also does a great job in providing a visual interface which is similar to reading a hard-copy book.",A great and affordable product for avid readers;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"When I first received this new Reader I was so pleased with it until I started to actually use it daily. My God, what did Kindle do to this reader? This is my third Kindle reader and I have to say the WORSE. I am so dizzy going back and forth every time I open it to read to change the font size every two minutes. Also, DO NOT EVEN THINK OF SNEEZING when you are reading. It will turn about five pages with the wind. Another complaint I have is finding previous books I purchased. My last Kindle was so very easy to navigate. This one is a horror. So I am sending my second review for this Kindle to inform everyone who is thinking of purchasing this Reader, beware and pay attention to all the negative reviews, they are right on the money.",Horrible! What Were You Thinking Kindle??;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Works perfectly, great size (like reading a pocket paperback except thinner), absolutely no need for backlighting as the screen is perfect. The only slightly negative is the slick finish and that's probably not a problem for anyone that doesn't have very dry skin. I'm solving that with a cheap cover that will also protect the screen while traveling. Tons of free books on Amazon that let me get started before making more expensive purchases.  Thanks!!",Glare-free Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my Kindle, I can enjoy all the books i want in one place without having to lug around many different heavy books, while I do prefer hard back books the convenience of the Kindle works with my on the go life :D",I LOVE MY KINDLE!!!!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This kindle is great for the price point. It truly feels like you are reading a real book. The font and look of the screens feels like a paperback. The type has a nice contrast with the background. I would highly recommend this for long time physical book readers because it is an easy transition. This does not have the bright glare of phones and tablets. You will love the ease of carrying around thousands of books in your pocket without ever accidently losing your place. I am an avid reader and for many years I resisted mightly against going over to the dark side of ebooks. But I got a special offer for this and I decided to buy it and give kindle another try. I had bought a kindle about 2 years back and it felt cheap and like an old piece of tech. This kindle is much diiferent, it really has the look and feel of a real book. I joined kindle unlimited and now I read a book a day. I can read at my lunch break and relacing in bed. I love this kindle! The only con is no built in night light.",Awesome entry level Kindle;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Wanted a kindle I could read in the sun, and one which would have a MUCH longer battery life than my 2 Fires. This fits the bill. It's not so easy to use however. Quite cumbersome to pull books newly purchased on Fire from cloud to non-glare Kindle. Then once downloaded on non-glare Kindle, the book vanishes into the vast library of books read in past and one has to painstakingly search through the books to find new book, usually around 200th in the queue. It's light and portable and once the nook is up I enjoy the reading experience.",Serves the Purpose: Not User Friendly;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've had my Kindle for a few days now, since the release date, so 5 days total, and so far I absolutely love it. I was skeptical of the touchscreen, but I find that I actually like it much more than the previous Kindle. It has a ""swipe-to-open"" feature to unlock the device, in addition to the button on the bottom of the device.It's not bad, but I feel it's a bit redundant when there's a button to unlock the device as well. It also has parental controls which is a nice touch for those who have kids that like to go purchasing things with 1-click. The set-up is just like the previous generation Kindle Paperwhite, which is very clean and well organized in my personal opinion.The casing feels a bit cheap, it doesn't have the smooth back like the previous generation Kindle did, which I was a fan of. Other than the casing I love the device and would recommend it to anyone looking into an e-reader. I would suggest a clip-on light to go along with it if you're one who likes to read in bed, but don't want to spend the extra money for a built-in light.",Much improved;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought two of these, sight unseen, for my wife and me because I happened to catch a great sale. I think it was a good move. The Basic Kindle seems to be all we would ever need.Less than a year ago I downloaded a free Kindle Cloud Reader to my Chromebook and really enjoyed using it, but there are times when reading on a relatively heavy laptop is inconvenient, and can also be distracting since I usually have one eye on my email. I was also trying to share a (limited time frame) free library e-book with my wife, so I got thinking that maybe having a Kindle might be more convenient, more portable...Long story shorter, at the sale price I decided to buy two, one for each of us. They arrived yesterday, with still a week left on that library book. We have only had them for 24 hours and are already nuts about 'em. Easy to use, light weight, uber-portable, individually customizable... I have already established that we can be simultaneously reading the same book on two different Kindles on two different pages with different fonts and font sizes, no problem. The touch screen is very convenient and fairly intuitive, and in any case the full instruction manual is right on board and can be referred to at any time. I have an idea that the spendier Paperwhite is cooler, but the lack of a backlight and a faintly gray screen isn't bothering us in the least, and real books don't have backlights. On the other hand, real books don't have WiFi, but Kindles do. I am writing this review before I have even scratched the surface of what the Basic Kindle can do. I am really impressed! I may one day decide I have to upgrade, but at the moment I can't conceive of a reason.",Basic Kindle is a Terrific Value!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've had this a few weeks now.  Only had charge it once so far, the batteryLasts. The kindle unlimited is just fantastic (free for the first 30 days and I'm hooked now) So many selections!  My nook had kicked the bucket after about 5 years or so, and I'm so glad I switched to kindle. I do so much on Amazon and the points add up on the credit card which can helped pay for this kindle device. My son can use it and read anytime he wants although he's not really a big reader, there are enough selections of books on minecraft that he's actually reading without me having to pester him to do so.  the device itself handles well, I like the cover that was in the bundle, and it's fairly easy to maneuver in. It's much faster thank my nook was as well, which kept dropping the wireless but this kindle does not have that issue.",Good change from nook.;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"The touch screen has problems.  Some of the features do not work, or only work part of the time.  As in, not often.  Mine won't go back into Airplane Mode at all.  Which would save the battery running down so  quickly.  ""Turning the pages"" forward or backward too often jumps many pages ahead, or drops back many pages, making continuous reading a chore.  You end up spending as much time hunting for where you actually left off as you do reading on a lot of occasions.  [When the earlier Kindle took you right back to where you left off, every time.]  I'm told this is a ""known problem"" by a friend who is technically knowledgeable.  Certainly maddening.  All in all, this version of the Kindle works far more poorly than my earlier Kindle.  I think Amazon tried to do too much with it, essentially got carried away with hoping readers would be able to have a ""magic touch"" that is needed for its various but erratic features.  Next time I'm considering buying a tablet and downloading the app in the hope it might work better.",Touchscreen Schizophrenia;;;;;;

Review: I bought this because my other kindle died. I loved the original kindle. It was the one with the keyboard at the bottom. This one does not fit as well in the hand and is awkward to hold for me. Causing some wrist pain I would have bought one of the old ones but a refurbished was 3 time more expensive.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I like it much better than my first generation kindle. The size is perfect. Not too big, not too small. I like the touch screen. It's light weight and the flash when the page changes is much shorter than the first gen.",Love my Kindle!;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,These Kindles are garbage. This is the second one I've owned and has died and is now worthless. The warranty is only one year for a reason--it will die literally right after the one year mark. Shame on you Amazon for making such garbage.,"pIece of garbage, not built to last.";;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"The Kindle works okay, but perhaps its glare-free feature also works against it, as I found the display to be very dark. In a low-light setting the screen was difficult to read.The unit has much lower resolution, which makes the reading a bit rough.The next model up has back-light and higher resolution, and both features are compelling enough to move up the Kindle ladder.Separately, the unit is very compact and can easily be carried almost anywhere. It is completely plastic, and so not sure how durable it will be.It is simple to use, and setup was a breeze.As others have commented, the ads are a non-issue;" they form the screen-saver when the unit is technically off. When you logon
Review: they go away completely.All in all
Title;;;;;;: a nice little reader for basic use.""
column4: the unit is very compact and can easily be carried almost anywhere";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"We now own four of these at my house- two for the older kids and one each for my wife and I (replacing our beloved 2nd gen models.) While part of me misses my keyboard and physical buttons, I have to admit that I love the compact design, the screen clarity and resolution, and the overall experience with this newer Kindle.I also love the fact that we can control our kids' Kindles easily and share books with one-another through Kindle Family Library.I know some like reading on phones or tablets and others are going back to paper books, but in our house, the e-book rules and the Kindle is standard equipment.",Reading for the 21st Century;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I won this Kindle in a contest, already owning a KindleFireHD.  Although I love the one that I had bought for use in a variety of different applications, my won Kindle in just incredible for reading.  True, it's not backlit, but it is so much easier to read with.",Although I love the one that I had bought for use in ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"It is my very first ever step into the electronic book world. A dear friend purchased this and gave it to me as a gift, most unexpected. I probably would not have bought this for myself. I like the feel of a book in my hand, the smell of the paper and ink. I like to see them laying on the table, on the shelf. But, my life is changing drastically in so many ways that the Kindle seems to be part of that change. I find it delightful to be able to read books instantly. I see it, I download it, I read it. Or I keep it for another day. The prices for these downloads are frightening because they are so easy to download so I search the bargain book bins, watch for prime specials and will see if my local library provides ebook downloads for free.... And with a chance to travel, I can take the Kindle with me more easily than books....This product has made my transition to the electronic world of books most enjoyable. It is easy to use, although having a sheet of instructions would have been nice. The touch screen is great except I tend to eat when reading.... Greasy fingerprints. The ability to change font size, etc. The ability to see what I have stored on my Kindle is helpful, and storage on the Cloud sounds inviting. And the Kindle is easy to hold, easy to use. Even my cat has learned to turn pages. I tend to want to touch the pages of a book and run my finger along a line of print. With the touch screen such actions turn the page! But this first Kindle experience is turning me into an e-book believer. And the Kindle gift itself has so touched my life with its generosity and caring thoughts.",Kindle Opens Worlds of Books;;;;;;

Review: I can't believe how affordable the Kindle has gotten. Get this one with the special offers (ads) for the best deal! Works perfectly - I'm not really sure why anyone would bother buying the more expensive ones.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"At first, I really hated this reader. I was so used to my IPad and it just drove me crazy when I tried to search for/download books on it, or even when I used it to read. Everything is a bit clumsy and cheap feeling.But, now, I like it a lot and see some real benefits. For one, if you are just reading, it's very, very light (unlike my ipad) and easy to carry anywhere, without a cover or any protection. You can even slip it in a large coat pocket. The best things are that you can read it like a book, outside in the sun and in bed (without the backlight stimulating your brain before sleep). You can't even see my Ipads outside unless you are reading at night. Also, you just don't have to worry about it. If I take my Ipad or my new ipad mini on a flight, to read at the beach, or waiting for an appointment, I worry a bit-theft, damage, sand. With this, you don't have to. The plastic makes it somewhat bulletproof. If it's lost or stolen, it's a drag, but not a big issue given the price and the fact that there is nothing on it but books.I also use it to read free Overdrive books from various libraries (if you don't know about this service, check it out immediately!). You can download books from your computer or ipad if you don't want to download it on this device (it works, but the browsing for books isn't ideal).For me, I love having both types of readers and this one has proven to be ideal for many situations.Hope this helps you digital readers out there!","Disliked it at first. But, it's very light, no backlight for bed, great for beach, travel, less worry than Ipad/expensive reader";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"A gift for my daughter, who had been taking my wife's Kindle.  She really loves it, and it works well.  We all prefer the display of the Kindle for reading, as compared to tablet, phone or computer screens.  Now I just have to keep her in the reading material she wants.",Excellent e-reader.;;;;;;

Review: I had previously purchased one for myself and liked it so much that I bought one for my 93 year old (young) mother who is an avid reader. She thinks it is just fantastic and is learning all of it's ins and outs.
Title;;;;;;: I had previously purchased one for myself and liked it so much that I bought one for my ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"My daughter loves this kindle.  She loves the touchscreen and how when you turn it off and turn it back on it remembers where you were on your book.  I like how it has parental controls so I can block the browser and wifi on it.  I would not have purchased it if I wasn't able to block these things. The only thing I would change is one thing.  She forgot her password and could not open the kindle.  So, I researched online how to open it and quickly found a code that would reset it.  This worked (although it reset it back to factory settings) and she was able to use it again.  But now the parental controls are off of it.  If the child knows the wifi password they can get on the browser easily.  So,  I feel that amazon should somehow change that part where anyone can look up the code online to open the kindle if  it is locked.  Maybe they could make the parent contact them through their email and they send us a password that way.  This part would only bother you if you are a parent who likes to monitor internet usage like me.  Other than that  (which may not bother some people) ... I love the kindle!  It is great!!!!  I would recommend it to others!",Very happy with the kindle!!;;;;;;

Review: now i can keep all my books in one place uses the same charger as most things now days and to top it off i barely ever have to charge it i recommend this over the tablets since the liquid ink display doesnt hurt my eyes
Title;;;;;;: ... off i barely ever have to charge it i recommend this over the tablets since the liquid ink display ...;;;;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this for my wife, and she doesn't have the vision problems that I have, and even she has a hard time reading the screen on this Kindle, as it is way too dim. I can barely read it at all. I have found there is no way to increase the brightness ( I have been told by Amazon that there is no way to do so ). My wife said she'd just put up with the problem, as it was a gift from me.This Kindle Reader is not disabled friendly, or accessible to those that have any sort of vision problems, or problems with their hands. I am disappointed. I would not buy this for myself. I was told by Amazon that I can just spend more, to get a better reader, or tablet.",Screen is too dim;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've always wanted to read ""The Count of Monte Cristo"".  Paperback is about 4 or 5 inches thick.  Downloaded it on my new Kindle and it's very easy to read.  This is new to me but finding it very convenient and glad I finally bought one.  Will especially be nice to have when I take vacation and use in airports and on flights.",Downloaded it on my new Kindle and it's very easy to read;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I hate this more than any other of my Kindles, and I have had many, many Kindles.This one is so buggy that it makes me incredibly frustrated. For example, it is constantly transforming the font size because of accidentally activating font-size-change. (Why? Who changes font size? Maniacs?).The forward backward is a ruthles, angry tap, not a simple click...It is thick and heavier than any previous edition.It cut my husband's head open when he somehow managed to bump it.The functionality is so beta-mode that I am sad, sad, sad that my nice little kindle committed suicide the other week.",Want to pay to be beta-tester? No? Nor did I...sigh..;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Still very happy with my Kindle tablet since July 2015. It also fits nicely in my purse for on-the-go. I use it mainly to read my Kindle collection of ebooks from the Kindle App, so that I won't have to drain the battery on my cell phone. The only drawback is that the battery DRAINS completely within hours of reading, so I find myself having to charge it EVERY DAY. Other than that, I love this tablet. I did not purchase insurance on this tablet, and have not had any problems. I have used several different tablets in the past, and I have to say that this is my favorite tablet of all. I even like this tablet much better than my husband's Samsung Galaxy 4 tab.",Still very happy with my Kindle tablet since last year;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"This Kindle is easy to use and I enjoy reading books on it. It is light and compact and downloads books fast. However, the material it is made of is far inferior to previous versions. After 3 months of use, it has scratches on it all over the casing. It was not thrown around, it has been inside a laptop bag in a padded pocket for the duration. My wife has an older generation Kindle and that one has been around for years and there is barely a scratch visible, with no cover on it for entire time. The quality of material has definitely decreases significantly","Still great reading device, Material its made of degraded";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"very smooth. it has a small left over of fading of letters when the E-paper refreshes. The touch screen is not as accurate and quick as my smart phone( it's slower). you can go online for a few things, the off screen is my most favorite. and passed my little drop test. nothing sounds loose when I shake it. It's well made. when I read;" I read 4 times a week
Review: i usually don't read more than an hour..so the battery should last long for me.""
Title;;;;;;: The touch screen is not as accurate and quick as my smart phone( it's slower)";;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought one of these for myself and one as a gift for my sister. I love it and so does she. You should realize before you but this that it is just for reading books. The display looks exactly like paper. Unlike earlier e-ink displays this reacts fast and it's touchscreen is really functional. The only con is that in lower light settings, the contrast isn't the best. If you love to read books like me, you can't go wrong with this.",Great for books;;;;;;

Review: This kindle is so easy to use.  Really light in weight.  I love you can use it outside in the bright sun.  A tablet you can't see the words but on this kindle you can.  Just like a book.  This would make a perfect christmas gift.
Title;;;;;;: This kindle is so easy to use;;;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"DON'T BUY THIS KINDLE!!!Do you have a lot of time to re-boot this device over and over again - if you put the book (kindle) down for a few minutes?Do you want to increase/decrease screen brightness? Sorry,,,it doesn't do it...only read in well lit spaces..Would you like to change the go-to-sleep time? If you go attend food on the stove while reading - you've got maybe 2 or 3 minutes - until you have to re-boot this Kindle.Here's the big problem with this (must be 1st version kindle); none or the device performance features that you would expect with a typical 'smartphone' are available.First major inconvenience - situation:Say you've got to put the book (this Kindle) down for a few minutes to check my clothes dryer....food in the oven
column4: etc
column7: When you get back
column8: the kindle has 'timed out' - and it must be restarted. (Booted up again).  THERE IS NO KINDLE SETTING FOR THIS IDLE TIME TO REBOOT PERIOD.....Because of a little 'idle time' the kindle must be re-booted -is time consuming:  This consists of Holding down the power button and waiting for 10 to 12 seconds - and then waiting for the 'boot' screen'.  from there you get a boot time odometer then runs for about 15 to 30 seconds....Conclusion;" So
column9: just this complete reboot - until you can read again -  is for  2 to 3 minutesScreen Brightness:- there are no controls what-so-ever
column10: you can choose is text style and size
column11: that it...end...no brightness
column12: paper color
column13: nothing...You cannot read this in a darkened room
column14: a paperback although heavier - is still a little more convenient (easy to see) that this Kindle.This Kindle has good 'synchronization' with an Amazon account
column15: wi-fi connection settings
column16: and other social media liking features....but compared to even a cheap cell phone - nothing
column17: zero...I would not purchase have purchased this Kindle knowing these deficiencies - I would have spent an additional $40 just for the basic features (like available on all current cell-phones) in order to prevent having to spend time
column19: and time again - re-booting this kindle between small breaks.I can read fine with it.  It loads my e-books perfectly. I can link to my amazon account(s)...it's just that most settings you would expect for such a device are just MISSING?  Common Device Settings!  As a reading device
column21: as a replacement for a paperback book - it sucks...Regards
column23: A FEATURE FREE KINDLE TO AVOID";;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love this little sucker!!  So light and has a ton of memory.  If you want a BACKLIT reader then DO NOT get this one.  However, if you are comfortable with reading text like a normal book, then treat yourself.  I am addicted to reading!  This little Kindle is perfect.  Super tiny and very light.  I love it!",I LOVE THIS LITTLE KINDLE!!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I liked my old, broken one better, but this is almost as good. My only drawback is that when I divide my books up into categories, they are still all out there instead of neatly tucked away until I open the proper category. I mean, with 130 books and counting, that's a lot of books to flick through.",Almost as good as my old one;;;;;;

Review: I got this for Christmas. I believe I have read 9 books since then.  I love everything about it.  I can enlarge the print and read it while on the treadmill.  It's easy to operate and I had no problem figuring out how to use it.  I highly recommend it and my daughter now wants one for her birthday.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my sixth kindle, actually it is for my daughter.  I can see it is improved in many ways than even the first generation of paper white.  The touch screen is smooth and sensitive. I like it and hope my daughter will read a lot on it.",I like it and hope my daughter will read a lot ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I had this in my cart for forever before I finally decided to buy it. I always used my iPad for reading, but because of the glare I couldn't take it outside.This is lightweight and easy to read. I gave it a 4 star because it would be nuce to adjust contrast on the screen, but this is a entry level user and it doesn't have that feature or a backlight and in hindsight I should of bought one with the backlight.In a low lite room I find it hard to read.But it's super simple to use and read - I'm glad I finally coughed up the cash for it!If you can afford a little more, def go for the backlight as it makes a difference. Otherwise if your thrifty/ cheap like me this works just fine.",Great purchase!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchased this on Amazon Prime Day and it arrived so quickly! I finished one book within a day of receiving it. I love this thing so much it has revamped my interest in reading. I was so annoyed with books and having to apply so much pressure to each page to get the book flat. With this kindle, I don't have to worry about that! I can read perfectly fine without my glasses too. I just love this thing it has made reading enjoyable again! It is packed full of features like the most common highlights within a book, the built in dictionary and even the web browser! You can't go wrong with this kindle it an awesome buy and the offers keep book searching interesting!",Why did I wait so long?!?;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I really like my kindle - it's easy to read, small enough to fit in my purse - and no glare.  BUT, though I keep buying Kindle books - I really, really prefer paper books. It's just not the same with a Kindle - it's hard to explain why. It is an amazing little device.  I really want to like it better - and it's not the hard plastic device's fault that I prefer paper!  It's definitely more sensible than a book- it takes up much less space than all the books it carries in its memory, and ebooks  are less expensive, are instantly available, and don't kill trees - but, still - it's just not the same. If you do decide to try an e-reader - I recommend it.  The distractions you have with an I-pad disappear, that's why I got the kindle, it's also very affordable.  For what it is, it's great - but still not a book!",Great little device - but not the same as reading a traditional paper book. . .;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have always loved the feel of a real paper book, and I am not usually a high tech advocate.  But after using the Kindle Paperwhite for a month, I'm hooked.Make sure to get the Paperwhite model!  It is lightweight and easy to hold with one hand.  The device battery lasts forever between charges.  With easy viewability in bed, and no need to turn on bedside lamp, I  just lay it down when I'm sleepy and the screen automatically shuts off.  (I recommend separate purchase of a screen protector as a fairly inexpensive way to preserve your investment).I'm retired and on a limited budget.  There are so many free books to download from the Public Library and no need to even travel there, because downloading a library book to the Kindle is an easy online process.  I will have saved enough money by not buying from used bookstores to pay off the Kindle Paperwhite in 6 months!",Kindle Paperwhite is a great invention.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my Wi-Fi Kindle.  The ads show when I first open my Kindle, but after that I never see them.  Talk about hassle-free and unobtrusive.  In fact, let me tell you how convenient this device is.I lived overseas in a non-English speaking country.  A few bookstores had full-priced books in Eng.  Our group of ESL teachers would pass our books along to one another or wait all year for the used book fair.  Then I bought my Kindle during a trip back to the US.  I learned I could log into my local library back in the US via my laptop or my smartphone.  I would then check out an e-book.  I turned on my Kindle and activated the Wi-Fi. In 15 seconds my new library book was downloaded.  I easily saved the $79 cost of my Kindle while downloading library books while 7,500 miles from home.  Try reading one of these Kindles on a sunny day:  NO glare.  I love it!","I was drug kicking and screaming into the 21st Century, and now I wonder why I took so long.";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Can't really give much of a review, I had this for only two days.  My brother bought this for me as a gift, but since he was visiting I let my girlfriend borrow it.  Next day her parents found out we were dating and they hate me so they took it and I've never seen it since!  But since amazon keeps bugging me with emails, here it goes.Battery: Good?  Never had to charge it, only read for about 45 minutes on it.Display: Excellent! I tried reading it outside as well as in bed.  Screen allows for readability anywhere as long as you have a light.Function: I wanted this to have a portable way to read books, instead of dragging my laptop everywhere. I believe this would have performed admirably.  I also don't like bookstores, since I am a giant nerd, they often are lacking in the nerdy books I like to read to make room for 1,000 copies of fifty shades of grey. I think online bookstores are the way to go.Bonus: Did not expect this to come with its own web browser.  It has limited capabilities but I think that might have been a handy feature when sitting on the couch watching TV and the need to google something arises.",Don't let your GF borrow it.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Lots of people have already posted their reviews about this device. I got it for $49 on Prime Day. For that price, it certainly is worth it. I got it mainly to take to places where I know I'm going to have to sit around and be bored, like at the DMV or doctor's office.I like to read in bed, and have been using my iPad. I'd rather use this Kindle, but because it isn't backlit, I would have to leave my light on, which I'd rather not do. So I can only use this new Kindle in daylight.As far as the ads are concerned, they only show up when the device is turned off, so it's really no big deal and certainly worth a $20 discount.The battery life is great. I've had it on about an hour each day, and still haven't needed to charge it.The clarity of the screen is excellent. I have lowered the size of the typeface to practically its minimum, and maximized the number of lines per page to nearly maximum, and the screen looks essentially like a paperback book. It's very easy to read.And I really like being able to highlight a word and get a definition almost immediately. The ""lookup"" functionality of the Kindle device is far better than what I get when I use the Kindle app on my iPad.One other advantage of the Kindle device over the app is that I can now ""borrow"" books directly from Amazon. I already have read one borrowed book and the process was seamless.I would have given it five stars if only it had come with a backlight, was a bit thinner, and still was priced so low....",Good for the price;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"So far this has been what I expected.  The ads don't bother me.  I like getting classic books from Project Gutenberg.  It's not as fancy as an IPAD, and I have an IPAD.  But I prefer to read books on a Kindle so I don't clutter up the cloud.",I like getting classic books from Project Gutenberg;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Great. When my older Kindle didn't work, despite rebooting, I didn't want to do without it for even one day. It's amazing how attached I've become to my e-reader. I went from a keyboard model (no longer available new) to the new touchscreen display. Love the swipe features. East-to-read instructions for adding notes, highlighting text. Faster Internet connection. The only drawback was my Solitaire and Spades games from my earlier Kindle edition did not travel to this newest Kindle. Besides reading ebooks, these games were my go-to feature to play in my downtime at night while watching a favorite movie. I did buy Tetris to play on this new Kindle, but I haven't yet tried it out. Also I had over one thousand ebooks to transfer over, and I found it faster to charge the new Kindle first and upload ebooks from the cloud on the device itself, rather than selecting twenty-at-a-time from the Amazon.com website under Manage Your Content and Devices.",Great. Love the swipe features.;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I was very unhappy with this Kindle from the moment I got it charged up.  There was not enough contrast to be able to read the titles of books.  Even the special offers looked very dim. I contacted customer support and asked repeatedly if this was a defect for this particular Kindle, but the lady I spoke with said they are all that way.  My old Kindle is much easier to read than this new technology and that doesn't make any sense to me.  To add insult to injury, she said I wouldn't have to pay to send it back but I still got charged for the return shipping.",Not enough contrast;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"It's a lovely e-reader BUT I should have read more carefully, I'm not at all sure that I would have taken the discounted price if I'd known that the screen saver would be ad after ad. Best or worse of all the advertising so far is for products that I'd never even consider buying.","""With special offers"" means With Advertising";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"After reading reviews for this product I decided it was the best for me. I just needed a way to read my books on the go and didn't need any of the fancy features the newer kindles have. The lack of a backlight hasn't been an issue and neither has the power button being on the bottom-in fact I like it better this way. I also decided not to buy the power adapter because it came with a power cord that plugs into either my laptop or iPhone charger adapter using the USB port. I would highly recommend this product for anyone looking for new, lower priced books at your fingertips",Great product;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought for my daughter ar Christmas and she loves it - reads all the time! (Mostly Stephen King, but what can you say?). Also bought a cover and E-reader and the set goes well nicely. Great Kindle for the money. Touchscreen. Won`t be long before her son takes over.",Great Kindle;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"If you just want a light e-reader that you can carry around to read novels,this Kindle is perfect.  The only reason that I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is that I wasn't aware that there is no audio on this version when I purchased it. My previous black and white kindle which was not touch screen had audio and I loved it right up until it died.  With no sound I can't do audio books and no text to speech on this version. I don't need all the full tablet features of the Kindle Fire but no audio is a definitely drawback.",Choose Fire Instead if you want to Listen;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"a nice little treat for daytime readers, as it does not have a built in light, but hey you can get a clip on light and then its go time. There are also a number of decent free e books available which is nice too. It also has some nice features, like font choice, vocabulary builder, and dictionary for words you can look up as you are reading. A good deal for the money.",love my kindle.;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"This product is junk.  I owned a kindle for years and then I dropped in on a stone table and it quit working, rightly so.  I bought this as a replacement and handled it with kid gloves and without cause it quit in less than 6 months.  What a lemon!",Piece off junk in less than 6 months!;;;;;;
