5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this kindle for my mom.  She's not speak English, which worry me the most, by trying to explain her will  it work with settings. The new edition came with  support at any language , touch screen, so easy to use it . It's please me so much.My mom will love it!!! I recommend to have it!!Must have it!!",so easy to use it;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I wasn't sure if I should purchase a fancy color model or just stick with this plain little e-reader. After doing some research, I decided on this one because it isn't backlit and so it is supposed to be easier on the eyes. I work on a computer all day and wanted something that wouldn't further strain my eyes. This is a great little reader! It's small, light weight and convenient to carry in my purse and it's never given me any reading discomfort. It's easy to use and the battery life is great. I only charge it once every couple of weeks.",A great little e-reader.;;;;;;

Review: I'm never without my Kindle Paperwhite. I just wish that the cellphone companies would have the same technology as this product so that I could see my cellphone screen in the sunlight just like I can see my Kindle in the sunlight.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"First touch screen basic reader that have gotten.. Their is a learning curve but not as ""touchy"" as the Kindle Fire.  Takes a little time to learn where to touch screen to go where you want it..  Very good for someone who has't had a touch screen readers to learn on and wants one..  Very satisfied with it and would recommend this to others looking just f wanting to read books..  Speed better than earlier one with ""buttons""  which I have.  Each generation brings changes which for most part are a plus.  Course if you have to have buttons this one will not  work for you.",Touch scree basic reader.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've bought and am reading my first book and so far I really have no complaints. Purchasing an e-reader has been on my ""wish list"" for quite sometime and when Amazon posted a special offer in my e-mail I just couldn't pass it up! I suppose the only negative would be there's no back light;" but that's ok... I am still enjoying my Kindle
Review: 6"""" Glare-Free Touchscreen. Thank you.""
Title;;;;;;: First e-reader I've had and I LOVE IT!!!";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought it.  I love it.  E-ink is fascinating.  I can't wait to see where else this technology takes us.  I've used this for a school textbook and many novels.  Even though I bought a refurbished model, anyone would have thought it was new.  It arrived packaged nicely and looks pristine.  Be sure to get a sturdy cover for it.  My spouse broke his because he didn't use a cover and had to replace it.  I don't feel the need for the paperwhite.  I just want to read it the way I read a paper book, under normal lighting conditions.  If you think you can't afford to buy all new books from Amazon, remember that you can borrow e-books from the library, many classic novels are only a dollar or two, and older or obscure titles are also very affordable.",I love this thing.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I originally purchased a cheap samsung tablet to do some reading with the kindle app, but the backlight would hurt my eyes and I couldn't read for very long without getting the text lines burned into my retinas. Staring too long at those backlit devices really drove me nuts.I decided to buy this Kindle when it was on sale, and I'm loving it. Now, the terrible retina burning doesn't happen! It's just like reading paper! I've had my kindle for a couple of months now and I use it all the time. It's exactly what I was looking for. Even though it's nothing too fancy, I just wanted to be able to read cheap books with one electronic device. And this is it. The special offers aren't intrusive at all. I notice them just enough to wonder if the book they advertise is what I want to read (and sometimes they are!) Everything works great on it and the battery life is unbelievable. This was a fantastic purchase, I love my kindle. I do recommend getting a cover for it, I'd hate something sharp to puncture the screen. I bought an off brand that works great for this.","Doesn't Hurt the Eyes, Exactly What I Needed";;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I don't know what to write on the review.  I mean, I've never owned a Kindle book before and have never seen one before.  It is definitely glare free.  It is pretty small but not too small.  I am getting used to this.  I do not have anything bad to say about it.  It is definitely differently than the kindle on my pc.  I don't know what to say.  The pages turn okay, it is the referencing that I am trying to get used to.  No directions came with the kindle.  And I do know I can not switch books unless I turn it off and reset it (resetting doesn't erase anything it just takes you back to the books.  It is a good thing so far. )  I have nothing negative to say about this kindle  book.  It is better than the nook, just from looking at it and handling it.  The nook is more like a tablet and I don't like that.  The kindle book is different.  Nice different. I just wish they came in different colors.  I really do not like the black at all.  But, I am still not complaining.  I got it on sale. If you are wanting to buy one you just have to make sure this is what you want.  The no glare is nice.  I need to buy a case for it.  or make one myself. (which shouldn't be too hard).  I think the average book reader will like it very much.  You should get one. Just don't allow yourself to get frustrated over it if you have never owned one.  It will take time.  But it is a good thing to have for novels.  NOT for school books though.",It's a nice little thing to have.  The no glare is a bonus.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"My sight is forced 10 hours a day in front of a computer, now I can read with this eink reader and it is pretty awesome, it is as faster as I need, has a dictionary includes I can use with my book and find in Wikipedia, that is all I need. I can surf in the web with the experimental browser and the battery, omg, I love don't think in battery for an entire month.",pretty awesome;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I was happy to get it while it was an Amazon deal. It is a very basic model only for reading. That is all I need it to do.I own several Kindles and switching from one to another I have to remember how each functions a little bit differently from the other.I was devastated when my original kindle died on. I look back and know I overloaded it and used it more than is was designed for.I really wished it could have been repaired.The only way this one could be better is if it could have a light, but for the price I can work around that.Be sure to turn off WIFI when not needed to increase reading time before needing a recharge.I bought this as a backup to read on when my other one is recharging and I have a third one that I allow others to borrow or read on.I do still read physical books but this is much more convenient and private to carry around.",Very basic model only for reading;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I really like this kindle. I'm very pleased that Amazon is still offering a kindle without a built in light. Reads very much like a book. The touch screen took no time at all to get used to. I traded in my old kindle keyboard for this one and am very happy. Loss of the page turning buttons is no big deal, and it gives me more area on the sides to hold the device. I like tapping the screen for page turns. I miss my old kindle keyboard word jumble game, but since this is purely for reading that's no big deal either as I have plenty of other devices to play games on.",Really like it;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I read a lot of and mostly ant night before I go to sleep,  The Kindle lets me keep all my reading material in one place and I can download the books I like to read. I don`t have to go to a book store. This is great",The Kindle lets me keep all my reading material in one place and I can download the books I like to read;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Avid reader who always has a book to read.  When I'm on vacation I take several books to read but lugging those around while traveling adds weight and bulk.  So, I decided to give this a try.  Choose the Kindle with no frills, downloaded two books.  I like the dictionary, the highlight feature and can be taken anywhere.  Still love physical books but this is a good alternative.",I like the dictionary;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this for my daughter... I now use it for myself! I have a few kids books on it, but she likes the color pictures. Im always amazed at the selection of books available, wish they weren't so expensive though. Some books its actually been more expensive as an ebook!",Im always amazed at the selection of books available;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is the new way of reading. No glare, no eye strain, no lights, no keeping you up at night. If you are looking for a way to keep all your future digital books in one location- this is the way to go!",So much awesome in one device!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Just received this, and tried it out. I immediately saw the improvement over the last version, which I have now retired (I bought the last three low-rent versions, and the last one still had the side buttons). I LOVE the touchscreen. I like seeing the book cover when I select a book. Yay.One thing I would like, and which Kindle doesn't appear to do yet, is to touch a book in my library and see its description, and what I paid for it. I don't recall half the time why I downloaded a book - I download a bunch of them - and whether I purchased it or downloaded it for free. It would be nice to prioritize something I paid for (clearly I felt the purchase was urgent, right?), or even type a note on why I thought it might be interesting. Sometimes context matters, when I finish one book and select the next one.If this Kindle does all that, and I just haven't figured it out, please comment and let me know. Thanks!",Great! And now for the next version!;;;;;;

Review: I hate this one.  I paid extra  for NO special offers.  I'm getting all the ads  I called  the telephone number to have this removed.  He went into my computer (I gave him the info)  to remove the ads.  then he wanted to sell me a safety program for my computer and the Kindle  I wanted to discuss this with my Grandson.  He said the ads were removed  and I hung up.  The ads are still there.  My old Kindle was so simple.  I only used it to read books from Amazon and my local library.  This one belongs in the trash can

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Exactly what I needed. I own an iPad mini and usually read there with the Kindle App, but the backlighting kills my eyes over long periods of time. Since this didn't have a light, I am reading so much more. It's also awesome for reading in bring daylight. Battery life is amazing. I'm on 2.5 weeks with no charging. Love the ads too, it gives me idea on what to read next!! Great deal since I also got it during their sale for $59.",Just what I needed;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a great Kindle. I used to have the Kindle keyboard. It is much easier to maneuver around when you can touch the screen as opposed to having to press buttons to control everything. It was smartly designed. The battery also lasts longer, as long as you leave it in airplane mode. I also discovered Goodreads through using this Kindle, which is sort of built-in. It's a great site and app to help you organize the books you've read, want to read, and to get suggestions for books from friends' reviews. Back to the Kindle, it is great. You have to treat it like a paper book and make sure you have enough light (none are built-in, but there are clip-on light accessories you can buy). Since the screen is glare-free, as advertised, you can read outside in bright sunlight. I took this to the beach with me and it was great. Highly recommended.",Solid update to the wonderful Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I picked up this no-frill Kindle during a sale at Staples for $65.00, after having my Nexus 7 returned to me (I loaned it to a friend) with a cracked screen and a broken Digitizer. I realized that I really only used it for reading anyway, so I went ahead and bought this Kindle. I couldn't be more pleased with this purchase!Though admittedly I'm not familiar with the other reading devices, such as Nook, Sony e-Reader, iPad, etc., I can't imagine any competitor could significantly improve on this Kindle's cost to quality ratio. With the Nexus 7 I was limited to reading inside, because even hazy daylight blotted out the text on that device's screen. With this Kindle such restrictions are meaningless, due to the device's paper-like background on which the text is displayed. Need larger text for poor eyesight? No-problemo whatsoever! This Kindle's text selection offers lettering which runs the entire gamut, from the miniscule to the humongous. All the other various ""perks"" one might expect to find on higher-end devices, have been generously included in this baseline model, including 2 dictionaries; a Goodreads app.; book info as well as author info;" vocabulary builder
Review: and various other apps and settings which make this reading device a fabulous bargain
Title;;;;;;: and hard to beat for the price!""
column4: This Kindle Delivers the Most Bang for Your Buck!";;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This was a gift from my daughter.  I really like it as she is my source for books as I am on a limited budget.  I still prefer reading actual books rather than on a kindle, however I am enjoying this. Would recommend.  Thank you, have a great day & God bless.",I really like it as she is my source for books as ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I got this for a die-hard paper-back lover, and she loves it!  She was skeptic, but has been sold.  The only draw back is that when she finishes a book, she can quickly get sucked into another.  Get it for the purest, they will be swayed!",Got for the purest.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love my new Kindle, I bought the Fire HD tablet before buying an eReader and I always get distracted and start playing games or wanting to watch a video  with this I get to just read my books with out being tempted to do something else. Plus I love when I have to read long documents for work I can email them straight to my Kindle and read then any where at home, out side, or even bring it up during my meetings and I don't have to hassle with a bunch of paperwork it's all at my finger tips.",Why didn't I buy one sooner?;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a nifty little Kindle that perfectly fulfills the need for which I bought it.  I have a Kindle Fire, but in preparing for a trip to Australia and New Zealand, I wanted a portable e-reader that was lighter weight and had a longer battery life than my Fire.  I also wanted to be able to read it in the sunlight.  Can't do that with the Fire.  A Paperwhite might also have been an option, but it is pricier than this Kindle.  It's true this Kindle doesn't have a backlight, but then neither do regular books!  I haven't found this to be a problem at all.  Before e-readers, we always had to have an outside light source to read a book, and we didn't give it a second thought.  This little Kindle still has multiple options that are the same as my Fire -- such as wi-fi and the built-in dictionary that lets me look up the meaning of a word instantly.  All in all, I love it!  Very light weight -- less than a paperback -- extremely long battery life, especially in Airplane mode -- and many options for changing the font style and size.  I'm looking forward to carrying it with me on my trip -- so portable, convenient, and readable! Also, because of the price break,I got the version with the ads -- they are very unobtrusive, only the screen saver and not bothersome at all!",Nifty Little Kindle -- Perfect for Travel;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Great way to read your books on the go. The display never hurts your eyes, your reading experience is fully customizable and thanks to the 4 GB internal storage you probably won't need external storage devices. Adding books from amazon is extremely simple and books from other sources can also be easily uploaded, provided the format is correct. The device does not accept EPUB so make sure your books are saved as PDF. What really helped me immerse myself in the reading experience was the vocabulary builder. All words you search in the dictionary are store and every now and then you can pop over to see how many words you remember. Searching a word in the dictionary is also easy, just tap it. Setup is quick, weight feels just right and the home menu has the perfect design.",Best tool for reading on the go!;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"The cheapie with center toggle and side button page turns is still the best. It allows for excellent collection making and errors are few because you don't arrive somewhere unexpected because of butterfingers. This one is not bad, but it is heavier and not my favorite. Simple, cheap, idiot proof and intuitively organizable is my way.",Butterfingers;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"When I first received my kindle, I was skeptical of whether or not this reading experience would be more enjoyable than holding a physical book. I often view books as friends, and I believed that like friends, experiences with them in person are more rewarding than through electronic communication. However, this device proved me wrong! I love having access to all of my books in the palm of my hand, being able to easily search particular parts of the book (this is most helpful when writing papers and needing to access quick notes!), as well as having access to an instant dictionary. I highly recommend checking out Kindle, if you've never had one before. This is particularly useful for travelers, students, and avid readers. The only other device I use more often than my kindle is my cell phone!",Talk about a Productive Tool!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This Kindle is perfect for those that just want a simple e-reader. I have recommended this model to several friends and family members as I use mine all the time.The functionality and organization options are great, and it is easy to use and navigate. The battery lasts for weeks when in airplane mode, and the browser and storefront work better on this one than my older generation Kindle. The touchscreen is very sensitive, and can be used even with thick gloves on. I have a thin cover on mine, and even though I have dropped it several times it stills works perfectly and looks brand new. Even though it has proven to be fairly sturdy, I would recommend getting a cover for it.",A Great Purchase!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I chose this item after much deliberation. I am the type of person who loves technology but found myself not enjoying reading as much from my tablet or from my computer and iPhone as much as I always do from books. Unable to place my finger on the exact reason I had ruled out buying an ereader for quite a while. Eventually after returning to college the issue was revisited as a matter of money and convenience.  I would no longer need to go to the store to purchase or return textbooks, not to mention no longer having to tote around books heavy enough to start midlife scoliosis. I happened to be lucky enough to catch it on sale twenty dollars cheaper with the specials. I got off especially cheap having chosen the glare free without backlighting. I wanted it to read as close to a real book as possible. The touch screen is great. It is appropriately responsive and the dictionary feature makes using the text books especially easy. Also being able to use the ""go to"" featur for terms and topics within text is great. The battery life is phenomenal. It's lightweight so I take it everywhere and either entertain myself or study if I have to wait.",I love this;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I ordered this a Sunday and and by Wednesday it was ready to be pick in.. Panama! Fastest I've received a product!This is my first Kindle and so far I'm loving it. It does exactly as the description details so don't expect a built in light nor a tablet-like-bright screen. You will be reading as if you're reading a real book, which as ai physical book advocate I can't complain. It is a twice as chunky if you compare it to the Kindle Keyboard but very weightless.Very easy to use, tap right= next page, tap left= previous page, tap upper side= Home.You can hold a word you don't know and display the definition and translation, you can even check new books and update your shelves on Goodreads.Overal, fast shipping to another country, easy to use and carry around in your purse.",Good for new e-readers users!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had been avoiding getting an eReader for so long because I love books. But I finally decided it was time because I can't fit all my books anymore. This is a wonderful invention. I absolutely love the convenience and ease, and the reader itself is very comfortable. I regret not spending a little extra for the built in light.",... avoiding getting an eReader for so long because I love books. But I finally decided it was time ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've had this almost a month. I was used to reading on my kindle fire and I was always getting headaches. I got this one because it didn't have the same screen as the fire. So far it's been great, no headaches!!",Love this kindle!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This was a gift for my parents.  Very easy to use and they love it.  Fits in a purse and is the same size as a paperback book.  They travel quite a bit and are always reading.  Amazon carries every book they use (Masonic lodge and Eastern Star books)  They love that they are not carrying an arm load of books :) The only down is they fight over who gets to use it :)  My parents are in their 80's-touch screen makes it perfect for them.  Very easy to use and they also love the fact that they can change the type size.I've owned kindles from the first gen, I currently own a fire, however for just reading this is perfect.",Great gift;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"There are so many benefits to having a kindle...I love it.  It's very easy on my eyes.  Light weight so I can carry it with me and it seems that the battery lasts longer.  Overall, Kindle is truly a great product.",Kindle review;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"If you love to read this is the ereader for you! I have had one for two years now and it is wonderful. No matter the lighting you can read your books. When you download a book it is quick and easy. I bought this one for my Daughter in law for Christmas. She also loves to read and was still using her original Kindle Fire. The price was really good right before Christmas, $49, so I couldn't pass this up. I bought a cover for it but had to send it back because it didn't fit. So I suggest you spend a little extra and purchase the kindle cover. They work well and are very sturdy. This book is amazing!",A must for readers;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my Kindle (7th generation)! It does everything I wanted and expected: No back light No glare Dictionary for unknown words Character summary by tapping names Included 30 day free trial of Prime Battery life is fantastic Ability to change font Ability to change text sizeSomething that I wasn't aware of is that your kindle is automatically assigned an email address that you can use to send documents directly to your kindle, pretty cool. The email address is the one you registered to your Amazon account @kindle.com, instead of @gmail.com, for example, easy. But, you can change it in your settings if you like.I was worried that the 6"" might be too small, but It's the perfect size. The screen is very clear and the spacing between lines makes it clean looking and easy to read. I have not adjusted margin and spacing settings as I like the default, but of course you can adjust them. The caseing is very sturdy and nice looking. The touch screen makes the kindle very easy to use. It was also very easy to sign up for Prime, only one tap! It was also easy to sign up for Goodreads, which allows you to see what your friends are reading, read reviews, ect. (I'm still learning about that)All in all a great buy for anyone who wants a fantastic, simple e-reader, I'm very happy with it. My only complaint is about the special offers on the device that show on the bottom of the home screen and as screen savers when on sleep mode. That's not the Kindle's fault, that was me choosing to pay $79 instead of $99. The good thing, though, is that if you choose to go that route and save the $20, you can later choose to spend the $20 and have the special offers erased from your Kindle at any time.","Great device, very recommended!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"All I want is an e-reader and this fills the bill perfectly. The price was great and it's smaller and lighter than my previous Kindle. I did buy a purple cover for it since I carry it in my purse all the time and didn't want any damage. All in all, I'm very satisfied.",The price was great and it's smaller and lighter than my previous Kindle;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"In terms of display and functionality, it was what I'd expected.  I would have given it 5 stars, but I'm a little disappointed in how thick it is.  To be clear, it's not terribly thick and certainly not heavy, but I had one of the original 6"" Kindles with the buttons (no touch screen) and it was delightfully thin.  This is purely subjective, but this one feels nearly twice as thick - but, again, it's not heavy at all.  It's likely due to the touchscreen, but I'd actually prefer one of the thin Kindles with buttons, but they are no longer available.  All that being said, I got mine for $29 on a one-day sale (it was certainly short-lived) and it is a tremendous bargain at that price.  I'm quite happy with it.  I have a 7"" Google Nexus tablet with the Kindle app that I had been using, but I actually much prefer reading on this.","Thicker than the old ""button"" model, but still a great reader";;;;;;

Review: I purchased this Kindle for my bf after his old one froze up. He loves it. The screen is very sharp and clear. It's also easy to hold. It seems a bit thicker than his last one but he hasn't complained about it. It's also easy to navigate. I love the fact that you can save words that you've looked up through the dictionary.
Title;;;;;;: Very nice Kindle for the price;;;;;;

Review: This was a gift for a very happy recipient. I have owned several generations of Kindles and this one is a good choice for an entry level e-reader or someone who isn't concerned about having a lit screen. It is small & lightweight & easy to handle. It has plenty of of storage space & battery life. This Kindle doesn't have the finer resolution that the Voyage or new Paperwhite do but is more than sufficient for the avearge person or someone on a budget. I can't compare it to other e-readers but I've always been very happy with the Kindles I have owned and highly recommend them.
Title;;;;;;: Can't go wrong with a Kindle;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"After using a Kindle Fire for nearly a year, this was an adjustment.  But the device works wonderfully and is easy to use.  With no light I am limited on the times I use it. It will serve it's purpose tho and that is to feed my constant need to read.",Works very well for a basic reader.;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"It may not be the Kindle, but rather the status of my vision.  I chose Kindle because reading print became a challenge for me. Contrast was often a problem, and the size and style of print.  With a book or magazine I had no control.  Kindle allows me to do that. I may need to move to a Kindle with a backlit screen to improve contrast.","It may not be the Kindle, but rather the ...";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Before my Kindle, I'd stopped reading for pleasure and read mostly for research purposes.  I felt I just didn't have the time to read a book.  A Kindle makes it easy.  There's only one small thing to carry around.  Ebooks are easy to either buy or borrow.  I use my county's online library system to access ebooks for free and have begun TWO  book series!  As long as you have a wi-fi connection, it takes about 2 minutes to borrow a book online.  And for all that waiting around that is inevitable in life -- your medical appointments, medical appointments of friends & relatives whom you accompany, a quiet lunch retreat, etc -- the Kindle sure makes the inevitable waiting more enjoyable.  At bedtime, it also helps me calm my brain after a long and busy day.  I had considered the paperwhite or a backlit version but then I read that it wasn't good for you to use that version at night (the basic one that requires you to supply room light, just like a regular book, is okay), I stayed with the 7th generation version and I've been very satisfied.  If you've been toying with the idea of an eReader and if part of you has been longing to pick up a book again, try this basic Kindle.  It's not much money and you will be very happy with it.",Kindle makes it easy to read again for fun;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"The only reason I have this 4 states instead of 5 is that I have no idea what the ads will be for. I purchased the Kindle because I got an email offer from Amazon for a reduced price. I have had a Nook for years now and didn't see that there would be too many advantages to having the Kindle. Let me begin...I use my library a lot, for ebooks as well. With the Kindle they are transported immediately. With the Nook, I had to manually load the book from my computer.The price was great. So far the ads aren't bad, but they are just there, they aren't there when I am reading, just as the screen saver, kind of.The battery life is similar to the Nook, without using the glowlight, which honestly, I rarely did. Camping was the one time I REALLY appreciated the glow light.The Amazon library and free books. Granted most of the free books are 1st in a series, but it's still free.The Kindle is a little smaller and lighter. It fits into my purse better, by far.Overall I think I am a convert, my Nook is going up for sale.",So easy to use;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Seems great. Unfortunately, as soon as I received it, Amazon dropped their price for the non-refurb. version for cheaper than I got this one. I didn't think I'd enjoy reading on a device, but it works well. It's nice to be able to have multiple books in one place. The ""special offers"" thing is pretty lame IMO. Basically, every time you turn on the device, there is an ad for some random book from Amazon. Not a huge deal, but still kinda lame. I guess you can get one without the ads for a more expensive price, but I didn't realize that at the time of purchase. The screen does flash when you ""turn"" the page (screen inverts the lcd), which is a little disconcerting at first, but you get used to it. Overall, it's a great product for what it is.",Cool but...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"It does exactly what it should. It is a lower end ebook reader. nice sharp letters, fast response, right now i have my entire collection on it, and it still has plenty of room.My biggest complaint is that i cant reverse the pages. I prefer to read white lettering on a black background, and that isn't a hard thing to do with an ebook reader.all in all though, Im quite satisfied with the product. i'd been looking for several years, and just couldnt pass up the deal the other day, and im glad i didnt.",Exactly what i expected;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I already own a Kindle Fire and had gotten tired of trying to be able to read while in direct sunlight.  I use my Kindle Fire mostly to watch videos on long trips or at the gym as well as read and as long as I was not in direct sunlight there was no glare off the screen.  I was looking for a reading kindle and a good deal popped up and I was able to purchase this one for $50.  I love it, perfect for exactly what I was looking for, reading books either purchased or borrowed through Amazon lending library and Prime.  I was finally able to sit outside by the pool or at the beach and read my Kindle.  This device is perfectly simple for anyone wanting a reading device WITHOUT a light, it tells you it doesn't come with a light so don't buy it and then give a bad review b/c it doesn't come with a light, there's a model up from this one that comes with a light.","Great for what its created for, Reading";;;;;;

Review: I have a computer and an iPad which I used to read on so I thought this was unnecessary but I saw it on sale and bought it on a whim and I am so glad I did! It's the most basic kindle so all I use it for is to read books. This device is not even backlit which makes it so so easy on the eyes and better to read on than my iPad. It's much more gentle and enjoyable- the look is pretty close to just actual paper. I ride the subway a lot so having this is so light and easy. I can fit it in basically any purse and it's so handy to have whenever I have a few minutes to read.
Title;;;;;;: ... used to read on so I thought this was unnecessary but I saw it on sale and bought it ...;;;;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"The good thing about this kindle is that you can use it in bright sun so when I go to the pool, it is very good. But indoors the screen is so dark that I cannot read anything without a bright indoors light. My original paperwhite was very good, screen that I could adjust the light, and a long battery life. But unfortunately it DIED after only a couple of years. I should have read the reviews and I would have known about this problem and ordered the other paperwhite device.  Also the screen is not responsive. The print size changes and it is hard to get back.",Only can be used in bright light;;;;;;

Review: I love this kindle.  It is my third one and  read with it more than the other two because the battery lasts such a long tie and I can see the print when I'm outside.  It was also a lot cheaper than my first two kindles.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"We bought this for my 7 year old's birthday.  She loves it!  We use kindle freetime unlimited which allows her free access to tons of books.  It's super easy for her to add books to it.  She feels like a big kid having access to lots of books, we can see what she is reading, it even tells us how much progress she is making on books, as well as set reading goals.  I love that this is strictly for reading and not for games.  She takes it to bed every night and loves to read it in the car or on the go.",It's super easy for her to add books to it;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"What can I say. It does what its supposed to and does it well for a reasonable price. I resisted getting one for a time because I like having physical books, but I just have too many now and the Kindle was a nice change.",<3;;;;;;

Review: I really enjoy it. My original Kindle died. I like this better than the original because it's touch screen & much faster to turn pages. I would have preferred to buy the paperwhite but this fit my budget better & does anything I want..
Title;;;;;;: I really enjoy it. My original Kindle died;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I LOVE my new Kindle! I was initially opposed to the idea as I love having printed books. However, I have both printed and Kindle versions of my absolute favorite books. It is convenient to travel with and read whenever I have a free moment. I cannot believe I did not buy a Kindle sooner.My only concern with purchasing this model rather than the Kindle Paperwhite was the lack of internal light. However, I prefer the gray background with black text for daytime reading. I also purchased a small light which easily attaches to the case for reading at night. A bedside lamp would also provide ample lighting for reading in bed.Again, I am so pleased with my purchase. If you are debating between the Paperwhite and this Kindle and are not attached to the idea of an internal light I suggest this model. I cannot wait to purchase more books!",Better than I hoped;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am between a four and five star rating on this Kindle.  I had the one with the keyboard (second or third edition) along with the first edition.  I purchased because I dropped my keyboard Kindle and the screen got damaged.  I needed, NEEDED a Kindle pretty fast.  I always loved the Kindle E Readers, but really have had to get used to the touch screen.  I liked using the buttons to navigate through menus.  I am getting better at using the touch screen.  Also very nice about this Kindle is the smaller size and weight - both of which I noticed while using, and I do appreciate.  And I purchased on sale, so it was a great buy.",This is an excellent E Reader.;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my second Kindle and I do not like it as much as I do my first one.  It is frustrating to use, does not have as much flexibility for settings and organization as my first Kindle.  The thing I dislike the most about this Kindle is that when I have wireless turned off, it will turn back on by itself.  I do not like objects that override my instructions without my permission.  It also does not allow you to monitor downloads as my first Kindle does.  In the couple of months I have had it, it has reset itself more times than my original Kindle has in all the years I have owned it.  I can't imagine what Amazon was thinking when they designed the software for this, but whatever it was, they need to go back to the drawing board.",This is my second Kindle and I do not like it as much as I do my first one;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love how this has changed my life.  I'd pretty much given up reading - had an accident that lost most of my vision and reading is about impossible even with large print and magnifying devices.  My daughters though that with the ability to increase the font size on here I just might be able to read books again, so they got it for me for my Birthday - BEST GIFT EVER!  I can see!  I've already read one book in a week that would have taken me 6 months or more to read with large print and a magnifying device!  I'm on my 2nd book now!  I just wish the dictionary would have as large of print as the page does - very hard for me to see the results, even with a magnifying device, but I'm reading easily and enjoying it again after 8 years of not being able to",BEST BIRTHDAY GIFT EVER!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm really enjoying the experience since I switched from physical books to the Kindle. Many peoples main argument is they don't like reading from a screen, and I totally agree. While the majority of my time is spent on my phone or computer reading various things, the long form of books becomes wearisome for my eyes after extended periods. The e-ink technology definitely replicates the look and feeling of reading a book, without the hassle of trying to carry a library with you.This is perfect for someone who loves to read and travels a lot. The ease and convienience of having your own personal library in such a small form factor, with a battery that lasts as long as the kindle does, is really a lifestyle changing experience.","Annihilates the ""I hate reading through a screen"" argument";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This kindle is pretty good. I am just starting to use it, and I find some of the touchscreen sensitivity annoying, and there aren't as many straightforward options as I'd like - for example, on the home screen, I can't swipe/tap to see the next page, but tap on the page number and type in 2. Annoying. Maybe I just haven't figured it out yet!Reading is really nice on this, again, except the sensitivity of the touchscreen. I often find myself accidentally turning pages when I shift position, then I have to figure out how many I moved forward, etc. Otherwise, I really don't miss having an actual book to flip through. For travelers, I think a kindle makes a lot of sense, and that's the primary reason I got this one.",This kindle is pretty good. I am just starting to use it;;;;;;

Review: I was really happy to get this device because I needed a small reader with lots of references however I cannot adjust the screen brightness and this is inconvenient sometimes because you're supposed to be able to read in the dark as well as the light.  I do not find this true in either case and maybe you can tell me how to adjust it it's nice to have all my books with me that I need to read and research so that is a definite pro plus.  I think I also thought it was in color but that's not a problem.  I did notice however that it doesn't have a speakers and that is one of the pluses for the article. Until I got this I have been taking my iPad with me and it was good to and of course I could adjust the screen but then you get the advertisements when you're might not want them or something jumps and when you're trying to read that you might not want but I think you might need all in all a nice reader and I enjoy having it with me and easy to carry.  In fact I think I might take it to church with me soon once I get my Bibles and references loaded.  All in all a nice little device just not worthy of five stars I don't think
Title;;;;;;: Easy to handle but screen not bright enough;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Wow.  This is so much better than my original Kindle Touch.  The updated software with Goodreads, ability to get summary information on books and improved X-Ray just make this a terrific bargain. You can even touch the name of a character and it tells you who that person is.  I prefer to read with a light shining on the reader rather than having a lighted display so this is just perfect for me. The fonts are nice and crisp and absolutely excellent.  I know that some of the more expensive models have better specifications or more dots per inch (DPI) for fonts but this one is just excellent and again much better than the original Kindle.  Also, the processor speedup makes a difference.  I would certainly recommend it to anyone unless they just have to have the backlight feature....Only one thing you need to be aware of:  If you have a snap on cover for the older Kindle Touch, it won't work on this model.  You will need to purchase a new one.  Also, this model has the magnetic power feature so if you buy a cover with the magnets, you turn the Kindle on just by opening the cover and turn it off by just closing it.",Impressive Kindle -  WOW describes it pretty well;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have 5 Kindle readers from keyboard to 8.9"" fire. This is my go to reader. It is light, glare free, lasts a long time without charging. This, to me is the best KIndle ever made. I would firmly recommend this product to any dedicated reader. I go nowhere without it.",Best ever;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I had it on the charger for 4 days after I received it, it never charged or 'woke' up.  Did multiple hard resets, finally when I had all but given up, a hard reset did the trick and I was able to do setup and actually use it.  Last 2 weeks it has been wonderful, no problems or issues.","Last 2 weeks it has been wonderful, no problems or issues";;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm much happier with this Kindle than I expected to be.  However I miss the automatic downloads of my NYTimes subscription that I had with my old kindle just from being online.  Now it is a multiple-step process (go online, select download from the cloud).  Maybe there is a way to fix this but I haven't figured it out yet.",Better than expected but still prefer my old one;;;;;;

Review: Love my new Kindle! The screen is beautiful and looks just like ink on paper! I changed the font and word size to just where I like it. It is so light and thin. Free prime borrowing is awesome and so many great cheap books in the library. Battery life is ridiculous. Don't know why I waited so long. Can't wait to lay on the beach with it.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I lost my way-old Kindle in the process of changing my living situation. I saw this deal and decided I'd never get a current generation Kindle brand new. The price was great ($64). To my surprise it turned out to have a touch screen! It's the perfect size, so easy to use, and so fast. The font choices have really been improved. I'm one who likes to get as many words as possible on the screen. The new set up is very flexible. So far, the only snag has been finding a cover and light. It definitely needs external light to be readable. Not to worry. The device itself gives you options on the covers and lights that will work. I'm very satisfied with this purchase (have been using for 3 weeks.).",So Worth Buying;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchased this one because i didnt use all the bells and whistles that come with the kindle fire. Plus this battery last weeks as compared to only hours with the Fire. Only thing that did bother me was this one not having a backlight. I shouldnt have to pay 50.00 more for one. But i love how light it is as compared to the first gen. Keyboard Kindle. The ergonomics of it are excellent. I highly recommend this product.Also,thankyou Amazon for still giving me the sale price",But i love how light it is as compared to the first ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Takes some getting used to, from my old kindle. I love the smaller size and the fact that I don't have to push a button to turn the page, and since I already had a light that actually fits perfectly onto the edge, I can see to read at night, without a bedside lamp on. Love it, although I wish it had been easier to transfer content from my old one to this one. And wish it stayed charged longer. Although it hold a charge longer than my Kindle Fire does. Will need to upgrade that one soon!",Small and handy;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"The Kindle holds the lion's share of eBook capital and I decided to switch to eBooks about a month ago. I chose this Kindle because it was on sale for Black Friday. I love the convenience of the eBooks but I'm slightly disappointed with the actual device.For what you pay here, you get the bare bones plus the pleasure of viewing ads when you're not in the middle of a book. It's fine by me because you only need the UI really when selecting a new book to read, which happens about once or twice a week for me, amounting to about ten minutes a month with a little book or shoe ad wedged in the bottom corner. The touchscreen, which I thought would annoy me, is actually very nice and I have seen no need for physical buttons to tun pages.The Kindle is a great ecosystem (lots of books at fair prices and plenty of distribution options) but it gets 3 stars from me due to its shortcomings regarding the hardware. No, this device doesn't come with a light, but that's clearly marked so I knew I wasn't going to get the light. However, I think it's silly to pay an extra $50 or so for the Paperwhite (the model above this that is backlit) for what amounts to a cheap, weak flashlight. I know there are other benefits (higher pixel density, maybe it's a little lighter) but those changes shouldn't cost so much more.One other thing to note: This device is a little heavier than I thought it would be. It's not uncomfortable by any means but it's worth noting here. It's also a little slippery: I would suggest buying a case for it. Amazon has a lot of cases available for ~$10.","Mediocre device, great ecosystem";;;;;;

Review: I am extremely pleased with this purchase. This is the 3rd. Kindle I have and have not had any problems with them. This is small and light enough to hold in one hand without compromising it's reading quality. The print is easy to see with the option of changing the font. It is truly glare free as I have enjoyed reading outside on these sunny days.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"""Upgraded"" from a Kindle Keyboard when this was on special for $59 (Or $11.80/mo for 5 mos). Took the Special Offer option and it's not really noticeable.  The Kindle Touch 7 is fast and the features like dictionary are much nicer than the older model.Also ordered the Elsse For Kindle 7th Gen, 6"" Glare-Free Touchscreen Display - Folio Case Cover.  It seems like a nice inexpensive case but I might go for the Acase(TM) Leather Case for Kindle PaperWhite and Kindle Touch if doing it over.  I have an Acase for the Keyboard model that is 5 years old and looks like new.Anyway I would highly recommend the New Touchscreen Kindle. I think it's easier to use and much faster.There seem to be many reviews by folks that expected backlights, color or other features that are not really found on a dedicated reader like this.  They don't seem to have read the product description very well. They may need a Fire or another ""tablet"" device.After using this for several days I like it more and more.","""Upgraded"" from a Kindle Keyboard and REALLY like it.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I sat on my old glare free kindle so needed to replace it.  I am so happy I did.  I got a good sale price, pretty fast shipping (since it was free) and I like the updates.  It feels a little lighter, and I love the touch screen over pushing the buttons.  Even though there are fancy tablets out there I like reading the glare free screen as it just seems easier on my eyes.  I would recommend this e reader.",An updated replacement;;;;;;

Review: Since I am such a big kindle fan when I saw this one I thought it would make a great gift for someone in the family. I love the fact that I can take my entire library with me anywhere I go without breaking my back carrying all those books. This kindle is easy to use and the glare free screen makes it easy to read outside or in bright light. The screen is clear and whether it is a pdf file or a kindle book it is easy to navigate through the book. Overall I think this is a nice basic kindle for someone who doesn't need all the bells and whistles that come with the fire editions.
Title;;;;;;: Another kindle to add to the collection;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm happy with it so far.  The battery lasts long, it isn't glitchy (I had a jailbroken Nook 1st Gen for about 3 years - and that is starting to need a reboot every 2 hours of activity).Thanks to Calibre and Send To Kindle, I'm able to get all of my files in the palm of my hand.",Solid e-reader!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I received this as a gift, as an upgrade. I previously had this Kindle keyboard, which I liked, but I didnt use the keyboard often and it was just in the way. This Kinde is absolutely perfect and so comfortable to hold.","which I liked, but I didnt use the keyboard often and ...";;;;;;

Review: The screen is a little too sensitive. It does not take much to for the header to appear as is the case of other features. I do not like the fact that advertisements for other book deals and Kindle covers are on the screen.Other than that I like it.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a great little piece of technology. Perfect for reading on the go, it allows you to take your library wherever you go. Built in Wi-Fi means this model is more economical than those with built in 3G-4G connectivity. But for many users, myself included, the Wi-Fi alone is sufficient..Its compact size means that it travels easily. The glare free screen means reading without eye strain. If you read a great deal, then the Kindle is just what you need.Many classic works of literature are free or at very little cost, so you can stock up on great books for nothing or close to it.",Library on the Go;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had an older keyboard style Kindle for years and it came up missing.  We looked everywhere for it and figured I'd lost in while traveling.  So I finally decided to pick up this new Kindle.  I really like its size and light weight, and I think the screen has higher contrast and is easier for me to read.  So about a week after receiving it, guess what?  I found the older Kindle in the zippered pocket in a bag, right where I'd put it.  So now I have two.  I have a case for the older one with a light, so I use that at home in bed.  I'll be taking the newer one with me when I travel for its form factor.  I love how all my content is linked together so I can read on my cell phone, computer, or either Kindle.  (PS.... we LOVE our Echo too, Alexa is becoming a member of the family.",Great form factor and utility;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"l like it, but...  I miss the 'Text-to-Speech' feature, which I often use in the car, and the 'Remove from Device' feature. I don't care to look at titles I've already read. Deleted a book on my computer & it still shows up on my screen, even after a restart.In Settings you can get rid of all the advertising, hallelujah!I have had a 2nd generation since 2009 & really like it! But, the battery is not holding a charge very well anymore. I'll keep it anyway.Would like a new battery!","I like it, but...";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Just got it today, and I really like it, so far, E-ink does take a bit to get used to if you're used to reading on a back lit LED screen. It's not like reading on my laptop, tablet or my wife's Kindle Fire. It is actually like reading a printed page. It's off white color is more like reading a newspaper page than a book to me, but my eyes are really telling the difference. I can read longer on this device with less eyestrain. I am blind in one eye so I needed something like this device.I also LOVE that fact that it doesn't have distractions like push notifications and all the other distractions that come along with using a Fire or Tablet. It's just a plain reader. Just what I was looking for.Easy to set up, has step by step instructions when you turn on the device. WiFi setup was a breeze. I was off and going, reading my first book in about 2 minutes. All my books easily downloaded from the cloud.I like that it's small and lightweight, easy to hold in one hand and turn pages with the touchscreen. And the ""special offer"" ads are not intrusive, wish the ads were more relevant to my interests though.The only thing I wish it had was a longer USB cable, and a AC Charger, but I can find those pretty cheapNow to find a cover at a reasonable price, with a book light.",Excellent product. E-ink screen is great for Bad Eyes;;;;;;

Review: This is a great device which I bought as an alternative to reading on my HDX. I love it and can read for hours with no eyestrain whatsoever. My one gripe is the claim that it gets weeks on a single charge. Not true. After a day it's down a quarter.
Title;;;;;;: This is a great device which I bought as an alternative to reading ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Picked this up at a local big box store on Feb 23rd. Only had it a couple of days, but I'm loving it. Upgraded from Kindle 2nd Gen that had started acting up after several years and a second battery. This new Kindle has the same 167 PPI as the 2nd Gen, but the difference in clarity in the screens is amazing. The grey background is lighter on the new one, the black text is darker/richer, and the contrast is more crisp making the text more clear. I love the touch screen, so much easier to navigate, access the dictionary, etc. For those who just want a reader, it is definitely a comfortable, lightweight, easy to use, affordable option. The ads on the $80 version are no more intrusive than the pictures on the screen saver of the older kindles - it's just a picture that comes up when the unit is left idle, usually of a book for sale on amazon - not scrolling ads like on computers/games, etc., so paying an extra $20 not to have them is a waste of money in my opinion. Hoping this little one holds up as well and as long as my original one did.","If you just want a reader, this is the one to buy!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I just added this to our collection of Kindles. I have a K2 and my wife has a Kindle Keyboard. I especially like the XRay feature for looking up characters in the books. I often forget who someone is if they have not been mentioned for awhile. This Kindle has a far superior display compared to my K2 and perhaps a bit better than the Kindle Keyboard. The pages turn MUCH faster than either of the older models that we have and it is lighter too. There is no audio like my older Kindles have, but honesty,  we never used that feature anyway. From what I have read the battery life isn't as good, but that's  not an issue for us as we are retired and use our Kindles primarily indoors so an outlet is almost always available.",Great!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"The Kindle is true to it's product descriptions. As the description and many other reviewers have stated, it has no back-light. That's fine, however, it's still much darker than I feel it ought to be. At very first I thought I was being stupid with my mental complaints, but then I placed my kindle next to a book page and there was a massive difference. The issue is that the kindle background isn't white, it's gray, so there's not a lot of contrast. I suppose that's what makes the Kindle Paperwhite so attractive, though.The other thing that is disappointing about the Kindle is that whenever you turn a page or do anything with it there's a moment of glitches while the page changes. It's almost a split second, but it happens every time. I'd expected it to be a bit smoother than that.Other than those small complaints, I do like my new Kindle. The extra features are really what makes this device a worthwhile purchase.Edit: I received my Kindle just this past Friday. I charged it fully then proceeded to use it. Since then (it's been five days) the battery is halfway down. I don't know if I just read more than other Kindle users (I don't think I do), but the description says that the battery lasts weeks. At the rate it's going, my Kindle will need a recharge in just ten days, which is technically not weeks, it's days. Obviously, that's disappointing to me, and I did dock my review by one star, but it's still a good battery life for a device.",Mostly satisfied;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I recently purchased a new glare proof kindle,, and I'm very happy with it. It's super light- weight and the glare proof screen is amazing. The lighter weight is a blessing since the arthritis is becoming worse in my hands and arms. I can hold my new kindle for hours without any pain. Also, I love to read outside and I will be doing a lot of that this summer with my new kindle.",Fun in the Sun with My New Kindle;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Not a lot to say here that isn't pretty subjective. I wanted a reader that has a good screen (this one is clear and very readable, could have a little better contrast), is light (it's lighter than most books but heavier than I expected), and has good battery life (probably better if I could remember to turn off the WiFi after I download something). I did not want a reader with more features. I could do without the occasional black-white-black flicker when you turn pages, and I don't get the impression that this simple, plastic device is worth a hundred dollars. In its seventh generation, the basic Kindle is good but could be better for the money. IMHO.","Capable, too expensive...";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is exactly what I expected from the product description, so I am almost, but not quite, perfectly happy with it. This is a little thing, but while you can put it in landscape mode, it only does it with the fat part of the bezel on the left-hand side. This is really annoying if you want to use your left hand for anything other than holding the Kindle, as might be the case if you are left handed. I can't imagine that it would be that hard to let you flip the display for lefties. One star demerit for dexter chauvinism.","Great, with one annoying flaw for lefties.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my Kindle.  I love the fact that it can judge your reading time and then let you know how many minutes are left in each chapter -- my biggest frustration with my old kindle (one of the earliest models) was that I never knew how long a chapter was.  Now, I can gauge how long each chapter will take me and I don't have to worry that I will have to stop reading in the middle of a chapter.  Plus, it is very lightweight and is perfect for reading out in the sun!",I love my Kindle;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"It's ok but the touch screen freezes sometime and it's difficult to hold the kindle lying down.if accidentally ( which happens a lot) your fingers touches the screen the font changes,which is very disturbing.i would recommend people not to buy it",i would recommend people not to buy;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"For those who do not have Wi-Fi . . . you should know that Wi-Fi is not absolutely necessary in order to use this Kindle. You will need to go to a Starbucks or other venue that offers free Wi-Fi only once and that is in order to register your new Kindle. Once you've done that, you no longer need Wi-Fi.This is what you can do:1. Buy a Kindle book, which will then be in your library.2. Use the USB cable (included) to hook your Kindle to your computer.3. Go to your library and click on Download.4. Your book will be downloaded into your computer's Downloads Folder.5. Click on the Start menu and then Computer.6. Find the Kindle icon and open it.7. In your Downloads Folder, right click on the Kindle book and choose Send to Kindle.8. Drag the Kindle file into the Kindle's Documents folder.9. Your Kindle book will now be installed on your Kindle.This Kindle is so lightweight and easy to use. Set-up is easy and the touchscreen is convenient. For the money, I think this Kindle rates 5 stars!",Wi-Fi is NOT absolutely necessary!;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I love the Kindle device, I really do.  But I'm just not really all that happy with this version.  I prefer the way my old Kindle Touch was made.  I don't like the material it is made out of now.  It shows fingerprints (not on the screen, only on the black part) which drives my OCD crazy.  Also, the inside edge of it where the black surrounding part meets the screen has a dip, which collects dust or hair.  This drives me nuts.  I use my Kindle daily because I love to read so much.  I love the Kindle allows me to do that.  I just love my old one so much more because it didn't have either of these issues.  I find I am constantly picking out hair, bits of fuzz, or teeny crumbs out of the little edge.  What annoys me more is that when I do this I have to make sure I'm not actually reading or I will accidentally turn the page 10 times by touching the screen.  So I just try to blow the little nasties away which isn't very effective.  It's just annoying.  I was so excited to be getting the newer version, and I expected to love it just as much as my old Kindle Touch.  I'm not sure if the Paperwhite is made the same way or not.  If it is, and I had gone ahead and purchased that one like I was considering, I would be REALLY upset.",Like my old one better :(;;;;;;

Review: Awesome. I love this kindle. Great for reading which is why I got it. No complaints here except that I like reading so much that I probably should have gotten the Paperwhite. But I guess I can just turn a light on with the regular kindle.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Not quite a replacement for a book, but offers convenience that books do not.  This kindle provides an acceptable reading experience.  It also provides the convenience of being able to carry many volumes of books with you.  What it gives up in terms of reading experience, it makes up for in convenience.I have not had any problems with it.  The battery lasts a very long time.  My unit has the sponsored advertisements, but they have not bothered me.  I contemplated getting the mobile broadband version, but the price differential was more than I cared to pay.  I am usually located near a WiFi access point so it has not caused me any problems.Highly recommended for those who plan to stay close to a WiFi access point.",Acceptable Reading Experience;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I last owned a Kindle 2nd generation, so this was quite an update.For one, the screen refreshes significantly faster than previous models. The crisp e-Ink display is easy to read, and when using features like the on-screen keyboard, etc, the fast refresh makes it much nicer to use.The other feature I really enjoy is the touchscreen. Coming from the 2nd Gen with its keyboard and 5d stick navigation, the touchscreen is so much more intuitive and simple to use.Really, I can't complain about this device at all. e-Ink readers have really come a long way, and they are hard to beat!Pros: Fast screen refresh, easy on the eyes, touchscreen navigation and operation is intuitive.Cons: None. (I'm reviewing this device for what it is...not what it is not. If you want a lit Kindle, they make them...it's called the Kindle Paperwhite. Don't knock this device for not being a different model, people.)","Works as advertised, easy to use, what more could you ask for?";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Love my new kindle. I had been holding onto my fiancee's original keyboard model for as long as possible. When a software issue rendered it useless I was able to work with Customer Support to get an upgrade at a great price, and my own so I wasn't hijacking hers. Overall, no complaints!Further, I was told that my case from the keyboard version wouldn't fit this model. However, I have found that it works great and I haven't had any issues at all.",Great upgrade from the keyboard version (1st or 2nd gen);;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Dear amazonThank you for you help and for  always answering questions.YOU DO GOOD BUSINESS! I appreciate you taking your customers first.  I love my new Kindle, and have figured it out, and found Network password in my previous notes kept. My old Kindle was so much simpler, and I wasn't prepared for such advancements..Now after my reading, and spending time with it I am delighted, and loving it. Thank you again for being there for your customers...NEZ",Learning New Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love this basic model. I don't need a built in light. This screen has bolder text than Paperwhite and Voyage. I love bold text. The background is light gray. I like light gray-there is less glare than a white background. You only have to tap the screen to turn the page. Simple. No areas to accidentally touch. At the bottom there is a bigger area to hold onto. I like that. The dictionary feature is much more positive than reading on a tablet. On a tablet it can't make up it's mind whether you want the dictionary or the settings window. I can use it one handed-either hand. It fits in my shirt pocket. I like that. It's sooo much lighter than a tablet.I have chosen to use it without a case. Just a sleeve type that also holds the charger.Without a doubt this is the best designed Kindle touch ! Since it is this much fun I plan to buy a second one. I'm afraid the next generation basic model won't be this great. Sometimes change is not good. If you don't want a built in light, you may discover this is the one for you also.",The BEST of the Kindles!;;;;;;

Review: Used to own a keyboard kindle and it finally stopped working. This one is not as comfortable to hold and the screen is definitely not glare-free. I am using the same light to read by as my old kindle but constantly have to adjust the position because of the glare.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,A new technology from past Kindles but once I got used to it am very very pleased.Lots of free books from Amazon.com and our local library has a reasonably good collection of books to read in Kindle format.,"Good deal, reasonable price, fast delivery";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my kindle dearly.  I have resisted buying a kindle for years being a ""Paper Only"" kind of guy but this device is wonderful.  It does a fantastic job of giving wonderful technology helps while making you feel you are still reading a paper book. It does not have a back light but to be honest I don't find myself reading in he dark very often.Pros- Books Are Cheaper- Take Notes Easier While Reading- Find Definitions of Words in Seconds- Having Hundreds of Books On Hand Any TimeCons- No Back Light",Wonderful Technology while still feeling like you are reading a paper back book;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"My new Kindle is charging... I'm assuming it'll work just fine. Here's my gripe: It's absolutely absurd that Kindles don't come with the wall charger. It's like buying a can of chicken noodle soup that doesn't come with the chicken. Brilliant. Guess what Amazon?, nice try, but you had to know I would do my homework & find a cheaper alternative to the $20 wall charger y'all market for the Kindles! *PSA: Go to Cable Matters & get it there*",Yay! ...but!;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"It takes getting used to.  You have great ability to read in bed at night...which establishes a bad habit.  (( wince))  It no longer 'archives' books...and you have no ability to listen to audiobooks on this one.  It is also not as friendly at the gym.  You have to swipe the screen, which means sweaty fingers wiping the screen.  Nasty.  Before, I would set it to a larger font and read on the elliptical...I must have read hundreds...and just pressed the right or left hand button.  So easy.  But once you get used to it, it is good.  I have had some problems where it literally locks up.  In that case, I have to RESET it.  That is really aggravating.",You have great ability to read in bed at night;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Love this Kindle...got it as a gift when my old Kindle Keyboard finally stopped working after years of faithful use. I thought I'd hate the touchscreen, but its actually not that bad. Very easy to use, however I feel like the screen is a little smaller than my old one. That might be an illusion due to there not being a keyboard so the actual device is smaller. It is the ""special offers"" version meaning that it shows ads when it is in sleep mode.  I think I would like this better if the ads were geared towards me and my buying/browsing habits and not just random items. It made the device 20 bucks cheaper so I'm not really complaining. Black casing shows fingerprints and smudges pretty bad so I got a case which I love (by MarBlue Vassen). When on the home screen, it doesn't show the current book that I am reading on the first page, it puts it on the last page of my books so I have to scroll through it find it which is the only reason I did not give this Kindle 5 stars.",Love this Kindle;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this to replace my previous Kindle (with keyboard) after it's screen froze.  I am actually addicted to my Kindle.  This one has about the same size screen;" the text is sharper
Review: and I like that you can change the font type (not just the size of the font.)""

Was really impressed this being my first Kindle. Took it outside and enjoyed being able to read it with the surrounding brightness. Could have used some sort of first time instruction sheet included. Wasn't sure I was downloading correctly but figured it out and was OK with my first book. Cured my problem of getting to many bound books. Would recommend to anybody.
Title;;;;;;: Excellent Product At A Reasonable Price.;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I didn't ever think I would own a Kindle!I love the way books feel and smell, but it's so easy to pack in your satchel, purse or backpack.It's light and easy to manage. Also I would recommend buying the reading light!This is a good starter outer to see if you will like  the Kindle and use it.Enjoy!*** If you are thinking about buying a Kindle I would say go for the top of the line if you can afford it!","Kindle 6""...";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I like my new Kindle. Took it to the beach and read it right in the sun!! No glare what so ever.Touch screen allowed for smaller dimensions which is cool as well. WiFi feature works extremely well and easy to set up.Device recognized me as the owner and synced my books in one minute.The only point to make: cover is a nice touch, but burgundy came as pink.",very satisfied;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"What can I say, its a Kindle e reader. Can't ask for more. We both traded in 3rd gen key board kindles so total cost after kindle trade in special deal was only $34.50 each. Glad we took advantage of the deal. Of course we added extra for new cases but the old ones were 5 years old and showing wear. Nice part is the old chargers are still useable and due to long battery life they don't get used much so should last a lot longer!",This deserves six stars!;;;;;;
4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first Kindle and I've had it for several months now;" time to have read a number of books on it. It's definitely a big plus for traveling
Review: when space and weight are considerations. There are so many reviews on this model already that I don't really have much to add that would be useful. But my wife has the Paperwhite version
Title;;;;;;: which is her 2nd Kindle - her first being an much bulkier early model. I have to say that I wish I'd gotten that instead.""
column4: Good
column5: but better is available""";;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Works great, No problems whatsoever . I have several other readers , but for someone that wants to purchase just one to solely read on, I'd spend a few extra bucks and go with the Paperwhite . Well worth the extra to be able to read at any time with the back light . I've never had a better reader .This one is great if you don't want to spend a lot and would use it mainly in the daylight or with the lights on at night .",Nice reader for the price !;;;;;;

Review: Great reading device. I bough it because I wanted a place to have my books and take my library everywhere I want. It feels like reading a book. No glare and no back light. It takes some time to get used to but once you get used to it but it is fantastic. I am reading more than before thanks to this device. Battery last for a week. I wanted a Kindle Fire Pro but for a reason that I don't know Amazon does not ship Fire Pro's to Puerto Rico. So i finished buying this device. But is good.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"We've used all sorts of tablets but not a kindle so we tried the least expensive one when it was on sale. I have to say I really like it, even though its the cheapest option. Its fairly easy to use, easy to read in the light and extremely light. Its something we can take with us wherever and you never have to worry about storage or battery life. Would recommend a kindle to anyone who even marginally likes to read, travels, etc.",Perfect for any type of reader;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I really like this product. I can take it anywhere with me. I small enough to put into my bag and light enough that I barely know its there. Super convenient to take on flights or road trips. I wish it had a built-in light so that I can read it when it gets dark out. I need a flashlight to see. Overall, I am very satisfied with this product. It is also very durable. Im very careful with my valuables, but accidents do happen and it had hit the floor twice (tile) and it didnt do any damage. Very pleased with that as well, where with an iPad it would have been damaged.",I enjoy it very much.;;;;;;

Review: It was given to me by my son and I love it. I never thought I'd enjoy not having a book in my hand but I can hardly put my Kindle down.  So manybooks to choose from and are instantly added to my Kindle.

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"I prefer my Chromebook since it's color, has email and web, while light and enough battery for use around the house unplugged. The Keyboard acts as a nice prop for reading in bed, on the couch or at a table.So I bought the Kindle for outside the house where the super-long battery life is required (backpacking and international travel).What I don't like about Kindle is that books I have checked out from my local public library can't be returned when finished (or unfinished if I've decided I don't want to read it), and they count against my limit at the library so I can't check out something new until the 3 week lending period expires.I also don't like that I can't read The Economist (a news magazine I pay for) using their app on my Chromebook, and the Kindle. I have to choose between the two devices (and it costs more on the Kindle, and is in black and white, so I read it on my Chromebook which is fine most of the time except when traveling when the longer battery life would be make Kindle a better choice).",Best outdoors or when traveling;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a very basic e-reader which is exactly what I wanted to go with my Kindle Fire..I use in bright daylight as there is NO glare and can read when my Fire is charging.  My generation 2 Kindle died and I had been using it as mentioned.  After a week, I decided I wanted this backup.  Very affordable.  Works great as simply an e-reader.",Kindle basic reader;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Fortunately I bought this as a back up for my paperwhite when the battery needs recharging and I want to continue reading while it charges..  I did not realize it was not lighted which has already been a problem for me when I was trying to read at night in a car.  Otherwise, it does what I need.  The extended battery life is for reading 30 minutes a day so it doesn't last weeks but in airplane mode it does last a good amount of time, as does the paperwhite.",Didn't notice it lacked a built in adjustable light like the paperwhite;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love the kindle. Seriously, I love it. First of all, it is great for keeping me focused on my reading because there is only the option of reading. I always read on my kindle instead of my iPad, because of 5 reasons...1: The kindle has the backlight, so there isn't glare, making it very easy for me to read books, even at the beach. The iPad? Not so much.2. It's so light! The iPad is very heavy, but this fits in my purse, backpack, you name it!3. Free books! (A Christmas Carol, for example.  My brother and sister read it over holiday break)4: It's so easy to change the settings on the Kindle. They offer about 8 different fonts, brightness level and shows how many more minutes in the chapter.5: Through the public e-library, I can download books from the huge e-library database onto my kindle and rent them for up to 3 weeks! It is so useful, its just like the regular library, downloads within seconds onto my kindle. Perfect. know other products do this, but it is so useful! I love the kindle, definitely recommend it!",Everything I Love About This Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am writing this from the perspective of being a long-time experienced Kindle user vs. someone brand new. From an overall perspective, considering the pricing of the Kindle with Special Offers at $79 vs. higher amounts for the different flavors of Kindle available today, this one is a bargain. If you have wanted to get your kids a Kindle to encourage reading as well as sharing of books but hesitated because $119 to $400+ is a lot of money to risk with a child, maybe at $79 this is your price point.From a size standpoint, the reading screen is the exact same size as the other e-Ink Kindles. It is slightly thicker - but slightly lighter - than the Kindle Paperwhite, but to me it's not really a noticeable difference when you're holding it in a protective cover.Opening up the box, included with the Kindle is a micro-USB cord but no power adapter. That's really annoying.
