Interestingly, and it seems rather chicken of Amazon, a power adaptor has to be purchased separately for $15 if you purchase it at the same time as you purchase the Kindle (or $20 if you purchase it later), so if you already have a micro-USB charger handy I wouldn't order one of the chargers.There are no page buttons - no buttons at all except for the power button - and turning the page is as easy as tapping the side of the screen with your thumb while you're reading, or swiping the screen with your finger.Reading is easy on this one: in comparison to my Kindle Keyboard, the previous version of Kindle, and a Kindle DX the letters on the screen are much, much darker and easier to read: the display is crisp and dark",I love it;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchased this new Kindle to replace my old Kindle (Gen 2 or 3) because that one was having black screen issues and getting stuck when paging forward.MISTAKE. This ""new"" Kindle is so frustrating. I dislike that my items are on the cloud, I dislike that if I move a book to a collection it still shows up in recent and it doesn't show me the entire description of the name of the book that would include the book number in the series.I was willing to deal with the ad's, the no WIFI, but when I'm connected and trying to move my read books to READ books...nope. It duplicates the effort.The touch screen isn't conducive to a left hand page turner.Overall I wish I hadn't purchased this Kindle, I've fought using my Galaxy S Tablet for reading but I guess I'll have to suck it up. This Kindle isn't gong to work.",Should have read the negative reviews first.;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"It's easy to read, but every few pages it goes to a page where it says, Kindle is restarting,"" or something like that.  I then have to wait about 40 seconds for it to do its thing.  Then it takes me to a page that's about fifteen pages *before* the page I was on.  So I have to keep tapping on the screen to get up to where I was. In addtion, there's no page number listed.  I may go back to regular books.",Keeps leaving page and re-starting;;;;;;

Review: Love this kindle.  I have problem with dry eyes and reading makes that worse especially with the newer computer screens but this kindle is just like reading a real paper book and easy on the eyes.  I love I can adjust the print bigger so reading is a breeze.  I would definitely recommend for reading books for pleasure but I would not  recommend for books with pictures or reference books that you need to be referring back and forth.  I had ordered a book with a lot of diagrams and they were hard to see so I ended up ordering the hardcover edition.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love it! Wasn't sure I'd like swiping to turn the page, but I'm so used to it from my iPad that it took about 2 seconds to be glad the buttons were gone. I really prefer the screen with no backlight for reading, especially at the beach. I was one of those people who said, ""Oh, I'll always be a ""real"" book person,"" and, looking back, I think, ""How ridiculous."" The Kindle is SO much better for someone who goes through lots of books. I just wish my local library got with the program and spent more on digital loans as opposed to paper books, CD's, and desktop computers.",Third Kindle - still better!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Since it was on sale ($59) I had to get it.The best part about it probably the battery life (aside from the price). It seems to last forever.I've tried to read books on a laptop, tablet and a smartphone before and I often get eye strain from staring at the screen or get easily distracted. With the Kindle, this is not a problem. The experience feels like reading a real book and you don't have text messages, emails or push notifications bothering you.I like touch interface and minimal design. The interface does get some time to get used too since it's not it doesn't respond immediately like a tablet or smartphone would.Digital Books on Amazon are more convenient to get than the physical books since I can just download them on the Kindle. No need to carry thick, heavy books in my bag anymore. The Kindle is small and easily portable. Sometimes it's cheaper to get the digital books too, which makes a big incentive to get the Kindle anyway.I also like how I can read a book on my computer running the Kindle app and then opening the same book on another device would ask me if I would like to pick up where I left off.",Great Reading Experience;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had been searching EBay looking for a good deal on a used Kindle.  Most of those sold at auction were selling for almost full retail of a new unit.  I happened upon this offer for a Refurbished Kindle and jumped on it.  Received order promptly.  Item is in perfect condition and have enjoyed reading with it for the past week!  Love my new Kindle.  it's light, small enough to handle easily, and easy on the eyes!  This is the current version of Kindle.  Doesn't have a back-light.  But, I do not find that to be an issue.  If I were reading a printed book I would need to use an external lamp to read in dim light.  Prior to using my Kindle I was reading using the Kindle ap on my iPad.  This works great, but gets a bit heavy to hold after a while, and is really hard to see in bright sunlight.  The Kindle is a perfect fit for me!",Refurbished Kindle - good buy!;;;;;;

Review: This was a significant improvement over the button-based model that I have been using for 2 years. Page flips are noticeably much faster. I can read leisurely for hours on end. Thank you Amazon!
Title;;;;;;: This was a significant improvement over the button-based model that ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love everything about it. I love that I have a trillion books to choose from in MY favorite genres. I love that they were all FREE from the library or other sites. The Kindle weighs the same (or lighter) than paper books, keeps my spot, the charge has lasted me one full week so far and I hear that it can last up to 2.5 weeks with regular nightly use. I love that I don't have to worry about lack of space to store my books. I'm looking forward to sharing my books with my friends. I love that I can sit anywhere in my very bright apartment where I have windows floor-to-ceiling without a glare! I'm looking forward to sitting on my balcony and at the beach, too. I can't do that with my Kindle Fire or my Ipad or my cell phone.I bought the Elsse For Kindle 6"" Glare Free - Folio Case Cover for Kindle (7th Generation), Dark Blue. This rich, quality leather cover is a perfect fit without adding a ton of weight.",Love!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had the 2nd generation Kindle a long time ago and gave it to my mom, and I upgraded to an iPad. I have used the Kindle app for years on my Android phone, on my desktop computer and now on my iPad. However, I noticed I was not really enjoying reading full books on my iPad. Partly it's the distraction of all the other things pinging me (Facebook, email etc) but also the backlighting was causing eye strain. So, when a sale came up on the nice little pocket sized Kindle, I grabbed it. So happy I did! Very light weight, perfect for purse and daily train commute (I was always scared to haul out my huge iPad especially with the thefts going on), and I can jam through a book much faster. I like the improvements they made in the navigation, much easier to flip pages. I'm delighted, will enjoy this tremendously. BTW I got my mom a Fire later, but she never used it. I am happier I think with this book-specific device.",Why buy yet another device when the app is free? Here's why;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I had a keyboard kindle for many years, and am now trying to find a replacement. I now use my Kindle Fire Hd. When I received this tiny little kindle it felt like a child's toy.  I had no trouble with registration, tho it is different, nor was there any glitch with transferring all content.  First, I do not like the type of Homepage. You can only see a few books at a time. Pulling them up requires several different moves. Other content such as ""definition"" constantly pop up when barely hovering over a word. Secondly, the most annoying feature, in swiping A  page, many many times it will swipe several, then going back, it will swipe many more. So I constantly have to be aware of the percent sign at the bottom of the page. That is VERY interrupting to reading fluidly. I am giving up and going to see about returning it. It is way too much trouble, something I never experienced with my Kindle with buttons, or my Fire with swiping.",Not your mother's kindle.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Great basic e-reader.  I received mine as a Christmas present.  It is everything it is advertised to be.  It has 4G of memory with approximately 3G available for storage. I currently have some 1200 books on mine with some 40 or so being textbooks with roughly 1200 - 1600 pages and another dozen or so being multi volume sets..............7 to 13 books per set.  And I still have roughly half of the available memory left..........1.524G to be exact.  The lack of a light was a known factor and like some have noted, a book doesn't have a light so just reading with a lamp on solves the problem or obviously it is not a problem in daylight or bright light.  The unit does a good job and is easy to read and operate.I find I actually read more with this than with my tablet since there are no interruptions from being able to go online and do other browsing.  It allows me to read uninterrupted.",Nice basic e-reader;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my 3rd Kindle Paperwhite.  I loved my first one, then it inexplicably died.  I replaced it with the current model at the time, which I never liked.  Then that one died (the curser wouldn't work so I couldn't pick a book etc.).  So I was hesitant to replace it, but it is a good deal better than the other model and easier to use.  Also easier to order more books.  I also had the first model of the Kindle Fire, which stopped charging, which is a huge disappointment as I like the option of the light for reading at night.  My husband still has the first model of the Kindle Paperwhite and it still works great, so I decided to try again.",3rd time's the Charm?;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"My daughter got a basic Kindle 3 years ago, then my son got one 2 years ago. I've been using theirs & they got sick of me hogging it.I bought this the week before Valentine's for $79, then saw it was on sale for $59 a few days later. I contacted Amazon & since the sale price was within 7 days of the delivery of my item they quickly refunded me $20. Score! Yay Amazon! I love being able to tap the page to turn it, very easy when I am lying in bed reading. Easy to navigate and figure out. These seem to go on sale with any/every holiday out there, so keep an eye out if you are in the market. None of our Kindles have ever had a problem. These are a no brainer for kids. My only gripe is that while both my kid's Kindles were able to download some games, like Sudoku & such, this new one doesn't have that option. I wonder why?",Love it!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchased this even though I have a fire. Due to the distractions that happen while I am trying to read on my fire I purchased this on ""prime day"" since it was such a good deal.I have been wanting to get back to just me and my book for a while!! Also since a good part of my day is spent outside in my yard ""relaxing"" with my kids, I love the no glare easy on the eye reader!! I have a couple of recommendations;" when you purchase
Review: include an e reader booklight
Title;;;;;;: this little guy doesn't have a back light! You can get your whole library on this and I love that! All in all
column4: I am so happy with this and happy to read distraction free!!""
column5: Love this little reader!";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I used to be an avid reader in middle and high school but the stress of college put pleasure reading as very last on my list, if it ever made it at all. Another change was that I got an iPhone my sophomore year and from then on I was proponent of consolidation and having as much as possible in one easy to access place (music, games, email, etc.) I think having this preference and mentality made it worse for reading as a book was just anthoer bulking thing to add to my book bag. At last, I asked for a Kindle as a late late Xmas/birthday gift and it's been the best gift I've received so far. My favorite part is how you're able to track your reading progress. It's lightweight, easy to store, has all the books I could ever want, and there's never any chance of ruining the book. I always hated and lamented ruined books. Finally the ease of purchasing books is the best feeling ever! All in all, I'm glad to become an avid reader once again.",I'm an avid reader again!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have owned a Kindle since the first ones came out.  I accidentally dropped my reader and needed a replacement. Love that I was able to pick this up on Prime Day at a reduced cost.  I've had to adapt a bit to the touchscreen, but it is very much like a smartphone.  The screen improvements since my first one make it even easier to read. Like no clicking to turn the page. That sound can be annoying if my husband is trying to sleep while I'm reading. I'm very pleased with this Kindle Touchscreen.  I also purchased an Elisse case from ProBiz to protect it as I travel. So like not having the bulkiness of having to carry books to read.",Replacement Kindle and It's Improved;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Owned two Nooks before this one. I adapted to it pretty well.-1 Star due to the annoyance of the touch screen, it can crowd you out of enjoying your novel when you accidentally touch the screen.",I adapted to it pretty well. -1 Star due to the annoyance of ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my sixth Kindle, so I was expecting a good product and that's what I got.  Excellent product, very intitive. I love the instant start feature when you use cover.  I recommend you splurge and get the reading light, it can be a little difficult to read in bed otherwise.",Happy Reading;;;;;;

Review: Greatest device ever made! Already paid for itself after 5 books. Wish i had known about this device years ago then I would have saved a whole lot of money instead of buying books that are doing nothing but sitting pretty in my bookshelf. Bitter sweet almost. But most of all I find myself reading a kindle far easier than an actual book. And this coming from a guy who loves the heavy hardcover editions too.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I like this Kindle.  I previously owned the very first Kindle model, but it was dropped which killed the screen and had to be replaced.  Maneuvering on that model was super simple.  It's not simple and intuitive on this model.  And what I HATE is that, like with so many other things that are manufactured these days, a physical instruction manual doesn't come with it.  Even a quick reference guide would be better than nothing.  I can't tell you how many times I touched something unintentionally, and it wasn't obvious or easy finding my place again as it was on the old model.  On this thing you have to use a slider bar to guess where you were and skim pages to figure it out because if you choose ""last page read"" it takes you right back to the wrong page you accidentally arrived at in the first place.  I still haven't figured out how to alphabetize my list of books from the Cloud.  So be prepared.  There is definitely a learning curve that's going to throw you a few curves!",I like this Kindle;;;;;;

Review: It worked fine for a few days and then it locked and remained locked. I have been in touch with the correct departments for trying to repair it. I have been told to return it and have been sent a replacement.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"It was so easy to download all of my books onto my new Kindle. I bought this to read before bed each night, since you're supposed to avoid exposure to the blue light emitted by electronics before you go to bed.  It is easy to hold even with the case I bought. I'm definitely enjoying it....even out in the bright sunshine.",Love this!;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"There is indoor glare on the screen I haven't tried it outside as yet.  Not impressed. PS  the reason it ""seems"" cheaper is that you don't get the $30 ac adaptor like you used to.  Tacky..tacky..tacky...I do like the fact that it is smaller and lighter weight than my old one.  Beyond that..  same old same old.  I got a new one because I absolutely hate the Kindle fire that I got a few years back (it has its uses but I never was happy with it).  and my old tried and true no frills kindle was finally saying ""enough"".",Three Stars;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"My eyes cannot handle LED lighting on computers, smartphones, and similar products. This seventh generation Kindle works well for me and does not give me any eyestrain or headaches. I absolutely love it!",No eye strain with this one;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my new Kindle.  It is much easier on the eyes to read on this than my iPad or Galaxy Tab.  My only complaint and it's minor is there were a couple of times where the Kindle ""froze"" and the font kept going big to small then back to big.  I couldn't stop it and had a difficult time trying to reboot it. But the battery life is pretty good.  I can go several days before I need to charge it.  I also like that it is very lightweight and my wrist doesn't hurt holding it for a long period of time.",I love my new Kindle;;;;;;

Review: I owned the original Kindle and the Kindle Keyboard in the past.  This one is a great improvement over the old e-ink readers.  I didn't consider the Paperwhite or Voyage as they are expensive and feel the Kindle is good enough.  I use my iPad for most things and use the Kindle for reading.  I personally not bothered by lack of backlit screen as I always have a light source in my room.  The Kindle is cheap and easy for traveling and reading a novel.
Title;;;;;;: Good E-Ink reader for the price;;;;;;

Review: Nice tablet.  I am pleased by the ease of managing my books and the easy to read format.  Only draw back is you need a light to read by.  The paper white is not back-lit but that is why the battery lasts for 30 days or more.  I knew that when I decided to buy this.  Much easier on the eyes than reading on a tablet.

I hate it.  My old kindle finally gave way and I am trying to figure out this kindles.  Pages confusing I have order two books by accident.  I don't need to see the covers of the books I have on this kindle the older kindle just had a list with the title and author which was perfect .  When you finished you just send the book to your archives.  I have no idea how to send the books to the archives when finished on this thing.  HELP.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my Kindle reader.  We have two in our family.  If our house was one fire, this would be one of the electronic devices I would grab on the way out.  What a bargain to have so many books at your fingertips.  This is much easier on the eyes than reading on a tablet, laptop, etc.  Of course it doesn't have the wow factor of an iPad (we have four of those), but as an inexpensive e-reader, you can't beat it.  It's so nice to have all your books handy and no need to dedicate closet space to them anymore.  :)",A great e-reader!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Good reader, easy to take places, easy to read on. Disappointed by the non-lit screen, although it works well for my child -- she should not be turning on devices after the lights are off anyway. The screen is rather slow, so the browser is only useful in a pinch. Have not tried the calendar yet. It's really a book. For me as an adult, sometimes reading while putting a child to sleep, I would upgrade to the back-lit version.","Good reader, easy to take places";;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"Perhaps  I am overlooking some advantages that this Kindle might have, however I find this Kindle not nearly as satisfactory as my pervious two Kindles. It is difficult to operate and is confusing!! Frankly I would prefer my last Kindle to this one.",Perhaps I am overlooking some advantages that this Kindle might ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"After years of thinking I wouldn't like an e-reader, I finally broke down and purchased one. So far I love it! The screen is very easy on the eyes and I love having easy access to various Kindle books on amazon.",After years of thinking I wouldn't like an e-reader;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I am a big fan of the Kindle. I've owned every model since the 2nd one. This was somewhat of a disappointment. No audio, and it wont run any of the games I had on previous models. Plus, it has the deeper screen so there is an edge all the way around the screen which likes to trap dust, lint, crumbs. The only thing this ereader will do is display text and allow highlighting, that's it. I still believe the best model Kindle ever released is the one currently called the Kindle Keyboard with the extendable light from the corner of the optional case.",more features disappear with this ereader.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I really like the paperwhite Kindle.  There are a few ease of access issues and all kindles seem to desperately want you to use the Cloud drive now, but I love the lack of eye strain and the huge memory.  Really, I can put loads of books on there.  I hate touch screens and all those finger marks that go with them, but this one isn't all that bad as far as they go.  It must be the glare free screen, the the finger marks are not as bad.  I don't much like the adds but they can be ignored just fine.  It is so lightweight and small (about like some paperbacks) I can just stick it in my bag.",Mostly good;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Great for reading during the day. So many free or almost free books available. The only thing I think is off about it they claim the adds do not drain the battery. I knew I wasn't going to use it for a while so I charged it and left it for about 4 weeks. When I used it again, the battery was almost completely drained. So either the adds do drain it, or the battery loses it charge in about a month. Either way I still love it, I would recommend you wait till its on sale. Its a little high for just a reader, but you can justify it if you read a ton of free books.",Great;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am big on saving papers, having all my mails as electronic mails and trying to convince my professors that i will submit all my work online not hand in papers. This saved my life and my shoulders . This is not the old days that you carry a bag full with books . That big chemistry book and all those lap notes and papers. I love it. I have been using it for almost 2 years now and it works AMAZING . Very cheap . Very hard build . It will last a long time .",Save Paper / Save Trees / Save Mother Nature;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"To bad each gen has different covers that fit properly.  it is a little hard to find what Gen you product is.  and not all covers are advertised with the same name or style description. Some Gen, some name, some unclear.  too bad there is not a code or number to clear up what you own and the same code on the cover for a sure fit.  I really do not want to know all about when or what Gen it is. Just want to protect it and have fun using the kindle.",To bad each gen has different covers that fit properly;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Great upgrade!!! I had the older kindle;" I bought it to replace older model because I liked the fact that it was touch screen and it was so easy to set up.  The only con is that the home page font is a tad smaller to read and this is not adjustable but everything else is great
Review: the light weight makes it so comfortable and screen display is perfect in the day time to read.  I love it!""
Title;;;;;;: What a difference!!! Touchscreen and lightweight make it so comfortable to read.";;;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"I finally like it now that I've figured out how to install the books I purchased.  Amazon really could have made things more user friendly for a novice like me.  The ""help"" topics took me in circles until I was near tears with frustration after several hours.  Once I figured it out, I was fine, but there was no way to ask a simple question from a live person.  For that reason, I would recommend that newbies like me start with a Nook or some such, which is purchased in an actual store with live people who are willing to help.","For a novice, it was hard to get started";;;;;;

Review: I am pleased with it. One reason I purchased it. I am going over seas and needed something light weight.I did not want to carry a large amount of books. This is perfect.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I'll be comparing this to the other two Kindles I have experience with - the Keyboard and the Paperwhite.First order of business: This does not have a light! Sorry, it's just that so many people seem to think it has a light, when it clearly states that it doesn't. If you want a light, get a Paperwhite (they're great, too).This simple little Kindle was a deal (crazy sale) that I couldn't pass up, as I knew I'd need a replacement for my Keyboard model anyway. I also need something to slip into my bag so I can read while I'm waiting or sitting in a coffee shop or commuting.Screen size: About the same on all three models. This makes sense, but I decided to mention it.Resolution: The resolution is better than that of the Kindle Keyboard (again, this makes sense since it's a later model of Kindle) and almost as good as the Paperwhite.Color/Brightness: This isn't a tablet, so there wouldn't be any color (I've seen it mentioned in other reviews, which is why I mention it here). The screen appears as bright as the Kindle Keyboard - that is, it looks like the page of an open book. It is not as bright as the Paperwhite, so there is not as great a contrast. This isn't a complaint, though, since the Paperwhite is always lit (when I compared, I had the light setting down as low as it could go) and by nature will always be brighter.Page Turn: I miss my buttons, but the touch screen is nice as well. The Kindle 6"" that I'm reviewing here seems to have a very sensitive touchscreen, as compared with the Paperwhite. This means that if you brush against it, it might go forward or back a page or two. I fixed this by getting a cover and closing it when I'm not immediately reading. Really, that's all it took.Speed: I had no issues. It was quite quick to load whatever I wanted.Collections: You can import your collections from your cloud, though you'll have to download each book individually. This was actually a good thing, since I'm realizing I don't need ALL of my books on my device all the time. Heh, maybe that has something to do with how fast this thing is.End grade: 4.5 stars, rounded up. I'm biased, though. I just really love the Kindle (and I'm still amazed at how many free books there are).Added: If any issues come up, I'll amend this review.",Very Happy;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Ok, I'm giving it four stars because it works well. But I only use it as a backup because, believe it or not, that back light is a very important feature, and this Kindle does not have it. I bought it, thinking that I can just read it like a book with the lights on, but, it's not that easy. After having a back lighted Kindle for so long ( I thought it died, which is why I bought a new one - it didn't really, it was just frozen - so maybe it's in the process of dying? Anyway....) Going to this one was too much of a hassle. So I wound up buying a new Paperwhite within a couple weeks. I didn't return this one though, because there's nothing wrong with it - as long as the light is on.  :)",Good but not Great;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"First Kindle eReader I have used. In short it does what I wanted it for to read books outside. Through a free service and Amazon I have 300+ books on it in less than a week. It was easy to learn to use this Kindle Touch. I have 4 other tablets  from Apple, Samsung, B&N Color, and RCA. They all have their uses in the family, but none are good outside in Texas. I do miss the the audio books on this model when we made our last trip down from Alaska to Texas. We were forced to load them to our navigation device for the hours of no or bad radio signal areas. This of course didn't sync with the Kindle so we had to find where we left off to read on in the Kindle from the Audio in the car.","Great eReader for outside reading, this is not a Tablet !";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm an old school kindle user.  I had the one with the page buttons on the side of the unit.  I like the new version but....the touch screen takes getting used to in order to turn the pages.  I usually hold with my left hand and you can't turn the page with one hand with that hand because you have to swipe or touch the right side.  So it's a two hand unit for me.  Could be worse things I guess!  But I long for my page buttons....Otherwise the unit is very clear, keeps cool to the touch outside which is a plus over the previous unit and has some additional features that are very helpful as well.",I like the new version but;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I use this Kindle ALL the time. I've had it for about 4 months now and don't go anywhere without it. Although it is slightly slow to transition between pages in the Kindle store, the benefits are definitely worth it. It is easy to read, especially when I need to adjust the size of the print. Additionally, there is no glare at all when I read outside! Much easier to carry around than books too when I go on vacation.",Great buy!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am SO Thrilled That I purchased THIS eReading Kindle Device. Now I've spent litterally hours reading from it one of the numerous books I have located in my kindle library. I use my Fire(s) [HDX, and 2 Fire Phones] to do other important (to me) things/crap/garbage/what-not! But with this I worry Not about having to recharge it due to spent battery power by leaving it on or paused because it automatically turns itself off or powers down to conserve NRG. My favorite feature I believe! LoL  Now to find and purchase a case to keep it cozy before too terribly long down the time road. . . LoL Always A Pleasure Working Shopping With Amazon . Com & It's affiliate merchants! Amazon Is The Only Place 2 Shop!! ! !! *in my opinion obviously! thanks always Again! Always,  LeAnne M Pruitt  1603 Quail Run  Muskogee, OK 74403-8456  (918) 577-2027","ABSOLUTELY BEST PURCHASE EVER!! I own numerous Kindle devices , 2 Fire Phones, 1 HDX, 2 keyboards, but THIS IS THE BEST eREADER";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"What a lightweight easy to read Kindle! I got mine with a special offer which made it even more sweet! For traveling, going to the beach, or just taking to the office, this Kindle will not let you down.",What a lightweight easy to read Kindle;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I didn't like the touch screen as well as the key board. The touch screen was too sensitive, would jump to other screens if I touched it on the screen. I returned my touch screen, and purchased a used key board Kindle.",I didn't like the touch screen as well as the key board;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I had the old Kindle with the buttons on the side. Unfortunately I broke that one and bought this one as a replacement, since that style was no longer offered. I like the touch screen because I can look up words I don't know on the fly, however I really miss the buttons on the side to turn the page. I feel like I am constantly changing the font size, turning pages, or opening menus on accident with the touch screen. Also, I can't turn the page back if I am holding with my right hand. I miss the old Kindle, or a hybrid of the two would be nice. However, since that isn't currently a purchasing option, this one is fine for what is available.",Miss the old Kindle.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm a tech horder. Basically something new comes out that's rather affordable and I buy it. I didn't actually ""need"" the kindle cause I have my phone and my iPad but I got it to read in direct sunlight at the beach. I think for this it's amazing.I've never owned a kindle before so I cannot compare models but for a first-time, occasional user, I think it's great. I don't know what it would be like if I read everyday but I'll update as I use it more frequently.",Everything I Expected;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"When I first started playing with this, I thought what a piece of junk. But, after I got the feel of it, I enjoyed it. If you think you are getting an iPad for cheap, think again. An iPad it is not. It is a reader- an alternative to paper. It has a very basic Internet browser (subtract a star), but hard to use. I found this great for kids because it is bomb-proof and cheap (add a star). It doesn't have a back light so you can't read it at night or in the car (subtract a star) The parental controls are minimal, but I can see if my kid is ordering off Amazon as I get emails. It took awhile to figure out how to borrow from the public library. Amazon now gives $1 credit if you choose longer shipping, so that is a plus for book purchases. Kindle books generally run a dollar less than paperback.",Great for kids!!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have bought 5 Kindles now. Each one has been handed down to the kids for movies, games, and whatever kids do now. My needs are simple, I want a place to store reference manuals, books, and documents. I need it small enough to be able to always have it handy. I don't want any extra do-dads that will inspire my teens to acquire and hijack my kindle. Most of all it has to be tough for the work shop. This is simple, tough, light, affordable, and saves a lot of room and weight for all I need to carry. It proved its worth in just the last 4 day trip I took. Great focus, long battery charge, recharges quick, and I have no one whining to use it. What else could you ask for?",Beyond expectations;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I only bought this Kindle because my old one kept quitting on me. Then I would have to reboot it, sometimes spending several minutes to get it to respond. Sometimes it would decide to reboot itself in the middle of me reading. This new Kindle might be great for someone just starting out but I had every thing organized in categories and then I had to try and duplicate that organization in my new one. The books are in the ""cloud,"" whatever that means, so I have to try to find them and download them. Anyway it is way too much trouble. I will keep plugging away on my old Kindle. I am just glad the new one didn't cost much. It will now just sit in a drawer unless I can find someone to give it to.",Old Kindle much better for me;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have a Kindle HDX 8.9 inch that I love and carried with me everywhere, however, because of the size it forced me to carry a larger purse than was always convenient. Also, I was very nervous about using the HDX around water, such as at the nail salon or in the bath tub, which are two of my favorite places to catch up on my reading. I'd considered purchasing the basic Kindle reader for these purposes but wasn't motivated to follow through until it was recently on sale for $59. I am enjoying it much more than I expected! It takes up very little room in my purse, even in its case. Wi-Fi speed is super-fast, easy to navigate, the touch screen works great , and it has a lot more bells and whistles than I was expecting, It would have been a great buy even at the regular price of $79.",Great Back-Up Kindle To My HDX;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had resisted buying an e-reader for a while. I love to read and I always have, but for some reason e-readers just felt wrong to me. I didn't think they would read like a book, and they seemed too expensive to justify the purchase compared to the $6-$8 per title I tend to spend on used books. I tend to have a couple books I'm reading at any given time and I like to bring them everywhere with me, and it was getting increasingly harder to shove 3-4 paperbacks into my laptop bag everyday to make sure I had something to read everywhere I went, so with the price of e-readers coming down I thought I'd check them out.I found this refurbished Kindle for around $60 so I ordered it. I've used it every day since. I love it. It's super convenient to be able to bring such a huge library with me from place to place in such a small package. And to my surprise, it really does read like a book. I don't feel like I'm looking at a screen. The electronic ink is really easy on the eyes and looks just like the page of a book. I've been reading on it for at least an hour and half every day since I've gotten it.If you're already a very active reader and are considering getting an e-reader, I would give this a try. It really does feel like a book.",Glad I jumped on the bandwagon;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"The recent black Friday sales on this unit convinced me to purchase a replacement for a five year old Kindle that was losing contrast (or maybe it was my eyes). At any rate the glare free unit is small, but with a viewable screen the same size as my original. How? the touch screen capability replacing the side direction keys and the keyboard. The readability is darn near amazing, allowing these old eyes to read in subdued light. I personally do not find the ads to be a problem, especially since you can turn the screen to blank if you desire. I find most of the ads interesting as they generally refer to books I might like to read. Battery life is good, but it is too early to tell if this will last. The unit is very light (hence the battery concern) and very portable. The charger cube does not exist on this unit, but since it is a micro usb, your phone changer will likely work. Charging time appears to be reasonable, I had approx. two week of reading nightly, which showed about half battery usage. It recharged to full (indicated by the green LED display along the bottom edge, in about an hour. I would recommend to a friend , especially at the sale price.","Price performance winner, in my opinion.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Just now, I accidentally threw my Kindle across the cafeteria. The device popped out of my bag when I was swinging it off my shoulder and it flew at least six feet in the air. It hit the concrete hard. It should have broken. The screen shouldn't have been working after that incident. But it did. There were no marks on the device when I picked it up and thoroughly examined it. This Kindle is well built.The only downside I've had so far is the touchscreen. Often when I'm reading, I bump the screen and the pages switch or the font changes sizes. Sometimes I wish it still had buttons and a feature to disable the touchscreen when reading. However, the touchscreen is very good for annotating. Looking up words, highlighting important passages, clicking on bits to look up a wikipedia article are all useful features.+ construction+ touchscreen features- touchscreen sensitivity",Threw my Kindle onto concrete. It was fine.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"It's a lot faster than the Kindle Keyboard and I haven't had any issues with turning pages - some persons have complained about accidental page turns, but then I also have it in a case (Elsse for Kindle 6) because I like to have cases for my tablets and e-readers to provide additional protection and to make it easier to read.It is short and most likely because of the shortness it appears unusually thick.The one gripe I have so far is that I set it up with a passcode which I have to enter, but instead of automatically unlocking the Kindle, I still have to swipe across the screen to open!",Good reader;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I really enjoy this Kindle.I like using the look up for words with which I'm unfamiliar.I like being able to easily find out who a character is, as I'm not remembering the minor characters as well as I did as a youngster.  I like using this function to get a bit more historical data on real characters, as well.The reading surface easily accommodates dim to bright light.I also like being able to swipe or touch the screen to turn a page. It used to be difficult to go between my Kindle and my tablet because I wanted to swipe my older Kindle.  ;" D""
Review: Makes for a good reading experience.";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this Kindle to replace my previous Kindle, which I had owned for more than three years.  The previous Kindle had buttons on the side to page back and forth and handle other actions on the device, and I was admittedly hesitant to buy this one due to having all functions on a touchscreen instead, especially since I have large fingertips.  Thankfully, I have had no problems using any of the functions on this device, and I also like its faster speed and larger storage capacity.The one drawback, which is admittedly very minor, is pressing a button to wake up the device, and then still needing to swipe the screen to actually use the device.  To me, this two-step process seems to be needless - but again, this is only a very minor issue.",Very Nice Replacement for an Old Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am really enjoying my Kindle. It's a plain vanilla basic version with no light, but that's fine with me. If it's dark I'll read it with a regular light just like a book. It's easy to read and use and I can see that it's going to become a good companion whenever I travel too.",Fun to Use!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I use it all the time, much easier to use then carrying a book around and you can free up space at home with this reader.  Remember though this is just for reading.  It is a no frills reader that is very convenient.  From a reading aspect it is awesome and the brighter the location the better.  Best part is the battery.  As the ad said I only need to charge is every few weeks and charges very quickly.I have found it simpler to shop for my kindle books via my computer, but you can access the store through the kindle too.",From a reading aspect it is awesome and the brighter the location the better;;;;;;

Review: I had heard and read that the Kindle with the paperwhite could cause problems with sleep patterns. I had been reading at night primarily and was having insomnia. That is why I ordered the Kindle glare free screen. It also had the touch screen that I had with my other Kindle. I have really been happy with this purchase. I no longer have the insomnia and have all the  touch screen ability of my other Kindle. This new Kindle also has a long battery life.Over all I am very happy with this purchase.
Title;;;;;;: I have really been happy with this purchase;;;;;;

Rating: 2.0 out of 5 stars,"Loved my first Kindle with the keyboard.  I am not as happy with this one. Grip: All the books are stored in the cloud (what ever that is) with no separation from books that have been read. If one is a voracious reader, at book a day or at least 4 books a week. There is no longer an ""Archive"" for books read only the cloud.  I have a little over 1600 books. Books that are removed from ""Device"" return to the cloud and are first in the queue. This system forces me to dig through everything I have already read to find new reading material.  It will skip several pages, at once, if care is not taken when trying to turn pages. The images of the bookcovers are so small it is almost impossible to read the titles when looking at queued books. With any type of vision impairment it would be impossible. I preferred having the list of unread books written out in order of purchase or in sequence if a series. Yes it is smaller as there is no longer a keyboard. It is a bit lighter but not enough to hold with just one hand IF one is older and arthritic. All in all, I would love to have my old Kindle back or at least have the option of replacing with that same model.  Sorry Amazon, you blew it with this one.",Loved my first Kindle with the keyboard;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've never owned an e-reader before, but am thrilled that I took a leap and tried this one.  It's not the same as paper books, but there are lots of advantages that a paper book can't offer.  I can get books instantly from the library whenever I want.  I can find out the meaning of a word at the touch of a button.  I can search for the same word or phrase elsewhere in the book.  I can turn the page with a touch of a finger.  I love this device and suspect it will be a long time before I read another novel in paper format.I chose this basic model over the Kindle Paperwhite and am very please with my choice.  The Paperwhite primarily adds front lighting to allow you to read in the dark.  I would rather not read in a dark room anyway and use a bedside lamp at night, so I don't need the light in my Kindle.  The text is extremely clear with the ability to increase font size as desired.  The only difficulty I have had with the device is remembering that the touch screen works like a mouse with single touches in identified locations, rather than like a tablet or smart phone that understands ""swipe"" touches.  This is not a serious issue since there are very few interactions, besides turning pages, that I need to do with the Kindle.  I highly recommend this product for anyone that reads fiction books.",Excellent for novels and library books;;;;;;

Review: I bought this Kindle to replace my first one. I love that it is smaller and lighter which makes it easier to carry in my purse. The one thing that I miss is the way to turn the pages. This is a touch screen and you can only turn the page forward on the right. I much preferred my previous Kindle that had both forward and backwards buttons on both sides. I found that much more convenient.
Title;;;;;;: I love that it is smaller and lighter which makes it ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"It took some getting used to having black and white versus color. But after a week it's not so bad. Going through the user guide is a good idea, due to the differences with this and the Kindle Fire HD I used to have.The internet can be used but it is not nearly the same as using it on a computer, tablet, or smartphone.I like that I can email attachments to the email given for the kindle. I like to keep PDFs and documents on my old Fire HD such as vacation literary.I don't miss playing games or FB, that's what my smartphone and computer are for.",Better features than I thought it would have;;;;;;

Review: I love the idea of it.  Not sure I've mastered all the complexities of it.  Sometimes I have trouble getting the pages to turn - sometimes I don't.  you can enlarge the fonts.  Too many e-books advertised on it.  must have accidentally clicked where I shouldn't have - they downloaded one of the advertised books and charged me $2.00  -  I sent it right back . haven't got the refund yet. just have to be careful in future
Title;;;;;;: I love the idea of it;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have both a Kindle Fire HD and this 7th generation Kindle 6"". I love both of them for different reasons. I take the Kindle 7th generation with me everywhere. It's extremely light and perfectly sized to fit into my purse. The display is easy on the eyes and the touch-screen makes page-turning a breeze. I highly recommend this to anyone looking for a basic, entry-level e-reader.",Love it!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I figured out how it worked in a minute or two, because I am experienced with an IPAD and the original Kindle. It is smaller than the original but I got use to that very fast and I must say the screen is very clear and easy to read. Using the settings by touching on the top took some figuring out but experience told me to try there. I don't know why they changed but I presume it was to get the size and price and the Fireversion is more for those who want to do more to read. My old Kindle broke down and I had to buy the new one. I had no problems downloading books that I have previously bought. Over all I am certainly satisfied. I tried the free book offer that came with it but found the books limited and little that I might want.",satisfied reader;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"The only reason for purchasing this was the death of my first Kindle after years of constant use. I guess everything wears out eventually. I read a LOT, so replacement was necessary and the price was acceptable.Let's talk about the nice things first:1. Size-it's perfect, portable, and fits beautifully in both hand and purse.2. Battery Life-It doesn't seem to need charging as often as my older version did.3. Internet Access-Very handy not having to stop and go online to download a book.Now for the reasons why I'm only giving it 2 stars:1. Touchscreen-Hate! Hate! Hate! Every time I turn around, it changes my page. Even worse, it changes my font size.2. Page Turn Button--I really miss that feature, but the cost of the Oasis isn't justified by that feature alone.3. Home Page-I get it. You want to sell books, but the layout and graphics don't do the books justice, so I end up using my pc to do my browsing.",Kindle-You Can Do Better;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is actually a gift my daughter earned from school.  She is 6 years old.  She has been spoiled with other tablets and doesn't understand why this one doesn't do the same things as the others she has.  However, in a couple years I feel she will learn to appreciate it.  She enjoys reading stories with color and pictures and this is not necessarily suitable for her age because it is missing color and pictures.As an owner of several Kindles, I do like how the screen is glare free compared to the Kindle Fire and Kindle Fire HD.  It is very nice when reading outside how you don't have to keep moving it around to stop the glare from hurting your eyes.  Kindle Fire is great for watching shows/movies and other apps but for actual reading, I like the glare free screen.",Kindle e-reader;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I wish I had picked a different Kindle, instead of this one.  It works good, and I can read my books anywhere.  I have trouble finding my place and, I find, that the instructions are not clear.  I have to search for answers, which takes more time then I want to spend.  I would rather be reading my book.Another complaint I have is that there is no way to make the screen lighter or brighter so I can see the words when I am in a darker place, I have to turn on a lamp or something.Good news is that it works almost like magic when I am outside even in the sun!",Works great outside or in the sun.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have been strongly opposed to all types of e-readers for a long time despite owning all sorts of electronic gadgets. After signing up for Amazon Prime (and thus the added benefits with owning a Kindle) I decided to give it a try. I'm shocked to say I actually love it. I bought the cheaper model just because I already have a tablet. I appreciate the low-tech aspects a lot. Seriously. The fact that it doesn't have a back light makes it feel more like a real book to me. I also found that reading on my phone or tablet made my eyes tired a lot faster than reading a book. This reads a lot like a book to me and I love that. Also, the battery on it is amazing. I always worried that if I used an e-reader the battery would constantly die on me at the worst possible time. I have read 2 entire books on this and still haven't had to charge the battery.",I'm shocked to say I actually love it. I bought the cheaper model just because ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had the very first kindle and I loved the idea of it. about 3 years ago it died completely. It just stopped charging. I decided to get something new and looked at the kindle fire HD.  Previously I bought an i Pad for my dad for Christmas and he loved it. So i decided to get an i Pad as i could use the kindle app and a bunch of other things on it.  I don't regret getting the i pad but I found that I didn't use the kindle app on it as much because reading on it after a while bothered my eyes.  I saw the promotion for this kindle for 29 dollars and thought what the heck I miss my old kindle why not try the new one for 29 dollars.Its a basic kindle e reader it does its basic job well.  I find it easier to navigate over the first kindle. Its nice and small but not too small and lightweight. I have only been using for about 3 hours but I love it.  especially since I wont get distracted by other bells and whistles.  For 29 dollars this was a great purchase.  I have a feeling they may be phasing this model out or getting ready to release a new model.I am not bothered by not having a keyboard or page turning buttons.  Its very basic and that it what I like about it.  I read a review where someone mentioned having the background a little lighter grey and I agree but its nothing a book light or good lighting wouldn't fix.Overall I am thrilled with this purchase at such a great price.  However If I were to pay full price I would probably splurge and get the paper-white. Also I was worried about the ads, but they really don't bother me. I quite like the suggestions that they provide.I decided to get the Infiland Amazon Kindle 2014 7th Gen case for 11 dollars over spending more on a case than I paid for the kindle itself and it isn't perfect but it does its job as well.",Great BASIC kindle on a budget.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This unit is not user friendly.  When I try to hold it in the corners to read, things are always popping up on the screen, the most annoying of which IS THE FONT SIZE MENU WHICH ALWAYS GOES BACK TO THE DEFAULT.  Then you have to bring it up again and reset it.  I don't know why it can't hold the setting you put in when you start reading a book because, as you know, fonts, etc. have to be changed from book to book.  I also don't like that it doesn't have the buttons so that I can play all my old word games.  When this goes bad in two years, which is what I've been told the life expectancy is, I will definitely research all readers before I purchase another.  If you are looking for a reader, I would suggest, if you could, do ""hands on"" research before you buy.",This unit is annoying and not user friendly;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've only had the Kindle for a couple of weeks but I do love it.  Do I miss the feeling for the good old printed books?  Yes, however, the ease of buying books and having them immediately without having to go to a store and buy them or library in hopes that they have the book I wish to read is gone and that's not a bad thing.  Getting my book immediately and for a lower cost than the hard copies is a big plus.  Also the light weight of the Kindle is excellent.  I like to read in bed and my arms and hands no longer get tired or cramped with the Kindle.  So, overall, and so far, the Kindle has lived up to its expectations and I am very pleased with it.  Now, when asked, I can request Amazon gift cards for e-books.  Keeping in mind that I have no other Kindles to compare this to, I do recommend this Kindle because of its' ease of obtaining books immediately and the ease of use.","So far, I love this A(my first) Kindle!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have enjoyed Kindle since 2008 and I don't have one single complaint. I have been fortunate to have 2 kindles previously before receiving this new updated model for Christmas. I love my kindle. It is lightweight and for an avid reader like myself it is just perfect. I don't really like the backlit models because they case some eyestrain. Overall, for the price it is worth every penny.",3rd Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love, love, love my Kindle! When my house was burglarized, thousands of dollars of items were taken. My Kindle was the thing I replaced FIRST. This is my third Kindle. My first was the keyboard version, my second the PaperWhite, and I've now returned to this more original-like, simpler version. I never cared as much for the PaperWhite as I do this one with the elegant, subtle grey-on-grey text to page. I was bummed after ordering because during my 2-day wait, Amazon announced its newer, greater dpi, version of the PaperWhite;" however
Review: as soon as I started reading on my new little elegant Kindle
Title;;;;;;: I was in love all over again. Love this. I even sometimes accidentally flip my Kindle closed at the end of the page because I literally turn the page thinking I'm reading a book. This is not like reading on an iPad. It's like reading a book.""
column4: Love

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Love the functionality of the latest generation of Kindle, but more than I bargained for with the special offers. It is one thing to have them on the sleep screen, but putting banner ads on the bottom of the home screen is annoying. However, the features far outweigh the annoyance.",Great device with too many ads;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Easy to use and great way to hold my books. I am not a tech savvy person, but found this very easy to navigate and was able to turn off all the suggested books on home page to make the Kindle an ad-free tool",Easy to use and great way to hold my books;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Much has already been said about this device so I will keep my comments brief. This was a replacement for a Kindle Keyboard I've had and enjoyed for years. I'm happy I made the switch. I find it easy to use, and when reading it's just as seamless as turning the pages of a paper book - once you are used to the controls the device itself fades into the background, which is the point. I do find that sometimes the touchscreen seems a little finicky;" occasionally it doesn't register a tap for a page turn
Review: or turns more than one page at a time
Title;;;;;;: but this is a pretty minor thing. The other thing that sometimes gets annoying is that
column4: for whatever strange reason
column5: it is too easy to change the font size with a random bump on the screen. Maybe it's just me but if I carry the device with the cover open and my hand slips onto the screen it just seems to always go to the change font menu and I end up with a screen of wonky-sized text.""
column6: Glad I upgraded!";;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I got this because it was on special for Valentines Day, so I can't really comment on the price.Really light weight. Easy to hold. Took me a little while to figure out how to get my 'collections' to download from the cloud, but no too long.Since my first Kindle was the one with the 'QWERTY' keyboard (sorry, can't remember the name), this one is reasonably different to navigate. However, I've also got the Kindle app on my phone, so it's kind of a cross between navigating my old kindle, and navigating on my kindle app.The screen is very clear, the pictures on the 'screensaver' are very crisp, and there is no discernible pixels in the shading, so download any books with pictures should be fine, as long as you're ok with black and white.",Good buy.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am in love with this Kindle. I will be honest, after having issues with my first Kindle (I believe it was the 2nd generation) and then the Kindle Fire, I vowed that I would never buy another Kindle device again. Instead I would just use the free Kindle app on my android tablet or phone. That was before I started having migraines nearly everyday. Reading on a backlit screen, such as my laptop, phone, or tablet made these migraines worse. Being an avid reader I decided to give the Kindle another try.The size and weight of this Kindle is perfect. Its comfortable for both one handed and two handed reading. I have arthritis in my hands so this was really important. The text is crisp and clear. It is so much easier to read than on a tablet or other similar device. It really feels like I'm reading a real book instead of a digital book. The battery life is AMAZING. I binge read 4 rather long books - took me about a week and that battery lasted the whole time. With lighter reading the battery lasts much longer. It's over a week since I last charged it and its only at about 75%. My first Kindle did not have the touchscreen feature and I must admit, I love it!I did try the web browsing, but honestly, if you want to web browse, use a different device. This device is made for reading books, it excels at that. If you are buying it for the option to browse the internet there are plenty of other devices that do that. I suppose the only feature that would be nice on it would maybe be text-to-speech, but its not really missed. It would be easier to listen to audio books on my phone anyway as that is a smaller device and can just sit in my pocket.If you want an excellent e-reader, you can't beat this one. Especially given that the Kindle Store probably contains the most free and discounted books in the market.","Loving my Kindle 6""!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I absolutely love my new Kindle. It is going to be hard to retire my Kindle Keyboard, which has served me very well. However, the keyboard on the new Kindle is much easier to use, and it has more features than the Kindle Keyboard.  The only thing that I am not as crazy about on my new Kindle, is that the edge has been squared off instead of having a more gentle, rounded, sloping edge.  I notice that my husband's Paperwhite also has the more sloping, rounded edge, which is a tad easier to hold. The squared off edge, as Kindle 6"" Glare-Free has, is a tad less comfortable, but I am sure I will get used to it, especially with all of the new features. I guess it is just hard to give up my old friend, the Keyboard.  It became a close companion.  But I look forward to making my new Kindle just as close a companion.",Love It.;;;;;;

Review: I got this because it is super light and small. No it does not have a backlight so I just turn on a light. It is like having a paperback. Since I have the Kindle fire 8.9 this is a great addition when I am running around and want to bring a book to read if I am waiting somewhere or even when I was flying. Just stick it in my purse and ready to go. The charge on this lasts a long time. It does not have all the bells and whistles but still has the dictionary and some nice features. Great kindle for a great price.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Having figured out how the touch screen Kindle works, I really like it.  This is the newer Kindle device that has the same touchscreen as the Paperwhite does, rather than the old buttons on the bottom.  The only differences between this and the Paperwhite is that it doesn't have a light, so its a little smaller and lighter, and the screen resolution is slightly less.  My wife's Paperwhite has 2 MB memory, while the newer Kindles have 4 MB memory.  It is worth it to get the Kindle case with the device as it protects it well, shuts it down when you close it, and turns it on when you open it.  That's much easier to deal with than the little power button on the bottom.  The resolution is quite adequate and reading is easy.","Like the Kindle, 6"" Glare-Free touchscreen display";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought the entry level model at least in part for budgetary reasons and because I just didn't need higher end features. My main ""pro"": even at small sizes the characters are crystal clear and easy to read. That's with bifocals and aging eyes. It's comfortable for reading for extended periods. The lack of a backlight was never an issue for me. It arrived well-packaged. My only complaint is not with the Kindle so much as with touch screens generally. I have some tremors in the ol' hands and sometimes touching the right typing ""key"" is dicey. I won't be doing much text input, but that is another consequence of aging and certainly not a ding on the product. If you don't need or want color or a backlight, get this version. You should be satisfied with it.","Crystal-clear text, even at smaller sizes;" excellent for aging eyes.""";;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Kindle needs a printed ""Quick Start"" leading to the User's Guide. Love the light weight of it. Screen brightness is inadequate for low light reading.",Best part of this new Kindle is the weight!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchased this Kindle back in July primarily because it was a lightning deal for $49.00. My intentions were to either give this one to my wife or replace my older Kindle, and give her that one. After playing around with it for about a week, I decided to give her the new one.For a basic e-reader at the price I paid, it's definitely a good investment. When comparing to my older model however (a Kindle Keyboard 3G), this new one just feels very cheaply built. It's a very lightweight, plastic design that feels almost hollow on the inside. I get the impression it could be even thinner than it is, but the thickness of the design somehow keeps the production costs down.Having been so used to the solid feel of my Kindle Keyboard, and really gaining nothing new or better with this model (in my opinion), I chose to stick with the Kindle Keyboard as my ""go to"" e-reader. My wife has been very happy with this model and it gets the job done. Regarding the ""special offers"" that keep the purchase price lower, I can't see any reason why someone wouldn't be in favor of this. The offers are not intrusive at all and I've actually come across a couple of good reads based on what's displayed while the reader is off.",A Decent E-Reader For The Price;;;;;;

Review: For a strict e reader this product is good. I always use a book light and I can truly say it does have an appearance of a real book which I enjoy. It doesn't have a glare and battery life is outstanding. Been using mine for a solid week for hours at a time and battery hasn't budged. Prices for books on the kindle are also very affordable and cheaper than regular books which is nice.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"i had the first  kindle and this new is much better and the software is elegant to use. the is one problem and that is because the kindle is so light and the edges to hold it so small that i was constantly  touching the screen and turning pages before i wanted. I FOUND THE SOLUTION ""FLYGRIP"". I  found this product and it lets you hold the kindle comfortably, you can manipulate all functions one handed, and you NEVER accidently touch the screen.. this item is as elegant a solution as the kindle software. It was such a great product i bought one for all the cell phones in the family.",... had the first kindle and this new is much better and the software is elegant to use;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I am terrible at reading directions, so I sort of perused the instructions and am fending on my own.  What ever mistakes I make are my own.  However, so far, so good. The device is small enough to carry around much like a soft paper back.  It is so easy to change fonts, go home to find other books if I have to go back to another, or find the author if someone asks, etc.  The presentation of books is what is throwing me off since I was used to a linear look, not books, but I will get used to it (unless I can change this and I haven't noticed how?) That brings me to the other issue of having my books from the first device I owned in the ""cloud"" brought back, some titles I remember, and others I don't...guess I better read the instructions on ""how to"" retrieve these items.  Other than these draw backs, it is a clear and seamless device, as promised, glare-free and easy to use.","Clear, easy, and it grows on you!";;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"My previous Kindle, a basic with the buttons, was far better. It was easy to turn pages by simply pressing a button on the edge. This one often  requires more than one swipe to turn a page. The touch screen is also annoying because a slight wrong touch brings up the font size screen, which seems to automatically select the wrong font. My old Kindle kept a list of books I had read. Not so with this thing. I would certainly buy an original from eBay, but the battery would be questionable. Mine swelled and cracked the case.",was far better. It was easy to turn pages by simply ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Easier to read than the kindle app for phone and other devices (which i intend to keep using), and knows where you left off reading on the last device you were reading.  very handy having all your books together.having the screen never really turn off is a bit unsettling, but the battery does last for weeks, as they describe, so it is OK.",Easy to read.;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I actually returned this product because when I had it in my hands I had trouble reading the screen, it was too dark for me and with no way to back light or turn up the brightness it just wasn't going to work for me at this time. I have vision issues and was hoping to have a kindle that I could read outside but it just strained my eyes too much.  Loved the size and weight though, and for those without vision issues I'm sure it's awesome.  Just didn't work for me.",Did not work for me through no fault of the product;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I initially purchased this kindle because I had lost my older kindle.  However, I was so pleased upon receving it.  First, I was able successfuly to transfer many of my already purchased stories and books to the new kindle with ease.  Second, it fits into my suit pocket, and so I am able to carry it without fear of losing it.  One negative is that the system I must utilize to reach books and stories requires that i go though sales offers every time. I did buy a cover, which is useful as I occasionally drop it.  In my condo, there is wall to wall carpeting, and so that not a problem there.  But when I go out, the cover is very useful.  I have about 160 stories on the kindle, and it will hold many more. I highly recommend a kindle for those of us who really like to read.  This is the best kindle I have owned.",Best Kindle I Have Owned;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I received a Kindle 5-way as a xmas present three or so years ago. I was hooked. I loved it so much that I bought a Kindlefire HDX Wi-Fi with 64 gig of memory for my wife. She was too afraid to use it. But I loved it  The resident geni in the box, makes it the MOST of the very best of any tablet of any brand. I always have both kindles running at the same time 24/7. Amazon's Kindle 5-way is by far the best for finding and buying books. The FireHDX is best at reading them for you. And a thousand other things.The new Kindle Touchscreen screams plastic and cheap. But it has more capacity (I have more than a thousand Titles Any Idea how large the Catholic Encyclopedia is?) and battery life than the 5-Way, and I swear, it is lighter and thinner also.  Amaz0n continues to knock the ball out of the park.",How can other companies compete?;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Kind of disappointing. I thought I was replacing my broken paper white model. This model does not have any illumination like my old one. Also, I was not able to use my old kindle cover on this model. Although it appears to be the same size, it's a bit thicker than my old kindle.",Disappointed.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I absolutely love this Kindle!  It's compact, lightweight, fits in my hands well and the screen print is dark and easy to read.  But most importantly, it's so easy to use!  The touchscreen makes navigation a breeze.  Believe me if I can do it, so can you.  I tend to shy away from trying new gadgets fearing I won't be able to operate them.  I needn't have worried with this Kindle.  Right out of the box, I turned it on and the screen prompts took me through the set up process which took less than 5 minutes.  I currently have a 1st generation Nook that I have loved for years.  But it doesn't compare to the Kindle.  The Nook is larger, heavier, has more navigation steps, the print is so much lighter, and sometimes the formatting is off.  For these reasons, I'm retiring it in favor of the Kindle.  You can't go wrong with this ereader;" I think you'll enjoy it just as much as I enjoy mine.""
Review: Love My New Kindle!";;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"The Kindle Prologue is great for anyone who likes to just read and gets distracted by other apps you have on other devices;" Kindle Fire
Review: iPad
Title;;;;;;: etc.--you can only read on this device--no other distractions
column4: i.e.
column5: games.  The only drawback for some
column6: and it's really not a big deal
column7: is that you can't read it in a really dark room.  It's smaller than most tablets
column8: very portable
column9: and very reasonable in cost.  If you just want to read
column10: this is a good deal.""
column11: The Kindle Prologue is great for anyone who likes to just read and gets ...";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've had a Kindle Keyboard for years and decided to do an upgrade when Amazon had their big sale day a few weeks ago and I can say that I'm really satisfied with the new Kindle. It is a real improvement over the old Kindle I had as it incorporates touchscreen technology and a number of other nice features (X-ray, time left in chapter, etc.) that are included in the Kindle Fire I use at times. The battery life is great although not quite as long as my old Kindle but still weeks vs. days for my Kindle Fire. This is really only a single function device ideally suited for reading and I'm absolutely satisfied with the way the device accomplishes that task.",Ideal device for reading books!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Took me awhile to get used to how to use it and get it set up, mainly using caps and non cap letters on the keyboard. At first it would do only one or the other, and still don't know how I got it to do caps, then switch back to small letters?  This was very much needed when setting it up, as the passwords needed to have both, but I finally got it to do what I wanted.  Was glad my eldest son was here with his and showed me a few of the ropes, though I would have figured it out, by playing around with it.  Haven't used it too much as I am waiting for the carry case... it is a heavy, slippery little bugger, but NICE!  So far, I really like it!  My son carries his in a hard case, and is pretty tough with his.... obviously it looked pretty dirty, but he assured me that in his work truck, it may get dirty and banged around, but the unit itself was in clean perfect condition.  I opted against this type of case as reviews said it was hard to get in, and they didn't know how to get it back out... which my son confirmed.",Was glad my eldest son was here with his and showed ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is our second kindle, as we wore the first one out!  My husband is visually impaired and this product meets his needs and more.  The no glare screen is perfect and the size and weight make it more usable than an iPad  for him.  We will always have a kindle for him.",Meets needs very well.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This was an xmas gift for my sister in law who was always borrowing my old kindle keyboard. I had the kindle fire and mostly used the kindle keyboard which most know is similar reading as a paperwhite, when I read outside as the glare was too much with the kindle fire. So she was elated receiving this. When I set it up for her she became frustrated with the touch screen because she was used to the keyboard so we switched. I love it! The touchscreen is easier I think. She's not a very ""techy"" person. The screen is totally antiglare indoors. I haven't had the opportunity to try it outside yet, its winter here, but I'm sure it's going to be fantastic. I would recommmend it to anyone looking for a basic kindle. As with a regular book you will need adequate lighting to see. This does not come with any back lighting. You can spend more money on the backlit version or just use a book light on the rare ocasssion you may need one.It's simple to use, very easy to set up and navigate. I got mine on sale but even at full price it's worth it.",Love it;;;;;;

Review: Just what I needed. I do not read outside. I have the first Kindle which was much larger and I dropped it and part of the screen would not display.So when this became available at a discount I bought it with no ads and just the wifi. It is perfect for me. I also bought a cover that fits nicely and turns off the Kindle when I close the cover. If you are looking for something to replace having to lug a book or even a paperback around this Kindle is ideal. And with the ability to order books online is a plus. Inexpensive and good investment.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I wish there was better light options then the clumsy clip lights. Maybe a little pop up light would be good. Right handed people will get seriously annoyed in landscape mode because you'll want the wide part in your palm but it only turns 90 degrees right instead of the left also. Would really recommend a cover since it scratches very easily. I think it's significantly better to read on this than an iPad, fire or any non paper white display.",Price and ability is great but....;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had been curious about the Kindle for a while since I like the concept of e-books but reading on my Android tablet was not comfortable. The e-reader is light, the ink is clear and my eyes are not strained. I am looking forward to reading many books and other publications on my Kindle.",Very satisfied;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"Up until now, I was truly a Kindle lover.  But yesterday, after my THIRD Kindle crapped out shortly after the one year warranty period ended, I have had it.  The Amazon representative I chatted with last night was so kind to offer me a ""special"" value price for a new Kindle of ONLY $79.00.  (Regular price is $99.00, wow, what an incredible deal!)  I spend lots of money downloading books from Amazon, but I think I am done.  I do not believe in paying for extended warranties on products, it is a money making scheme.  I am very disappointed that Amazon does not reward it's loyal customers.  I would have more respect for them if they would replace a Kindle free of charge, or at a truly ""reduced"" rate for loyal Kindle users.  If you are new to Kindle, save your money and invest in an IPad.  They do not stop working after a little more than a year.",I am very disappointed that Amazon does not reward it's loyal customers;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"great little Kindle, love the size and the reading screen, but absolutely shocked to find the kind of adds popping up on the bottom of the home page.  AND then the recommended reads!!!!  Are you serious??  'Wet girls picture book'????  I bought this for my 9 year old and it's ridiculous that even on a reading devise she is exposed to completely inappropriate things.  All i wanted for her was to have something to read her good reads on.  Does anyone know how to block these things?",great little Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have not had any problems with this one at all. i love it! it is easy on your eyes, and is small so it doesnt take up much room in my purse or bag!! it does require you to be in a well lit room, but LED arent good for our eyes anyway. so what are you waiting for : ) go grab one of these today you wont be sorry..... plus you can buy books right from the device OR download your favorite you have saved on your computer... either way it is a win win situation : )",SUPER DUPER WIN WIN here;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this for my 8 year old daughter who loves to read. It's so easy for her to use this Kindle. A big plus was that a library near us lets us rent ebooks for free online, so she can keep getting books for it without having to pay too much. The Kindle book prices on Amazon are usually only a dollar or 2 less than the paperback books, so that's a con, but other than that this device is really helpful for kids.
