She can take it on trips with us and have 20+ books available at once without the weight of carrying them all, or read it when she's laying in her bed. She's really happy with it.",It's so easy for her to use this Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have the previous version, without touchscreen. My bf wants a Kindle and this new edition comes out. He got it and thinks it is much better than my non-touchscreen one. I guess so. So much easier to navigate with this one. Only thing i think the old version is better is that the older version is thinner and lighter. This is a little bit thicker. It is a little harder to hold it in one hand for me. But than again, touchscreen makes navigation so much easier. Can't beat that.",He got it and thinks it is much better than my non-touchscreen one;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This newer Kindle Reader replaced my 2nd Gen model. You may be asking what was wrong with that one? Nothing at all. I handed that one off to my wife when she started highjacking it to read her own books. I gave up switching account logins and fighting over reading time and got the better end of the deal...I bought this newer model and I love it. This has touch screen features with the lauded no-glare screen. This newer model is about the size of a standard paperback book, only thinner. I use it almost everyday.",This Newer Generation Kindle is Wonderful;;;;;;
5.0 out of 5 stars,"OMG! Love. love, love the 6"" size!! Fits right inside my purse. Great for reading on the go;" as I so often do. I have a larger reader but
Review: now I actually prefer this smaller Kindle. Has all the features as my larger one but
Title;;;;;;: so easy to carry from point to point. Can't wait to take it on vacation. Thank you Amazon for this smaller version of the E-Readers..""
column4: 6"""" So Easy to Carry";" Love it""";;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had a Fire HDX and the screen was way to bright to read for long periods of time.  My eyes would hurt and I would get a headache.  I like to have an e-reader but wasn't able to read much with it.  Then i decided to get this one.  I LOVE it.  I can read for longer periods of time.  I no longer get headaches, my eyes don't hurt.  I like that you can change the font size and the font.  it is a pretty basic reader.  It is not back lit.  There are no speakers.  there is no reading light attached.  It is exactly what I wanted.  I got a regular book light for the store and it works perfect!  It fits in my purse and is super light weight yet feels sturdy.  the back has a rougher surface so it is not slippery to hold.  If you do not like reading from a computer screen or get eye strain from other readers get this, you won't regret it!!","Perfect, simple E -Reader";;;;;;

Review: The refurbished one I received was in perfect condition and works great! I can't believe people complain it doesn't have a built in light! If people read the description they would know what they're getting. This is my second reader and it's light weight and easy to read outside in bright sunlight. I couldn't be happier!!!

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I have been using the kindle app on my iPad to read books but with limited memory, I figured I should buy a Kindle.  I like it but the format took some getting use to.  I had it for less than a week before I sent this Kindle reader back, realizing that I need more light to read by.  I bought the Kindle paperwhite instead.",Good but some getting use to;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I really like this base model Kindle. I have lights installed over my bed for reading and good lighting elsewhere in the house so there is no need for the more expensive model. The type is clear and distinct and battery life with this model is exceptional, especially with the wi-fi off. I download all my books off wi-fi at home so no need for 3G. I have an iPhone 6Plus which holds a similar amount of words per page using the Kindle app, so I can download books to that as well and read on the iPhone in the few instances I need a lighted screen.",I really like this base model Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Thanks to numerous back problems, I have to lie down a lot. This makes reading actual books awkward at best, especially with reading glasses digging into the side of my head. I finally broke down and got a Kindle, and I wish I'd done so sooner. The Kindle is really lightweight and comfortable to hold whether you're lying down or sitting. The screen is easy to see even when it's flat on a table. I like that this Kindle has no backlighting because I mainly read at night and I find that computer lights keep me wide awake half the night. Being able to choose a font size is a definite plus (no need for reading glasses!), as is being able to look up unfamiliar words and characters that I totally forgot about, even when they are only one chapter back. I almost got an iPad to use for reading and I'm really glad I got the Kindle instead. It's the perfect size for reading and it doesn't have that computer feel to it. Plus, I can take it anywhere.",So Glad I Finally Bought This;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Good battery life, easy to carry, good value.  Let me repeat what many other reviews have said, this e-reader does NOT have a backlight.  It is clear and easy to read outside, but if you are looking for a device to use in low light, or bedtime reading, you should select a different model.  I use the Kindle app on my Samsung Tablet for reading indoors or in low light.  Through wifi, the devices synch up and remember your place so transferring between devices is easy.",Good value;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love reading and this makes it so much more convenient and encourages my reading even when I'm busy.  It allows you to highlight and take notes.  You can look up any word you come across on a built in dictionary and Wikipedia.  You don't need to buy books online because you can drag the files on the kindle if say you borrowed an ebook from your library or found an old classic available as an ebook online.  The screen is visible and matte, with no glare.  Ultimately, I'd say well worth it if you're looking for something to just read on with no apps or extraneous functions.",I love reading and this makes it so much more convenient ...;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"It is enough different from the older model, that it takes some time to learn its operation. We found it touchy in that one can get unexpected sub-windows unexpectedly by touching either the top or bottom of the screen. Once one learns that these areas are where the menus are brought forth, it is easy enough to avoid while advancing or paging back. The screen is very sensitive so that it is easy to skip pages. A disadvantage is that there is no indication of what percentage of the book is read, or what page is on screen. The idea of minutes remaining to read the chapter on screen is of little value. Learned one neat advantage of Kindles. I have two, if reading a book on one and switching to the second, the option of going to the page being read is made possible. Really an appreciated feature. All in all, the new touch screen model is OK, easy to use once mastered and holds a charge for a long time.",New Kindle 6 is OK;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"My first generation just died. I read many wonderful and many terrible books on it. I recently replaced it with this one. I like it because I have the convenience of so many books at my fingertips. My only complaint is that it's a little bit on the thicker side and I know this is old fashioned, but I liked the old qwerty keyboard and page flipping side buttons. Touch screens are sleek and high tech but I feel like good old buttons are more reliable! But this is a fantastic product despite my old fashioned notions!","I miss my first gen, but this is great!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this for my daughter who, with the Holidays, has not had a lot of time to use it. I thought I would 'check it out' for her so I could give her some pointers when she had time to search the offerings of titles. I found a series I was very much drawn to and ended up ""buying"" the first book in the series for $0.00! The other four books are ones I can borrow using the Prime features. Well you can't beat that with a stick, as my great grandmother used to say. I have also found several stories (I only looked through the first 35 titles) my daughter can borrow for my granddaughter who is 7. I have no fear of any similar titles to children's literature that is anything but for children getting viewed because of the ability to create a child safe reading environment with password controls. I have to say thanks to Amazon for providing such an extensive lending library. Also, looking at the prices of books for purchase, all that I looked at were less than half the price of a new bound book. If you love to read but cost and the sometimes awkward visual book covers/titles keep you from your love of reading anywhere and everywhere...this eReader is the maker of your dream come true.",as my great grandmother used to say;;;;;;
5.0 out of 5 stars,"I was expecting less from the least expensive of the Kindle line, but was presently surprised. I just wanted a Kindle to read;" not play games
Review: check my email
Title;;;;;;: or anything else. I wanted something light to carry and easy to get the books I wanted to read. This little Kindle does it all and it's so easy once you set it up (wifi and one click payment - be sure you edit the payment information before you purchase something). I am rediscovering reading again for fun.""
column4: Back to the Basics for Good Old Fashioned Fun";;;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"I really thought I was upgrading from my Kindle Keyboard when I purchased this item. While the touchscreen is responsive and its easy to reading, I realized that in this item I gave up one of my favorite features of my previous model- audiobooks. No speakers, no place to plug in head phones, I use public transportation to get everywhere and having the Kindle out to read is not always an option but I could always pick it right up with the audiobooks, well no more. I'm greatly disappointed, to the point that I am contemplating returning this item so I can use the funds to go purchase a used prior model with audio.",Not the upgrade I expected.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Great Kindle. Perfect size, responds well to touch, and I haven't missed the 3G/4G connection at all. Adjustable fonts make it easy for anyone to read, but if you do need large font (super large) a bigger kindle might be better for you. I have found the screen and background to be perfect. I haven't tested its durability against drops or scratches but normal wear and a few drops (on carpet a couple times from about 4 feet up and on tile a couple time also from about 4 feet) and have not noticed any malfunctions in the 4 months I have had it. Work well outside and in, very portable and holdable, doesn't stretch my hand at all. I haven't put a case on mine and haven't really missed it. The price is definitely the best you'll find for such a great ereader.",Another Great kindle;;;;;;

Review: I have a Kindle Fire and I like this SOOO much better from a ereading stand point. On my Fire you can't create collections and I am a very organized person. I have all my books organized my author and series. And it's so light! The only downside is that it is not back lit so you can't read it in the dark unless you have a reading light which are really easy to come by and super cheap. Just find a case that you can clip a light to and it becomes a non issue.
Title;;;;;;: I have a Kindle Fire and I like this SOOO much better from a ereading stand point;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Just got my 6"" touchscreen paperwhite Kindle yesterday. Already loving being able to read WITHOUT the screen shining in my eyes. Amazon shipped it already set up for my account so it was just a matter of Turing it on and running through a simple setup menue.I can read outdoors again, something I've missed using a tablet. With the paperwhite screen the brighter the light the better the screen shows up.Ultra light, clear high contrast print, pocket sized... better than a book when you are on the go.","Paperwhite 6"" Kindle,  the base model";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"A perfect and convenient companion for reading.  I love real books and am not one to discard favorites to which I have become emotionally attached. Shelf space has run out so this is ideal for pure reading enjoyment and convenienceNo need for other ""stuff"" or backlight.  If it's dark I turn on a light or just go to sleep.  It's my second one and I have purchased a third for a grandchildPlease DO NOT ""improve"" this modelIt is perfect for reading and needs no fixingA good product, good quality, good value.",Thanks be to Amazon;;;;;;

Review: This is the third kindle I have bought. The first two were paperwhites. This one is for my son and he absolutely loves it! It works perfectly as a dedicated ereader. I love that it doesn't have anything else such as games or anything on it. That way when I tell him to go read and give it to him I know he isn't messing around and playing games. Its great!
Title;;;;;;: I love that it doesn't have anything else such as games ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Absolutely love this Kindle!!!! I have a Kindle Key Board ( which recently stopped working) and a Kindle Fire which I dislike for its weight. This basic Kindle is perfect, its light weight and not the least bit bulky making it a pleasure to carry in purse or work tote. My suggestion is if you want bells and whistles choose a different model, if you want an easy to use basic e-reader this is the perfect purchase.",Pleasure to use;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I got my new basic Kindle last week and must say I am really enjoying it!! After reading some of the reviews I wasn't  sure what to expect! I have had many tablets including Kindle Fire, Ipad and Nook Tab4.  The back lighting on all of these was really bothering my eyes. This traditional Kindle is PERFECT!! I am an avid reader and the type is very crisp!! You can easily adjust font size and I love the fact that you can easily categorize each book (much easier than on tablet). The best thing I've noticed too, is now I am not so distracted as I was on my tablet with email and other notifications going off!! This model is so nice and smooth in each task I choose whether going to next page, amazon store, good reads, or adjusting settings.  Whispersync is very fast!! I highly recommend this ereader !!!",A Wonderful Ereader;;;;;;

Review: nice little appliance- fits in my inner coat pocket- this is my first Kindle and it's great. 4 stars is the most I ever give because I deduct a star for any payment I gave. I only give 5 stars for free stuff- :)
Title;;;;;;: nice little appliance- fits in my inner coat pocket- this ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love to red on this.  My son thinks he reads faster because he doesn't lose the page or have to turn pages.  Me to.  I bought the one with ads to get the cheaper cost and do not find them annoying at all. Oh, and it is my second kindle. I think the first was stolen from my office, admittedly after I left it on my desk when I left one night.",Love my second kindle.;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"So this review would've had 5 stars except I wanted to alert those people whom are gift givers like me to beware because the Kindle devices automatically link to your Amazon account. I gave two devices for Christmas and then after the gifts were given I returned home to find that I have emails that I have purchased books and signed up for book clubs on my 2 new Kindle devices. Not cool Amazon, you should be required to register your device on your own and it should not automatically be linked with an Amazon account. I have deregistered both devices and am hoping this is the end of it.",Buyer beware;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I broke down and purchased this kindle after hemming and hawing between it and the paperwhite.This is a terrific device. I can hold it comfortably in my hand for long periods of time. The light issue isn't a big deal to me (which is why I didn't splurge the $40).I wanted a device to hold the many e-books I review instead of using a tablet's screen. Once you purchase an e-book though, it's a challenge to justify the more expensive paper books.",I've Converted;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a great eReader and does a great job for the upgrade. But I was having a problem with reading in darker lit rooms so I opted to return this one and get the Paperwhite, which I LOVE! It has everything this one has to offer but the backlight allows me to read no matter where I am! Worth the extra money!","Great, but no Paperwhite";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm a simple person and I've fallen in love with the simplicity of my kindle! I would have loved a back light but other than that I bring it everywhere I go, it's lightweight and doesn't drag my purse down and I have unlimited books anywhere! Its easy to navigate on and love how I can purchase a book on the app from my phone and sincs to my kindle with Wi-Fi. One of the best purchases I've ever made! Definitely beats buying a new book every week and trying to find somewhere to store it.",Love it!! A great and very smart purchase;;;;;;

Review: I wanted a reader that I could take out to the pool and read.  This works perfectly.  You can read it even in the bright Texas sun.  Perfect!  My only beef is not with the reader but the cases available for the reader....Not one case sold for the reader will stand on it's own.  Really need a case that will fold into a stand!

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"First, I'm not the most familiar person when it comes to the kindle devices. with this kindle, at first glance it looked weird, felt weird ( it really is as light as a feather) and it took some getting used to.. Esp since the only kindle I've ever used was the fire. Now that I've used it a little I really like it. The kindle fire is nice if you want a tablet, but for reading books as your primary focus, it is just too bulky. This kindle is easy to handle, light and easy to transport. It seems perfect to carry in a backpack or take camping due to the small size. If you're a female, you could prob carry this in your purse with no problem (I've seen bigger things pulled out of a woman's purse) lol. The only thing I notice (in my opinion) it seems a little harder to read in the dark then the fire.. Maybe there is a setting for this ? I think I will buy a light for it though. Overall, if you are looking for a light kindle without the bulkyness of the fire, this is highly recommended.",Now that I've used it a little I really like it. The kindle fire is nice if you ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I have always like the feel of a book in my hands and figured I would not get use to a kindle. My wife has had one for several years, I purchased one on a Wednesday and took it on a long weekend trip. reading on the plane was so easy, so was the beach and by the pool. I would recommend that the first book you read is an author that you know you will like!",I have always like the feel of a book in my hands and ...;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I can't say that I LOVE this new e reader....my old kindle is the best and I still find myself using it.  I purchased this to see what's new, well, not much.....I hate turning pages and dislike all the other NEWER ways to find things....guess I'm old fashioned and I say ""If it ain't broke, don't fix it!!",NOT IMPRESSED;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Great way to read your books on the go. The display never hurts your eyes, your reading experience is fully customizable and thanks to the 4 GB internal storage you probably won't need external storage devices. Adding books from amazon is extremely simple and books from other sources can also be easily uploaded, provided the format is correct. The device does not accept EPUB so make sure your books are saved as PDF. What really helped me immerse myself in the reading experience was the vocabulary builder. All words you search in the dictionary are store and every now and then you can pop over to see how many words you remember. Searching a word in the dictionary is also easy, just tap it. Setup is quick, weight feels just right and the home menu has the perfect design.",Great way to read your books on the go;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Exactly as advertised. Very easy to use and read, despite being the cheapie model. Get this one with advertising on it and save the $20. The book advertising is only on the wallpaper screen when the unit is inactive.",Love it!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Kindle 6"" Glarefree touchscreen is awesome.  I have trouble holding on to things that are weighty and bulky. With it being so slim is great and easy to use. Just turn it on and then touch the screen to get what you want.  Reading is a snap and can also do it one handed.  I would so recommend this for anyone.",Greatest  Product of Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"We bought this because my sons could not follow rules with apps and wifi.  I used parental controls and time after time they figured out the code, or reset the kindle - etc.  So my one son lost it for good.  However we use kindle books for school ALL the time.  This was the solution.  He had to buy with his own money, and it has nothing to get him into trouble.I WISH I started with these and we never brought the apps into the house.  Oh well.  This is a great kindle - do wish it lit up, but I knew it didn't when I bought it and the price was perfect, so no issues there.I recommend this for the younger kids especially to keep inappropriate apps out of their lives.  (FYI the ads on the apps are my biggest concern)",Great Kindle for READING.  Which is what we wanted!!;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I really like my old first gen better.  Although the screen size is the same, the screen is touchy, and there are fewer places to put my hands without ending up accidently highlighting something, or altering the print size, or equally distracting things when all I want to do is read, not screw around with mis-touches.",I really like my old first gen better;;;;;;

Review: I just took my new Kindle out of the box and I'm already in love with it. Setup was rather easy and the tutorial was easy enough to follow along. It didn't take long for me to get it up and running so I could finally read a book on it.

I love this kindle ! Is so easy on my eyes that ice read two books in a week .The battery life is amazing I've charged it once when I received it a week ago and it's still going while I only use it about 2-3 hours a day I think the claims about battery life are spot on.Great product bought it on sale for only $59.00 and I'm very impress by it while I will be passing this one on to my 9 year old as soon as the paper white goes on sale again I highly recommended ;)

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had the Paper white 1st gen, the screen stop working after 2 years so I got this to replace it. I thought I would miss the built in light and to tell you the truth I don't. This Kindle is just as good as the Paper white but it is cheaper. I repeat there is no built in light, you don't need it, now if you had to read at night with the lights off than you can buy a light or you could get a case with a built in light of you want to spend an extra $40. This feels more sturdy than my last Kindle, you don't need a case to protect it. I have a feeling this will last much longer than my last Kindle.",GET THIS KINDLE NOT THAT ONE;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This unit replaces my original Kindle, It's a great product once you learn how to use it. They should include a printed list of shortcuts to help you get started. I had to keep calling tech support, they gave me the feeling that I knew more than they did to solve problems that i could not find answers to on kindle tutorial. It was a frustrating 2 days for this engineer who was at the beginning of the solid state revolution in Silicon Valle.y","Great, But!";;;;;;

Review: I love this Glare-Free touchscreen display because I use it outdoors all the time.  I love being able to read it in the bright sunshine as I live in Florida and it is usually very sunny.  I also take it to the beach with me.
Title;;;;;;: I love this Glare-Free touchscreen display because I use it outdoors ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've been hearing a lot of comments about the Kindle from my friends and family. I was finally convinced on buying one for myself. I was a bit skeptical about it at first, being the kind of reader who prefers the actual book in hand be it soft or hard cover, but my view changed when my first Kindle came in the mail and tested it out.I have had this for almost three weeks now, and I am happy to say that I am glad that I bought it. It is easy to use, allows me to log onto Amazon to browse through a selection of books and I am by far loving the Kindle Unlimited. It also saves me room in my bag for when I need something to do to pass time while out of the house and it's light too.Being a new Kindle user, there were a lot of functions that were strange to me, but eventually got the hang of it as this Kindle has no actual page turning button as I thought it would. The fact that there's no glare when I read it under a light makes me love it more and satisfied. The battery life: great!",First Kindle User and Loving It!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"love these simple to use kindles. I am ""technology challenged"" & they are extremely easy to use. I also have vision problems & can make the font XL> Not so w/fire6 I ordered on sale I cannot make font big enough. Plus my vision did not work well w/color & brightness.Also love LONG battery life.",love these simple to use kindles;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have owned several Kindles over the past few years, most of which I have given to friends and family.  Recently, I realized I had given away my last Kindle Paperwhite to a friend, so back to Amazon I went to get another.  When i saw this particular model on sale, I bought it immediately.  It arrived well packaged and two days sooner than predicted.Now I've read a couple of reviews where people had trouble switching the language when the Kindle first arrived.  Charge it up first. I had the same trouble before I had the forehead smacking moment of ""Duh"", you need to charge it first.  Once done, I had no trouble.My only complaint and it's not even really that, is that this particular model is not back lit.  No real issue there as I have a clip on book reading lamp that works perfectly well for night time reading.My greatest love of this model is that it is so very light!  I love that it doesn't hurt my hands to hold it for long periods of time.  This Kindle is perfect for those who travel quite a bit and do not want to be carrying a heavier Kindle along.  It's also perfect for those who have trouble holding a book for long periods of reading.So remember, if you want an e-reader that is light weight and easy to use, I highly recommend this model.  Just remember, if you want to read in the dark, either buy a book light or choose one of the other models.",My greatest love of this model is that it is so ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love this! I never thought I'd use an electronic reader because I love books so much, but the convenience of carrying dozens of books at once in one device won out.  This is light and easy to use.  The browser allows me to buy new books from the tablet.The only issue I have is that the power button is on the bottom, and when I hold it my finger accidentally hits it on occasion.",Book lover converted!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought a 5th generation Kindle back in May.  It was my first e-reader.  I liked it a lot.  Then I saw that the Kindle was being offered in a touchscreen.  I thought ""I just bought a Kindle! I don't need to buy the newest model.""  The price was $79.00.  (I only spent $49.00 on my first Kindle)  I then realized that I could trade in my old Kindle and get a gift card.  I then saw the touch-screen Kindle was being offered for $49.00 on Black Friday.  I could not pass this up.  I got my new  Kindle last week and I love it!The touch-screen did take a little bit of getting used to.  After a day of use, I found I liked the touch screen better than the page turn buttons.  I found highlighting to be a lot easier.  This kindle actually highlights the passage instead of underline.I love the new features on the Touch screen Kindle.  I love having Goodreads right there on the menu.  I use Goodreads all the time and it is much easier to update what books I am reading.  I really love the Page Flip feature so that I can go anywhere in the book and not have to constantly turn the page and lose my place.  The new ""about this book feature"" is great since you can mark the book ""currently reading"" on Goodreads.  It also tells you if the book is part of a series.  X-ray this book is a good feature because you can go to the dictionary and Wikipedia without leaving the book.  The Touch keyboard is a lot easier to use than the old Kindle.  Writing notes is a lot easier.I had very few problems with the Touch screen Kindle.  The main problem was getting all my books transferred onto it.  I had some books on my old Kindle that I transferred with a USB cable, so they were not on the Cloud. I could not open the books so,  I ended up having to re-buy two books.  The ""Cloud"" and the ""Device"" sections took some getting used to.  I have a lot of books I borrow from the library and they show up on the Cloud.  Some books have the loan ended, so I had to make an ""archive"" collection.I wish the Touch Screen Kindle had more font choices.  On the old Kindle you had a lot more choices.  I like Times New Roman san serif.  I like the plainness of it.I am very satisfied with my touch screen Kindle, for now.  (I might in the future trade it in for a Kindle Fire)",The new Kindle is awesome!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have had a kindle for about 4-5 years, the one with the keyboard. I love it and was very reluctant to switch to this new touch screen kindle. It went on sale and a friend had decided to get it for me for my birthday. I have to say, I did not want it, I was happy with what I had. However, after I used it I was in love. The things you can do on this amaze me. You can look everything up while in text. I can see the characters and read about them and as a history guy it helps that I can look things up via wikipedia right on the ereader. I absolutely love this, so much better than my kindle I had before.",Didnt want to upgrade but glad I did!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I've had this version for 2 weeks now.  Still on the initial charge on battery. A bit different than the PaperWhite, but the OS is the latest 5.6.2.1I personally chose the smallest Helvetica font with the least amount of margins.  I don't have to flip the pages as often.  The screen is crisp clear.  Yes, if you get close enough you can see the pixels of the fonts, and it's not perfect. If pixels bother you, you may want to consider the new Voyage which has a 300 dpi resolution.  Storage has been upgraded to 4 GB, but the OS takes up 0.9 GB.  I have 3.1 GB of available storage when it arrived.  I have about 60 books and 10 PDF's which takes up about 1.2 GB.  I don't think the Kindle can store thousands of books as Amazon claims.  It's more like hundreds of books.  But, propaganda sells.  I bought one and you may want to.",Must have for the avid (and casual) reader...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This version of the Kindle is truly glare free, and the touchscreen makes it very easy to maneuver through any book.While I still enjoy the tactile feeling of holding a traditional book, I admit that this device made reading on a plane, in bed late at night, and on the beach much easier. My only complaint was that it can't be read at night without a light- found this out on a late night flight when I was unable to sleep. However, I still would recommend this device - it's fairly lightweight and quite easy to use all of its features (font, dictionary, library, etc) with a simple touch.",Great Gift Idea;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I had my first Kindle for almost 6 years before the battery life became an issue.  My current Kindle is having battery issues after just 9 months.  It will not hold a charge for more than a couple weeks of reading for an hour or two a day.  If I don't use it for several days, the battery still drains.  I never experienced this with my first one.  It has been a big disappointment after the experience I had with my first Kindle.",It has been a big disappointment after the experience I had with my first Kindle;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"This is the third Kindle that I have bought on which the screen has died!!!!! The Kindle representative to whom I mentioned planned obsolescence said that wasn't the case.  Originally, no recompense was offered, but after some gentle negotiation, she applied a $15 discount to the purchase of the new plain vanilla Kindle.  Not that I wanted it at all.  I liked my old button page turner type and I shouldn't have had to buy another one. Or the previous dead one.  Or the previous dead one!",THIRD DEAD KINDLE!!!! (SCREEN DEATH);;;;;;

Review: I am very pleased with my new Kindle but am stymied as to how to delete books that I have read from the Kindle.  I do not have a problem swiping to turn pages.  It is easy to read.  I also like it that I can change the size of the font if need be.  The only problem is not being able to figure out how to delete from the Kindle.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm loving this Kindle. I had a second generation that finally died, but this one is just the right size and I like the ease of page turning and the other option on the touch screen.  I don't like a back lite screen and it's so much lighter than reading on my iPad. I would definitely buy another if and when this one should ever go kaput.  Love it!",but this one is just the right size and I like the ease of page turning and the other option ...;;;;;;

Review: This is my first experience with Kindle and I really wanted to use it before I gave any kind of review.  My wife recently used my Kindle and it reminded me how pleased I am with this little handy tool.  There have been some updates that are making it even easier to read.  The only thing my wife said she would like it better if it had a built in light.  I guess I'll have to get her one with a light now.  (:

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"This new model doesn't seem to hold a charge as well as advertised.  Also, every time I turn it on, the font is a different size.  I expect it to stay the same as where I had it set, but it rarely does.  It seems to me there are still some bugs to be worked out.  It is more convenient to use than my old one, but will not accept some of the games aps I had on my old one and used all the time.  My old Kindle, in addition to loosing the charge quickly, will no longer connect to wi-fi.  I hope that doesn't happen to this new one.",The jury's still out.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I believe I'm going to upgrade to a paperwhite when they go on sale. I like this unit, it's only a book reader, except for the fact you can not adjust the contrast and it impossible to read in a dimly lite area . The Paperwhite is again ,only for reading books , both units are worthless for any thing else I believe both e readers overpriced. I own Kinde Fire HD,s which you can get for $ 100.00 plus and you can do so much with them , except read  books ,due to the short battery life , the weight and the back lite ,bad on your eyes ,washed out in sunlight. You do need two unit's, one for reading books and one for everything else.",Works only in well lighted area !;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Kindle made me get into the reading game. I don't like to hold a book and flip pages, but I loved how kindle shows me the real reading experience and the same quality as if I was reading a real book. I love how it lets me choose different fonts, weights and sizes. Too bad the basic model doesn't have built-in LED light.Thanks Amazon for creating this amazing device.",Turned me into an active reader;;;;;;

Review: I love my kindle!  I received this as a gift and have fallen in love.  I have never used an e-reader and was surprised by the comfort of the kindle and the readability of the device.  I highly recommend this model.  I have been converted!

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"The kindle is small and compact. The touch screen is nice but so incredibly sensitive.  If anything brushes it even a little it changes pages, opens things or messes with the page set up in general.  The page set ups cannot be saved.  If you bump the page it brings up the font settings and any touch messes them up so they have to be set again.It didn't come with an instruction booklet, just the one inside the kindle itself. which is all well and good except that if its all new to you and you have no idea how to turn it on or unlock it, though it only has one button so my deductive reasoning told me that I should just push it,  it was frustrating.I really miss my kindle keyboard. It was much easier to highlight and navigate. No abstract touches screwing things up or changing things or taking me where I do not want to go.",The touch screen is nice but so incredibly sensitive;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I originally had a Kindle Keyboard (gen 2) that I bought back in 2010 for classes as most of my textbooks were in PDF or Kindle format.  It died a painful death last year so I began to search for a new one.  I'm physically disabled and my hands don't work very well.  I only bought this because I didn't couldn't find another option and I'm beginning to wish I had never bought it.  The touch display is too sensitive for me and I can't highlight passages.  It's too slippery for me to hold but when the Kindle's in its case, it's too heavy for me to hold up for long.  Kindle for PC app is better than this device.Amazon, sometimes newer IS NOT better...",It died a painful death last year so I began to search for ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I don't know if I have this one of not. I have so many. from the button turn page and keyboard  to the first paperwhite the next paper white, and the small fire and big fire not the big big one. cant afford it. can you tell, I love my kindles and yes love is the word. I have different books on all. bye the way have given up and don't use the ones with the button page.and key boards. kindle,, how about taking them in for trade on the big fire. lol.",I love my kindles and yes love is the word;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This Kindle was exactly what I wanted. My mom broke my previous Kindle (which was a very basic early model, it was a gift, so I honestly can't remember exactly what it was). I really missed being able to read on the old reader, so when I got a gift card for Christmas, I knew I wanted to get a new Kindle. I opted for this model because I prefer the non-backlit screen. I have a tablet and I don't need anything fancy, I just want to read books, which this is great for.I'm glad this is a touchscreen because my previous model wasn't and I got so used to touchscreen phones that I frequently tried to do that to turn the pages anyway. Occasionally, I will accidentally turn the page or pull down the menu if I bump, but that's not really a big deal. I have brushed hair off the screen without turning the page as well, so it's not overly sensitive.","If You Just Want To Read, This Is Your Device";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"After having spent the last few days playing with my new Kindle I am thrilled with the simplicity of the device. I'm no stranger to the Kindle and what it has to offer. This is...in my opinion a very basic model in comparison to the Kindle Fire model. There really aren't that many thrilling perks to this one but it works well. If you plan to watch videos, movies, etc then I would go with the Kindle Fire model or better. The 7th generation is clearly more for the avid reader that just wants an ereader. The ability to set up collections for your books is easy. The download of new books or transfer of advance reader copies via review sites is simply and fast. As a bonus the deliver was super fast. Thanks Amazon!",Clearly a GREAT DEAL!!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my 3rd Kindle and I love it.  This is even nicer than the second one I purchased (with the light).  It's easier to use  and the price was very good.  Whenever I have an appointment, I take my kindle along with me and it makes the waiting time go faster.  I enjoy the books I purchase and the ones I get to read for free.  The variety of Kindle books is  wonderful.  This is just one reason why I love  Amazon so much.Thanks, Amazon.",Great Buy!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Love my kindle. So easy on my eyes!  This is my second and that's the reason that I lowered the rating. I'd just had the other for 2 years and am not hard on them. It just stopped working. I guess I'm not sure why it decided ""This is IT."" But, I loved it enough to buy a second.  By the end of the day, after using computers at my work and home, I darn sure do not want a back-lit screen for reading for pleasure.",Best for my eyes!;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I read a lot. I have worn out the buttons on 3 Kindles in the past and lost my last one at the airport. So, bought the new touchscreen. It's bad.  The pages are constantly freezing and I'm currently waiting for the battery to run down because it won't even let me turn the Kindle off to try to reset it.  The page turn is slow and I am constantly overreading the page turns. That is I do when it doesn't read my touch as a signal to define a word (usually ""the"" ) or highlight a section of print.  I've had this less that a month and am serious about returning it.  GAH!  Worst Kindle ever!",Worst Kindle EVER;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Super light, very compact, and easy on the eyes.Fantastic battery life.Touch response is acceptable but do expect a slight delay. after a while, you get used to it.The screen is crisp.I bought the special offer version (which plays some ads on your home screen) but it isn't intrusive and after some time, you don't even notice they are there.You can pack a LOT of books into this little guy.I recommend it!Btw, I highly recommend downloading the third-party program Calibre to help manage ebooks and convert between formats. It integrates very well with the device.","Great value, great tech, recommend it!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"excelent first kindle.. i gave 2 as gift and they area being used intensively. I knew this one did not have the backlight and to be frank at night or in low light you need a lamp. Not critizicing this kindle as it is very clear to see with a lamp just as a book would, maybe even better but with all the advantages of being a kindle and carrying many books with you. You can also send documents like word or pdf to it via email whic is nice to carry technical papers and manuals with you. It is light, small and easy to hold up for extended time. Highly recomended for the avid reade and traveler. Consider the model with light if you are like me and read mostly at night.","excellent first kindle,  if like me you read a lot at night, consider the model with light";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love it. I purchased this as a Black Friday huge deal as a ""why not"" test and couldn't be happier. I am a public transit user and this is so much simpler than lugging a book around. Not to mention the ease of ""borrowing"" free books from the library without having to go to the library! There's no back light and no keypad, but I can download and read books, which is all I ask for.",Perfect for Me;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this because my beloved old Kindle KB finally died and I wanted a reader that I can see in the sun sitting out by the pool on our vacations. My HDX is more difficult to see under sunny conditions. I am kind of disappointed in the touchscreen display on this one. It's very sensitive and the edge is pretty small (and I have small fingers), so I am constantly hitting the screen and inadvertently turning the page. It's kind of awkward to hold it without touching the screen at all. I vastly preferred the old style with the page turning button on the side. That said, for the price it will do the job (I bought it from another vendor on sale and with a rebate).",Don't like the touchscreen;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is contradictory, but I like it and yet I wouldn't buy it again.  It has great battery life, loads quickly, and is lightweight.  My two problems with it are that there is not, in my opinion, adequate screen contrast and I wouldn't buy another reader that didn't have a color screen.  The contrast issue is simply that I need a whiter page color and a darker text color to read easily.  My only problem with it being black and white is that I find it very difficult to distinguish books in my library because I can't read the covers easily.  I have 3 Kindles:  the Fire (love it, but it is heavier, bulkier, and has a much shorter battery life), Paperwhite (hate it - it won't stay on and freezes up;" after much troubleshooting with Amazon I just gave up on it)
Review: and the plain Kindle (love-hate relationship).""

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Rudimentary reader, but what I wanted.  The screen needs to be SHUT DOWN after use or an image remains; I am not sure if it hurts the battery.  I have not used this much as yet
Review: but I am hoping for a LONG battery life so I can read in airports and on trips without trying to find an outlet every two hours like I need to with my Phone or IPAD.  THERE IS NO SCREEN LIGHT; so it is like a book.  You cannot read in the dark
Title;;;;;;: you need a light to see the screen.  It is light; a little big for a pocket
column4: but thin and easy to carry.  Beets carrying around a book;" or a few
column5: when traveling.It is a book reader--NOTHING ELSE.""
column6: but I am hoping for a LONG battery life so I can read in airports and on trips without trying to find an outlet every two hours";;

Review: This is my first e reader. I love my basic Kindle. It's easy to maneuver and the touch screen makes the page turning very simple. I love being able to change the font size and adjust the paragraph spacing; this allows me to read without wearing my eyeglasses. I'm happy with my decision to get the Kindle basic for $79.00 rather than spending an extra money on the Kindle paperwhite for $119. I did a comparison and it looks like they have the a lot of the same features except the Kindle paperwhite has a background light. My lighting solution was to purchase a $5 book light.My only complain is every once in awhile the screen freezes and I have to reboot my Kindle. At first I didn't know what was happening but I went to the Kindle support wed site to get instruction on how to fix the problem.
Title;;;;;;: The Kindle basic is a good e reader for first timers.;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I really enjoy the simplicity of the Kindle.  No buttons and a very responsive infrared touch system made it really easy to use.  This being the lower end of their screen resolution doesn't make a difference to me, still looks great.  The battery lasts as long as Amazon states, pretty much forever.  I read on multiple devices and tend to use the Kindle when I don't want to stare at a lit up screen anymore.Page turns are fast and boot up as well as application switching are reasonable for the device type. It doesn't include a wall charge but you really don't need one considering you barely ever charge it.  Overall very happy with it, no more paper for me.","Great simple device, no more paper books for me";;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"Just bought my third Kindle, and am very disappointed that touchscreen versions are the only choices available. I was happy with both of my previous versions, and was fine with the earlier upgrade (a toggle switch instead of keyboard). But the touchscreen is making me crazy. I have a touchscreen laptop and smartphone, so it's not that I am against touchscreens in general. I just hate it on the Kindle. With the way it fits in my hand, my fingers often slide onto the screen a little too far and boom, I'm on a different article or chapter. PLEASE, Amazon, bring back some version without a touchscreen. The only plus is that the print quality is sharper than ever. I am glad that there is still an option without the paperwhite lighted screen as I much prefer this unlit screen option.",PLEASE bring back a non-touchscreen option!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first kindle. Prior to using a kindle, I read all of my digital goodies on an ipad, and, as much as I enjoy using my ipad, it is not exactly the most comfortable device to use for reading digital articles and ebooks. The kindle screen does not strain your eyes the way an ipad or computer screen would after reading incessantly for hours. It is also much more ergonomic. It is lighter and fits comfortably in one's palms. Moreover, the battery lasts forever. All in all, it is a much more comfortable and convenient device for those who like to read--which makes sense since that is the sole function this machine was designed to serve.",First time kindle user;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I knew it was small when I bought it, but I still wish it was bigger.  I would have given it 5 stars then.  Other than that no complaint. As promised. I also have arthritis in my hands, and this makes it easier to read being that it easier to hold than a new book, which is tight..",Good item;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is the fourth Kindle that I have purchased.  I like the fact that it can be read without glare.  When I registered I put it on my old account, so I would be able to use books that are already in my Archived items.  Now, however, I cannot figure out how to transfer the many books that I have purchased to my new Kindle.  It says I have only 4 books.  I have always been very happy with past Kindles, and I would love to find this one as useful as others I own.  I am giving this a 5-star rating on my experience with past models and hope with the proper help I will be able to enjoy it to its fullest.",I like the fact that it can be read without glare;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I know it's my fault for getting the version with ads, however I wish they at least turned off after a few hours or so. Whenever I haven't read in a while, I come back to a dead kindle because the ads used up the battery life.Otherwise, the reading experience is fine! Figuring out the most comfortable to read using it took a little bit of time because you can't hold it like a paper book, but one it was figured out, all was good.",Ads drain battery;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is the first kindle I have owned.  I needed the Kindle guide but found it easy to navigate.  I wasn't sure that I would like the screen but it reads like a book and does not make my eyes tired.  I have only downloaded two books so far but I am very happy with the results.  One thing that I was not aware of is that it is in black and white.  If you are downloading something that is in color, like beading books, color is very important.  I got the app and downloaded the beading book in color on my tablet.  I am really looking forward to taking the kindle on vacation.  Once the book is downloaded, wi-fi isn't neccessary.  It holds more books at a time than I can read in two weeks.  I wish I had purchased one sooner.",Kindle;;;;;;

Review: I really like this . it is easy to use and carry with me. ithas good resolution and I can enlarge or decrease the size of the script. have purchased the carry cover for it also. good value for afirst time buyer who wants to get the feel of one of these for reading books with out the paper page turning.
Title;;;;;;: I really like this. it is easy to use and carry ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"My Kindle is just the right size and weight for holding without fatigue. It truly is glare-free, so my eyes don't get tired when I read. The ease of downloading books is a huge plus, whether I'm purchasing a Kindle book from Amazon or borrowing an electronic book from my local library. Just a few taps and I'm reading! I like mine so much I purchased one for my husband, who reads much more now than he used to. If you're looking for a basic, easy to use e-reader, I highly recommend the Kindle!",E-Reader Love!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Overall I like it and I think it's a great value (I got it on sale recently). I had an old Kindle Keyboard that died and was debating which model to upgrade to. I debated the paperwhite but I don't read too often at night and if I ever do I could use the kindle app on my phone. For me being on a tight budget, this device is very good. I think I even like it better than the Keyboard. Occasionally I have very slight problems seeing the page in dim light but mostly it's very crisp. It feels light, battery life is good, and I like accessing Goodreads from my kindle.",Great device on a budget if you can do without the light;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I have to say I am not a big fan of touch screens & I was disappointed the previous generation kindle (with the buttons) wasn't available & this one was its' replacement. But the touch screen on this kindle is great & very responsive. My previous e-reader was a Kobo touch & this new Kindle is far more responsive than my old Kobo was. It is a joy to use & it will turn on & be ready to use within in 1-2 seconds, my previous e-reader took maybe 30 seconds to get the point where I could start reading. The plastic body does feel a little cheap and clunky but for reading purposes I would say it is great & worth the money.",Simple to use ... responsive touch screen;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a really solid Kindle that provides great value for the price. My wife has an old school Kindle, the kind with the keyboard built into the body and the arrow buttons to move around. Oh my is that version incredibly difficult to navigate. So it's clear the Kindle has improved considerably from older models. The only real downside to this model is you cannot read when the lighting is low but it's a trade-off I will gladly accept for the great price.If you aren't looking for all the bells and whistles and are fine with a bare bones Kindle this is a great choice.",Great Kindle for the price;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I read a lot. I use to like carry 3 or 4 books with me to work, just not knowing what mood I would be in during lunch. This has saved my sanity and my back. It took a while to become adjusted to the idea of buying digital copies of books. When I got over that, I did spend a bit of money to get my favorite reads on the Kindle and reread them all again, and because the Kindle is so comfortable, it was like reading them as a fresh experience.This coupled with Kindle Unlimited has saved me time and gas, as I'm no longer at the public library every week.",I use to like carry 3 or 4 books with me to work;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love this thing.  Easy to hold and read no matter where you are.  Inside or out.  I weighs almost nothing and can fit in just about any decent size pocket.Easy to set up.  Makes reading very enjoyable.  The screen size seemed small at first, but I honestly think it is just the right size.This is not a backlit model, so you can't read in the dark.  But for all other applications, it works just as it should.",What a great reading device!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is an awesome device! Even in a dark lit setting I can still read the words without squinting. It's very lite and I can hold with one hand while reading. Easy to use, though I'm still learning. I would recommend it for those needing just a device that allows for reading, for a reasonable price and having access to Amazon's library and the unlimited Kindle plan.Finally, there are ads for the cheaper option. However they are book recommendations that only appear on your screen saver and bottom of your home screen.... No way intrusive and worth the 20-30 dollars in savings.","small, easy to read and affordable";;;;;;

Review: Perfect for someone like me who wants their phone to just be a phone with texting ability and my computer to sit on a desk and not be mobile. I use it to read when I go to the doctors office and arrive an hour before my appt because that's how my medical transportation does things or when in bed but not sleepy and my lady can enjoy my non-pestering companionship while using her laptop.
Title;;;;;;: Perfect for someone like me who wants their phone to ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"so my reason for getting a kindle is simply to be able to read computer based books without straining my eyes. computer screens really hurt my eyes especially when I'm focused on them for a long period of time to do things like read a book.in that mark the kindle is stellar. the kindle is really soft on my eyes making it easy to read for hours. the screen is similar to one of those old pda screens which is nice because there is no glare. you can easily download your kindle library and do not need to be connected to the internet to use the dictionary and some of the other features. it does what its supposed to do extremely well. As far as the programming goes, it gets a little getting used to and inst the most genius layout. the main problem is the texts changing sizes when its brushed against, i really wish there was a lock for that. also the constant bombardment of adds is also unfortunate. also if you have big fingers, it will be difficult to learn how to press the menu button and not the top row of words. however it serves its purpose well and I highly recommend it as a cheep solution to read computer based books.",kindle is really soft on my eyes making it easy to read for hours;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"It6's a great machine but I have a hard time in that it has no buttons. It's all on-screen and tapping. I guess that's the current trend. I'm old and I can't catch up to frantic changes in technology. My 3d Kindle was best. Fire is too hard for me and I gave it away. The first one, I bought in 2010 or so, had clumsy typing. Now things are better. But SLOW down, techies, you're goin' too fast.  ( Paul Simon, 'Feelin'  Groovy')",It6's a great machine but I have a hard time in that ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm enjoying it. A nice solid ereader that is much better than the older $200+ competition.For reference, I got a nook tablet a few years back. Huge mistake. Wish I saved my money for this nice streamlined reader with all the features I could possibly need on handMy only regret? Not getting the one with a back screen.",The standard.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"6 year old daughter loves it! Got it because she loves to read, shes finishing kindergarten and is already at a 2nd grade level. Chose not to get one of the Kindle fires because I didn't want her using it for games and such. She wants to read and I'll reinforce that. Kindle unlimited is a great program that lets her read all the books she wants. The public library also has ebooks. What this all boils down to is that it is amazing for reading and so easy to operate my 6 year old can do it!",6 yr old loves it!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Price was right, This is my 5th Kindle over the past 6 years. I don't have any need for a Fire and consider the battery life of color fire units to be unacceptable.  I can use my laptop or desk computers for all of those functions.  I would buy this again but I prefer the paperwhite Kindle for low light reading.My Amazon Prime allows me to utilize thousands of books and I use my smart TV for Vidios.",good buy for readers;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I really like this - much easier to read than my iPad.  Two necessary add-on items: a light that clips on so you can read in darker rooms (the screen is not backlit so you need to have light to see it, and in a dark room you can't see it at all) and a cover (it really shows my finger prints and stuff). I got this on Prime Day so I got a great deal on it.  Not so sure I would have paid full price for it.  I'm ok reading a traditional book.",Good product.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This device has brought me back to reading.  I have asthma aggravated by dust mites... who thrive in paper books.  I had given up my library habit (the worst kind of books for dust mite triggered asthma) entirely.  With the kindle and Indiana's Public Library Access Card, I can read ebooks from any library in Indiana at a low annual fee.  I am in heaven!  The fonts are really easy to change, so if my eyes are getting a little tired, two touches and the font is easier to read!  Book downloads happpen extremely fast, and I particularly enjoy the touch dictionary for unfamiliar words and terms.  Thank you Amazon!",I had given up my library habit (the worst kind of books for dust mite triggered asthma) entirely;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I wanted a new basic ereader - this device seemed to fit the criteria, and the price was right.  It was easy to set up and connect with Amazon.  I like the different fonts offered on this device.  I also like the vocabulary builder, which remembers all words I have looked up while reading.  I have 2 older Kindle ereaders and am used to buttons to turn pages.  On this Kindle, the touchscreen page turning is OK, but once in awhile the page turning skips several pages(!!!), which can be frustrating.  I took off 2 stars for that because it is a big deal.  I'm still undecided if I will keep this Kindle or return it...",Basic Kindle 6 inch touchscreen;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Wow... I bought this before vacation to read on the beach because no tablet or phone (or any other e reader) is as good as a kindle in direct sunlight.  It came on Friday my vacation started Saturday and Wednesday was prime day and I saw it was $30 cheaper, no problem a less than 10 minute chat with a customer service rep and I had my Kindle for less than $50!It did not disappoint from a quality angle either ... perfect viewing on the beach even on the sunniest days, lightweight, quick, smooth performance and I had a new book club friend.Great device, great regular price.  The amazon kindle is still the king of eReaders and this small lightweight beauty is perfect for a summer vacation.",Prime Day made it almost criminal but at regular price it is a steal anyways!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this as a Christmas gift for my mother last year and I'd say she is 100% happy with it. She uses it all the time.She takes it with her everywhere and has so many books to read on it.I would recommend this to anyone thinking of getting this for yourself or another book lover!My mom, even a year later, is over the moon for this thing!",Mom Is Over The Moon For This;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love this.  I can read in the sun and the battery lasts forever. I was reading my kindle books on my phone and my tablet, but the glare made outside reading impossible and it ate up my battery life.  This is the perfect alternative. I keep it with me all the time and have a book to read no matter what I am doing.  Really good investment.",Perfect for reading in the sun!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"It has a smaller screen than I would like, would have preferred to get my Kindle Keyboard fixed.  It meets my needs since I needed something I could use outside, which I can't do with my Kindle Fire.  I really don't think that Amazon should charge more for purchasing one without ""special offers"" (aka ADS). It would also be nice if the covers were reusable.  Really, how hard would it be to make this and the other Kindles to fit in the original covers? I ended up retrofitting my old cover with Velcro...  But it does what it's supposed to do very well.","It has a smaller screen than I would like, would have preferred to get my Kindle Keyboard ...";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I absolutely LOVE IT, I'm a voracious  reader, never get enough!  It's great fun to stock it with the books I love and it also frees up my iPad for other fun things to do!  It's small enough to be comfortable for reading in bed, more comfortable than even a book. I can take it with me as it fits in my bag and it holds a charge for so long!  I still love my paper  books but this is a wonderful addition to my library.  The world is mine, I can go anywhere with the written word and do it all from the comfort of my home!",A wonderful addition to compliment other devices!;;;;;;

Review: Kindle has allowed me to assessed way more books then I've ever had before. Great page quality - better than my previous keyboard Kindle. The only con is that I like to read on my bed and my blankets sometimes turn the page or change the font size.

This is my 5th kindle. The product keeps getting better. At this price I think I will start buying them as gifts.Best feature: not having a browser or other electronic distraction! You can actually use it to read a book.Other favorite features: Great readable screen. Fast page turns. Lots of customization of reading experience.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I swore I'd never use an e-reader, but I've crossed the line! I've had my Kindle for one day and I've downloaded 2 books. Really enjoying it. I'll never give up my actual books, but this is so convenient for when I'm in a hurry for a good read, I don't have to wait for a delivery, I don't have to run to the store or library. Also, I can download library books to the Kindle! When they are due back, they just disappear from the device. Love it! The screen is glare free and very comfortable to read and operate. I didn't get the Kindle with the back-light because I figure my actual books don't come with a light and since this was my first reader I didn't want to pay more. If I ever upgrade, I can give this one to my grand daughter.",Love it!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love that it fits in my purse and I can take it anywhere.  I had a Kindle several years ago and gave it to my granddaughter when I bought an iPad.  I recently bought the 10.5"" Galaxy Tab S and kept thinking about getting another Kindle because the size makes it so much more portable.  Amazon offered a special deal recently and I jumped on it.  So glad I did.  I was surprised that it was a touch screen (no, I did not read the product specs as carefully as I should have).  If you are looking for a small e-reader, I would definitely recommend the Kindle.","Love, love, love my Kindle.";;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this device mainly to see what all the hoopla was about. I also bought it to see how it works because I am a writer who will be self-publishing soon, and I wanted to see how the user would be reading my book when it's published. So here are the pros. It's a good size. Feels like a small trade paperback in my hands. It can hold a lot of books. I already have over 100 downloaded onto it. Most were free to download by the way. So here's the cons. It's dimly lit, and there's no way to adjust the brightness from what I can find. So if I want to read my Kindle device in the dark it's tough nuggets. Everything is in black and white. So no way to see the color(s) on a book cover. I am sure higher priced Kindles are vastly superior, and probably fix all the cons I mentioned, but I think that those features should just be basic on ALL Kindles, and not just the higher ones--if those features are there to begin with. It's a nice little intro to the world of digital literature, but I think Amazon could do much better with a product like this.",It's a good size. Feels like a small trade paperback in ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had a Kindle Fire that I used for a few years, and I recently decided to get the regular paper white Kindle, instead, for just books and get a samsung tab for internet/apps and such. I am so pleased with this! You can read in the sun, no glare, and it's so much easier on your eyes for actual reading. If you are looking for a Kindle that you want to use for e-books only, this is really great. It's almost exactly the same feel as reading an actual paper book. Couldn't be happier.",I am so pleased with this;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"my last 3 Kindles were the keyboard type. It is taking me a while to figure out how to get to the various settings. Thank goodness there is a video on the Kindle site. Lack of keyboard does allow the Kindle to be smaller and lighter, though (easier to slip in my purse)",my last 3 Kindles were the keyboard type. It ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"My old reader died a horrible death and I shopped around for a good deal and I certainly got one. I like being able to get my books through Amazon as I trust them and this reader has lived up to what I read about it. And, I've found books that I haven't seen in years that are available. I'm still learning about the reader but enjoying it very much.",My old reader died a horrible death and I shopped around for a good deal ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Everyone advised that I get the Paperwhite. I didn't listen and now I am happy that I didn't! This is a great and simple interface, no light, but I usually read under a light and dislike having a bright book in a dark place (contrast strains the eyes). The features of the Kindle are pretty sweet (this is my first ereader). I have two different library download sites that my state offers me, so I can pretty much get any book for free, or cheap. I share this with my 7 year old daughter, who is breezing through books, and it is wonderful.I highly recommend this version of the Kindle, as it is simply a book with a few great features to make reading that much more enhanced, without taking away from it. It is the E-reader for us book-people.",Ereader for Book-People;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This has been a most unexpected and pleasurable item to use. My kids purchased it as a gift for me. I am an avid book lover and never thought I would enjoy an electronic book. I was wrong. It has been a wonderful gift & I use it every day. It is also very simple & user friendly, which is good for someone born before the computer era. I would highly recommend it to anyone who loves to read. Furthermore, it is much easier to carry around with me than a regular book. Please note a simple piece of advice though;" Always keep at least a few books on the devise. I made the mistake of only having 1 book on it while out of Wi-Fi range when I completed that 1 book and could not download another until getting back into range of a Wi-Fi signal. I now keep at least 3-5 books on the device at all times.""
Review: I am an avid book lover and never thought I would enjoy an electronic book";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This the most fantastic device I have every purchased from Amazon. As I get older, my eyes are not what they used to be and, although I am an avid reader, and while I used to base my book selection on author and book title,  I find myself gravitating toward books with larger type. With this, and its adjustable type, I can read like I was young again. I absolutely love it. My only complaints are that (a) the 110 volt charging cord should have been included with it, and (b) the leather case is a ripoff and not worth nearly the price. But, again, as to the Kindle itself, it is better than watermelons, sliced bread, and sex. What can I say?","Better than Watermelons, Sliced Bread, and Sex";;;;;;

Review: I wanted another kindle besides my fire just for reading books and where I could have everything downloaded easily.  I understood the limitations of this version(primarily no light on the screen) so I am very satisfied.  I got it though staples with a great rebate so I was a really good deal for what I wanted.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have an ipad mini so I didn't want a kindle with all the ""bells and whistles"" of internet, streaming movies, etc.... I just wanted a basic kindle to add books to and read from . This is perfect. Fits right in my purse. I can pull it out in a waiting room, on my lunch break, etc. It doesn't have a backlight on it, so if you MUST have one, you will need to order a different version of kindle. This one is there most basic one, and it meets my needs just fine.",Just what I needed;;;;;;
5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have Kindle Fire, which I dearly love;" however cannot read it in the sunlight.  So
Review: I bought the e-reader specifically because I am going on a beach vacation and want to read while I am away.  This is not my first e-reader (this is my third the first two having gone to Kindle heaven) so I know that it is perfect for vacation reading:  it is light weight
Title;;;;;;: holds more than enough books and best of all I CAN READ IT IN THE SUN because it is glare-free.""
column4: Why I bought an e-reader";;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"My wife got this for me for a great price; she got some sort of special offer via Amazon Prime.  It would be a five star rating if it had all the bells and whistles such as whispernet
Review: a colored display
Title;;;;;;: and etc.  I guess I've been spoiled to those things by my tablet.  For the money
column4: it has been great.  The battery life has been great.  I had an older Kindle model
column5: a Kindle Keyboard
column6: and this is a million times better than those.  The ads aren't even intrusive;" they just show up on the front while you aren't looking.""
column7: So Much Better than the old Kindle Keyboard!";;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought this when it was on sale.  I knew it was the basic model and that's fine.  I don't need a ton of bells and whistles.  And it was my first e-reader so I figured this would be a good entry level model.  I have a few free books on it and have read ONE.  I never use it.  No matter how I adjust things, it's just not right for me and my eyes.","Seems Nice, Just Not For Me";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first kindle so I didn't know what to expect.Surprisingly, it is as small as to fit in my mailbox, and very light to carry.Screen is white and black, reading is smooth for the special .mobi format or other pdf of good quality. Not all the books in your computer look good on the kindle. Page transition looks a little cheap, as it takes some ms for the screen to flush and you could observe it .I thought I would be a little disturbed by the ads, but actually I am not. There is no turn off for the kindle, as the ad stays there on the screen all the time.Overall, I have a useful device which does its job. Reading goes very smoothly. Very practical overall.",Useful device which does its job;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my 5th kindle. I still have the 1st gen Kindle and 3 keyboard Kindles, all of which still work great! The only reason I bought this one is because it was offered to me at $29. I couldn't say ""no,"" so I bought it. Can anyone ever have too many?  Anyway, I am enjoying the lighter weight of it and it works as well as, if not faster, than my older and very reliable ones.",Great little device for avid readers;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"Have two kindles and both were OK but I recently upgraded my network router and they seem to be unable to operate with the latest model Dlink AC-1750 router. All other wifi devices work fine but the kindles cannot connect and keep on requesting you enter a new password (over and over and over again!). Kindle support was useless (would you like to buy a 3rd one and see if that works!) . I have tried every possible setting on the router including removing all security and even though the router sees the kindles as wifi clients, they say they can't connect and I now have to use my phone wifi hotspot to get books. Would not buy another one.",Wifi incompatible with Dlink AC1750 router;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love my new Kindle! It has many, many good things about it. I love the ability to access from the Cloud immediately, but wish that when I categorize my books, they would disappear from the general list on my Kindle only, (not in the Cloud! - Please don't make them disappear from there!). I do not like to have to go thru so many books over and over again to categorize them. I would actually like to be able to put each book into my categories as I buy them. Is that possible?",New Kindle in the House!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"It charged fast, the print is clear and easy to read (I enlarge it), it's easy to use. I don't find it to be completely glare free, but for the most part it is. I've owned a Nook Simple Touch for 3 years, using it daily, and I like the feel of it better as it doesn't slip through fingers so easy, and I like the ability to use buttons as well as touch screen to turn pages. The screen is clearer and has less glare then the Kindle. The Kindle charges faster, seems to hold a charge longer. I've had it for only 3 months, and though there are things about Nook I like better, I have no complaints about the Kindle.",the print is clear and easy to read (I enlarge it);;;;;;

Review: I like to read my kKndle while I am hunting deer.  After reading in a misty drizzle of rain my earlier version of Kindle died. After arriving back home I immediately ordered a new Kindle for my reading pleasure. I chose this version because it didn't have a back light which kills the battery faster. It was also similar to my previous version. So far I like it very much. The only reason I gave it a four star rating is because I now will have to use special gloves while reading while I am hunting or I will have to take my glove off every time I turn a page. I did enjoy the push button page turner while out in the woods with my gloves on.
Title;;;;;;: I like to read my kKndle while I am hunting deer;;;;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"Its OK and and allows me to read outdoors which I could not do on the IPAD. However, its time that the the PaperWhite technology be the standard even in the base model. For the price I paid under the special I got value. However, without the deal, this device is no bargain.",It's Just OK;;;;;;

Review: This entry-level Kindle is just what I was looking for: something inexpensive to read in bright sunlight with.  Does the job without breaking the bank on yet ANOTHER muti-hundred dollar electronic device.  You need a booklight to use it in low or no light though.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"As you know this is the fifth Kindle that I've owned and it rates up there with best of them.  The only thing that I miss is the color.  However, it has every thing you would want in a handy reader.  I have transferred Bibles, books and other reading material to it and find that it is wonderful that I can read from it even in full sunlight. It is good to study from and use any where.  I use it when I'm teaching or waiting for an appointment etc. I find it so handy and so easy to carry with me, it is always in my hand.",It is the handiest of the Kindles!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Easy to read. Easy to get books downloaded.  It's great. The no-glare factor is the best feature of all. I didn't believe it would really work outside until I sat on my patio to do some reading.  I was truly impressed. Plus, I can actually see and read with or without my glasses.",Love My Kindle!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I read lots of reviews before buying this kindle. Seems like people who have owned prior versions of the kindle do not like this newer version as much as those of us new to Kindle. But I am a first time kindle user and I am very fond of it.
