I am very farsighted, so reading regular books can be rough (even with glasses). The screen on this is very easy on the eyes and I love the fact that I can enlarge the print. The battery lasts weeks on a charge. The only real issues I have with it are that the touch screen is sometimes slow to respond, and learning to navigate a book in digital format. One quick note, when you buy accessories make sure you get accessories made for the ""All New Kindle"" and/or ""2014 Version"". I bought a very nice case that did not fit, lesson learned.",First Time Kindle user and I am hooked;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I might be a little biased because mine was broken. It never would charge properly. It was constantly dying. But also I realized, it not having a back lit screen was a huge issue for me! Just all around hated it. But the return was really easy. So that's good!",Disappointed;;;;;;

Review: If you do not want lit screen go for this instead for the higher resolution one. I bought the higher resolution and own both of them. There is not much difference in the quality of the text in real life.

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this because I cracked the screen on my previous kindle (my fault).  I was surprised that this new model was heavier and bulkier than my older kindle from years back.  I suppose it's to squeeze in the touch technology.  The touch technology is not bad. Though, I do miss the lighter and thinner kindle I used to own. But, otherwise, I use my kindle a lot and I like it.",Good but surprisingly thicker/heavier than my older version.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a pretty cool little device. I think the Kindle books are way too expensive considering what I'm giving up (having the physical book on my bookshelf and flipping the pages), but there are enough free books that it makes it worth more;" plus
Review: the ability to read PDFs is very useful. As a musician
Title;;;;;;: this will come in handy in the future. Now if I can convince my wife to hand it over...""
column4: Pretty cool little device.";;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I can't give this neat little device 5 stars.  I just can't do it.  It works good enough to do the job, but I'm not blown away.  I really expected the screen to be more white, not so off-white, but it is still very readable in good lighting, which is what it is designed for.  I probably would have wanted the Paperwhite model, but I really liked the discounted price on Prime Day, so I can live with it.  The touch screen seems overly sensitive to me and I frequently turn multiple pages by accident and have to find my way back.  I may have to try a stylus.  It also seems slow and laggy to respond for everything but page turns.  Once again, I bought the cheapest one, so I can live with it.  Other than those little issues, it's a really nice little reader and does everything automatically like downloading and such.  I like it, but not 5 stars worth.",Not bad for the price.;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I was much happier with the previous version.I like the touchscreen in theory but this one is not great. The font and text size change every time I put it down. Very irritating. It needs a lock of some sort. I wish you could set your own gestures. The ones it uses are strange and awkward. I have to use both hands to turn a page. That's silly.I can choose to read in landscape orientation but only on one side, I'd much prefer the other one, and it switches back to portrait when you go to the menu and other areas. I find it harder to hold in portrait as it becomes top heavy. I really hate that. Hate it.I'm a bit of a Wordy. I like reading the dictionary. I was really looking forward to the Word Wise (and Vocabulary Builder) feature but found it to be something for children or for people who are still learning the language. The first time I actually came across a word I needed a definition for, it didn't have one. That feature ought to have difficulty settings.I don't hate it, but I'm really disappointed in it.It absolutely does everything it says it does but not as well as it should.",Meh;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"very lightweight, small, easy to read. I wish it was backlit, so I could read in the dark. Other than that, it is everything I could ask for. One thing I wish amazon/kindle would, is to allow you to  move all of the books you have on one device, to another, with one move.It was tedious to have to move all of my book from my old kindle, one at a time, to my new kindle. Just a thought.",my new reader;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my second Kindle.  I bought the smaller of the kindles and I actually prefer it.  The first Kindle that I bought, about five years ago, had a keypad on it.  Personally, I found that to be a pain in the butt.  This version has no keypad.  Please be aware that it has no light, either.  It also works via touch and I am much happier with it this way.  It's smaller and lighter and actually fits in my pocketbook, without a problem!  I got it on sale for $40 and am tickled pink with it!  The charge lasts for days, whereas the other one lasted for hours.  It also holds many, many more books!!  If I had the need, I would buy a second one!!  I am very pleased!!!","Smaller, lighter Kindle made me a happier customer!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had one of the old second generation Kindles with the keyboard that communicated through the Sprint network.  Loved it, but then I decided to move up in the world to a tablet, specifically, a Galaxy Tab 2 10.1, and passed the Kindle on to my son.  Again, I loved the tablet, but portability was an issue;" it was too big to take with me to the store while waiting for my wife - whose """"I just need a couple of things"""" usually means hours.  So last month
Review: when the price came down dramatically
Title;;;;;;: I decided to splurge on this entry-level Kindle
column4: just for reading purposes.  I absolutely love it.  No
column5: it can't do all the things my tablet can do
column6: but then again
column7: neither can my tablet when it doesn't have a wi-fi connection.  It's small
column8: light
column9: and easy to carry in my pocket.  As far as the touch screen that many are complaining about
column10: I have no issue with it
column11: given that I had to swipe to read on my tablet.  While travelling for Christmas
column12: I loved the no-glare screen for reading in the car.  And after dealing with the battery hog that a tablet can be
column13: I can't stress enough how much I love the multiple day battery.  Great choice for reading.""
column14: Loved it
column15: but then I decided to move up ...""";;;;;

Review: My first Kindle. I simply love it! Even without a back light it's completely glare free and I'm enjoying every page of every book I read! Now my daughter is wanting one and can't for Christmas because this is going to be onee of her gifts.
Title;;;;;;: I simply love it! Even without a back light it's completely ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Connects to the internet great though you can not use it to browse the internet, only Amazon for books. Some times it skips a page when progressed so it's something to watch out for. It downloads books effortlessly and doesn't keep you from using the kindle as it is downloading. It is very easy to read from and it really does look like paper. It doesn't have all the bells and whistles of the higher models but I don't think they are necessary. I almost bought the next model up but it was so much more expensive and I only wanted that one because it comes with free 3g internet and I don't have good access to internet right now. All in all I think this base model is a great value and I would recommend it to anyone.",Connects to the internet great though you can not use it to browse the ...;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"Well this kindle was amazing for exactly a year. It worked well, and I used it frequently with a great battery life. However, as soon as the warranty expired the screen froze and the customer help guy said my only option was to buy a new one or ""google kindle repairs in your area.""",Well this kindle was amazing for exactly a year;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"My old kindle with the side buttons broke , so I bought this one. I absolutely hate it, and will be sending it back. Maybe its just me , but I don't like the touch screen. I found it difficult and confusing. Also I had a page freeze on me. Unfroze an hour later. I just wanted to buy a basic Kindle so I can read books. I guess they don't make it anymore.",Sending it back.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my second purchase. The screen broke on the first one after about 3 years. It started as a dot and then eventually messed up 50% of the screen. I took good care of it so I don't think it was anything I did. Eventually I love this reader so much that I decided to get another one very quickly. Amazon has always the best customer service in all my experience and even though they didn't do anything about the first one, I am still confident in their products.",Simple e-reader just the way it should be!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"A great introduction to those that are looking for a dedicated e-reader and find back lit devises harsh on the eyes. It is easy to setup and use. A great gift for those with poor eye sight that enjoy reading. If you've ever held a large print book, they are HUGE and HEAVY, this is so light there is no issue holding it for hours.At only $60 and free 2-day shipping at this time, this is a great thing to order and donate to a local charity. With free wi-fi everywhere, being able to borrow from the local library, and the large list of free ebooks available at Amazon, this is a great present to share with those less fortunate.",Great introduction to e-reader;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"First, the product is great!However, Amazon dropped the price by $20 one week after I bought this. I feel a bit cheated.Update: Amazon offered to refund me the $20!I bought this after I stepped on my Kindle Keyboard I got in 2010. I wasn't happy with getting a new model - I loved one I had.The speed, the touch screen, and the bigger capacity has won me over. I especially like that it integrates with Goodreads!",Good product. Missed a huge savings opportunity. UPDATED;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I had some problems with this kindle as described on my previous review copied bellow, but the excellent Amazon customer service promptly contacted me and proposed me a solution, which was updating the kindle software, or replacing the device as last resource. I have been using this kindle for a few days after the update and now it works like a charm. I am giving 4 starts to this kindle, and 6 stars for the excellent customer service.If you don't care about having an integrated service with Goodreads, I would still recommend the previous kindle 4th generation because is thinner, lighter, and aesthetically more beautiful. Nevertheless being able to access Goodreads on your kindle is perfect, and if you care about that I would definitely recommend this Kindle 6"" Touchscreen.-----------------------------------------I was reluctant to upgrade my old kindle because it worked great for me. However the integration with Goodreads was something that I wanted and since it is unlikely that Amazon will release a firmware upgrade for old kindles, I decided to give this new model a chance. I have to say that I am frustrated with my decision, and I still read most of my ebook on my good old kindle.Cons:- Sometimes the touch screen stays active for few seconds even after kindle is put to sleep. Because of that my books are frequently in different pages when I turn back on, and it is a pain to find back the right page.- When I am reading in the airplane mode to save some battery, errors appears in the middle of the reading saying that it couldn't find network connection. I have to turn some pages back and forth to make the message disappear and when it does, sometimes it skips randomly a few pages or a whole chapter and it is again a pain to find back the right page.- The touch screen was not designed for left handed people.- The software that runs on this kindle feels like horrible.Pros:- Integrated with Goodreads.The previous kindle fourth generation is simpler but very well designed. This new one sounds cool in theory, but they did a nice job in ruining the reading experience, besides making the device thicker, heavier, and less attractive aesthetically speaking.","Problem Solved, Thanks Amazon!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my 5th Kindle device, although only 4 are still working.  This one is a completely different type.  More like a tablet or I-Pad.  It is touch sensitive.  To turn the page, you sweep your finger across it instead of pushing a bar.  To me, that is more labor intensive but I don't think it's supposed to be.  You tap the screen in various areas to bring up menus.  It's harder, to me, to create and fill collections than on the other type, but one can get used to almost everything, I suppose.  The fact that you can load so many more books on it is a high plus in its favor.  I'm not sorry I bought this at all.  I'm still in love with the technology of e-books!","Not like previous generations;" some better
Review: some worse""";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love it. If I can't have a  book in my hands this the next best thing. My buddy has the kindle w/back light and it is also great. I read in in areas that are lite ( lamp inside or  natural sun light outside). I can download an eBook in less than a minute. When traveling I can download several books to take with me. Now if I read more in darker areas or in bed I would have gotten kindle with the back light. The battery last quite a bit longer on mine than my buddy's with the extra usage of the light.....so each to their own. One last thought is that when reading from a book the print size is what it is, but the kindle allows several different print sizes. Easy swipe of screen (like a phone) to next page or back. You can hold your finger down on a word for a definition. Back to traveling, the convenience of carrying several book in a small device is wonderful. When reading just tap the top of screen you will be offered several options. What ever page you are on you can return to home page and choose a different book without loosing page you were on from previous book or books. Times I read more then one book or one book is poems that I might want to go back to. Another good option is the ability to select chapters.",I love it. If I can't have a book in ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I just love my new Kindle! It does not strain the eye, the dictionary, vocabulary builders are exceptional and reading is such a delight. I could not be happier with my order. It's such a beautiful gadget for avid readers, making reading more than a pleasure.",Just what the universe ordered!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is noticeably cheaper feeling that the metallic Kindle I had previously, but it doesn't really matter. The e-ink display is very sharp and makes reading much more of a pleasure than on a backlit display. Huge battery life makes this an obvious replacement for a pile of books on your next vacation.",This is noticeably cheaper feeling that the metallic Kindle I ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my new favorite thing. Now that I have a Kindle, I can't believe I waited so long to get one. There are so many free books available. I've been finding that it's really easy to use. It's been easy to transfer MOBI files that I've saved to my Google Drive from Gutenberg.org using the USB cord. The battery charged really fast when I first opened the box. Once I signed on to my Wifi, my other Kindle books quickly became available to read. I'm so excited to explore books!",I'm so excited!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Great price for a perfectly sized reading device.  Very lightweight, so I wonder about durability.  Given the price, not a big worry.  I wished the screen was a brighter white.  I bought this as battery life is so much better than an iPad!",Great value;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Cutest eReader I've owned yet, and lightest. Comfy to hold and slips easily into most purse sizes. I've owned a Sony 505, a basic Nook, a Kindle Fire. Neither of those readers have been this light.If you don't need to read in the dark, like to carry your reader everywhere you go, and don't need any extras like an MP3 player, then this should do you just fine. Has a nice crisp screen and fast response time. I have only ever charged this device once since I bought it... Four weeks later, and it is still going. I read about an hour a day. For a no frills reader, this is great value.",Comfy to hold and slips easily into most purse sizes;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I resisted getting a Kindle because I love reading actual books so much, but now I've changed my mind and I love the kindle. It's so convenient to just grab a book online and started reading, it looks just like a page and I still use a light in bed to read by. So fun, it's really great! Also stays charge for like months at a time!",I resisted getting a Kindle because I love reading actual books so much;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Wow, what a great gift for my Husband. He loves to read and does it quite often. He takes it to work with him every day, as he has to sit and wait for the patients he transports. He has thanked me a million times for his glare free Kindle. He has always read before sleep. He says that it is so much better than holding a book.He loves the features as well. Thank you again Amazon for a job well done. Great product, great sevice as always. I have truly never been disappointed with anything.",What a great Kindle;;;;;;

Review: It's a great way to store books. Not being a lit screen is more natural.Once in a while it jumps many pages when I just want to turn a page.It's probably too complicated to be able to s at exactly what page you're on but it would be nice.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"So far, so great. I have not even had to re-charge my new Kindle yet and I've been reading my usual amount every night for at least 3 weeks. I love that the paperwhite screen is not an LCD display so there is no lit up screen to stare at. Such screen exposure disrupts your internal clock and interferes with sleep. I have enjoyed the virtual highlighting feature which sets the digital version apart from standard library books.",Still love books but the Kindle is a useful e-reader.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my third (and smallest) tablet/reader.Initially less than impressed.Reading was OK'ish, but less enjoyable than expected.Decided to keep it and a couple of weeks later my opinion came up slightly,but NOT to five stars.Contrast and font are adjustable (size and character set), andI can read this anywhere I can read a paper printed book.It's an evolving product, and will get better.Just wondering about the battery's life expectancy.I'm guessing it's throwaway when the battery no longer holds a good charge.Anyone know?",Good enough for my tired eyes.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love the look, the size, the weight.  The toolbar is versatile and allows the reader to get anywhere and do practically anything instantly. When I need a definition, I just touch the word itself and hold until the dictionary entry appears.  This Kindle also lets you decide how much reading assistance you get so it's a great reader for children and adults. The only thing that isn't perfect is the swipe page-turn. It's very sensitive and once in a while it skips ahead --- whoa!  Other than that, it's great.",A Great Deal for the Price...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I was a little disappointed in this Kindle. It is very light weight, but the screen feels smaller than my old Kindle and it is harder to see at night. The feature I like the most is the ability to change the font size, now I don't have to always wear my glasses to read! The other thing that is annoying is that the touchscreen is so sensitive that if you accidentally lightly brush it you will activate a change in font or the dictionary. The old Kindle cover will not fit the new Kindle and I wish they would make them universal!I also don't like the Kindle store front. The way the books are listed it is hard to read the titles(they are too small) once you have downloaded a book. Otherwise, the Kindle works well.",I was a little disappointed in this Kindle;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"It's a fine reader, bit my elderly mother could not master the options on the touch screen. She has an older reader with the hard keys on the device.The battery is tiring and I thought it would be nice to replace it with a nee one. No-go for the 88 year old.","Need a VERY simple ""Granny Kindle""";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this Kindle for my wife, but i soon realized that the operating protocols were different from my 4year old Kindle Fire.  Since she was already familiar with the KF, I decided let her have the KF and to try the Kindle 6.  I like it for reading books and have more or less adopted it.  I like the long battery life, the light weight, its compactness, and the low price.  With choice of fonts, format. and line spacing, I have it adjusted for very easy reading.  I plan to let my wife have the old Kindle Fire and do much of my reading with the Kindle 6.",A Fine Simple E-book reader;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This Kindle is great for binge reading, because it's light and can be held in one hand. I like the ability to adjust the screen brightness, text size, and text style to make it easier to read. The anti-glare screen is probably it's best feature -- I have tried it out in direct sunlight in and out doors and it truly is anti-glare. It's easy to use, and purchasing books from the store is very quick. You don't have to wait more than a few seconds for them to download. Great for when you finish a book in a series and can't wait to get your hands on the next one! For the price this is a great value.",This Kindle is great for binge reading;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have visual problems and the kindle makes reading so much easier...there is no glare and I can adjust the size of the letters.  The only problem I have had is not knowing how to get rid of word wise and turning too many pages at a time and not being able to go back a couple of pages without going to home, go to, and type in the page number.  I should probably read more of the user guide but to be honest....it is not that helpful.  My kindle did not have a tutorial on it or else I did something wrong.  Could use some help here.",I have visual problems and the kindle makes reading so ...;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my 3rd Kindle. I've liked and enjoyed using my Kindles from the start. But...I'm an old dog that doesn't want to learn a new trick. And I HATE this Kindle 6"" Touch Screen model. I liked the weight, the feel, the side buttons, the content format, and numerous other features of my 1st two Kindles. This new model is slightly bigger, slightly wider, slightly thicker, you name it. All of the differences are so slight that you almost can't tell. But when I'm reading I can. And I don't like it. I'm not a tech person, I just want to read a book. Give me simple and I'm happy. I've invested way too much money in Amazon books to switch as my collection is close to 275 books. Amazon you need to give the people what they want!",I've liked and enjoyed using my Kindles from the start;;;;;;

Review: This is exactly what I wanted.  An e-reader and the ability to order more books from the e-reader.  It is easy to setup because it comes setup for you.  This is the basic reader.  There is no light or ability to listen to audiobooks.  It is very lightweight.  You can hold it in one hand while you are reading.  The battery lasts a long time.  I had it a week before I charged the battery and I read every day.
Title;;;;;;: It is easy to setup because it comes setup for you;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"First Kindle I've owned. It was given to me as a gift. Nice. I knew nothing about these other than people talked about the Kindle and how they like them for reading. One thing I would have liked with it was a backlight. Didn't take any stars off because it was a gift and I guess I could have somehow returned it and got one with a backlight. Only other thing is it seems slow to boot up but it doesn't matter. After all if you are into speed, you probably aren't reading. Just an observation. Good basic ereader.",Good Basic Ereader;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Coming from a 2nd generation Kindle, this is pretty great. So light and airy. The touch screen is fun, options are great. My biggest complaint is how sensitive the touch screen is...if it touches ANYTHING, it changes the page (sometimes several) on me and/or the font. I come from using an iPhone, which has amazing technology that know when SKIN touches it & doesn't type, etc if my shirt or a cup bump into it. It's quite an adjustment from the buttons turning the page but I'll adjust. It's still pretty amazing!",this is pretty great. So light and airy;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"It may not show as verified purchase because my husband bought this for me on his amazon account for Christmas this year and I  love it! No hard glare because it doesn't have  the lit up screen but it is great in sunlight. Battery lasts longer then my other e- reader. Holds thousands of books and has never froze on me like other e-readers have!! Great buy for the price! If you want all the apps chose the Kindle fire, if you want a kindle for only reading this one is perfect!I like using the Goodreads connection available with this Kindle also!",longer lasting battery;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I would really like to say that I Love it, but can't because I'm spoiled and wanted the one with text to speech. I wasn't aware that all kindles didn't come with it. At first the touch screen display is a bit choosy and can be a bit of a pain. After a full days use, I found it wonderful. I would still love the text to speech feature, but I am happy with what it does come with.Reading is a breeze, no glare, no issues beyond the listed.Wonderful product and would recommend it to others.",I like it;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I like my new kindle. I exchanged it for the older model that did not yet have a touch screen. My old Kindle started loosing its screen after 3 years. It seems a common issue. I was very impressed with the ease that Amazon sent me a new one at a really good price. I really like the grey background it is comfortable to read for my eyes. This Kindle is a little thicker than the old model and the screen seems smaller, even though it is not. The frame just makes it seem like that. I liked the sizing better on my older Kindle, but I guess there is more technology in this one and that might take extra space. There is a lot of free dictionaries available and you can organize your books into categories which is great when you have a lot of them. Altogether a great thing for people who travel a lot and like to have their books with them without the weight.","Great screen, happy customer";;;;;;

Review: I got this kindle as a gift from a book event I went to and I love it. It's very light and small so it fits in my purse perfectly. I haven't charged it in a month and I use it on and off. So for me the battery is great. I highly recommend this kindle.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Great product for the price.  It does not have a light, but I knew this when I bought it.  Probably comparing the price to Paperwhite, it would be the better deal if you definitely don't need a light.  I bought it for use outdoors during day, becauseI cannot see on my Kindle HDX at all outdoors during daylight.",Great product for the price;;;;;;

Review: This  was gifted to me. I am very happy with it so far. I have not had any problems using Overdrive to download books directly to my Kindle from my local library. I like that the text font size is adjustable & that there is a dictionary available. I immediately purchased a screen protector and a hard shell cover for it. Without the cover the Kindle felt slick and fragile and I was afraid that I would damage it in no time.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I was worried about these being ""refurbished"", but they look and work perfect. No need to fear the word. This is a great transition from paper to electric. Easy on the eyes for those who have issues with back lit readers = faster reading. I suggest that if you're thinking about Christmas presents get it! And a gift card for Kindle books.",Pleasently Suprised;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this for my father who is in the hospital after a serious issue. He was in there without his glasses and could not read anything in normal print. When this arrived I put some Louis L'Amour books on it for him and took down to him. He was able to read the screen without glasses and without having to blow the font all the way up. This came through exactly like I needed it to. Thank you, Amazon.",Let me give books back to my father;;;;;;

Review: This is a great value at $50 for a reader. My 1st generation Kindle bit the dust and it cost about $350 way back then. I love the touch screen for all function except on and off. The only thing I can see that would be nice is to have the ability to zoom-in on graphs and diagrams. This Kindle like my 1st generation device leave those images very hard to read if not impossible. I read mostly technical books and have thought about the larger Kindle offerings but haven't been willing to put out the cash. For books where I need to really see the graphics I by paper books. But other than that this is a great reader.
Title;;;;;;: This is a great value at $50 for a reader;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Smaller than earlier ones.Still  easy to read on. Bright enough and clear. Very portable and light but big enough to read. I bought a protective case separately and it makes it more substantial. Since my last one only lasted a year, thats important!! These are fragile! Portable. Love the touch screen. I do wish it had audible but its not a deal breaker. I don't mind the ads. they only show up when you turn it on, the older versions just had kindle ads. These are kindle plus other companies or products. If they don't interest -- one swipe and they are gone.",Worth getting - especially on sale.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Good Kindle, and knew what I was buying, but still find the lack of backlight more irritating than I thought I would.  I have a kindle paperwhite, and my husband snagged this one to replace his recently broken Kindle Touch.  We bought a case with a light, but there just arent enough products with a durable enough light to make this a worthwhile purchase anymore.  Glad we snagged this on sale!",Pretty good Kindle; just HATE that there is no backlight!;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have a Kindle 2 and only replaced it because the screen cracked and it was slowing way down, but I can tell I'll love this as much - as soon as I get used to the difference in touch and buttons.  I'm still learning how it works, so I'm slower finding things on this one..........",Think I'm Gonna Love It;;;;;;

Review: High quality and durable feeling.  Easy to use. Though every now and again I do activate the wrong action when touching the screen. It is tons easier to use then the old model I used a little. The old one used button controls that were tough and confusing to navigate.  This model (generation 7) the controls are really easy to learn and understand.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"This item definitely does what it says. It allows you to read books without carrying books with you. It isn't built to do anything else but it does that one thing really well.This version is the lowest tier of Kindle available. It has none of the bells and whistles, like 3G access to the internet or a backlight or a high definition screen. However, if you load on a bunch of books (and it will hold lots and lots of books), you don't need the 3G even when you can't find a wifi signal. It has it's own dictionary so you can still look up words even without wireless signal. It is light, and easy to hold, and the user interface feels very intuitive to me. Without a backlit screen you do need a decent light source to read, but then, so do books. The screen is clear and readable, and I appreciate being able to make the text different sizes.Yes, the screen savers on this device are advertisements. There are no ads while you are actually reading, and hey, you might find a new book or two that you would love, that you wouldn't have heard of otherwise. So far the ads seem pretty unobtrusive to me, but if you don't like them you can pay a fee and Amazon will turn them off for you, which seems reasonable, especially as it's only a one time fee, not an ongoing charge. My old 3rd gen Kindle has a finite number of screen savers and you can't change them, so this is at least different.Overall, for the price I paid, given that I can't afford the paperwhite or the voyager, this is a good reading device with a good screen that is easy to use but isn't full of the fun bells and whistles that come if you can invest more money into your electronics.",like 3G access to the internet or a backlight or ...;;;;;;

Review: I bought 2 of these for my grandkids for Christmas. They are exactly as described. The glare free screen makes it easy on their eyes and they can read in different lighting conditions which makes it great for reading in the car or in bed at night. The size is great too.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"The Kindle continues to improve.  This is the third incarnation of the Kindle I've had.  This one is WiFi only, but picks up the local signals with ease.  I got the cover designed to go with this Kindle, which automatically puts it to sleep when you close it.  It's much easier to use than my last Kindle.  This one has thumbnails of the covers of the books, so I can browse my library more easily, and an option to read them off the cloud or download them to my device.  All in all, Kindle technology is advancing and making me happy.",Best. Reading. Experience. Ever.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Before this Kindle I hated reading. The page feeling of a book makes me cringe and the glare from light is awful on a regular book.  This kindle allows me to personalize my reading experience for myself.  It makes it so I can space the text how I want, make it bolder, change margins and tracks the percent and location I'm at in the book  making it more fun because I see my progress.  It's awesome and has driven me to start reading tons now! Best gift ever!!!","Amazing device, I actually enjoy reading for the first time in my life!";;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Cons: I had a Kindle Keyboard for years, but someone stepped on it and the screen cracked. It like it was time to upgrade to the new version. To me, my old one seemed like the perfect size/shape for an e-reader. I used it all the time and it was comfortable to hold and read on. This one is smaller and the housing feels cheaper. I know I just bought the glare free version & not the version that has a reading light, but my last one you could at least adjust the contrast of the screen. The text cannot be adjusted to be darker on this one.Pros: It functions well, looks clean, is fast and holds a lot of books. The battery life is truly impressive. The ability to sync directly to Goodreads is fantastic.Overall: I'm just not as excited about picking this up to read on as I was about my last kindle simply for the way it feels in my hands. That, and because I absolutely have to use it in a very well lit room or outside. But it functions exactly as you would expect from a Kindle and I do not regret the purchase whatsoever.",I only have an issue with the style...;;;;;;

Review: I bought the Kindle touch because my Kindle keyboard  screen no longer worked. I haven't had the touch long but so far I like it. I do miss the buttons that the other model had. I didn't want a touchscreen and find that the touch is sensitive and turns more than one page at a time. As far as the other options on this reader go I probably won't use them.
Title;;;;;;: I haven't had the touch long but so far I like it. I do miss the buttons that the ...;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Although I just used this Kindle once, I really like it for the fact it is so easy on the eyes. If you read a lot like I do, reading a book on a tablet is not an option because of the glare and that is the reason  why I didn't buy a Kindle with back lighting. My only complains are: it doesn't come with any paperwork explaining how to use the software so you have to play with it and use it hit or miss.(Some of the pages came with highlights I didn't know how to delete) and you can only download Kindle books, unlike other tablets.",Easy on the Eyes;;;;;;
5.0 out of 5 stars,"I finally relented and purchases a Kindle.  I have always loved the feel of a good book in my hands;" flipping the paper pages
Review: seeing the progress as your bookmark moves through the book.  The Basic Kindle had the easiest to read screen
Title;;;;;;: in terms of strain on your eyes.  I also loved some of the features
column4: like the time left in the chapter and the total progress (%).""
column5: For all you hold-outs... get this Kindle... you won't regret it";;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I'll admit, I'm one of those who didn't clearly understand that Amazon was still producing ""paperwhites"" and regular ""kindles"" - I thought kindles had evolved to the point where they were all using ""paperwhite"" technology, and that only the older models weren't paperwhites.  I already owned a paperwhite that I bought last year, but recently gave it to my wife, so I was looking for a second one.  When I saw that this was ""latest generation"", I assumed that it had all the latest features (including the backlight), and chalked the lower price up to the fact that it was refurbished.  I'm not sure the lack of a backlight option would have been a dealbreaker, but I wish I had known at the time.  Anyway, no fault of the device, just wish Amazon were clearer in their marketing of ""paperwhite"" technology.",NOT A PAPERWHITE - NO BACKLIGHT!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchase this after my Kindle Fire developed some recharge issues.  I like the Kindle 6 better.  I read outside a lot and find this one easier to see and hold.  The easily adjustable font is very easy to convert with each book. I also like  the fact that it is lightweight and easily fits in my purse.  I'm still figuring out how to catagorize my books so that I know what I've read, but I'll eventually figure it out.",Light weight;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love my new Kindle!  This is my 3rd Kindle and I'm just as happy with it as I was my other 2!  I first got the Kindle keyboard, & that still works.  I got the Kindle Fire when it first came out, but just after that, it became a Kindle HD for the same price as I paid for a non-HD model.  Was a bit bothered by that, but not a biggie.  Now I got my new 6"" Kindle (got the lowest-priced one) and am very happy with it.  I don't need all the extra bells & whistles, so this will do me just fine!!",Still Love Kindle!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I specifically purchased this ""bottom"" model in order to NOT have any background lighting and avoid the ""blue screen"" issues associated with sleep interference. (And I thought that something that did NOT have the distractions of FaceBook and Candy Crush would be more productive).  Ended up being pleased for so many more reasons!  Lightweight, compact, super easy to read and turn pages, along with an amazing battery life.",No Blue Screen;;;;;;

Review: Very nice!  I have already downloaded 2 books from the owner library and the public library.  Very easy and so nice to be able to hold a library book without worrying about all the other people who have also held it - a little germophobic!

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought for my 9 year old to encourage him to read.  It's working!! According to him, reading kindle books on iPad mini,  it was too tempting to play a game or get distracted.  Now with kindle, it's books and only books. He's read 3 or 4 so far and can choose his own with my approval.  Only thing I don't like is that really inappropriate books are advertised on the ""off"" screen.  Not happy about words like ""murder"" appearing every time he picks the thing up. Other than that,  it's great.  Illustrations still show up as on iPad,  just in black and white, which is fine.","Great for kids, less the ads";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Snagged this during the Black Friday sale for $49.  I have the other devices to read my Kindle books on, but having one that will help with distractions (email, Facebook notifications, Candy Crush etc.) has helped get me reading more.  After searching several stores for cases with no luck, I found the Amazon case for $25 at Best Buy and it fits perfectly as it's specific for this device.  I wish the cover would unlock the device when opened, but it's just a quick swipe.  I can tell from other reviews that they haven't read the description of what this does and the same goes with cases - though trying to figure out which one to order was tricky, so I am glad I found the correct case at a store (for cheaper than on the Amazon site, plus I don't have prime, so the $35 free shipping limit wouldn't have helped much).  Overall I am pleased...simple, inexpensive and gets me reading!",Does what it says it does!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"It's a Kindle. It displays books, just like it is supposed to. Readable. No light (as expected). My cell phone charger plug works for it just fine, so no need to buy another. I bought this on the March '15 special for $59. I have an older Kindle Fire as well, but this is better for books. I'm not distracted by apps, the battery life is way longer and it is much lighter. The adverts are not too annoying (mostly books), and only show on the first screen before you swipe it to turn it on. Of course their proposed advert books are way off from my interest, but hey, that's Amazon. They'll figure it out one of these days. I bought a black leather-like cover (Elsse For Kindle 7th Gen) for about $9, and I don;"t like screen protectors
Review: so the whole kit was only $68. Satisfied customer.""
Title;;;;;;: just like it is supposed to";;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Works just fine BUT, how about a short piece of paper with some basic instructions on how to use it enclosed with it?I REALLY HATE having to search all over the internet to try to figure out how new electronics work. GoPro isanother time abuser.  If you're 18 and have all the time in the world, that's great.  However, those of us who actuallyWORK 12 hours a day 6 days a week don't have that luxury.",Works fine but how about some instructions;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Great value in this latest version of Kindle. It came packaged with a free 30 day subscription of Kindle Unlimited. My wife is partially disabled after knee surgery and reads about a book a day. In addition, the Kindle is lightweight and easier to handle for long bouts of reading.Briefly put, my wife, who wasn't sure she would like a Kindle, can't stop thanking me for it.",Big time reader and sceptic of digital books loves her new Kindle;;;;;;

Review: Not like my original kindle- I am not the type that like all the touch features. I like a kindle that has features displayed on the frame and easy to see features. All this slide technique is trying to copy an iPhone which if I wanted I would get an IPad
Title;;;;;;: Not like my original kindle- I am not the type that ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"So I had an earlier version and love kindles. This one doesn't have buttons which I kinda miss, but the touch screen works pretty well. I like that they changed the way it's made, the screen is the same size but it's a little thicker and a lot more compact so it fits in small bags and large pockets better. Haven't figured out how to make collections on this one yet, but I haven't spent a lot of time trying so there is probably a way.",So I had an earlier version and love kindles. This one doesn't have buttons which I ...;;;;;;

Review: I loved my old kindle. This one is thick and heavy in comparison. The touch screen is too sensitive. It gets to busy doing things that I don't like to have happening (e.g. it keeps changing fonts or opens a dictionary when I accidentally touch the screen. I miss the page turning buttons on the side. With this one you have to move your hand from where you are holding the kindle in order to swipe the screen.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I know that this might sound weird for some people but Kindle Glare Free works BETTER for me than paperwhite ! I was recently gifted with this Kindle and I love it more than my old paperwhite , mainly because of the light gray pages and the absence of the screen light (which tired my eyes after long hours of reading)",Love it so much!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"We recently had to order a new kindle as our last kindle developed a screen problem after several years.  We replaced one of the first kindles and I have to say the new one is a marked improvement at an excellent price.  My son loves the white screen and the touchscreen aspect compared to the scrolling and typing his last one had.  It's beautiful, easy to use and vibrant.  Hoping lots of reading gets accomplished with it!  Nice and light for carrying to school too.","Great price, great improvement";;;;;;

Review: I loved to read on my Kindle Fire (we are talking ~100 books a year) and that is not good for my eyes also not very useful in bright places. Got this on sale and I absolutely love it. This was used to upgrade my original Kindle the my husband was using for his textbooks. Super easy setup. I was reading within a few mins of opening. Only thing I don't like is that it does not come with a wall charger.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"The Kindle Touch (7th Gen/2014) is my first e-reader ever. I've been thinking of getting one for a while since reading off a tablet or even a LCD screen (anything backlit) is very fatiguing on the eyes.  My eyes feel extremely tired and dry after any such reading session. Another big reason for my purchase is two books that I wanted to buy were about $25 each while the Kindle versions were $10. A great incentive to finally take the plunge! Right there was a savings of $30. It's the same for other books with varying degrees of cost-saving.On to this one. I considered either this or the Paperwhite and eventually went with the touch to save the $40. Upon opening the box and slipping the Kindle out of its plastic case, I wanted to remove the sticker stuck across the screen, but lo and behold, it was the actual screen. Amazing. The text on this reader looks exactly like a printed page. - actually better. Specifications say that the Paperwhite is a higher resolution but let me tell you, I cannot imagine text being any more crisp than this. At least I doubt that the human eye can really differentiate it.It's a real plus to be able to set the text size to what you desire. I imagine this is a big plus to older people who are getting in the reading glasses zone. The only thing I would say is that the software could be a bit better in this regard -- the text size selection should stay with the book rather than be a system wide selection. Right now, if I change the font size it does it for all books - and for some reason different books have different default sizes.  In general the operating system is good but I imagine it can get a lot better.  One thing that is good is the ability to set up the Kindle for other users, i.e., ""freetime.""  You can set up a freetime account (another user) on your Kindle and only add selected books to their library.  That way, you an keep more adult oriented books away from kids for instance.This Kindle requires light to read but that's not an issue for me.  It's just like a book - you need a light to read. So I'm either in a lit room or use my bedside lamp.I've had mine for about 10 days now and the battery is still at least 30% charged.  In these 10 days I have discovered a ton of free Kindle books - from racy novels to biographies to classics to a magic book!  It's really drawing me back in to reading. It's amazing to be able to have hundreds of books right in your hands.  There's no doubt that printing of books will be gone within the next generation - and with this wonderful device (screen technology) - I won't miss them.In summary, I would say that if the extra $40 is no problem, spring for the Paperwhite as having the lit screen (different from backlit screens) could be useful when reading in bed with someone else. All-in-all I have to say that this is easier on my eyes than any screen or even a regular book. And it is getting me back to the joys of reading! It's been a great purchase for me!!",My first e-reader and it is awesome;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this. The package arrived timely and in good condition.  This review does not reflect negatively on MidContinent whom I have bought from before and look forward to purchasing through again.  This review is about the product--Kindle E-reader. When the Kindle arrived I discovered the usb cable was insufficient to properly charge the Kindle (per information supplied by Kindle) ,  so I purchased ac adapter for additional $20.00.  Then discovered, after charging the Kindle battery and reviewing the eoperator's manual,  I had to have WI-FI to link to computer.  I don't have WI-FI so I purchased a NETGEAR 23 USB WI-FI USB adapter for $30.00 to create linkage between my computer and the Kindle (supposedly cannot use the cable supplied with Kindle to download).  Then spent 3 hours on Amazon tech support and 6.5 hours trying to register Kindle (that according to Amazon was already registered because I am a customer) but the Kindle doesn't know that.  The WI-FI NETGEAR23 connection is listed on the WI-FI networks the Kindle can identify, but will not recognize any passwords to allow me to complete the registration process and enable use of the Kindle.  There is a workaround, I can use the enclosed cable and the Cloud, which I have never used, AND if I download one book the cost to use the cloud is $5.00 (that's the monthly minimum charge--supposedly the more I use the cloud, the less the pro rata charge up to a volume level of data whereat the charges increase). For my NOOK, there is no cost, no cloud involved.  Getting a Kindle up and running should not be this hard or costly to do.  The additional costs are not transparent to the purchaser.  The Kindle does not appear to have a way to back out of the registration process once one is into it to change passwords, user ID's, nor confirm same. Yesterday the Amazon tech spent 3 hours and we couldn't solve the problem. Today I called back and the Amazon tech was in a noisy boiler room and could not hear me, could not make her computer work, and being located OCONUS was having as many problems understanding my English as I was having understanding hers (she seemed like a nice person, but we didn't talk long).  I have a NOOK.  I have used it for years.  I wanted the Kindle to download ebooks that are not otherwise available.  I am frustrated, unhappy, and not a happy camper--but the world as I know it will go on.  No, I cannot get through or out of the registration loop on the Kindle;" I cannot download the Kindle ebooks
Review: but at this point that is infinitely more easy to live with than fruitlessly trying to make the Kindle I bought operational.""
column4: and no guarantee of successful useage""";;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is great for novels, but I read a lot of nonfiction with pictures, maps and diagrams which are difficult to visualize the details.  I would recommend this for any book that does not contain visual aids because they don't in this format  I still haven't worked out all the manipulations of the device yet which can be sometimes frustrating when one finds oneself going in circles, but, given time, I expect to figure it all out.  Again, great for fiction, not so good for maps and diagrams. And  it saves space not needed for a collection of many huge bookcases.  .",Recommended for novels.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This was surprisingly easy to navigate. And as one review pointed out the touchscreen is highly responsive. Setting up collections was a bit tricky so you may want to create those first (if you don't have them already) before downloading your archived items on your device. I wasn't too thrilled with the experimental web browser at first, but it too is fairly easy to manage/navigate, once you get used to it. I love it.",My New Favorite Tech Toy;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"hate it. almost everything about it.don't want to swipe. want to passively click and not be forced to perform a two-handed maneuver.don't want the font changing or big pop-up screens taking over every time i touch the bloody thing. hate that i'm restricted to keeping my fingers cramped along edges in constant fear of having my reading interrupted by screen tricks.really really really hate that the books don't disappear into collections once categorized. how am i supposed to know which i've read and which i haven't? yes, you are going to tell me that the line of dots under listing indicates where in book i left off. except it doesn't for books imported from other devices, like my last kindle. in other words, all my books.am now going on ebay to find old version.",failing to detect the so called improvements.....;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I like to read the classics. Some of the authors are no longer in print and buying them used is quite expensive.It was a no brainier to buy this kindle since most of the books I read are free from Amazon.I would highly recommend this kindle. It is easy to use, holds a charge for a long time and it's a breeze to buy more books for it on Amazon since the devise is linked through your WiFi",Love it;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had to adjust from my old kindle keyboard model, but, I'm finding the page turning, etc. although an adjustment, is comfortable after a book or two.  It loads quickly.  I liked my old home screen better, but, this is a good reader.",is comfortable after a book or two;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this because it was a Kindle for $59. At first I thought, maybe I'll give it as a gift, but It is so light and little and the characters are so dark and crisp and it still looks like my preferred screen on the kindle Keyboard. So I am keeping it for now. I really like this one.",It's so little and cute!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"THIS IS A WAY TO READ BOOKS ON THE GO.IT FITS IN MY POCKET OF MY COAT.JUST THE RIGHT SIZE,LIGHT,AND EASY TO USE.I AM A LITTLE OLDER PERSON,WHO READS A LOT OF BOOKS.AS YOU GET OLDER YOU NEED MORE LIGHT AND BIGGER PRINT.WHAT I LIKE BEST ABOUT MY KINDLE IS I CAN READ OUT SIDE,INSTEAD OF STAYING IN HOUSE ON A BEAUTIFUL DAY.AND I CAN ADJUST THE PRINT SIZE.I CAN CARRY ALL MY BOOKS ON AMAZON CLOUD WHERE EVER I GO REALLY NEAT.THE PRICE IS RIGHT.START ENJOY READING AGAIN.I DON T NEED A BRIGHT LIGHT TO READ BY,THAT IS COOL.",KINDLE 6'' A HANDY DEVICE;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought to use for just ebook reading, mainly Kindle Books. Was using HDX 7"". Because of battery usage of HDX I had to charge a lot. I will mainly use for reading in restaurants, doctors, while waiting for planes. I mainly keep in my car when traveling in a Amazon Basics zip pouch. Battery will last weeks. I purchased at very low price ($50) or would have gotten paperwhite if bought direct. Touch works fine, found a cheap portrait case for it because screen doesn't rotate, strictly vertical portrait.","Good basic Kindle ereader, no backlight, portrait only.";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I ordered this for my grandmother it's a wonderful device. My only problem is it does not come with written instructions. I understand it has instructions loaded on it, however for older generation that are not tech savvy it would be helpful to have a print manual. Once she gets the hang of it I'm sure she will love it.",great device;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Amazing, with a bright background and overall very easy to use. Only thing it lacks on this model is a background ight but I use my small reading clip on light if needed at night and it works just perfectly.  I also thought I would end up hating  and removing the special offers ads but they surprisingly don't bother like I thought they would, plus I saved some money. The special offers in my opinion don't distract me from reading as they don't show up when reading so I don't find them to be annoying, but that is a personal choice  of course. The only thing I was a little disappointed about is that I'm a prime member and most of the books that I was looking  to borrow from the lending library for prime members were not available as lenders but only as purchases.  Hopefully the lending library keeps growing as that was one of the primary reasons why I bought a kindle. Overall I am very pleased with my kindle!",Finally Got my kindle!;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"This kinkle is okay.  I have the old HD fire, so I wanted a kindle mainly for reading.  Something that was lighter, and this fit the bill.  It is definately lighter.  I was disappointed it didn't have the light, but I knew that when I bought it.  The touch screen doesn't bother me too much except when the fonts change on it's own.  The only thing I don't like about this kindle is that it freezes frequently!!  I have to reboot multiple times!  Luckily I've only had to reboot when I was at home. But I would be very disappointed if I had set aside some reading time at a park or the beach, only to no have it work.  Not sure how that's gonna get fixed.",Freezes frequently;;;;;;

Review: I've been traveling with this for over a week now and really it!  It's light weight and a good size to travel with.  I'm giving it five stars because it been fun to read with and I really like being able to see the scree in the sunlight.  Figuring out the configuration is not as intuitive as I'd like it to be so I suggest reading the manual (for all you guys out there).  Unlike tablets you'd don't have a lot of light coming off the screen so you need to be reading in a well light environment to see the screen.  All-in-all I'm very happy.
Title;;;;;;: It's light weight and a good size to travel with;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I thought this would be a nice change. Nothing but books and nothing else. I have another Kindle bigger and full of stuff besides books and I get caught up in Redditch and FB. Well this little guy fits the bill. I wasn't use to the lack of colour, but, I'm only reading! It's a responsive little guy. And the screen size doesn't hurt my feelings. It's just right.",A Fun Little Thing;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Am so happy with my Kindle.  I have the HD Fire but I cannot read it outside.  So I got this on the July Black Friday for a great price.  Am so glad.  I only wish that it had the capability to ""read"" to me as does the HD Fire for those times I want to do something else while ""reading"".Very happy with it and how it syncs across all my devices.",Am so happy with my Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I got this on a ""BLACK FRIDAY SALE"".  It is a up grade to the OLD KINDLE I got two years ago.  It took some getting use to like all new technology today.  I can adjust the font to suit my reading speed but I like the larger print as I move faster thru the BOOK.  It is all touch screen now no more buttons!  Hey, get use to it!  You'll like it after you have read a few books  and see how fast everything coordinates when you are familiarized with the KINDLE E-Reader.This new KINDLE is the greatest thing to come down the pike since sliced Bread hey.",TECHNOLOGY AT YOUR FINGER TIPS WITH GRADIFICATION FOR YOUR BRAIN go for it Dude;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"After having the first generation, what a difference in the visual quality. It is clear and easy to read in all lighting andmakes reading much easier when you are not squinting all the time. A great value and perfect for the avid reader",WOW what a great product;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I don't know why I waited so long to get one.  Reading on a tablet sucks compared to this, especially in bright light.  The optional browser function s and is a nice add on.  It is slow but one can use it to look something up, or use the mobile site to check e-mail.",what one expects in a good way.;;;;;;

Review: This not my first Kindle. It is comfortable for reading and light weight compared to my first Kindle. I have two issues. The main problem is the dark graphics which make it Impossible to read the book titles. It would have been nice if there was a way to adjust the display. Second is the annoying fact that it changes text size on its own and I have to change to me preferred setting often. For those reasons I would not recommend this Kindle. Pay more and get the paper white. My daughter has that and it is good.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I really like this reader.  My wife got it for me for what was a decent price and I don't have to keep stealing hers.  The only issue I have with it, is that apparently you cannot use any active content on it like her old one.  So all those word games that I love to play on hers are not available on mine.  I wish I had known that because I may have opted for a different model.  I guess it's better that way.... now I'm forced to read instead of playing games.As far as function?  Works great.  I read on it every night.  The WiFi works fine even from across the house.  In airplane mode, the battery has a nice long life.  I recommend it.","Great Reader, but can't play games like on my wife's old Touch :(";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Love the new kindle, it is light weight and stays charged a long time. I would have given it 5 stars if I could have listened to my audio books on it also. Now I have to download them to another device to listen to. Otherwise it is a wonderful device. Very easy to use!",Love the new kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I recently purchased this kindle with the intention of ""testing it out"" and returning it if it didn't meet my expectations. After using it for over a month, however, it's definitely become a keeper.One of the first things I noticed was how much faster it was compared to my previously owned Kindle Keyboard. I'm talking about both the speediness of the device itself and overall usability;" typing text and selecting things both feel faster on the touchscreen interface than using the Kindle Keyboard's physical keys. In addition
Review: because everything is done through the screen
Title;;;;;;: I can usually touch the spot where I want to move the cursor instead of having to scroll to the location. The pages turn noticeably more quickly on this model than the Kindle Keyboard I had. Another thing I like is the feel of the device. This kindle is a little thicker than its keyboard predecessor
column4: but it's also shorter
column5: meaning holding it is even more similar to holding a small paperback book. This
column6: combined with the nicely sized touchscreen and some of the touch gestures
column7: makes one-handed navigation even easier. My only criticism is that the screen sometimes seems a little more sensitive than expected
column8: causing unintentional page turns. This doesn't occur very frequently
column9: however
column10: and may be more due to me still getting used to the change in interacting with the device. Regardless
column11: this can be alleviated by using a stylus
column12: and the screen overall is well calibrated in my experience.As for the new features like Vocabulary Builder and integration with Goodreads
column13: I don't currently use those much. However
column14: I can see how they'd be useful especially in the case of studying and trying to get through difficult material
column15: or if you had kids and wanted to encourage them to read more without having to buy a separate device. And if you never end up needing them
column16: it isn't ridiculously hard to either ignore them or turn them off in the system settings.Overall
column17: this was a very good purchase. Compared to the Kindle Keyboard

column19: and the new design makes the reader less aware of the hardware and more aware of what's being read.""
column20: Another thing I like is the feel of the device";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Great product!I've never really been a big reader, and when this was on sale, I decided to buy it;" thinking it would encourage me to read more often.As soon as I got it I was able to get a Kindle First book
Review: The Einstein Prophecy.I've been reading for about 5-6 hours a week since buying the kindle.I like how you can read it outside
Title;;;;;;: without much glare at all (compared to a cellphone or ipad). I love that it has a really long battery life
column4: and that it saves where you left off reading.I really like to use the feature where if u hold down on a word
column5: it looks up the word and gives you a definition. Very helpful.""
column6: Motivated me to read";;;;;

Review: Love this Kindle!  It does everything it is supposed to.  Which for me means being able to read my e-book in the sun.  Having it sync with my Kindle Fire means I can read the same book at night with no lights on which is good when my husband wants to sleep.  As you can tell I read a lot and this little reader has been awesome at the pool and the beach.  Go for it - you won't be sorry!!

I got this as an anniversary gift and I love it. I have loads of books on it and it is super easy to use. I also love how portable it is--I can slip this into my purse for silent reading time at work (I work in a school) and have all my books right there. I definitely will be using this for some summer reading!
Title;;;;;;: I got this as an anniversary gift and I love it. I have loads of books on it ...;;;;;;

Review: I purchased this kindle as a gift for my husband.  He is not an electronic user but prefers the old fashion pen and paper ways.  He is an avid reader but was having trouble seeing the print in so many of the books.  I showed him how he could enlarge the print and downloaded three books.  He is enjoying the kindle and has thanked me for it.  I am glad I purchased this for him.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my new Kindle! It's easy to read with less eyestrain than a tablet or laptop. It has wifi for quick shopping and download. It is VERY easy and intuitive to use and has very useful dictionary, hi lighting and bookmark features.It's small, yet functional and has an amazing battery life.To me, it's the ultimate reader.",My new inexpensive Kindle;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Wish they still mad the kindle with buttons.  THIS is HEAVIER, THICKER, and the screen collects fingerprints.  My previous Kindle was lighter and thinner and there was no need to put your fingers on the screen EVER.  Bring back the BUTTONS!",Wish they still mad the kindle with buttons. THIS ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am quite happy with the Kindle, a bit to my surprise.  Being ""of an age"" when large print is preferred, the Kindle is a treasure. It is easy to adjust the print size and spacing to a comfortable level.  And ordering new books is quite quick and simple.  I got it mainly because some favorite authors have some short novels that are only available as e-books, but I am acquiring quite a few interesting books to read.  It is easy to carry, so I always have reading material handy whenever there is a little time to kill.  It is easier to hold while reading in bed, and it turns itself off when I fall asleep.",Happy Happy Happy;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Wow!  This is just what I needed in order to read large books without having to carry them around.  Since I read most everything in Spanish, I was able to configure my Kindle to be a Spanish version (other languages are also available).  Now if I am unsure of a word, I can call it up on a Spanish-Spanish dictionary.  Words that I call up automatically go into a list.  I click on the word and it will show the definition and the sentence in which I found it.  This list can be viewed in a flash-card format.",I turned my Kindle into a Spanish edition and love it!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Been using a tablet for ebooks, but the display was basically unuseable outside in the sun where I spend alot of time reading.  The Kindle is amazing in bright sunlite and exceeds my expectations for readability outside.  Only wish it would support openlibrary.org.",The Kindle is amazing in bright sunlite and exceeds my expectations for readability ...;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I ordered this reader because all i needed was a simple one. when i got it, i couldn't read anything because the background was GRAY, not white, and it was illegible. when i called customer service they seemed to think that was normal. if that's normal, no one would buy this. it was an eye-strain to look at it, and no settings whatsoever for brightness or anything. i still don't know if it was defective or just meant for people who like to read dark pages.",i still don't know if it was defective or just meant for people who like to read dark pages;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm an avid book lover and utilize both hard copy and digital formats.  I've been using Kindle on my IPhone and MacBook for years but just purchased my first dedicated Kindle e-reader. Like than it syncs with my other devices.  Still learning about my Kindle but so far a good experience.  Simple, no frills, easy to use reader to use when I'm on the go.  Fits my needs.  Great price!  Got it for $49 during Black Friday week Amazon sale.",Fits my needs;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This was a Christmas gift so I could read before turning out the lights and going to bed. [New research shows the blue light in tablet and computer screens interferes with sleep cycles.] It's very lightweight making it easy to hold and I have enjoyed reading on it, especially the embedded dictionary/Wiki function.Somewhat critical comments: Page turning function 'hangs-up' at times, which is annoying and it is slightly too dark a page for me unless I have a bright reading light on... might be my age (mid-60's), who knows? Overall, I have enjoyed reading on the Kindle.",Lightweight and comfortable to hold;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"My wife's old kindle reader got stepped on and broke the screen. Amazon had a special where you could get $20 off by trading in an old Kindle working or not. This was a no-brainer. Amazing battery life and holds 1,000+ books all in my wife's purse.",Amazing battery life;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"First Kindle device. Had a minor glitch registering my new Kindle Touch, but Amazon Help pleasantly and competently guided me through a reset and subsequent setup. Was surprised how tethered to Amazon.com the device is configured, requiring Amazon involvement even in acquisition of library loaned literature.  Love the contrast of the text on the screen and how it improves my experience reading on an electronic display. Once I figured out where to tap on the screen to maneuver through books and menu selections, I liked it. Looking forward to expanding literary horizons now that I have so many options at my fingertips with my new Kindle.",Pleased with new Kindle Touch;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have the basic model and discovered this is all I need: non glare, optional font sizes and a nice dictornary. Amazon makes it a little too convenient to set up and purchase books - one sign in and I was all linked up -Pretty impressed, first kindle and on my original charge from a week plus ago. NICE in that regard. And it's very light",optional font sizes and a nice dictornary. Amazon makes it a little too convenient ...;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I play Scrabble with my Kindle, along with a lot of reading. My old Kindle failed, so I replaced it with this ""updated"" touch screen unit. It is not compatible with Scrabble, and won't even download it from online. Big disappointment, and unless you are very careful, there is no way to know ahead of time. If you play Scrabble, do not buy this unit. I returned it the day after I received it and ordered the more expensive Paper White, which is compatible with Scrabble.",It is not compatible with my favorite Kindle game: Scrabble. I returned it.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Not my favorite way to read books, bought for a specific book.  Will continue to try, but like a book in my hands.  It is convenient to carry, but so are paperbacks!  Purchased at Best Buy, but bought insurance through Amazon and very prompt service.  I got a stylus at Best Buy,  but am not sure how Kindle works.  Unhappy that I can't get books at Harlequin and deals through them.  Might try to get an upgraded one that would work, but not sure if Kindle Fire would be better.",Not my favorite way to read books;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I love the kindle technology, so of course I'm going to love this kindle. Only reason I got it was because my old kindle randomly died. I honestly HATE the touch technology and really hated that the only thing available was a touch, but it'll do. It's more bulky then the non-touch kindles, too. Satisfied, but unsatisfied at the same time, just because I knew what the kindle used to be.",it works;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"The devise was very good, once I learned to navigate it. Not being a nerd in electronics I usually have a few problems learning to get through the operations of such.  All in all I was pleased with the reader, so Thanks much.",Self education;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love it!  I resisted the Kindle for a long time because I love printed books, but now I am a Konvert.  The instant book delivery is seductive, and the touch screen is entirely intuitive.  Makes it easy to read in bed, too.  I took it on a 9 day road trip and it is so easy to carry and takes up so little space.  I am a backpacker, and this will save weight when I take it out in the woods, plus the battery lasts for days without needing a recharge.  Recharging is fast too..",Why Did I Wait So Long?;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I loveee my Kindle! I had been wanting one for a long time. Even though I have an iPad, reading with the Kindle feels like really reading a book. The screen is crisp like a book and my eyes get less sore. The only Con would be that sometimes it feels a little bit slow but thankfully not reading per se rather browsing web and using the main screen.",loveeeee;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I recently purchased the Amazon Kindle with a 6 touch-screen and Wi-Fi capabilities. I would highly recommend this product to anyone who is a book lover or traveler. There are several features of the Kindle that I enjoy;" the glare-free screen
Review: quick download times
column4: and tools available while reading.The Kindles glare-free screen is great for reading outside on sunny days. Unlike the iPad
column5: you dont need to worry about a glare coming off the screen making it hard to read. However
column6: should you want to used an iPad
column7: all of your books are available using the Kindle app. Reading from the tablet instead of a book is also nice to have for beach reading. There is nothing worse than a book full of sand!I was shocked when my books downloaded so fast. They downloaded just as quickly any app would download on your phone. I found this very impressive considering how many GBs of space is used to download books to a device. The quick download speed really comes in handy if you are at an airport and want to buy a book before a flight. Keep in mind the Kindle has Wi-Fi access
column8: not 3G. This means you must be in a location with Wi-Fi to purchase and download books.Nothing is more frustrating than needing to constantly be charging your electronic devices. You should be able to go a few days without needing to charge your Kindle. This depends
column9: of course
column10: on how much you use it during the day. When you travel
column11: you may need to charge it more frequently than when you do not because you will be reading on it more. This is one of my favorite features as I find myself charging my iPhone and iPad at least once a day even when Im not using them much throughout the day.Finally
column12: there are some very helpful tools that can be used while reading. I find the dictionary to be very useful. Whenever you come across a word that you do not know
column13: you can highlight it and look it up right then. Along with this
column14: there is a highlighting tool. You can highlight passages in the book you are reading and what other readers highlighted as well.I give this product 5 stars and I hope my fellow book lovers find this product as great as I do!""
column15: Great Product for Book Lovers";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"They have dramatically improved the responsiveness since the last Kindle touch I looked at.  It is now usable.  This is for my son and he has done great with the books on it.  Being able to check out books from my library and knowing he can't do anything else on it besides read.  (yes, I have disabled the experimental browser.)  Love it.",Great new version!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"No issues with Kindle itself,works fine,nice features,fairly easy to use.My only complaint is that it should come with at least a thin instruction booklet,not every one wants to go online to follow instructions,also the adaptor plug should be included with the purchase of a Kindle,I cant believe that Amazon cannot afford to throw in a piece that probably cost them a dime or less to make,it would be GOOD customer service,rather than milking the customer for an additional $8 .....not kool.","works fine, nice features";;;;;;

Review: In my location it was hard to connect to WIFI sometimes.  With the new Kindle it is so quick and easy to get books.  Have loved having a Kindle since my family gave me one as a gift after they first came out.  The glare free screen helps when outside.
Title;;;;;;: With the new Kindle it is so quick and easy to get books;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love this.  When I pick this device up, I know I can ""RELAX"" because I don't use it for anything except reading.  No internet, no FB, no pop-ups, no whistles, dings and notifications.  Just a relaxing time.",I love my Kindle.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I have only had the Kindle for a week.  I have to admit that reading ebooks is easier than on my 7"" tablet.  A ""nice to have"" would be a little more contrast between the background and the text.  I did not see any way to change it.  Big downside of Kindle is that I have over 400 unprotected epub books that Kindle doesn't support so for now my tablet will remain as my go-to device as I choose not to purchase these books again.",Almost there;;;;;;

Review: Exactly what I wanted.  I already have a Kindle Fire HD but wanted something lighter to carry to work and wanted glare free for outdoor reading. This is perfect and the price was good too (got on sale for $57).Bought Nov 2014 - now Mar 2016 and it just stopped working.  I do not use it every day.  Still have paperbacks I read and on trips I take my Kindle Fire for games/internet/books.  So I am a little disappointed that this stopped working a little over a year into lighter usage than my Kindle Fire.
Title;;;;;;: A little over a year and stopped working....;;;;;;
