Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have Kindles in about every room.  I have 'wore' three out. I  love all Paperwhites, they make reading better.  The search feature alone is great..  The ultimate is the Voyage (inproduct my opinion, no negatives - only positives.","Great Product, The Kindle";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Great eReader. You see all the hype on other eReaders that make you wonder what the difference between it and a tablet is. I don't need to access the Internet and other crazy things from my book. I wanted my reader to be exactly like a book, which it is. The only ""fancy"" thing with this reader is that it does have a dictionary, Xray, and wiki. Xray let's you look deeper into the book, if it is supported. It does have Goodreads integrated, so you can add the book to a shelf and give it a star rating (though I haven't figured out if you can update your progress or not, only had it for a week so far). It does not have actual internet, no backlighting, and no page-turning buttons. It is lighweight, about the size of a paperback book. I have actually caught myself grabbing the top corner as if I were going to turn the page! This is an awesome basic eReader. If you tend to read in bed like I do, buy a book light to go with it. I would recommend this to every avid reader.",Great eReader for paperbook lovers;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"My rating is heavily influenced by my expectation that this would be a step up from my Kindle Keyboard (which died at 5 years of age). The new Kindle is not as comfortable in the hand, I just don't love the touch screen, and it is ONLY for reading. I actually find the touch screen kind of annoying (personal preference). Also on the negative side (and a warning to other buyers), if you enjoy Active Content - you won't be able to use it on this device. I played ""Every Word"" pretty much every day on my Kindle Keyboard. Received a Paperwhite as a gift and discovered Active Content is not compatible. After a lengthy phone call and being assured by an Amazon ""Kindle Expert"" that I could play the game on this model, I exchanged the Paperwhite. Active Content is NOT compatible with this model - I don't know why their ""expert"" assured me it was. It's another annoyance and it seems kind of stupid that Amazon would take away the ability to use their own material. The only way you can use active content now is on certain Kindle models only available through third-party sellers. On the plus side the screen is easy to read for anyone who has eye issues with back-lit devices. This is a nice, non-glare reading experience. There are different fonts and sizes to choose from. This is the first time I have been so seriously disappointed with a buying experience from Amazon, and it's really left a bad impression. The Paperwhite was given as a thoughtful gift to replace my beloved Keyboard;" however
Review: the gift giver wanted me to be able to play my game AND read
Title;;;;;;: so encouraged me to call to arrange an exchange for one that would do what I wanted. I made the decision to replace it with this model on the advice of an expert who apparently wasn't
column4: I was disappointed again. So
column5: all in all
column6: if you only want to read
column7: and can't take LED or backlit screens
column8: this is an OK tool for those purposes. As a PS: Why was the Keyboard eliminated (some people liked it)? Repair services would have been a great option
column9: also. I'm sure there are others out there who don't feel the newer models are all an improvement.""
column10: For Reading Only";;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"Be careful. I ordered a kindle whose description was ""Certified Refurbished Kindle with Special Offers (Current Generation)."" I ordered a 7th generation cover for it, but it didn't fit. Amazon even registered it to my account as a 7th gen. Turned out, when I asked customer service what the issue was, that they checked the serial number and it was a 2nd generation, even though that is not what was advertised. I paid about $65 for it, and the brand new 7th gen is about $79. Seems a small discount for a give generation difference. I pointed this out to customer service and they just said there is not much difference and offered no compensation or other options besides ""oops, we'll have to fix that listing."" Still false advertising to me. Not happy.",Not happy.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had one of the old-school Kindles with the keyboard on the bottom and when it died I was afraid to upgrade;" so I have had to adjust to the touch reader. This is a great reader with a easy-viewing screen
Review: and the new technology ink makes the type easier to read. It is also lighter so I can read in bed longer than I should.""

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I like the Kindle.  Great for reading.  Especially like being able to adjust font size.  I live on a sailboat, so it's great to be able to have lots of books without having to have a place to store hard copies.  Things I don't like - 1. The battery charge does not last for weeks.  I'd say perhaps 8-10 hours.  2. It takes a long time to for it to charge - most of a day.  3. It's a bit hard to find a place to hold it so I don't touch the screen and change pages. 4. Wish it just had a list of my books, rather than the actual book covers. I have to scroll though many pages just to find a book.  Also, you have to enter the page number of the book list - would be better if you could just touch/swipe to get to the next page.  5. Hate the underlining/highlighting of passages that I assume was made by other readers.  I don't underline/highlight, yet many of the new books I get already have that. 6. Hate that the screen spontaneously comes on with some suggested book.  I think that is part of the problem with it using the charge up so fast. I find it with the screen on with a suggested book.  7. Please skip giving me unrequested book suggestions.  You don't have a clue what I want.","Like it, except for the things I don't like.";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"A book fanatic with an extensive library, who truly loved hardback books, it took me awhile to finally try out a Kindle.  I was hooked with the first book.  The ease and convenience of my Kindle is wonderful.  My reason for 4 stars instead of 5 - I wish I could download library books directly to my Kindle without signing into Amazon to complete the process.  Very happy I finally made the transition.","Kindle, 6"" glare free touch screen - Wish I hadn't taken so long to convert!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"While it would be nice to have a larger viewing screen, this kindle is nice. I'm not sure what extra features amazon is talking about but the kindle itself is nice. I love the anti-glare screen that makes it easy to read when I am on the beach in the sun. It's lightweight and I don't have to worry about the bulk when packing my beach bag.",While it would be nice to have a larger viewing screen;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have had 2 other Kindles prior to this one.  No there was nothing wrong with them, I still have one of them and gave the other to a friend that didn't have one.  I love the touch screen.  My only regret (and this is on me not on Kindle) I think I should have got the paper white.  Recently traveling with some friends wanting to read in a hotel room after they went to bed I was wishing I had the back light.  I guess I will just have to purchase a new book light.  I love love love this kindle.",Great Product.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"It's very good for the price.  But for the additional price for a HDX fire the added features are a bargain.  That's just my take.  Since I already have a 7"" HDX fire , this reader is a perfect addition.  In fact, this reader doesn't glare in direct sunlight.  The HDX does.  I really wish that books could be transferred between the two without going through the cloud (sometimes being without wi-fi) but for just a plain e-reader, this unit works very well.  Especially with it's ties to amazon.com and kindle books.",It's very good for the price;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I got it in 49 USD in PrimeDay.Pros: light, convenient, good for eyes compare to IPad.Cons: didn't come with a charger. it flashes every time i click (That's the design).I don't understand why ppl will pay 200 USD to buy just a reader similar like this (higher end version). I think 49 USD is fair as it is just for reading, that's all. I like my purchase but i don't think it shd charge too much for just a simple function reader.",good for eyes compare to IPad;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"My 12 year old granddaughter was very excited to get the Kindle as it was just what she wanted.  It was delivered on time and in excellent shape.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was that it did not come with a charger.  I suspect, if I had read the fine print more closely, I would have noticed the lack but I didn't so it was a little bit awkward when she wanted to try the Kindle immediately on Christmas and couldn't, as it comes uncharged.  I was saved by her finding another charger that would work.",Wonderful Product but No Charger;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I got this by mistake thinking it was the paper white Kindle which I am use to and I love. When I saw that it wasn't my husband decided he would like it and has fallen in love with it. So as long as it is a Kindle I am good. We can send books back and forth and all and we are both happy. It makes my life much easier since I am so used to reading on my Kindle I really don't like looking at books and magazines when he wishes me to read an article,  now he can just send it to my Kindle fromantic his Kindle.  Awesome.",Works well for us.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I love this kindle: it is my first one. I like the glare free screen. It works as advertised in the sun. I love highlighting and taking notes, as well as looking up words in the dictionary. I dislike that I cannot read on it without an external light- I wish it had a setting to allow me to turn on a light so I could see it while lying in bed or on a plane. Finally, I wonder what will happen to my notes and highlighting of non-fiction text if this kindle dies. Is there a way to save them?",I love this kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this on a whim.  I have an iPad that I have always used to read books on.  I started having wrist and arm pain, and I traced it back to holding the iPad for hours.  It seems silly, but I just got annoyed with the weight of it.  So I bought the Kindle, fell in love, and we've been happily ever after since.  It's lightweight, no glare, and I can read outside in the bright light (love that feature).  I haven't quite figured out how to find books online and get them using only the Kindle. I usually find them on my computer, then download on the kindle.  It's how I've always done it, so no problem there.  It didn't take me longer than 10 minutes to figure out how to set it up, use it, and download my books on my Kindle account.  My kids still can't believe I'm cheating on Apple, but I love this little thing.","Bought on a whim, but I love it";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I will have to say, I like this better than the paperwhite. The light of the Paperwhite burned my eyes and I couldn't read more than 10 pages at a time. This product's display actually feels like a real book. Now I can read for hours",Better than Paperwhite;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I like it yet there are no instructions except in it, which is a problem if you miss them.  I wish they weren't completely touch.  Not everyone likes or can use touch.  My girlfriend is Physically Disabled and can use hers with the buttons.  I hope it never breaks.  She can't use touch. I was happy with the price deal when I bought it. Cool device over all.  Will they ever make them bigger tho?",I like it yet there are no instructions except in it;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I upgraded from the 1st generation of Kindle (with hardware buttons). This is a great upgrade, still same size and almost same weight. The touch screen is much better. I haven't experienced the accidental page turn or zoom in/out. Typing is much easier now. The only problem I see is not sure how to look up a multi-word item in dictionary, since the dictionary pops up when you long press on a word. I still think its the best book reader out there.","Quick Review, great product, best book reader";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Got my newest Kindle and I  love it! So much smaller than my first one or my second one but I love it. It's going to be great for taking along where ever I go and I can just read any where again. My last one I had quit some years ago and had the keyboard. You won't miss the keyboard on this at all. You can still type in searching what you want from the top in search bar, like being on computer. I'm working on putting more books on it from my old one... little each day.","Kindle, 6"" Glare-Free Touchscreen Display, Wi-Fi - Includes Special Offers";;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"This is the 2nd Kindle I bought.  The first one was a couple of years ago and about the same price.  I like the older one better.  The new one seems ok until you compare it to the older version.  Maybe I should have bought the one with the light but the older one was not marketed as lighting up.  I will keep but don't be fooled by the term ""paper white"" because it is sort of grey.",Maybe white but not bright;;;;;;

Review: Amazon you have to do better.  Navigation is not intuitive and pages don't go forward and backwards trouble free.  Not worth the price and Amazon is better off giving it away as a free gift than charging money for it.
Title;;;;;;: Amazon you have to do better. Navigation is not intuitive and pages don't go ...;;;;;;

Rating: 2.0 out of 5 stars,"One of the best things about the Kindles has been the simple yet addictive word games. Games like Every Word, Every Word Crossing, etc., were free, fabulous, and used by me daily. There is no mention of the fact that they've discontinued all active content (!) in the latest Paperwhite, but let me assure you, it's gone.Not only that, but the screen IMO is a step back from the 6th edition, which I loved. Sadly I lost mine in an airport and had to get a 7th gen to replace it. When the first Paperwhite came out it had terrible mottled lighting on the bottom, but they fixed that in the 6th edition (yay!). Well, it's back in the 7th edition. In addition, the screen is less responsive, the lighting isn't as good, and it's just not as easy to read, regardless of what Amazon's marketing may say.I've loved every kindle I've had until now. Sadly this ""upgrade"" really feels like a letdown. I'm sure they'll come out with an 8th edition so they can get people like me to spend another $120. Sigh...Amazon: Bring back active content and stop mucking with the screen!Update: January 2016. My Kindle has started acting wonky. Now, when I tap for a page turn, it sometimes takes over two seconds to turn the page. I've rebooted to no avail. It still functions, but now the distraction is breaking my revery from whatever I'm reading. I've docked another star because this has become a huge disappointment. Honestly the best thing about this Kindle is the cool leather case I bought for it. I'm considering following a commenter's advice and buying a used older one.",Does not support games!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"i love this! really do not understand all the negative reviews. anti glare is perfect, the dialogue part is nice and dark so you can read it . you can adjust the lettering to your liking, its stays charged it seems like forever. lightweight, you can hold it in one hand, pages turn with a touch of a finger- that is the best! i still have my old one ( its like 4 years old now) with the side buttons and always disliked it  this one is 100% better to read with trust me..",love this kindle!!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I really love my new e-reader. I read much more and more often. My only complaint is that I still need a light to use it, for instance I can't read it in the evenings outdoors. I will probably upgrade to a paperwhite soon.",Lots of Pluses;;;;;;

Review: I bought this for my 21  year old daughter that's going through some medical issues that require a lot of appointments and waiting. She's an avid reader and Kindle is a great way to take advantage of our prime membership and save money on books. As stated it is a smaller model. That's what she needs to toss in a bag or purse. She loves it! I own another Kindle product and have enjoyed it as well.
Title;;;;;;: Kindle E readers are still a great gift!;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Excellent product: it's small, multi functional, but simple.  The glare free aspect sold itself, and although I've always enjoyed reading in the past, I have increased my reading by more than 50% because of its convenience, font selections, and ease of use.  I recommend this to anyone who wants to enjoy reading from something that's just right and without paying a ridiculous amount of money for all of the extra ""stuff"" (which would be a distraction anyway).",Exactly what I needed;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"love it.  portable, light.  long-lasting battery.  glare free screen.  affordable price (got mine on a lightning deal for $50)does not have a backlight...which I thought would be a hassle, but so far, it really hasn't impacted me at all.  I never use the little clip on light I got to go with it in fact.",Kindle is a Keeper;;;;;;

Review: I've been reading Kindle books on tablet and phones for years and put off getting an actual kindle (though I've coveted them) until this touchscreen version came out.  I absolutely love it.  Easy to hold.  Easy to read.  I love just holding it in my hand and sitting on the front porch reading.  I find myself wanting to read on here more than my phone.  Love my touchscreen Kindle!

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love this as its so light to hold.  Anyone with arthritic pains in your fingers or wrist will appreciate it.  its a little different from the regular one as it has no backlight, so in the evening must be read under a light.  But it's great to take to a doctor's office and light to carry.  only thing I dislike are the ads for other books.  And you can't beat the price.",Good Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Very pleased with my kindle, I am getting used to using it. Some times the back lighting seems a bit dim (for reading in the dark) I thought that there might be a way to adjust it but I don't see this option.",Very pleased with my kindle;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Was somewhat disappointed... the good news is that the screen is a good size for reading and it is very light to hold. However, the screen is rather dark for reading (even in sunlight) and the only adjustment available is the background color (doesn't help). They have also placed the power button on the bottom of the Kindle AGAIN;" the book keeps turning itself off when I hold it in one hand (which is supposed to be the point of it being lightweight).This particular issue is the most annoying.""
Review: A good try but could have done better...";;;;;

the only problem I have with the new kindle is the choices of font sizes.  I had a kindle keyboard that broke which is why I purchased the new kindle. the font sizes jump from barely big enough for me to see with my bi-focules to HUGE. a step in between sizes 6 & 7 would be perfect.  otherwise everything is easy to navigate.
Title;;;;;;: a step in between sizes 6 & 7 would be perfect. otherwise everything is easy to navigate;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought the entry level Kindle when it was on sale. I wasn't sure I'd like a ""reading"" only device, but I hate reading on the iPhone (too small a screen) and didn't want to lug around a heavier tablet AND my iPhone. Besides the heavier tablet would aggravate my carpal tunnel (just holding a book or newspaper does, so I knew the extra weight would be taxing). I've used an iPad several times and frankly don't find them all that useful - for me. But the Kindle seems to suit me.I ride the subways of NYC to get to and from work and find that the Kindle is very easy to use, light-weight and doesn't bother my hands. It also is very easy to read (easy on the eyes - as it doesn't shoot light up into my eyes as a tablet does.",I like it - and it doesn't bother my carpal tunnel;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Great offer, great value. I mostly do reading (it's a Kindle, after all) on this unit but checking email (Gmail), Facebook and Twitter makes it very handy. Would like to see it hold a charge longer (average three-four days between charges) but love form factor and ruggedness. Overall, very pleased!",I loved the offer - installment payments!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love the new 7th generation Kindle e-reader.  Already own the older, button operated one & enjoy that one as well. If you want or need a tablet the Fire will work just fine for you, but if reading is your primary usage nothing beats the Kindle e-reader.  Easy control of font size makes it very adaptable to each individual.  The non-glare screen really does work.  I've read a lot from people who have an issue with the touch screen--I don't.  Very easy to use & user friendly.  No, it's not designed for color printed graphic novels or comic books but for reading books it's great.  A definite addition if you travel or fly a lot--just download the books before you go & read away.",Love the new 7th generation Kindle e-reader;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Purchased it during Black Friday deal. Had kindle touch & new kindle paperwhite. So, compared to the previous ones I had, I think this is by far the best value deal. The resolution isn't so bad for reading and the processing speed has gotten faster than kindle touch. I also like the squarely simple design, which, in my opinion, is much better to grip.For $49, I believe I'm getting the best reading experience I ca get.One drawback, though, is that the touch screen is infrared style. Durning normal reading time, it doesn't make any difference, but when putting down the device beside the pillow after reading, with a just a touch from the blanket or my hair causes the screen to turn the page or change the font size. Even when I cover the screen with a cloth or a paper to protect from screen damage, it senses touch and responses to it. Quite annoying especially when using kindle (this one) after being used to the touch style of paperwhite. So, that's one star off.But for those who wants simple reading device, this is THE IT.","Love the price, functionality, and speed. Hate infrared touch screen that responds not just to my finger but to every contact of";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a very solid product.  I got the special offer and decided to it would be a great opportunity to try out an e-reader before moving on to a more advanced model.  I must say the screen is very easy to read; the interface
Review: while a bit laggy
Title;;;;;;: is very concise;" and the feature-set is surprisingly robust for the base model.""
column4: A great entry level e-reader";;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love to read and I have resisted going to an e-reader as I am old fashioned and like to hold a book.  As the cost of buying even paperbacks has risen so high, I cannot afford to pay for my ""habit"".  I tried my daughter-in-laws Kindle and found I could handle laying in bed to read as I often do.  In addition my local library carries a few thousand books for Kindle that are free just like checking out a book!!  I just got it for Christmas so I haven't tested all the possibilites but I am really please so far.",I love to read and I have resisted going to an ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my Kindle.  I only gave it a 4 stars because I am having difficulties learning to use it.  This is my first touch screen.  I can't seem to find the books loaded on my Kindle.  If I get off the book I am reading and go into some other book, I can get back to the first one.  But again, that is probably just me.  I really really loved my original Kindle purchased in 2010, and I really love this one.  Hopefully I will learn to use it.  Oh, and the learners program just doesn't cut it for me.","I do love my Kindle, but...";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"The first one I was sent had a touchscreen issue so they replaced it immediately. I have fallen completely in love with my Kindle Touch, $79 base model. The ads are based on the books in my Kindle library and I find them a brilliant way to pick my next read. They are also only on the first page of the homepage in cover-view so they are incredible unobtrusive! I'm infatuated and cannot praise this product highly enough.",Ads? Not a problem!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,I found there were lots of books that I wanted but I couldn't get through inter-library loan and the actual books were much more expensive.  I have found a number of great self-published authors for cheap or free.  The only thing I don't love is that background is gray and I wonder if it would have been worth it to buy the paperwhite as the background appears to be more like paper.,"Just the basics, but it does what I want.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I swore I would never get an e-reader because I love the feel of an actual book in my hands. Well, never say never! I had been downloading some free books through the Overdrive library app onto my iPad to read a book when I didn't have time to get to the library. My eyelids began twitching and I was having serious eye-strain. I thought I'd try a Kindle since I had been having luck finding ebooks in the library and I'm so glad I did. I love how light it is, how easy it is on my eyes, and how I can carry around 5 books at a time in my bag on one little device. I even got the ""special offers"" version and the ads are not annoying at all--they never appear in your book. For $79 this is totally worth it!",Never thought I'd buy an e-reader!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I don't have wifi, I expected to download e books to my computer and transfer them to the kindle, but the process was much more complex than I expected and it took about 2 hours of live chat and two chat-live experts to finally accomplish it. The Chat line helped because the second person was an expert in Kindle and I was able to ask the person for clearer explanations.I hope the 2nd half of the transcript from that whole chat will help me to repeat the process the next time I want to download a book!!!","I don't have wifi, I expected to download e ...";;;;;;

Review: Got this for my mother as a gift.  She loves it!  She has read several books and keeps asking for me to load another book.  It is small and portable so she takes it all over.  It is nice to go to an appointment and pull out your Kindle to read while you wait your turn.  My mother is 79 and she has no problem using it.  I find it to be very user friendly.  If you are a reader this is the way to go.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I use it a lot when I'm only going to be reading and using the HDX mainly for tablet use.  I usually read before going to sleep, and I really like the touchscreen for that. Not only is it lighter and easy to hold, but I find that I go to sleep much easier after reading with it than I do with the HDX. It must be because there is no light in it shining back at me.  And it's the greatest for tossing in my purse on the way out, no matter where I'm going.",I wouldn't trade it......;;;;;;

Review: I really like the new Kindle very much.  I am not used to all the nuances of it yet but I am learning.  I did like the way the books lined up in the old Kindle but I will get used to this.  It is easy to read and comfortable to hold.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Got this for my elderly mother, and she hates technology, but loves to read. She reads this every day, and loves it! She figured it out pretty quickly, but does mess it up once in a while if she accidentally touches the settings or something, but I always fix it for her. A home run for any reader!",Thrilled for this gift for my mother!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a great basic Kindle. It will allow you to read all of your favorite books (even at the beach in glare) in a small easy to travel with package. Kindle is the best E-reader on the market for a reason, and it continues to be the best.",Great basic Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This has changed the way I read!  I purchased this right after Christmas for $20 off (thanks for the sale, Amazon!).  I've read 3 books already and it's only late January.I had intended to purchase the Paperwhite, but a report came out just before Christmas from the medical community warning the use of blue light devices at night, such as the Kindle's with lights (Paperwhite included).  I find that I can see just fine the old fashioned way, with a bedside lamp, or I think you can buy a clip on light for the Kindle if you are concerned with keeping your spouse up while you read.Love the product - it is so light and fits into my purse!",Great purchase!;;;;;;

Review: Friends got me this for Christmas. They felt it time for me to move into the 21st century. I was a bit hesitant at first. When you've been reading real books as long as I have you wonder how a little etch a sketch wannabe could take the place of an actual paper book. Well I've had time to do some reading on it and I have to admit it's pretty neat. I am alternating now between real books and my Kindle. I can't imagine ever giving up real paper books but who knows? I think anyone who likes to read would appreciate this little devil. Buy one today. Or ask for one as a present!

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a fantastic device! I'm enjoying reading so much with this Kindle. Even with no backlight, it's easy to read as long as it's daytime or you just use a lamp. The pages move easily and the font is nice and crisp looking. I love that I can adjust the font as large as I need it. The unit is SO lightweight that I have no problems holding it even though I have bad hand  circulation issues. I'm so glad I took advantage of the $59 deal on this Kindle they recently had.",A fantastic Kindle!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Great device!... Received this as a Christmas gift from my wife because I want to get back into some regular reading, but I'm terrible about carrying a book with me.  This is slim & lightweight and fits easily into my computer bag or anywhere really..  The screen/pages are clear and crisp.  I also like the fact that I can download my own documents onto it, so if I want I can load work related info that I typcially would review on my hefty laptop.My wife got the 'Special Offers' version which has advertising on the opening screen and home page, but NOT in the book pages.  I would prefer not to have the ads, but since they are only visable when in standby mode or on the home page, I can live with that.  If I really get tired of them, they can always be turned off with a $20 extra charge.  My wife got the unit new at a special Christmas cost of $59 with the ads, so I can't complain at that price.",Great device... fits my needs perfectly!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Don't quite know everything about it but so far, its great.  Real deal for the price.  The ads are that bad, don't affect reading.  Its got good touch sensitivity.  Some screen features are small, but no more so than smartphones, yet no problem, use a stylus.  I use a dowel stick fine.  Read up on it and when you buy, you'll see its as good as amazon says.",Should've bought one sooner;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Very nice if you don't ad a lot of your own notes - if you do, it slows waaaay down.  But Kindle is basically the only realistic choice out there.  Just don't try to talk to your books on this machine.",Very nice if you don't ad a lot of your own ...;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Great reading tool, the best out there. Major issue I have is with my home Wi-Fi. It is a hit and miss connection. In a good days it will connect to my network in about 2-3 seconds after I turn it on. On a bad day it will not connect at all (such as the case while I'm writing this). Initially I've purchased 2 of the basic kindles for Valentines Day for me and my wife. The Wi-Fi problems started with both devices on the first day. I've called customer service and was advised to update the software. I did the update, but that didn't help much as both devices were with on-off relationship with my home network. From there I've spent countless hours on the phone during the next couple of days with customer service training to fix the problem. The last time I've spoken with them, I was instructed to use a specific code on the device which pulled up all the recorded data for the device, including any issues with the Wi-FI. I was able to forward this data to the technician, who told me that once reviewed, he will call me and let me know how to proceed. That was about a month ago and I'm still waiting. Meanwhile I decided the problem is within the model itself, so I've ordered 2 new devices of the more advanced Paperwhite version and returned the other two. The problem has appeared on both new devices again couple of hours after I've opened the boxes. I have not called customer service again on the new devices. The reason is that I'm tired of spending time on the phone explaining what is the problem and begging for help. (On the good side, I now know my 10 digit Wifi password given to me from FIOS and can tell it without looking). It seems that every time I call, the rep has a quick fix to connect me to my Wifi which works for couple of hours may be. After that we are back to hit and miss. I now know how to connect the devices to the Wifi: Restart my router and restart the device (there are days that even that do not work....but there is always tomorrow). However, I don't see this as a particularly convenient way.This should not be an issue for a device of such level. Bottom line: I'm keeping the devices, as I really enjoying them as readers (my wife doesn't care about the Wifi as many people probably don't) even with the Wifi issue in hopes that the next update will fix the issue.",Great reading device. Bad Wifi capabilities.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I own 3 Fire tablets (1st gen, 3rd gen 7"" HDX, and the new 6"" model) but for reading this has become my favorite device. The size and weight are perfect and its portability make it perfect to take with you anywhere. At times I can see the advantage of  the backlit model, but for the price difference, it is not a problem using a portable light. If you want a reader, without the distractions of a tablet, you can't go wrong with this device.",Ideal E-Reader;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am very happy with this Kindle.  It is easy to carry around, easy to handle when reading and I can read outdoors in the sun - that's right, no glare.  I can't say the same thing about my iPad.  This Kindle is very appealing and many ask me where they can get one when they see me with mine.  They make great gifts for readers and because of it's ease of use it is good for any age group AND the price is right for any budget.",Happy with Purchase;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"While I prefer the simpler use of the original white Kindle with the buttons, I am slowly getting used to the swipe.  There are a few quirks which I find frustrating, such as the font changing while reading the page with no input from me, and the location information, neither page or location showing and then reappearing, the clarity is still there. I still have trouble making collections and wish that making one would remove the book from the total list shown.","OK, but";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Great E-reader!! The price is PERFECT. Amazon Unlimited gives perfect access to lots of titles. Size is really compact and fits easily into my smaller purses.This version does not have a back light, so No reading without a light.Great product though, and it keeps a charge for weeks.",Great e-reader!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I really like my Kindle. I love that fact that it is glare-free so when I'm on vacation at the pool, I can still read it like a normal book! The only reason I gave it 4 stars was I wish there was a light/dimmer setting. It would be nice to be able to brighten the background when I'm in a darker location.",I love the glare-free!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is exactly what I needed without all the bells and whistles.  I just wanted a Kindle for reading purposes only. I read the description exactly, comparing it to other kindles and their benefits. NOT A TABLET, NO FACEBOOK, NO LIGHTED SCREEN, ETC.  This is small, I like it because my hands are very tiny. Actual paperback books hurt my hands if I have to hold them in the same position to long until it's time to turn the page.  This dimensions make it easier for me to hold than a regular book. Changing pages is easy as swiping a finger and there is a ton of free ebooks to choose from.  I LOVE THIS!!!!!!!!!!!This is a perfect simple E-READER. NO BELLS AND WHISTLES.  EASY NAVIGATION!!!",I like it because my hands are very tiny;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I like it surprisingly well.  I like the category options - makes finding my favorite books very easy.  I find reading it to be more difficult than the Kindle DX it replaces.  It seems dark to me.  Yes, I know it isn't back lit but neither was the DX.  I like the touch screen and I'm finding my way around the menus.",ok - not as easy to read as my DX;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"so far (only 2 days)  I like it. It works pretty much the same as my Nook with just small differences. Some features that nook doesn't have that this does, like x-ray I like. Would have to wait a while until I have had a chance to use it fefore I can give a proper review.",just got it so preliminary review;;;;;;

Review: I just really love the Kindle.  I have to admit it takes a little getting used to the new one.  I liked the manual controls on my previous Kindle.  Now you have to log on the internet to get basic questions asked.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Had a previous Kindle 7"" which was either lost or stolen, so had to replace it. Actually ordered this new 6"" size by mistake, but when it arrived we found that it was a great size for holding comfortably in one hand - so we kept it.Very happy with new size and the Kindle quality is exactly as expected. Great little gift as well.",NEW SIZE VERY COMFORTABLE.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I put this Kindle side by side with the Paperwhite.  In good lighting, the brightness of the screens are fairly identical as the Paperwhite adjusts to the light within your environment (the darker the room, the more prominent the light). I do like to read in bed and find that lamp light is sufficient when using this Kindle.  However, I must admit that the backlight on the Paperwhite is a nice feature and very convenient.  I got this Kindle around Valentine's Day on sale for $59.99 and there's no way I'm returning it unless it malfunctions.  I'll purchase a book light and use it as a backup reader if nothing else.  On the mechanical side, its very sensitive and at times skips a few pages when I tap to advance to the next page.  From reviews of the Paperwhite (which was $99.99 at the time of my purchase of this Kindle), the Paperwhite has the same issue. It's a little frustrating trying to get back to your place in the book.  Overall, this Kindle is a good e-reader.  I recommend that you really evaluate your reading habits before you purchase this Kindle. If you're used to holding a physical book, then there's not much difference here. Just adjust the light in your environment as usual.  It's lightweight, easy to transport, and has every feature the Paperwhite offers, with the exception of the backlight and the higher price tag.  Its also easy on the eyes, especially for someone who sits in front of bright computer screen all day and desire to give their eyes a break. Overall, I give this Kindle 4 Stars.  It is what it is :-)",It Is What It Is;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love it! Sensitive touch screen, everything that the ads promise. I just wish Amazon came out with a color e-ink reader. I'd love to have my toddler read more color e-books so that his room doesn't have to be strewn with books everywhere (slipping hazard). Amazon, please hurry up in your color e-ink research!",Everything as promised in the ads.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I really love my kindle but the only problem I have with it is I wish it had a glow backing option to be able to read at night in the dark and I wish it was a little easier to navigate through different genres.  I do, really like the book suggestions that pop up when it's in a sleep mode and the fact that the ebooks are relatively inexpensive.  Plus Kindle has this new ebooks unlimited option where I can get all these books for free...you can't beat free.",LOVE;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"still working on getting used to it.  it's different from paper books, both better and worse, but i'm getting to really like it.  easy to read, a handy size.  now i have to weed out the (mostly) terrible free books i downloaded",both better and worse;;;;;;

Review: Great e-reader for the person that doesn't want any distractions from social media. It's awesome to take on an airplane or traveling. I Like how it doesn't give me a headache staring at words for a long time. Very lightweight and easy to hold with one hand. Definitely recommend.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I have has this for a year or two now and it is still going strong.  Adjustable text size in the settings is great.  The battery life is excellent when using the Kindle a lot.  The only thing I do wish for was a backlight.  I bought this one because I like the print look and I do not like reading off the Kindle Fire's screen, but this would benefit greatly from having a built in backlight.",Adjustable text size in the settings is great. The battery life is excellent when using the ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have an iPad mini and was using it as my kindle (since I left my last one on a plane--grrrrr!) but in the sun, the color screens are just useless.  I live near the beach and love to read there, so I had no choice but to buy this kindle again.  I just love using it in bright light!  Unfortunately, I find it absolutely useless in dim light, but hey, that's why I have the iPad!",Only way to read in the sun!;;;;;;

Review: This was a gift and the receiver absolutely loved it. She is an early teen that requested books as one of her gift items. How much more perfect can you encourage that love of reading than to gift a Kindle? I do recommend this item and would consider buying one for myself in the future. I happened to purchase it on either Black Friday or Cyber Monday so I also got it at a great price. Kindle has brought books back to the masses. Props to Amazon.
Title;;;;;;: A gifted Kindle is the perfect gift for young mind that already enjoys reading;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is to cool, I would have bought this from Amazon years ago had I known.I am awaiting the LED Clip-On Reader light for Kindle and them I'm set. ( Needs to be well lit )One down side - ( Not always around a USB - No wall charger. - Hate when you have to buy extras just to keep something working.",Love it;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"It's a Kindle.  I love it.  So what if it doesn't have a light bulb inside.  It's much easier on the eyes.  This was a refurbished model, but to be honest, I can't tell what was repaired.  It is in excellent condition and appeared new to me.",Refurbished?  I couldn't tell.  Great Kindle!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am so excited that I can keep it charged for weeks! Sure, I only read about 30 minutes a day, but still! I could not care less that it has no light because I read in a lit room. Also, the ads are not annoying like I thought they might be. When I go to it to read, I just swipe and the ads are gone. I am glad that I didn't buy a more expensive Kindle. This one is perfect!",Love it!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"There is already over 5,300 reviews of this Kindle, so I just wanna say thank you Amazon! For a couple of years I had used my iPad as my reader and did not enjoy it.  Then my wife convinced me to buy the Kindle Touch.It's lightweight, small and purpose made for reading.  I bought a nice cover and a tiny light for it and love it.  I have spent 4 hours or so reading it and totally enjoy it.  Very worth the price!",No bad stuff to say;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my kindle, the only complaint I have is that it doesnt have a light on it, but then I discovered the cases amazon offers with an led light connected to it. I just ordered it and cant wait to get it. This kindle is the perfect size as well and very light weight.",I love my kindle;;;;;;

Review: Very happy with this purchase. A lot of my friends have this same model and love it too. I hesitate with the Kindle Fire because I want a device that is for reading only. I don't want my kids using it to play games or watch movies. Just looking to see them read more.Battery life holds up well and I don't even feel the need to put it in a case. Seems sturdy and I love how it fits in my purse.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"You do not need to turn it off, it passes sleep mode and this mode does not affect the battery. When you are reading just touch the finger the word you do not understand it says the meaning. It does not affect your eyes. I suggest you should a candle case which covers your kindle and if you buy it you don't need to turn it off. The case does it instead of your fingers. Amazing. I like kindle :)",Amazing. I like kindle;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"First things first - I like it a lot.  Very readable, and light enough to hold comfortably in one hand on the Metro for prolonged periods.  Second thing is a question for which the jury is still out: are ""special offers"" worth saving 20 bucks?  Make no mistake - they are ads, and they *are* quite intrusive.  I thought they'd be on the screen only when the unit was asleep, but I was wrong, they're pasted all over the screen along with the books on my Kindle, as well.  I'll probably get used to navigating around them, so I'm in no hurry to pay the reported *30* dollars to remove them.  But they get in the way of a five-star review for now.","Are ""Special Offers"" worth 20 bucks?  The jury is still out for me.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love reading on my Kindle... this is the 3rd one I've owned and it is far better for reading than the iPad or other color tablets, at least for reading BOOKS. Magazines may be a different story, but I find it is very hard on my eyes to read on a back-lit screen. The Kindle's paperwhite screen is easy on the eyes, and the extra features like the dictionary, ability to highlight, buying online and getting books instantly... you can't beat it. Being able to carry several books on such a small and light device is great for traveling.",I love reading on my Kindle;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"pretty good over the old kindle keyboard but with some caveats.-no ability to put books into a collection and have them display that way.-no physical buttons to go back and forth.-not a rubberized back but a cheap hard plastic back.other than that its much faster and page turning works well with the IR curtain.Its a tough place to be because I wonder what the paperwhite version is like, then I think ""why don't I just get a tablet?"".best not to think about.",its ok.;;;;;;

Review: I like being able to carry my library in my pocket.  I was surprised by the lack of back light.  This kindle reads exactly like the printed page.  The black and white format is no problem because most of my books are printed in black and white.  This is my first E reader and I am loving it.
Title;;;;;;: I like being able to carry my library in my pocket;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought it on Amazon day for about $50, and although I'm glad I did, I wouldn't pay more than what I did for it. Glare-free is very nice, and I love the matte finish on the black plastic casing, but I don't like how there's a big noticeable lag when moving from menus and navigating through it.",and although I'm glad I did;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my Kindle! It's my first one, and I bought it after I realized how much I missed reading. I travel a lot, and it's not practical to bring books - which was always my first choice. However, after just a day with my Kindle, I'm a converter!The touch screen took a half a second to get used to, because there is no vibration response that I'm used to with my smartphone. It's also a bit slow in the response department, in comparison to a smartphone, but really, it's just a teeny tiny adjustment period. After that, I found it easy to use and an addition to my life that I love!","Compact, lightweight, and easy to use!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This works really great, but it can be a bit tricky when turning pages. Sometimes it will turn several pages at once and I have to try to figure out which page I'm supposed to be on. (I'm not sure if it is the Kindle or my fingers that are the problem.) I like the ability to change font size on the fly, it makes reading a lot easier. I'm using my Kindle several hours daily now. For the last several years I could only read print books for a half hour a day or less because of the strain from reading smaller fonts. The Kindle has freed me from that problem.","This works really great, but it can be a bit tricky when ...";;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I got Kindle because it has better support for reading other languages than nook (older touchscreen version).  I haven't found the reader to my liking when comparing it my Nook so far.  In fact, I get frustrated with Kindle on its usability.Pros:- It has more support for non-English (or Western European languages).- Has multiple dictionary for English as well as other languages to choose from.- Vocabulary builder.Cons:- Not even used for more than a couple of weeks, it froze on me.  I had to restart the system.  I also lost last read page of my book!!!- Home page doesn't allow me to go back to my previously read book without searching the book again.  Whenever I navigate say to my cloud or goodread, I have to use so many back button to get to where I left off.  I would think going to the home page would allow me to go back to my book with fewer clicks, but no.- Dictionary search limitations  - Words with dashes or other punctuation are hard to search.  There's no custom highlight to search words in dictionary.  - Sometimes I need to look up words in dictionary definition too, but I can't do that.  Nook has it and I really like the feature where I can search dictionary of words that I don't know everywhere, not just the words in the book.  - Custom search.  Sometimes, the words you search are not available in regular dictionary OR wikipedia, but if you modify the search word a little bit, it can help.  But user cannot edit the search word.  Again, this is something Nook has and I find it very convenient.- Can't disable wi-fi without going into settings with multiple clicks away from your book.  Then have make more clicks to find your way back to the book...Overall, as a reader, it's not much different than other readers.  It can improve by increasing dpi, making text more clear, but other usability is very important too.  I personally find it hard to use.  The dictionary usage is very important for someone who is not a native English speaker and need to look up words in dictionary all the time.  Not only the highlighting is rigid, not user input to correct the selection and no option for user to search further on new words in definition, I simply find it extremely inconvenient.I don't think I will buy another Kindle in the future.",Don't like navigation usability;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"Huge Kindle/Amazon Fan (now on my third Kindle), but Kindle Operating Systems are the worse, the most recent upgrade is terrible, loading/organizing books has always been painful but impossibly Amazon has gone out of their way to make it even worse, can't say I'll ever buy another Kindle","but Kindle Operating Systems are the worse, the most recent upgrade is terrible";;;;;;

Review: Love this reader!  I found that reading from my kindle fire for short times was fine but after working at the computer then coming home and reading all afternoon on the fire screen made my eyes tired.  I bought this glare free kindle specifically for reading my books for long periods.  It is much better.  No frills but great for reading and this is what it was made for.  Glad that Amazon made this basic kindle a touch screen now!

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"DON'T BUY A NEW KINDLE if you already have one.It will not have your books on it. And getting them on it from ""the cloud"" is a tedious book-by-book process that will make you decide to go back to paper.I transferred all the old content (only my screen was broken), via USB from old Kindle to new.  When I tried to open the books I was told they were not authorized on the new device, even though it is now registered as my primary device.After chatting with 3 customer service agents (one of whom told me they would fix the problem by assigning the old serial number to my new Kindle), and speaking on line with an agent, I discovered there is no fix for this.Sorry folks.  If you REALLY want to access all those books you OWN... you have to do it one-by-one from ""the cloud"" and you'd better not be someplace where you don't have access to wifi when you want to do it.The stupidity of this defies description since the software fix that would be needed is so obvious and so easy.",AMAZON does NOT support upgrading to a new Kindle -- you'll be sorry if you try;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"It is a big improvement over the original kindle.  I had one of the originals but the battery gave way after many, many hours of use by my wife, a voracious reader, whose final seven years were spent in a nursing home and she simply wore it out.. In addition to the glare free kindle, I bought a kindle fire which I also like very much but I rarely use it as the on/off switch fell off and I have to turn it on or off with a screw driver. I really liked the fire better than the iPad",The new glaare free kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought it as a gift for a relative and she absolutely loved it! I knew she's a heavy book reader, so I figured what the heck I know she will enjoy this. The price of this kindle was pretty good as well. Most of these things would cost a little above the hundred mark.",Great buy!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"My husband does all his reading on a Kindle - this one is the first touch-screen one and took a few minutes training, but it is great.  A good basic Kindle, lightweight, easy to use.  When my original basic Kindle bites the dust, I will get this one also.",Love our Kindles;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I wasn't sure how I would like using an e-reader, so decided cheaper was better.I had to really get used to how sensitive the touch screen is, and how to use my computer along with the kindle to get the books I enjoy.Reading is one of the joys of my life, and using this, I have access to a huge amount of fresh material without dragging books around, making a point of going to a library, so, yeah. I'm now a ""Kindle Convert"".",Works like new!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my 3rd Kindle since their release date several years ago.  I never leave the house without my Kindle.  I love the Kindles, the benefits and the flexibility. I can download some of my writings onto my Kindle so I can proofread while I am out of my office, indicate errors, make notes, and utilize all my time.  I like the light weight of the Kindle 6"", and the non-glare screen so I can spend more time outside reading while relaxing.",I love the Kindles;;;;;;

Review: I love my Kindle so much I bought this one for my daughter to take while studying abroad. Then we downloaded her textbooks so that she wouldn't have to travel with the heavy weights of school books along with all of her luggage. It was worked out great.
Title;;;;;;: I love my Kindle so much I bought this one for ...;;;;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"The touchscreen is a mixed blessing. While it make the kindle interface more tactile and user friendly (especially when zooming), it makes the device noticeably bulkier and heavier than the previous model. Although by no means should it be classified ""heavy"", I do like the slicker feel of the previous incarnation.",I do like the slicker feel of the previous incarnation;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my 3rd Kindle.  I like the improvements made over the last 4 years.  The touchscreen makes life so much easier.  Maneuvering through the screens, is so much easier.  I just had to get used to downloading my previously purchased books from the cloud and the removing them when I am done takes some getting used to.",I like the improvements made over the last 4 years;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Liked my old Kindle better, this is small and light but the all touch screen is annoying, keep slipping finger onto screen when reading and I am suddenly at Wikipedia etc. its explaining the meaning of a word I may have touched accidently!  Already a book disappeared I was in the middle of reading, do no know what happened suddenly I had to pick out a new book to read!",Liked my old Kindle better;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"The 6"" Kindle is really still an exceptional reader for the price.  Note, the second part of that sentence is the operative part.  It does have its shortcomings.  The screen is still distinctly not white on black, tending to more of an off grey or brown color with dark grey text.  And, although I had never noticed it before, after using a Kindle Voyage, the text is noticeably aliased.  However, page turns are faster than ever and the image, sans aliasing, is extremely crisp.  For $79 dollars, really, it could replace every book in your library and leave you wanting only a little bit over the charm of dead tree.  Hard to beat that.","Flawed reader, great price.";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I like it because it is lightweight and very easy to read in daylight.  It is harder to read by artificial light, and of course it does not have an internal light as does the Kindle Fire.  I also like it because the charge lasts a long time.  I find I am always turning pages.  I suppose there is not as much text on one page as some other models.",Lightweight and easy to read.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Couldn't be happier. I have the Kindle Fire and do love it but it's much more suited for videos. For a reader it works but it is rather heavy. Whenever I go anywhere I like to take reading material with me for my downtime. Now instead of one book I have my whole library. It's light weight, easy to read in the bright outdoors and I connect using my IPhone when and if I want to download or purchase a new title.  I highly recommend it and the price can't be beat.",A good companion for the Kindle Fire.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love that the newest baseline Kindle Reader allows for finger-flipping of the pages.  Did I need this?  Perhaps not--since I have the reader on my computer and cell phones.  Yet, this reads so nice.  The letters are big, crisp, and easy on the eyes.  Navigation is not too difficult.  And, unlike my Kindle Fire--the kids don't ""steal"" the readers.  :-)  Thanks Amazon for upgrading, rather than abandoning, your economy reader!","Page-flipping, eye-pleasing, reader that the kids won't steal";;;;;;

Review: I can finally read books and save trees lol. E-ink is amazing and the kindle can store many many books internally. Sometimes I wish I had the Paperwhite edition just to have the backlit screen. Otherwise it is awesome for reading and portable
Title;;;;;;: E-ink is amazing and the kindle can store many many books internally;;;;;;

Review: What else can I add that hasn't been said? I bought this to read at the beach. Love that it syncs with my kindle fire so I can pick up where I left off making sure I sync before I leave home because you need a wifi connection. i have a kindle fire and a nook color. I do prefer to read on those but this is much easier to read in direct sunlight. It's doing the job that I wanted it to do and it does it very well.

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"The Kindle is perfect for using to read books during my workouts and small enough that I can even hold it as I run laps. It is simple to use and I love turning pages with the touch screen rather than the buttons that were on the frame of my old Kindle Gen 1. I also like the fact that the screen doesn't light up. It is very easy on the eyes.However I am very disappointed with the wi-fi connectivity. It often will not connect and so that makes it hard to look up definitions or use other functions dependent on wi-fi. The experimental browser is useless. It just plain does not work. I never intended to use the Kindle to browse the web but I did want to be able to download books from the library using the Kindle. But the browser is so bad I have never been able to use it to browse and download library books. I have to use my computer or iPhone to get library books for the Kindle. I also wish a power adapter had been included because it is not convenient to charge it on USB. The $19.99 price Amazon charges to buy the power adapter is ridiculously high. The Kindle cover is also overpriced at $29.99. It feels very flimsy - a far cry from the nice leather cover the Kindle Gen 1 had.I bought the Kindle at the $99 price and the next day saw it went on sale for $79. I was happy that Amazon agreed to give me the sale price retroactively. I've seen the Kindle on sale more recently at $59 and wish that I had waited to buy it at that price. I think $99  - and even $79  - is too much considering the problems with wi-fi connectivity and the uselessness of the browser.But all of that said, the device itself is very handy for reading electronic books.",The Kindle is perfect for using to read books during my workouts and ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I am very happy with this product. You can't tell it was a refurb. My only complaint was that it didn't have a backlight like shown and described. But for a child's first Kindle and to continue their love of reading, I didn't go wrong.",Overall very pleased. Great price!!!!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This replaced my old Kindle Touch and I really like it. I took off one star because it isn't as easy to locate new downloads and place them into collections. Also, I borrow A LOT of ebooks from the library and there is nothing to indicate them as borrowed, so when I was downloading my library, the borrowed books kept making the Kindle freeze. Other than that, I am finding it a good device for reading and I do recommend for anyone who wants just an ereader.",I  like my new Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Works great, light comfortable to hold. The battery lasted two weeks with me using it every day. I was worried that the special offers - ads would be intrusive  but they are not, they are never in the reading page only the screen saver.  A small price to pay for the 20 dollar savings. For features vs price it was my best purchase all year.","No worries with ""Special Offers""";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I never wanted one of these because I love the feel of a book. However, my son & daughter-in-law got this Kindle for me for Christmas......and I LOVE it!!!!! They also bought a Vera Bradley cover for my Kindle, so it almost feels like a book. I'm 69 years old, and I must say it's easier for me to read from my Kindle than from a book.",Great Gift!!!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Got this for my 7 year old daughter's birthday.  She wanted a Kindle just like her big sister!  She loves it.  The only problem is that now the older sister wants one with Touchscreen also!  She loves using the Kindle, and still loves to read physical books too.  Best of both worlds.",7 Year Old: Thumbs Up;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love it!!  I had an old old Kindle with the keyboard on the bottom (yes, the letters were pretty well worn off).  It worked well until I spilled a glass of water on it. I have a Kindle Fire HD but I don't want to take it to the beach, etc. I just wanted a reader with wifi that was easy to read. This does it & I did spring for ""no ads"" because they are too annoying.  Happy!!",Love it!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This basic Kindle is a great value and I love it!  It's like having any paperback you want to read at your side anytime, anyplace.  The touchscreen works great and is the best I've found for reading in sunny conditions. It's very book-like and easy on the eyes.  It's not backlit;" but then again neither are my traditional books!My current endeavor is learning Spanish. With the Kindle
Review: it's easy to select words of interest.  These highlighted words are automatically added to my vocabulary list
Title;;;;;;: which I can then review at leisure.  Excelente!""
column4: Great
column5: book-like screen!""";;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"I was very disappointed in this version of the Kindle. The  Touch screen is so sensitive that even just brushing my clothes against it, changed the  chapter location in the book I was reading. My previous  years of  enjoyment of  reading on the Kindle was GONE due to the erratic behavior of this version. After I struggled to read just one book on this new Kindle,  returned it and bought the keyboard version which I am now enjoying using again.",What a terrible experience.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"When I purchased this, it was to replace a Kindle Generation 4, which came out a few years ago. I also own a Kindle Voyage;" this Kindle was to be what I used when going into the city as a cheaper alternative to traveling with the Voyage.The cons: Compared to the Voyage
Review: the case feels cheaper. It's hard plastic with a deep bezel.  It has no backlight.The pros: The Kindle is perfectly readable. No
column4: but it's perfectly serviceable. As for its lack of backlight
column5: that can be remedied by purchasing a case with an external light.It responds relatively quickly to touch and remains light and easy to carry. Moreover
column6: the text is crisp and easy to read
column7: although for some odd reason the Time to Read function has a slightly different time remaining on it for the same book than the Voyage does
column8: but that's easily fixed too.""
column9: The Kindle";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love it for reading!  I ordered it through AARP and was supposed to get a 10% discount but did not receive the discount. When ordering it never asked for my  AARP number.  I did order this off the AARP site.  That is the disappointment in ordering this item.  Since I already have a NOOK, the offer of a 10% discount on the Kindle e-reader drew my attention.  It is much easier to work with Amazon than with Barnes and Noble when ordering items.  I was also not happy that I had trouble with the NOOK recently and was not happy with their attitude.",Love it for reading;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Got this as a gift for my step-father.  He is not the most techy guy, but he loves this thing.  He reads all the time and can barely put this reader down.  He gets books off Amazon, the local library and other websites too.",Nice little reader that's easy to use;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought this for my husband as a gift and he loves it. This one has nicer features than the Kindle I bought for myself a few years ago, but mine has held up so well that I can't justify upgrading.  This is a sturdy, user-friendly product and the battery lasts several days even with heavy use.",great product;;;;;;

Review: I AM VERY PLEASED WITH MY NEW KINDLE.  IT IS VERY LIGHT WEIGHT AND DOES NOT TIRE ME TO HOLD IT UP.  I WOULD LIKE IT MORE IF I COULD FIND A STAND FOR IT SO IT COULD SIT ON THE ARM OF MY CHAIR.  MY OTHER KINDLE HAS BEEN WITH ME FOR YEARS AND ACTS UP EVERY NOW AND THEN.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my 4th Kindle.  I had the first one, then upgraded, then got a Kindle Fire.  I've loved them all.  The Kindle Fire is great when I travel as I can do e-mail and go on line but it is much larger and heavier.  This Kindle E-reader is so small and light weight and has the ""paper"" screen, I love it for reading!! It is easy to read, fits easily in a purse and the battery lasts forever.",I've loved them all;;;;;;

Review: Hubby bought this for my 10 year old daughter. She loves it and we can also check out library e books on it. I like that there is no blue light background. The charge lasts a long time (several weeks).

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I've had this for a year now. My only complaint about it is, it loses its place if I don't exit out to the home menu before closing it for the day. Love the e-ink and the fact it's a simple ereader. It was exactly what I wanted.",Great product.;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"Inferior product. Would not recommend even though I purchased it at 48% off. I just isn't worth it. The screen scrolls to five pages ahead of what your reading without the reader doing anything. When trying to purchase a book, the device will not register the register. I have execellent WiFi connection and no problem with my Barnes and Noble Nook. I set the Amazon product aside and don't use it. Lisa Quinn",Very inferior product;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Great for daytime reading, but consider the new version with the built in light. It really depends on your usage. We also have the new version paper white, with light, and it seems to be a better all around device for us. I still use this with a book light, but the added cost of batteries is a consideration, compared to the cost of jumping up to the next version kindle. Works as advertised though!",Consider the new version with built in light;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this because I am a big Kindle fan. I have a Google Nexus 7 with the Kindle Reading app. When I sit on my deck in good weather, the glare of my tablet is annoying. The eReader solves that problem. It's very light, but I had to get used to its different interface. Should have paid closer attention to the introductory screens providing an overview of the interface. But I eventually figured it out in a few hours. I just wish I had reached my decision to buy this back in January 2015 when it was still on sale for $20 less than I paid for it. LOL!","A really good, budget minded eReader.";;;;;;

Review: It is very difficult to read the titles of books on the home page.  I don't like all the ads.  I purchased the Kindle without the ads but apparently they come with it anyway.  I Do like the non-glare screen.  I can't read on the Kindle Fire or play games on my phone  because the glare hurts my eyes and I get a headache.  I can read this Kindle all day long without getting a headache.  It is very lightweight and easy to hold.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"My keyboard tablet died.  I ordered the Kindle Glare-free Touchscreen because I didnt want a lighted screen like a tablet and this more closely resembled my old Kindle.  I love to turn the pages with just a swipe.  I like the smaller size, and it feels like a book.  I bought a light for reading at night and it's great.  Also I'm a prime member and Amazon delivered it in two days as promised.",Feels just like I'm reading a book;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first kindle, haven't been disappointed yet only wish I would have chosen the paper white. Only for the light. This has many fonts which is really nice because there are days my eye sight is a little worse than others.  Love all the other things this has.",My first kindle;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Although I wish I could buy something that actually has everything needed in one purchase (e.g., charger, cover or light), it was exactly what I needed as someone who has put off getting a Kindle for years.  I have many actual books that I will not pay to put on the Kindle as well, but in combination with having Amazon Prime, it's helpful getting cheaper versions of books for my monthly business book club, and to try out other books prior to buying.  I already have laptops, etc., and this is just the right size and convenient for many situations.",Exactly right for my basic needs;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I put off getting a Kindle for a long time now.  I bougt one for my Son and one for my Grandson, but didn't think I needed one as I have an Ipad.  I couldn't have been more wrong.  This thing is wonderful!  The battery lasts so much longer, it is smaller, lighter, and more portable.  It is better than I ever expected and I am reading more now than I have in years!",Got me reading again.;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I do love my reader but there have been two things so far that I have found to dislike.1. The screen doesn't just shut off after letting it sit. You have to actually hold down the power button to just shut off the screen.2. It doesn't auto find where you are on the book. There are times where when I am at work and do not have my reader with me so I continue reading on my phones app. When I go back to me reader later that night I have to search where I was manually. On an iPad, iPhone, or Android the app auto finds the last page and asks you if you would like to move to that point. This device does not.Don't get me wrong I love the reader but these two things almost made me want to return it for another better device.",Happy but unhappy at the same time...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"very lite. Touchscreen is easier for my arthritic fingers.  My experience with Amazon has been excellent. The orders arrive quickly and if you need to return an item, there's no problem. The customer service reps are professional, knowledgeable of items sold, patient and efficient.",Four Stars and a half;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love this for outdoor reading! I bought this because anything with light displays are difficult to see out in the sun but this works perfect. Also, if the back lit screen bothers my eyes on my iPad, I just switch to this! I work many hours staring at a computer screen and this helps when I want to read a book. Who uses paper books anymore? The battery life is long lasting between charges.","Perfect, just what I needed!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Exactly what I was looking for.  I have been using the Amazon Kindle app for years on other devices. But I was always handicapped by the fact that either the screens were too small or I couldn't see it in Brightlight. This Kindle takes care of both of those problems at a great price. It's lightweight, easy to read and the battery last four weeks. Also having a kindle the Amazon lending library is an added bonus.",Love it!!!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Could you please mail me more information? I can't learn enough from the info I have, for example: how do I archive books that I have read?I also want to know how to find books I haven't read yet. Currently, such a book shows up at the end and I need outside help finding the first page...I really would appreciate a mail explaining me these issues.Otherwise, I really enjoy the touch screen. It saves time and is a vast improvement to my first Kindle.Warm regards,",I really enjoy the touch screen;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Not bad for the price,but I find the Dictionary and Highlighting extremely annoying and apparently it is not possible to delete them!  I have a Fire and the DX ( which I think is the best of all) but this is OK for travel.If I had known about the features that I mentioned I would not have got this one,but will persevere for a while.",Some annoying features.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I received the Kindle 7th Generation as a Christmas gift and have really been enjoying it.  Since this is my first Kindle, it took some learning and getting used to how it works.  The ""user guide"" is disappointing and not very user friendly.  However, I am using my Kindle every day and reading on it is a real pleasure.  Downloading new ""books"" to read almost instantly on my Kindle is really nice.  I would recommend the Fintie Kindle 7th Gen SmartShell Case for security and comfort.  If I upgrade to another Kindle in the future, I think the back-lit model would be useful for low light reading.",Nice basic Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I recently retired my original Kindle and purchased the Kindle  with glare-free touchscreen display. It is so much more than just a reading device. I love it.It did take a few days to get used to the touch screen. You have to learn 'hands-off' of the screen unless you're changing pages or need to access information. My old kindle had the buttons for accessing information.But, this one is really clear and easy to use.",Fantastic device;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Nice kindle, sturdy and glare free. Great for the kids and myself. Good starter kindle, though I wish it had a light and more pictures in books for younger children. A bit tricky to figure out at first.",Compact kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Fantastic little reader!  It's comparable in print quality to a book but easier to handle.  Not yet used to the features, but definitely a plus to have the dictionary available at the drop of a hat.  I'm enjoying reading on it so far and not noticing any straining my eyes usually having when reading illuminated screens or having to strain to wrestle with book bindings while trying not to bend a book open.  I will admit i love the smell of older bound books, but so far only a positive experience with this reader!",Fantastic little reader;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this for my neice this last christmas. Originally I was going to get the kindle fire. Her parents however, weren't comfortable with her having internet access and all that comes with it like the apps, social media and games. So i was quite happy when I found this. No, it isn't the fanciest high tech thing, but it does what it's supposed to very well. the touchscreen is very responsive and easy to navigate to where you want to go. It is a great e-reader, where you can purchase or borrow books. When a book is open the screen looks a lot like the page of a real book. What was a huge seller for me, and the reason for wanting to get my neice a kindle in the first place, was the built in dictionary. My neice can now read many books and have easy access to the definition of words she is unfamiliar with. This device has increased her desire to read and her vocabulary has improved. Now that I've seen this being used I'm glad I didn't get the fire. Without all the distraction from apps and games she is able to focus and immerse herself into whatever story she's reading. Definitely recommend!",Definitely Recommend!;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"It is a great concept. This is the first Kindle I have owned. But I have to reboot it every time I want to use it. And it is made of chinsy material. It feels like it will break in my hand. The plug has already mangled the power input, and I've only had the Kindle for a few days (less than a week). I will have to return this soon because I am sure it won't last me even a year.",It is a great concept. This is the first Kindle I have ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love to read and this Kindle is perfect.  The charge does not last as long as advertised, but then I read several hours a day and the charge will last more than three days.  My only real whiney complaint is I can't see the art work  on the covers really well because the arnt in color.  I love that I can make the print size bigger. The anti glare screen is fab. All in all this is a great product. Love it!",You need one of these if you like to read!!;;;;;;
