5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love this kindle. Easy to use, lightweight, great readability. I thought I'd never like this because I really love books, but this isn't so bad after all. It's very light and easy to hold in one hand. No glare on the screen which is really nice.",Pleasant surprise;;;;;;

Review: I need help I have never found MENU  or have been able to find all of the books I bought b/4 my 2nd kindle died I can get cloud whish is arcives on old kindles...Never could get the devise to turn on HELP  HELP  i a 77 yera old NANA that loved her old simple to use Kindle
Title;;;;;;: Never could get the devise to turn on HELP HELP i a 77 yera old NANA that loved her old simple to use;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Fifty bucks on Amazon Prime Day, so this was an impulse purchase. It's a backup to my Kindle Voyage, but a nice piece of hardware in its own right. Needs mechanical page turn buttons;" the touchscreen doesn't work well for high-speed readers. Otherwise
Review: serviceable and cheap.""
Title;;;;;;: A nice starter or backup Kindle";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"The Kindle 6"" has been a handy little gadget for when I am going to college. It is nice to have to read not only text books for school, but also books that I download from Amazon. It is nice to have the glare-free touch screen. Easy to read with the white background.",Easy Reading;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Considering the price, the device is great.  My 8 year old son needed a way to read some of the Kindle books we had purchased for the older kids, but he did not have a device. Since he sleeps with a night light anyways, the lack of backlighting is not an issue. Plus, with the parental controls, he can only read with it and only the books we curate for him. He loves it and it has helped him increase his reading minutes at school and home. I only left it four stars because buyers should be aware, the screen refresh is a little slow and it does not have backlighting.",Great device for children!;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Activating the insurance package for kids is extremely confusing.  The confirmation email from amazon should include a link since the process involves going to the page for the insurance, "" buying it"" and offsetting cost with a promo code ( since you already paid for it in the price of the kids package.",Activating the insurance package for kids is extremely confusing. ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had to purchase this Kindle because I broke my old keyboard Kindle. I am still getting used to it, but it is doing what it is supposed to.  The best part of this and all Kindle e-readers is that you can read outside!  But Amazon still needs to offer an affordable version that is not a touchscreen. My 92 year old mother has the previous version with the buttons on the side, but she could never use this one.",good e-reader;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Vivid display but so contents small in quantity so feel like I have carpal tunnel from turning page so frequently. Can't be helped unless print adjusted and then I can't read it comfortably. Otherwise, nice device.",... display but so contents small in quantity so feel like I have carpal tunnel from turning page so frequently;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought the basic Kindle (newest model) and paid to receive it without the special values. Easy set up,bought my first book and it downloaded quickly and I was ready within a half hour. If you need the backlight feature for night reading then this isn't your model. I am very happy with this model after a try with the ""Fire"" series made by Amazon. No clutter,no pesky ads.",The Way I Want it! To earn Five Stars it should be able to tap Dance.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I liked it but it takes a lot of geting used to it. My other kindle had the books automatically transfered to the kindle and were not in the cloud. I like them being in the cloud because you can read one book at a time. the page turner buttons on this kindle are easier to use than on my other one, but i seem to have to go to the cloud to download a book every time while with the older kindle I did not have to. Its easier to turn this kindle on and off as well. I am still learning this kindle. I am looking forward to learning more about it and just need to get a case for it.",good kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my Kindle ... I just want to read and this is perfect, However  do consider getting a reading light if you're not in a well lit reading area. I have been having a hard time finding a good one. Waiting for one I ordered from Amazon to arrive so we will see how that one is. I don't know if the covers that come with a built in reading light are the best option, for I did not get one, so you may want to consider this also.Hands down awesome , light , long battery life, fits easily in my purse. =)",I love my Kindle;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I love the fact that I can once again read my Kindle in my hand rather than on my PC. Not a big fan of reading on the computer...I don't know how I survived the internet, probably all the bells and whistles and colors and info. Anyway. this is my second kindle since I broke the first one I had by kneeing it to death while it was under the covers. Anyway, I like my first one better. I don't particularly like touching the screen to go from page to page. I liked the page turner on the hardware side of the Kindle instead. I don't really like the ability to put in a page number instead of hunting from page to page. I should be awing and ooohing at this technology, but I think it might have something to do with stopping to put in the page number which to me is a bit of a delay in this age of instant gratification. It's still a great piece of technology and one day in the future all books and textbooks will be read on a kindle which will save the trees.",Still Saves the Trees;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've had my Kindle for a couple of days now, and it has seen very heavy usage, but barely sipped at the batteries - I keep it in airplane mode for security and to preserve battery life. Though I'm still finding my way around the more advanced and difficult aspects of using the Kindle, using it for its basic functionality is very intuitive. I'm impressed by the eInk screen, with glare equivalent to a glossy magazine page, it's very readable in all light conditions.Its light weight and small size, and the lack of need to hold the pages open have made reading in bed much more comfortable than with conventional books - this is a big deal, coming from a paper book purist! Repetitive strain injuries have made reading a painful chore - not any more! Between this and the many free kindle books, both new and classic, I've been able to get back to reading as a hobby despite a low budget.I find the Special Offers unintrusive, similar to ads in a magazine, so for the cost conscious, it's not so bad to get the Special Offers edition.",Repetitive strain injury made reading a painful chore - not anymore!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this for one purpose only - and it is fulfilling that need quite nicely.  I wish a paper manual had come with the device, as it would have saved me some low-grade hassles while I was out of town.  I'm sure if I took the time to learn some of the features, I would no doubt be delighted - but my learning curve is very steep and it doing what I need it to do right now without those features, so maybe another day I'll venture further.",Does what I got it for;;;;;;

Review: I had wanted one of these for a long time but just never found one that was this size.  The size is great so I can fit it in my purse like I have done with my paperbacks.  I always carry a book with me for any appointment as I am an avid reader and have already downloaded 3 books so am excited about getting new books at a reasonable price.  Have already almost finished one of the books and the print is very clear and their is no glare on the screen.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchased this within the past four months for myself, mainly to borrow eBooks from my local public library. I was hesitant to try an eReader because I much prefer physical books. However, I am very glad I made the decision I did. I read much faster on my Kindle than I do paper books. I am able to rent textbooks at a much lower cost (being a poor college kid is a struggle). I can even email myself PDF files of required readings from class to save myself from printing them all. It is very easy to sort all the PDFs into different collections for each course.I have two critiques. One is that Collections cannot be made within Collections (but I acknowledge that this is my over-organized brain seeking unreasonable requests). The other is that highlighting in PDFs is difficult. However, highlighting in a normal eBook is incredibly easy, even if the section I want to highlight runs over two pages.This is a very basic eReader without many bells and whistles, and it suits me just fine. Reading outside is not an issue, and reading under the covers with a flashlight poses no problem. I charge my Kindle once every two weeks with my frequent use, but it can go longer between charges. I would recommend this eReader to anyone new to the eBook game.",Very pleased;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Wow, what an amazing find at an awesome price! I should have gotten one of these awhile ago. I never wanted to make the jump from a tangible paperback book but the kindle is perfect and I can go through the pages must faster. Perfect starter kindle for anyone on a budget. The background doesn't light up but I didn't expect it to from reading previous reviews. If you love to read I say go for it!!",what an amazing find at an awesome price;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I finally got an e-reader after considering it a few years, and I must say it's more than I'd hoped for! The text is dark and clear, the kindle itself is light and easy to carry around, and by far the best feature is one that isn't even advertised. There are no pages to close on you when you set it somewhere to read! After years of reading in odd positions and using anything nearby to weight down the pages, being able to just set the kindle down and keep reading is possibly the greatest change possible. The future is finally here, and my book doesn't try to close itself every time I shift around!I was a little worried about its PDF reading ability after doing extensive research, but after loading up a few from my computer I can say it's much easier to read them than on my computer screen. Just set it to landscape mode and you're set to go, which is a godsend since I've amassed more PDFs of programming books and other texts over the years than any human should, and sitting at a desk trying to read them has always led me to stop just a few dozen pages in never to return.Overall it's a great product, and I look forward to using it daily!",Makes reading even easier;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Seriously, how did I live without a Kindle for so long? Kindle apps are all well and good, but it just isn't the same. It isn't as ""cute"" as some of the animated options out there, but  I didn't realize how much eye strain there was from reading with a backlit screen until I switched from the app to using a Kindle with e-ink. And the battery lasts forever.","Kindle apps are all well and good, but it just isn't the same";;;;;;

Review: I now have to apologize to everyone who kept telling me how awesome this device is. I was a major naysayer- An English prof. who ABSOLUTELY would NEVER EVER utilize this format. Insisted I needed the tactile sensation that holding a book gives me!!! I was wrong!!! Love this!!! Received it for Mothers Day.

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"It's nice but I am yet to figure out how to increase the font size permanently in settings. I am farsighted so I need large fonts. Nevertheless, despite this issue, the devide is quite portable. I was able to download some of my books from the cloud. I wish it had audio capability and be linked to Audiobooks so I could listen to some of my audiobooks while commuting. It is ""linked"" with goodreads, though.",Nice Portable Device For Reading - No Audio;;;;;;

Review: A great device at a great price.  Feels better made than earlier versions. But now a year later its already having problems. Freezes frequently and I have to restart it.  I think these kindles are for people who don't read very often. I read every day and this kindle has been acting up for a couple months. I love my kindle but I can't justify buying a new one every year. I hope they improve the quality of the kindle. Maybe someday I'll try one again... but I've had 3 that didn't last a year...
Title;;;;;;: A year later NO MORE Five Stars;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"As a companion to my iPad, this little gem is about the size of a large paperback book, and much lighter. I find I am reading Kindle books on this handy device more than I am my heavier iPad. Long lasting battery life, portability, ease of reading the screen all add up to a pleasant little reader to use wherever you like to read. I am pleased with my purchase.",Hold a hundred books in one hand.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is fine for just reading books. I do get a slight glare with my attached iKross clip on light when I have the light aimed straight at the screen, but tilting the screen and adjusting light helps. I haven't tried this outside in sunlight yet. I had a Kindle Fire before, and the backlight gave me headaches with extended reading, which is why I bought this one. Works great for just reading...","Kindle 6"" Glare-Free Touchscreen Display";;;;;;

Review: My husband and I bought this Kindle for our 10 year old.  Christmas is taking too long to come!! :D  We can't wait until he gets this.  I love the size of this new kindle - just perfect for those little hands.  It's so easy to set up.  I would recommend this bundle to anyone who wants to buy something for their child to read.  It doesn't get any better.  I love the dictionary feature - great for learning new words.
Title;;;;;;: A GREAT DEAL FOR YOUR CHILDREN;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"An excellent device that even skeptics will grow to love. I love the smell and feel of real books, but when I was on vacation, I spent a week with no internet connection nor cell phone signal and had to rely on my books to keep me company. During this stay, I had luckily preemptively downloaded a bunch of books to the device, and I plowed straight through 4 or 5 of them. This would not have been possible if I had to carry 4 or 5 books on every trip.As for the specifications on the device: I recommend splurging a bit to get the paperwhite, particularly if you like reading at dusk or while traveling. This version is pleasant while there's adequate light, but if there is inconsistent light, say from reading while on a train, you will become frustrated. The paperwhite with a backlight is much better in this regard. In addition, I do wish that it was a little bit larger, as I have to either hold it with two hands, or between my palm and my abductor pollucis (meat of the thumb) to balance it;" more non-screen space for leverage is welcome and would make reading upside down or at angles easier.My last quip about this device is that the exterior scratches fairly easily. I left my kindle in my backpack while traveling
Review: but it suffered no huge distress and has little scratches that can be distracting from the page. Definitely recommend purchasing with a cover of some sort.The positives:I love the screen
Title;;;;;;: it really does feel like paper
column4: and there's about as much readable area as a normal book. Customizable fonts are nice
column5: the area allocated to touch is nice
column6: sensitivity is adequate
column7: if a bit too much
column8: and overall does its job well.The data transfer system is excellent
column9: as I can download books
column10: either from Amazon or through a third party service
column11: and put them on the device via USB easily. The experimental browser and goodreads are nice bonuses that I don't really use
column12: but you could. It's very easy to share books with friends/family as well.It's very light and pleasant to carry around
column13: no matter how heavy the reading you're doing is.Great volume lets you read as many books as you want and you can set up a buffet of reading for whatever you're in the mood for
column14: rather than being limited by what you have with you.Overall - Recommended
column15: but consider the other models first to best match your needs.""
column16: An excellent device that even skeptics will grow to love";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,Had to replace the 6 year old Kindle we had. Really like this touch screen model. Screen is the same size but overall its a bit small and a lot lighter. Great job.  Only problem is the games that were on the old one wont work on the touch screen. They game people have on touch screen version.,"Really nice, love the touch screen. Very light.";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I have a hard time getting used to the touch screen, the previous 5th gen kindle had a more positive feel for the control buttons. After a week am still unable to to find a way to delete books from the kindle. WHERE IS THE MENU BUTTON? I bought the kindle for reading books, not for all the built in fancy tricks!",AMAZON HAS ABANDONED THE KISS PRINCIPLE;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Great kindle for reading. I have a kindle 8.9"" fire HDX that I use for a lot of things, but I needed something for reading exclusively. This kindle does the job. The books are very clear to read. Turning pages is simple. The battery life seems to be very good. I can go weeks without having to charge it, while reading about thirty minutes a day. Overall an outstanding product.",Great kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this for my eleven-year-old brother, who is a VORACIOUS reader. It's been three days and he's already finished three young adult novels. Coupled with a Kindle Unlimited subscription, he has access to hundreds of thousands of books (including comics!). When he goes back to school, I'll help him get his school textbooks and required readings uploaded onto his Kindle. The interface is a little confusing at first, and the advertisements are really ""meh"", but as a whole, I'm really glad with my purchase :)",Love it Already!;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,This is a nice little reading device. It's held up well for the past few months of travel.What I don't like is that the black plastic scratches and streaks easily. It's kind of distracting when you're reading a book to see streaks in the black plastic finish. Wish I could have gotten this in a different color.,"Good e-reader, with some quality issues";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I preferred the listing of books to be in text. The screen is not easily managed with the thumbnail images. With practice, however, I will become more comfortable with using it. one of the problems with my old Kindle is the glare;" the touchscreen display on the new one is glare-free
Review: so that is a plus.""

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This was exactly what I was looking for.  My husband bought me the Kindle Fire to replace my Kindle 2 that had gotten wet, but I just wanted a reader so I wouldn't have the distraction of internet, apps and email.  I have an iPad and Surface Pro 2 for that!  Now I can read without all of the other noise.  Very happy.",Very happy.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchased the Kindle, 6"" Glare-Free Touchscreen Display as a kit for my 7-year old granddaughter who loves to read.  It came with a 2-year warranty by Squaretrade.  This was a super investment in my grand kids education and future.","Kindle, 6"" Glare-Free Touchscreen Display";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have not used it much at this point so I don't really know what it does and doesn't but it is superb in what I have used it for...reading my favorite books.  It is easy to use, I can read the words without any trouble, it is clearly marked as to what you are doing.  I am just really pleased with it and would recommend it to others.",Recommended!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this to replace my trusty old original Kindle DX with the keyboard after the 5-way button on the DX suddenly broke. I was a little worried about how tiny the screen is, and on Day 2, I am finding it annoying to have to page turn so frequently, but I think eventually it will become second nature and the touch screen will be better than the klunkiness of all those buttons --  although after years with the DX the only time the buttons annoyed me was when typing in a search term or when I forgot I wasn't on my iPad and tried to scroll with my finger. I opted for the plain old Kindle vs moving up to a Paperwhite or Voyage because I stare at a computer monitor at work all day and usually spend an hour or two in the evening on the iPad, so I really didn't want another lighted screen. I use the Kindle almost exclusively to read in bed, where I have a lamp on the wall that shines over my shoulder. I am quite satisfied with the clarity of the text which is noticeably darker than the DX - so I am glad I didn't opt for the more expensive models simply for higher resolution, especially since I read a lot of complaints that the lighting in those models is not even, which would drive me nuts. I'm not entirely sure I made the right choice getting the ""Special Offers"" version - I misread the description and thought the offers would only be on the sleep screen, not on the home screen too. One thing I will not miss about the Kindle DX is the bruises on the bridge of my nose from it bonking me when I fell asleep reading - I think the smaller lighter Kindle will be easier on my face.",I am finding it annoying to have to page turn so frequently;;;;;;

Review: I think any negatives that I am feeling now are just because I am not used to this on.  I had the one with buttons before and still have to learn about navigating.  It has all the options but I am not used to having to take the extra steps.  Over all I am enjoying my new Kindle with touchscreen and would feel comfortable recommending it to anyone looking for just a reader.

This is my third Kindle. I love all three!  My first one was the 2nd Gen. When the Fire came out I had to have one. I gave my first one away. I love my fire. I keep that one next to my bed so that I can read at night.  I bought the 3rd one because I was going on vacation to the beach and wanted to be able to read. I also enjoy reading on my back deck. The fire is not for using in the sun because of the glare. Now that vacation is over the 6' is perfect for carrying around in my purse for reading emergencies. People need to fully read product descriptions before they buy stuff. It does not come with a light. I've had with buttons and without. Both work great. Kindle products are awesome!!

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love books and have been resistant to reading on a kindle. I borrowed my husbands kindle to start and then got one of my own. Now I love reading on a kindle. I still prefer the feel of a real book however this kindle has a lot of cool features: the pages look like regular book pages, you can read outside,  Its very easy to turn the page with just a quick little tap, it's easy to bookmark your page and then scroll back to reread something. Amazon's advertising of this was completely true. It does everything as promised and I am very happy with it.",Satisfied customer;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love my kindles, all of them. Each one beloved, each newest improved, but love and use every single one. Good for young or old. I have become dependent on the light weight, the simple to use font and size of print settings. This one is so light weight,  The turning of pages so much simpler, not that it was so hard on the previous one. Nothing to dislike, everything to love.",Love my kindles;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I can't say enough good things about this.  I have dropped mine several times, my kids borrow it and abuse it and it works and looks like new.  I have owned several of the ""other"" brands and paid hundreds of dollars for the color tablet kinds at that other book store only to find they are heavy and unpleasant to read on.  I prefer reading on this to any other of the several I own.",I can't say enough good things about this;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"There isn't much new to say about a Kindle reader than it hasn't already been said. I can't recommend enough owing a Kindle, and try for yourself if it is for you. Some people say that they still prefer reading on paper books. It's hard to argue with them, but if you are not one of those persons, you will find the Kindle reader to be one of your best tech products.",One of my favourites tech products;;;;;;

Review: Love kindle 's these are Christmas gifts for our grandkids. Who love to read. They were big winners for this year's Christmas. I was very happy that Amazon adjusted my bill when they went on sale a few days after I had received them. Amazon's support are great.Thanks Amazon
Title;;;;;;: #1 Xmas gift for our grandkids this year!!;;;;;;

Review: I got this as a gift from my grandfather. So far I am in love with this. The only thing I wish it had was an option for a back light when reading at night. I can't read on the new style e readers so this works very well for me.
Title;;;;;;: So far I am in love with this;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This little digital reader is perfect for those of use who get eye strain and headaches after reading books on phones, tablets, or computers.  The size is perfect to hold in one hand during long reading sessions, and the font options are great.  I use a smaller font, but can enlarge it for books my children read.  Book downloads are quick and so simple, I'm  sure I could hand this little device off to my non-technical friends and family members without a glitch.  If you just want a straight forward ereader without bells and whistles, this kindle is for you.",perfect for an avid reader;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"Yes, I knew this was not ""lighted"" like the Paperwhite but I did not expect it to be so dark. Others have likened it to reading a paperback and having to do so in a lit room but I can guarantee that the pages of a paperback are much whiter and brighter than this old, yellow thing. I don't really understand why Kindle/Amazon have this item still available and haven't at least upgraded the background to a brighter image. I almost feel like I'm being punished for not wanting to spend twice as much for a light! It is apparent that the glare-free screen is necessary because the reader must be held up to bright light just to be readable! Not a fan....wondering how much it will cost me to return a product that probably shouldn't even be on the market!",Unlit reader with dim yellowed pages - why aren't the pages whiter? It is new-7th Gen-surely they can update the background?;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"The jury is still out for me on this one.  The touch screen is very touchy and often does things you don't want.  Also mine has been freezing up a lot-a problem I didn't have with my old kindle.  I don't know that I would purchase this again but since I did I will use it.  My older kindle was much more user friendly. Updating my review-the jury is in.  I still have this but use it very little.  I have huge problems finding my downloads and hate hate hate hate the blasted touch screen.  The set up of the older models was far better. you could find your books, and swiping the screen didn't send you into something you were into before you swiped it.  Mine is still freezing up. Will not buy another kindle until something is available other than this touch screen format.  If it worked well that would be one thing but it doesn't.",I hardly use this it is a poor product IMO.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Though I wish I had bought the Paperwhite so that I didn't need an external light source, I have nonetheless enjoyed having an e-reader. Travel will be so much easier now that I don't need to carry actual books with me. It seems to have all the features I would want in an e-reader and I have yet to need to charge it. I still don't understand why Amazon doesn't include the charger with any Kindle, but other than that, I'm satisfied.",I can't put it down!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I gave this to my favorite Aunt for Christmas. At 89 she reads her Bible daily from her Kindle now. She loves it and I am so glad to find yet another gift that she appreciates and can use. Keep this in mind for your elderly loved one, help them set it up and have them enjoy modern technology and the convenience of thousands of titles to chose from right from their easy chair.",The perfect gift for my 89 year old Aunt.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"As the owner of an original Kindle Model #1, I am very pleased with this product.Pro's:  It's fast.  Real fast.  It took me a few days to get use to how quick it was changing pages due to the V.1.Cons:  the touch screen can be very sensitive.  A twitch of your finger when turning pages may cause the device to change two pages instead of just one.  Not a huge deal, and not worth removing even a 1/4 of a star.I highly suggest this Kindle for anybody who wants an e-reader.",Fantastic Product;;;;;;

Review: I have multiple kindles....and I love them all!  I bought this specifically for outside reading.  And it delivers crisp script & no reflection or glare!! It perfect just like ready a paper book!  Easy to use....its just what the reading Dr. ordered!

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"We have been giving these to our kids as their reading improves. They love having so many books so accessible. Eventually we will have all 5 kiddos using their own, right now we only have 3 readers so we will still be repeat customers on the Kindle.",Great reading tool. Wonderful for kids;;;;;;

Review: I am so amazed at the clairity of this display and how easy it is to work.  The charger is not needed because my phone charger works with it just fine so I am glad I did not invest in the extra charger.It arrived in wonderful condition and in good time.
Title;;;;;;: I am so amazed at the clairity of this display and how easy ...;;;;;;

Review: I really like the size of the kindle.  The backlight is subtle and does not hurt the eyes.  I carry it around in my purse and can use it in quite a few areas. It is amazing how compact and convenient the KINDLE Touchscreen is.  DCB

I was lucky enough to get this new kindle 2014 edition when it was on sale for$49. I love this kindle even though it doesn't have a light built in. It's really lightweight. I think it's even more light than my cell phone (Samsung galaxy s5). I have no complaints about it. I am pleased with the touch screen technology. This is replacing my kindle keyboard which no longer keeps a charge in the battery.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Works great, so far so good. I like that it looks good underneath a lamp or lighting at night, and there really is no glare.  I was a bit skeptical at first, but it seems perfect. It's very similar to reading an actual printed book, which is what I wanted, so it's good.","It's good, and I like it...so there it is?";;;;;;

Review: Simple straight forward way to read. The only thing lacking is adjustable screen lighting. The kindle reminds me of a basic car from the '60's. It got you where you wanted to go and got 25 mpg. It didn't need a computer on the engine to tell you it wasn't running properly. Nor did you have to spend $800 for a slight bumper bump.
Title;;;;;;: No need for bells and whistles.;;;;;;

Review: I bought a Kindle so I could read several library books that I can only get as an ebook. I love this. The only bad thing is that it doesn't have a light so no nighttime reading before bed unless I keep the overhead light on.
Title;;;;;;: I love this. The only bad thing is that it ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have the very first Kindle and I'm going to keep it, but I did want something that had a touch screen.  For anyone who likes to read outside, this is what you want.  I have an iPad that I love but take it outside, or any where there is glare, and it is literally worthless.  This is also small and lightweight.  It's for readers like myself who go through a ton of books.  Again though, the biggest benefit is NO GLARE.  You can sit in full sun, and I live in Phoenix, and you can read just fine.  At night, I also use it in bed but you do need to have a light on, but personally I tried reading on devices that were backlit and they make me go bug eyed.  My eyes just get exhausted trying to read off iPads, or other devices that have the little TV screens.  This simple, basic, affordable Kindle is just right for those readers out there who just want to sit back and read and not get cramps in your hands because of the weight, or headaches because of the screen.  Hands down - best reader out there.",I have an iPad that I love but take it outside;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I like the size of it.  It has been very easy signing in and getting books, but I have not been able to get audio books to work.  I have tried connecting head phones, I have downloaded books to my computer and ipad and still can not get the audio portion to work.  Any advice would be greatly appreciated.",Need audio to work!;;;;;;

Review: Perfect.  But I do with Amazon would come out with a reader that combines the light up screen and the way this turns the pages.  Love being able to click on the side rather than having to swipe the page.  Bought this as a gift.  I already own one.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this to replace my 3g version that wore out from all my reading.  I like the compact size and it reads well in sunlight. The only thing I miss is buttons to move pages since it is not always convenient to swipe the screen.  Still, I enjoy this Kindle as much as any I own.",good reader;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is personally my fourth Kindle, but within my family we've had 8. I love this one because of its size...it's nice and small so I can pop it in my purse. I had the original kindle and used it until it broke. Then I got a Kindle Fire for Christmas. I loved the Fire...but I also have an iPad and an iPhone , so I got this one just for reading. It's a lot less bulky",Love it;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Purchased this for my daughter's use as I can get so many more free books for her to read via Kindle vs. her Nook, and can share my books to her device because she's only 12 so I keep it on my account.  She's a VORACIOUS reader!  Loving it so far - all the functionality she wants, and the versatility I was looking for!",Great device for simply reading;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this after reading a prep article. I have had it less than a month but have managed to shift all 120+ kindle reads (most of them free!).  I still have to move some others, but it's no where near full.  It works like a book (just like advertised). If you don't have light you don't read.  Battery is still going good though I read only 1/2 - 2 hours a day on it. Sure beats using my phone or tablet all the time.  For the $50 + 14.95 for the 110 v adapters still have less in than normally would cost. Since it runs off of the same voltage as my phone all my power storage setups work with it including my solar set up.  Sure can't complain so far.",best deal for my need (storage & reading of lots of how to books).;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"The screen is too small so unless you read at a child's pace be prepared to constantly flip pages. It doesn't have a backlight so can't be read in dim light available in other readers. I read when I go to sleep or on the plane - both occasions where I don't use lights. It doesn't support ePub, the most common format of eBooks floating in the virtual libraries. Pro: Good battery life and price!",Good battery life and price;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am happy with my Kindle now that I have a light and cover for it...I just find it hard to believe that once you made a Kindle with lighting and then (with out anyone to let me know of the the lights removal..I sent a replacement back because of NO LIGHT...but person in service didn't bother to inform me of that one small item and then I ordered a replcement and also had to start all over in calling to ask WHY I have no light . Finally It was explained to me.No light, need to buy a cover with light.  Sorry to complain, but I buy alot from Amazon and have NEVER wanted to complain..Please tell your service people to help their older customers like we are 5 yrs. old....At least me......Kathy Hulem",I am happy with my Kindle now that I have a light ...;;;;;;

Review: Great reader! These were gifted to my children (ages 10-11) and are quite user friendly. My two favorite features are the Kindle Free Time and the vocabulary builder. We home educate and these two features are a great way for me to keep an eye on their free time reading (time aside from assigned reading) and how their vocabulary is growing (if they are reading challenging enough books). Already an indispensable tool for our home school. Thank you Kindle for a wonderful product.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my second 6"" Kindle.  My husband recently had a stroke and is now having visual problems -- the font size feature on the Kindle allows him the ability to actually read again. Thank you so much.",Great Therapeutic Aid for Low Vision Readers;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,This is my 2nd Kindle.  The 1st I re-gifted when I received my iPad but then I found that I needed another one as I simply cannot read any of the tablets we own outside.  It's perfect size for my hand as well as for my purse or whatever bag / tote I am carrying.,"Yes, if you're a tablet owner you still need a Kindle!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a great reading device! After working all day on a computer I love to come home in the evening and read for a while, but reading from another back lit device at the end of a long day takes a toll on my eyes.  This Kindle eliminates that problem so that I like to read for longer periods of time now, just like reading a real book!",Great Reading Device!;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I am a senior citizen and I like the old keyboard Kindle better. This one is not good for people with shaky hands because of the touch screen. Also, I have trouble with this one locking up and have to reboot it which I hardly ever had that trouble with the old one.",Like The Old Version Better;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love books, I have always loved books. When the e-reader craze started I was horrified. I would never give up my precious bookswith their sound, their smell, their magic. But then I married a man who's job allowed him to travel. I realized touring my entire library across the country would be completely ridiculous, so I bought a kindle. I bought it solely for the sake of portability with the expectation of hating it for it's coldness, the coldness of technology. I was wrong. It reads wonderfully, the pages turn seamlessly. I forget sometimes while I'm reading that it isn't a book, it is the perfect size and weight and without a backlight it reads just like paper. There is no screen glare with the exception of a particular angle in direct sunlight which is easy enough to avoid. While I do believe I may just be falling in love with this little electronic device I am certainly not turning my back on ""real"" books, I bought one just the other day in fact. However if you are the type to carry a book with you this is by far a game changer, you can have as many books as you like all in one place.",happily surprised;;;;;;

Review: This is awesome! It's not one of the ones you can use for games which I liked. I use it all the time and rarely have to charge it because the battery life is AMAZING! I would recommend to anybody that wants one just for books.

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"I have had an old Kindle Touch for sometime now so a new one was I order. I like this one but have a few things I would change:-They took away the home screen button from the front of the device. I really miss that.-I wish I didn't have to jump through so many hoops to turn off WiFi. There used to be an option for this in the menu but now you have to go through several steps to put it in airplane mode. Just a small annoyance...-It feels cheap. My old one had a coating on the back that made it non-slip and the edges were rounded which made it more comfortable to hold. This one is just slippery plastic and I don't like the beveled edges. It's like they are making it so you have to buy a case for it.Two annoying things that are true of all Kindle devices and apps are true of this one:-There is no way to stop items automatically downloading to the devices/apps. I buy a lot of free books and don't necessarily want them all downloaded automatically. That makes for a lot of items to wade through!-I wish there was a way to delete multiple items at once so when the above unwanted download occurs, I can quickly delete what I don't want.Other than those things, this Kindle is faster and the battery is better. I hope they improve on the next one!Update 5/19/15 - I am also now realizing that none of my Kindle Active Content will work on this Kindle and apparently has not worked on any Kindle since the original Kindle Touch. That is frustrating! I really enjoyed my active content!",Eh...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"It is a usable device but requires extra lighting. The gray-scale background is very dark and unhelpful in certain lights. It is difficult to scroll through the books and find something particular because the true cover of the book isn't shown. You have to read all the titles on the page to find the one you want. The search function is fine if you remember the correct title or the author's name, but is confusing in the icons along the side of books. And relatively useless at guessing what you want if you omit one letter from a title. But it works, holds my books, allows downloads anywhere there is wifi.",The search function is fine if you remember the correct title or the author's ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a GREAT E-reader! I upgraded from the very first kindle... which still works perfectly, just wanted something a little easier to use instead of using the  buttons to choose everything. I do wish i would have gotten the backlit screen but my led light works perfect. I read constantly and before the kindle i had TONS of books everywhere, love that i can now keep them all at my fingertips in one small device. I also recently took this to Florida and read on the beach with no glare at all. Like i said the only drawback is that it doesn't have a lit screen, i feel like this should now just be a constant on all e-readers instead of having to pay extra for it.",This is a GREAT E-reader! I upgraded from the very first kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"love it!!! bought one for myself and two more for my family!!! i really love that it has no backlight, so i have to use it with light just like a book. it doesnt hurt my eyes that way!!!thanks kindle!",love it!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I was worried with this being a lower end device that it would be lacking in quality and features. It is not! As long as you're in light suitable for reading a paper book, you will have no issues reading the text on this Kindle. Load it up with books from a wifi connection, charge it, and you're literally set for weeks.Don't fret over saving the money and opting to receive 'Special Offers.' They're unobtrusive and you'll rarely notice them.",I was worried with this being a lower end device ...;;;;;;

Review: I love that I can take my entire library (hundreds of books) with me anywhere I go and it weighs less than a paperback book. The only thing I don't care for is the black and white when I am looking for a particular book cover. It is difficult for me to tell them apart but my eyes are a lot older these days.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I like this little reader so much I'm getting another one for my daughter. Now I don't do anything but read on this, but it downloads a book in about 7 seconds. I love that I can increase the font size. I also like the touch page turn. I have read some people don't like the way it feels. I have no problem with that. It's light and easy to hold or put on a pillow on my lap and read. I don't need  a light and find no reason to pay for a light.",I like this little reader so much I'm getting another one ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought this a while back, when it was Prime Day and it's honestly one of the best purchases I've made.It just so happens that I have a huge bookkeeping problem and have legitimately run out of space to store physical books so the day I bought this I switched to digital and that is no longer a problem.This kindle is exactly as advertised and I'm always so surprised that it lasts for weeks without needing to be charged. I knew that this one did not come in with a built-in light, so no complaints there. It's also light-weight and does not get uncomfortable to hold over an extended period of time.I've had no problems with it what-so-ever so far and it's a good reader to start with (my first one). I'm surprised I didn't think this was a good investment back when I was a Freshman in college, because it would've made my life so much easier (I use it now for textbooks, at least).If you don't need a built-in light or extra features not advertised, I'd definitely go for this one. It's held up pretty well.",when it was Prime Day and it's honestly one of the best purchases I've made;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I gave this 4 stars because sometimes, when I touch to turn the page, it will advance several pages, making me back track one page at a time to search for where I left off. Otherwise, I'm really enjoying it.UPDATING REVIEW - Change from 4 stars to 1. Received on May 15, 2015, used an hour or so per day, on July 6, 2015, the device froze up. The only thing I am able to read are the Ads Amazon so kindly provides. I have contacted Amazon and am informed that they cannot do an exchange, but that it is under warranty, whatever that means. I will update this review when I learn just what Amazon will do to back up their product.UPDATING REVIEW - The response to the above problem was swift and fixed. I was very pleased with the help and the device is now up and running. So I'm changing this back to 4 stars.",Quick Response to Frozen Kindle.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love the kindle touch screen. It is so easy to use and it is also very easy to download e-books from my public library as well as Amazon.  All down loaded through Wi-Fi.  My family owns three of these and because they are all linked to one account, we can share books off of the cloud.Going on a two week vacation, my wife and I used to take a suitcase full of books.  Now we just take 2 kindles.",A library in your hand;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I enjoyed this product for 13 months until the bottom half of the screen went black for no clear reason. Amazon wouldn't refund because I was passed the 1-year warranty mark (by just a few weeks!). I called and lobbied them for a replacement, or at least a discount on a replacement, and I got nothing. Bad product. Horrible customer service.",Bad product. Horrible customer service.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"With some trepidation last Christmas I gave this Kindle to my dad, who is 93. At first he had some trouble with it but now he absolutely loves it. Since it is on my account I get his books. I am able to get a lot of library books online for him. It's great! Some of his books are free. Of course I buy him some too. I believe his Kindle has added to the quality of his life. And I know what to get him this Christmas: an Amazon gift card.",It's great! Some of his books are free;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Its a great item for reading and it does well in the bright light. It doesn't have a back light, which the description explains to you. Its everything I need and the price was good. It was on a great sale on black Friday in July.",Its a great item for reading and it does well in the ...;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"Kindles have been a part of our lives since the first generation kindle reader.  My son and I are on our 6th kindle. Boy, was I a loyal fan. I'm a librarian and it changed the way we read books and lightened our load when we traveled. I probably sold hundreds to friends and family in those first five years just through my vocal enthusiasm for the device. I loved showing people how it worked. In addition, customer service would replace our broken kindles regularly for a small price and we could read and buy books weekly if not sometimes daily.  Fast forward ten years and I am so frustrated with kindles and Amazon.com. I quit Amazon Prime this year. I dislike the Kindle Touch reader because any slight touch to the screen gets me completely lost, (even my son, who never complains about anything, complains about this Kindle) and I detest the Kindle Fire because it stopped holding a charge after 12 months, so watching a movie is just a pain. I dislike reading books on the Fire;" the light bothers me. We've rented dozens of movies and lost at least half of them to that silly 24 hour expiration after you start. I'm sorry
Review: but I can't stay awake at night to watch a whole film. It sometimes takes awhile and I need that option. Don't get me started on customer service. What used to be wonderful is now awful and time consuming. Not worth the hassle.  I've become quite soured on the whole business model. Plus
Title;;;;;;: it doesn't help that the employees of Amazon work in harsh conditions with low pay. I've listened to a few programs on the radio and on television (I think one was 60 minutes) and the founder
column4: Jeff Bezos
column5: has come under some very harsh criticisms by book sellers
column6: publishers and other small businesses competitors as well. The reviews on him are not complimentary.  My two cents: think through your purchases
column7: estimate how much money you're going to spend in a year on Amazon products and if the Amazon Prime membership is worthwhile. Figure out how many hours of enjoyment you will get in return for that investment.  Is truly worth your money? I've thought it through
column8: and for me
column9: the answer is clearly no. I've been 8 months """"clean"""" now and I'm happy with my decision.  I've chosen to buy less and pay outright for each individual item I deem important enough to own or rent (and I still get consistently duped on those movie rentals!).  I don't mind waiting a few extra days for an item to ship either. It turns out I'm still frustrated
column10: but at least I have a few more hundred dollars to spend elsewhere now.""
column11: I wish for the good old days";;;;;

Review: This kindle is a huge improvement over my earlier version with all the buttons. It's nice having a touch screen and the font is easier to read. I would have liked to try the paper white model but got a REALLY good deal on this during Prime Day.

I received a kindle for Christmas and I absolutely love it. I am also an iPad owner but I prefer the kindle for reading as the electronic ink is much easier on my eyes. The back lighting is pretty decent and very useful for compensating for lower light conditions. I was concerned that it would kill the battery life quickly but it seems to be good. I only charge it about every two weeks.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This basic Kindle totally met all my expectations. I have a KindleFire which I love, but, when I'm reading on it, it's a tad heavy to hold for extended reading times. I wanted a Kindle that was light and was not backlit so that I can read it comfortably in bright daylight without having to turn the screen brightness to the max as I have to do with the KindleFire.",Totally met all my expectations;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Pros: Easy to read, dictionary words look up, translator, notes, 10$/mo for unlimited books(like 700k out 3 million), amazon prime 1 free book a month, battery life, priceCons: No audio capability anymore, still pretty slow, books are pretty expensive, the interface could be a lot better and easier to use though its pretty easy but annoying , no button for next page as an option, screen blinking whenever clicking a command.I'm on the fence on returning it because of cons, though price is reasonable.",Pros with clear Cons;;;;;;

Review: I have an older Kindler e-reader that wasn't syncing so needed to upgrade. I'd had it for about 5+ years.  The new e-reader is easy to use.  I LOVE the non-glare feature.  I hate having to move my tablet as I read to eliminate the glare whether I'm inside or outside.  If you're an avid reader this feature is for you.  I was hesitate to go from a 3G to Wi-Fi but it hasn't been a problem.  Lots of free Wi-Fi areas.  The size and weight are nice.  It fits easily in my handbag.  I don't get tired of holding it as I read.

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"I was a firm supporter of Kindle, but after this one broke down out of the blue and Amazon did not offer any type of discount to replace it (my warranty expired), I was deeply disappointed in both Kindle and Amazon. I will not be purchasing a Kindle after this, and will certainly note recommend this device to anyone.","Bad quality, awful service";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love it!  I like it way better than I assumed I would. There was a great sale around Christmas, so I took a chance. I read more and buy more books than I used to. If I'm running errands, I pop it in my purse and read if I have to wait in a long line. Love it. I've also used it to store & read PDF files.",Love it! I like it way better than I ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Pretty nice once you get used to it. I sort of wish there was some way I could fit it in to my shirt pocket to take with me, for when I'm waiting for appointments. I'm sure I can fit it into a larger pocket, but I'm afraid of it getting damaged. I know they offer covers for it, but I'm not sure if that would help, or not.",Nice.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I received this for my birthday and I love it!! I had no intention of getting a kindle as I have long standing arthritis and didn't want to deal with any buttons. When I happened to come across how it was going to be updated to touchscreen, I knew I had to have it.I read everyday;" and still read actual books. However
Review: for authors like Phillippa Gregory whose books are enourmous the Kindle has been great. It is as light as they say. I work for the local library and read so much and now I can get downloads from two different libraries and using amazon for lending is very easy
Title;;;;;;: especially if you register your kindle under your amazon account. Then you can manage however you like
column4: all the books.Thanks Amazon for another great invention.""
column5: For Everyone";;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first Kindle. As a busy college student, I bought this item for leisure reading in my free time. I love its compact size and that I can download books very quickly and easily. I read from it between classes and on my commute to school.  I like the fact that it is easy on the eyes and relatively easy to navigate. I love the dictionary! I would not otherwise take the time to look up words I don't know. The fact that there is no backlight is no problem at all. If there is enough light in the room to read a book, then you read from the kindle. Actually, I think the kindle might be easier to read in low light than some books due to its bright background. The lack of back-light will be a deal breaker if you like to read in the dark. The special offers are not intrusive to me and occasionally some of them spark my interest. Overall, I like it. It is great for what I use it for. I would definitely make this purchase again.Nit Picks:1. I hate when dust gets on the screen, it makes it appear like pieces of the letters did not materialize. I got the amazon case to go with it and dust particles still get on the screen. Not a big deal though. Debris have a much more negative impact on e-ink screens.2. I wish there were instructions on all of the features on the kindle. There was a short tutorial upon set up, but I run across other features that I would like to know function of.3.  Because people can self-publish via amazon, there are a lot a crappy books out there for cheap/free, but don't be discouraged there are good ones too.4. I wish the transitions between tasks was smoother. It would be a much nice experience. I definitely would not use this to browse the web.",It is great for what I use it for;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"At first I found this Kindle different enough from my earlier ones that I did not like it!  But Imdecided to give it another try, and I am finding that I do love it.  I like the touchscreen very much, as well as the fact that it turns off automatically when I close the cover....Be sure to purchase a cover!!!  The cost of the Kindle is so reasonable...I find that I save it within the first 7 or 8 months after purchase!","The Kindle is one of the great inventions,,!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had an earlier model that was not touch screen. The new version has more space and touch screen navigation. I really like the size of my Kindle. It does fit into a pocket and is easy to hold and operate with one hand. The glare free screen is easy on the eyes and more like reading a paper book. I really like that the font size and style can be changed to what suits me and anyone's preference. If your eyesight is not what it was you can adjust the Kindle to a more suited size.  I  like that I can store hundreds of books on the device, so I can read several books without the cumbersome task of carrying multiple books. I also like the built in dictionary that enables you to look up a word within the book you are reading. The price for the device is great. Amazon makes this affordable for anyone. The many days battery life is also a great feature. This device has really made reading so much more enjoyable. If you like to read or need to read you should get a Kindle.","The most affordable, ultimate reading experince.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"After years of using the Kindle software on my 7"" tablet with no problem, I recently began to develop eyestrain after reading for long periods of time. That doesn't happen with the Kindle's glare-free, e-ink screen, even if I use it with a small book light for reading in bed. The display is actually much sharper than I had expected for a non-back-lit screen. Another unexpected benefit of the Kindle over my tablet is that it is so lightweight. It's easy to hold in one hand, and the touch screen makes it easy to turn pages while doing so. I absolutely love my new Kindle!",Great Product!;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"This Kindle functions and lets me read e-books.  That's the positive.  The negative is that I used it a lot this past weekend and the battery was draining very quickly.  I really don't trust the stated battery life on it.  I did have the WiFi on but still one weekend shouldn't kill a device that can go for ""weeks on a single charge"".I've owned a Kindle Touch (loved it but lost it), a Kindle Paperwhite (gen 2) but had to stop using it before bed because it interfered with my sleep so I went to this one.  By comparison, this one is larger but lighter.  It feels somewhat hollow in comparison to the PW2.  The PW2 also had a better feeling back on it.  One would think if they made a bigger Kindle with less in it, that the battery would be better.At the end of the day, yes you'll be able to use this as an e-reader.  Is it all that's promised, probably not.  Could it be made better (to be more on par with its predecessors), yes.  It is however cheaper than the predecessors so that explains a lot too.  For me, I'll probably use it just for traveling where books are more cumbersome or for when I'm reading fiction.  For more important items, I'll no doubt continue using physical books.In other words, I expected to love this device like my previous two, but I don't.  I'll wait to critique the case for it separately.  That's absolutely overpriced and under engineered!",Not the biggest fan of this version of Kindle.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've got two of these devices for Christmas presents. So far they are working fine, I have not used them to much yet. I have had a kindle device before 5th generation, still working like a champ. I hope my mother and brother are going to love them as much as I love my old kindle.",Nice device;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"LOVING MY KINDLE!!!!! Decided to ""try"" a Kindle with the big Amazon sale a couple of weeks ago and see if I liked it...I just carry my little dude everywhere and can read anywhere I want!!!! I LOVE LOVE LOVE it!!!! I'm an ER RN and now just relax and read on my lunch break and am enjoying it!!!",LOVE IT!!!!!!!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love it: more portable and versatile than original Kindle, a tough little piece of hardware that goes anywhere. Amazon does it again by offering, for free, all e-books from my previous version's library. If you don't love Amazon, you don't love America! :)",Love it: more portable and versatile than original Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I really like my new Kindle.  I like reading from it better than the traditional book.  It is lightweight, the font is crisp, and I like the way the software works too.  Not only that, I feel I got a steal of a deal.",New Kindle rocks;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I really like it so far. The touch screen is responsive and I love being able to access my kindle library and amazon to buy new books directly from the device. it syncs perfectly with the Kindle app on my iPhone and iPad. Battery life is good so far, and the ""Special Offers' on the display are not distracting or annoying at all, so it's worth it to save $20! It is so lightweight! I also have a first generation Nook and this is a nice change - it's easier to download books through my library and the syncing between devices is much better.",I really like it so far;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Perfect- nothing wrong with it, but I am one of THOSE who had the old Paperwhite, and I like touching the side button to advance the pages.  When I swipe to change pages with this version, sometimes it does not advance, causing me to swipe twice. Just a little annoying.",Reliable with good content.;;;;;;
5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am glad that I purchased this item.  I purchaed 3 books just after unpacking device for use.  If you are on the fence about ordering;" just go ahead and do it
Review: you will not be sorry.  The product description is very very accurate in describing what the product is and how it performs.  Definitely a good buy !!""
Title;;;;;;: Good Solid Purchase.  Will pay for itself !!";;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Love the lightness and small size.  Screen doesn't turn kittywonkas when not straight, a real plus.  Easy to read, easy to turn pages forward and back, just by a tap on either side of the screen.  Basically, this has replaced my Kindle Fire for READING purposes.  It was easy to transfer my e-books from the Kindle Fire to this.",Great Little E-Reader;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I had been reading books on my old Kindle Fire (1st generation). It was alright, but my eyes got tired quickly and I was finding myself distracted doing other things with the tablet. Also, the Fire is a bit bulky and needs constant recharges. I wanted something distraction free, and easy on my eyes. This Kindle (7th Generation) is perfect for me. The e-ink display is gloriously clean and crisp. The touchscreen is snappy and responsive. I have to give my old Fire credit for getting me back into reading, but I can tell that this new Kindle is going to to keep me reading far into the future. ***My only qualm isn't with the device itself, but with the bait and switch on shipping I received when ordering it. When I made the purchase I was promised delivery on a Saturday if I ordered within the next hour and a half. I placed the order, but when I got the confirmation email they changed the guaranteed delivery date to the following Monday. I don't appreciate the bait and switch. The package could have been stolen while I was at work. The reason I ordered 1 day shipping was so that I got it on the weekend when I was home.***",Great Product Bait and Switch Shipping;;;;;;

Review: Very easy to use and no problem with charging the battery- Would recommend for anyone with difficulty holding larger ereaders-larger size Kindle is preferred but this is easy to carry in your pocket or purse
Title;;;;;;: Very easy to use and no problem with charging the battery- ...;;;;;;

Rating: 2.0 out of 5 stars,"This is the third kindle I have owned. Although the size and weight have been reduced from the first original kindle, this kindle is actually more difficult to handle. The touchscreen is very sensitive. Every time I accidentally touch the screen, the font changes or notes are highlighted or the page accidentally turns. And because the area around the screen is smaller, it is harder to hold unless you DO touch the screen, which causes font changes, etc.  The kindle was a great little reading device. Now that it is trying to mimic  Apple products, it has lost its charm.",Not a fan;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I AM ENJOYING MY NEW KINDLE VERY MUCH.  I APPRECIAED THE ABILITY TO DOWNLOAD, EASILY, BOOKS THAT I HAD PURCHASED EARLIER.  THE TOUCH SCREEN IS VERY CONVENIENT AND I LOVE THEEASE WITH WHICH I CAN ADJUST THE FONT SIZE, I HAVE VISION PROBLEMS AND MOVING TO A LARGER PRINT WHEN NECESSARY IS MOST HELPFUL.","EASILY, BOOKS THAT I HAD PURCHASED EARLIER";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought this to replace my Nook which died.  Very happy with this model - quick page turns, the light gray screen is easy on the eyes, and the battery last a long time before recharging.  I had tried the Kindle Paperwhite last year, but the white screen a little bright for my eyes and wasn't happy with battery draining quickly, so I gave it to a friend.  This one is perfect for my needs.  Love it.",Very happy with this model - quick page turns;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Nice reader. Works well and keeps a charge a long time. Tip on the screen though;" if you hold the power button in for a few seconds a dialogue appears so you can shut off the screen so it doesn't display the """"ads"""" for other books or content you paid $20 less for.  Also my cats seem to be in a pool to see how many times they can knock it off whatever table its on and it still works fine
Review: though I got the 3 Year guarantee if I break it.  Recommend it if you just love reading like I do with no frills.""
column4: seems tough!!""";;;;;

Review: I got these for my daughter ages 11 and 9 because I loved my kindle so much and we were spending so much more on book orders through their school. They love them and they are easy for young kids to maneuver
Title;;;;;;: ... for my daughter ages 11 and 9 because I loved my kindle so much and we were spending so ...;;;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a very bad product. Every time I start reading it, a notice pops up telling me I have no wifi connection even though the signal shows strongly on the kindle. I can't even get into it anymore to read anything. I am going to return it.",Really Bad;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Obviously the kindle is great, with good functionality!! However I must admit I was disappointed to find that the kindle does not work with 5ghz WiFi, so if you have that in your home or office it may be difficult for you to instantly download and sync books.",Just didn't work with 5ghz wifi;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This was a totally unexpected Christmas gift and I love it! The battery holds up for a really long time and I love the glare-free screen--much easier on the eyes, although I will be ordering a clip on light for those late night reading sessions in bed. I'm still trying to figure out all the ins and outs of using it, but that's part of the fun of a new toy, isn't it?",Awesome gift!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have resisted an e-reader for a very long time because I have always said that I am a BOOK reader and want to hold a book in my hands... Well for several reasons I decided to give it a whirl and figured I would go with the no frills version since it was less expensive and if I didn't like it I could pass it along to someone else with not much guilt.I love it.  Several commenters have mentioned that it doesn't have a light and that is true, so I read in bed with a lamp just like I would with a book (!) and it has not been a problem!  My local library has tons of ebooks and with one click they are delivered to my kindle!I still love the feel of a real book and have not given them up, but I also really love the kindle and I wish I had not waited so long to get one!",Love it;;;;;;

Review: I bought this as a gift for my daughter who is in her 20's and I think it may be on the top ten best gifts ever because she calls me almost every day to tell me how much she loves it. She then proceeds to tell me what she is reading. We talk all the time now about what books are on our Kindle's and we are loving it!
Title;;;;;;: ... I think it may be on the top ten best gifts ever because she calls me almost every day ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I own the first Kindle model made, and when it died, I was forced to buy a new one. I am still getting used to the newer features, but I do like it. My only complaint is the process of switching my old Kindle to the new one. I found that all of my husband's books are now on my device, and I really don't want them. I, alone, have over 650 books on mine, and have no need for his. Overall, once I am more familiar with the features, I am sure to continue to love the new as much as I did the old.",Good quality;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Case material hard to hold due to ""slippery"" nature.  Very smooth to get a good grip without concentrating.  Kindle is new but works fine.  Purchased a case and makes usage more fun as the case has a textured feel to grip.",Very smooth to get a good grip without concentrating;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"It is great  to use and the Magnifier makes it great to read even when I don't have my glasses.  The only downside Is it doesn't have a built-in backlight for night reading.  Which I purchased a separate clip-on light, so as to not have to use a table lamp and bother anyone else in the room.",It is great to use and the Magnifier makes it great to ...;;;;;;

Review: Used this while we were traveling.  It was easier to read in the sunlight than my Kindle Fire.  I like that I can go back and forth between the Fire and this one and they both keep track of the last page read.
Title;;;;;;: I like that I can go back and forth between the ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I previously have had 2 Kindles (generations with keyboards) and have been very surprised by how much I like the touch screen. I thought this would decrease the battery time or make reading harder. Instead, it has been wonderful, and I'm happy to have the smaller and lighter Kindle. I just went on vacation for 2 weeks and read about 5 books (including going on WiFi a couple times). The battery is still going strong.",Love it! High quality product as always;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"After two years of dropping hints, Hubby got this for me last Christmas.I love this thing. I have several books, but mostly I keep my knitting patterns on PDFs. It is so handy and great to use. No more paper patterns dropping on the floor or fluttering off. It's all tight there. It's a knitter's dream when it comes to pattern organization.The only con is that it's not back lit for bedtime reading. However, that doesn't really bother me all that much.Total, total love this thing.","Good for Books, Great for Knitting Patterns.";;;;;;

Review: I love my Kindle. It's so much easier than reading a paperback or hard cover book. Don't get me wrong... I love to have an actual book but in reality I really want something that is easier to carry with me everywhere I go and also I'd like to not have so much clutter. I bought 2. One for myself and one for the boyfriend. We both carry them everywhere we go. He is able to fit his in the pocket of his jeans and that is with a case on. I am easily able to fit it in my purse.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I got this kindle for points earned on a rewards program. If I had bought a kindle outright I would have been inclined to purchase one of the upgrade versions. On reflection, I am happy I didn't spend the extra money. This basic kindle (version 7) serves my uses to a T. This is my first venture into the e-reader world, and I've only had the unit a little over a week, but it is a perfect fit for me. I use it for reading while traveling, in the doctor's office or other occasions away from home when I have time to fill. Don't really need the extra stuff like a built in light and such. Just want to be able to read on the go without having to carry around a bulky book. This kindle is perfect for me. The battery is as advertised--still well over half of the original charge after a week of use.",I am happy I didn't spend the extra money;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first Kindle purchase, although I have previously used a Nook. I love the paper-white screen, it makes a huge difference when reading, especially when using a night light. No more annoying glares and battery life for a life time. I highly recommend this if you're looking for something affordable and reliable.",Great alternative for transitional readers!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love this Kindle. I bought to replace my generation 2 or 3 kindle which still works 6 years later, but doesn't hold a charge for very long. I love the touch screen. Of course, downloading is easy, plenty of selections, and the screen is awesome in daylight!! I can't wait to take this on vacation to the beach and be able to read all day. This is smaller than my old one and even easier to carry everywhere I go. Love it!!",Can't go wrong with a Kindle!!;;;;;;

Review: As with all Amazon products this meets all expectations.  It even fits my old Kindle case.  It is easy to use and the New features include telling you who a character in the story is with just one touch.  No bells and whistles just an easy reader.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Kindle me this.  What?  Just trying to be funny.  A bit of humor, writing out yet again another review.  I have 4 Kindles so yes, it works great.  Kindle is the way to go.  I hope someday they will allow folders on them so you can have one folder for each subject matter and maybe even subjected.  Why not?",You can Kindle this;;;;;;

Review: Great product. I had the original kindle with keyboard but thought I would try the new paper white. I started with the voyager because it had the side button option for page turning. I sent it back the first day. Not worth the extra money for the button page turners. Plus they felt awkward. I am not sure why the page turning buttons were discontinued in the first place but oh well. I then tried the newest paper white. It was nice but I noticed little ink smudges on the bottom of the screen. Not overwhelming but enough to annoy me. I thought it may be defective so I returned it and ordered another. Same thing. I returned it.I then ordered this product. It's beautiful. The touch screen page turn isn't as bad as I assumed. Plus the touch a word and the dictionary comes up. It's sweet. The main reason I wanted a new kindle is that the original one I had you couldn't adjust font size or type. It was getting harder for me to read. This new one you can. I can see great without adjusting font size due to a darker option of font print. Very happy with this product so far. Would def recommend. The price is great also compared to the new models. If they would fix the ink smudge problem I would go for the paper white model. But not until then.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This was my first Amazon Kindle and it was wonderful! I didn't need light behind it. If I start reading in the dark then jut turn on a lamp. I'm still learning about all the instructions, but it's great to read especially when you got to many books on a shelf or when a book is very heavy to carry around.",Excellent!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first Kindle. I love it! I read the product specifications before purchase which clearly noted that it did not have a lighted screen. I'm very happy with that, as I don't want to read in the dark anyway. I like all of the features that I've used so far. I would like to turn off the dictionary. There very well might be a way to do that and I just haven't figured it out yet. It's pretty light weight, and with the case (purchased separately), it's easy to take wherever I want. I love touching the screen to turn pages. Love the easy interface. The one thing that I wish it did is to recognize if I'm viewing it landscape or portrait without me having to change it in the settings. I have no need for all of the kid/parent features, so I don't care.","Nice looking, easy to use, definitely recommend it";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Overall, I like the Kindle a lot. There are a couple of things that bug me, though, that keep me from giving it 5 stars.First of all, it's slippery - I'm not sure if they did that on our purpose so you would have to buy a cover, but it can slip out of your hands pretty easily.Secondly,  the touch screen can be kind of a pain in the backside. If you move the Kindle (like stand up and walk around with it) and you haven't turned it off, you're likely to move through pages unwittingly. Even just reading, if you adjust your hand, or your fingers slip, you turn pages. More of an inconvenience than a flaw, but I REALLY liked the buttons on the side for page turning.","A couple of irritating things, but overall, good";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm not a reader at all. I've always wanted to, but I've never set as one of my priorities. I always loved technology, so I thought that it would be perfect to start reading on an e-book. And it works! At least until now (I'll update you all later).I'm not giving 5 stars though because it doesn't come with a wall charger. I know that everybody should already have one at home, but the one recommended from Amazon costs 20$! I would rather pay extra money to come with one than open the kindle box and didn't find one! I felt the same when I bought an expensive glasses that didn't come with case! I think that this is ridiculous because it doesn't cost a lot to them to produce it, and they still want to make more money from us. I know that this is how business works nowadays, but if you want full satisfaction from your customer, you should know that this is necessary. Include it on the price. I am wondering if I will buy a phone in the future without a wall charger as well.I already saw a lot of good reviews about the product itself, so I won't talk about it.","Good product, but what about the wall charger?";;;;;;
5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love this kindle because it is basic. I have a hard time with back lit screens so this was my first choice. I don;"t use it as a tablet
Review: just for reading. I went from the non-touch screen version to this one with ease.""

This is my second Kindle and I love it. It is a great way to read books. Now I don't have hundreds of paperbacks accumulating all the time. And I don't have to go to the bookstore when I need a new book!
