Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Very accessible and easily understood controls. I have next to no patience for learning the fine points of device use (for instance, no patience with my i-phone), but this was easy to use, easy to read, and downloading content into it was also super-easy thanks to it being pre-loaded with my account information. Easy, works well, hence the five star review.",Very accessible and easily understood controls;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Prior to purchasing the Kindle I was adamantly against the idea of reading a book on an electronic device.  Mainly because things like my phones and tablet had a glare to the screen and the phone was too small and the tablet was to big and bulky.  This kindle is like the Goldilocks it's just the right size, almost the same as a paperback book, and there is no screen glare.",Mainly because things like my phones and tablet had a glare to the ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"It's awesome!  I wanted something I could read in the car, so I didn't get a Kindle Fire.  It is a little hard to read the book covers on the home page unless I actually click on the book. Other than that, there is really no problem at all.  If I am ever able to get another, I will move up the the Paperwhite.",Great and trouble free.  No glitches whatsoever.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Great little device. I had a 1st generation Kindle almost 10 years ago, and this version so much improved. Much more compact, with a sleek touchscreen and is very portable.  Perfect for my needs and great for travel.",Great little device;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Its abit smaller than I thought however, I like that it is compact enough to fit into any of my handbags without being too clumpy. I should have taken the advice of other reviews and gotten the upgraded version with a lighted screen. This was my first time ordering a device of this type. I am happy with everything else. Easy to use, downloads pretty fast and the text is the prefect size for me.",I like that it is compact enough to fit into any ...;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I don't like the touchscreen.  Every accidental bump or touch sends it off to who-knows-where.  Then good luck trying to find your way back.The on/off button protrudes out the bottom.  As a result, any attempt to read with the device propped up results in it turning itself off.  I would be happy to flip it 180 degrees, so the button would point up, but there is no such option available.  I sure miss my old button operated Kindle which was so much more user friendly.  I mislaid it somewhere and keep hoping it will turn up one day and allow me to toss this one in the back of a drawer and forget all about it.Bottom line: it serves its purpose, but its predecessor was a five star device.",A shadow of its former self.;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I preferred the one with buttons.  My hands are large and it's nearly impossible to hold this without bumping the touch screen which, while useful, doesn't really matter for a cheap e-reader.  Bring back a basic version with buttons, Amazon!","while useful, doesn't really matter for a cheap e-reader";;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"There's nothing wrong with it. It works fine. I just prefer the buttons to turn the pages instead of touching the screen. And I knew when I was getting when I ordered it. I find that I am more likely to accidentally turn the page.  I don't think it's very user-friendly. It's hard to find what you're trying to get to. I set it up for a 12-year-old with the Kindle FreeTime.  It's kind of a pain. I thought I would be getting emails alerting me to how much she's read and how much progress he's making but I don't. The overall shape of it I think I prefer the original Kindle. This one is thicker and the edges don't slope to near nothing like the original did.  I think I have normal size hands, but it feels too small to comfortably hold and be able to see the whole screen.  I liked on the original one that you could touch the button on either side of the screen to turn forward or back depending on which hand you were holding it with. This one forces you to use you're right hand to turn the page if you're holding it with your left hand.I wish I hadn't gotten the special offers thing to save money. Because now my 12-year-old is seeing advertisements for things not meant for a 12-year-old. They're not inappropriate, they just aren't kid friendly.  I like the images of classic authors like they have without the special offers.","It does what it says, but";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,This is my third Kindle.  I bought this one when it was on sale for $59 and did NOT buy a case for it.  I keep it tucked into my purse and can take it out and read if I'm in line somewhere.  I also own the Kindle Fire (which I keep at home and bought a case for and watch streaming videos on).,"Great, inexpensive e-reader";;;;;;
5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have owned two e-ink Kindles (the keyboard models), and several Fire tablets;" even an iPad. This is definitely the best experience for READING that I've had. I love the size
Review: weight
column4: and utility. I picked it up on Prime Day for under $50 - what a steal!""
column5: one-Handy device!";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Light weight and the right size for holding at just the right angle for comfort while reading makes Kindle 6"" an excellent reader. The screen is easy on the eyes and the no glare screen makes it easy to read by the pool.  This is my second Kindle.  I also have a Kindle Fire.",Just Right;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I chose to give the Kindle a try rather than build another book case.  We have a lot of classics and Newbery Award books on our shelves and use the Library extensively.  My hope is to transition many of those books to the Kindle over time and use my current book cases for more reference type books.I like its easy on the eyes display as I spend most of my work days staring into a monitor as well as the dictionary and X-ray functions.  We do a lot of reading as a family and I am often asked what a particular word means.  The X-Ray function helps show the kids particular threads amongst characters and within the plot so I am looking forward to using that in particular.The one issue I have with the product thus far is the cumbersome approach to managing ""FreeTime"".  I have only had the product for a week, but so far the only way I know to add books to each of my children's profiles is through the Amazon ""Manage My Device"" web page.  It would be nice if I could manage this on the Kindle itself.",Good but FreeTime Management is lacking;;;;;;

Review: I've been holding out and reading paperbacks. I finally pulled the trigger and picked this up. I love the look of the screen - looks just like the real thing but its also easy to hold. You can also just place it on a surface and read without holding it.
Title;;;;;;: I love the look of the screen - looks just like ...;;;;;;

Review: My daughter loves it. She won it for her swim-a-thon and thinks its the neatest thing ever. Reading has always been a bit of a challenge getting her to actually read but she's more excited to read on her Kindle now!

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Amazon now has Kindles at three price points, and this basic model without the self-illuminated display is the perfect beginning point for someone new to e-readers and who might be uncertain about how much they will use the device compared to traditional books.The display is suitable for normal lighting conditions but not dim light, so if intending to use it for reading in bed and without a light by the side of the bed for illumination, for example, either the Paperwhite or Voyage might be a better choice.The strengths of this model, in addition to the low price, are the terrific battery life and the great amount of storage available. Since there is no demand on the battery to power lighting of the display, the normal time span between needed charges is the greatest of any of the Kindle e-readers. The storage is the same as all of the three models, 4 GB which is a tremendous amount of space, sufficient for thousands of books.At $79 this can almost be an impulse purchase for many people, and if the user later finds that an illuminated display is desired, it can be a nice hand-me-down to someone, or kept as a backup device.I have both the Paperwhite (first generation) and Voyage models myself. Noticing that many of the most recent reviews for this entry model are facile and useless, I thought that a more informed point of view was needed. This is an excellent product, and Amazon backs it up with superior customer service. I can confidently recommend it to anyone who wants to check out what it's like to own a Kindle, who doesn't want to commit too much money right away.",The best entry-point e-reader for exploring the Kindle ecosystem;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have used this Kindle now for a couple of weeks and I enjoy it very much.  It is easy to navigate, the instructions are clear and the screen is very easy to read.  I increased the font size as my eye's aren't what they once were and I have no problems with it.  Since I don't anticipate reading in the dark, the lack of the back lighted screen doesn't bother me at all.  The touchscreen without the buttons is very nice.  I used to search for the navigation buttons on the older version my wife has but I can navigate with a single finger on this one.  I have recommended it to my wife and anticipate that she will upgrade soon.",Very easy to use.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Second one I have, both are highly useable. It is lighter than a book and much easier to read on that a tablet. Additionally the secletion fo books for the kindle is outstanding and usually reasonably priced. .",I love it.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I am now addicted to reading again.  The  best part is I don't have to cart a big book along, I can just stick the Kindle in my purse and go.  Very light weigh as well.  My only suggestion is to buy the light for it sold separately, and the charger and case. But you so need that light.",Back to obsessive  reading and I love it.  Bests the TV any time...;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Can't beat the price. Easy to read in bright sun.  Super lightweight and small.No back light so no reading in bed.  I knew this going in but was more of an issue than I expected.Buy this for the beach, that's about all its good for.",beach buddy;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Am more impressed with it the more I learn to use it. It would be nice to have a light for those darker places that I read, but I knew it didn't before I purchased it. It is much more convenient than I expected. I am still learning how to access, download, etc but am very happy with the purchase.",Impressed;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love it. I've been using a kindle app on my phone for ages, but wanted to get a real kindle for serious reading. The kindle screen is so much easier on my eyes than my backlit phone. It's easy to use and books download quickly. The goodreads integration is awesome because it makes it easy for me to track what I've read and rate finished books.",Love it;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"All I can say is awesome.  My daughter bought me the keyboard Kindle years ago and I dearly loved it.  But, I am happy that it died on me.  I just wanted a Kindle for readingno games and other junk.  All my books came over to my new Kindle.  My books no longer sit in the Archive, they are now in the Cloud. Like going from grandma's Kindle to grandchild's Kindle. :-) Of course, the glare free touch screen is awesome.  Love just touching a word to get the definition from the dictionary or more from Wikipedia.  Very easy to learn how to move around and access everything on your Kindle.  The only thing my Kindle is missing is the new book smell.",AWESOME!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought 3 of these for my girlfriend, my mother, and my grandmother. It's the most convenient way to read all of your books in one place and it doesn't hurt your eyes like reading on a tablet/iPad for hours does.",Great way to read.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"The Kindle (7th generation) is a basic eReader.  It is easy to operate.  Doesn't have a lot of bells and whistles that only add to the cost.  If you are looking for a low cost machine, this is the one to get.",It is easy to operate;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I like my kindle and naturally you get what you pay for and I did not want to pay too much for a kindle. However, the only thing i don't like is that this kindle has no light in the dark, thus I""d need to have my light on in order to read. Othat then that it's fine & light, comfortable to bring it with you when you travel.",I like my kindle and naturally you get what you pay ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love this version, really small so it  fits in  my purse, which is not a huge bag, does not cost a fortune so if I have to replace it I do not feel horrible, and I am able to read it in the sunlight, unlike my phone screen.","Great version...use it all the time, everywhere!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am so glad that this has been updated to a touch screen format because the first editions were not user-friendly at all.We purchased 2 of the new editions for our daughters as a Christmas gift. They used the first editions when they were younger and we ended up shelving them due to constantly having to assist with navigation. We haven't had to do anything to help them (ages 9 and 11) with the exception of setting up the accounts on the new editions.If your goal is to simply read, and do light browsing on Al Gore's Internet, these are perfect. Even my 74 year old grandmother, who has trouble with her DirecTV remote was able to use this, bless her heart. I am very pleased with the new Kindle e-Reader!",Touch Screen For the Win!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"love it! The screen is clear and crisp even though its not 300ppi. I don't care about having an internal light because I treat my kindle like a book and don't read in bed. In fact, I did not buy a paperwhite because I don't want a light that can't be turned off. Also, the kindle is lighter than the paperwhite and weight is a factor for me. I really appreciated that it has a wonderful touch screen and no buttons. I did not consider the voyage because of its price and other features such as the buttons and light which I don't care about. My only general complaint is that its really difficult to port my epub stuff over from my nook if it has DRM on it, and I believe many amazon books do too. I would love to buy a book and be able to have it on any device I own. What a novel concept ;")""
Review: love it!";;;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"Liked my other kindle a lot better. Find it hard to tap the screen to turn the page. It doesn't always work. Sadly, they don't make the one I loved anymore.",Liked my other kindle a lot better;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"The price was good and the kindle works as it it designed to, but I am so used to working with a smart phone or a computer that I miss some of the features I find in those electronic items. Still, it is easy to read on the Kindle and the device is mostly user-friendly.",Good for reading;;;;;;

Review: I wanted a basic Kindle and this worked out perfectly. I used to read my books on a full tablet but the glare was always a problem. This model is bare bones but is perfect for reading on public transit. The compact size is just right to carry around when traveling. I am enjoying it very much.
I love how easy it is to read on.I don't like the set up/home screen as much and find it a little difficult to use.The books download super fast. It is light-weight. Battery seems to last a while.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Very impressed with not only how this little gem looks and operates, but also with how easy it is to transfer books and documents to it.  That said, it does not handle PDF documnents very well as the text is very small and cannot be enlarged.  But.....This IS desinged to read books and it serves that purpose extremely well.",Great Reader;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Absolutely amazed. Now I can take a dictionary, books, magazines, and newspaper publications backpacking with my dog and I. I just open it up and I'm immediately at the location where I left off reading. I'm getting more reading in than ever without toting a book bag around. This will be the next wave in education.",Kindle is cool. Way cool!;;;;;;

Review: I got this for a gift for my younger brother as he loves to read. I loves the light weight and the fact that he doesn't have to deal with too many books anymore. He was also able to use this Kindle for some of his classes so that was definitely a plus for him.
Title;;;;;;: I got this for a gift for my younger brother ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"getting yourself a kindle is a one way ticket, you would really reconsider to read a book again..It doesn't tire your eyes, the backlight's awesome in busses, you dont need a page marker...Really, really worth it",one way ticket;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"You can read the reviews on the Kindle yourself. I just want to point out something that was a bit of a revelation to me. I had always figured that since I had numerous phones and tablets which utilized the Amazon Kindle app, I would never want a Kindle. I decided to pick one up during a great sale just to see what they were like. Since buying the Kindle, I find that I read books much more often than before I had the Kindle. You won't be distracted with Facebook or any of those other things that seem to distract you with constant notifications on the Kindle. It's just you and the book.Apart from all that, the Kindle is great. It's easy to use and the battery life is insane. It literally lasts for weeks at a time. If you've been on the fence about buying one, just do it. You will not regret it.",I thought I didn't need an actual Kindle because I had the app ... I was wrong;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first Kindle and it is a neat little reader if all you want to do is read e-books which is what I bought it for.  I specifically wanted two of them and have found a couple others since.  It is easy to use and easy to read, has enough settings to work for fonts and other adjustments for ease of use.  But if you want to play games and such you need to get another model.  I also got the adapter so I can plug it into a wall socket and not the computer to charge;" and I got a case for it as well which will be coming in shortly and will protect it when I am not using.""
Review: It is easy to use and easy to read";;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"I know it has been  while since this kindle was purchased  and I should have done this earlier but here goes.When I order a book I never know where it will be sometimes on device and sometimes in the cloud,  Thats ok  if I just ordered but when I preorder it ends up in the cloud  then getting it on the device  can be a pain.If I am reading a book it doesn't become #1 on device it stays where it was which means if I do anything else on the kindle I have to search it out again.  All in all I am unhappy with this touchscreen kindle.",I know it has been while since this kindle was ...;;;;;;

Review: I bought this for my grandmother who had to stop reading print books because of her eye sight.  She is absolutely pleased because she can read again. With her being bed ridden this is the best thing ever!
Title;;;;;;: She is absolutely pleased because she can read again;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Love the new Kindle. I had an older version which I liked. But I started using my iPad for reading and sold the kindle. When I realized that the ipad light was negatively affecting my sleep, I decided to repurchase the new model kindle. I'm very happy with it. It was very affordable, so I didn't feel too guilty rebuying it. It's kind of bare bones, but that's all I wanted. The touch screen works well and I enjoy the light weight, small size. The kindle lending library is a nice plus, too.",Love the new Kindle;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm so disappointed. I absolutely loved my original Kindle, but suddenly--and for no external reason I could imagine--it just stopped worked. Suddenly the screen split, and I tried everything I could find on Amazon and on YouTube videos to fix it. When that didn't work, I ordered a new one of the same type: they simple one. When it came, the screen was so much smaller. The way it works is different, and I need to download all 181 of my books one at a time. I guess I accept that things change in a few years, but this is so different than what I have, that I'm very sad. I loved my original Kindle, and it died. Maybe I'll come to get used to this new one, but it will take a long time. My Kindle is my refuge, and the change is very sad to me.",Sad replacement;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this entry-level Kindle and quickly discovered that I like reading Kindle books, but in the end I regretted buying the cheap model because it's not as easy to read as a Paperwhite. I subsequently bought a Paperwhite and I like it much better.","Functional, but display not so great";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"T was a real bargain but I really didn't need it since I get Kindle on my iPad. But there are some books that will not download except on the Kindle it's wonderfully light , compact and easy to read. I travel with the Kindle as well as the iPad and read only on the Kindle - thus saving iPad battery usage. The price was my main reason for buying it.","Very light small enough to carry around, yet large enough to read comfortably.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Oh my gosh, I am in love!!!!  I always assumed that a multifunction tablet would be more useful, but being a reader and dad of teenage daughters, I never know where my tablet is!  Since my kindle is a reader, not a gaming/ email/ video device, nobody in my household cares about it....BUT I DO!!!!!It is easy on my eyes, and I am so glad, I now have access to the KINDLE LENDING LIBRARY!!!!YES...if you've never had a Kindle...and you are a reader...YOU GOTTA GET A KINDLE!!!!",Love at First Read!!!!;;;;;;

Review: OMG! I love my kindle.Don't waste your extra money to remove ads. It only display one ad when you open the book. Just swipe and read. It does not show finger prints and you can read it very well in the light and outdoors (even in the sun). Can't read in the dark unless you buy the light attachment separately.

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"I was very excited to receive my Kindle but have found it does not meet my expectation.  I own a Nook and was hoping that the reading of the Kindle would be so much better than the nook.  The Kindle is very hard to see the type unless I am under a very strong bright light, like a very sunny summer day.  But I do not read in the sunlight.  I read by my bedside lamp and I have to have additional light to be able to read.  The thing needs some kind of  adjustable lighting to be able to read comfortably.  My eyes are staining and I find that I keep a headache after reading a very short time. I truly wish it could be used in any kind of light setting. I know I will not be able to see a word on a airplane as I can not see without a bright book light added when I do read.","Regretfully, I can not see the book to read";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I got this right after Christmas when it was on sale. Since then, I have brought this into work every day so I can read on my breaks. It's so easy to use and I love that I don't have to carry a huge book. It doesn't have a light and it's slightly thicker than the paperwhite, but for a basic e reader it's amazing!",Best purchase ever;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"If you like to read, just read some books, this is the best simple reading tool for you.  Long battery life, simple to use, and a lot of free book to down load from Amazon.  The only thing I can complain about it is, you need to turn on the light to read, which can be solved easily by adding a mini clip-on light.","Long battery life, simple to use";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I have had a Kindle for 4 years.  I thought it might be time for a new one.  Personally, I liked my original one better.  This newer version has a touch screen for commands, next page, library, etc. instead of buttons on my original,  I think it is more difficult to use.",Not as User Friendly as My Original Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first e-reader. The text on the screen is very clear and is easy to read in the light. A back light is not necessary as the screen is perfectly clear by regular lamp light.The Kindle is nice and light so you can comfortably hold it in one hand while you read. The navigation is intuitive so it is easy to go to different sections of the book you are reading and then return to where you were originally reading.The touch screen is appropriately sensitive, it has always registered my touch. Occasionally the page will turn if I accidentally touch the screen but that isn't really a problem.The settings menu can be a little confusing, at times it is difficult to determine where the control is to adjust something.Overall, I would recommend this to someone looking to buy an e-reader.",The text on the screen is very clear and is easy to read in the light;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"The new and improved 6' Kindle is great , I have an I pad, but this kindle is so much better for reading. I can read for hours with the kindle, but when reading with other devices my eyes get tired. I can't believe they can make a reader this good for such a reasonable price.  If I could not purchase another ,  I would not take $1,000 for mine.",Kindle Glare-Free touchscreen;;;;;;
4.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm loving it!  The font is crisp and clear, the touchscreen is responsive but not overly so;" it's easy to hold (the beveled back is actually better than a flat one
Review: I find) and contrary to many people
Title;;;;;;: I love the cloud collections - it works exactly the way I intuitively think it should.  Compared the Kindle Keyboard
column4: it's so easy to download books from your archive
column5: move books between collections
column6: and remove books from collections and from the device - all thanks to the touchscreen.  It's fast and way more responsive than my KK
column7: what used to take a minute is now instant!  And because my books stay categories even if they're not on the device
column8: I don't need to keep all 2000-odd books on the device :)The only downsides - I can't always figure out the exact view I want  (cloud/on device
column9: collections/books/all
column10: and recent/title/author/collections all combine in different ways)
column11: but that's minor.  The biggest drawback for me is that now I have to actually move my thumb to turn pages
column12: whereas on the KK I just needed to squeeze.  I'm still too aware of the movement required
column13: although I'm sure I'll get used to it and it'll fade into the background.  Besides
column14: all the good points far outweigh these two minor concerns.Oh
column15: another caveat - KK collections are not importable to the new kindle.  Some of my very old and since deleted collections showed up
column16: but none of my current ones.  I'm having to manually go through my books and add them to collections.  On the KK this would have been a nightmare
column17: on the new kindle it's just unpleasant.""

Review: I do wish I would have paid just a little extra for the paperwhite but this is still good. It's a little heavy and thick in my opinion. I feel like it could definitely be thinner considering our 7th generation that we had for years was about 1/3 of the thickness. I'm sure it has something to do with being touch screen. I don't know. It gets the job done though.
Title;;;;;;: ... little extra for the paperwhite but this is still good. It's a little heavy and thick in my ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Easy to set up and begin reading. I have not yet purchased any books, instead I'm going through the ""free"" ones and have had many hours (9 books in 3 weeks) of enjoyment with my Kindle. I charge it about once a week overnight while sleeping. I prefer this model over the one with a backlight as those hurt my eyes after awhile due to the sharpness and contrast between the print and back light. So far I have not been in a situation where I can not turn on a lamp to read. If this is an issue for you, buy the one with back light so you can read in the dark.",Easy to set up and begin reading;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Simple, dedicated eReader with direct access to Amazon. Does everything it says it will, but nothing more. Great for anyone new to computers, but powerusers will be disappointing by a lack of features. Taking away a star for this only. Giving it a plus for having an ""Experimental Browser"" though!",Great for anyone new to computers;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Glare-free is an overstatement. The materials (the cheap look/feeling plastic casing) is lackluster, but I'm a sucker for the first-to-market reader. Not sure I'd trust another name in ebook readers. OH! and why can't we pay the $20 to remove ads AFTER the initial purchase? Seems like some kind of consumer research experiment - I'm not amused. I didn't think the ads would bother me, but they do.",Seems like some kind of consumer research experiment - I'm not ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this for my nine year old daughter for her birthday.  In our tech savy family, we already have thirteen devices between Kindle Fire, phones, iPads, computers, gaming systems, etc with internet, the last thing she needed was another distraction (for the record, these are my husband's and my devices and while it seems like a lot, we are not glued to screens all day).  We are stationed overseas and it's not easy to get books in English here and she has quite an extensive reading list for summer.  This is exactly what she needed.  The screen is clear, it is very easy for her to navigate, the dictionary feature is fantastic and she can read quietly in her room at night with her booklight.  She has been a fairly avid reader but now I can't keep get her to put her kindle down, which makes me a very happy mom.  I had to use chat with customer service for a setup issue and they had everything taken care of for us within a few minutes.  Great product and great support.",these are my husband's and my devices and while it seems like a lot;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I do most of my reading during my commute on the New York subway, and on the LIRR. The last few years it has been easier to just play a game on my iPhone, while I stand in a crowded train. Flipping pages while holding on to a pole in a moving train is awkward.Since I got my kindle (originally I bought it for the wife) I have been reading every day, and finishing books faster than I ever used to. I love it.",This little device got me into reading again;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Am enjoying the Kindle just received. I believe they called it a ""paperwhite"" but couldn't find out much from the customer service department.  I am replacing one of the original models, ordered years ago and broken and replaced three times. This is my fourth, then. The third was indestructible until it fell into the pool. Hopefully this one will remain usable for years to come. My disappointment comes concerning the price of these older models charged to a loyal multiyear paying customer expecting a discounted price.",My disappointment comes concerning the price of these older models charged ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"After reviewing all the types of Kindles, I finally chose this on for myself. My last one was a manual one with a keyboard. It was easy to use and support was great when I had additional questions. It came in black  but I was sad to see it does not have an audio feature. It's really light in weight and using touch is fantastic. This was a present from my husband when the other one malfunctioned when I was using it. Although, there are not any stores in my area, I finally found a BEST BUY down by the mall. The sales staff there were Very helpful and the extended warranty a good buy also.",NEW KINDLE is a best buy.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Fantastic gadget! It's hard to believe that you can read it anywhere in the world,on the airplane,ship boat and numerous books that exist. In the past we had to go to the library for a book, now we have the library in the pocket!",Fantastic gadget! It's hard to believe that you can ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am very pleased with my Kindle. It has a touch screen that is easy to use. It is great for finding definitions of words I do not know.It is great to be able to transfer books back and forth with my wife. I did find it somewhat difficult to set up. It should come with more instructions. However, Customer Service was great when I called in.",Kindle 6 In. Touch Screen;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"After using a tablet device and my cell phone for e-reading the last two+ year it took some getting used to have a screen that required me to in a lighted setting. It is easy to use and I love how long the battery lasts, but the need for light is weird.","OK, but different than the other readers.";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"One of the best products out there and well worth the price! The only problem is that it's not very PDF friendly. I already had many PDF books, and it's hard to read them on this device if the pages are fairly large. Resizing of PDF documents is not possible, or at least I haven't figured it out yet.",One of the best products out there and well worth the price;;;;;;

Review: It's ok for the price depending on the lighting in the room depends on the background of the screen....was going to return but felt I could deal with it....I think I would have perferred the paperwhite as a upgraded version of the screen....but this is my first kindle so far just learning my way around it in different lighting in rooms as well as outside...so that mention u can't beat the price upgrade later....so it's ok for me at the moment....
Title;;;;;;: It's ok for the price depending on the lighting in ...;;;;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"I am happy with my Kindle. I have had another e-reader for quite sometime and bought this as a back up and to access books that are only offered on Kindle. There are several pro's and con's for both my e-readers, but I do favor my other one more because of some options that the Kindle doesn't offer. Overall, It was a good purchase!",I am happy with my Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Great product.  This is a replacement for my original Kindle, which was larger and required pushing buttons to change the page.  This unit is easily, and comfortably, held in one hand.Do not like the ""cloud"" feature as a library.  I much preferred the original format of all books shown in a ""list"" format.  However, that is just a personal preference and has nothing to do with the functionality of the Kindle unit.",Great product. This is a replacement for my original ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my second Kindle. For reading books, I so much prefer it to my KindleFire, which is so heavy to hold, it falls out of hands when I read in bed and bonks me on the face. I paid $200 for it almost two years ago, whereas I got this Kindle for less than a hundred dollars. It's strictly for reading, so far as I can tell. This suits me to a T, since that's all I wanted in the first place. I love the paper surface as opposed to the fancy color one. Just give me an electric non-glare paper book -- electronic features included of course. This product is a real winner! Five stars!",I love the paper surface as opposed to the fancy color ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought mine from best buyLoving it....my first kindle!  I have the app in my tablet but nothing like the real thing,and plenty of books..the only thing I did was open an account and my book were in my kindle YESSS",Enjoying my books thanks Kindle....;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Though I have had a number of tablets, this is my first experience with a Kindle reader.  I purchased it because it was at a special price and because I looked forward to being able to read in the sunlight .... something that is exceedingly difficult with most tablets.  What I did not realize, however, is that these basic Kindle units provide no internal illumination (hence their extensive battery life).  They are therefore the polar opposite of a tablet -- they are wonderful for outdoor reading, but not ideal for indoors unless you have adequate lighting.  I am still pleased with the purchase for it will serve its outdoor purpose very well.",GIVE AND TAKE AWAY;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love my baby Kindle.  first one I have had, and I love the size - it fits in ANY purse and even some pockets.  There are no bells and whistles, but you CCAN read it outdoors in bright sun -- a requirement for me. YOU NEED A  SEPARATE LIGHT  SOURSE TO READ AT NIGHT -- not back lit.  It is not as fancy as the others:  you cannot check email,etc, but this is exactly what I wanted for travel -- or just busy days when you end up waiting for a few minutes here or there -- since it is so compact.  Fantastic!!!",Perfect in so many ways!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Got this after my old one took a dip in my kitchen sink. I am very pleased with this model Kindle. The screen contrast is excellent and easy on the eyes. Highlighting, word lookup and font changes are quick and easy. WiFi hookup is simple, with WPS. Library downloads work well. The unit seems physically thicker and more robust than the previous version. I got the ""ads"" model, but they are unobtrusive and only appear when the unit is shut off. The only two small nits I can pick are, the touch screen is a little too sensitive, so in many cases I actually prefer having the buttons from the old version, but I am getting used to it. And, having to swipe the screen to begin reading is annoying;" if the passcode option isn't selected
Review: there should be an option to skip the swipe. Other than those two minor things
Title;;;;;;: this is an good bargain on a great reading device.""
column4: Nice device for the price";;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I had an older version and it feels and looks of better quality than this new one.  I do like the touch screen on the new one it makes navigation easier.  The whole thing is smaller than my old one which makes it lighter which is nice. I'm just a little concerned how well it will hold up. I passed my old one on to my sister, I hope I don't regret it.",Good buy on sale.;;;;;;
5.0 out of 5 stars,"I received this as a Christmas present.  I am thoroughly enjoying the e-reader; so much handier than physical books
Review: and definitely takes up less space.  I just wish it had a back light;" this is my only negative comment on it.  It would be nice if all the Kindle e-readers manufactured included a back light.""

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first kindle in about 6 years. Great product. Definitely like the ""glare-free"" aspect and the fact that it doesn't have all sorts of apps that distract me from my reading. The last reason is the main reason I got it. I have an iPad and an iPhone, both of which have the kindle apps, but I always end up really distracted before long. Having something like this allows for the convenience of multiple books on a small device and the distractions are greatly reduced. I'm happy with it.",Distraction Free;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Absolutely love my Kindle! Given to me as a birthday gift from my 2 nieces and I've had to discipline myself to keep my nose out of the latest book I've downloaded! I love the various features, especially the ability to highlight a word to get the exact definition if I don't recognize it and the ability to bookmark pages. I highly recommend this Kindle.",Wonderful!;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"This is our 4th Kindle and cannot say I am impressed with any of them. While they work, everything is great. However, each of the Kindles have just stopped working after just a few months and needed to be replaced. The first three were 2nd generation Kindles. The first one lasted 8 months before it froze up and no longer worked. Since it was under warranty, they sent a new one at no cost. The second one lasted nearly 6 months before it wouldn't turn on at all. Since it was a replacement the warranty was only 6 months instead of one year so we barely got a new one under the 6 month warranty. The 3rd one they sent us came with no warranty at all and quit working within 7 months. So, we decided to not purchase another one for 2 years. Then at Christmas in 2014 we thought we would give it another try for a family member...BIG MISTAKE! It is only the end of April and this Kindle has already quit working. They replaced it for free under the 1 year warranty. Thank God we bought an addition 2 year warranty at the time of purchase.We are very UNHAPPY with the 2 different Kindle devices we have tried (4 Kindles total) and would not recommend spending the money on it. If you like to read from Kindle, download the app. It works like a charm on my phone and tablet.",4th Kindle Now All Have Stopped Working In Less Than 1 Year;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is an amazing value. It's nothing fancy -- no colors or anything. But it does the job. We love the touchscreen feature. It's so simple. The syncing is fabulous, and everything is compatible it seems. Amazon has done a great job with this one.",Fabulous Value.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Just recently got it. Not sure yet whether I like it. I am a Luddite, and hope that I will be able to work this kind of touchscreen device, which is a replacement for my previous original keyboard kindele",Not sure yet will add comments later;;;;;;

Review: Love this Kindle!  I bought this for my wife.  I have the older version and she has this newer one.  Very easy to use and the screen is awesome.  I can't believe you can get a Kindle for such a low price!

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I own a 2nd edition Kindle--I waited to see how the 1st ed, went before I purchased it.  I paid quite a bit of money for it, even got the leather case for it, a kandle light, and even subscribed to a newspaper!  It came out around $300 dollars at that time but also had the free 3g for life-which was super nice.  I say was because well, the kindle was in my backpack and met its end with being slammed into a corner of a desk that shattered the screen.  It sucked.  So when Amazon offered the latest kindle for only $60 bucks, I jumped on it.Now it ain't a Voyager, like I got my mom for Christmas, but its damn near close.  It's WAY better than my 2nd ed. ever was, except for the advertisements.  Being a Prime member just sweetens this deal.  Except for the advertisements.  I have to keep saying that because that is the ONLY thing wrong with this model.  The non-advertisement model would be better, but man, 60 bucks for a kindle....that's like a no-brainer.  I'll deal with these ads because they aren't obtrusive, I just would rather see the old screensavers than an ad, but whatever.  A nintendo game is 60 bucks.  So is this kindle.  uh, hello?",Get a Kindle for the price of a Nintendo game!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This basic Kindle is exactly what I hoped it would be.  Before selecting this, I compared it to the features of other Kindles, and realized I didn't need all the bells and whistles.  I got it with the special offers, and as soon as I click on Home the offers go away.  Not a problem for me.  It is easy to operate and easy to read.",This basic Kindle is Great!;;;;;;

Review: This is my second Kindle.  I like this one so much better than the earlier version.  This one uses a finger sweep to turn pages that I find a lot easier than pressing a button on the side of the unit like my older Kindle.  Very easy on the eyes.  I've used it quite a bit since it arrived.  Highly recommend!

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Nice product but returned it for paperwhite version because I'm an idiot and didn't know that this version doesn't have a backlight.  I know they say you shouldn't read just before bed with an illuminated screen, but it's the only time I have when my wife is asleep.",Nice product but returned it for paperwhite version because I'm ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"...a wonderful piece of technology.- The technology behind the screen makes the reading feel more like paper.- Changing from page to page is simple and fast.- The battery life is extremely long.It also might helpt to mention that the size of this device makes it especially exquisite for me due to the resizing of pages to the (not so) small screen that gives you a better feeling of advancement (I have a problem with big books where the pages contain small letters and long descriptions, which makes me feel a bit frustrated by thinking about how the book will continue to be like this, and gets on my nerves).I bought this device on a special to try it out, and I'm glad I did.",Just saying that this is...;;;;;;

Review: Fantastic ....piece of gizmo .....yes it does not have a reading back light but I anyway did not want one .....and for the price I got it for was a steal anyway ....bottom line if ur a avid reader ....there no way u will not like this device ...

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"It's ok.  I actually prefer the oldest model better.  This touch screen freezes up in cold weather.  The older model did not.  It seems buggy, for example, sometimes when trying to go to the next page it readjusts the font.  That's very annoying.  It should be a 2 step process to change the font, yet when clicking in an entirely different area, it changes the font with one touch and will get stuck like that. I have to turn it off to change the font and then click to go to the next page. It's also really thick, at least twice as thick as the first (or second, can't remember which version I had) generation kindle.",Wish I Hadn't Upgraded;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I like my new Kindle but not as much as my old one that it replaced.  The touchscreen while convenient, also drives me nuts. I'm constantly inadvertently touching someplace and getting pop ups like font size adjustment screens, dictionary screens and some screens that I just don't know what they are for and when I put it down, my hand always seems to flip through pages by unintentionally touching the screen. As easily as these unwanted screens pop up I have difficulty accessing my Home page, shopping and the web and it seems like I can't get to the end of books or get out of the crap attached to the end of them. Everything being equal I'd much rather have my old Kindle working again.",I like my new Kindle but not as much as my ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"For the money, this is great. Just large enough to read at night. Easy to find books one likes to read. It doesn't have a light, but didn't need one. The pages are quite acceptable for reading. Highly recommend.",this is great. Just large enough to read at night;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Been a Kindle user for years. A while back, when I got an iPad began using the Kindle app for iPad. Found that it used way too much memory on iPad so went back to a Kindle reader. Love the newer small size. Couldn't be more pleased with reader and service.",Kindle user since they first became available.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Although I really liked my old kindle, I am satisfied with the new one.  It is only a little sensitive for a touch screen, but I will get used to it.  You were able to transfer my old books (some of which I never read).  As far as it being refurbished, if you didn't tell me I would have thought it was new.",Certified refurbished Kindle;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"Honestly, I didn't like it very much compared with my Kindle Keyboard. I liked being able to select using the touchscreen for definitions, etc. but I much prefer the physical buttons for changing pages. I also didn't like the way books are displayed. I have hundreds of books and I give them a name that includes what order they are in the series, unfortunately I can't even see that on the main screen in the Kindle Touch, I have to open the book to figure out whether it is the next one for me to read. When a series has 7 books in it, that can be very frustrating. I also want a better way to organize my books into Collections, I previously used calibre, but to use it with this Kindle I would have to Jailbreak it, which I don't want to do. My next e-reader may not come from Amazon if they keep making it so restrictive. For now, I'm going back to my Kindle Keyboard until it dies.","Eh, the Kindle Keyboard is better for me...";;;;;;

Review: No lighted cover/case available.  Small to hold and if your finger slips the slightest the page changes or the font changes or it sets off the dictionary. ...touchscreen is very sensitive.Not an easily handled device at all.It reads fine. About as good as any other and the battery life is as expected.Overall I am disappointed.Page turner tabs should be an option.  And someplace to actually hold it (more than the 1/2 inch provided)
Title;;;;;;: Not an easily handled device at all;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my Kindle! There is a little scratch in the screen so it's a black spot.  But I have 80 books on it and it doesn't hurt my eyes,  I have a lot of eye problems. It's super light and I can bring it anywhere.",Came with a scratch but love the device;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I used to read one book every day when I was kid, now I don't have time or I can't read for one hour because I start being bored of reading one subject or 1 book.Now with this little device, I can read a lot of books in same time.Light weight and user friendly.I spent $50 and it's totally worth it.",I love it;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"My old Kindle didn't  work we ll after an update, so my daughter bought me a new one. The glare free Kindle is very nice and I can read it anywhere. I like the fact that does not have back light as that is not favorable  for sleep.",The glare free Kindle is very nice and I can read it anywhere;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my new kindle touch. I have bought 5 kindles over the years, two for gifts and 3 for me. I prefer the newsprint over the paperwhite. Paperwhite is to bright for my eyes. I love the touch screen which so easy to use. It took me about 5 minutes to get it up and running. It's a lot of product for little money!  My books go everywhere with me and new books are so easy to download. Buy one and love it!",I recommend this Kindle Touch for everyone!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"The screen resolution is good, but if you have the money, buy the 300dpi version.Backlight is also important. I am impressed by the Kindle, but I will definitely buy the one with 300dpi screen resolution and backlight in few months once I am used to carrying it everywhere without losing it :)","The screen resolution is good, but if you have the money";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Very light, easy to read. Only problem, sometimes when I tap the screen to go forward or backward, it just sits there.  Working on getting past that. Fits in my purse and is very easy to read on the bus, main reason I got it! Good value for the price.",Easy and Light!;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I love to carry this around and read from it.  However I had to exchange it because it would no longer charge.  Now the same problem has occurred again.  This time I googled ""kindle does not charge"" and found a solution that seems to work.  How long this will work for me I don't know.  What would happen if I became dependent on Amazon for all my reading I don't know.  I recommend you think about it.",Look for the charging workaround before you buy.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"great deal on a great product, however, I now wish I had the one with the ability to background light so that I could read in bed without disturbing my husband.  The size and weight of this product is wonderful as I can easily slip into my handbag without worry.  Therefore I am reading much more.",Great deal on great product;;;;;;

Review: The paper white screen is as easy to read as a printed book.  Sometimes reading from a computer monitor strains my eyes but the Kindle does not do this.  I am very pleased with it and would recommend it to any one.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"My mother doesn't use electronic anything, until now. She loves her Kindle. I put the Kindle on my account and said I would buy books for her for the rest of her life.  I really thought she might be intimidated, since she doesn't use email or a cell phone.  But she is really reading a lot.",Loved by a technophobe;;;;;;

Review: I was debating on getting the basic kindle or the paperwhite kindle. So i went into best buy and saw the little difference between the two The paperwhite has a backlight for night time reading and a slightly higher resolution but thats all. If you want to spend 40 more bucks for a light that you can simply turn on a lamp or get a clip on light for less than five bucks and the reolution isnt a big deal if you are reading books because most of the time its not like your going to zoom all the in. So if you just willing to do 40 more bucks just for a backlight then be my guest but the basic kindle is a bang for the buck it even has the anti glare screen which is amazing but it all depends on the person if they like the fancier version thats seems to me like a waste ot 40 bucks that you can buy a couple books with.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I honestly was hesitant to ever switch to an electronic device. I love my paperback books, but this is awesome. No driving to the store or waiting on the mail to be delivered. I just search and buy. It's pretty clear and easy to ready as well. Might even get a Kindle Fire for the hubby.",Worth it!!!;;;;;;

Review: Good size and so far so good- just got it last week but I was able to sync it with my existing Kindle account after my old kindle died.  I'm very happy with this so far.  Easy to use and clear menu bars and prompts.
Title;;;;;;: Good size and so far so good- just got it ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love, love, love my kindle. This is my second kindle given to me by my son. I have given 2 gifts of kindles & they love their kindle. Easy to see the words, compact, lite weight for easy travel to appointments or trips.",Fall in Love with Your New Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"CAN'T BEAT IT FOR THE PRICE.  I BROUGHT THIS ONE FOR MY DAD SO HE COULD READ THE BIBLE IN LARGE PRINT AND NOT HAVE TO WORRY ABOUT TEARING PAGES.  HE COULD SIMPLY TOUCH THE SCREEN AND IT WILL GO TO THE NEXT PAGE.  IT IS A CHRISTMAS GIFT, SO I WON'T KNOW HOW HE LIKES IT UNTIL THEN, HOWEVER I PLAYED AROUNG WITH IT TO SET IT UP AND I LOVE IT.",LOVE IT!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This suited all of my needs, great product, low price and easy to use.  I have a top of the line tablet I use for ebooks, but have problems seeing the display in sunlight.  The screen on this product can be seen in the brightest conditions.  I definintly recommend this to people that read a lot of books","great product, low price and easy to use";;;;;;
5.0 out of 5 stars,"What a magnificent little thing! The battery lasts for a very long time;" and the screen feels like a natural paberback
Review: without the glare of tablets or phones
Title;;;;;;: which is very pleasing to the eyes.Portable
column4: light
column5: and durable. I bring it nearly everywhere. Now if I'm stuck on a never ending torturous line (DMV
column6: anyone?)
column7: at least I have a book in handy.""
column8: A livesafer!";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Had an old style one with keypad, and bought the new one after my old one broke. I like this version a lot more, as it seems easier to use and the keypad, which I never did use much doesnt get in the way. so far solid and dependable.",A great product;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"really disappointed in this product that I shipped to my mailbox & then to UAE (Dubai) - the screen definitely has issues. the screen keeps twitching & each time I load a new page it takes time to display clearly. it turns all black, then all white... horrible experience!",really disappointed in this product that I shipped to my mailbox ...;;;;;;

Review: Love it. No worry about glare for use outside. Only reason not five star is finger page turner sometimes slow or flips backward. Probably user error but I had previous push button and worked perfectly.
Title;;;;;;: Love it. No worry about glare for use outside;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my 3rd Kindle. As with any new electronic gadget there is a bit of learning to be done. I now love my new Kindle as much as I have loved my Kindles before.  The reason I'm on my 3rd Kindle is that they break for no apparent reason.  One day they just don't work any more.  My last one just couldn't be woken up, it must have been in a deep coma.  Troubleshooting with one of the Amazon technicians did not bring it back to life. I had that one for about 1 and 1/2 years.  It was a replacement for my previous Kindle that also had succumbed to sudden death after about 2 years.  That one was still under the extended warranty I had purchased.  So my 2nd Kindle was free. When it broke the warranty had expired. I had to pay for my new Kindle, and I also purchased an additional 2yr warranty.  In fact I was so discouraged with the Kindles that I first bought a Kobo,. To my dismay I found out that  Kobo and Kindle do not speak a common language. The Kindle app could not be downloaded onto the Kobo.  All my books, some of which I had not yet read, were for Kindle.  So what could I do?  Since my e-reader is my favorite thing I bought another.  How sad that Amazon is unwilling or unable to create a Kindle with a respectable life span. I'd like to add that I have always treated my Kindles with as much care as I would treat my first born son.",Condemned to keep buying Kindles.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I absolutely love it!  I have the original kindle still but this one can fit in even my smallest purse. I'm visually impaired so I was apprehensive if I would be able to read the type & I can see it just fine!  Great purchase, great price & fantastic product!",Fantastic!!!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I love the portability and no glare of this device. My one issue is not being able to switch from a book I've finished and a new one without having to restart the device. It's sort of frustrating. But, it's great for reading. I can finally read without getting a headache from the glare of the screen from the Kindle app on my phone!",Very much enjoying it;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"My 2nd gen Kindle died and I didn't want anything fancy as a replacement.  The 7th gen basic works great, easy to get used to the touch screen so totally satisfied.  I do like the smaller size as well.",Completely satisfied;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"THE UNIT IS GREAT.  THE INSTRUCTIONS THAT ACCOMPANIED IT ARE AMONG THE WORST I'VE EVER ENCOUNTERED WHICH THEN REQUIRED A COUPLE CALLS TO KINDLE SUPPORT (THE PEOPLE WHO ANSWERED THE PHONE KNEW NOTHING, THE SUPERVISOR I EVENTUALLY REQUESTED TO SPEAK WITH WAS TERRIFIC. GREAT HELP.)  ALL WORKING JUST FINE NOW.",THE UNIT IS GREAT. THE INSTRUCTIONS THAT ACCOMPANIED IT ARE AMONG THE ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"For being an ebook reader, I'm very happy with this device. I got it on sale for $60 and it does exactly what I want out of ebook reader - it lets me read books and has a good battery life. I'm still disappointed that Kindles don't natively support epub format but that's Amazon's fault, not the Kindle. My previous Kindle, and my wife's (both Kindle Keyboards) started freezing up after a couple years so I couldn't unlock it apart from a device reboot, and from searching online it seems it could be down to the battery, so only time will tell if this Kindle suffers a similar fate down the line. As of right now though, it does the job, and the ads only appear on the unlock screen so don't intrude on reading - I'm happy with the discounted price for an inconvenience I don't even notice.",It does the job;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"As I just got some books loaded, I haven't started reading yet. Do have a problem. Being a DUMMY, I have trouble learning it. Printed off the Kindle users guide. Have trouble understanding some things. And there isn't anyone close I can go to for help. (Live in the boonies) Put all my books in a collection. (Only have one series now.) When I tried to put in the order I want to read them, they just jumped all over the place. I tried last one first, then first one first. Neither worked.","As I just got some books loaded, I haven't ...";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Nothing left to say about the good things of this product.Its ""The best thing"" for book lovers.My only concern is that the screen flickers whenever there is a change in the content that is being displayed. I am not sure if this is normal. If it is then it doesn't feel good to me.",Only 1 concern - screen flickers whenever it has to refresh contents for display;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This replaces an older Kindle for my husband.  It took a little getting used to the touch screen, but he finally got the hang of it.  The older Kindle stopped working, just died, but after we replaced it, it suddenly came back to life.  But he seems to prefer reading on the new one, so I guess he must like it after all.",Replacement Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"There will always be a place in my heart for the real deal, the smell of a book and holding one in my hands. But I have to admit that so far I have loved using the kindle, and I think it may encourage me to read more than I have in recent years (I've barely read one full book in the past 3-4 years). I can't say it's 100% glare-free, if I hold it just right the lamp light glares on the screen, but it's definitely not as bad as a shiny, glossy finish would be. I'm amazed at just how much the kindle really does look like the page of a book, and I like that I can set my own size and font preferences so that I don't necessarily have to deal with whatever a book was printed in. I have charged it once since I received it, which was only a week ago, but after several hours of use there is plenty of battery life left yet.Overall, for the amount of memory and the visual quality, I think this was a great purchase for the price. I did not get a case since I don't plan on taking my kindle anywhere, so I can't give an opinion on cases.",But I have to admit that so far I have loved using the kindle;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Perfect for my needs.  I purchased on Black Friday for $49, and knew what I was getting.  It's light and uncomplicated, and I've found it to be well worth the money.  There are some times I wished I had a light, but for $49, I can't complain.  It's my 3rd Kindle, and they've come a long way since the old days!!  I just wanted something light and easy to throw in my bag.",Perfect for me.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Ive always heard good things about Kindles and have had the opportunity to use friend's and family's kindles in the past. Finally broke down and purchased one, and am happy with it. Easy to read, light weight and touch screen. Battery life is top-notch as well. Cant complain one bit.",No complaints at all;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Just fantastic! I have the first generation Kindle also which had the voice thing so it could read the book to me. But I barely used it. This new version doesn't have audio capability. But it's light and easy to operate. This is the base model, so it can only connect via wi-fi.",Perfect!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Still getting use to it.  Don't like the idea that if I have a problem trying to figure out some function, I have to locate the on-line manual, try to remember what I read, then continuing to try to solve the problem.  I need a guide to follow alone with problem solving. Amazon should offer a printed manual with each reader.",Don't like the idea that if I have a problem trying ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have always hated reading when I was little, but now that I am older, I wanted to pick up reading because I am having difficulty writing and expressing myself clearly. I was looking for a ""single purpose"" device without any possibility of app distractions and this Kindle so far have delivered. It is simple to use, and the fact that it has no backlight it doesn't make my eyes feel tired.",A device that helped me focus on reading.;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this because it is easy on the eyes, which it is extremely good in that regard.  I give it three stars because it takes significant effort to read .PDF files on this machine.  Also, my kindle doesn't connect to my computer as a USB drive, I suppose I should call the company, but WIFI transfer of files is sufficient....Just FYI for .PDF file enthusiasts like myself, the files do not show up well, table of contents is mixed up....the formatting is way out of whack...the .MOBI files are perfect, and even though there are converters out there, the conversion yields the same results.For $64 after all is said and done, 'its okay' is a fair assessment, as I haven't decided to sell it......yet.  The one thing that I hate the most is while you are reading a .PDF or converted PDF to MOBI, you hit the page back button and it returns you to the first page, so you have to keep track of where you are in the document, and pull up the bottom screen menu to return to where you were......which I haven't even bothered doing yet.....I wanted to relax before bed and read programming, etc. books before bed, but having to keep track on the index where you are in each book......'it's okay'....","Not a good choice for PDF reader, even with conversion to MOBI";;;;;;

Review: Touch interface is not what you'd expect from a modern touchscreen and less practical than the old buttons. User Experience and navigation should be completely rethought. Quality of graphics is poor. Zoom is useless for graphics.
Title;;;;;;: A step back relative to the original. Transition to touch is far from complete;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I got this as an early Christmas gift from my mother. At first, I was disappointed because I was expecting to get the Paperwhite version. But this quickly grew on me. I actually prefer not having a glaring white lit background while reading. This is much more akin to what an actual page out of a book might look like. I love that I can easily hold this in one hand and read, depending on my sitting position. Even though my hands are small, it still fits comfortably for me. I have had this for about a week and a half, maybe two weeks and I've already zipped through a few books. I'm very happy with this! If you're trying to decide between the Paperwhite or getting this version, just get this one! It works just the same as the other one, and you aren't really missing out on any special features.",Great product!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I mostly love my new Kindle. I upgraded from my previous 4-year old Kindle and it is a much better piece of technology. My only issue is that the font size seems to change by itself when I haven't even touched the screen. This happens often. Maybe it's a glitch in my Kindle, maybe it's an issue with all of these. Not sure. It's really annoying, but it is still a great e-reader.",Almost 5 stars!!!!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"The book covers did not download and I was left looking at book names with no cover.  The man at the service help line was very pleasant, polite, knowledgeable, thorough, and after 20 minutes of trying different things, we finally figured out how to make the covers show up.  Service was excellent!  But I did not enjoy having to delete books off of the kindle to put them on the cloud, to put them back on the kindle so the covers would show up.  The books on my cloud had to be queued onto the kindle, then deleted off the device for the covers to show up on the cloud.  In my mind, this type of ""glitch"" should not have happened.  Half the books had covers, half of them did not.  I own three kindles and this is the only one with an issue.  I bought it for my elderly mother to have books to read while waiting at doctor appointments.  This makes me question future ""glitches"" in the system.",Service was excellent! But I did not enjoy having to delete ...;;;;;;

Review: I was always one of those people who wanted the book in hand and then read it and put it on the shelves.  Then I started checking prices on book from amazon and a lot of the books I wanted were free or the most expensive one were 1.99 and for the price I paid for the kindle I just couldn't pass it up.
Title;;;;;;: I was always one of those people who wanted the ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Got this kindle for Christmas to replace my second generation one that finally broke after 6 wonderful years. It is different to get used to after my last model had the keyboard and this is touch screen. I love this just as much as my first one, looking forward to many years with this one.",great update from my 2 generation kindle;;;;;;

Review: I bought  this for a lady I take care of so she could read without struggling to turn the page of a book. It worked great and she love the fact that it is light and easy to use. Thanks for a nice transaction and fast delivery.

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"Got my kindle from prime now refurbished with the $20 off coupon for a total of $44. I like it, the software is great and getting books is easy, reading books is easy. My biggest issue is the hardware, this does not feel like an $80 product, at all. The case is made out of plastic that makes it feel like an old game boy, and a few taps on the back make it sound very hollow inside. The screen is fairly low resolution, although e-ink is definitely much nicer to read than an lcd. All in all I like it, especially for the price I got it at, but if I were a serious bookworm I'd spring for a higher end model.","Got it cheap, the only way I'd buy one.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love the compact size of this Kindle.  It is not lighted or backlighted so it does not cause eyestrain due to the glowing screen experience.  It charged quickly and still has a 50% charge a week later.  Makes it easy to carry it around with me when I have to be in a waiting room.  I read a lot, and this Kindle reads just like a book, without the weight of the book causing it to close unexpectedly and lose your place.  Yep, what I love most about a Kindle is that you never lose your place, even if you put the book on hold and read something else first.  The touchscreen offers a quick turn of the page with just a touch, controls are easy to find and to use.  I bought this Kindle for reading only, and I am pleased.",Well worth buying;;;;;;

Review: Impressive. The Kindle reminds me of the tablets Picard reads at his desk in STNG. Also it's nice packing this little gadget instead of lugging a 700 page hardback of Ayn Rand around. You still need a PC or a fast smart phone to make it easier to load Kindle but it's aight.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I always want to read some books before I sleep, now I can do it with my kindle, not using my cell phone and read all those junks.  At the very beginning, I struggled whether I should buy the paperwhite, but I finally chose this model due to the much lower price.  I thought I don't need a higher resolution.  At the end, I think I missed a key feature from this basic model, LED light.  I like to read something before I sleep and I don't like  to turn on the light, so I need to do it if I want to read with my Kindle now...but paying $40 to upgrade to Paperwhite for the LED light...I really don't know.",I like to read something before I sleep and I don't ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Registering the kindle was really easy as I had had a previous one.  That eased a lot of my fears.  The written instructions are simple and easy to follow.  However, the manual on using it is only in the cloud (you can download it).  That means you need to experiment quite a bit to get to it.  I would have preferred a basic manual in writing.  It's easy to read and light weight.",Almost perfect;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This replaced my 2nd gen kindle and it's better in every way possible, and I loved my 2nd gen before I broke it. The only minor complaint I have is the touch screen. I would like physical buttons to turn the page, swiping requires a bit of weird hand movement for me that my old kindle didn't require.",Awesome;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have been wanting to own a Kindle for yrs, but never purchased one.This was a recent purchase for myself as a Christmas gift. After reading the reviews, the Kindle e-reader would meet my needs. I absolutely love my new Kindle...",My first Kindle...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have already read 6 books.  Before buying this I had an old Ipad with a Kindle app.  It was heavy, and it hurt my eyes every time I tried to read.  I love my new Kindle - easy on the eyes and I can stick it in my purse.",Easy on the eyes;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is one sweet little machine. I have a Fire and a Kindle keyboard which got damaged when caught in a console latch in my car. I use my Fire (first release) for email and Internet access. I like the six inch Kindle for e-reading books. It is ultra - intuitive. I really love it. It's beautifully manufactured and has a fabulous screen. The on - screen keyboard is so much easier to use then my older keyboard - kindle. I'm thinking the six inch Kindle will be a great gift this holiday season.? several people. All in all, the six inch Kindle is the perfect e-reader.",The six inch Kindle is a dream of a machine.;;;;;;
3.0 out of 5 stars,"Not that easy to use;" slightest touch at edge of screen will put you three
Review: four
Title;;;;;;: five pages away from current position.  Went to settings to insure not pestered by ads.  Still have some.  I use Kindle to read books and that is all.  This Kindle not as good as 6"""" with keyboard I purchased about six years ago.  Too bad.""
column4: Newer Kindle is less.";;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I was replacing my original 'keyboard' Kindle that I have used every day for over three years, I tried a 'Fire' but really just wanted an eReader to read books without all the flash so I returned it and bought this. This works well, is a bit smaller and the screen is easy to read even in the sun. The Touchscreen Display IS much easier to use than the keyboard. I do NOT like the fact that two of my favorite games can't be loaded onto the new device. Apparently it requires either the old 5-way pad or a Kindle Fire to support the games I'm interested in playing. I still have enough life in my old keyboard device to play my games but will be out of luck when it finally 'bites the dust'.",I Just Want to Read Books (and Play Two of My Favorite Games);;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Touch screen not as sensitive as I'd like, but overall seems to work well. Searching for books on it can be painful with the touch and scrolling.Amazon, when I type in something like ""The Adventures of Alice in Wonderland Free"" or ""Through the Looking Glass Free"", why are the free books buried deep down? There should be a ""sort by price"" option maybe? But ya, it can be hard to find the Free books on.","Touch screen not as sensitive as I'd like, but overall seems to work well";;;;;;

Review: Great price.  Love reading on this over a tablet.  Got it for the kids so they can always have a book no excuses.  Can take it to school because it won't do anything besides let you read.  Well worth it!
Title;;;;;;: Great price. Love reading on this over a tablet;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Wasn't sure how it was going to fare over paperback, but I love it. A little guy, well put together and engineered. Fits right in my hand, and the plastic has a nice tactile feel.  Even the unboxing experience is pretty cool.",but I love it. A little guy;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this Kindle for my Dad who is 84 and loves it!  He has never used a computer or any other electronic devices but the touchscreen on this Kindle made it quick & easy for him to master.  Turning the pages of a regular book had become hard because he has a tremor, but with the Kindle he can read with ease and total enjoyment.  We are both thrilled with how much he is using and enjoying this Kindle!",Octogenarian Loves this Kindle!;;;;;;

Review: Absolutely LOVE this!!! It does everything is says it does. And if you're looking for a basic ereader and nothing over the top fancy this is for you! My husband bought it for me as a gift for my birthday since it went on a SUPER good sale and it came EXTREMELY fast!!! Love everything about it!! If you're looking for a case OMOTON has several pretty awesome designs to choose from and are great quality but won't break the bank!!

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"Just started using it. I am slowly learning how to navigate it.  I think if it hadn't been given to me as a birthday present by my step son I would probably stick with hard copy books.  I appreciate that the Kindle is compact and is essentially a library at your finger tips, but I read 2 - 4 books a week and find comfort in falling asleep with a good book in my lap.  :-)I intend to keep experimenting with the Kindle in order to get adjusted to its capabilities.",Newby to Kindle;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"The screen is a little darker than I anticipated, and I assumed I might be able to change the brightness - I have not discovered a way to do it.  But, despite that issue, it is lightweight, easy to hold in order to read for longer periods of time.  It is good to have a multitude of books at my fingertips and all of them ""together"" weigh as much as a children's book.",easy to hold in order to read for longer periods ...;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"Perhaps I was spoiled by my previous Kindle - it had buttons and a keyboard. On this one, everything is done with a touch screen. However, after several months of using it, it has become clear that the Kindle Engineering folks have produced a sloppy product:1. The font changes size without any input from me2. Using the ""Go To"" screen is impossible because the slide bar to scroll down down does not work with either finger or stylus3. The slightest touch on the screen brings up the Notes function, which cannot be disabled4. A tap on the right side of the screen results in the screensaver coming up, instead of advancing a page5. From time to time, when the screen saver appears. the only way to return to the book is to reset the unit and wait until it restarts6. When the unit resets, while the books are still present, you can not resume where you left off but must start from the beginningNote: If the unit is never connected to a wireless network, books copied to it from a computer via a USB cable can still be read.Other than these issues, it remains a useful device that did not gain from the ""improvements"" offered by this generation.","it remains a useful device that did not gain from the ""improvements"" offered ...";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I never thought I would convert to a Kindle but I can never go back now. I love that I can sync up my account and connect the Kindle via wi-fi. When I buy a book on Amazon.com on my computer, it automatically sends it to the Kindle. No connection and syncing with a wire required! I don't mind having to read under a light. There is no glare and it is very lightweight and portable. LOVE it!",I love that I can sync up my account and connect ...;;;;;;
