5.0 out of 5 stars,"I like it more than expected. It's so easy to snuggle up with, even if you are reading a 1000 page book - it is still comfy to hold. Also super easy to carry with you. The downside is that you might need to buy a cover for it if you carry it in a larger bag with things that might scratch it.",Awesome device;;;;;;

Review: This kindle is a replacement for my old 2nd gen kindle(old one with the keyboard and no touch screen). I've had the old one since 2009 and had it destroyed in a motorcycle wreck  20 days ago. First let me say Amazon customer service was outstanding and this kindle is everything advertised and served me well on most of my 19 nights in the hospital following the wreck. Thanks Amazon for great service and a great product.

This my 3rd Kindle...First just stopped working after 2 years. The second one lasted until I dropped it into the pool. Wish there was a waterproof skin for it like there is for the phones..It is great for reading outside - no glare
Title;;;;;;: Wish there was a waterproof skin for it like there is for the phones;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"It was a little difficult to get used to the touchscreen after owning a keyboard Kindle, but I expected that. I do like the fact that it weighs less than my old one. I haven't had it long enough to do a real review of all it's features, but it does have more of them than my old one and I like the fact that I can switch back and forth between the two and my computers without losing my place.","I'm glad that Kindle still has just e-readers, since I'm not interested surfing the web with it.";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I am very happy - now. The first few days were stressful. I was showing my wife how to use it and, as soon as she touched it, it froze. It would not respond to anything except a LONG power off. I almost returned it.  But, I have read several books since then without problem and prefer it to my Fire - based on weight alone.",Refurbished Kindle is a great value;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Great product, i'm pleasantly surprised at how easy and fast it downloads book. Product was as described with no misleading advertisement. First book i downloaded was The Road To Surfdom, and it doesn't disappoint. I am sold on the whole e-book idea, and look forward to seeing how well it works, with textbooks, for my college classes.","Great product, i'm pleasantly surprised at how easy and ...";;;;;;

Review: Great for outside reading and much lighter than HD one I have. I  use HD one as an audio book listener and this one for reading. It would be great if it had some kind of light for darker rooms/rainy days.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a great little gadget.  For starters, it produces NO light...  especially the blue tones, which are proven to interfere with later efforts to sleep.  Of course, that means that you can only read when there's light available. It's light in weight...  probably about the same as a paperback book and it's similar in size to a paperback.  Best of all, it looks like its battery lasts in excess of a week.  I couldn't be more pleased!",I love this thing!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have had this maybe a week and a half. I unfortunately have been in a spell where I am not reading as much as I like, but that being said, so far I am pleased with my purchase. It responds quickly and is easy to read.","I unfortunately have been in a spell where I am not reading as much as I like, but that being said";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I already owned the Fire HD 7 which I enjoy very much. The Fire HD 7 works well as a tablet and a reader but it can get a little heavy after a long period of time and the battery life is limited in heavy use. I decided I wanted to try a dedicated reader and I have been very happy with my purchase. The Kindle 6 Glare Free Touchscreen is lightweight, easy to use and I have not charged it in weeks even with everyday use. This device is not backlit so you must have a light source to read by (just like with a real book) and it does not display color which is not a big issue. If you need a color display you can always put the Kindle app on your other devices. Highly recommended.",Lightweight and Fun to Use;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a great new innovation to the Kindle series. This is my fourth Kindle.  Two have failed and I was ready to try a touch screen.  It is smaller and thus easier to carry, but Amazon has done a great improvement over the former touch screen technology.",This is a great new innovation to the Kindle series;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I am having some problems with this Kindle.  It's freezing up ever so often and I just have to turn it completely off, wait a while before turning it back on and then it will work for a while longer.  May have to send it back....",I am having some problems with this Kindle. It's ...;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this for my 9 year old grand-daughter's Christmas present.  I had forgotten how dim the pages appear on the ""regular"" Kindles.  It is very gray and a light source is definitely needed when reading inside.  I would not have purchased this model if I had seen it in person.  Should have bought a Paperwhite instead.",Dim and dark;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"OMG this is literally my favorite object in the world. I love it. I cherish it. I have barely put it down since I opened it a few days ago. As a commuter into NYC this is going to be my best investment ever (especially since I got it through the Lightning Deal on Prime Day). I had a charger butt already, so I didn't need to splurge on the additional butt, but I think it's annoying that it comes separately. I guess Amazon has to make up for their unsurpassable customer service some how.Anyway, I didn't buy a screen protector (I forgot about it), and I'm glad I didn't. First of all, I tend not to touch my electronics (computer, phone, tablet, etc) with sticky/greasy/disgusting fingers so I wasn't concerned about that, but I knew fingerprints could be an issue, and later on pretty distracting for reading. This screen is pretty matte to begin with, and with a gently touch I haven't noticed any prints or weird smudges on the screen.Also, the no button thing some people were complaining about I find as a non-issue. Just tap the top and it's basically like a home button.5 stars. love it love it love it.",This seriously can't get any better.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I like this kindle much better than my Kindle fire.  (I have an older version of the Kindle Fire).  I had the very first kindle e-reader, and this one is very similar.  Light to hold, and great for sunlight etc.  I only wish it did light up for night reading.  With that said, I use this one for daytime and my fire for night time reading.",I like this kindle much better than my Kindle fire;;;;;;

Review: The Kindle arrived on time and was packaged well.  I was able to quickly download my books from the Amazon cloud to the Kindle.  The screen is truly non-glare and I see plenty of reading time on this.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have an IPad so I didn't know how I would feel about the Kindle, but thought I would pick one up on sale and take it to the beach. You can read the Kindle in any kind of light with ease. The controls and features are very intuitive and easy to use. The Amazon library of books is huge. I found that the Kindle and the IPad are not the same animals and that having one does not exclude the other!",The controls and features are very intuitive and easy to use;;;;;;

Review: I love my Kindle. This one I purchased for my granddaughter for doing so well in school. She's an avid reader and I thought it would be the perfect gift. I've used my iPad in the past but nothing compares to holding the Kindle for reading.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I should probably start my review by stating that I've never purchased or used a Kindle before so I cannot compare it to other models.  The immediate issue I found with it has to do, I suppose, with my reading habits and not the device itself.  I like to read in the evenings after the day has wound down and, by extension, it is usually dark.  Without a backlight or some other pop-out LED, I can't read it.  Well, books don't come with lights either so this is hardly the fault of the Kindle.  So I searched for a case with a popout LED.  Suprisingly, this is harder than it sounds.  After much searching, I finally found one for $59.99, exactly what I paid for the Kindle itself.  So now it costs a little less thrifty $129.99.  Well, surely the books, given that there is no printing or shipping involved, must be fundamentally cheaper.  Nah, not so much.  Some Amazon sellers have paperbacks for less than the electronic version of the books I want to buy.  Hmmmm.Well, I'll say this for it.  I can pack hundreds of books in one little device and its easy to use and read.  So, there's that.  5 stars if you put on the sale page for my Kindle ""Here are some accessories that fit your device"".","Very good, with some caveats";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I love the Kindle for easily reading ebooks that I get for free from my local library's ebook lending program, or free through Amazon prime (though at times I buy books I can't easily get for free). Unfortunately though, this is my third Kindle in about as many years because my first one stopped working after about a year, and my second one's screen cracked somehow. For this one, I've bought a nice cover that will hopefully keep it protected so it will last longer.I would give it a 5 star rating if I didn't have longevity issues with my previous Kindles.","Great ebook readers, but are they made to last?";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had been wanting a Kindle reader for quite awhile and when it went on sale for $49 I couldn't resist!  I have a Kindle Fire tablet, but I always found it too heavy for comfortable reading.  This new Kindle is very light and easy to carry and hold.  I'm actually reading books again!",I'd forgotten how much I enjoy reading!;;;;;;

Review: I really liked this. It's very easy to use. Plus the weight is really light and I can make the text bigger. Plus I can get my books a lot easier than I thought. The only thing I don't like is that I have to go into a Wi-Fi Hot Spot...but other than that it's very good.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I enjoy reading so I had to own one of these to avoid all the bulk Books taking up space in my home. This kindle came well wrap and very protected without damage. small yes and easy to carry around in purse or bags. Very light weight and can be held with one hand for hours. Easy to purchase kindle books just a click away. You have to be watchful when shopping in kindle bookstore because at a click of a button you can place an order and not even realize it, that is how sensitive this kindle is. Have no worries amazon was great in reimbursing me and showed me how to turn off this feature in my kindle. I have purchased books not only for me but my daughter as well who loves to share my kindle with me. Try this kindle you will not be disappointed.",I enjoy reading so I had to own one of these ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this Kindle for my 10-year-old niece and she LOVED IT :) She said ""Thank you SO MUCH auntie, I got Everything I wanted this Christmas!!!"" This came at a great price of $59 right before xmas too!!! (Sorry that I can't comment on the performance of this item;" just wanted to share what a great gift it is for preteens)""
Review: This Kindle was a HIT! ";);;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I was hesitant to get an e-book reader, but I read a lot and the books were taking up too much space in our house. My husband suggested we try the kindle and I LOVE it. I have been reading more because downloading books is so easy. The battery life is awesome - which was one of my hesitations about buying the reader.",Hooked;;;;;;

Review: This little baby has single-handedly kindled (pun intended) my daughter's desire to read. It's a great morphing of the kindle paperwhite and the Fire.  Great for encouraging reading without getting a bunch of internet gadgets you don't want a younger child to putz with.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love the Kindle. I just needed something to read on, without other bells and whistles of tablets like the iPad. Works well and if you just need an e-reader and not the other functions of a full tablet, then this is for you.Battery life is also long, unlike tablets. I can ready for 4-5 hours a night and it will last almost 2 weeks.",Perfect if you just need an E-Reader;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Great reading tool that makes my life much easier! This kindle is great for reading, even better than my iPad. It is really easy on my eyes since it has the same brightness as my surrounding. The battery is amazing because I can charge it once for a month of reading. The Word Wise feature is also great for reading harder books since it automatically translate difficult vocabulary into simple definitions. I would definitely recommend it and buy another one for my kids.",Perfect gift for students;;;;;;

Review: Screen is crap. When I flip the pages it stutters and is not smooth. It takes a bit before the words on the page are even readable. If I could return it I would. Just bought it black Friday online from staples. Its not returnable after you open it and put books on to try it out. Spend your money elsewhere.
Title;;;;;;: Get a nook. I wasted good money on the kindle.;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a great reading device. I replaced my first Kindle Keyboard which owes me nothing and functioned well for 6 years. I read almost 500 books with that Kindle. While I could read on one of my other devices, there is something so comfortable about a Kindle. Seems just like reading a real book. I love it. Mostly, I download books from my county library.",Time for a New Kindle;;;;;;

Review: I never thought I would like a Kindle or a Nook. I  got one as a gift.  I am a book reader but I have really been enjoying my new kindle. If your thinking of getting one get the Kindle Fire...then you can join you library cloud
Title;;;;;;: I'm a book reader but i love my Kindle.;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Great product thus far. my first kindle. I enjoy not having to hold the pages open, and also be able to access new books via amazon account on my computer when I feel inspired to and not having to wait or trek to a library. The display is comfortable to read from and easy to navigate, although sometimes it can bit a bit challenging in comparison to a full on tablet display - although i would take this any day of the week over a tablet for reading, regardless of what i just mentioned. I enjoy being able to touch anywhere near the edge of the ""page"" to turn to the next page.I have not tried other Kindle products but do enjoy the newspaper style color scheme, it is easy on the eyes. I'm not sure how I would feel about a stark white back ground, if that is what the Paperwhite model offers.BEST feature: A dictionary at a moments notice, by simply highlighting a word you will get an in-page dictionary definition/diplay with an option for Wikipedia info. it feels as if i can have a custom footnote at anytime for any word, great for many uses. Also it then keeps track of the words you looked up in a vocab-builder, which is nice to review later.the fact that the screen is not centered in the item/case (having a thicker dimension below the screen) is actually beneficial, as it allows the kindle/book pages to not be hidden behind the folds of a blanket for example, so I am actually and very happy then it is not symmetrical top to bottom.Negative: mainly because I really dislike the means and methods of the advertising industry in general - The Kindle never ""turns off"" even if you turn the screen off.. by morning time, there will be a display showing some book or amazon product for sale. This feels imposing to my personal space, as I often may leave the kindle next to my bed.. then to wake up and have an advertisement in my room just doesn't feel appropriate. Of course this is minor and doesn't ruin the product by any means, and can easily be fixed by simply turning the device over for example. But, I wish I didn't have to see the advertisement each and every time as I open/unlock my book/kindle just as I am getting relaxed/clearing my mind from all the materialism and other issues of the world and am looking forward to reading. Maybe its an odd thing to mention but I thought it would be worth sharing.",Good product. I have not tried other Kindles but am very happy with the function and display.;;;;;;

Review: This is my second kindle and the first with a touch screen. My only complaint is that I wish the borders (black part) were wider because every time I move or shift I accidentally hit the screen and then my page turns or some drop down pops up. Its really really annoying in that regard.
Title;;;;;;: Wish the sides were wider so I'd stop hitting the touch screen and turning the page when I don't want to.;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I like how it works, and I am able to understand it (even at 73 years old).....BUT, I seem to have lost most of the books I had on the other kindle I had....I saw them when I first opened this kindle, so know they were there, but can't find them now..... can anyone help me, please?????",I need help in finding my lost books;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I received my kindle as a gift and loved it instantly. It's light weight and small enough to take anywhere. The battery lasts forever, I've read 4-5 books on one charge. I would recommend to any book lover.",I absolutely love how easy it is to use and having multiple ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am so far pleased with the 6"" Glare-Free Touchscreen. I love the size and light weight because it makes it so much easier to carry it in my handbag when ever I go out and also when I travel on a trip. I still have to get use to it and learn a few more things about it.  Of course I made a great purchase and saved a lot of money when I bought it on the big sale day.","I am so far pleased with the 6"" Glare-Free Touchscreen";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"What can I say that hasn't been said. This is a great piece of electronic hardware. It's an elegant and portable way to carry your entire library with you. For those bibliophiles out there, this is a must have. I wish I could transfer the books I own physically over to my Kindle without having to repurchase everything.",This is a great piece of electronic hardware;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Giving the Touchscreen Display only four stars because Amazon does not provide a book cover with a light. You can buy a book cover but you have to buy a separate light which is cumbersome and really, really sucks.",really sucks.;;;;;;

Review: I didn't want my Kindle FireHD to get wrecked somehow when I go camping or to the pools with my children. So I purchased this one to take along in its place.  It pretty basic but  it serves its purpose and works well.  I would not recommend it as a gift.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"My Kindle of many years was broken and not repairable. I ordered a new one and it is awesome. No buttons, totally touch screen, I like it. (I reserve ""love"" for living beings.)  It was refurbished, but looks flawless. I would not hesitate to purchase again. If you have no Kindle, buy one.",Forced reluctant upgrade.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I already had a 1st generation Kindle, but I was having a problem now and then. My wife surprised me with the Kindle 6"" for no reason. I have used it exclusively since I got it and I love it. Next will be the Kindle Fire like she has.","Kindle 6, Glare Free";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a wonderful thing to have, it's very easy to use, it holds lots of books, and the battery lasts for a long time. Although I still like paper books, I love my Kindle and take I it with me everywhere I go. I'm not bothered by the fact that it doesn't have an inbuilt light, as the battery lasts longer this way, and there are reading lights made specially for this. I bought a cover provided with a reading light, and I'm very happy with it.",very nice;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love this item! I received this as an early Christmas present from my husband as he knows I love to read. I've had it a couple weeks and it especially has been helpful in getting my daily time in reading the Bible and having easy access to read is so nice because I for the last few years have been reading books on my pc for kindle. I had a little learning curve with making sure to buy books that work with kindle as I got a sudoku one thinking it'd let me play on touchscreen - hah nope. That's okay I returned that book, lol. Thank you for this affordable and good quality device!",Great Christmas Gift;;;;;;

Review: Under powered processor I have complained about that one issue for YEARS across three version of Kindle.KeyboardTouchAnd this one.Every*#{] one of them had a DRASTICALLY UNDERPOWERED PROCESS.PLEASE INSTALL A FASTER PROCESSOR!!!!!!
Title;;;;;;: Amazon never listens PLEASE INSTALL FASTER PROCESSORS!!;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Got this kindle as a gift for my oldest daughters 13th birthday. She's an extreme reader, we don't have enough house for the amount of books that she's accumulating so the kindle is perfect for her. I'm a kindle fan. I've had pretty much all the kindles, kindle hd, all the way to the kindle fire phone. What I love about my daughter's kindle is that all the books that she reads are free through Amazon Prime. Set up was easy and there's a step by step explanation on how to use the kindle. This is by far, for our family, one if the better e readers.",kindle fan;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This was ordered to replace one I had ""lost"" or so I thought.  The day after this one arrived, I found the old one.  Since I like it so much, I decided to keep both.  I would encourage anyone who loves to read to get this one.",Since I like it so much;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had to replace my old kindle.  So I just received it a couple of days ago, but far so good, though.  The only thing I think is missing is the audio reader.  Maybe I just have not located the feature yet.  But other than that, I am pleased with the smaller size and touch screen.",Nice!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love taking my  kindle everywhere. I can read the books I want at a reduced price. Now I only buy paperback or hardback of the series that I collect. I even read my kindle while I exercise. Everybody who loves to read, needs one.",I love taking my kindle everywhere;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have not used this new kindle much yet, because I have many books on my older Kindle and I didn't see any sense in moving them.  I took advantage of a good deal just to have an extra one on hand.  It works fine and I do have some books to read on this new one.",I took advantage of a good deal just to have an extra one on hand;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm loving the light weight and easy to hold nature of it. Even though I own an iPad, a iPhone, and the first kindle fire, I found that I needed to be able to read without light shining in my eyes, and without glare. It was priced affordably.  I've since enjoyed many hours of reading.",Sometime an all in one solution is not the solution you need.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I absolutely love this reader! I am still learning my way around but the touch screen is wonderful and easy to read. I didn't want anything larger than my first Kindle and I ordered the carrier as well. It's something I will enjoy for a long time. I can't go further with my review because I still haven't explored--or learned about all that the guide explains, yet. So, until later, I am in the middle of a new SyFy book!",This One is Perfect ForMe!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love the size!! It fits perfect in my purse!!I have two nooks and an iPad mini, but I love the size of this!! Very light and easy to carry around!!It's great if you like to read outside!!",Love it!! Great for just reading!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I was one of those people that promised myself to never buy one of these things, but I had to acquire one to get affordable versions of my expensive college books. Now that I have one I wish that I had invested in them years ago. I would've save so much on my college books alone, not to mention my own personal library. The only negative thing is have to say about this kindle is that you can't read in the dark and that seems a little rediculous sense this is essentially a small tablet and we already have that technology.","Good investment, especially if you're in college";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I like it but I have been spoiled with my paperwhite, I cant go back.  This was my sisters,  occasionaly she bemoans the loss of her kindle 2 with no ads and 3g.  There really is no going back from 3g and no ads. But you probably won't notice what you never had as this is the entry model.",I like it but I have been spoiled with my paperwhite;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"It doesnt unlock everytime I leave it for a while. Even ""slide to unlock"" screen doesn't come back. Stuck on the lockscreen ad. Total reboot is the only way I can get in. I tried factory reset, no help.",It doesnt unlock everytime I leave it for a while ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"It's fine. I just liked my Kindle w/ buttons better. It is very difficult to get back to screen where you search etc. after you have finished a book. And I have yet to figure out if you can view archived items. When I go to buy a book,that I know I have already purchased, it tells me I have already purchased it but does not have a place where I can view archived items (that I can find) like my Kindle w/ buttons.","Kindle 6"" Glare-free Touchscreen";;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I previously owned a Kindle with buttons (to change pages, go to home page, etc.)  that I loved. unfortunately when traveling something pushed into the screen and broke it, and Amazon doesn't fix the screens, so I had to order this one. I absolutely hate the touch screen. It is way too sensitive so I end up jumping between pages randomly, or highlighting/pulling up the dictionary for random things if I hold it down for even a split second too long. I also hate that I can't bring it to the pool or the beach because I try to put it in a plastic bag to protect it from the water and the plastic bag just constantly pushes against the screen and hits random features such as changing the text size and font, highlighting passages, and pulling up the dictionary. It is impossible to read this way. I really wish Amazon would just come back out with the Kindle version with buttons-not everything needs to be touch screen!",Hate the Touchscreen;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this to replace my original Kindle, which finally gave out.  I had some misgivings based on the less-then-five-star reviews I read but couldn't be more pleased with my decision.  Everything works and the screen is easy to read.  Love my Kindle!",I had some misgivings based on the less-then-five-star reviews I read but couldn't be more pleased with my decision;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first E-Reader and it has really made  me to get into reading again. I find the screen to be easier on the eyes then the Kindle Android app or Kindle Fire which my wife has. I don't read in bed, so there is no need for a back light such as the Paper White. Set up was quick and there isn't much of a learning curve. If you have a smartphone, you shouldn't have any issues operating the Kindle.  For $59 I am very happy with Kindle Glare Free and have already read a couple of novels on it.",Nice entry level E-Reader;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"My wife is always reading so I grabbed her the kindle for the sake of time and convenience.  You won't find a better product for a better price.  ""How much did you spend!"" I was asked.  ""Not as much as you think I did.""  Don't get me wrong, I love books.  The tangibility, the smell (yes, I know) the shelf that collects new works and old classics, but when she can't fit a John Sandford hardback in her purse, she certainly can fit that kindle in.^ that should sell the kindle itself.Buy with confidence, it's a great product.  What would make it better and 5 stars?  A backlight.  For those who read in bed.","Not bad, not bad at all";;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"The feel of the unit is somewhat light and ""cheap"". It does what it is supposed to do by allowing you to read the e-books but the processing power behind it feels a little slow. Some menus are slow to load, slight lag in between screens.","The feel of the unit is somewhat light and ""cheap"" ...";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this for my daughter and she didn't like it, she already had kindle fire before but got broken so I bought this, but she said that its ok to read but fire was easier to read.but she already has laptop and smartphone so for me she don't need any internet on kindle so I love the price.over all I loved the price. so I give 4 star.",good price;;;;;;

So if all you want is to purely read than this is for you. This did replace my old kindle touch which could download such productivity active contents.",7th Generation vs. Kindle Touch;;;;;;

I don't mind the special offers at all since they don't interfere with the books I'm reading while I'm in them. If you love to read, do yourself a favor and pick this up. No regrets whatsoever. :)",Best thing I have ever bought for myself;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Okay, I had one of the original Kindles, the first version of this one. This one works okay but turning pages is more awkward.  However, I bought for reading during down time at work and it does what I wanted.","Not great, or close to it, but it does what I bought it to do";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I really have enjoyed this Kindle its 6"" and the words appear nice and big and bright for easy reading inside or out. This is my first Kindle but for the price I don't think have made a better choice. It would be a great device for a child that enjoys reading and its simple to work.",Great device for the price!;;;;;;

Review: I prefer the ease of navigation on my ipad vs the kindle. I wanted to take for travel books and found it a challenge to flip around between the pages. Hated not having a good zoom function and prefer the color on my ipad. It was not very touch sensitive either.My mother loves her kindle for book reading so don't let me comments deter you. Best part is it's ability to hold a charge. It's pretty incredible.
Title;;;;;;: Hated not having a good zoom function and prefer the ...;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"It's much lighter to carry in my purse than the Fire HD 7"" however the ""collections"" option is in need of an upgrade.  I had the keyboard model several years back and when a book was put in a ""collection"" it didn't appear anywhere except there.  On this model, it still appears in ""books"" as well as the ""collection"" you filed it under.  This was a great option since not all books go into a collection it would much easier to organize your books and/or collections.  Once it's moved to a collection it should no longer appear under books.  When I first started using this model it seemed a little difficult to turn the pages but I've since learned that if you ""tap"" the center of the screen it will turn to the next page.",Collections and Books Need Upgrade;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"great little device! a back light would be good now and then. I was able to upload a number of PDF files, or books. They must be loaded into the DOCUMENTS folder on the Kindle, then they show on your book menu.",great little device;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I hesitated for a long time to buy a Kindle as I love real books. So when I finally took the plunge I was pleasantly surprised. I love that my Kindle is lightweight, easy to carry and stores many books in a tiny space. Its non-glare screen makes outdoor viewing very easy, and on windy days I can read hands free whilst eating lunch, without having to worry about pages being turned. It never loses my place, i can bookmark passages easily and highlight text if needed. If I'm reading the book on more than one device, it will sync to the furtherest page read. The device holds a charge for weeks. The only drawback is the inability to read the screen in a darkened room. For that I have a tablet and use the Kindle app for android, but I cannot read the tablet in broad daylight.",Love It!;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Some of these ""did you read the description??"" reviews are a bit harsh, considering that many people drawn to a low-cost e-reader may have never purchased one before, and don't really know what to look for.  Such was the case with my husband who got this for me for Christmas. I wanted an e-reader so I could read a book without being interrupted by texts and other notifications popping up on my screen (without having to mess with my phone's settings every time I stopped and started reading) and so I could read in bed without turning on a lamp or draining my phone battery.  Having zero experience with designated e-readers, my husband thought they'd all be like my daughter's iPad, or our phones: lit.  This is not. You can read from this Kindle under the same conditions you can read from an actual book.  No reading without the bedside lamp. So that in itself was a deal-breaker for me, but some other impressions I had: this thing is so lightweight, I love that about it! Also, the dictionary and character bio features are awesome. I can't tell you how many times I'll be reading a book, and someone who disappeared in Chapter 2 comes back in Chapter 12, and I have to go flipping back to Chapter 2 to remind myself who he is.  For the negative though, coming from the Kindle and Nook apps for iPhone, I love their animated page turns.  You don't get that with a ""real"" Kindle.  For video editors out there, the effect is comparable to a one-second cross-disolve. It's something I'd get used to, but it felt strange at first.  But I never did get the hang of paging through my library. Sometimes it would lag, sometimes it would flip perfectly, other times I had to try to flip three or four times. Strange.  This device also has no kind of contrast control.  Not-quite-pure-black type on a gray page is a little tough to read, but you get what you get.  I do a lot of graphics work, and the slightly bitmapped appearance of some of the larger images/icons on the page bothered me a lot, but I'm betting most people wouldn't notice or care.So, if you know what you're looking for and understand what you're getting here -- a simple e-reader without any kind of backlight/front-light, whatever, my guess is that you'll be perfectly happy, because that's what this is.  But if you've been using a Kindle or Nook app on a tablet or phone, know that this is different. It seems like the Kindle Paperwhite is more of what I'm looking for, so I'll try to convince the hubby to upgrade. :-)",It's is what it is -- which is nothing like the Kindle app for your phone.;;;;;;

Review: This is my second Kindle.  I love the smaller size and lighter weight.  The touch screen was easy to get used to.  My first Kindle was over five years old.  This new one has many more features and conveniences.

I'm totally enjoying my Kindle. I only have one regret... that I didn't purchase it sooner. I've cleared out my hardcover library and am enjoying the extra space. A great device. I just wish that it came with step by step operating instructions and a better user's guide. I'm still trying to figure out how to do stuff and that's AFTER reading the owners manual they provided.
Title;;;;;;: A great device. I just wish that it came with ...;;;;;;

Review: This is my 2nd Kindle and it's as good as the first. It took 1 1/2 days to be delivered and it was delivered on a holiday..I ordered a cover for it from Amazon 10 days ago and it hasn't even been shipped yet. I know where not to go next time!
Title;;;;;;: This is my 2nd Kindle and it's as good as the first;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Great Kindle for basic reading.. I don't use mine nearly as much as I used my Fire HD but if you want a cheap kindle just for books, this is it.. The eInk screen allows this device to stay charged for weeks with tons and tons of use.. I have received about 3 weeks on a single charge with hours a day of usage!!  Amazing battery life..A few things to keep in mind.. 1.) This is an entry level Kindle so there is no backlight!  I knew this before hand but have read a few reviews where people ding it for that reason.. 2.) Unlike older entry level kindles, this one does have a touchscreen which makes it much much easier to use.. The touchscreen alone is worth the upgrade if you have owned a kindle in the past..One of the keys I love about this kindle is there are no notifications like my fire HD.. Ill be reading on my fire HD and get an email ""notification"" and stop reading to check it, usually knowing it isn't important.. Its just something people do now days so no push notifications on this device is GREAT..There are tons of reviews here on amazon but my review hits the keys that mean a lot to me.. Hopefully other readers will feel the same when reading this review.. If you would like me to review or answer something else about this kindle feel free to ask in the comment :-)",Great basic Kindle!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I Love this!!!  It is my 4th Kindle, and I purchased it simply for travel, dr. visits, all those things that you hurry up and go to then sit and wait......It is well worth the cost. I have a kindle fire as well that I love, my original kindle has the page turn buttons on the side. I love both and use both. This is actually much more simple and easy to use for me, one handed, riding a bike......but I still love my old one as well. I don't like carrying my kindle fire every where I go, this was an inexpensive way to have something small and lightweight always with me in my purse so I can read whenever I have that few extra moments. It sets up quickly with no problems, easy to use instructions walk you step by step. Very happy wth this purchase!!!",My 4th kindle and I simply love it.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Spend the extra money for the paperwhite. I have the paperwhite and LOVE IT. I bought this one for my husband because he hunts and reads in the tree stand. No need for light when hunting right? Well at home, at night, he has to read with the light on, or if I'm sleeping he will wear one of those head lamps.  We've purchased several ereader lights to attach and none of them work well.",I have the paperwhite and LOVE IT. I bought this one for my husband ...;;;;;;

Review: meh. It's lightweight and small. Feels a bit chintzy I would probably have to wear readers to get more words on the page which I don't care to do so it will be lots of flipping. Hoping it will all be worth it when I'm reading a good book on the beach
Title;;;;;;: Hoping it will all be worth it when I'm reading a good book on the;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Freaking awesome!  The kindle beat reading from a backlit Tablet or a laptop.  The Battery last for Ever and I now have all my books with me everywhere I go.I have literally read 3 book since having it.  My reading has increased 200% because of having my kindle.This isn't a purchase, it's an investment in your mind.",Just Buy it NOW!  Obey;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"The Kindle itself is flawless.  It's light of weight, but to the point of feeling cheaply made.  Seemed to work very well, however.  I thought when I bought it, that I'd be able to find a cover with a built in light so I could read the thing in the dark (I had a great case with a built in light for my Kindle Touch).  Amazingly, there is no cover with a built in light, anywhere!  I could have bought a little clip on light, but my fear was that it would snag on something and make me drop the Kindle, plus, they just look shabby and klutzy.Ultimately, I returned the Kindle and upgraded to the Paperwhite, which has a built in light.  Read my review for that device on it's review site.",Lacks accessories.;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"The screen is too sensitive.  Every time I touch any part of the the screen lightly by accident all sorts of windows pop up.  I like the first kindle better.  Also, the edge is very thin and it's hard to hold it without getting a hand cramp.",I like the first kindle better;;;;;;

Review: This e reader is a pain in my ass! It's too sensitive I can't even put the device down without pages being accidently forwarded and losing my place or having the text change size on me! Navigating it is not as easy as the nook either! I prefer the nook!
Title;;;;;;: Navigating it is not as easy as the nook either;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a great companion for my Fire HDX.  Do a lot of RVing and could never read my Fire HD out on the patio and even had trouble reading it inside because of the glare.  Love the size, too.  Can now read my books anywhere.",This is a great companion for my Fire HDX;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my new e-reader, I have a Nook but it is old and does not want to turn the page like it use to. The Nook was really driving me crazy and this was such a good deal I could not pass it up. They had it for 49.00 around Christmas time, so why not. Saved some money and my sanity.",Five Stars;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"The package came with a tight plastic wrap around it that was full of dirt or sand. It's really kinda gross, how am I supposed to wrap this up and give it to someone. I can't belive someone actually shipped this crap to me. It looks like they dug it up out of a sand box. It's too close to christmas to exchange.",full of dirt or sand;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"The touch screen is a real step up on the older kindle I had, I'm loving it.  Wish I bought the one with backlighting though.  I've become a fan of a dedicated device that doesn't get email / internet - just for reading","Handy, love this device";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first e-reader.  I avoided the purchase for a long time due to the lighted screens.  I have a significant problem with the LED screens and other bright screens giving me headaches.  I need to adjust the brightness and limit my screen time to avoid migraines.  And when reading a book, I don't want to be limited to such a short period of time.  The fact that this e-reader does not have a lighted screen is perfect for me.  The touchscreen is easy to use.  I am still getting the hang of how to maneuver from one feature to the next as the organization is different than other devices I've owned, but I am sure it will get easier with use.","the screen is not lit, Yay!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Very light and small. For the price and use, I love it. Originally bought to take internationally because I didn't want to lose something I spent over $1,000 on. The ease of use and simplicity is what I wanted and the battery lasts forever!",Perfect reader;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had a Nook before then it froze  cant fix it. Then I decide to buy a Kindle this time. I am impressed with the high quality if this product. The fact that it is special offer does not make any difference. The special offers do not interfere with the reading because when you read, the Kindle does not show any offers. Also the offering pages are nice -  it displays in the Kindle some attractive pictures that works well as wallpaper.  I did not want the backlight version because I have an ipad and the backlight experience impacts on your image during your reading (no matter what they say, it does!) This Kindle is perfect, it is much lighter than my old nook and the letters are bold and easy in your eyes. I highly recommend it  also get the one with the special offer, it is kind of nice, like I said it does not interfere with the reading plus you save money,",Also the offering pages are nice - it displays in the Kindle some attractive pictures ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This latest version represents a significant upgrade from my previous and quite satisfactory Kindle Keyboard.  I have several modes of Kindle reading, including iPad and iPhone, yet this basic Kindle has inherent advantages.  Among these are sheer simplicity, ease of reading in even the brightest of lighting (think beach!), and, as with a book itself, the ability to ""get away from it all"" without having this basic Kindle ring, buzz or otherwise interrupt you for any thousand of reasons.  I might note also that the Kindle Whispersync seamlessly and perfectly works among all you devices!  T.Hunt",Excellent Product!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am in love with my Kindle. Basic and just for reading which is all I wanted. I didn't want a tablet because I felt I would play games and get on the Internet so this is exactly what I wanted. I've had it for a few weeks and haven't charged it since I got it and I read at least 3 hours a day. I bought the $79.99 one with the advertisements and I actually really like it. I found my book light and cover via those advertisements. Also, love that you can go on Goodreads and get a free trial of Kindle Unlimited (which I will keep after th trial is over). Overall, it's the best buy I've made in a long time.",Best buy ever.;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first kindle I'm not overly impressed with it.  I tried the paperwhite first, but the light, even when turned all the way down, was giving me migraines whenever I read on it.  I then bought this kindle and I still get slight headaches reading on it.  I'm very surprised this has 167 ppi.  I have a first generation (2010) nook that has the same 167 ppi.  I would have thought after 4 years, the ppi would be better.  The nook's have continued to be upgraded with each new release, while this basic kindle version doesn't?  I'm really not fond of the touch screen either, I would prefer actual page turning buttons.  The power on button at the bottom is weird.  I can already imagine all the crumbs and dirt that will be stuck in the button from being in my purse.  The power on button should be at the top.  The very plastic edge and back have no grippers or anything to hold on to it with if you buy it without a case to try it out.  It is a little slippery and I actually dropped it a few times because it slipped out of my hands.  Once in a case, it's fine.  I also think the background color is too dark.  My 2010 nook is still the better of the two to read on.","My first kindle, not impressed ...";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"So light and cute!  I love it!  Who needs a light, it's like a real book.  I just use it like a real book only it's super super light to hold in one hand.  It's also better for using before bed because back-lit readers interfere with sleep.",So light!  Love it!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Easy to use. Easy to navigate. I can read for hours without hurting my eyes, just like a real book. I work at a survey call center, so I spend a lot of time waiting for the computer to find a number to call, or for people to actually pick up their phones, and my Kindle has been my constant companion ever since my dad bought it for me a couple weeks ago. The battery life feels like it goes on forever! It does exactly what it is made to do, and does it well. Buying books is extremely simple, and the Family Library my dad set up works perfectly on it. The size is perfect too: it fits nicely into the small pocket on my backpack, but it isn't too small to be comfortable for reading on. I haven't found anything I dislike about it yet. My dad opted for the version with ads when the screen is locked, but I barely even notice they are there. I would recommend this tablet to anyone looking for a way to read ebooks without having to stare at an LCD screen, although everyone should be aware it doesn't do much else. This is an ebook-reading device, not an android tablet. It does not do apps or anything fancy like that, but my phone and laptop already do all of those things for me. It is basically like having your personal library in your pocket. All-in-all, it is perfect for what it is.",Easy to use;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Does the job for ""just reading"" perfectly.  Needed a paper white Kindle for outdoor use and didn't want to spend big bucks.  The ads aren't bothersome as they are just there on your main screen like a screensaver and go away as soon as you ""swipe"" to wake up the Kindle.  Not sure why you would pay more to not have ads.  Just recently started taking advantage of the ""book loan"" feature that a true Kindle is required to access with Prime.  (Doesn't work with the app only). That alone will pay for this Kindle and the Prime membership in a short period of time.",Does the job!;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I go everywhere with Kindle, and the old Kindle had just died.  So a friend bought this one for my birthday.  For the first three days I sooooo, loved it, but than the thing won't turn on, won't do a thing.  I had to wait til the next day to get to a computer to find out how to fix this issue.  When they send out this unit it should have a trouble shoot book sheet in with it.  Because I have heard from a few people that this is a common issue.","loved it, but than the thing won't turn on";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"The intro level Kindle does not have a lot of bells and whistles. However, it performs its primary function very well. It is a great eReader which is simple and easy to use. It is much easier on my eyes than a tablet and makes reading, especially at night, very enjoyable.",Great eReader;;;;;;

Review: I read a lot and pretty much wore my old kindle out. This has been an awesome replacement! I was reading on it as soon as I could open it and turn it on. I found it very simple to operate. I am not very computer savy. I may get one for my mom!

It mys first kindle and I have no ...;;;;;;

Review: Wonderful device. Got it on sale at a super price. Still learning what can be done with it. Already the word definition feature very helpful. Increasing my vocabulary. First and only tablet device I have.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"As always this is a great little Kindle. You can read it outside in the sun and inside but not in the dark as long as you have an add-on light, no problem! If you are new to Kindles this is a great way to start. This unit is a replacement for one that was lost right here on the place and we never could find it...another mystery!",Great little Kindle!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I was on the fence about getting a kindle, and I'm sooo glad that I did. Reading on it is easy on the eyes.  The Kindle is light weight, durable, and very nice for travel. My travel experience will never be the same.",pleasantly surprised!;;;;;;

Review: Very nice unit.  Much easier to read than my previous 1st generation released unit.  I also like the new format for books.  All previous books transferred over seamlessly.  Did have a problem signing on to WiFi and kindle help was NO help however I would recommend purchasing this Kindle
Title;;;;;;: Very nice unit. Much easier to read than my previous ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"i don't know why it took me so long to switch from books to a kindle. i had tried reading on my Note, but the glare made it not so enjoyable. I love love love my new kindle, it really feels like a book in your hands.",I love love love my new kindle;;;;;;

Review: I find it difficult to activate the menu bar at the top. Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I actually enjoy reading with this Kindle, although I will admit I was prejudiced against it because I enjoy actual books. I bought it during black Friday sales, so the $49.00 price can't be beat.",I actually enjoy reading with this Kindle;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Not as easy to use as one might think, but it lets me carry a ton of literature with a few ounces of weight, helping me to reduce the library-grade clutter in my house without giving up on reading altogether.  Clear screen, easy to read, decent software options. No night illumination.",Not as easy to use as one might think;;;;;;

Review: I really enjoy reading on this Kindle.  It is  very light weight and easy to read.  I do find that it is hard to view some book covers on the home screen however.  They seem to be very gray and not clear.  I also love the page turning feature.
Title;;;;;;: very light weight and eady to use.;;;;;;

Review: This is the most basic Kindle I could buy.  I wanted something low-priced that I could take to the beach.  I prefer to read printed and bound books but you can't beat an e-reader when you travel.  This does exactly what it promises to do.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my Kindle for reading.  It's so easy to take to work with me...very lightweight.  So much better than bookcases full of once-read books gathering dust!!!  I do wish it was backlit so that I wouldn't need to turn a lamp on to read after dark, and it can be a little hyper-sensitive when turning a page - or not.  But it can't be beat for the price i paid, that's for sure!!",Love it!;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"If I lay this Kindle down on it's face, it changes it's type size and changes pages.  Definitely not crazy about this, but I bought it to use while on cruises and in the sun.  It works for that purpose.",Get a better one that this option.;;;;;;

Review: Good deal for me at $39.00 although my wife prefers the Fire because of the more brightly lit screen.  This is good enough for me to read my technical books and Bible and dictionary and the battery lasts longer than the Fire.  I would buy it again.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Excellent e-reader. I saw a woman on the bus using this product, I came home went on Amazon website found the e-reader with the paper white and have been pleased. 4.0 out of 5 stars,"A little slow and plastic cheap feeling, but light and small.  Battery life outstanding.  The device is a bit slow seeming, yet otherwise fine.  Kindle search is just getting more confusing every year, with my Prime and my Unlimited trial.  (Utter shock how limited the unlimited selections are in Science Fiction, for example.)  But I got this on sale for $60.  I got what I paid for, definitely.",It's a fine cheap e-reader;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I have one of the 'original' Kindles and have loved it from day 1.  I have purchased various Kindles for other family members and everyone agrees that they are the best! I decided to purchase a newer Kindle for my husband and myself  because the battery on our old models must be plugged in almost every night.  I was attracted to this new model because of the longer battery life and the smaller size. Unfortunately, we all have certain games we love to play on our reading devices in addition to reading great books.  I was not aware that this could not be done on this Kindle. If I had known, I would have never purchased these devices.  I use my new one for reading only (its great for that) and then switch back to my older Kindle to play the brain games. My husband, who is an avid card player refuses to use his new one and is still only using the old one. I had already loaded my books over so I am sure Amazon would not accept a return at this point :(",I have one of the 'original' Kindles and have loved it from day 1;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"girlfriend loves it because it is not heavy and can carry it in her purse when she travels.the only bad thing she found on this was that it has no lighting, so it is hard to read in dark places.",the only bad thing she found on this was that it has ...;;;;;;

Review: I have had the Kindle edition 2 for years and it has received some bumps and bruises along the way.  So for Christmas I asked for a new Kindle.  I am amazed at how small and lightweight this version is.  I am extremely happy with the product and look forward to enjoying the enhanced features on this version of Kindle.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"It was a gift for my husband, trying to get him to switch from paperback to this....he's procrastinating, but I think he likes the idea. He's been loading up on books here and there, just a matter of him actually using it now.",Nice;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"It is ok, however, one has to search for the book each time to findIt. Not easy to use and rather difficult to read in dim light. Should have spent the extra on the back lit model. Better on my IPad.",Not worth it;;;;;;

Review: This is a nice way to read a book. It is the first time I have tried Kindle and the first book (an anthology) only cost $0.99. The screen is clear and I can adjust the font size to suit my old eyes. Changing pages by touch is a snap. So far I have found no negatives.
Title;;;;;;: This is a nice way to read a book;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"The only reason I got this kindle was because my dear wife destroyed my first generation kindle that I have enjoyed thoroughly.  I was afraid of upgrading due to the fear I had of newer kindles not standing up to the first.  The touch screen can be tricky sometimes, but the display is as crisp as ever.  Take a bow Amazon.","1st gen, rest in pieces.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Ive owned an iPad for several years. Actually, Ive owned two iPads (1st iPad & iPad2). Ive loved and hated the iPads. I love the battery life and semi portability of them. Besides my 6 year old playing games on it, I spent 97.4375% of the time reading on the Kindle app. Yet, outside in sunlight iPads are USELESS!! Forget taking an iPad outside and relaxing on a porch or park.So for my birthday, my wife bought me an $99 plain jane Kindle. It is incredible!!  The electronic ink technology is amazing after using glaring screen of an iPad and other tablets. Cuts down on blue light usage at night which allows me more easily fall asleep.  I already had  a decent collection of books.  Because Im a Amazon Prime member it allows me to borrow books from Kindle Owners Lending Library which should pay for the actually Kindle within a year.  Its light and easy to carry my Bibles on the Kindle to church. iPad was always a little inconvenient. Kindle with an Omoton smart case can easily slip in my pants pocket.  Sermons/song lyrics can be stored on Kindle for easy access for spur-of-the-moment moments. :)  Its easier to lay down on a podium and see from any angle without an obvious glow. Others around you are less likely to be distracted by an electronic device being used.Bookmarks, notes, search features allows me to easily replace iPad for speech giving and church usage. Not even considering the huge price difference between an iPad and basic Kindle I would consider readers and laptop owners to try a Kindle e-reader. I recommend for preachers, musicians, and book lovers alike.I learn more with the Kindle's built in dictionary, Wikipedia, X-ray, and search features. VERY happy with my gift!",Ive loved and hated the iPads;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"My new Touchscreen Kindle is great.  It is easy to use, being similar to my older Kindle.  I like being able to change the font and the font size of letters.  The one problem I have is it is almost too sensitive.  I gently tap it to turn the page, a feature I like very much.  But if I'm not careful, the Kindle will turn several pages instead of one.  Also I get the dictionary  sometimes when I mean to turn the page.  I do like the dictionary feature, however.  The Kindle is a so fun to use, all these books at my fingertips, and I can get a new one in seconds.  Love it.",My new Touchscreen Kindle is great. It is easy to use;;;;;;

Review: I love this reader.  Great price and easy to use.  You cannot go wrong with this reader.  Sony reader went out of business and I was stuck with a reader that I could not use any more.  I wish that I would have gotten this one in the beginning.

I just got my new kindle. I have managed to kneel on and destroy some other way two other kindles so I haven't had one for a while. I bought this one with three years of protection.I Love the touch screen. The on screen touchpad works very well. Navigating is not clear yet but looks like it will be way easier than with the older Kindle. I've been using my laptop to read Kindle books but it was way to big and uncomfortable.I am learning Spanish. I loved that I could look up Spanish words as I read. I did not have that capability on the laptop. That will be a big plus. It looks like there was a Spanish to English dictionary provided with the kindle also as well as several other languages. I already had dictionaries on my cloud but I'll be able to compare definitions now.I am quite happy!!
Title;;;;;;: I'm so happy to have my new kindle.;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I looove my Kindle! Got it on sale for $60. So far it has mostly been an Anne of Green Gables machine but I have also read more free, marginally awful mysteries from the Kindle store than I care to remember. It's to books what the iPod was to musicyou never stopped loving reading but the Kindle makes it really fun again.Technical details: reads just like a book. Never have to worry about glare. I have found myself wishing I had purchased the Paperwhite, just because I want to read in the dark and this Kindle doesn't come with a light, but ultimately it's not a huge deal for me. Maybe I'll upgrade in a few years.",Love It!;;;;;;
5.0 out of 5 stars,"Excelent product, very easy to use and very ligth; the screen is a little dark but this is good for lecture;"I had troubles to register the kindle (I am in Colombia)
Review: but I contact the Amazon's costumer service chat (in spanish) and they solved the problem in 10 minutes. works perfectly now. Must remember that this is a device only for lecture.""

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I use this significantly more than I expected, and it's great for reading at night. The only downside is Amazon itself. I want a general-purpose e-paper tablet (for email, text messages, and RSS), but Amazon refuses to release anything besides Amazon-consumption products.",and it's great for reading at night;;;;;;

Review: I love the fact that Goodreads is now integrated in Kindle! It's now easier to mark and shelves books there without visiting the actual website. I also have the older version and I can see a lot of improvements in this latest model.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Good if you have some light. Not so good in the dark =) I know that sounds funny and for most people it is a no-brainer, however, some people don't get why you would pick up a Kindle Paperwhite.If you have some decent light (sun, lamps, office, starbucks...not in the dark, or other generally lit places) it works very well.  Still haven't had to recharge it and enjoy reading on it.",See Light? This one is good. In the dark? Paperwhite would be better.;;;;;;

Review: It was too difficult to figure out. Old kindle was easier. Got an android from AT&T and am reading from the kindle up. Much easier to uunderstand. Wish I had not bought the kindle

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've owned Kindles since the first generation.  Always loved them, prob always will.  I like the regular ereader because backlighting gives me headaches, and these look like paper but I can carry my whole library in my hand.  This new one is super light too.  Love it!",Kindles are awesome;;;;;;

Review: I liked my original Kindle better.  It was bigger and felt more substantial in my hands.  This one is small and easier to misplace.  It slides between the cushions of couch or chair if I'm not careful to put it somewhere specific when I stop reading.  I grew very attached to my original Kindle.  I miss it since it died.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm an avid apple user so I was hesitant to buy another device.  This is IT for reading.  Light weight, no glare,durable and great pool or beach side.Much lighter to carry when I travel then print books.",durable and great pool or beach side;;;;;;

Review: This is my second Kindle. I had a first generation kindle which had more  features than this one does  like page turning buttons and the ability to play audio books.  However I really like having something that is just for reading. It has functioned as advertised with long battery life and glare free screen.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Works very well. Wanted one for a long time and am very happy with the results. Easy to download books, long battery life, excellent view screen with no glare and very light weight. Would recommend ordering a protective cover to protect the unit.",Wanted one for a long time and am very happy with the results;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Kindles are amazing, for anyone who reads. This is the 4th one I have purchased, this one for my grand daughter. Her reading skills were slow until she got her own Kindle. Now she reads all the time. Excellent for children.","Kindles are amazing, for anyone who reads";;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I got this as a replacement for the older model.This model is awkward to hold, has a wide frame and is very thick. The touch screen is an okay but unnecessary addition.",Disappointing;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought this Kindle for my 88 year old mother who is enjoying it very much! Unlike most books, she can choose her font to ensure ease of reading with her aging eyes, while still devouring novels passionately.","Great for everyone,  even my 88 year old mom";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Very easy to hold, lightweight just as promised.  Seems a little sluggish when using download function though not when using cloud.  Battery charges quickly and holds charge as promised.  Nice in the car at night - bright enough for me to read but not so bright that it distracts the driver.  Only drawback is that on the homepage and on Kindle instruction manual the screen flickers, alternating between light background with dark words / figures, then dark background with light words / figures.  Not a huge issue but does interrupt the flow of reading and then leaves me with the same visual experience I used to have when I looked too directly at a camera flashbulb.  I have only used the Kindle  app on my laptop prior to this purchase and am very pleased with ease of use and portability of the actual Kindle.",Very easy to hold;;;;;;

Review: Amazon does have the best e readers in my opinion but I would think that even the most basic would have a backlight to read at night. I find that it's inconvenient to have to have a lamp on or have to buy another e reader just to get some light. Other than that it's pretty good if you just want to read and have your books stored in one place.
Title;;;;;;: Amazon does have the best e readers in my opinion but I would think ...;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is working for my Russian mother in law who doesn't read English.  Hard cover Russian language stuff is very expensive, but digital is three dollars.  She also incidentally isn't computer literate.  She does get help buying the books.",Russian Language availability.;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"If you want a kindle just to read, this is perfect. After coming back to Colombia the wifi was not longer woking. So i can not purchase new books and read them, This is horrible. Its the second kindle i bought.",this is perfect. After coming back to Colombia the wifi was ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love this Kindle.Even though I have a Kindle Fire, I  enjoy the basic 6"" Glare-Free Touchscreen.  I had an original Kindle and this is highly superior--much easier to navigate and deal with reading list with the touchscreen.  Because of the low price of this Kindle, I do not feel the need to put it in a case.  I carry it in my purse when out of the house and use it extensively in the house when I want something really light and easy to hold to read.  I love reading books on this Kindle.  And, sure enough, it will really sync back and forth with my Kindle Fire if I alternate reading the same book on both Kindles.When I buy Kindle books, it is very easy to get them down-loaded on both devices.",Great buy for the money.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"My husband bought this for me for Christmas. I have always been apposed to these devices, I love to go to the Library and read ""real"" books.However, I acually love this Kindle, I read fast anyway and this makes it even faster. The only thing I wish this had was backlighting, maybe I'll buy a little light to fit on it.  This is from his wife, Debra Harris.","I love to go to the Library and read ""real"" books";;;;;;

Review: This is NOT the Kindle to get if you want to have 'apps' BUT it is a wonderful Kindle for the avid reader who prefers that their digital book look more like a real book! I love the fact that Goodreads website link came already installed on it b/c that is where I keep track of all my books and browse the possibilities of future readings!

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"It is exactly what I wanted and, so far, works very well.  I got someone else to get it started, though, because the instructions were not clear to me, a non-tech person.  Otherwise, it is a wonderful product.",Great product;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I couldn't handle the lit up screen on other devices, it's just an eyesore. I get headaches easily, but still want to read. This kindle did the job, and I can actually read and feel like I'm reading a physical book...just without having the weight on my hands, or the glaring screen. Great product.I also enjoy not having to deal with a bunch of applications that distract me from whatever I'm doing. I just want to read, I don't want to play games or surf the web on my reading device. So, this is perfect. It also has the dictionary and glossary search, which is much appreciated. It's so easy to use. Thanks, Kindle.",10/10;;;;;;

Review: Works great for the daily subway commute and if all you need is an e-reader then look no further.Gentleman -  This will fit in your suit jacket pockets. This is clutch if you don't carry a bag or want the hassle of holding it all the time.
Title;;;;;;: Perfect for Subway commute - Fits in suit pockets;;;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"VERY disappointing. Screen is dulllllllllll, cannot get it to brighten. Even our tech tried.Will probably return to store where I purchased.Martha Rudman",Disappointing;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I enjoy reading books, but I am constantly traveling and I never know where and when I am going to settle down, so I don't like accumulating storage, which can come in the form of books. Although I enjoy reading books in their paper format, I don't like buying them when I know that I will probably throw them away. My kindle is so lightweight, easy to use, and easy on the eyes. I read books before I sleep, on the subway- just about anywhere I go. E-books are so cheap, and I have already read so many random books about nutrition and history.",I enjoy reading books;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"It wasn't a bad little device until the latest software update. I will no longer use it, just chuck it in the junk drawer. Instead of having easy access to what I want, I now have to share the screen with suggestion, more suggestions, more; Junk
Review: Tripe
column4: I paid extra to get rid of the ads only to have the new software that I never asked for bring them back on steroids. Guess it was just too tempting for Mr. Bezos to honor the agreement of no ads. Of course he will say they are not ads
column5: but recommendations. Why would I want a recommendation on my next book;" I can't find the last one without using a blood hound. DO YOU GIVE REFUNDS on at least the part about the """"Ad Free"""" version?""
column6: It wasn't a bad little device until the latest software update";;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Purchased 3 of these kindles and gave as presents, didn't get direct feedback from the receiver, but I believe his wife is enjoying one of them.  The other 2, not really sure, but for avid readers, its a great gift.",its a great gift.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Fast, the touch feature helps a lot to make highlight and put notes.Baterry: has been always great in kindle devices.Portability: I can even carry it in the back pocket of my jeans.Price: it can't be better.",Amazon did it again. A++;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This was a gift that I was quite befuddled by at first,but it is becoming more and more something I use every day.  I'm old,so I doubt it'll take the place of a real book all together,but so far it's nice",Gift;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I gave the Kindle 6 inch to my grandson for Xmas. Both my daughter and I had trouble getting it to work so, at this point, all I can say is that I'm disappointed. I have an ipad and it was a breeze to set up. Not sure if anything is wrong or if it's just not easy to use.",Disappointing;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"this is my 3rd kindle..and i love them..i have a kindle fire but prefer to read on the kindle reader,.i have the old version of the reader with the key board on it and def like this new touch screen alot better..well worth the money considering i paid $129 for the old one..lol",and i love them.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I LOVE my Kindle Fire but wanted to be able to read outside.  While this Kindle allows me to do this, I do not like the transitions.  I do not have a problem with turning the page--I do that on my Fire.  The transitions are not smooth.  Not a deal breaker since I only paid $49 but I wish the transitions were smoother.  I don't mind the ads either.  They are usually book suggestions, so they are not completely irrelevant.",Happy except for transitions;;;;;;

Review: This is my first E-reader and I am VERY happy with it. I am glad I purchased it. I was a little worried at first about getting one. I wasn't sure how I would like it. I do read a lot and I wasnt sure how the screen would work and if it would hurt my eyes. I have read half of GOT-Clash of kings and it has been so easy to read. I personally think its easier on the eyes then a book. Its light weight even with a case. I take it everywhere. Anyone considering this should give it a try.
Title;;;;;;: This is my first E-reader and I am VERY happy with it;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Works great. Same touch interface as the Kindle app on my smartphone so very easy to figure out. Very nice to read Kindle books. Only drawback is that reading pdfs on it is nigh impossible, tho it does work fine for Amtrak tickets, hotel reservations, etc - just not reading.",4 1/2 stars;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"It seems the ""designers"" are young people and do not understand or think senior citizens are interested in the Kindle.  The plastic surrounds is slippery & the on/off being black is very difficult to see. The format of books bought should be just shown as a list and not pictures of the book covers.The covers are again------- difficult to see.  BT",Not as good as my old Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love it because it easy to carry than a bunch of books that will weigh you down.  The convenience is what is important, and the book are automatically sent to your Kindle in less than five minutes.  You cannot beat it. I do recommend the Kindle, and in fact I am planning on upgrading soon.",I love it because it easy to carry than a bunch ...;;;;;;

Review: Disappointing.  Did not know I was getting the Advertising version and that there was no adjustment of the brightness.  Looks like it was just a promotion to get rid of some obsolete Kindles.  Unfortunately I threw away all the boxes and can't return it.
Title;;;;;;: Looks like it was just a promotion to get rid of ...;;;;;;

Review: I use it mostly for learning Latin with flash cards that I create using MS Word.  I use a print driver that converts the output into PDF form and then load it on the Kindle Touch.  This is a great tool for learning lists.  And of course it is great for reading books too!  It stays charged for more than a week at a time and I use it over an hour a day.
Title;;;;;;: Great for PDF flash cards too;;;;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my kindle, this my third one and I hate that they got rid of the buttons. My hair changes the page, and you have to do funky things with your fingers to get simple changes like font and the home screen.",Third Kindle and I like the older ones better;;;;;;

Review: didn't realize this was not a lighted display.returned it. Amazon charged me $3 for shipping. I'm fine with that. I can take some responsibility for not reading more thoroughly;" I just assumed it was a lighted display.
column4: but display is not lighted.""";;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I got this Kindle 6"" for my birthday. I think that it would make a good present for everyone else that may be having a birthday. Since I got this Kindle the battery has never gotten below half gone. The wire is 3 ft. and 2 in. long. The Kindle has a Kindle store where you can buy or get for free books. The Kindle has Wi-Fi and can download at speeds under 1 minute. the Kindle has a 6"" glare free touch screen without any buttons on the bottom. This is noce because when you hold your Kindle there is not a bunch of rounded buttons on the bottom. The Kindle has 4 GBS. of storage and that can hold a lot of books. It is not a color screen but is a black and white. Not glowing in the the dark enables it to have a long battery life.",A Whole New Way To Read;;;;;;

Review: I have used a Kindle reader app for my PC for a long time but I have never owned a Kindle reader before. I LOVE this reader. I can make the font as big as I want which is great as I get older. I also love that I can highlight a word or words and get a definition or explanation in the context of the book. Highlighting is easy. The fact that it is not backlit is not a problem as the text is very easy to read even in below average light conditions. The unit is light and easy to hold on a plane or on a deck chair. I bought an Anker cradle for reading at my desk at home as it is just easier to not have to hold at my desk. It is also great that the battery lasts about 2 weeks on a single charge.
Title;;;;;;: My First Kindle But Now I'm Hooked;;;;;;

Review: Love this kindle! I'm glad I went for the cheaper version with special offers since they don't disrupt my reading at all (only show offers when the kindle is idle).  Perfect size for reading at any position and the display is great.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought this as a gift for my fiancee. It is worth so much more than what it costs. She absolutely loves it. I have a Kindle Fire HD, and I can not imagine my life without a Kindle. Thank you Amazon for making such great products that allow us to enjoy reading anytime, anywhere.",She loves it!!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Compared to the kindle fire, this is much easier to read on. I got it for a special price, so I really can't complain. I'm definitely happy with my purchase. However, I wish I had held out for the Paper White. I didn't think the light would make much of a difference but it would be impossible to read on the Kindle without a light on. Since I mostly read at night, I think the Paper White would have been a better fit.",No frills but definitely a great reader.;;;;;;

Review: I bought this for my daughter. She loves to read. She enjoys having the book in hand but enjoys the convenience Kindle brings when traveling. Buying books is easy and the print on the screen is good.  Very good product. Good price.

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"due to the size and the functionality, it's not that easy to use. I have a several year old kindle fire that I really liked, but the glare was frustrating.
