I wish I had gotten a larger size - the 6"" hardly fits much on a page - although it is certainly compact.Functionality is a little clunky and not as easy/intuitive to use as I'd expect.",a little awkward;;;;;;

Review: Was easy to join this kindle for my husband with my own kindle and share books.  My husband loves to read and loves the kindle.  It was a gift to him.......... just because!  He is not tech friendly at all and learned how to use the kindle fast.
Title;;;;;;: My hubby loves the new kindle!;;;;;;

Review: Love my Kindle. I had to purchase a case because the Kindle itself is slippery and small. I wish I bought the one with the light because it will not light up.Easy to work with and downloads books straight to my Kindle without any issues.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchased this as a replacement for the kindle I got three years ago. My buttons where starting to go out and I was happy to have a reason to upgrade. The only think that was disappointing is that my old kindle had free word games I really liked playing but on the new kindle I can't play them. So for that I would have gaven 4 stars, butAll the new features make up for that so it gets 5 stars. I love the xray with the books. Its really interesting how i can learn about the characters And places. I Also enjoy good reads being on there to see updates, my shelves, and reviews. The touch screen responds very well, can be a tad slow but remembering that it's not an LCD screen it responds better than I imagined it would. It is a perfect replacement for my previous kindle and I enjoy all the small details that make it better.",perfect replacement;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought it for my son.  Was comparing with Fire HD 7, 8GB.....End result,Kindle is pure for readers to read.  It is simulating actual book by making sure reads under enough lights. With the technology it has, it's background and words look very much like actual book!Fire HD, having Kindle app, just like iPad Air/iPad mini or other tablets, it's a tablet.  Originally thought it will have option to turn itself to ""kindle"" when  selected, but obviously not.  I have decided to return Fire HD 7...*BTW, I got Kindle for $49 on Prime Day!  $79 for Fire HD 7, 8GB version!Thanks to Amazon!","Kindle 6"" beats Fire HD 7!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"The Kindle 6"" Glare-Free Touchscreen is great.  It truly is glare-free. My favorite thing about it though is the battery life. I've had it for a month and it's almost ready for a recharge! I wish all my electronics had batteries that lasted that long. I love to read and my Kindle is light, fits in my purse, goes anywhere and I don't have to drag a charger with me.",Go Anywhere Reader;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I like this Kindle but I am thinking of upgrading to the backlight version and passing this one onto my son.  A little backstory, I like to read and I bought a phablet last year so I could use my cell to read during lunch.  My current job does not allow cellphones (or any camera/video device) of any type in the office so I purchased a Kindle.  While I like the concept of the Kindle I find that I miss the color screen of my phablet.  Also, I realized that I tend to read a lot a night and not having a backlight requires me to switch between my phone and the Kindle.In essence the Kindle does what I needed it to do but I think the backlight/color screen would be better for my use.",Nice Kindle..Just not sure it is for me.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"It's pretty much everything I wanted in an e-reader. My only complaint is that a slightly sharper screen would be nice. If you look really closely, you can see some jagged edges to text.  But once you're holding it at a normal reading distance, everything looks fine. The battery life is insane. I went almost a month, having read two and a half books, before it needed recharging. The amount of storage is overkill.  I definitely do not need that much space, as I typically read just one book at a time. But if you want to carry a library around with you you can. A definite must accessory for this is a case that can serve as a stand, and most importantly hold it up vertically, not horizontally! Borrowing books from my library is pretty easy;" I just hate the short check-out period. Transferring books from my PC to the Kindle took a little figuring out
Review: but in the end it was a cinch using the free program
column4: two other features I love is the quick ability to look up words
column5: and then how that word is added to a list of words I'd previously looked up that I can then study via flash cards to learn. Very cool! I do not regret not buying the version without the backlight. I always read next to a lamp
column6: and it looks great in natural daylight too.""
column7: Love it. No going back to clunky books.";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I LOVE my Kindle! This is my third one. I previously owned one with a full keyboard and then another ""special features"" one. I really enjoy the touchscreen and new features included on this model. I am very glad I upgraded and use this product quite frequently. Also I bought it on Black Friday so it was a very good price.",Very happy about this model!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Does everything it is expected to. Small, lightweight. Battery lasts a long time.Read the description and you'll not go wrong.The 'special offers' are simply books shown on the sleep screen. Does not mess with the reading experience.only runs .mobi files cleanly (no epub) and pdfs cannot be easily zoomed, etc. Again, this is info easy to look up on the web, but worth considering.All in all, dirt cheap ereader. Good stuff.","Does everything it is expected to. Small, lightweight. Battery lasts a long time.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Having never had a Kindle, I have to say, I am impressed. I had toyed around with some of the older versions (with buttons!) but I have to say that this version is how it was meant to be. It's like something out of the future, ads and all! It's even more minimalistic than your given iDevice, as there is only one physical button, an that's on the bottom edge of the device. The face is just screen and handling area, and I think that's just what it should be.Reading is wonderful on it. The letters are amazingly sharp. It reads like a book - well, in my opinion, better, since you don't have to deal with a device that you need to hold open to read.Before purchasing, I agonized for a while over the ""special offers"". I'm a heavy user of adblockers, and I can't stand most advertising. Honestly, the ads on the device don't bother me. I was quite surprised. There's a small banner at the bottom, but that only shows when in the menus, not when actually reading (which would be abhorrent!). The lock screen is a full screen ad, but the alternative is just a simple lock screen image, so whatever. It doesn't get in the way of anything physically or mentally.I got a refurbished model, but the device was just like new. Maybe it didn't have some extra packaging goodies, but I'm not missing out here. I'm already enjoying reading some Arthur C. Clarke on the device and it works great.",I now prefer this to books;;;;;;

Review: Very Fast Shipping!  I got it like the next day!  Everyone should buy one.  I've downloaded all the free classics.  Vocab builder/ flash cards/ word wise plus additional features make reading so much more interesting. I love X-ray!  Reasonable price!!  Awesome!!
Title;;;;;;: I got it like the next day;;;;;;

Review: screen may be glare free but it's difficult to read the print - the screen is very dim and there is not enough contrast between the print and the background ...
Title;;;;;;: screen may be glare free but it's difficult to read ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Perfect basic kindle.  We bought 3, one for each of my sons, 8, 10 and 15.  I've had a kindle since they first came out, and LOVE IT!  They have so many books laying around, we thought maybe it's time to move to a kindle since it takes up less space.  We travel in the summer in an RV, so these will be perfect!  No more packing six or seven books and lugging them around the country, just one kindle with thousands of books to choose from!  So far they have gotten the hang of it, they love seeing the percent they're on while they're reading.  I've shown the how to look up words and highlight things, they love them!  We've already traveled six hours to visit family, and they've been reading non stop, in the car and before they go to bed.  Perfect Christmas gift!",Perfect basic kindle;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought this at a special price as a Mother's Day present for my mom.  Miss the light as with the Paperwhite and Voyage, but otherwise pleased with it for the price.  It's a little thicker than any other Kindle I've had, other than the first generation Fire I have, but it's still lightweight.  Mom's happy, so I'm happy.",but otherwise pleased with it for the price;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"My sister gifted me a Kindle about a year ago and it has changed my life quite drastically. I'm the kind of person who enjoys watching TV and movie adaptations of stories rather than reading books. But, after getting a Kindle, I've been reading about 5 novels every single month and the experience is just amazing. Recently I read ""the fault in our stars"" and watched the movie too and I could easily relate to why people keep bashing on adaptations. Anyway, coming back to the device. I really love how portable and lightweight it is. Unlike my smartphone, its battery lasts literally forever and I have to hardly ever charge it. The only thing I don't really like it is how it responds to every single kind of touch. It's sometimes really frustrating when you're in the middle of a story and the font changes.",Kinda a life changer :P;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Just as advertised.  My daughter loves it.  It is the next best thing to a real book.  The advertising on it for a $20 savings is no big deal.  It only is on the screen when you first turn on the Kindle.  If it really bothers you, you can always pay the $20 later on to have it removed.  The books that I already had in my Kindle account for my iPad show up on the Kindle.  This was a pleasant surprise.  Thank you Amazon!",Next best thing to a real book!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Enjoying but haven't figured out all the many things available.  Like that the big print makes reading go faster, easier to hold and read in bed, and can get books promptlly.  Need to learn all features like how to lend books etc.  Do really like.",Like that the big print makes reading go faster;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Works great! Purchased it for my middle schooler. They can't have phones, lap tops, tablets, etc at school. They can have e-readers with no games. She uses this kindle as a book only. She always has books with her now. It has really helped her to read more.",Great Purchase!;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I cannot use my lighted cover with this kindle because it does not have the sensors on the back to connect to the light.... very disappointing and limits my night time reading options. Otherwise, it is easy to navigate and use.",it is easy to navigate and use;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Wish I'd gone for a better KIndle - I find the gray screen a bit hard to read by. Would be nicer if it were a paperwhite. But it works OK and if you can handle a light gray background rather than white, it will do the job of an e-reader",Wish I'd gone for a better KIndle - I find the gray screen a bit ...;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"The print on my kindle keyboard has started to fade.  I tried several times to get an answer from Amazon as to why this was happening, but unfortunately no one has been able to help me.  I made all the recent updates thinking that might help, but it has not.  I decided that before all the print fades I would purchase a new one.  I saw the recent deal of $30.00 off kindle e-readers so I purchased the Kindle 6"" Glare-Free Touchscreen.  It is okay.  I am not really thrilled with it, but the price was good.  Maybe I just have to get used to it.  I LOVE MY KINDLE KEYBOARD!  I will keep using it until the last letter fades!  Wish they still offered that one.",The price was good. Maybe I just have to get used to ...;;;;;;

Review: I just love the way this kindle reads. It doesn't hurt my eyes or make me squint in bright sunlight like my other devices.  It has so many functions.  I got this as a dedicatede-reader because I was having so many eye problems from the glare when I would read for long periods on my phone ir tablet. An extra perk to the kindle is that the battery lasts for days at a time! I can take it on a trip without worrying about taking an extra cord. It's just one of the best purchases I have ever made! The only drawback is that there is no backlight for reading in the dark.
Title;;;;;;: Great for eyes tired of squinting from the sun glaring on my phone;;;;;;

Review: To tell the truth I haven't used it much.  It hooked up to Wi-Fi just fine but what I want to read is either not available or expensive to get.  The screen and device seems fine... We'll see how it goes.
Title;;;;;;: It hooked up to Wi-Fi just fine but what I want to read is either not ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've loved it so much that I've ordered one more for my husband! It's awesome to have all your books in just one small and soft little ""book"". Perfect to carry in your pursy wherever you need to go. Don't get crazy choosing what book would like to read today.. Or what are going to do if you are finishing one book but you don't want to carry two books with you.. That's really perfect!",Perfect!;;;;;;

Review: This one's my backup Kindle--I leave the other one in odd places and then can't find it.  So taking advantage of the constant updating so I can pick either one up and keep reading from where I left off.
Title;;;;;;: Worth having a second for those who are scatterbrained...;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"It's a pretty basic product but I knew what I was getting. I just wish the user interface (OS) was better. It seems way too rudimentary. But as for fulfilling its intended purpose (easy, light reading w/o the hassle of carrying physical books), it's superb. Especially if you live in metro area like NYC where you take the subway a lot.",Great for NYC subways!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"it's a kindle..it's awesomeUpdate: Sept 2015Still love the kindle, but would highly recommend getting the Paperwhite model.  You will really want the backlight esp after you start using this more and more.",Five Stars;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"When I saw this advertised one day for $49.99 I thought I'd better get it, put it away for a gift.  When I received it, I decided to open it, remembering my old keyboard kindle was getting old, decided I need to keep it for myself.  What an amazIng deal!  I LOVE THESE THINGS.",99 I thought I'd better get it;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I received a SEALED package that did not include the instructions or manual.  Either one of the handlers or the manufacturer forgot to include the manual.  Very disappointed.  I have been purchasing from Amazon heavily and never had this trouble.  Since most reviews haven't mentioned this with their purchases, I suspect, it had to be a handler.  I only found that a manual was included by watching a video on ""YouTube"".  You will need a manual.Also, if you are buying this as a gift for someone, they per-name you (the purchaser) in the Kindle memory. (?)",Trouble with missing documents;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love This product !Help to read more, light weight, lot of book available (some problem with sentences layout).Perfect to read. As a book you need a light source to read.I'm waiting to see if battery duration is okay but I'm afraid of less than 3 week. (1 book more than 50% battery)It can be interesting to see the percent of battery on device.",Happy;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have had a kindle fire for a while and have been pleased with it as a tablet but I really wanted a reader specifically. They just have a better display for reading, especially outside where the glare of the tablet makes it very difficult to read. Then the debate was regular Kindle vs Kindle Paperwhite. I read a ton of reviews on both and watched video reviews and asked people I knew who had them. From what I gathered, the primary difference is that the Paperwhite has an internal light and the regular Kindle doesn't. Oh and the Paperwhite is $40 more. Amazon has an excellent return policy which I've used before and been happy with, so I decide to save the $40 and go with the regular Kindle, knowing that if the lack of a light really bugged me I could return it and get the paperwhite. Well I've had it two weeks now and I can understand how the light would be useful, but I am 100% pleased with my kindle. It reads perfectly, there are zero issues with the display (I've read reviews with the paperwhite having spots in some cases or uneven light), and it doesn't bother me in the slightest to read under a lamp. I give the Kindle 5 stars because it is exactly as marketed. What you see is what you get, no less, no more. It reads sooooooo much better than my Fire, and it's lightweight and super easy to use.If you're on the fence between a Paperwhite and the regular Kindle, my advice is this: if you regularly read in dim lighting (not just dark but dim) and don't have access to light to read by, think about the paperwhite. Otherwise, save the $40 and get the regular! It's awesome!","For me, regular Kindle was the way to go";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I enjoy this reader very much. I have a tablet,, don't care for it, can't read anywhere there is glare, can't touch anything that it doesn't go elsewhere. The paper white isn't anything like that. I love it.",I enjoy this reader very much;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my Kindle. I love to read and this is easy to hold. and the screen is easy on your eyes. Thanks for making reading fun again.For the longest time I struggled with reading. I had a hard time keeping my place and holding a book was very uncomfortable for me. It never felt natural. I tried reading on my laptop but I look at a monitor for 8 hours a day. It just tires your eyes.This E-Reader has helped me find a new love for reading, I can not put it down sometimes and I seriously look forward to reading everyday. Books are great. And I would never say this is better than a book. But for those of you out there like myself. Those who have trouble reading a normal book out of discomfort. This may be something worth trying.",Reading is fun again.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"My original Kindle died on me when my screen demagnitized. I was heartbroken. This one has a different profile - thicker and shorter, and I am not thrilled with the touchscreen. Still, it is a serviceable replacement and much easier to use than my iPad.",Adequate Replacement;;;;;;

Review: This is a great product. I read a lot and having it all in one device is fantastic.  I had a different e-reader before this one and the screen on this is much nicer than the old one. The only thing I don't like is it is not as comfortably to hold as my old one which had a rubber finish.

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"I bough this for my 11 year old. It worked quite well for a few months, then it started freezing up. I called customer service and was told that my warranty was about to expire, but that if we still had problems with the kindle a week or two after the warranty period Amazon would replace it. Well, exactly a week after the end of the warranty we had the same problem. I called customer service and explained to the lady what had happened. I also repeated my previous conversation with customer service. Well she was absolutely no help, all she did was try her best to sell me a new upgraded kindle. I am very disappointed in Amazon. What a let down, my 11 year old is quite frustrated and upset that she will not be getting any books for Christmas.",Disappointed in Amazon;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I absolutely LOVE my new Kindle! I could not even tell that it was refurbished next to my sister's BRAND NEW one! The screen really is glare free and I haven't had any glitching problems like I've read in other reviews. The battery lasts forever, I ue it every day and have only had to charge it four times in two months. It is very light weight and easy to hold in one hand. Shipping was VERY quick, it even arrived a day early. This product is exactly as described. I would definitely purchase this again as a gift! :)",Love It!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Solid e-reader.  Love the new touch screen.  I do wish Amazon would have the same interface/menu options across all of its devices.  In other words, when you touch the screen on a Kindle 6"" Touchscreen for the menu options, it would be convenient to see the options in the same place and have the identical options as with the Kindle Fire HDX.  I also have a Kindle Fire HDX.  For the price, the Kindle, 6"" Glare-Fee Touchscreen Display is well worth giving it a chance.","The new Kindle 6"" Glare-Fee Touchscreen";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"A great product for a great price! I have always like REAL books so I wasnt sure about buying this product, but after my first book in my kindle I simple fall in love with it. Is very light, confortable to read, and the batteries surely last for days and days.",A great product for a great price;;;;;;

Review: This item should come with some basic operating instructions or at least directions to where instructions may be found. I actually like my former Kindle better even though it is not a touch screen product.
Title;;;;;;: I actually like my former Kindle better even though it is not ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Just as expected! Replaces my old Kindle which now has a defect in the upper right corner. It got injured on a plane trip back from GA at Christmas. The new one is easy to hold, lighter & I love the non-glare screen.",The new one is easy to hold;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I like the size of it very much, but I have had some troubles with it.  Sometimes when I am reading, it freezes up and I can't turn the page.  Then I have to turn it off, back on and it resets to the page that I had started reading, like it never 'synced' for that reading time at all.My daughter also ordered a cover/case for it, but the first ones didn't fit (even though they said they were for the 6"" Kindle.  Finally after the third order I got one that fit.The Kindle is okay, but not great",I like the size of it very much;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Not as easy to switch between books as my original kindle and even though you only need to tap the screen to advance pages, sometimes you have to tap a couple of times. I also have to clean the screen more often to keep fingerprints off. You have to know the exact # location if you want to go ahead in the book as the table of contents doesn't show entirely.",Not as easy to switch between books as my original kindle and ...;;;;;;

Review: I had the original Kindle and loved it. Well it got broken by accident so i needed a new one. I wanted one like I had because I hate change and wanted what I knew. But I found that to get it I had to buy it used and wasn't that much less expensive than this one. It is touch screen  but works great. I found that it doesn't work the same way but it wasn't hard to learn. I love this one now as much as I did the other one. Great Buy!
Title;;;;;;: I had the original Kindle and loved it. Well it got broken by accident so ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Definitively an excellent purchase. I got my kindle a couple hours ago and I already loaded  it with over 40 different books in my 3 different languages. I have a complete library that weights only a few ounces and fits in my pockets. Amazingly, I still have over 2 1/2 gigabytes of storage. Enough space  for hundreds of books. Make sure you download the app 'calibre' to manage all your ebooks in your library.",mesmerized by the ability to carry an entire library in my pocket.;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm actually having a more difficult time with this one than with the Kindle Fire. I now have three products, the original Kindle, the Kindle Fire and now the Kindle 6"". When I order I get a message that the book is going to Kindle Cloud--where is that. On my way to church, will get back with you this afternoon to get some clarification. Oh, by the way, have a Kindle app on my computer.",I'm actually having a more difficult time with this one ...;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this for my dad. He's 80 years old and his vision isn't as good as it used to be. No Light?!?! No Power Cord?!?!I saw the cord wasn't included but I could look past that. A little anyway.This one is clunky and big, too. I didn't like it from the moment I took it out of the box.Clunky and unreadable half the day. It's not even very good in low-light conditions. Ironically my lamp causes a glare on the screen. Major disappointment. Amazon loses this sale.",Oh so very unimpressive;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Extremely easy to use and to get started on. The screen is very effective in all respects. The books download very quickly. The Kindle is both large enough to make the screen perfect, but small enough to carry in larger shirt pockets. Battery life is quite long and the capacity is immense.",Extremely easy to use and to get started on;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I love this kindle! The battery is great, screen is great! It's so much easier on your eyes than a backlit screen. I was a little concerned with the size of the screen when I got it but I don't even notice it while I am reading, so that worry is gone. The only thing I really don't like is that you can't change the picture from an ad when you turn it off. I remember thinking that one of the coolest features about the old kindles was that it would have fun pictures on the screen while it was off. I really detest ads so that was quite the disappointment to me.",Great over all product!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This Kindle is much nicer than the previous one I had, although I really like my last Kindle.  The new Kindle is more compact, easier to hold and the readability is better.  I did have trouble getting use to the touch screen and how the everything works, but the How to book that comes with the Kindle is very easy to follow.  Since I had my previous Kindle for over four years, habits develop..",Better than before;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love the 6"" glare-free touchscreen Kindle.  I owned my previous Kindle for about 5.5 years and was happy with it.  Unfortunately, I dropped it and the inside screen fractured.  I had no idea how much of an improvement the touchscreen Kindle would be.  The size is perfect and the home screen is so much easier to access the different features.  I would definitely recommend it.","6"" Touchscreen Kindle";;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"As a e-reader it is a great device.While it is not the ""white"" version, it is super great, it does not get my eyes tired like an lcd screen and it feel like having a real book.The only thing I feel that the case is made of plastic, it feels cheap at the touch. My wife has another older one that has a ""rubbery"" feel to it: don't different than this one it feels better in the hand.I like the weight, it is super light.",Super great e-reader...don't like the plastic case;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is one of the best purchases I've ever made! I'm an avid reader, and I LOVE the feel of holding a hard copy book in my hand and turning the pages as I read. I am also in the habit of highlighting passages and making margin notes as I read nonfiction, which was a big reason for me not having been open to the idea of an electronic book. When I read the description of the Kindle 6"" Glare-Free Touchscreen and saw that it has the highlight and note feature, I became more receptive to the idea of an electronic book. I chose the glare-free style after some debate because I thought about how difficult it is trying to read the screen of my Smart phone outside. I told myself I would just use the bedside lamp for night reading. Over the last couple of years, I have gotten into the habit of Googling topics on my phone in the dark before going to sleep. Usually, not always, I wake up the next morning with a terrible headache. The first night I read from my new 6"" Glare-Free Kindle, with the bedside lamp for light, I kept thinking to myself, ""This thing is so comfortable to hold....even lying down"". I really liked the fact that I could enlarge the font and not have to keep readjusting my glasses while lying on my side because I re-sized the font enough that I did not have to wear my glasses :-) ! The next morning when I woke up, after having read for hours on the Glare-Free Kindle, my head did not hurt at all! Now when I read outside, I don't have to find a shady spot nor do I have to hold the Kindle in weird positions trying to see what is on the screen like I have to do when I try to read my phone screen outside. Another GREAT thing I LOVE about having many books on the Kindle is that instead of dragging along a heavy tote bag full of books on trips, I will be able to stick my Kindle and my charger in my purse and will still be able to have a choice of what I'm in the mood to read. I'm so glad I finally decided to try something new after fighting the idea of changing to this new-to-me way of reading books for so long!",Old Habits Die Hard :-);;;;;;

Review: Kindle rocks! It's so lightweight and the pages look like real book pages. I just connect a book light to the portfolio cover that I got for it and I'm all set for nightly reading in bed. The battery really does last for weeks.
Title;;;;;;: Just as good as the actual book;;;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"Don't bother.  I bought the Kindle with the ads, and it's impossible to navigate around them.  The Kindle was slow to respond, and when it did, the screen was very dark and hard to read.  I never did figure out how to get to the Amazon store to download games for my daughter, and finally just gave up and returned the thing.  It was quite a disappointment from the Kindle my daughter had a few years ago.  This one is cumbersome and a real pain.",Not worth your time or money;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Finally gave in and got a kindle, and I love it. It's better than a paper book in experience while reading, and touring so many books around is nice. I've barely scratched the surface, but I already wish I would have gotten one sooner. That said, there's a grounding, a nostalgia that only a premiere hardcover novel can bring (tactile, visual, olfactory), and a usefulness that only a paperback study book can bring (note taking, page marking, kinetic mnemonics).","Great for eating up text, but save a place for paper";;;;;;

Review: Three things are really annoying with this:1. The power button is at the bottom and it's really easy to hit it. Would it be so hard to put it at the top?!2. It doesn't turn all the way off.3. It comes with a power cord but not a wall charger.However it does what it says it does. It's a no frills ereader and despite the annoying bits it is easy to use.
Title;;;;;;: Three things are really annoying with this;;;;;;

Rating: 2.0 out of 5 stars,"It's a great reading device. But something about highlighting causes it to become more and more sluggish until it freezes and I'm forced to restart the kindle. Sometimes it'll go 10+ highlights without freezing, other times it will happen after 3. Never had this problem with my older non touch kindle.",Sluggish performance after highlighting;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have no problem with my eyes when I use this Kindle.  I love my Kindle Fire, but I cannot read it for hours at a time.  The Paperwhite is really just like reading a book, but easier to hold and carry around.  Best of all, no buttons on the face to accidently push.",The Paperwhite is wonderful;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love it!  I have 4 Kindles, each serves a different purpose.  The 6"" is light, it fits in my bag and goes with me everywhere.  It has a long battery life and so I am never disappointed when I am in a waiting room or parking lot or traffic jam.  It is easy to read and easy to turn pages.  I have to admit after I had read some of the reviews I was a little worried, complaints about page turning and battery life and ability to read the page.. Don't believe it.  I wanted something light and more portable than even my first Kindle.  This lives up to the advertisements.",I love it! I have 4 Kindles;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my new Kindle! Small enough to hold in the hand and so easy to manipulate. Love being able to send text, PDFs, etc. to my Kindle address and be able to read them almost instantly on my reader! I strongly recommend buying a touchscreen stylus. It makes keeping the screen clear effortless--no smudgy fingerprints!",I love my new Kindle;;;;;;

Review: First Kindle I have ever owned.  Just started loading books from Amazon.  Not yet comfortable with it.  I have always preferred a book rather than an electronic item but since there are so many books that only go to Kindle had to try.  .So far so good.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my new 6"" Kindle - I was hesitant at first to purchase it since I thought that the screen would be too small. But, I don't mind the size at all & I love the fact that I don't have to carry a book with me all of the time!","6"" Glare Free Kindle";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Met and passed all my expectations. This is my third Kindle and all still work just great. My original keyboard changed my world. My Fire is always ready to entertain me. The newest, the 6"" touchscreen is the lightest, most portable of all. Always have touchscreen with me which means never any wasted time. Traffic jam - no problem, waiting for an appointment or friend - quality time at a touch. My SONY stopped working after a couple of years, my NOOK was dropped one too many times too endure. My Kindles just go on. The book is dead, long live the ebook.",The New Age of Reading is here;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"Not entirely happy with the new Touchscreen. Though it's easy to use when working properly, it sticks a lot. That is, at some point while reading, it won't turn the page. I tap and tap the screen, but instead it reverts to the Kindle start-up screen where I wait while the device refreshes itself. When it returns to the homepage, I have to open up the book again, only to discover it can't remember the page I was on. Grrr! May have to replace it.",UNREALIABLE TOUCHSCREEN;;;;;;

Review: Fine e-reader. Long battery life and can't beat the Black Friday price I paid for it. The ads are really obnoxious though and I am used to Apple products so it feels very clumsy and much less intuitive. But I really needed a light e-reader and this fits the bill.
Title;;;;;;: Fine e-reader. Long battery life and can't beat the ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This device provides an accessibility to literature that is unprecedented.  Love it.  I do wish I would have opted for the version with a built in backlight, but I probably need more sleep anyway :-)I also use it to store documents that I need to reference frequently - even my classwork.  You just cannot beat the portability and the battery life.",makes reading a joy;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love this thing! I literally use it ALL the time as I am injured and spend a lot of my time alone in bed. You can group your books into collections you name, I.e., some of mine are ""fiction,"" ""non-fiction,"" ""Christmas,"" ""Game of Thrones Series,"" etc. (definitely handy for book series'!). Some people have griped about the screen being too sensitive. It is sensitive but I've never had a problem with it. I love my Kindle!!! :)",LOVE IT!!!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a great little book.  I keep mine in my purse and whenever I find myself waiting, I just pull it out and read.  I originally bought this for a beach vacation... works great when you're in the sun.",This is a great little book;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Easy to read and light to hold. Visible in all light (other than darkness). Wish there were paper instructions on operating this device because I didn't know how to activate it from off. I pushed the power button but didn't have on reading glasses to see the small text at the bottom that said ""swipe screen to turn on""",I like the touch screen now that I am used to it.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm still getting familiar with the changes, compared with my other Kindle it is very touchy, changes in a blink and am having trouble getting back to where I was but I like the non glare and am sure I will like it better once I get used to it. It's like having a new phone. Gotta work with it.",changes in a blink and am having trouble getting back to where I was but I like the non glare and am sure I will like ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This was a Christmas present. I really like it. I have been learning how to choose books, choose the size of print and how to charge my kindle. It is fun and the variety of inventory is good. I read books on it every day.  It's much lighter than a book.",I really like it. I have been learning how to choose ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm a late adopter to the eReader game. I love my paperbacks, and keep a nice little library at home. I'm a Barnes & Noble employee but never liked the feel of the Nook. After using my Kindle for the past week, I can honestly say I'm in love.  Will it completely replace my library? Absolutely not. However, the ability to carry around (currently) 300+ books on a screen that has 0% eye strain, can be read in the same lighting as a paperback, lasts for weeks at a single charge, and is comfortable to read one handed? I consider this an excellent purchase, and I'm sure I would have jumped on this train earlier had I seen what I was missing.","Lovely, from a technerd who cherishes print";;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I used to own a kindle with keyboard so like generations before and was pretty satisfied until one day screen stopped working and was like after couple of years I bought it, so, whatever. I then bought this one and it was fine like the one before but without all the buttons, now I'm giving 2 stars because I have two problems that really baffled me.1. I bought a book from gumroad and they only provide pdf at the moment for that book, fine, I use calibre to generate a kindle friendly format, sent it to my kindle account and started reading it there and boom! kindle will just restart itself. Fine, I'm using calibre, my bad, I then sent my pdf and started reading it and bam! again restarting. And not only that it would say kindle out of memory and restart.2. I bought a kindle book directly from amazon, reads fine and everything, and today it occurred to me that I wanted to do a search on the book, type, type, type, hit search, bang! again! restarting without saying anything.I'm really disappointed since both matters are something that my oldie kindle was able to handle, and now I spent bucks in something newer that's really dissatisfying. I don't think I'll ever buy any kindle or suggest any of my friends to do it.","Kindle restarts on ""big"" pdf and searching throughout a book";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I got this one to replace the second gen. kindle i had for years.  I wasn't sure about the touch screen and not having buttons, but after having it for a few weeks now i love it!!!! Page turn is super fast, home screen takes some getting used to after my old one but, battery life is better then my old one. Overall i am really happy i got this one and the price made it a no brainer.",Loved it;;;;;;

Review: It is lightweight and I could see and read outdoors  and it was very nice to be able to adjust the size of the print. so all together it met my expectations and is very nice. :-) a wonderful surprise!

fantastic for what I use it for - reading.  print is clear and i especially like the dictionary feature. most of my reading is done while riding a recumbant bike but i will use this more and more as i exhaust my source of books.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Just an awesome item. I love that it doesn't hurt my eyes and it's great to read in the car or anywhere else. I definitely recommend getting a light for it, that you can clip onto your case or otherwise.",Just an awesome item. I love that it doesn't hurt my ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"What can I say. It's a Kindle, and when you have voracious readers, this hits the spot. My girls love them. No frills and whistles, but it does exactly what it's supposed to do. Would definitely purchase again or as a gift for another.",We love our Kindles!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Perfect for reading books.  I love the glare free screen.  Its lightweight, easy to use and carry around.  It has a long battery life.  This is perfect for someone who just wants something to read on!",Great for reading;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I am still fairly new to the use of it.  But steadily learning.  I would like to have a manual that clearly shows you how to use it.  So far it is trial and error.  There are directions on the screen, but skipping back and forth between directions and actual use is confusing to me.  Otherwise I like my Kindle.",I would like to have a manual that clearly shows you how ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchased this Kindle when it went on sale for Prime Day. I am so happy with this purchase. It is durable, easy to read, and easy to connect to wifi and download books. I love that I don't have to go to a bookstore to browse and pay bookstore prices. My favorite thing about this Kindle is that I can download samples before buying a book to make sure it's something I'm even interested in.",I am so happy with this purchase;;;;;;

Review: Like that it's a touch screen. My first kindle has the buttons on the bottom to navigate and that kinda drives me nuts. I LOVE the simplicity of this kindle. No bells and whistles just good ole reading.
Title;;;;;;: Like that it's a touch screen;;;;;;

Review: Just getting use to it.  I like everything it has to offer especially the free books they have  because I love to read.  This really comes in handy.  And for a great price that I got on Thanksgiving.  No more buying hard cover books  to read.
Title;;;;;;: I like everything it has to offer especially the free books ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I LOVE my kindle!!! I love to read but have arthritis in my shoulders and hands. This made reading some of the Heftier tomes that I enjoy a chore. My Kindle is lightweight, small and holds hundreds of books.  When I go on vacation instead of packing several books to read I just slip my Kindle into my purse and I am ready for some Beach time! Some of the books I enjoy in hardcover are not available in large print. With the Kindle it is easy to adjust the size of the font and enjoy any and all books.  I would not trade my Kindle for anything!",I LOVE my kindle;;;;;;

Review: love reading from the kindle.  Long lasting battery.  I have used my tablet with the kindle app but the real kindle lasts so much longer without a recharge of the battery.  Convenient to take along wherever I go.  It holds lots of books and information.  Very satisfied with this kindle.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Had the original KINDLE, and gave it as a gift. Happy that I just got this one. Light,& can hold in one hand. Great if all you want is an e-reader. Downloads books at the blink of an eye. No light, but doesn't matter to me.",Love it!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Im glad I got it for a discount because if I had spent $70 on it I wouldn't be happy. But the $30 I spent on it was well spent! (I took away one star because I don't think it's worth $70.) However, I keep it with me all the time. I read a lot more often than I did before I got a kindle.",I love keeping it with me all the time.;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"At various times I encounter a fairly long lag between the time I tap the screen and the page turns.  Additionally, there are times when it takes several (more than 5 tries) to get the page to turn.  Frustrating...  This doesn't appear to be an anomaly.  My previous 6 inch model did the same.  Also, due to user error that I'm unaware of the screen often changes type size without any purposeful input on my end.  Don't know what I'm doing wrong here!  Owned three kindles now--liked the first generation best! All that said I still enjoy reading from the kindle better than from a book...",User error a problem for kindle owner;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"For something to read with it's great.I was surprised it didn't have the ability to access the intr-net. The onboard Manuel said you could, but not true. But I didn't buy it for that purpose so was not a problem. But if you want to access the internet don't buy this model.",Won't acess the internet.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I am pretty satisfied, even though the unit is smaller than I expected. Fortunately, the screen is the same size as my 2nd Generation Kindle. I am still getting used to the features. The biggest plus I can give is that the battery last longer.",Good replacement!;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"Amazon Kindle customer support is as poor as the device. We have had to buy 3 of these!!  First one crapped out and Amazon did what they should and replaced it. Second one failed (partial frozen screen) at 11 months.  When I enquired, it got interesting because A-Kindle support told me they couldn't help because I didn't have possession of the device. (It was with my child, overseas)  I got it about a week and a half later and then they told me they wouldn't honor a replacement because in the intervening 10 days the device crossed the one year return window.  Too bad for me.  Then they changed their mind on that explanation and said the 12 month warranty period does not apply to products given because the first product was defective - only to the first broken productThe Amazon Kindle algebra is apparently this simple: 1 defective product + 1 replacement defective product = only 12 month original warranty. The new math!They first offered me like $20 toward buying a new kindle. ha!  I already had to buy a refurb'ed one to send overseas to swap with my kid so they would have one and I could get the broken one back. So when I express my dismay about the support process, they ask me to contact them again and I go thru the whole episode and they bump up the coupon offer to $30. I still don't need a fourth and lost 30 minutes I'll never get back. Then they has the gall to send me a customer service email that says, ""I understand that how inconvenient it must have been to borrow a free book and sign up each time.""  Where did that come from???  We have always had wonderful customer service for all other Amazon products APART from the Kindle stuff. Never again!!","""Amazon Kindling"" might be a better name (or use) for this product!!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,". . . Believe it or not, this is the only other ""electronic device"" that I've purchased other than my laptop and cellphone - and an investment I'm glad I made! With a super-long battery life (I only charge my Kindle about once every 7-10 days) I know that this device will last me for years to come. It's very easy to navigate, and takes LESS than half an hour to charge. Five stars. ;"-)""
Review: My first Kindle . . .";;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"The Kindle of this generation is glare free, Iam absolutly satisfied with purchase.The Menu is easy to use, the only down side is that the processor is a little slow.The weight is a breeze,love it.",Iam absolutly satisfied with purchase;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I used to be an ereader skeptic until I purchased this kindle as a Christmas gift for myself because I don't have enough room to collect books like I normally have right at this point in time. I wasn't expecting much just wanted to be able to read the books I would normally buy in paperback in a much more compact way. I've fallen in love with this kindle though (it takes priority over my cell phone even) and I plan to be a kindle user for life probably because this is the best electronic device I've ever bought.I have a brain condition that causes migraines on a semi-constant basis so reading off a kindle fire (or some other tablet with a backlight) was out of the question. You need to buy a light to read with this kindle in the dark because it reads exactly like the pages of a book. It's amazing! That's my favorite feature about the whole thing. I also like that it has touch page turns. Buttons would probably make it too bulky. It's so sleek the way it is.I have always had a dictionary handy in case I ever needed to look up a word. With the kindle, it has a built in dictionary inside of it! You highlight (by holding down) the word and above it pops in a window with the definition. It's amazing honestly. It also pulls up the wikipedia page for whatever word you highlighted. Even if you're reading a book you manually put on there because it wasn't available in the kindle store.Another amazing feature is the xray. You highlight a character's name and it gives you a complete biography of them. If you like those fantasy/sci-fi books that come with maps at the beginnings and have tons of hard to pronounce character names, you can keep them all straight because of the xray feature (however this one only works if you get the book from the kindle store).One thing I don't like is that it's so sensitive that if something brushes up against the top (i.e. a cat) the font will change sizes randomly and you always have to set it back to your preferred font.I don't know why people make such a fuss about special features. I wouldn't pay extra not to have them because I hardly notice them at all. I thought the kindle would be too small initially, but it's really a perfect size. It's bigger than a dollar store paperback. I love how it shows you what percentage you are through of the book.Finally, if you're poor but love books like me and you hoard used paperbacks DON'T be fooled into thinking you're spending less money on books this way because they're digital. They're cheaper than a new hardback or even a new paperback but they're not cheaper than a used paperback. Like I said, I also did not have the room to keep hoarding them the way I was which also led me to purchase this kindle. However, I also think that it is worth paying a couple dollars extra on the digital kindle copy of the book versus the used paperback just for the kindle's neat features.All in all 5 stars this was my favorite gift of Christmas by far. I will use this for a very, very long time.",A Lifelong Christmas Present;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,This is my wife's 4th kindle. She's had evey edition. She used this one on the cruise since the fire isn't easily visible in the sunlight.,"Small, light, and visible in direct sun";;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"A little disappointed as it has no light for night time reading-guess I missed seeing that in the specifications. It is fine for day light reading.Ordered the conversion plug and the cover separately as well as the instruction book, all in good order.",OKAY FOR THE MONEY;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had previously been using a Samsung Galaxy Tablet for reading, but it stopped working. I went online to a book club I belong to and started asking for opinions as to what I should purchase. I only needed a tablet I can read on ( I have a laptop and smart phone for internet, games, etc). More than half the people (there were at least 30 comments) recommended this reader to me. I made the decision to purchase and I've been using it ever since I got it. I absolutely love it! The only downside to the one I  purchased is that there's not a built in light. I knew this before I purchased, but didn't think it would be a big deal. It's not, but I kind of wish I had a light some times!",Reliable and Easy to Use;;;;;;

Review: I purchased this is a Christmas present for my teenage daughter. Delivery was quick and the device works great. This is the third Kindle I've purchased from Amazon and I'm very satisfied with its performance.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I was anti e-reader, but my brother bought this for me as a gift. I can not begin to tell you how much I love my Kindle. It's so easy to use, the screen is easy on the eyes, no straining staring at a bright screen. (there is no light on this model) You can order books direct from Amazon, or anywhere really. I can check out books online from the local library and have them delivered to my Kindle, no trying to work around my Library's limited operating hours! Amazon also has tons of free books, and with Prime you can ""checkout"" read 1 book free per month.","Don't think about it, just buy it!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my kindle!! But who doesn't amiright?But in all seriousness, it doesn't hurt the eyes with glare.  I can read it in direct sunlight.  I feel like I'm cozying up to an old time book - feels great and light.  Get it!",Love it.;;;;;;

Review: I really like it. So much better than holding a book. Of course I still love books. They bring back memories.Regarding the Kindle. I have to get use to it. Pages move quickly if you fingers get touchy with the screen.It is such a great way of having all these books at your fingertips.I'd been putting off getting it for years. These special prices that you have offered made it so much moreprice able. If any one likes to read this is the way to go. Jo Hayden
Title;;;;;;: I really like it. So much better than holding a book;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"PERFECT!! There are no words to describe how good this device is. Amazon did indeed a great job with this one. I am a person that do not care about social networking or apps on a device, I just care about reading. It really meets all my needs. No glare at all, perfect resolution and the seamless download of any book is amazing. The materials are of great quality and very simple yet refined design makes a must for avery passionate reader.",PERFECT!! There are no words to describe how ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my Kindle. It is very easy and comfortable to read on. It reads just like a book;" absolutely no glare in the sun and it requires a light to read in the dark. Turning the page or finding a certain page is very easy. It has an awesome feature where you can highlight a word and its definition will pop up. It automatically takes all the words you've looked up and makes flash cards out of them...which is awesome if you're reading a text book or something for school. I don't recommend buying the charging block. If you have a smart phone then you already have a block that allows a USB charger to go into an outlet. The battery life is really long so you can charge it for a couple hours then use it for a month straight without charging again. Basically
Review: don't waste your money on the charging block if you already have on. In summary: awesome product
Title;;;;;;: no need to buy charging block.""
column4: I love my Kindle!";;;;;

Rating: 2.0 out of 5 stars,"I had one of the key pad kindle e-readers, which they do not make anymore. I loved it. It froze up on a screen and would not change pages or do anything.  I had it for probably 10 years.  I use my Kindle for reading only, so I do not need or want all the extras. The customer service person told me there was no difference in the one I had and the touch screen one. I specifically asked if it would fit in the case I used for my old kindle, because it was leather and had the built in light. He assured me that it would fit the new one, so I ordered it.  I have had the new one for about 2 weeks and would not order it again. I hate the touch screen. It does not fit in the case I have, in fact there is no way to even use that case. I never had any problems with my old one, when shopping, or downloading a book from Cloud. This one can't ever seem to find a connection, and therefore is useless unless the book is already downloaded on the devise from my house. I am very unhappy with this purchase and would find an old used one like I had, before buying one like this if I had to do it over.",Not what I was told.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I know that I am way late to the Kindle game, but I am very impressed with this e-reader.  It's easy to use, lightweight, and has a great battery life.  I'm able to read 3 books without charging!  I also love that it is small enough to fit in my purse.  I bought it on sale for $49, and it was money well-spent.",Perfect little e-reader;;;;;;
5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first kindle, and I love it!  The screen is small;" however
Review: the words are large enough to read.  The touch response is fast and I have had no issue turning the pages back and forth.  This device is not backlit
Title;;;;;;: so you will need ambient light to read by.  This was not a huge deal for me because there is no """"screen-strain"""" on your eyes.  Overall
column4: I would buy this again.""
column5: First Time Kindle Owner - I love it!";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am an avid reader. I truly love and I am truly enjoying my KIndle Paperwhite. I can now read my favorite books without staining my eyes from using my iPad. When I first received my Kindle I was so excited, I just had to open the package and inspect it though I was pressed for time because I had to head off to work. To my utter amazement Amazon had already registered my Kindle, so basically all I had to do was set the time and charge it a liitle. I just want to say thank you Amazon, you guys are the best. I am a very satisfied customer.",I truly love my Kindle.;;;;;;

Review: The touchscreen is very good.  I am still getting used to it however. The ease of changing type size is great.  But I still haven't figured out how to access the game I had/have on my older version (which resurrected from the near dead upon arrival of the replacement).  The Times subscription is a little easier to use also.  On balance it is a better product.
Title;;;;;;: The touchscreen is very good. I am still getting used to it however;;;;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"OK, it's a Kindle so it's a great thing. However, it does not compare favorably to the older model. It is awkward to hold, which gets pretty significant when one is reading a book for more than a few minutes. The touch screen is either too sensitive or not responsive enough, depending on what you're trying to do. If you want to enter your code, it is unresponsive and takes a looong time to register each touch. If you're trying to move your fingers to a comfortable position, the screen registers the corner of your knuckle as a touch and starts to change the font or go to the home page, or something else that interferes with the actual reading. I broke my old model by mistake and am very, very sorry that I have to make do with this one now. Makes me wonder what reading a Nook is like. Battery life is good, as always.","If only I hadn't had to get this ""new and improved"" kindle";;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Had issues getting the documents feature to work and never was able to resolve this issue, even with the help of Amazon Technical Support.  Thought about sending it back but just am not up for the struggle again.  Guess I will just do without that feature even though I cannot download book galleys to preview.  Have had a little trouble using the touch screen but I think I will get used to that.",Had a Document Issue.;;;;;;

Review: I bought it so I could read by the pool. I have a kindle fire for inside and at night. Got a great price but wish that I would have got the paper white one. I really wish I had the back lit screen so I could read in bed at night.
Title;;;;;;: Got a great price but wish that I would have got the ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Super happy with this purchase best e-reader out there! This is well made the durability is impressive. The touch screen response is excellent with almost no delays, and of course the battery life last for almost an eternity! You can't go wrong with this e-reader, but don't expect to read comics on it for obvious reasons it's not designed for that but you still can load them on there with no issues. This is strictly for text novels. However Manga because of how it's drawn, works well on it, but if you're looking to read DC or Marvel you are better off getting a Kindle Fire to appreciate the artwork.","Durable and long battery life, good for manga";;;;;;

Review: Purchased as a gift for Christmas and it keeps rebooting itself while my husband is in the middle of reading. I've had my Kindle for 5 years and it has never once had to reboot. Very disappointed. Researched blogs and this seems to not be that unusual.
Title;;;;;;: Does not work as well as expected.;;;;;;

Review: Much smaller than my previous kindle and close to too small for my hands.  Screen functionality is only fair at best.  Difficult to get around and do what was almost automatic with my old Kindle.  This is not an improvement for me.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Excellent and easy to set up and use. If it could be improved, I would suggest that the surface be slightly less slick. It is easy to drop, especially with cold hands. I know,  I know (buy a cover) but I'm old and on a fixed income :-)",Excellent and easy to set up and use;;;;;;

Review: As a person who really doesn't read much I have to say this thing is fantastic! Its light enough to not make my hands tired and the screen is super easy to read! I love the dictionary portion of it as well.  Honestly if you are just looking for a basic reader don't spend a ton of money on anything more advanced then this!

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Got this as a present for my mother for mother's day. She had a kindle keyboard for FOREVER and finally needed a replacement, the buttons and keys were starting to not work and the screen had seen better days. She says she prefers the touch screen to the page buttons on her old kindle, Personally I just think this kindle in a little small. But she's happy, that's what matters!",the buttons and keys were starting to not work and the screen had seen better days. She says she prefers the touch screen ...;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I found the directions a bit confusing. But, I am persistent. Also, I am VERY disappointed to find no backlight. I looked and looked for it and finally read that this model didn't have a backlight. Thank you.",Get it?;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've been using this on my Kindle Fire for over a year and am very happy with it. It fits perfectly, there are no bubbles and no obstructions. One thing, I wouldn't call it ""glare free"" more ""glare reduced"". I'm not sure you can completely eliminate glare, but this does an adequate job.",Very good value.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I had troubhle with the IPhone also. Sometimes my fingertips won't register. I press and press, but it just ignores me. Then again, if I reach to take a sip of my beverage, my sleeve will change the page. Maddening.",Meh!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"My 13 year old granddaughter purchased this to replace a Kindle Fire HD 1st Generation that she hardly ever used.  She was extremely limited as to when she could read from it.  She absolutely loves the improvements.  It's like a book, glare-free, and she can read anytime, anyplace.  It's lightweight and the features are updated and improved. This is the low-end model but has everything needed to make her very happy.  I'm going to be getting one for myself.",It's like a book;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This ended up being the perfect gift for my mom, who used to spend a lot of time searching through book stores for her favorite author. The only negative is I thought it came with a light but it doesn't, so you can't read in the dark. Also, as a side note, you're able to torrent books and convert them to EPUB or MOBI using calibre and load them right on to the kindle. I would convert them from PDF so that a cover is included and the feature that lets you define words.  Not that I would illegally download books or anything....hah....just saying it's possible.",This ended up being the perfect gift for my mom;;;;;;

Review: This is a great Kindle. I love it. The only thing that keeps me from rating 5 stars is that there was a problem with my family library and I neeeded a lot of Amazon help to even get close to fixing it.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"My first ereader! What a perfect gift. Everyone should get one. The ease of using it makes paper books feel like a chore now. If one hand gets tired, you can flip it upside down and use the other hand. Its brilliant",First ereader!!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am not into tec and love ""real"" books and do not like the idea of books that one owns being stored on some ""cloud"".  I have wall to ceiling cases full of wonderful old history books.  I love the way they look and feel in my hands and the way they smell.  With that said, I am surprised I am enjoying the Kindle my Son gave me for my birthday.  I can stick it in my purse and carry it easily with me.  I am disappointed there has to be light in order for it to work.  I had thought that would be one of the nice things about it, being able to read in bed without turning a night light on and disturbing my partner.  I see no sense in paying for something that is not tangible and when the electrical source is gone cannot be accessed so will probably stick to free books. With that said, I am enjoying the Kindle and will probably like it more as time goes on.",Geezer says Kindle OK;;;;;;

Review: I liked my old kindle with the push button to turn page the swipe one is ok bu't I prefer the old model.  Sometimes when I swipe it thinks I want to highlight or something else .  I wish they hadn't changed it.
Title;;;;;;: I liked my old kindle with the push button to turn ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"It is a great little device to read on, I don't use it for anything else as it only had an amber screen, but it is small and weighs nothing and can be read in the sunlight, just not in the dark like the Kindle Fire, which I also have. Totally worth the cost.","My little ""book""";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought it by mistake, my daughter wanted a Kindle Fire, so I was going to return it, but my husband convinced me to give it a try and I'm glad I did. I use to read a lot, but we also move a lot and packing books is a PITA, so I haven't bought new books in a while. Since I had the Kindle, I already read several book, 1 per week, even with my busy hectic schedule. The gray display is really easy on the eyes, the device is lightweight, fits in my purse and in my hand comfortably. I'm glad I didn't return it!",Amazing!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I am pleased with the kindle.  Books are easy to read, easy to load.  I successfully borrowed a library book.  There is an excellent selection of books both free and for purchase.  The ads are not intrusive.  Battery life is excellent, it charges quickly.Downside is that the touch screen occasionally advances more than one screen at a time, and getting back to the starting point is sometimes a problem.  I would prefer that the charge level be visible within a book, so low charge state, if it occurs would not be a surprise.I think this device is valuable as a single-purpose device, a book reader, and well worth the cost.",An excellent single-purpose digital book reader;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I had the lowest level Nook from three years ago and thought I'd upgrade with the glare-free touchscreen Kindle. I wish I had gone back to a Nook. I bought the Kindle for the screen - and it is better although not a dramatic change from the older Nook. The Kindle is also faster when opening a book, but page turning seems about the same..The best thing is the battery. On the down side, you cannot expand the memory with an SD card on the Kindle, which I find very frustrating. I would love to use margin notes except the touchscreen is ridiculously sensitive and it either turns the page or only highlights a single word when I want the paragraph - adding the note is not exactly great either. The same sensitivity interferes when trying to look up a word - if you don't get it just exactly right, you simply turn the page. Sigh.","Nice on speed and looks, but the touchscreen is not great.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love the kindle. I have Prime so I am able to borrow books for free through the lending library which is a great benefit.After I purchased this we went on vacation and I was able to read without any glare on the beaches of Jamaica. The one thing I like is the new smart lookup. You can lookup dictionary definitions or even wikipedia entries all without leaving your page.Battery life is excellent. If you read for 1 hour a day the battery will last 2 weeks, with wifi signal turned off. If wifi signal is on it kwill constantly seach for the connection and that will drain your battery.I am not sure how many books this holds but it has to be alot. I have over 100 because I never delete.Charging time is a little slow. When I charge mine it takes about 3.5 hours to fully charge. Other than the charging time, this Kindle is great. If you purchase the one with special offers you will see ads everytime you turn it on, no big deal. No ads while reading..",The kindle is very impressive;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've long since graduated to a Paperwhite and really wouldn't buy this anymore (I'm spoiled now with the built in light.  No more clumsy clip- ons!)  I first bought this when it went to $79.  I wasn't sure I could grow to like reading on an electronic device, but at that price I was ready to try it out.  My reading is done almost exclusively on the Kindle now, and I LOVE paper books. But really the only reason I'm throwing in this review is to counter all the one and two star ratings from the people who hate it because the light isn't adjustable (!) or other such nonsense.  But it is a great device.",It's a great basic e-reader device!;;;;;;

Review: This is a really great product it makes reading much easier whether you have too many books or if you have trouble with understanding words. Just highlight if your confused and the meaning pops up or it gives reference to other uses in the book you're currently reading. I would recommend a kindle to any book lover.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Still getting used to it, but so far I like it. Due to my arthritis, I have trouble turning pages in a book. This has become my Bible. I like having several translations, and I can have the all in this one unit. It is easy to read, small enough to easily carry.",but so far I like it. Due to my arthritis;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"II'm returning this Kindle because Whispernet refuses to work with the AT&T Beam device. I have to download the files and somehow make it work. I can open a ""real"" paperback and start enjoying, or I can waste time dorking around with Whispernet. Not my problem. I have better things to do than to fix Amazon's technical problems..",or I can waste time dorking around with Whispernet;;;;;;

Review: Pretty good.  My first Kindle; waited for a long time but finally took the leap.  Enjoying it a lot.  I do wish that I could read my newspaper and magazine subscriptions on it; that would be a great boon!

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I adore my little Kindle. I didn't know that I would like it that much since we own two multi-use tablets, but it's very nice to tell my kid no, this is full of Mom's books and doesn't have anything on it for you. It's light weight and fits into a large coat pocket or the front pocket of my purse. I'm a huge fan.",Love my Kindle!;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"The only good thing about this Kindle is the price. This was my third Kindle -- kindle2, paperwhite, now this one with its yellowish dim screen, and its definitely gone from good to fair to bad. the law of diminishing returns. i returned this one and will stay with my paperwhite and its annoying habits.",The worst of all my Kindles;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is exactly what I wanted. I had hoped that by waiting and given the popularity of the device and its subsequent evolution, a bargain would appear and it has. I am retired and on fixed income. I didn't not want to burden by children with 'suggestions' about what presents I would like, I just waited and here it is. It contains all the options I require - variable font size, built in WiFi that I have to invoke (and if I don't I save battery life) that I can use at my local library and glare-free display of the text. I can read it at home or take it with me to the occasional doctor's appointment - a blessing since the magazine offerings there are of no interest to me. The only thing I have to worry about is getting too many books - a library I can't process before I kick the bucket - something the ease of pointing and clicking can do. I will be careful about that.My Kindle is a great solution to my problem of portable reading.","I didn't not want to burden by children with 'suggestions' about what presents I would like, I just waited and here it is";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"My Kindle Keyboard became inoperable on a recent trip.  I rely on my Kindle when I am traveling.  I do have an iPad with a Kindle application, but I use the Kindle almost exclusively when traveling.  I prefer its light weight and smaller size for reading on the plane.  It is also more convenient when my accommodation is a tent and not a hotel room.I particularly like having a touchscreen now.  I also like the way the new Kindle is organized.I am very pleased with my new Kindle!",I particularly like having a touchscreen now;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love it.  Purchased two - for two younger teenagers. One was already a reader, the other was not.  BOTH girls have already read several books.  Only negative was that they needed light in the car to read.  Of course, for the price, I knew light wasn't included.  Great product - very happy I purchased.",Love it. Purchased two - for two younger teenagers;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,I have been hesitant to acquire a kindle of my own for some time as I thought the electronic pad would be inferior to holding a paper book in my hands.  I received this for Christmas however and I have to say that I have been very impressed with the Kindle.  I recently took it on a trip with me to Arizona and it was able to be used for several hours each day on a single charge (prior to trip) allowing me to read several books during the trip.  While I still lament not being able to hand somebody a book I just read and urging them to read it (not many of my friends have Kindles but there is apparently a kindle share thing you could otherwise do) this promises to get a great deal of use from me in the months to come,"Had low initial expectations, was impressed with how well it works";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have wanted a Kindle since they first came out years ago. I was finally able to get one for myself this Christmas. Its my own personal tradition to get myself things as I shop for others so I don't get jealous. Anyway, this is one of the best gifts I have ever given myself. It is quick and easy to use and navigate. The battery I have only charged once in the month I have had it. I already have a nice little library of books to choose from. I hope to have this for years to come and I will definitely get another one when this one retires.Edit: Just a little side note, I don't make much but there are a lot of free books that are great on Amazon. There is also Kindle Unlimited which is like an Amazon library card and you can check out 10 books at a time for ten bucks a month. I also joined a site called Bookbub.com and they send daily emails with a list of books that are between 2.99 and Free! Ive added so many books to my Kindle library with that site. Its also not just for Amazon, there are books that are on Google and much more. So I can still read lots of books and not spend a ton of money.",I love my Kindle!!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"The Kindle lives up to its promises. It was easy to setup, downloads books quickly, and is an enjoyable way to read. It's light to hold and turns pages quickly. Of course, without any light, you must use it in lit rooms or outdoors. This means the battery lasts a long time. I also have a smartphone and an iPad, so I can use one of them if I need a backlight. The Kindle software puts up a dialog box when you pick up your book, asking you if you want to jump to the most advanced position, no matter which platform you were last reading it on. Some (not all) books even have the option to read out loud, an audiobook. And they still keep track of your last stop point when you go back to the non-audio version of the book. I have always liked the Kindle reader software, now it's even better to have a Kindle, too. Especially, when I take it outdoors to read.",Kindle lives up to its promises.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Really enjoyed the little time I spent with this before handing it over to my kid, the parental controls work great, and he really enjoys reading on it, (he really struggles with books but the kindle has made it a joy for him and he can adjust the text size to better fit his needs, fantastic tool for the little ones)",Great for kids TOO;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Everything is as described. It downloads books fast. It is small, light (the cover feels heavier than the reader lol), touch screen responses very well, and no back light as expected (like reading an actual black and white printed book).",Everything is as expected.;;;;;;

Review: Love it. Very small and extremely light weight. Fits right in the inner pocket of my vest and coat. Highly recommend it. You just need to get a light for night reading and found a slim cheap case on Ebay.
Title;;;;;;: Love it. Very small and extremely light weight;;;;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"God knows why this device freezes and requires a reboot - luckily usually takes only seconds - every 5, even 3 pages.Also, though less important, I wish there was a way to have a sense of progress vis--vis traditional pages / page numbers. The system of pages or progress is measured  differently on Kindle.","Restored my reading habit, but crashes every 3-5 pages.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"and it works perfect still! The water wiped off, no damage! So so so pleased! The videos of the kindle on the beach are TRUE!This is my first eReader. I have watched my mom go from a Sony eReader to a nook tablet and never really cared. Now looking at my bookshelf, full of books I never get the chance to read, I decided it might be time for me to invest in my own reading device. I knew right off the bat I wanted eInk. Reading on a computer is hard enough, and no matter what I would be doing, tablets hurt my eyes like crazy.Keeping this review simple, I like how light and small this Kindle is. It will fit perfectly in my purse. I can't wait to see how convienent it is to carry a book (more like tons of books) with me everywhere. Downloading books is easy, and the device itself seems simple enough.The one thing  I will need to get used to is the special offers being the ""off"" screen. When you press the power button to normally turn a tablet's screen off, the special offers pop up.**UPDATE**After a month's use, I will keep my rating as a 4.
