I managed to get this device at $60 because it was on sale rather than the regular $80, and at times I wish I had just splurged and got the paperwhite, but honestly, it isn't worth it for me.Anyway, all that I have previously said still holds true. I have read 5 books in a month, compared to 3 (?) physical books in the past 2 years. The kindle has made me want to read more.I have ""purchased"" about 70 free kindle books, which more than cover the cost of the device in itself.I love it's portability, and being able to read on long car rides with the glaring sun.","Full bottle of water emptied on it on accident,";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I love having moved from the buttons to this value priced touch screen with two exceptions. First, I didn't realize how much I was depending on the texture on the back of my old Kindle to keep from dropping it. The cheaper plastic on this new model is super slick and dropable. I added some textured stickers on day two of ownership.But much more important, brush the screen with the edge of your sleeve or, heaven forbid place it face down in your lap for a sec and your font size will be changed. At first I thought, ""no big deal"" but I have been using my new Kindle for two days and I have probably fix the font 100 times. That's getting old fast, and apparently touch Kindle users have been asking for a font lock for at least two years.",Great but needs a better lock screen;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love everything about it, except for the highlighting feature. I had a lot of trouble with the highlighting feature, as it would frequently bug out, and would want to highlight the entire page when I was trying to just get to the end of a paragraph.This happens a lot, and it's making me not want to use the highlighting feature, because it often takes me at least 1-2 minutes to have the highlighter stop at the correct place.",98% Perfect!;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I am having trouble getting the""home"" and other things to come up on the screen.  I like my first  Kindle much better, but this was a gift for a family member. I also did not realize this one would have no color.",A little Dissapointing;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"While trying to transition from paper books to digital, I found my backlit tablet hard to get adjusted to. So I thought that I would try the Kindle and I really like that the screen looks like a paper book page. I don't mind the advertising because it is not obnoxious - their is no blinking, flashing ad at the bottom of the page. The screen functions were simple and easy. The page turns were fast. I now have many books at my disposal while traveling without the weight and bulk of paper books. The Kindle was a great buy for me.",The Kindle was a great purchase.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Good for just reading. Kind of wish it was back-lit. You have to read with good lighting, for sure. Great battery life. I rarely use my iPad now. Apparently I only really used my iPad to read. I use my phone for everything else. The Kindle is perfect because it's lighter than my iPad, but bigger than my cell phone.",Great for just reading;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Quick set up, easy to use and clear to read.  I wondered if the 'special offers' would be annoying but they only appear when the Kindle sleeps - one touch wakes it up and the ads are gone. I have a Nook e-reader (which I would rate five stars also) and only purchased the Kindle as several authors works I enjoy are only offered on a Kindle.  A few purchases and the Kindle pays for itself when compared to buying the books in hardback.",easy to use and clear to read;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Not long ago a revised version of 'Kindle, 6"" Glare-Free Touch Basic' was on sale at a very tempting price, so I took the plunge. My only regret is that I didnt do it sooner. This is a very useful little device. One feature I really like is Locations  (tap upper right hand corner to place a marker for later reference which stays in place until deleted). I have the means to convert most any document into a mobi file and place it on my reader for later use. That in itself saves me plenty on paper and printer ink. There are more advanced and expensive versions available, but for basic functions, good battery life, and readability, you cant go wrong with this handy unit.",Great little unit;;;;;;

Review: I like hard copy but carrying books for business trip can be challenging. It's great for the travel and it's working great for me. I read in different languages and kindle can display those languages. It is an added convenience. I'm glad I bought kindle.

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"The kindle kept giving me Internal Error when registering to my Amazon Account. I called Amazon help desk. Firstly they could not figure out what version I had, then they disputed the serial number that I read of the kindle - like I was making up a 16 digit number for kicks and giggles. Then none of the prompts or screens that they read off their device matched mine. Finally after 2 agents and 40 minutes (of my time which I will never get back), they said that the order was not completely fulfilled and I would have to wait for them to do that internally first and my device would be updated via wifi. Still waiting.",One Star;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,After using the Kindle Fire HD it took alittle time to get used to reading on the Paperwhite.  The model I purchased didn't come with a light and the letters are in a special magnetic ink instead of being digital.  It is light in weight and easy to hold and the battery lasts for days. I think the write up says up to a week.  I haven't had the opportunity to use it in bright sunlight but I have heard that it is great for that. I bought it with a Black Friday discount which made it an offer I couldn't refuse.,"I highly recommend the 6"" Kindle";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"love it..... I didn't get the paperwhite because I don't need bells and whistles,  I also have a book lite that fits on this perfectly.  I do mostof my reading during the day so this is perfect.  Downloading books is a breeze.  Thank you Amazon for a great product",love it.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Surprised by the apparent small size. Actually, just the wide sides and external keyboard are missing. Same screen size with great page turning only through touch screen rather than button. Preferred the standby pages rather than the advertisements.",Same screen size with great page turning only through touch screen rather than button;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have had this Kindle for 2 years.  I use it many hours per day and last night, it stopped working and I cannot revive it :(  I am elderly and lightly disabled, so reading is my best friend and I cannot read books as they are too heavy.  Kindle is light and works great during power outages.  Now, I will buy the same model and transfer the unread books.  Hopefully Amazon will transfer the books from the old one onto the new one.  Cannot go wrong with this e-reader.",Wonderful Piece of Equipment;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Not easy to navagate. I am reading a book, want to switch books and don't know how to get to main menu. When I was in the main menu not easy to find your books. Took time to figure things out.Easy to read. Swipe to change page is nice, but gentle or you could go a couple of pages. I feel once I get the hang of things it will be fine.",Not easy to navagate;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love this!  I purchased this to take camping so that I could have longer battery life than my Kindle Fire HD and also a glare-free screen.  It holds a charge for a long time, and is easy to read.  The touch screen makes it simple to use as well.  It also has an experimental browser that will work in a pinch if you just need to look up something.I would definitely buy this again.",Love It!;;;;;;

Review: Had one of the first kindles ever and loved it but accidentally destroyed it...looked hard for a simple Kindle -my preference.  This is a bit smaller than I would like but I am enjoying the touch screen.  Had to work WAY too hard to find a cover that would fit it however.
Title;;;;;;: NIce  but why isn't it sold with a cover that fits!;;;;;;

Review: My mom got a Kindle touch for my son for his birthday! I liked it so MUCH that I ordered one for myself to replace the Kindle Keyboard that had broken.My son has actually read from his kindle EVERY DAY... where it used to be a fight to get him to read a book! Thank you AMAZON!

I received my kindle a few days ago and was very pleased with the item.  I took it out of the box and set it up  it was so easy to use I have already  read 4 books and starting my 5th  I would recommend this item to anyone  who loves to read
Title;;;;;;: ... my kindle a few days ago and was very pleased with the item;;;;;;

Review: Awesome little gadget. Does exactly what it's supposed to do: read a book!Very easy to operate! Nothing complicated.It's very slim and will fit anywhere . the battery will last a long time !  The screen is excellent and all I wanted was the feel of a real book instead of the glare of a traditional screen like the iPhone or iPad.I recommend it for books but not comic books of course . use your color screen kindle app on other devices or bigger kindles if you are a comic book reader .I got this on Xmas and honestly anyone that likes to read should get it . (the ads that are shown -if you get the special deal- do not interfere with the reading . they are shown only when the device is on standby )

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Amazing!!  Great buy. Love the size of it and the battery last forever and that is so nice when reading a book or many books easy to use, make you when you read at night you have a light close by other wise you can't see anything.  This is my 2nd kindle and I love both of them.",Amazing but!;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Functional.  Love how lite it is.  The problem is the touch screen.  I had a Kindle Keyboard and loved it and used it to death.  The touch screen is very sensitive. Also the fact that different areas of the screen do different things.  This perhaps is just going to take some getting used to, but for now it is somewhat frustraiting.  The battery is amazing.  I have charged it twice.  Once when I first got it and then three weeks later.",Love how lite it is;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I was perfectly content with my old Kindle Keyboard, but then I received warning that I would have to update it in March in order to continue obtaining books. I tried following all the instructions to the letter, leaving it attached overnight twice, but couldn't make the update happen. Before seeking help, I remembered that we had on hand a 2014 Kindle 6 which my husband had received as a gift. He never used it because he prefers to read on his Ipad and has no problem taking that with him everywhere. So since the Kindle 6 didn't have to be updated to work, I switched to using it. With the touchscreen, it was simple to learn.  So I bought a  beautiful new cover that turns it on and off. It's' slim and lightweight--even easier to carry in my purse.  Very happy with it. .",Much better than updating old Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"What can I say.  Purchased two of these - one for my wife and one for myself.  Decided to go with the Kindle Touch as it does not have a backlight.  Was having some trouble staying asleep.  However, discovered a sensible recommendation for improving sleep from a University of Maryland website which suggested at least one hour of light reading before bedtime and if you use an e-reader, make sure it is not backlit in order to not reset your internal clock with a bright light.  So far, so good.  We are both doing better at staying asleep thanks to the Kindle.",Improve Your Reading and Your Sleep;;;;;;
3.0 out of 5 stars,"Advantages: Battery life is awesome, can last for a week;" very light
Review: easy to bring around
Title;;;;;;: a good alternative way to read real physical book
column4: the most affordable option among the kindle family devices.Disadvantages: slow touch screen response (especially when you used to smartphone touch screen response rate)
column5: which is quite annoying
column6: lack of free nice ebook to download
column7: lack of good chinese novel (e.g.
column8: those from Jin Yong) to download
column9: lack of different versions of bible to download
column10: no colour.""
column11: an ok book reader device";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Most useful when using dictionary instead of cumbersome way of my 'old' Kindle.  Enjoy the touch screen and menu on top of the screen availability.  Am still in the process of 'learning' it, and am sure there are many more beneficial aspects just waiting for me to work with them. The ability to simply touch a section and highlight it has been very useful, also. Being retired and at 80 not much into a lot of activity, enjoy my new Kindle for at least 8 hours a day...  better than TV or out shopping, and Amazon's choices of ebooks is bountiful!No",Totally enjoying my 'touch screen'..;;;;;;

Review: I had gen 4 kindle and returned it as part of trade-in program. Now I upgraded to this model. I love the touch interface so far. Only few grips* software isnt much intutive in the place of homebutton and back button keys* screen looks bit smaller* kindle is way thicker than sleek 4th genBut love the touch portion. No need to click side buttons to turn pages over.

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"I mean it served my purpose and I have read like 5 books on it since I got it back in the winter of 2014. I don't have nothing to complain about its physical design and materials Amazon used to make it. Yes, this one is thicker than Paperwhite and feels very plastic, but I'm completely fine though, what you expect from a $80 dollar device? An iPhone costs you $700 dollars. But I have to say, the screen is decent.The touch screen has its pros and cons. You can click a word or a name to check dictionary or X-ray, which is very nice. If it's buttons, it will be a huge pain.But the touch screen is very sensitive. It changes my font and font size even if I didn't purposefully do it. When sometimes I open my Kindle, I was  a few pages ahead or behind where I left and was in a weird font and font size. That's why I have to set the password and I suppose Kindle is not smart enough to enter my password automatically and change my font size.Honestly, that's my only complaint. I bought this version because I need something simple and basic, without chunk of other non-reading related capabilities. I prefer to read a paperback, but if I read on a Ebook, I hope my Ebook will as close to a paperback as possible.I just hope Amazon won't ever forget our very intrinsic motive to buy a Kindle so there is still a Kindle in the market that I need to buy. What we need is something really simple and please don't add unnecessary functions to this device in the future. I hate tablets, I have a iPad Mini and the screen broke but I never bothered to fix it.",... mean it served my purpose and I have read like 5 books on it since I got it back ...;;;;;;

Review: I have a Nook tablet and got this simply to be able to read outside.  I LOVE IT!  Many of the people who leave negative feedback don't know what they are getting.  It's simply a reader.  Very easy to use!  The reason I left one star off is because I really wish it came with a little direction sheet.  I didn't even know how to turn it off etc.  I had to go online to figure it out.  A quick start guide would have been great.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"After a lot of oscillations between this one and the paperwhite and after side by side comparisons for several hours; i have decided this one.I could not see any resolution difference between them even with the smallest font.Since I can not tolerate any kind of illuminated screen
Review: especially in dark
Title;;;;;;: this one is perfect;" thought you need some external light to read a real book.I bet god will send the next holy book directly to the kindle : )""
column4: Perfect device...";;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Pros:I like it a lot! I try to stay away from lighted devices as much as possible given how often I'm in front of screens and this is exactly what I wanted. Quick to work, clear, durable, and so thin and easy to carry around. It slides right in my purse! I'm so glad kindle kept carrying the original.Cons:The battery dies pretty quickly- I turn it off but it dies much more quickly than the original I had before.I'm also a bit disappointed that it has a small black mark on the screen that doesn't seem to go away but I've gotten used to it and for the price it can be ignored.",Pretty good;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"First one I received did not work correctly - locked up and wouldn't fully charge. Exchanged for a new on and it works great. Working with the ""Kindle Specialist"" was a pain, but eventually got the job done.",First one I received did not work correctly;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I am very happy with my new Kindle.  Being new to Kindle, this model met all my expectations and is a very easy reader in both daylight and at night.  It does not have a backlight which I wondered how I would like that, however, I do not miss it.  It is light weight and fits nicely in my purse to keep with me at all times.  My only issue is the advertising that Amazon puts on for the screensaver that I have to look at all the time unless I completely power down the screen.  I don't like to be sold to constantly on a device, that I bought, and wish I could change the screensaver!!!  Therefore I give it a 4 star versus 5.",Nice Kindle for the Price;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Purchased as a gift for my wife. It is her 1st Kindle and she LOVES it! It was very simple for me to set it up and show her it's various features and how to use them.(I have had a Kindle for several years, 4th gen page turning buttons on sides, with keyboard.) Battery life doesn't seem to be as good as with my 4th gen. With moderate use(2 to 3 hours per day)she has to charge it about every 6 or 7 days. My 4th gen with about the same use will usually last 3 weeks before requiring a charge. Neither of us consider this to be much of an issue though. It's ease of use is the most important thing to her and she hasn't had any problems using it. For her, being able to highlight a word and instantly get it's definition is a huge plus. I'd have no problem buying one of these for myself if I didn't already own a Kindle.",) Battery life doesn't seem to be as good as with my 4th gen;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This Kindle replaced another simpler earlier version, and it took some time to get used to it.  Now I've learned to use it, I find it an easy device to use.  I wouldn't want to go back  to my old one.","Kindle 6"" Glare-free touchscreen Display";;;;;;

Review: I Received this couple of days back and ordered it for my son who is not a big fan of reading. The screen as its being shown in the Kindle main page video is not all how my product screen is. In-fact its more duller than a book. We mostly have yellow light in our apartment and in the evening  i struggled to read it at an angle. If I leave it flat directly below the light its a lot better. When i saw the review I picked Kindle ahead of the Fire Tablets because they didn't had some features like word wise and vocabulary builder etc. I am afraid it seems either i picked up the wrong kindle or was expecting a bit too much out of this. Its very difficult to convince kids to use it with all those High resolution smart tablets out there.
Title;;;;;;: Display not as bright/sharp as you would see in the demo video;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I have never had a kindle, always read from an android or iPad, so the no glare is great.  Just wish I could brighten the background just a bit. It is also hard to see the books I haven't as yet read.",Easy to read outside...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought my first kindle about 4 years ago and it ended up freezing up on me. I returned it to Amazon and got a $20 credit towards a new one which was awesome. I'm glad I upgraded mine anyway, this model is way more intuitive to use and the touch screen feature is an upgrade from what I had.",I returned it to Amazon and got a $20 credit towards a new one which was awesome. I'm glad I upgraded mine anyway;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Great value for the money.  Would be better with a backlight.....but it's lightweight and easy to carry.  I use it when I'm going somewhere that I might have time to wait or sit & read, but do not want to carry my Kindle Fire around for the entire day.  It does the job I wanted it to do.",Great value for the money;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchased this Kindle with a Christmas gift-card.  This was never dropped, dunked or stepped on.  It completely quit working in less than 6 months.  I did a hard reset, which brought it back to life for a week.  Then it quit again and will not restart.  I've had a kobo for 3 years.  It is still working hard.  I regret every kindle book I bought and now can only access on my tablet.",I purchased this Kindle with a Christmas gift-card. This ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"the first time i received this item i wanted to returned cause i have a lot of PDF books and at the beggining it looked like the kindlle did not handle weell that format, but my problem was the configuration, once i fix it, WAOO  i liked a lot, i also have the nook touch and nook with light but these one is even better.  i dont gave 5 stars cause i cant see how many pages are in the book.",3 stars later on  4 stars;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am very happy with my new Kindle, that replaced my first generation one. Spending a couple of weeks without my Kindle was a nightmare! I am looking forward to having it as my constant companion wherever I go. My Kindle is an essential aspect of my work as a travel writer - it is my big-small reference book for all my writing resources.(Visit richardzahra.weebly.com to read some of my travel articles)I would also add that Amazon's delivery service is incredibly efficient. My Kindle was delivered in 3 days. Well done Amazon!",My constant companion is back - in an improved form!;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I would rate it higher but I had a terrible struggle learning to use it. No get-started instructions on paper came with it. I had never used a Kindle and never used an I-phone or touch-screen Smart phone; and touching the screen here and there to make it work
Review: guessing where and how to do it
Title;;;;;;: as the screen was filled over with writing
column4: was very hard. I still mess up a lot. I have no Wi-Fi at home
column5: so I went to Wendy's and couldn't connect as I had to sign in
column6: and couldn't as I am not registered with them;" so I went to Panera to connect and register via their Wi-Fi. I had never used Wi-Fi so I had a struggle with it
column7: but finally connected online. The whole thing was a hard experience. But I am now able to do some reading. And now that I can
column8: I can give the Kindle a higher rating. But I still need to form the habit of using the Kindle to read. I wonder if that will happen.""
column9: Not Easy Getting Started--But I Finally Made It";;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've had it for a month, I love it! Long battery life, enables me to read on the go a lot easier that lugging around books. It is super lightweight, easy to hold with one hand. Simple and elegant interface. I have already finished 3 books with it, and bought one for my brother on his birthday.",I love it! Long battery life;;;;;;

Review: I love my Kindle paper white. The only think I would have wanted is a back light but I got mine for a cheaper price so it didn't come with one. Other than that it allows me to read when I'm outside at the beach or pool. So I'm very happy with it.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first kindle and I like it very much. It's easy to read and carry with one hand. In fact, I like kindle paperwhite more because it has a built-in light, but I need to pay for $40 more for it and it's only the last year version, so I considered to buy this one instead. I've used it everyday and then start forgeting about buying a real book again. You don't need to buy another wall adapter if you have adapter for your mobile phone that can put USB plug into it.  There are couple things that I don't like, first is about the battery. The battery life advertised as it last for several weeks, but if i use it everyday, it can last for only a week or less so i need to recharge it. The second thing is about its stability, my kindle got slower and hanged after using it for a couple weeks, at that time I cannot read the book at all. But fortunately, it's back to normal after I restarted it (long press about 10 seconds at the On-off button). I would recommend this to my friends for sure.",Not perfect but I like it.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a great product. It is super light-weight and very user-friendly. Setting it up was no problem at all, and I was reading a book on it within 5 minutes of taking it out of the box. I personally think I read faster on this kindle than in a book. Not to say that I don't like books, I still do! It also is great for me because I'm practicing Spanish, and there is a translator and dictionary built in, which makes reading in a second language easier.",This is a great product. It is super light-weight and very user-friendly;;;;;;

Review: This is my 3rd Kindle and I must say I prefer the first one which had a keyboard.  I love the backlit page however and can read all night with no lamp on!  I long for my page turning buttons since dexterity becomes a problem with age and when I hit to turn a page  it may be to hard or in the wrong place and all kinds of surprises occur!  I read so much (up to 3 books a day) that I get frustrated with this version of Kindle.  I am certain that dexterity only declines so who knows what the future Kindles will bring for us older folks but hope the innovators keep us in mind!
Title;;;;;;: I love the backlit page however and can read all night ...;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Very good for the price.I bought it with advertising. I thought it would bother me, but the truth is that the ads are pretty, also only show up when it's on standby. I loved that does not reflect sunlight, and is very light.So far, I recommend it. Economic, good quality, very easy to carry and the screen is very sensitive.",Simple and lovely!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had a Kindle keyboard for many years, was very happy with it and never had any problems. When I saw the offer for this Kindle at a discounted price, I decided to upgrade mainly for the touch screen features.  I am very happy I did.  This one  is a little smaller and lighter than the previous model, but very easy to use.  It is much easier in all aspects such as selecting a font, finding a definition, etc.  Getting this Kindle was a great decision and I am very happy with it.  It arrived timely and with very little packaging.  I would highly recommend.",Thrilled with upgrade from Keyboard Kindle;;;;;;

Review: I had to return this product after only 3 weeks.  It would not find Wi-Fi so I could not add or purchase ebooks.
Title;;;;;;: I had to return this product after only 3 weeks ...;;;;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"My Kindle Keyboard lasted 5 years and when it died I quickly purchased the simple 6"" glare-free model. Right away I was disappointed that it doesn't have the side flippers for turning pages. I find that more often than not when I touch the screen on the right side to move to the next page it flips forward a few pages, not just one.When I lay on my (right) side and read in bed while holding this Kindle with my left hand - I can't turn the page! May not seem like a big deal, but it is to me. I must investigate the other available Kindlesto see if there is one more suited to my needs.",Ok but...;;;;;;

Review: I like my Kindle. This is the first one and I received it for Christmas last year. I love reading and the fact I can get free books or even low cost books are Awesome. With me on a fixed income this is Great. I may in the future get a Kindle with a light built into it but out from that I have no complaints.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought as a replacement for a Kindle Touch.  Works pretty much the same, except the shutdown procedure is more involved.Also, shutting down the Wi-Fi on the ""Touch"" did not involve ""Airplane Mode"", as it does on the new one.  Just differences thattake some time getting used to.","Good Replacement for the ""Touch""";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I like the Kindle a lot, but have had some difficulty figuring out how to get everything set up via the user guide.  Some of it I'm still sorting out, but I'm getting there.  The unit itself is lightweight, easy to read and use.  I did notice that the colder my fingers were, the more trouble I had getting the touchscreen to work.",I like the Kindle a lot;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I took advantage of a Prime Day deal to buy this for my partner, who is an avid reader but a reluctant adopter of new technology. I have a first-generation Kindle Fire that I like very much, and hoped my friend would benefit from the convenience and portability of an e-reader. There was no trouble at all setting it up, and the matte screen looks great -- he doesn't mind the lack of a light, especially if it means longer battery life (it does). He loves the small size, the ease of buying books and the sleekness and user-friendliness of the Kindle. The ads (book suggestions) are not a problem at all;" they're very subtle and sometimes interesting.""
Review: Great for a Kindle newbie";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This was surprisingly user friendly to start up, and set up, for my preferences.  The glare free feature is by far and away the best feature.  I am using this strictly for reading purposes and for that it is wonderful.  Light weight, small enough to fit in my small purse, and easy to use.",Great REading Device;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"10x better then the old e book readers. Love the touch screen aspect. This lesser model is nice and simple. No bells or whistles. Cool dictionary aspect. It even let's you see areas of the book people highlighted most. Overall, exactly what I needed... I can't bring a book to work but this is perfect",10x better then the old e book readers;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Very happy with my new kindle (version 7 I believe).  I never had one before.  I'd read on my phone or tablet, but this is so much more comfortable to hold and easier on the eyes.  I bought a reading light with it and I couldn't be happier.",Love it;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have Kindle Fire but the backlighting is hard on my eyes. So I got Kindle Touch. I like it much better. I get a much more comfortable on my eyes experience when I am reading. I will still use my Fire for other things, but for reading, Kindle Touch.",I like it much better;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had a Kindle Keyboard that got wet, and never was quite the same again.  All I wanted was another barebones Kindle and the 6"" Glare-Free Touchscreen is perfect.  I don't care that it has no light and it is perfect for outdoor reading.  Good price and just what I needed.","All I wanted was another barebones Kindle and the 6"" Glare-Free Touchscreen is perfect. I don't care that it has no light ...";;;;;;

Review: Easy to activate. I love this Kindle because I can easily slip it in my purse or coat pocket so I always have a book handy to read. I do miss the buttons to turn pages available on the first Kindle I owned.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"So I accidentally dropped my pretty kindle from a roof to an awning, just like an old cartoon of a baby falling, and onto the pavement.  It doesnt bounce but it does scuttle. I was certain it would blink out and die but it was still on the correct page. Its either devil spawned or more durable than my car. Bumped into a parking meter with that and the fender crumpled.","Big Fall, Still Alive!!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Outstanding e reader it works even in bright sun. The kindle weighs barley anything which makes it super easy to read. My books download within 30 to 60 seconds. With wifi the possibilities are endless the experimental browser is a bit tricky to work ( does not support html5) i don't ever really use it noting the kindle is not in color. The battery lasts for weeks not days and charging is super fast. If you do not want special offers hold down the power button until a screen pops up and tap screen off then it is just a blank screen so that takes care of the special offers ( which never really annoyed me ). the send to kindle email is great i can send .pdf, .jpeg, .txt and lots more straight to my kindle. the books are very well priced and with kindle unlimited it makes reading even better you get almost all the books for free in the store for just 9.99 a month (ten dollars ). over all this is a great product i would recommend it to anyone who is looking for an e reader.",kindle review;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I was really hesitant to buy a Kindle - I could always find great deals on used books and preferred reading that way. Now that I live in New York, it's harder to read books while holding on for dear life on the subway and I quickly realized I might need an easier way to read. This Kindle is PERFECT for what I needed. Love it.",Perfect for the NYC Subway;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is exacly what I wanted!I love reading and this device provides me with an easy way to carry books and magazines (the ones with few pictures)  every where. The battery goes weeks with out recharging,  It is light weight and fits in my purse. This is my second Kindle. My first is a 1st generation Fire, which is great, since you can do a lot more with it. However, my second one goes everywhere.",Great if you love to READ!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my new Kindle 6"" glare free touchscreen display.  It was so easy to adjust the print size for these old eyes.  I like to read at night when I go to bed.  But frequently I fall asleep and drop the book to the floor without marking my place.  With this device, hitting the carpet is no problem.  And the next time I turn on the device, it's right were I left off.  The glare free screen is extremely important as I have cataracts too.  It's just the right size to take along to doctor visits.  I had already purchased several books that were in the Cloud for downloading to keep me busy until the next Social Security check comes.  Smiles!!!",Love it!  Love it!  Love it!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had another Kindle... it was ruined when my apartment flooded - and just from exposure to the high humidity caused from the flooding. I can't stand trying to read books on my phone because it fatigues my eyes. The screen these Kindles provide help to alleviate that issue. Also, they are great to use if you are outside, because they don't have the glare other screens may have. It is super simple and fast to load up your account on the product. If you want something that is easy to read, has no frills, and lasts a long time, this is what you need to have in your life.",they are great to use if you are outside;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I read a lot, sometimes traveling to and from Asia. Airport, airplane, transit lounge....ALL COVERED! Never finish a book and can't find another one. I am currently reading a book I checked out on line! Selection in the thousands!","I read a lot, sometimes traveling to and from ...";;;;;;

Review: I have only owned one Kindle prior to ordering this one.  It was a first generation Kindle and because of Sprint being the connectivity and no Sprint service in our area the nearest place to be able to download books was 100 miles from my home.  What a pain that has been.  I really like this Kindle with the simple touch screen and although the screen is not lit I have not encountered any difficulty reading in a lower light room.  I am so happy that I purchased this Kindle.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"LOVE my new Kindle. It is exactly as described and completely meets my expectations as well ass perfectly serves my needs. I know there are other, ""more advanced"" versions available. However, my requirements are simple and this Kindle is ideal for them. Thank you Amazon, for a great product and exceptional service!",LOVE my new Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I absolutely adore my kindle! i love that it is small enough to take just about anywhere you can take a phone, and even though it doesnt have its own light, i find thats easy to work around (dollar store booklight saved my life while in the hospital one night)I also have a pretty savere astigmatism, so my eyes strain easily when looking at computer screens, but the kindle doesnt give me that issue!Overall I am a happy little book worm who has already downloaded too many books to her kindle and is considering quitting her job to catch up wtih her reading... :)",i love that it is small enough to take just about ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have only had my Kindle for a short amount of time, but I absolutely love it.  I use to be completely against eReaders when they first came out and thought that actual books were just so much better.  However, after taking a long vacation recently I understood how nice it would be carry around hundreds of book on a device that takes up hardly no space.  I also really enjoy the no glare screen that makes me feel like I reading from an actual book.  I would personally recommend this to anyone who loves to read books.  Another plus is the ability to rent books from a library (no late fees)!",Great purchase!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have had the Kindle for a week now and I must say I love it. I got it an exclusive deal from Amazon for a great price. I am now tempted to get the Amazon Paperwhite which has about twice the resolution as this one and a backlight. But even this is really awesome. I rarely read in the dark and the resolution was pretty good for me. Vey light in weight and unlike other tablets very readable when there is light around, including direct sunlight with absolutely no glare. Excellent product!",... for a week no and I must say I love it. I got it an exclusive deal from ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I had and older Kindle that was actually a hand me down. It wasn't even touch screen! I loved it anyway... Well, one fateful day, I sat on it and cracked the screen. It sucked. This one is so new and shiny. Literally. Very easy to read display, no straining, no squinting. Menues are straightforward, just a quick swipe and click to adjust most settings. I'll admit I was slow to get a digital reader and this isn't a real fancy one (you can get on the regular internet,  it has a browser) but for someone that thinks sitting at home and reading is like a dream vacation, Kindle is the s***!",I like books!;;;;;;

Review: Although the functionality is a little awkward (still adjusting to that) it is the perfect size to read on the go.Glare free claims seems to be spot on even outside. Overall it was a good purchase at a great price!
Title;;;;;;: ... little awkward (still adjusting to that) it is the perfect size to read on the go;;;;;;

Review: I love my new kindle and the way it feels in my hand while reading. I wish I  could read it in the dark (but I knew I would not be able to do so when ordered) I'll have to find a good book light for when I need it. I bought the Amazon made case in pink and it complements my kindle perfectly! If you are just wanting a device to read on or something to easily carry to the beach or pool I highly recommend this kindle.
Title;;;;;;: I love my new kindle and the way it feels in ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I like my new Kindle because it doesn't strain my eyes compared with other tablets, because it is cost-effective, and because of its superior battery performance. However I can't buy some kindle books that are available else where in the world, for example from amazon.cn (China). I don't know how it'll function abroad. I'll wait and see and post back of possible.",I like my new Kindle because it doesn't strain my eyes ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This Kindle has the ads that run on the front. I wasn't aware of that as we also have a Kindle Fire that just shuts off. Buyer beware on that front as you can't control the ads. Otherwise, works great!",works great!;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first Kindle.  I bought it at a sale price of $59.99 be cause I just want to read books on it so decided to start slow and if I like it I maymove up to a Paperwhite for the light and whiter page.  So far I am satisfied with this one except for one annoying thing.  I thought when you go to Amazon and use the option to remove a book then the book should no longer appear on the reader.  I, however have a full book still on my kindle that I deleted. If every book I buy stays in my library in spite of being deleted I will be very unhappy.  Stuff like that will send me back to buying real books very quickly.books.  Update!  Enough internet browsing brought me the help I needed.  I was able to delete completely two free books I didn't want.",Mixed Feelings.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"completely satisfied, bought one for me and one for my girlfriend, we read perfectly, glare-freesince it doesn*t have blacklight you must be in a well-lit room, with the right illumination it readsperfectly, 10/10 would recommend.oh and now it has an update for the OS which added features such as horizontal view and a couplemore features, simply perfect.",epic :);;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Received it as a Christmas gift. Found it easy to set up, and use. It will go a long way toward reducing, or eliminating, the already-read ""book clutter"" within my household. I can wholeheartedly recommend it to all who read as voraciously as I do. T.D.",An Excellent Acquisition !;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my new kindle. It's exactly as described. I read a lot so I find it convenient to have, especially when traveling. The display is crisp and easy to read, and everything is quite simple to maneuver. It's lightweight but doesn't feel cheap. Of course it doesn't have a back light but for the price it's a good deal. Other than not having a back light, it does everything the paperwhite does. If you're on a budget, you should definitely get this. Just know that it's solely an e-reader, no media.",I love my new kindle;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"Very disappointed with this new Kindle. I had the previous version (with buttons on the sides), unfortunately that one has been misplaced. I bought this new touch one while on sale since I love having the kindle for train rides, but it is not living up to expectations. The most annoying thing is that the touch seems to get caught on a glitch cycle where if I try to go back one page it takes me to a random forward page, and then I hit back and it takes me forward again and I get stuck in a loop of 2-3 pages flipping back and forth and it takes 6 touches just to get back to my original spot, and I give up on trying to go back a page because god only knows if I'll ever be able to get back to my current location. During this glitch cycle the bottom left corner always displays the same page number even when it is clearly a different page, so I literally have no idea where I'm at in the book or how to get back where I was...i get lost in the book and not in a good way.Also, this kindle seems to be slightly bulkier than the previous one--not by a lot, but the ""frame"" is a few millimeters thicker, which isn't a big deal, other than the other one slid into back pockets/bags easier.I honestly don't know why they felt the need to update to a touch screen for the basic kindle--considering it is glitchy, bigger, and tapping a screen versus pressing a button doesn't change anything about my Kindle reading experience, but making me read my book like a flip book is really obnoxious.",Very disappointed with this new Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I like how simple the device is to use and the screen is very easy on the eyes. I bought it for my mom, but she is visually impaired and even on the largest font setting she could not see it. I am using it and it's great.",Awesome Kindle;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Really should be 2.5 stars. I bought this Kindle to replace my Kindle keyboard which just died on me. When I got it, it made me sad. I think the reading screen is the same size (I think...) but it felt smaller. I knew going in that it was touch screen, but I didn't realize how much of an impediment to reading that would be- my hands are often cold, so I wear gloves a lot- not good with the new Kindle. To me, it felt more like reading on a phone. Yes, the set up was easy and my old books appeared nicely- but I didn't find it nearly as appealing. Thankfully the folks at Amazon, upon hearing my unhappiness, allowed me to return it and I ordered a new ""old"" Kindle so hopefully that one works out. FYI, for those who still have the plug/ charger that came with the older Kindles, this new kindle doesn't come with a power cord, but the charger/ plug for your old Kindle will work/ interconnect with this one, so you don't need to buy a new charger if you still have your old one. There isn't anything technically wrong with this Kindle- but for me, the size and the feel were unappealing. The lack of keyboard really wasn't a factor, but the lack of page turning buttons was a factor. Agree with some other reviewers- if I hadn't had a Kindle before would likely have loved this one. again, glad Amazon was willing to work with me and crossing my fingers for a new old Kindle!",it made me sad. I think the reading screen is the same ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Have had the Kindle 2 weeks now .... Amazing little Gadget. ....The only thing I don't like is...  trying to read with lamp light is kind of difficult. In retrospect, If I had it to do all over again I would have have purchased a Paperwhite.",Amazing little Gadget;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I don't really like the touch screen. I accidently hit it and then lose my page. I would rather have the buttons on the sides to change the pages.Also, they do not have a case with a light built in for this model. They have one for the 6th generation and I loved it. Hopefully the case and the light I bought will be just a good as the case with the light.",I don't really like the touch screen;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Excellent price and quality are both very satisfactory.  I like the look and feel of this display, which reads like a book page, the intended design of course.  It's also very light to hold, although I wouldn't mind a rougher surface on the frame so as to grip a little better.  I realize one can buy covers, but then that adds cost and bulk, which tends to defeat the advantages of this Kindle by itself.  I'm enjoying reading more with this product than anything I could imagine since it's so different from reading book pages, yet so very advantageous.  I know it's been around for some time, but for those of us just joining the Kindle brigade, it's just as satisfying now as it must have been for those experienced Kindle readers of several years already.  And I have an iPad, iPhone, Mac and other PCs to read off of too, but this little device will be great just because of its exclusive use for book reading.  What a joy.","Ok, I'm new to Kindle, but it's still Fabulous";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchased this to replace the original Kindle... and I have truly enjoyed it. The touch screen is so much more convenient and there are more intuitive features that allow you ""control"" your experience that were not in the older version. For example, I set my Kindle to not show all the highlights from previous readers. Admittedly, I don't really care what previous readers found good enough to highlight, particularly for fiction. I just want to enjoy the book myself. :) Lastly, I admit, the back light (in the Paperwhite version) would have been nice for night time reading but really, an additional $40 so you can read without light? I haven't seen one to try it but it's hard for me to think the convenience is worth the extra $40.",GREAT NEW VERSION OF THE BASIC KINDLE!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have been against readers, due to glare and size. As an avid reader, there is just 'something' about an actual book in your hands. This has been a great substitute! There is no glare. Its lightweight. It actually reads like a book. Its suprising how much the font looks and reads like a book. I like that I can carry many books on my kindle, I ride the train as commute and now I don't have the weight!! Thanks Amazon, just another reason I am a returning customer!!",This has been a great substitute! There is no glare;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Life changing device! 10 books read in a 3 weeks spam. Is incredible wjow easy is to set up and start reading. The difficult part is to stop reading, honestly, is addictice! The feeling you get in the hands and the low stress you inflict in your eyes with this device, makes wnat to read the whole day. Easy 5 stars!",Is incredible wjow easy is to set up and start reading;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"It okay for the price.  I don't see how to change the lighting, and the glare free screen makes it a little too dark to read in bed at night.  It's a lightweight, inexpensive reader, and it is what I expected.  It's definitely no frills.",It okay for the price. I don't see how ...;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"It's not very user friendly, and was difficult to set up (I won it in a raffle). Also it is not compatible with textbooks, which is the reason I wanted it. I wold rather have a home button than the total touchscreen set up, which is why I said it's not user friendly. It is easy to read outside, but I wish it had a light behind the screen. Also, I tried to add my mom's account as the other adult and it wouldn't let me because I had had a different adult in the last 180 days which was a mix up I had when trying to set myself as the main owner.",Not user friendly and doesnt work with textbooks;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Great! User friendly, only downfall is I bought it for $79 after waiting 2weeks for the price to drop, the day after I purchased it(needed by Xmas) the price went down to $59  typical. Bought as a gift for my teen daughter who has recently discovered a love for reading. I'm sure she will get plenty of use out of this.",Great! User friendly;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought it, reading on it, and absolutely loving it! The reviews said it wasn't much different than the Paperwhite and I don't honestly see a difference. This little gem is the prefect fit for my reading needs.",Great for the avid book reader!;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my second Kindle.  The first had 3G and a keyboard.  The 3 G stopped working (and after 2 hours on the phone with a nice lady from India, they still couldn't find the problem and my phone died while she had me on hold and I couldn't stand the thought of calling back) and the battery wouldn't really stay charged anymore, had also gotten wifi so I got this new, cheaper version.  The touch screen is beyond a nightmare.  The regions actually overlap, so, for example, it's impossible to highlight anything without the pages flipping.  But that's just an example.  I have other touchscreen devices and this is beyond the worst.  Also the page turning forward region is on the right.  Who holds their book with their dominant hand?  No one.  So, if you're right-handed, you can't just slip your thumb over to tap it.  (I have left-handed friends who feel they're finally getting the recognition they deserve.)  Then, it's impossible to know what you have to do to turn a page, because in the store it's different from when you're reading, and within things in the store it may be different.  Turning the wifi on and off is also annoying, because you have to go into a menu to change it.  Actually, I hate this thing, but gave it an extra star just because, well, it's a Kindle, and you can shop and get good prices, etc.  Otherwise, it would be in the trash and I'd be investigating other e-readers.",What a misery this thing is.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my kindle! It's light weight easy on the eyes, I love being able to browse through the books and having them instantly on my device. I have it synced with my phone so I listen to books while I take my walks and it automatically updates where I left off so I can read on the kindle where I left off. I actually like the ads because they are book or kindle accessories ads. The ads introduce books I wouldn't normally look know about. If they were product ads then it would bother me. I love my Kindle",I love my kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my Kindle(s).  My wife has 1 and I purchased this one for myself.  Definitely great for the beach as there is absolutely NO GLARE.  Highly recommend picking one of these up, if for no other reason than travel-reading.",I love my Kindle(s);;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love this new Kindle. It's lighter-weight than my old Kindle, it has more storage space, and I love having a touchscreen. Navigation is so much better and simpler. All the functions of my old Kindle have been improved in this one. I've set it up, I've downloaded all of my books on it, and everything is ready to go.",I love this new Kindle;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I love reading e-books on it, but then I have problems with the experimental browser crashing and malfunctioning on me when I use it. A lot of the e-books I had on my home computer I had transferred to it once I finally got it delivered.",My new Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I should have read the specifications better.  I thought it was the same as my wife's and immediately bought it.  OPPS.  No back light and the print doesn't change when tilted.  Bought a portable reading light and now I can read in the dark.  Over all,  very happy with my purchase. It works exactly as advertised.",I should have read the specifications better. I thought it was the same as my ...;;;;;;

Review: I love the kindle product BUT I do not like the way their is a book advertisement every time I open the kindle. I really liked the pictures on my last kindle when I turned it on. I also wish the books could be deleted from the home page once you .press remove from device. Haven't figured out how to do that yet.

Ohh I have owned so many of these ( and other brands ) that I can say this is one of the better readers around.  I am very happy with this product and even buy them as gifts ( as this one was for my brother ).  Very happy with this product.
Title;;;;;;: ... that I can say this is one of the better readers around;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"The nonglare screen is awesome. Reading at the pool is no problem. I was skeptical but it is beyond my expectations.  In addition,  I recently had a detached retina and I can actually see and read more clearly on my kindle than on the printed page.  So pleased!",Why did I wait so long??;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I like the ease of use of this tablet as well as the screen.  It is handy to have a touch screen.  Previously I owned one of the very first kindles that came out.  I liked it, however, the buttons that turned the page had been a problem for me, flipping too soon, etc.  That is why I like the touch screen.  The icons are well arranged.  Well done!",a good purchase if one just wants to read.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Exactly what you would expect from a kindle at a bargain price, unfortunately the prices fell again after purchasing mine, but I don't regret purchasing it. I use it both in and out of class now for personal reading.",Exactly what you would expect from a kindle at a ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Things I liked about Kindle - 6"" Glare-Free Touchscreen Display, Wi-Fi:1) Light and Easy to carry around. Weighing only 191 gms and with a size of just 6.7 x 4.7 x 0.40 (169 x 119 x 10.2 mm) this device is sleek, lightweight and super easy to carry around. It fits in our pocket, bags, purses and can be easily carried around in our hands. It is lighter even than a paperback!2) 6"" Glare-Free, Touchscreen Display: The screen size of 6"" is just right for reading and the Touchscreen display reads like real paper - no screen glare, even in bright sunlight which is really impressive again makes reading during the day easy on our eyes and doesn't put any strain on them.3) Impressive Battery Life: This Kindle device has a long lasting battery life that lasts weeks. So no more tension of charging the device again and again!4) Faster page turns: A 20% faster processor delivers smooth, quick page turns.5) Adjustable Font size: We can adjust the font size from eight sizes according to our needs. The font size can be made bigger or smaller without any hassle which makes reading easy and more pleasurable.6) Exclusive Amazon Features like Goodreads integration, Vocabulary Builder and Word Wise: This Kindle device has some really cool features likea built-in search option that searches wikipedia, x-ray and dictionary for meanings of words and phrases.Share favourite quotes with friends on Goodreads, Facebook and Twitter. We can also rate books on Goodreads directly from our Kindle by connecting it to Wi-fi.Word Wise: Word Wise makes it easier to enjoy and quickly understand more challenging books. Short and simple definitions automatically appear above difficult words, so we can keep reading with fewer interruptions. Tap on a word to bring up a simple card with definitions, synonyms, and more. We can adjust the number of hints you see with a simple slider.In-line Footnotes: We can create and then read each footnote with a single tap without losing our place in the book.The Kindle remembers the location in the book where we left off. Whispersync technology synchronizes your last page read, bookmarks, and annotations across all your devices so you can pick up exactly where you left off reading.Easy Translation: We can easily translate any passage in other languages using the Bing Translator provided in this Kindle.7) Carry thousands of books at one time: Amazon provides free cloud service and with over 4 Gb of space on the Kindle device, we can carry thousands of books  in our Kindle at one time.8) Buy easily from Amazon and download to read without needing a computer: The Kindle connects to the Wi-fi and we can easily shop on Amazon and get our book directly on our Kindle device. No computer needed!9) Fast Charge Time: The Kindle charges fully in about four hours time by connecting it from a computer via USB cable and stays charged for weeks!10) Supports a wide range of formats and provides free conversion service to convert formats to Kindle readable ones:This Kindle device supports Kindle Format 8 (AZW3), Kindle (AZW), TXT, PDF (without password and DRM), unprotected MOBI, PRC natively;" HTML
