Review: My old kindle was easier to figure out. But I love the size and screen. Miss my 49 page lists of all my books. Not liking all the pictures. Really not necessary. Amazon service wa great. The return of the defective kindle super easy. Thanks to Sophia
Title;;;;;;: But I love the size and screen;;;;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"I had the basic Kindle and really liked it so was surprised and disappointed when receiving this one that it's not as user-friendly. I thought the touch-screen was going to be great but sometimes it turns back to the previous page and it sometimes takes a while to turn.  It's also not as easy to purchase books from the device so I wait until I can get in front of the computer to do so.  The light for my other one was built into the cover but the only lights I've seen available for my new one sets above the Kindle.  If I fell asleep reading with my old one, the light would automatically shut off after so long and it wasn't in the least cumbersome.  I haven't bought a light for my new one as I'm not sure that I'm going to keep it. Very disappointed!",I had the basic Kindle and really liked it so was surprised and disappointed when receiving this ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"My mother loves to read, though in recent years she'd fallen away from it (time, convenience, etc.), so naturally being a Kindle lover myself (I own a former generation with the keyboard), I thought this would be a great gift for her and was able to get a great deal on it during Black Friday this year.I dislike the idea of having ads on the Kindle (relevant or not), but appreciate Amazon's willingness to make the Kindle more affordable than previous models by having the option for ads (which you can pay $20 at anytime to remove, if you so choose). This Kindle is exceptionally more modern than my Kindle Keyboard and was significantly less expensive - that's a win no matter how you look at it.I found the size of it on Christmas morning a huge improvement over my Kindle. It is small and lightweight, yet the screen itself is much crisper and more responsive than my own. The only thing I can fault it with is that the black plastic looks and feels a little brittle and cheap.I helped my mom set it up which was easy enough to do and you're given a brief tutorial upon getting to the home screen for the first time. A lot of the basic concepts from my Kindle carried through to this Kindle (love the touch screen and the mini cover displays on your home screen ""book shelf). However, I really wish Amazon would give a start-up guide in paper form with the Kindle. The user guide on the device itself isn't ideal to learn from and I've had to field several questions from my mother since walking her through it on how to do something. I would argue that despite the better features (especially the ability to click a character's name in a book and be given a biography on them), it's a little less user friendly than previous versions. I'm 29 years old and the learning curve took me a bit, even being a seasoned Kindle user.Even in light of a few minor annoyances, I plan on buying one of these for myself soon. The size and speed of this model will be a great upgrade to my Kindle Keyboard and I absolutely love the ability to borrow Kindle books from my local library.I worry a bit that my mother won't fully utilize her Kindle based on the confusion she's had with the interface, but like everything else in life, practice makes perfect. I have some grievances with the user interface of this Kindle, but it's not enough to dissuade anyone from purchasing it and it remains the best e-reader on the market, and for good reason.My advice to potential buyers is to save $20 by buying the version with ads. They're relatively unobtrusive and many cases have functionality to auto turn on/off the device when the cover is opened, so it makes the ads even less noticeable. Use that $20 to invest in your first few books, and if you find the ads too much to deal with, you can go to Amazon and pay to have them removed. Just my .02.",Improvement to Previous Models (with a Few Exceptions);;;;;;

Review: Love this touch screen.  Had the old version with the button commands & will never go back.  Didn't want to pay the extra for the back-light model (plus it had some bad reviews) and this one works fine for my needs.  I suggest you get some sort of case to protect the screen from accidental scratches.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Just what I expected from the latest generation. This is my first reader, I was waiting until the price came down and they got the fundamentals right. This is the one. Yeah, you have to put up with it displaying an ad on the lock screen--but so what, I saved $20.The screen is very readable, the fonts are scallable, downloads are quick and simple, and the device itself is comfortable in the hand.It would be perfect if this were the paperwhite version with the backlight for this price, and if all books could be had for the deep discounts I've found on a few books (like $1.99).",Just what I expected.;;;;;;

Review: My first Kindle is ancient but still works though the letters on the buttons are difficult to read now. My 8 year old grandson finds it useful. What I like best about this newer version is the more compact size which is barely noticeable in my purse. Also the touch screen. Glad I made the switch!
The touch screen is too sensitive. one tap often scrolls 2-3 pages. The ON button is too small. I liked my old Kindle better.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This was my second Kindle after having a seller refurbished unit from another website die (Amazon couldn't replace it but offered a reduced price replacement).The Kindle came with everything but its original box and manual but, from previous usage, I was able to fire it up and get it running. There was a digital guide already on the unit that helped to reacquaint with the features which was nice.This kindle uses a screensaver when ""powered off"" and I was skeptical of the battery draining from this, but three weeks later, it still had battery power and worked great.The touch features are excellent. The screen registers each touch flawlessly. I prefer not having buttons on the face of the unit so the touch features are nice.I've currently got approximately 30 full length novels on it and there is still tons of space available for reading material. There is no worry in my mind that I'll ever fill the entire storage capacity.I don't anticipate needing another kindle after buying this one. It definitely exceeds my expectations.",Works and looks like new;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love it!  Lightweight and small enough to fit easily into my purse.  Size and weight make it easy and comfortable to read in bed.  My original Kindle didn't work with our home Wi-Fi, but this one does and makes ordering new books so easy.  So glad I bought it.",Love it! Lightweight and small enough to fit easily ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Not as intuitive as earlier models, but once one becomes familiar with the interface--and reads the guide--it's pretty simple. Also, the features not on my older Kindles (like storing words one looks up and having the covers of books shown in the library) make it even better.",An overall improvment.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is truly a great product. The fact that my Kindle can stores so many books. And I can take them with me anywhere I go. This can fit in the smallest of pocketbooks and also it can fit in my coat or the pocket of a light jacket. It's anti-glare it's great indoors and Outdoors. This product is what it says it is. I don't understand why people complain about it not having a back light when it clearly doesnt states that it doesn't have One to begin with. For the price of this product. It's well worth it. Now if you want a backlight which for me I don't find it necessary even though I wear glasses. Then yeah you can go ahead and spend the extra $30 or $40. I would totally recommend this product for the Carefree and fussy free person. I find this adorable, affordable very well priced, superlite to carry and an endless library of books to choose from. Which I might add that the books are very well priced. No complaints here like many of the other reviews. I would totally recommend this product over exceeded my expectations thank you Amazon a million times!!!!",This is truly a great product. The fact that my Kindle can stores ...;;;;;;

Maybe because I had another Kindle.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This Kindle does not have a light and while I was disappointed at first it's not really a big deal. Books don't have lights, and I can see the screen as clearly as a book, though the back is grayish and not white like paper, I adjusted quickly. It's better on your eyes as a night-time reader as well. This e-reader was cheap, only $49 on Black Friday sale, perfect for an introductory e-reader.Important detail about E-Readers that I did not anticipate! E-Books aren't aren't cheaper for new releases (older books are for the most part), and Amazon limits your rights to your purchase. You can't share libraries with friends well because your Kindle is synced to a single Amazon account. This is annoying, because I tend to share books with friends and the time limit to borrow a book is two weeks.EDIT: One year later my Kindle is going strong and I have really come to love it. I've upped my rating from 4 stars to 5. I love being able to download a bunch of books from the Kindle store (there's a very good selection of rotating free books). I'm reading more than I have in years and I really like that reading has become part of my nightly routine again.",A Great Introductory E-Reader!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is the best purchase I made this Christmas season! I love my Kindle! Long battery life, easy to use, easy to read (even in the sun), durable, light and easy to carry around. Hopefully this one doesn't get accidentally tossed into the washing machine like the last one

I absolutely love this e-reader.  It is small and so easy to hold.  I have two other Kindles but I find I am using this one almost exclusively.  I really like the touchscreen which makes it so easy to turn pages.  It definitely rates a five!

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"It's great but had I known that the ""with special offers"" meant it would display an ad all day I probably would have just upgraded to the other one. love the functionality and everything, having the ability to pay out of these ads would be awesome though. Maybe there is a way, I don't know...","It's great but had I known that the ""with special offers"" ...";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I don't know why I didn't try using one of these e-readers sooner. It is so much easier than books. My fear was losing my place when I turned it off, you turn it on and you are right where you left off. Great piece of technology",Great piece of;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I got this on the latest promotion, and it was worth every penny. The newest generation of the e-ink Kindle is outstanding in its screen's responsiveness, I was so impressed with it when I was using it to navigate! I can't wait to dive into some new books!",Latest generation -- Biggest improvement;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"If you're looking for a basic E-reader to hold your book without too many bells and whistles, this is a good choice. I previously owned an older Kindle with a keyboard, compared to that one the device is smaller but the screen is the same size. The touchscreen is responsive and you can tap once to turn the page in lieu of a ""Turn Page"" button. Battery life is excellent, can last several weeks. Because it's so thin, you may want a case if you plan on taking it out for storing it in a bag or purse. I was pleased with an ACdream case which provided 365 degree coverage an a sleep/wake magnet that turns the device on or off when you open the cover.","Lightweight, portable, and effective.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have owned my kindle for about 1 year now and I have to honestly say that it is the closest thing to reading a ""real"" book. Just as a background I am an occasional reader who is starting to read more and more. The price is perfect for an entry kindle for people who are like me who occasionally read. However, this is the closest thing to reading a physical book. As we all know physical paper back or hardcover books have no backlighting just like this kindle. For me not having the backlighting has its pros and cons. I prefer the backlighting because I like to read before bed, but not having a backlight really makes me feel like I am holding a real book. It is mind blowing to me that Amazon has created this E-ink design and really make it look and feel like a real book. I am currently waiting for my Oasis to arrive and I really can't wait to use it.Just some quick pros and cons below.Pros:1. No backlight makes it feel like a paperback book.2. Battery life is pretty good.3. I like that I can read on my iPhone and kindle picks up the current page.Cons:1. I wish it was backlight (I know that might sound contradicting, but it would be nice)2. Turning pages is kind of slow.",General Review from a moderate reader;;;;;;

Review: We love it. So until I can afford a second one the twins take turns. It's so easy to switch the profile except I have to put in the password. They are 14 and too distracted with the Internet. My daughter out reads her brother 10-1. I may get the upgraded version for her. She loves books.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"All as I expected.  Easy to use. Like that it came with how-to-use instructions on the Kindle.  I hope it lasts as long as my previous kindle.  I haven't ordered the plug-in accessory yet;"  ...that is the only disappointment
Review: that the plug-in has to be purchased separately and not included in the overall cost of the Kindle. However
Title;;;;;;: I knew this before I purchased the Kindle.""
column4: Easy to use";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Just received a Kindle w/6"" display. Love the device. I can read all of my books late into the night with disturbing my wife (like I used to w/my laptop). Great product, sorry it took a while before I got one...No issues.  Everyone should have one.",Great Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first E-reader and it's awesome! It came with my amazon account on it so set up was a breeze. Then all I had to do was plug it into my computer and simply upload my books onto it. The books look great and it really does look like real paper! Overall, this is a great E-book and is environmentally friendly (after about 100 books). If you love reading and want to carry your library everywhere, do yourself a favor and buy a kindle- you won't regret it!**** THIS KINDLE IS NOT BACK LIT **** I do not understand why it's such a big deal considering that normal books do not light up!If you really want to read in the dark then buy a clip-on reading light for $8-$20 or buy a Kindle Paperwhite for $119-$210",Great for book lovers! (Who read with the light on);;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"1) it's bulky with the cover.2) the cover is not user friendly3) didn't like the way the page turn. you can only turn pages left by touching the right side of the screen and right by touching the left side of the screen. i prefer to be able to turn one way by touching either side of the screen! That way, when i am holding either with left or right hand i can still turn the page4) because it is so sensitive, sometimes the pages turned more than once",2) the cover is not user friendly 3) didn't like the way the page turn;;;;;;

I must say that I bought it with an special offer ($50.00) for being an Amazon member, maybe you can wati for this kind of offers to buy one. So, I am happy.",I am happy.;;;;;;

Should make it easier to disconnect wifi, do not understand why it was changed. Thought I might miss the keyboard that was on my older Kindle, not so, the new one works fine.",Easy to use and the price for Kindle books fits ...;;;;;;

If I went back, I would have gotten the higher dpi version, but the lower end version works just fine.",Easy to use;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"My favorite ""basic"" Kindle so far. The touchscreen is much better than the buttons - my last device was a 5th Gen basic Kindle and this is better. I prefer not having a backlight;" if I need to read in the dark I can use the Kindle app on my iPad. The Bookerly font is great. I only wish the device had at least the 212 ppi of the original Paperwhite.""

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"So far, this device has met my expectations. Downloads are very quick and the battery life is great. Even though the menu is easily accessed on-screen;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Good: Functional, well designed.Bad: Wow resolution of text was noticeable on my eyes. I didn't feel it was healthy to continue reading on it. It also had a weird habit of jumping pages, really annoying. I'm sure there was a fix for that, but honestly, for a device that is built to just read books from its own library, there shouldn't be any issues.Conclusion: At least go with the Kindle Paperwhite. The lighting(not backlighting) and the higher ppi really make a difference. If you can, invest in the Kindle Voyage, it is really nice albeit a bit overpriced. The Kobo HD Glo is nearly as good as the voyage for a good amount less money. I have a feeling this technology is going to simultaneously improve and get a lot cheaper in the near future.",Eh;;;;;;

Review: I was not  sure I would like it. but I do. It is very easy to read and I read more books sense I have it. as I can buy 2  for the price of one and I love the sales you have on books . I haven't used your free library yet but I am looking forward to it.. Took it on vacation for easy reading at the beach.in the sun . wonderful. and I don't have to charge it up very often .a great item and a great price . thank you AC

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Does everything I expected it to. Wanted a reader I could use while sitting outside in the sun. Does not have the same functionality as my kindle fire, but that wasn't what I was looking for since I already have one. Instead, this allows me plenty of pool days and sunshine without having to hide in the shade. Completely satisfied and still amazed at how well I can read my books glare free!",Friends with the sun and outdoors again!;;;;;;

Review: Got it for the $49 price on Black Monday and it is worth every penny!  I have since ordered the upgraded color version of the reader because it was on sale at half price.  So far I couldn't be happier with the device.
Title;;;;;;: So far I couldn't be happier with the device;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've mostly been a book reader with the occasional ebook when price was a major difference. I read my books on an iPad. But then I got an offer recently for a $29 kindle and decided to give it a try. Best decision ever. It's so much easier to read on vs the iPad. It's pretty much like having a real book, minus the bulk. Much more comfortable to hold while reading compared to my iPad. With a case it's like I'm holding a real book. My only regret is that I wish I would've gotten a kindle years ago. I will mostly buy ebooks  from now on.",What took me so long to get one?!;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my second Kindle. I originally had the 2012 version but lost it. (They are light and thin and surprisingly easy to lose!)  I use an iPad to do most of my reading, but wanted an inexpensive, barebones  device just for the beach or for reading before bed.What I was surprised to discover is I found this version annoying to use. The pages flicker a bit when turning and it's just hard to get used to a touch screen. After a year of not using it much, I'm selling mine and buying a used 2012 version so I can have the side page turn  buttons back.Three stars because Kindles are just simply great devices you'd never think you need, but the long battery life, ease of reading the e-ink (so it doesn't interfere with your sleep like an iPad) make these a worthwhile purchase. This just isn't my favorite model.",Touchscreen is not for me;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Got this as gift to replace my Kindle I purchased when they were first put out.  It is easier to turn pages, for sure.  However, since I am really computer challenged, it is harder for me to figure out what is what.  Good thing my granddaughter and daughter are here to help me.  Would sure be nice to get printed directions w/things rather than always depending on the computer.  I like to read directions - much easier for me to comprehend.  I am over 70 years old, so go figure!!!",Nice gift!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a slick, portable, long last battery E-READER! It does it and it does it very well. Amazon makes solid, easy to use, inexpensive devices and the new Kindle with touch screen is exactly that. You aren't getting a mistasking Apple device with all the bright lights, bells and whistles. I have an iPad, I wanted something that wasn't going to bug me with notifications every three minutes while I'm trying to read. These kindles are quiet, they last a long time between charges;" this one is about the size of a mass market paper back. Kindle's app allows for sharing between devices

Title;;;;;;: I can read the same book or another book on my iPad mini because of the Kindle app. I wish I would have gotten the Kindle before the iPad because that way all my books would be on all my devices. Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I received my Kindle for my birthday.  It has brought me such joy.  I love the feature of being able to make the letters larger and easier to see.  I have loaded many books including children books I thought my grandchildren might enjoy reading when visiting.  The touch screen is so nice--just touch and the page turns.  I have read several of my books and have really enjoyed the story lines.  Take my advice, buy a Kindle or one of the many readers that are offered to suit your needs.  You truly will love to read again.Paula Andrews",Everyone should own a Kindle !!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Better than any computer or cell phone by far.Wish I acquired one much earlier in life.At 80 years old my eyes need the larger type, and I never lose my page. Convienent to carry, has strong battery life. Wish I had gotten one with light. Also, has no option for changing from portrait to landscape mode or vice vs",Sorry i waited so long.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is perfect for someone who wants no distractions the fancier versions of the kindle and tablets bring. It's so simple and easy to use, portable and very light. I love my kindle. For the major price difference between this one and the one with the backlight built in, it's much cheaper to buy an led light that  hooks inn and it works just as well",This is perfect for someone who wants no distractions the fancier versions ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I chose this version of the kindle over the paperwhite because of a great price offer at the time. At first the whole ""touchscreen"" thing was confusing/annoying because it just seemed to constantly respond to any touch. The usage instructions contained in the kindle were not too helpful. I went online and downloaded them on my pc and then things got much better.It is now quite easy to use and i have loaded my cloud library on the device. My only complaint is that the screen is rather gray... NOT like the paper in any book I ever read. I will definitely need a reading light for it.",Touchscreen kindle works fine;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Good product - does exactly what I expected. The refresh between each page can be disorienting and the screen glare ( touted as the differentiator from an iPad or other tablet) is muted, but direct light still makes it hard to read. Overall a pretty good product!","Meets expectations for hardware, exceeds for quality and content management.";;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"Very disappointed at the quality of the product. It's sooooo buggy. When I started up, the screen was non-responsive on the select language page. I tapped many many times until it finally responded and randomly selected French. When I start reading, I find that at certain font size, certain words are chopped off. Another problem I encountered is sometimes I cannot go back to a previous page, I can only go forward! And I bought two of them, both are like that! I'm very shocked at the quality of the product.",Very disappointed at the quality of the product;;;;;;

Review: This is the best way for me to read a book. I have arthritis in my hands and I am able to read a long time due to the no glare on my bifocal glasses and holding the Kindle is so light weight. I would recommend this product to young and older people who like to read and also with so many special features on this Kindle you can learn so very much so fast.

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"screen is dim and there isnt instruction about how to brighten.  also the 6"" dimensions are just enough bigger to make the holder (for 2012,2013 kindle) that I bought too small.  downloads are easy enough.  I think it should come with a power cord and not have to spend another 20 dollars for a power adapter.",downloads are easy enough. I think it should come with a ...;;;;;;

Review: Personally I am not a fan of the touch screen on my Kindle.  It is to sensitive to every little movement.I prefer the side bar method that I was previously using.  I would not have purchased this model hadI known.
Title;;;;;;: Personally I am not a fan of the touch screen ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I will keep it short and sweet. I love the size and weight. Easier to hold that a printed book and it is not a light like a tablet that will disrupt your sleeping habits (hopefully) if you read in bed. Down side it the constant ads for glasses, oatmeal, Pokeman, etc. on the power off screen. Now if there is a way to change this, great, let me know. Not sure why I need ads, I paid for this device. Don't I get enough on TV, etc?",Great but....;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am currently looking to replace my kindle, according to amazon it would be a 6th generation kindle, so that is what brought me to this page.  As I read the reviews I knew I needed to speak up in defense of this model.A short history to understand where I come from:  I bought my first kindle in 2009 and gave it to my daughter when she married later that year, it was a 2nd or 3rd generation model. I then bought the next generation model and used it for about 2-2.5 years until I had to replace it because the battery wouldn't hold a charge any more (at that time I used my kindle about 6 hours a day, sometimes up to 12 hours). I then bought the current one in the summer of 2013. This one saw less use because less than a month later my husband got me a kindle fire but still I would have to admit I have given it a work out and now it too no longer will hold a charge.For those who ask why I would use both kindles the answer is simple. As you can see from the above information I read a lot. I read on the way to work, on my break at work, at home sitting in my living room or den, and in my bed at night after my spouse is asleep. I initially took my kindle fire everywhere with me until I found that in bright light it was harder to read that my other kindle, while in dim light I like the display light of the fire. So when I travel to the beach I pack my kindle touch and drag it everywhere, and believe me when I say everywhere, and it has performed without a problem.So End of the story is that now I need to replace that kindle and I believe I'll get another touch.ADD: I've been able to get a hold of a relative's kindle voyage and I really liked it. Why you ask? Because the contrast in sunlight was just as good as my kindle touch but unlike the touch I can read it in the dark without waking up my husband.  The other plus is that unlike my fire the voyage didn't give me eye fatigue, meaning I read it one night without a problem for close to 8 hours where at 4 hours in the dark with the fire I begin to feel the strain. So what am I to do now?? Well right now I'll keep my touch and use the fire in the dark but when the touch goes get a voyage.Oh, and by the way, I get about 24-36 hours of reading time with the wireless off with one charge. This equals a charge about every 3rd day or on long weekend a partial charge every night. This is the same with my fire.  My 2nd gen kindle really did go for weeks, 2 or 3, between charges. My 3rd gen kindle made it about a week.  But my touch seems to lose more charge and I think it's because I sleep it and don't turn it off.  Maybe it would last a whole week if I turned it off every night, but who knows.",Long time Kindle user loves the kindle without a light;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,Love it. So much less fuss than my old fire. Less distractions and less glare. I got a little book light so I can read at night since there is no built in light. I only have 4 stars because of even sometimes in the daylight it still seems a little too dim. But it is awesome and came so quickly.,"Quick Delivery, less distractions, easy to use";;;;;;

Review: Love it. The screen looks crisp and the touch screen is responsive. Browsing books and sending books from your Amazon account is easy. I love the dictionary feature.I would take this kindle over one of the more expensive ones any day.

I absolutely love my new Kindle.  It is so easy to read books on it and it is comfortable to hold.  It also fits nicely on my exercise bike stand so I can read as I ride.  It is perfect and would definitely by again.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"The only thing that is disappointing is that it doesn't have a speaker or earphone attachment.  My other Kindle was able to read to me, while I got ready for work or while driving.  I haven't been able to find my word games that I like to play either.  Other than those things, the screen is wonderful and the ease in getting to the controls is great.  I found myself trying to turn pages on my other Kindle with touch more than once, it is surprising how you get used to the touch screen.",I haven't been able to find my word games that I like to play either;;;;;;

Review: I really LOVE my new kindle. The e-ink display is better than my original kindle which I still have. I love the increased space to hold even more books. I read a lot and always like to have many books on hand and of all different genres to fit my mood that day.the battery life is really good for someone who reads for long periods of time.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought as a gift for my granddaughter. She now has her very own Kindle and doesn't have to monopolize Mommy's. She's a voracious reader, and I don't think she's put it down since she got it. She loves the touch screen and found the interface very easy to learn after using her mother's much older Kindle.",She loves the touch screen and found the interface very easy to learn after using her mother's much older Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I LOVE THIS GADGET! It is just what I wanted. The browser works really well and it is so easy to navigate. It isnt in color, which is fine with me. I do recommend this to anyone wanting a simple 'reader'.",I LOVE THIS GADGET;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I've owned several kindles. While I like the screen for reading, they all suspiciously ceased to function shortly after the expiration of the warranty. Amazon technical support was equally unhelpful in resolving the problem, since they simply suggested I purchase another device.",E-reader suspiciously stops functioning at the end of the warranty period.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Gave this to our son who is a avid reader.  His first gen Kindle was starting to show signs of its age, and this new reader has been a hit with him.  He has a tablet but prefers to backpack and camp with a Kindle reader because it's smaller.  The screen is truly non-glare, a point he really appreciates.  Like all the Kindle readers we have in our family, this one holds a charge for a long time, and is measured in days of high usage.",Excellent Reader;;;;;;

Review: I got it on sale for $59.99. That was a good price. I hate the adds though. I hate all adds entirely anyway so its particularly annoying to me. I would buy the add free one if I had a second chance. Other than that the Kindle is fantastic. There is no reason to buy a Paperwhite. Unless you really need a lighted one this Kindle does everything the Paperwhite does.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Smaller and lighter than my old (& now dead, RIP) Kindle, this was easy to set up and the touch screen makes it easy to use. 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Honestly my only issue is that it had no backlight. But it does everything I want completely and totally, and it is a very smart investment.Definitely going to get a new one when I feel like getting another.",Ye;;;;;;

Review: the touch screen is a nice feature but it is also the problem. sometimes its not always easy to only touch the edges of a device. your fingers cramp up and you ajust your hand and then you have just made changes. I will have to buy a case or put some kind of protector on the screen to make it easy to read while holding it but have access to the screen to turn pages. This is a good device if you only read at a table and dont have to hold it.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Was on the fence for a long time on whether I would like reading from a device or not. I have read books on tablets, computers, and even my smart phone before and didn't really enjoy it. The Kindle screen is easy on the eyes, plus it is easy to use.",would recommend.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am so pleased with this purchase. It was received on time and in excellent condition. The battery time is fantastic and all the other functions as well. It is so easy to navigate. I am so happy that I ordered the Kindle Paperwhite because this one does not have a lighted background, but I knew that when I got it. I will pass this one off to someone else who loves reading.",I am so pleased with this purchase;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I had to replace my dead Kindle 2, which I loved.  The new one is OK, the touchscreen is fast and responsive, a little too responsive.  Somehow my fonts increase with the slightest touch and I don't even realize I'm doing it.  Brushing dust off the screen can result in spending several minutes finding your place.  If you accidentally page forward, paging backward to find your place can be an adventure.That said, the Kindle is easy to navigate, the ""ads"" are not intrusive, on-line browsing is good, shopping is good.  But, I would trade for my Kindle 2 or even my original Kindle if I could.  It was hard to accidentally flip pages or access the system/options.",Kindle Touch is Good;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love this. It can fit in my purse and u can pull it out and read it anywhere. Even at the beach. Some of the ereaders are unable to be seen when in direct sunlight. I highly suggest this. Especially if you love to read, like myself!",I love this. It can fit in my purse and ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This was purchased for my son for his daily 20 minutes of required reading.  It's awesome and he really loves it.  I can track the number of pages he reads with bookmarks, making that really simple, and he can change font size etc to make reading time easier.  Most of all we wanted it for the ease of digital library books.  He can pick whatever children's books he wants, change his mind, and change his mind again.  Very convenient and it encourages reading time, which I love.",It's awesome and he really loves it;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my second Kindle Touch and as long as it doesn't wear out/die like the first one did after 21/2 years, I'll stay in love with it.  I am a voracious reader, especially at night. So. I guess I just plain wore it out.  My e-reader is a gift from heaven for me as I can no longer hold a book, especially a hardback for long periods of time.  The Kindle came earlier than expected and I had no problem picking it up to find all of my Library in the Cloud and diving right in to my list of ""books to read"".  Thank you.",Second Kindle Touch;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought it for a pre-teen and she is in love with it!  She reads almost as much as I do.  At first was not sure because I have an older model and really love it.  Thought it may be to much like a tablet, but was surprised it makes me want to buy a new one.",Bought it for a pre-teen and she is in love with it;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"At first I was weary after reading someone elses review that there are about 80 pages to read thru before you can start using it.  Well, those 80 pages took only about 5 minutes to go thru, and was well worth it!  I love the size, functionality, light weight, easy to read and easy to sync up new books.  If you're looking for a reader, I recommend this...",Love it!;;;;;;

Review: I love love love the new kindle!  Went back and forth between the kindle and paper white but thought I would try it I did get a book light to use at night.  The length of the charge lasted about two weeks but I use it for hours every evening.  I don't miss the back light this has been perfect and I found it at staples for less than 40.00!

Have a Kindle Fire also and bought this unit for vacation to be able to read outside in direct sun light.  Received a good deal on it and although I only use it sparingly it does what I bought it for.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I don't understand why you'd  take away the games I used to enjoy but otherwise, I like the new Kindle.  There's something about the home screen that seems less appealing than my older Kindle but that's just a personal wierdness that I'll get over.  I was very happy to get this during the National Reading Month sale and I'm glad I spent the money.  The only thing better than one Kindle is two Kindles!",I miss the games that were available on earlier gen Kindles;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this for a 3 week offshore sailing trip, and I loaded it up with books before I left. I spent many hours reading on this as the boat rocked constantly. Unfortunately the glare of most of the LEDs in the boat was annoying, but it performed great in full sun. It was also moderately resistant to salt spray. I love the feel and the battery life is phenomenal. It's great to not worry about ever pressing the 'off' button if you have to run away and do something. I would certainly buy another as a gift for someone.",This withstood the sailor's test;;;;;;

Review: Does what its intended to do. Manually adding non-amazon ebooks is as easy as drag and drop when connected to a computer. surprised it did read .epub books though and conversion software is hit and miss.

This doesn't have the background light and no buttons but that is fine with me.",This is a great gadget if you use to read reg books -I ...;;;;;;

Have a Kindle Fire which I love but wanted something to read outside in the daylight without glare and with a longer battery life for reading.  Thought I might miss the backlit screen but not at all.  I don't read in the dark anyway.

Plus I got a great deal on it. I bought the clip on light and with it I have no problem reading at night or in dark places. So far the battery lasts pretty long.
