Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love this. I bought the Kindle, just wanting the ability to read books on a small platform. Since I didn't want any of the fancy bells and whistles (backlit screen or anything), this is perfect. It's really intuitive to use, even if you've never picked one up before. I would definitely recommend this if you don't want all the fancy and extraneous options that other versions of the Kindle possess.",I love this. I bought the Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Using it for about a month, so far I'm happy with how it works and feels.Pretty light weighted. Plastic is not slippery.Battery lasts for about a week being used intensively.The touchscreen which is the most critical component, works just fine.Well-designed touch areas, I like the way they did it. Makes paging very easy with one hand.The power button is a regular flat button, not sliding switch like it was on earlier version of Kindle.I would appreciate if the screen background was more white (here it's grayish) but that's something that really bothers me.Good value for money so far, we'll see how long it lasts.","Works fine, good value for your money";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I previously had a Kindle Fire and this Kindle does not match the experience of the ""Fire"".  One example is that it lacks background light so one can not read in a darkened room.  However, I like most other features and it is better when reading in sunlight.  I dropped it one star because of the inability to read in poor light.",e-Reader is a  Good Value!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Love my Kindle, size is right for easy carry in my purse and the battery charge is great for someone who is a serious reader.  My only complaint is you cannot adjust the brightness.  Will have to upgrade to a paperwhite for that but for now will stay with this one.",Love my Kindle;;;;;;

Review: My story is sad/happy. I lost my original reader (6-8 years old) and ordered this new one. The new one came and I looked at the tutorial and took it for a spin. Love it. I found my old reader the same day the new one arrived. Keeping both!David
Title;;;;;;: Love it. I found my old reader the same ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought this when my old kindle keyboard appeared to have died (I had the ""tree screen"" - it magically came back to life a full week after I had already bought this new kindle). I must say that I am loving it as much as the old one. The touch screen took a little bit of getting used to, but overall, this is an excellent READING device. I prefer to do my reading on a non-backlit device, as it doesn't tire my eyes out as much as a regular tablet does.I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys the paper book reading experience, but doesn't want to carry a lot around with them everywhere. Thousands of books in one tiny package? As an avid reader, I'm in!",Not screen time - Reading time!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I really like the touch screen and the ease with which I can look up definitions and type, as well as get on the Internet. Sometimes it's almost too easy to turn too many pages at once, but I'd rather that be the case from time to time than use the side buttons I used to have.  Thank you for the 7th generation Kindle. It's well worth updating as far as I'm concerned.",7th Generation Kindle a Good Buy;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"It seems to work fine , but the case it comes in seems a bit flimsy after my last Kindle ( which got stolen ) It may hold up O.K. , I'm just not convinced at this point . The housing on the older on seemed much sturdier .","It seems to work fine, but the case it comes in seems a ...";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this recently to use this for reading books strickly and this definitely has met my needs and exceeded them. After starring at a computer and phone all day, the last thing I wanted was to read books on another computer screen like device. Having this works perfect and provides the convenience of not having to have multiple books floating around at once. Easy to checkout books from the library and Amazon has great selection to choose from as well.",Great for introductory E-reader;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Purchased the Elsse when Amazon was running a promotion for 59 dollars. No reason to carry around hefty books especially if you read several books at once, storing all your downloads in one single platform adjustable to any font size - I love it!",storing all your downloads in one single platform adjustable to any font size - I love it!;;;;;;

Review: Being an experienced reader user I enjoy this new one. I'm not big on the touch screen only because sometimes it doesn't do what I want (ie I want to turn the page but it hits a footnote or I want to look up the word and it turns the page). Overall I'm satisfied with this reader.
Title;;;;;;: Being an experienced reader user I enjoy this new one;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I loved my original Kindle, but have lost two of them to the dreaded hole in the page that can't be repaired.  The PaperWhite is a welcome improvement so far, still feeling my way on how to do everything I could do on my originals.",Good update;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"My bad... I bought the bundle for kids, which comes with this type of kindle...  We have 3 kindles in our family now, this is for our youngest... but I failed to notice the most obvious limitation - it doesn't come with an internal light!!The kids best reading time is at night before bed (same with their dad and I!)... the Light is essential!!!As I said, I failed to notice - but I am sure others have as well... so what you need is the PAPERWHITE edition if you want a light...",My bad - Doesn't have an embedded Light!!!!  (need paperwhite for that!);;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"It does what it's supposed to. Sometimes it's hard to read at nighttime and you definitely need an extra light to see the words, but other than that, it's simple, gives me the books I need, so it's fine.",so it's fine.;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a fine Kindle. Nothing fancy but meets all the basic needs. I gave it a three because it is a little dim. Since it has no light (which is like a regular book) I would have liked it to be a bit brighter.  However the letters are very clear and of course the font and size is adjustable. I probably would have been happier with the the next one up that has a light, but this was a gift, and a very nice one. As with any hard copy book, just be near a good light source. You can do searches, and make notes, and it has a dictionary, so I'm not really sure what the next one up gives you except for light and a little better resolution. I'd go to a store and see if that makes a difference to you.",This is a fine Kindle. Nothing fancy but meets all the basic ...;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this Kindle during the Prime sale, so it cost $50 or about $30 cheaper. I was impressed with the eink technology and was wanting a reader/tablet. As a musician, I also wanted a device that I could easily display custom documents (like lyrics and lead sheets) while performing. So far, it's been difficult to get your documents displayed exactly as you intend. The interface is much clunkier than Android or iOS. What I would like to see is a spruced up OS (maybe with better organization, folder options, syncable to Google Drive or Dropbox. Variable text scaling as opposed to stepped options). It works ok, but I feel like maybe I should have bought a tablet for what I'm looking to do with the device.",I also wanted a device that I could easily display custom documents (like lyrics and lead sheets) while ...;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Tends to turn off, go to the wrong place in the book when turned on, or change font size,  if touched on the wrong spot. I would prefer a backlit screen.  I wish Kindle had page nos. displayed rather than percentages.  Going to Amazon & finding books works very well & Kindle Unlimited is a really great deal for me since I read about 20 books per month.I would also like pre-orders to be displayed, or to know how to get a list of what I have pre-ordered, without doing an author search, so I can make sure the funds are available.",Going to Amazon & finding books works very well & Kindle Unlimited is a really great deal for me since I read about 20 books ...;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Received this for Father's Day, which of course means I was thankful to receive a present from my kids.  I am, for better or worse, one of those people who adore reading traditional paper-made books - the tactile experience and joy I've received from reading paper books throughout my life has made me averse to change into digital reading.  I feel this Kindle is merely ok - the ability to carry a lot of books in a ""pocket"" (?) device is nice, but I would prefer to have a device that had a backlight for my aging eyes, and reading on this Kindle doesn't provide the same joyful experience (yet) as I get from reading a paper book.",Fathers Day present;;;;;;

Review: I ordered the Kids bundle for myself and am loving it. I am currently sharing it with the 10 year old but with her reading more with the availability of the Kindle (and Kindle unlimited) I may have to buy her one of her own.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am enjoying my new Kindle. I like it's size it fits in my purse, I have found it has been easy to connect with my other Kindle so I have all my books on both. I would recommend it to anyone needing a basic Kindle that has a more useful size.",I like it's size it fits in my purse;;;;;;

Review: A gift for Christmas.  I would have never bought it because I thought I would not enjoy the reading experience.  I was wrong.  I will still buy books I wish to write in and place notes in but my reading has increased.
Title;;;;;;: I would have never bought it because I thought I would not enjoy the reading experience;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love the Kindle I recently purchased. I used to read from paperback books and my android phone. I felt inconvenienced a lot of the time with either the heaviness from the book or interruptions from my cell phone notifications or dying battery. Its been a long time since Ive read a book in one or two sittings but, since Ive gotten the Kindle I am able to read continuously. The kindle is very light weight and durable. Although its durable I would still recommend some type of protective covering. It is perfect for all lighting type but, please beware you cannot read this kindle in the dark there must be some sort of lighting available.",Fall back in love with reading again;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"After using the Kindle Keyboard for years I was very disappointed in the Touchscreen.  One of the main problems was the inability to use a good reading light  - the only ones that will work with it are the clip-on lights that need batteries.  I do not want to be constantly carrying batteries around with me.  I checked into all of the available cases and there are several that say they will work but this Kindle has no way to power them (no connectors)  I also wanted to be able to use headphones.As a simple reader in daylight or using room light it would be just fine and the price is very good l- you get what you pay for - I have returned it for a Fire 6"" and am very happy.",... using the Kindle Keyboard for years I was very disappointed in the Touchscreen;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this to replace my 1st gen Kindle.  I just wanted a reader and I got that and more.  I am delighted with the extras, like Goodread, dictionaries in multiple languages, and flash cards.  For the money, this is a bargain.  I am very happy with this basic reader and Amazon was a pleasure to work with.",A perfect little reader;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Has a ton of storage, incredibly convenient size and image clarity, and the battery lasted 18 days on a single 2 hour charge that I did initially. I use it every night for about an hour to read. It's amazing, I love this thing and will be back for more from Amazon.",100% sold on it.;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I do like this kindle, its easy to use but I wish they would have made it clear that I can charge it from a computer with a USB port and that the battery lasts for several week, otherwise I would not have bought the $15 dollar power adapter.","Kindle is good, I wouldn't buy the power adapter though.";;;;;;

Review: Very small and compact. Easy navigation controls. Like being able to tap instead of swipe. I moved to this after a Kindle Keyboard 3g. Can't say I miss the keyboard. Now just trying to find a good case that I like.

I really love my new kindle. I just want to read books and not do anything else. I bought a light that clips on and works great in the dark. Back light is not good on your eyes so I love what I have at a much cheaper price than the kindle fire!!

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Great product. Light, affordable and the screen is very easy to read. The touch screen creates a solid reading experience. I love having my whole library with me, without the distractions of my smartphone.",Solid product;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I *never* would have thought it, but I like it even better than paper. It's also light weight which puts less weight on my arm so my arm doesn't get as sore from long reading. I think I read more with it too. It's just great.",Wonderful experience -- Like it better than paper;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"My wife has the original 3G Kindle and a friend of mine has the current generation Kindle Paper White. This Kindle has a darker screen than both of the kindles mentioned above. I opted not to buy the Paper White as I figured that I've gone my entire life reading paper books without a built in back light. However, if you open up a paper book next to this kindle in a lower light situation (dimly lit living room at night), the paper book is easily readable, while the Kindle is very difficult to see without significant eye strain. With that said, as long as you have sufficient light, it's easily readable with no eye strain. I love the size and form factor, weight, and that I can easily switch between books on a whim. Would give five stars if it wasn't for the dark screen.",Love it but has a dark screen;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I ordered the Am 7"" in eror, the Kindle paperwhite shell case in error,  and returned both.  My daughter finally got it right and she is happy.Can't rate the ones I did not keep except it is expensive to buy and return!",Watch what you order;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love it!  My Kindle goes with me to the dentist (there's always a wait), doctor appointments and oil and car repairs!  It fits neatly in my purse and allows me to read anything I'm in the mood for.....I'm planning on doing some travelling soon and won't forget my Kindle!!!!",A Gem of an Idea!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I got the Kindle for $50 on cyber Monday and figured if I didn't like it then I only wasted $50. Thankfully, I am really enjoying it. The thing I find most appealing about thisbebook is the convince. I can purchase a book online and it is immediately on my Kindle. I also find the recommendations in the Kindle store very helpful on choosing my next book. The kindle is lightweight and very portable. The glare-free works like a charm. I've read on the beach in the glaring sun and it worked great. I also like the cool features the Kindle has like the character list. I also like how you can click on any word and it will tell you the definition and store that word in your vocab builder. The battery lasts forever (days even a couple weeks). The only negative thing about this Kindle is there is no built in light so it's hard to read in the dark like any book. However, I bought this Kindle knowing that so I will not fault it for that. Overall, I love it because it has really made me more passionate about reading.",Convenience is key;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"The $59 kindle is a bargain.This is my first e-reader and I was undecided on which model to get, so wound up choosing the cheapest one. I have to say i really enjoy reading on it and find it easy to use. The whole process is really easy from setting it up to buying your first book and reading it. The functions are very intuitive and i find myself leaving lots of highlights, notes and book marks to make referencing at a later date painless.The only down side of this product is that it is very basic, so if you are a gadget person, just anti-up and get the kindle fire, which is probably what i will do after i put some miles on the one i have.one really nice feature of the 6"" Kindle is that it will fit in the inside breast pocket of a mens suit jacket, or pretty much any winter coat inner pocket which makes it easy to carry on the train for those of us that don't carry a man-bag around.","Great Value, Fun to Read";;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I like this kindle, but am disappointed when looking for a case.  I can't figure out what generation it is.  Kindles are the only product sold at Amazon that don't allow questions.  According to Amazons own system.Show results forAny CategoryKindle StoreAmazon Device AccessoriesKindle Paperwhite Covers (93)Kindle E-Reader Accessories (5,379)Kindle Keyboard (3rd Generation) Covers (2)Kindle (7th Generation) Accessories (46)Kindle (5th Generation) Covers (38)Kindle Touch (4th Generation) Covers (41)Kindle (7th Generation) Covers (35)Kindle Fire HD (3rd Generation) Covers (38)Kindle Fire HDX (3rd Generation) Covers (28)Kindle Fire (2nd Generation) Covers (25)Fire Tablet Accessories (3,591)Stands (1)Styluses (4)-  See LessSo what generation is it???  Looking up the word ""Generation"" on this page has no useful results.I click on 7th Generation, and I click on one of those they have this review.  http://smile.amazon.com/Kindle-Cover-Turquoise-NuPro-Paperwhite/dp/B00LTI5GNS/ref=sr_1_2?s=fiona-hardware&ie=UTF8&qid=1444531048&sr=1-2&keywords=cover""It appears this item has been renamed by Amazon since I first received it from Vine and posted my review. At that time it was called ""Kindle Case, Kindle Paperwhite Case, Kindle Touch Case . . . "" This understandably led me to assume that it would be equally appropriate for any of those three devices;" but
Review: assuming that the unqualified """"Kindle"""" meant the basic $89 model
Title;;;;;;: this was not the case. It did not fit my Kindle";" it almost fit
column4: but it was too tall and tapping the power button inevitably pushed the device up against the top straps
column5: with quite a bit of overhang on the bottom.""""In a nut shell """"As long as the product isn't made by Amazon
column6: it's good to buy on Amazon.""""Still frustrated
column7: wanting a case.  So since there are no questions available on Amazon products
column8: can someone post what model this is?""
column9: Amazon disables it's best features
column10: for Amazon products.  Making me never want to buy Amazon products again.""";;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have always been a fan of reading ""real"" books (hardback/paperback)... until I realized I wasn't reading as much as I would like too. Bought the Paperwhite and I've been reading on the train, waiting in line, walking to a meeting - it's AMAZING! Highly reccomend avid ""real"" book readers to give it a try!",until I realized I wasn't reading as much as I would like too. Bought the Paperwhite and I've been reading ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I ought this as a gift for my dad, who does not even know how to turn on a computer. Really. I made him an e-mail account to get started and attached his credit card to his account. I showed him how to get books, but paid and the many free novels available, and he was off like a shot! I think I'll have to update his credit card when he gets a new one in a few years, but other than that, he took to this like a duck to water. He loves it!",perfect for my technophobe dad.;;;;;;

Review: 1. The screen is excellent because it doesn't have a backlight. It's like reading a paperback. I've read for hours at a time without strain.2. The battery lasts forever.3. 4GB of storage. I downloaded my entire book collection and I still have enough space left to do it 3 more times.4. Light. It doesn't weigh a ton so it's easy to hold for long periods.5. Faster. It might just be me but page turns and the like seem snappier on this Kindle than older ones I've owned.6. Price. I got my on the five month payment plan. $15 bucks a month is nothing. Well worth it.

after a slight problem connecting my wifi i am now delighted with the product and the ease it is to work out how to do what and also very impressed i was able to instantly download recent unread purchases to my new kindle. thank you. Jenny Cullen writer/journalist
Title;;;;;;: this is a beauty. am thrilled;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I like it very much. It serves the purpose as an e-reader and noting else. Honestly, this is only for reading, and that is why I bought it. to read kindle books. it is clear, the text is sharp, and the size is perfect for putting in your purse of backpack. I suggest getting a case with it, though. it is pretty light and slips out of the hand a little too easily for my taste.","Good for reading, bad for games and web browsing";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"excellent product! Athough i wish the touch had an option of locking all features but the page turing option because the slightest touch changes the features even when you dont want it. Shipping, packaging, and set up are so well thought out and user friendly.",excellent product! Athough i wish the touch had an ...;;;;;;

Review: I was disappointed when I got this product. It was much smaller than I had anticipated. I haven't read a single book with it. It's too small. I use to own an original Kindle. I can care less that it's a touch screen because it's uncomfortable in my hands/

As my first venture into ebooks this kindle was great.  I usually buy a select number of offers but with the free books I received with the trial of Prime I was able to download some authors I had never heard of before this.  The kindle instructions are a little confusing at first but still after some experimentation easy to master so far.  I generally know when the books I want come out so that I can pre-order with little trouble and know exactly when I will receive them.  I no longer have to put a note on my calendar to go out and buy them or wait for the mail.
Title;;;;;;: As my first venture into ebooks this kindle was great. I usually buy a select number of offers ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first E-Reader ever so I don't have any other experiences to compare with this product.  But so far, I am thoroughly enjoying using my Kindle even though I am still in learning mode with some of the e-reading functions.  I love the non-glare scree and the print is very clear and easy to read.  At times, I think it would be nice to have a back-lit screen; but I rarely have a need for one.  I love the size of this kindle.  It's lightweight and easy to hold in one hand.  This one includes special offers;" but they are not distracting because they only show up when I first open my Kindle.  The low price of $79 (with special offers) is one reason I decided to try this product because I was not sure whether I would like using an e-reader.  I would highly recommend this Kindle to anyone - especially to anyone who has never used an e-reader before.""
Review: A Great First E-Reader!!";;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This was supposed to be a Kindle Paperwhite. Must not be as the Paperwhite cover I purchased from Amazon does not fit. I will do some research to see how many models there are???Otherwise, I love the device. It is fast, clear and works well.","Maybe it's not what I ordered, but love it anyway.";;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"when i bought this it never said you wouldn't be able to adjust the screen brightness!  for almost a hundred bucks it should have that feature! I never would have purchased anything that you can't adjust the shade of the pages. If it were the same color pages as a real book that would be one thing, but this is dull grey and I have to squint to read it which is NOT good if you have glaucoma because squinting raises eye pressure! I spent a few wasted hours trying to figure out how to make the screen brighter only to figure out it isn't possible. I am mad that I wasted alot to buy this, only to not be able to use it, I have tried to GIVE it away and as soon as anyone sees the screen they don't want it, not even for free!",dull grey pages;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I  this Kindle and it's my very first one!! The books for it are much cheaper than the other formats. I only wish it had a light feature for while reading at night, but other than that: Pure Awesomeness!",Awesome Kindle;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my third Kindle, and I have to say that I am disappointed. Compared to my earlier Kindles, this one doesn't hold a charge at all - in a week and a half to two weeks it needs to be charged, while my other Kindles lasted 3 or even 4 weeks before needing to be charged. Another problem is that is is SUPER slippery. I have a case for it, but I like to take it out of the case to read, and the darn thing slips off of everything. I will obviously keep using it, butI hope it doesn't break on one of its falls to the ground.",and I have to say that I am disappointed. Compared to my earlier Kindles;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my new Kindle touch but I sure do miss the page turning button on the sides instead of having to touch the screen to turn the page.  And I wasn't pleased that it was a tiny bit thicker and heavier than my original Kindle.  But the touch feature is very convenient for looking up words and to maneuver between books and menus.  Amazon PLEASE continue to offer the non-backlit screen. It is so much easier on my eyes than the backlit screen on the Paperwhite--despite your claims to the opposite.  I love reading on my Kindle and carry it with me everywhere in case I have a few minutes to read. I never thought I would like it better than a physical book but now I couldn't live without it.  In fact when my original kindle's screen burned out, I ordered this the very same day.",Can't live without my Kindle!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Great for being the entry level, love the package for the kids, especially removing the ads. Defn a viewable ""step down"" from the paperwhite or having lights for reading, but for trying to see if the kids would even like it, being on a budget, it is excellent. Local library system doesn't have the simplest way of doing things, but at least the Kindle is up to date that it auto-loads it and no hooking up USB cables to download like before. Never having them, I still already miss some of the features of the upgrades, understanding why, but the kids are ecstatic and can't put it down. I'd buy it again.",Kids Package-- I'd do it again;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I did have kindle on my phone and tablet, but the bright screen always bugged me when reading for long periods. Then, at the behest of my parents constant praise for their kindles, finally caved in and bought for myself. And I have finally seen the light. I read even more now. I love that I am able to research words and people and things at the press of the screen. My favorite product (at the moment). I take it everywhere. Before, my phone and current events were my go to while waiting. Now, I am lost in my kindle and will often let people cut in front of me so that I can finish a page (or chapter)...hahaha. Can't wait for this one to break so that I can upgrade to the paperwhite.",Used to be a devout hardcover and paperback reader;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Effective basic reader. Common USB for charging. I wanted the non-backlight feature for minimal eye strain and it is perfect for that. I own iPads but didn't want the light in my face for hours with longer reading materials. The contrast is excellent.  The resolution is totally fine even though it is the lowest of the kindle line up - it's already twice common screen resolution, basically, and I read that all day without complaints.  It's less responsive than an iPad, lesser hardware for sure, but does it's simple job very well and distraction-free.",I wanted the non-backlight feature for minimal eye strain and it is perfect for that;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Upgrade to my previous addition. Love love love love my kindles. While I own iPads, I choose to have a dedicated ereader. No interruptions of any kind. I've had kindles for years and will keep coming back.",Love my kindle da!;;;;;;

Review: One of my most favorite summer activities is floating in my pool and reading a great book.  My children purchased this item for me for my birthday and I have  used it every day since.  It is glare free and lightweight as promised .  The book purchasing process easy as pie.  I am thrilled with my kindle!
Title;;;;;;: One of my most favorite summer activities is floating in my pool and reading ...;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first kindle.  What a cute little thing, it looks even better with my red case I bought to go with it.  I work in front of a computer screen most of the day, so this is great because it doesn't feel like additional screen time.  Someone described the graphics to me, kinda' like those Mr. Doddle Graphic magnet toys who write with...well that's what the print looks like.  I downloaded a trilogy, and it took less than a minute I believe with Wifi.  I'm still getting used to navigating around the thing.  I was having trouble scrolling around, closing out certain windows etc., but with time I'm sure that will be fine.  The only thing I don't like so much is that when I want to choose what books to purchase from the kindle store, it's in black in white and there isn't a description of the book. But what I do is just go online on my personal computer and figure out which books I want to download first.  Not a big deal.  Oh another thing, is that I didn't have to buy the adapter.  It says ""Not Included,"" so I bought one.  It turns out that it comes with a USB cord, if you have a power cord that has a USB port option, then that would work, such as your iphone charger.",it looks even better with my red case I bought to go with ...;;;;;;

Review: It sure is a great device meeting my expectations. It was given to me as a Christmas present and I am very please with it. I have a tablet too so having the basic Kindle is nice for one thing the battery last for a long time.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"My old Kindle (the early model) worked very well for me for years and then broke down. I wrote customer service to see about repairs and was told about the Kindle 6"" glare-free model. I purchased it and all my contents were automatically transferred to the new one. I enjoy everything about it but I was told that I would get a $20.00 rebate credited to my debit card which I haven't received.",I enjoy everything about it but I was told that I ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a great little tablet for reading books.  It's simple and the screen is perfect, no glare.  I have a Fire color tablet, but did not enjoy reading with it because of the harsh glare.  I'm really happy with this product.",Excellent reader;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Nice, light device. After having a Kindle Paperwhite I was rather disappointed with the lack of a backlight for the screen, but once I got used to it and how nicely it displays in even very low light, I like it better.",Great device - not bothered by the lack of a back light;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love it!  It's easy on your eyes.  When you spend most of your day staring at the computer screen,  it's nice to be able to sit and read without the eye strain and glare.  I've had no issues with page turning.  The ads only pop up when you wake it.",Good buy for readers;;;;;;

Review: I bought it for a trip overseas and it was perfect. It makes reading while traveling enjoyable and easy. My favorite feature is the tap motion to turn a page. It is light and easy to transport.Great buy if all you want to do is read!

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Is exactly as advertised.  Allows me to have a reader that will go to my patio or to the beach without glare, is very light, and has a long-lasting battery. Good for a long flight if I only want to read. MJB",Good for a long flight if I only want to ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I just received my new kindle 6 touchscreen last week after using Amazon's trade in program.  So far I really like it.  Battery lasts long.  Screen is very clear.  Directions were fairly easy to follow so no problems getting my books transferred to the new one.  I know others have complained about  not having a light to read by, but there are cases you can buy if you really want that option .  Only thing I miss is not being able to use my old games on this device.  But I knew this was a reader only when I purchased it so I am happy with my choice",Good choice;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"So before I bought this I was using my phone to read my Kindle Amazon books, but it was leaving me with half battery before I even got to work in the morning (long commute). This device lasts for a long time and is perfect for reading my books on the train ride into work. +++RecommendPROS -*Lightweight*Small*Touchscreen*Long Battery LifeCONS -*Ads*No Backlight**Both of the Cons can be fixed by buying the more expensive version.",Exactly What I Needed for my Morning Commute!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I loved my kindle, it doesn't have a back light and I hadn't realized that until AFTER I bought it (I was in a bit of a rush very excited). I however lucked out and had the chance of getting the Fire on sale the following week for late night reading.However this is everything I was hoping it would be. It's light, compact, and most of all does its main function of being an eReader. I would only change one thing that I've noticed with this and other kindles my friends and family have. When you switch screens it looks a bit glitchy, those that have one will notice what I mean.Another thing I wanted to touch on being a huge bargain shopper is that 80% of the time you'll find kindle books to be a lot cheaper than the physical competitor! In the future I'll be purchasing one with a built in backlight because I just love this one so much.",An inexpensive way to read...;;;;;;

Review: I had to replace a Kindle that had stopped working.  I replaced it with this e reader.  I like the Touch a lot.  Very intuitive and easy to understand.  My books all transferred perfectly as soon as I turned it on.  Very light weight.  I wanted a device to use at the beach and this one won't have any glare and will work just fine.
Title;;;;;;: I like the Touch a lot;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I like that I can change font sizes;" I couldn't on my first (very basic) Kindle that I literally wore out.  I'm not crazy about """"touch screen""""....  but that's my problem.  I'm still getting used to touch screen on other devices too.  (I keep going back a page
Review: when I really don't mean too....  my fingers in wrong place?)""
Title;;;;;;: I like that I can change font sizes";;;;;

Review: I totally love this Kindle!  My previous one was good (until I dropped it one time too many) but this one is wonderful.  So up to date and easy to use.  The cover is great also.  I think being able to read with the cover on is a definite plus.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Definitely an upgrade from the previous kindle I had. I don't need a lot of fancy things because all I use it for is to read. It was really easy to set up. I love having the Goodreads feature on the kindle to look through what my friends are reading and maybe get ideas on new books to read myself. I didn't think I would like the touchscreen feature but so far its great. The only down fall is I like to lay in bed and read and if a blanket or pillow touches the screen it'll turn your page or change your font size. All in all, its a wonderful kindle.",Love it!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Pardon my old age, but I gave away my Paperwhite and am going back to an unlighted Kindle.  The glare was too much for my eyes, and didn't have the same dimensions to hold comfortably while reading in bed that my Kindle Keyboard had.  Bought the little clip on light and was happy, happy, happy for many years...til a certain someone dropped it. :)  There is a real need for a non-lighted, glare free Kindle.  I'm only sorry that they are no longer producing new Keyboards;" I happen to love them.  So easy for one-handed holding and page turning.""
Review: and didn't have the same dimensions to hold comfortably while reading in bed that my Kindle Keyboard had";;;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"I like my kindle, but maybe I am so used to my old kindle that i had to touch the button to change the page that I am just getting used to the touch screen. I like it that you can change your settings from the page your on.",I like my kindle;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"After my first generation Kindle died, I had to replace it. While the touch-screen is great in theory, in practice it can be a bit annoying as the slightest touch can flip a page. I also find that if I press too hard while turning a page, the Kindle will jump forward 2, 5, sometimes 15 pages. It gets annoying. I do like how quickly this Kindle charges and how long it holds a charge.",While the touch-screen is great in theory;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I picked this up for my 10 year old daughter and it is ideal! Kindle free time makes it easy to see her daily reading time and allows me to keep her library filled. Coupled with Kindle Unlimited this is a no brainier for any reader, young or old!",Awesome;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Very easy to read in almost any light, and a handy size (like a paperback book). It was easy to set up, and it's easy to use. Very easy to buy books. Now if I could just free up more time to read them!","Easy to read, and a handy size";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love this device. The battery is awesome, I charged it once overnight and it is still halfway down, 2 weeks later, even after reading an average of 3 hours a day. Reading enhancements (word wise, translator, x-ray, dictionary) work flawlessly. This is an entry level Kindle, so no built in light -- if I were buying it again, I would get the paperwhite model.",Loved it;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Perfectly good product for reading books, screen is good, touch is good. an improvement over the key board controls, and easier to hold without a case than my old one.I just should have paid more attention when ordering to what was included. I thought it would be the equivalent of my old kindle on which the screen had gone all wonky/garbled. It does not have a headphone jack (i used my previous kindle for listenting to audio books as well as reading) and there don't seem to be any game options available for it (the old version i had a good verison of scrabble and i had the NYT crossword puzzles that you could do right on the kindle).",Good Kindle but pay attention to feature details if replacing an old one;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I haven't had my Kindle for long, but I really enjoy it! It's super light, easy to read, and the touchscreen works much better than I expected. The page turns are fast, at least compared to my old Kindle Keyboard. My only complaints are minor, for example, landscape mode only goes one way (the bottom of the device is on the left side), but like I said, very minor issue. So far I think the biggest issue I have with it is that the back is harder and has less grip than my Kindle Keyboard. It makes it a little harder to hold, but I'm sure if it causes a big problem you could get a case for it. All that considered, I think that the price is really what kicked it up to 5 stars for me. This is a really good deal, and I'm super happy with my new Kindle!",but I really enjoy it! It's super light;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my Kindle. I was reading books on my iPad, but did not like the glare. I would give this 5 stars because it's perfect for reading books, but I am disappointed there's no integration for the audio books like on the app.",Perfect except the lack of Audibles integration;;;;;;

Review: I had a kindle fire and really liked it but was in the market for a new kindle. I went with this one because I love the touchscreen feature and that it's glare-free. I like not having the glowing screen since I use this primarily for reading.
Title;;;;;;: Great for reading as primary purpose;;;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"I may have received a refurbished unit, the name says Andy's 2nd kindle. What the heck? Edit: It is confirmed that I was sent a refurbished unit. I have full access to the users cloud and ability to purchase books. I can't believe first that I was sent a refurbished unit and second that it still had the users information on it!",They sent me a refurbished unit with prior owners account still logged in! Are you kidding me??;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Since I am not technologically astute, I really don't know how to use my Kindle effectively. I wish that it had come with directions on paper. Once I get used to this, and my daughter walks me through the features, I will probably be more comfortable with it. But right now I am afraid to lose what I am currently reading to find something else or to explore its features.",I will probably be more comfortable with it;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I wish there were some ways to adjust the lighting because sometimes it gets really difficult to read at night. I never had a kindle before so at first it seemed kind of glitchy (going from one screen to the next) but now after getting used to it I really like it.For those who don't know this, you can borrow ebooks from your local library so you can read them on your kindle! Just remember to return them via the link within your Amazon account.",I never had a kindle before so at first it seemed kind of glitchy (going from one screen to the next) but now after getting used;;;;;;

Review: If you are looking for a simple and well price kindle then this is the one for you. It is just the basic and does not have a built in light or web access but it is perfect for anyone just looking to read books on it.
Title;;;;;;: Perfect if you are looking for something just for reading!;;;;;;

Review: Disappointed that Amazon makes a new version of the Kindle that does not have an internal light feature but doesn't have a cover with a built in light available for purchase.  Customer service was also incredibly lacking in knowledge of this fact and it took me 10 minutes of restating my question about this before they could confirm that there is not currently a cover with a built in light feature to accompany this Kindle.  I have not complaints about the Kindle itself but expected that they would have accessories available to go along with it.
Title;;;;;;: No cover with built in light available;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I am still learning how to use the various features. I do not know if there is a way to find which page from the original book I am on.  This would be helpful if I am reading along in a class.  Also, at this point I wish I had bought a model with a larger screen.","Enjoying the Kindle experience, but still learning";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Its Fantastic! The touch screen is awesome for the lower grade kindle, its very light and i like the thickness it makes the device much more comfortable to hold while reading a book! the new layout of the home screen is nice and so are the tool bars! the only down side is that you cant use apps like you could on the previous generation kindle. BUY NOW",Impressive!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my Kindle. It's small, compact and has great battery life. With the Prime Lending library, I've found myself reading more. Easy to read while sitting outside at the beach and easy to use. Perfect.",Love My Kindle;;;;;;

Review: While it's nice and does a great job as an e reader I liked my old kindle keyboard much better. If you have a lot of books it is more difficult to see which ones you have read if you don't delete the ones you have read.

The only thing good about this kindle is that it is lightweight.  It's much smaller than I expected for a reader and the management of the content is not intuitive at all.  I would not buy a kindle again.
Title;;;;;;: lightweight but too small - content management is not intuitive;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought it for my niece for her 10th birthday party - she is in love with it. It's easy to use and seemingly kid friendly. This kindle has the ability to turn on Parental Controls, so we turned off the ability to download books from the kindle and access the internet. She's an absolute book worm, so this was perfect. It wasn't fancy, and she still is able to read as she wants to.",Pre-Teen Friendly;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Being new to paperless book idea I found the Kindle easy to set up and use. I enjoy reading a light weight device that I can use to carry a ton of books to my favorite reading spots. I like the adjustable text size, paper-like appearance and fast download speed as well.",Great entry level device;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have been debating purchasing a Kindle for awhile now, and I'm so happy that I decided to. Easy set up, great battery life and a huge selection of books. I've always wanted to read more, but can't seem to find the time to make it to a book store.  This makes finding new books easy and convenient.  All in all, a great product.",and I'm so happy that I decided to;;;;;;

Review: Great product. Light narrow easy to hold for people that have problems holding things especially for long  time like I do. Easy on eyes for reading pleasure. Easy not complicated at all to work. Does everything my original first kindle Fire did.
Title;;;;;;: great for readers and children that need encouragement to read more or ones already love to read.;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Beautiful !!I bought it recently and now i am hooked to it. I have downloaded 100's of books and started reading books after many, many years.Best thing is I can ready anywhere, even in bright sun-light and it doesn't put stress on my weak eyes.",Beautiful!! I bought it recently and now i ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first e-reader and it's amazing! Light, comfortable, and easy to use. People are giving this device a bad rating because you have to touch to turn the page, I personally don't see the big deal and believe it works great. If you're thinking of getting it, you should! Well worth it!",An amazing E-reader !;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"This Kindle has a couple of quirky features that drive me crazy, i.e., you can't TURN IT OFF, and it displays an image when you need to charge your battery but does not tell you what percentage your battery is on so that you know when to stop charging!  I think the engineers need to slow down and pay attention to detail.",Yes/No;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I've been a Kindle user for several years. This was my 4th Kindle and by far the worst. Reader us very cheaply made. Movement from one page to the next is not a smooth transition as I've seen on previous Kindles and other eReaders. Additionally, this particular Kindle's back is slick plastic and not steady in the hand. Previous versions had a rubber backing and seemed overall much better quality. All in all, this Kindle is a definite step backward. I would expect more from Amazon on this one.",Step Backward;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought a Kindle fire when it was launched and It works Ok but I have seen the White Paper before then I bought one and it works nice because you can ready it with Sun Light without problems with the books with Kindle format.It can also open the PDF books without problems but the font size is small for me even using the display as land scape. I saw it is possible to increase the font size but in that case it is necessary to scroll the page to be able to read it although it is not really practical.Anyway, I am happy with it although I will not be able to manage my Technical stuff on it.",... Paper before then I bought one and it works nice because you can ready it with Sun Light without ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"It met all my expectations. It is easy to read, down loads enough of library to have variety & the price was more than acceptable.  I have been resisting buying a Kindle;" as I prefer printed material
Review: a real book versus a screen.""

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"The 6"" model is pretty small. If you have good lighting and good eyes (or glasses) you can make the text pretty small, but when I read in bed the lighting forces me to use larger type so I only get about 1 paragraph per page. It is slower turning on and updating than I expected, but it is acceptable.","The 6"" model is pretty small. If you have good lighting and good ...";;;;;;

Review: It looks and feels fake like those fake phones on display at stores.Very light. No back light. Needs more fontGraphics is like an old gameboy or a Ti-83 calculator game.Looking up words helps out a bunch.So simple.Battery use is very efficient.I love it but I returned it to get a fireHD6 because I wanted to read at night. =P[bought @ bestbuy]
Title;;;;;;: If you love reading and ONLY reading. This is awesome!!;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I am very satisfied with my new Kindle e-Ink.  I almost bought the Paperwhite, but decided against it because of the reviews (known backlight issue). I know technology constantly changes, but I am with some of the other reviewers:  the touchscreen is too sensitive, I want the page turn buttons back.  Other than that, I love my Kindle!!",I LOVE my Kindle!!;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Having the Kindle with touch is so much better than the original version with the button controls on the sides. The functionality and usibility is improved, but my one complaint (and why I downgraded my rating) is that the casing feels cheap.  It is thicker than the previous version, with some sharper lines, and the case is unmistakably plastic.With my original Kindle reader, my only worry when dropping it was potentially cracking . shattering the screen - This one feels cheap enough that I worry the case would break or split.","Great features and functionality, but feels cheap.";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I like it but when I download library books the process seems more convoluted than I think it should be. I have to go through my laptop or iPad through Overdrive to get to the Kindle.  I think you should figure out how to make it easier.  Also, when I hold the reader in the horizontal position with my right hand I would prefer to hold it by the fat end rather than the skinny end.  To me it just makes sense being right handed like most people.  Maybe you could work on that.",I like it but when I download library books the process ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Smaller than I thought, but very portable and lightweight.  I am just upset that I need to spend additional money on a light so I can read at night.  Having owned two previous Kindles as well as the first generation of the Kindle Fire, I bought this beause of its increased battery life and storage space.  It's still brand new, so I haven't come across any issues yet.",Words from a lover of all things Kindle;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I've changed my review slightly.  I can't change the star rating much - because my original complaint still holds true - there is not a case with integral light available for this Kindle because of it's design - and that is disappointing still.  However, Erin at Amazon read my review and emailed me.  She suggested this light (http://www.amazon.com/Belkin-Clip--Reading-Kindle-Graphite/dp/B004ZN5Q5W/ref=sr_1_8?s=digital-text&ie=UTF8&qid=1433020341&sr=1-8&keywords=case+with+light)  and issued me a credit to try it out.  All without asking for anything.  As usual, Amazon does not disappoint.  I'll let you all know how this light works.  I'd seen it previously, but frankly it looked too bulky.  We'll see.I was really excited for this purchase.  I've had the original kindle forever and love it... but was always so frustrated by the constant accidental turning  of pages.  I love the size of this one too. Overall the Kindle itself I really like... but unlike the original, there is absolutely no ""lit"" case available that doesn't counter the small portability of the device.  Remember the old kindle with built-in book light??!  Why oh why did you get rid of that option?  I am hesitant to purchase the newer backlit ones because that is the feature I like most about my kindle.  It really does still feel like reading a book.  And by using regular lamp light, I don't feel like it ""keeps me up"" to read it - I'm a read in bed every night person.  There are tons of studies that show looking at your cell phone or tablet messes with your body's melatonin production and keeps you awake.  I know I can sit there and surf the internet in one capacity or another for ever on my phone - that's not what I was looking for.","AMENDMENT = 5/31/15 Amazon Customer service comes through again.. (Old review: .I think they made this one inferior to ""old orig";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Absolutely love it! Great product, great price.  I take it with me everywhere. I had a lot of the free classics like Zane Grey westerns and Sherlock Holmes from Amazon which I set up from my laptop several years ago. Now I can read them on the Kindle. To add them to this Kindle only costs 99 cents.",Great portable library!;;;;;;

Review: I bought this on cyber Monday for a gift for my mom for mothers day. Upon turning it on for the first time it was in chinese! We had to call customer service and talk to them for about 20 minutes and we were able to figure out how to put I in English. NOW it won't charge! I'm so frustrated that a BRAND new device is having so much trouble.
Title;;;;;;: Brand new with lots of problems;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This Kindle is superior to the first one I purchased which I have had problems with and can no longer use because the print size will no longer work.Being elderly I had initial problems but now that I have mastered its use I find it brilliant & I love it. Everything on it is just a touch away, I would heartily recommend this to any one whether it's a first or replacement like mine.",A new Kindle?;;;;;;

Review: Having only used Sony E-Readers and Ipad2 ...I would say this has been money well spent.I read a lot and some times thick paperbacks are hard to hold.  This light hand held device is just the ticket.  Much easier to download purchases than the Sony E-Reader ever was and much better than the Kobos product that Sony partnered with when they decided to go out of the e reader business.My only regret is...I wish I could read my old books that were purchased through Sony E-Reader Store and Kobos on my new device.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"This was a nice replacement of my older kindle which I dropped recently.  It is a little smaller than my old one but still easy to read and actually lighter.  I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 as I found getting back to the menu difficult, but that could just be me getting use to the touchscreen and the way this one functions.  Also while swiping is easy I did grow use to using the buttons on the side of my old kindle to turn the page as my fingers were already there so I barely had to move.Overall it is a great product and a worthy replacement, my prejudice and star reduction is mostly related to being more comfortable with some of the features of my older one.  I would recommend one especially if you do a lot of book reading.  I check out lots of kindle books from my library so that is an added plus.",This was a nice replacement of my older kindle which I dropped recently;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I got this for the Black Friday price which is a good price point for a gift for my 8 year old daughter. We travel a lot and this is the perfect way for her to load some books without the bulk of ""real"" books. I like having my own tablet without having to loan it to her. This one truly is hers and it's fun for her to borrow books from the Kindle lending library (we're Prime members). At this price, if something happens to this Kindle, it's not a big investment. It's good for what she's using it for which is only books.",Great tablet for my daughter;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"It's been over a month since I purchased my kindle and I'm so impressed with the battery life. Aside from the initial charge, I have yet to have to charge it!The ads don't bother me as much as I thought they would--the cover on my case helps a lot with that (by covering the screensaver ads).With the 15 bucks I saved by getting the ads, I was able to purchase a nice case :)",Love my Kindle!;;;;;;

Review: Just got this Kindle and I am sooo happy to have it. Reading with this device is so much easier on the eyes than a tablet. I would highly recommend for anyone who reads a lot. The size is great and it is so light. I am more than pleased.
Title;;;;;;: Just got this Kindle and I am sooo happy to have it;;;;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"Yes, this isn't backlit. But for a starter ereader, I'm happy with it. I can carry several books at once and converting my pdfs has been pretty easy too. I'm glad I finally got this. And the fact I can get to my email and facebook too in case my PC crashes is great too.",I'm happy with it;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This and the Paper White and I think the Voyager - the Kindles with the Ink paper screens - are really the only Kindles worth buying. They are great for reading in conditions, like outside, when other screens are impossible to read. I took my Kindle to Egypt. It was great. Very small and light and I could read it outdoors. I love it. But I also have a Samsung tablet. I hate those ads that compare the Kindle Fire with the iPad. They only compare very basic and superficial things, like weight but not important things. Kindle Fires are not tablets on the same level as an iPad or a Samsung Tab Style or Tab 4 or even a Tab 3. I use my Kindle for reading and only reading in conditions I cannot use my Samsung tablet. I use my Samsung for reading when I will be in places where I can from that screen and know I will be using my tablet and don't want to carry both. But I would never buy a Kindle Fire in the place of a ""real"" tablet. I would also recommend buying the Kindle from Best Buy which, ironically, often has it cheaper. And at Best Buy you can try any tablet before you buy it.",The only Kindle Worth Buying;;;;;;

Review: This is my second kindle and it came in Spanish with no directions on how to convert to English ...My husband tried for two days and finally got it....I was extremely disappointed that there was no directions ....it is working now ....but I think written directions should be included ....

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"The touchscreen is sensitive, but I have not had the issues that others have had where wind makes the page turn. I have found that clothing can turn a page though.It is so much smaller than the Kindle 2nd generation that I had. That took a little getting used to as well as the touchscreen for highlighting and taking notes. I love the simple look though and not all the extra stuff that distracts from the page at hand when reading. It's more like reading a page out of a book than my previous Kindle.I will definitely get a cover for it so I feel comfortable toting it around with me.I love having a Kindle. It has encouraged me to read more and also makes reading larger books less intimidating and easier to read wherever I am at. I have the Kindle app on my phone and use the Kindle cloud reader sometimes at work when I have forgotten my Kindle. As long as I have synced since my last read on a different device, it makes it super easy to change devices to read the same book. I love that.I am not really a fan of the special offers. I have accidentally, more than once (in the last month that I have had the Kindle), almost bought a book or something else that pops up on the screen saver as well as in my home menu. Next time, I will definitely pay the extra in order not to have the special offers.",I love the simple look though and not all the extra ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've read using the Kindle app on my ipad for years, and felt no need for a dedicated kindle.  But I loved the battery life my husband's kindle had, so on prime day I decided to buy one.  I wish I had bought it years ago!  It's small and light enough to fit in my purse, it stays charged forever and it's really pleasant to read from.  I just wish Apple and Amazon would work something out so I could put my iBooks on my kindle.",Finally bought one.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love this Kindle. I have an iPad and an iPhone, but I wanted a device that would only be used for books. I didn't want the Kindle Fire because I need something with the batter power to last as long as this Kindle's does.It doesn't light up.  I specifically chose this Kindle BECAUSE of that. Lighted screens would detract from battery life.  This device will go a month on a single charge.I love the touch screen and font sizer. Do I sometimes fumble and turn a page?  Yeah, but so what?  I can simply turn back to where I was. No big deal. My son has an older model Kindle, and the thumb pad directional button is annoying to me.In my opinion, for the money and features, you can't beat this generation of Kindle.  If you just want a reliable, long-lasting device for reading, look no further. Skip the bells and whistles.  Let's read a book.",Simplicity and functionality at a great price;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"As a first user of this kindle, I can say that this item full fill my expectations. Is easy to read my favorites books and save them up into the cloud, thats make that the internal memory no need to be used",Is easy to read my favorites books and save them up ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Amazing, i thought the small size (In comparison to the kindle keyboard Gen2 my previous kindle) would dampen reading for me but it still has the right size for text and correcting to your preferences, very light simple to look at and very nice. Much more cost effective to get this kindle and a $15 case with a light than it would've been to get the kindle paperwhite (50 dollar difference for a backlight) and then buy a 25+ dollar case.No complaints so far love it a lot.","Amazing, i thought the small size (In comparison to ...";;;;;;

Review: Wish the Kindle keyboard was still available.  I am older and touch screens are not my favorite.  I do love reading on this but sometimes have a problem with the page turning.  Being able to enlarge the print is great.  I bought one for my great grandson and he loves it and does not have the problem with the touchscreen.  Younger generation you know.  My keyboard kindle is still usable and when this one needs to be charged I just read on the old one.  Love it.
Title;;;;;;: I am older and touch screens are not my favorite. I do love reading on this but sometimes ...;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I have been using the Kindle app for some time, and I finally decided I wanted a dedicated e-Reader with the e-Ink to avoid glare.  This is the first Kindle I've bought, so I went with the basic model.  It does exactly what I want it to do, no bells and whistles.  I got the special offers model, and they are not invasive at all.  I kind of wish I'd gotten the Voyage with the built-in light, but my bf got me a reading light which works very well",I have been using the Kindle app for some time ...;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Since this is my fourth Kindle, I obviously love Kindles.  I don't like the fact that they're continually being updated, making the Kindle and its accessories obsolete.  I have a beautiful leather cover for my first one which I can't use anymore because it doesn't fit the newer ones.  I don't like the touch screen on the new Kindle.  Much of that can be remedied by my getting used to the new features.  The screen is much more sensitive than I'd like.  I touch it accidentally often, when I'm just reading or when I'm carrying it to another room.  It doesn't just go to the next page, it moves several pages ahead (or back), so then I have to find my place again.I've wondered about getting my original Kindle refurbished.  Do you do that for customers?  At any rate, I have no intention of giving up my Kindle.  I love the availability of hundreds of books, and the convenience of carrying one small volume.Thank you.Dorothy McIntosh",7th generation kindle;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my 3rd Kindle. The script is easier to read, but navigating is seriously more difficult than my second kindle. There are fewer prompts and their meanings are difficult to decipher. A written instruction sheet would also be very helpful.",This version of the Kindle is inferior!;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"My original Kindle died, when I called to see if it could be fixed the person I spoke with said no and suggested this would be very close to the one I had.  It is not close at all, I will in time get use to it but I am not happy with it.",I will in time get use to it but I am not happy with it;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I really like the basic Kindle - I use it in situations when I don't want to use my iPad.  I had to replace my last basic Kindle and wasn't really needing a touchscreen, but that is the only choice now.  I have found that the touchscreen can be problematic.  It frequently highlights text that I have no interest in highlighting - then I can't figure out how to undo the highlighting.  It seems really sensitive at times and less so at other times.  It often brings up definitions instead of turning the page - I don't need a definition for the word 'and'.  In addition, the screen is segmented into regions for moving forward, backward and settings, etc.  It is easy to move forward because over half the screen is used for moving forward, but I find that I need to tap on the actual left edge of the screen to go backwards, because it sometimes moves forward, even if My finger is a tiny bit to the right of the edge.  I find myself getting frustrated with the device quite frequently.  Overall, I can use it, but it is not nearly as user-friendly as the previous basic model.",Not as user-friendly as the previous basic Kindle.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Very nice product.  It is very easy to hold and read.  The screen image is excellent and can be enhanced by the individual user by selecting alternate line spacing, font style, and font size.  Navigation through the various features takes some time to learn and with which to become proficient.  The price when considering all the features available to the use is outstanding.  I purchased for the for reading only;" models with additional features
Review: while undoubtedly important to some users were of little or no interest to me.  My on complaint is the list of book categories.  The list ends with ROMANCE and there is no way that I can determine to scroll the listing to SCIENCE & MATH and SCIENCE FICTION & FANTASY categories.  I have had contact with the Kindle help desk and they believed that there should be a way to scroll to these groupings.  In that regard
Title;;;;;;: a new Kindle was shipped to be on the belief that the unit in my possession was somehow defective.  The new unit arrived and I performed the initial start up routines only to find that the same issue still existed.  I have decided to keep the unit and accept the shortcoming of being able to scroll further through the book categories.  I can type in the topics and then make a selection.  While this is a bit inconvenient
column4: it is acceptable when weighing the inconvenience against the excellent pricing.  I give the unit three and one-half stars.""
column5: Very nice product. It is very easy to hold and ...";;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"Very disappointed. I could not get it to connect to my high speed network at home.  After one hour and 22 minutes on the phone, a supervisor finally told me I had been sent a kindle that was not updated and that they would be sending me a new updated version. I though I was buying the latest version! Why else would I be replacing my old Paperwrite? I was told I was, but I hadn't been sent the latest updated version. That doesn't make sense to me and my trust level in Amazon took a big dive. I bought a new Paperwrite thinking I was buying the latest version, only to be told I was sent an old, not updated one.  I guess we will see what I get when it arrives. I had to reminder her I was on Prime and it should get here with the 2 day service. Also, the first man I talked to was very nice and tried to help. He had to finally turn me over to a supervisor who was overly sweet and extremely condescending. So condescending that when she said she would help walk me through how to print out the return tag on my computer because I probably didn't know how, I lost it. Insulting my intelligence was the last straw after one hour and 22 minutes. I love my Kindles, but my trust in Amazon is at an all time low. Sad.","Disappointed, but time will tell....";;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I miss my Kindle 3 (aka Ye Olde Fashioned Kindle with Keyboard). This is lighter and looks tidier just sitting there, but typing notes is painful, page-turning is glitchy, and highlighting is maddening, particularly if your hands are a little dry. Which, as a lady in her mid-50's living in Los Angeles, pretty much describes mine all the time. Did I mention I miss my Kindle 3? Yeah. Kinda like that.","It's no Kindle 3, and more's the pity.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Although I miss the feature of audio that was available on my old kindle, this one with the touchscreen display has more desirable features such as the ease and speed of page turning, and the easier accessibility of the word dictionary. Other new features I am beginning to learn to use more effectively.  All in all I really like this new kindle and find it a joy to use.",All in all I really like this new kindle and find it a joy to ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"For what it is it's a nice compact reader at a very reasonable price. It preforms exactly as advertised. I bought this as a back-up device just to keep in the car in case I stop at a food place and want something to read while eating. If this was the only reader you had you might be disappointed because it does not hold a candle to the ""Kindle Fire"". For one thing it is a reader only and you can not surf the Web. It does not have a colored screen and no back light so you you need an alternate source of light to read in the dark and you can not download Apps.on it.All that being said the best feature is the low price and that you can read it in bright sunlight which you can not do very easily with the ""Fire"" and it's a lot more compact and easier to carry than a regular book.","New Kindle 6"" Glare-Free Touchscreen";;;;;;

Review: I am so happy with kindle! Since I love to read and I know there no more room in my house for anymore books in the house I mentioned to my sweetie how I would love to have a kindle. The kindle was one of my Christmas gifts. I use my kindle almost daily.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Adore this lite weight kindle!  Having said that there is one annoyance which is why I only gave it 4(and a half)stars.  The feature to increase the print  is way way too touchy.  Blink wrong, set it down and the font changes size.  Annoying.  But I do really love this Kindle for it doesn't hurt my RA wrists to hold it.",Got a good thing going on here;;;;;;

Review: I didn't plan to buy a Kindle but a lot of the books I want are only available on Kindle. I feel the offer Amazon gave me was a good deal. I am enjoying my Kindle. The no glare screen is great . I wear very strong prescription glasses so I was concerned about glare.
Title;;;;;;: I feel the offer Amazon gave me was a good deal. I am enjoying my Kindle;;;;;;

Rating: 2.0 out of 5 stars,"Wait.. I like the Kindle, but I DO NOT LIKE buying one and being automatically signed up for Amazon's Kindle Unlimited and then having to remember to come back and cancel it before they keep charging my credit card monthly.  If I want Kindle Unlimited, let me check a box or sign up after 30 days, don't tell me you are just going to start auto charging. I am getting tired of this sneaky corp crap.  Keep it up and I may decide I don't need a Kindle or Amazon.Ugh, and what is this 'Promotional Amount' that results in a 'Deferred Payment' when I try to check out?  Is this a layaway plan or something?  Where was any of that explained in the Kindle page?","I like the Kindle, BUT.... Amazon is making the purchase less than easy";;;;;;

Review: My Kindle has been fantastic. The touch page turner works well. The display reads like a book--no eyestrain. I also like that it has synced up with all the books I had been reading on the Kindle app on my phone (except the Kindle is much easier to read from than my phone).
Title;;;;;;: My Kindle has been fantastic. The touch page turner works well;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have had this Kindle for about a week now, and it is great! Lightweight, easy to use and fun! The prices are pretty good, and they have a good selection of books, magazines and singles. I charged it as soon as I opened the box and it still has more than half battery on it. Very simple and great product. Definitely recommend it!","So far, so good";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"My husband gave this to me for my birthday. I am still figuring out all it does or does not do. Only problem so far is the screen. I am in the old lady age group so I could have used the paperwhite,I kept trying to find a way to adjust the brightness but of course there is none.I  do really like that there is a way to  adjust font size. So my only warning is to make sure that you like the screen lighting.",I do really like that there is a way to adjust font size;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Maybe I was just to accustomed to my old keyboard Kindle,  but  I preferred it to this one.  The screen is so ""touchy"",  it is so easy to lose my place.  I'm sure after I get used to it , I will love it as much as I loved my old one.  However, I thought  I ordered the one  without the special offers;" but came with a free album.""
Review: it is so easy to lose my place";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love it, but am still trying to learn all the ""in's and out's"" of how to move back and forth between readings. I have ""Every Day with Jesus - read your Bible through in a year"" and need to learn how to move from the daily reading back to the book I am reading. But, certainly do love the Glare-Free Touchscreen. Thank you for this updated product..",Great product!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"My daughter gave me her Kindle about five or six months ago - I had my own, but it was/is very old, and the buttons wore out. The Kindle she gave me was wonderful. I loved it! I used it constantly every day from the day she gave it to me up until yesterday. I was laying in my bed reading after getting home from work, (just as I usually do just before sleeping), and I drifted off. I'd let the Kindle slip out of my hand and drop to the floor. I snapped awake immediately and grabbed the devise up only to see that the screen had cracked. I was and am devastated. I'd already felt lucky as could be to own one of these to begin with, and was extremely thankful to my daughter for giving it to me as I seriously can't afford to buy one for myself. When I saw that screen and tried to make it work right again, I had to come to the conclusion that this awesome piece of equipment was truly dead. It was the only ""gadget"" I owned, and I really loved it. Being able to buy the occasional book or borrow one from the library to read on it and slip it conveniently almost anywhere, (just like a paperback), was my greatest of simple pleasures. I miss it already, and am looking forward to maybe being able to set aside some money out of next year's income tax return to hopefully get another.",Good Old Friend;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Simple, light weight, no glare, long battery life.  If you read this in a dark place then you would be better off getting the model above which is the paperwhite with the backlight.  Also, I get the NYT newspaper app and my only complaint is that it doesn't download until later on in the day instead of first thing in the morning.",If you read this in a dark place then you would be better off getting the model above which is the paperwhite ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love to read. I bought kindle fire HD about a year ago but didn't quite like my reading experience. However, since I bought this kindle glare free my reading experience has improved and now I just can't put my kindle down. I even bought the kindle unlimited and let me tell you it can't get better. Love love love my kindle. A must buy. The battery life is great and glare free is just so much better for your eyes than the kindle hd",I love to read;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"It's great except for the Amazon of loading and adding foreign language dictionaries to Cloud which I will never use and which, because there are alphabetizd they are scattered among the books which I have saved to cloud being a nuisance when I search for a book I've previously saved to Cloud.  Your policy should be to ask if the user wishes any of those dictionaries and NOT IMPOSE THEM ARBITRARILY or at least enable the person to delete them entirely from Cloud!",PLEASE NO IMPOSED FOREIGN LANGUAGE DICTIONARIES;;;;;;

Review: These things are great.  Brig a senior I do have to say one thing.  I personally like the button control over touch screen.  Way to easy to acidentaly touch the screen and page forward or back several pages.  I went forward a few chapters one time. If I could have the buttons and lighted screen would be great.  Gary
Title;;;;;;: These things are great. Brig a senior I do have to say ...;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this to replace my third broken Kindle device. I know it's crazy but I like the device so much that I decided to replace it again.When I contacted Customer Service they were very helpful but only offered the version that is backlit or a Kindle Fire as a replacement. I do wish the screens were less fragile. Apparently, the slightest mishap can irreparably damage the screen so I've decided to bite the bullet, replace the device and treat it like it's made of eggshells. Wish me luck.",I know it's crazy but I like the device so much that I decided to replace ...;;;;;;
