Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Setup was a little frustrating, this is my 6th kindle, the last one lasted almost 2 years but even in the hard cover the screen still went crazy.I am hoping this one lasts longer. I love the convenience of having so many books on one small device.The reading is easy on the eyes, still find getting to the controls a little hard but the actual reading is easy",I love the convenience of having so many books on one ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had never bought one of these before, so I was hesitant about getting one. I had so many e-books stored on my computer, it was slowing it down. I had to buy one out of necessity. I thought it was going to be difficult to get all my books on it, but it was so easy! The instructions are so simple to follow, and it pretty much walks you right through the setup and installation process. The battery life lasts a LONG time, as I don't think I've put it down for more than an hour since I got it! I put it on charge at bedtime, and the battery, after a full day of reading, has barely been used. I highly recommend this product, especially in the bundle pack, for anyone who is addicted to reading books! I can't believe I waited so long to get one!",Perfect for people who love to read!;;;;;;

Review: Bought this as a Mother's Day gift for my grandma. She LOVES it! She is still figuring out how to use some of the features but loves that I can share books with her and she has already read over 60 books on it since we gave it to her!

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have had this for a week and love it so far. I had a second generation Kindle for years before it finally died. I definitely got all the life out of it. This new Kindle is everything I love about the old one, except with a touch screen. Since I already own a smart phone, I had no need for another device with a bunch of apps, I just wanted something to read on. This was a perfect purchase for that. Great on battery life. You do need a light source to read on, and I am fine with that because I like to read in bed and backlighting tends to mess me with my sleep cycles.",Great purchase!;;;;;;

Review: It was smaller then I had anticipated.  I assumed it was 6 inches from top to bottom but like TV's I guess it was diagonally measured.  It also was not lighted and hard to read at night with out using an outside  light.  Could only read it in a vertical position not horizontal.
Title;;;;;;: I assumed it was 6 inches from top to bottom but like TV's I guess it was diagonally measured;;;;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"The screen is very dark, there is no back-light and I feel like I'm going blind reading it. On the other hand, it is much more comfortable to use a small device like this than to be stuck in one position for a long period of time reading on the kindle-pc.",get the paperwhite instead;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"The previous Kindle that I owned had a keyboard so that I was able to play games with it which I enjoyed very  much - especially Sudoku.  So  you can imagine my disappointment when this one arrived and there was no keyboard. Two thirds of the enjoyment  that I had had with my previous Kindle was gone.  I haven't figured out, as yet, what to do with it.  Any suggestions?",... was able to play games with it which I enjoyed very much - especially Sudoku;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love it.  Especially the non glare screen and built in light. I can read in sunlight. If I need to read when I  can't sleep at night, I just turn the kindle o, no need for a lamp.  It is fantastic to use.",Paperwhite Kindle Review;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is our second Kindle, I am still learning all the capabilities.  It is handier than our original Kindle.  It shortens some of the procedure (password to commence is not required).  The longer battery life is nice.  It is a little harder to delete a sample or book.",The longer battery life is nice. It is a little harder to delete a ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"A perfect simple reader it is. I love how neat and light it is, its touchscreen works much better than that on Nook Simple Touch I used to have. An experimental browser works fine, too. One of my fav functions is the ability to send docs via email, the device syncs fast and smoothly. I feel like there are many more functions, I just need to take my time and discover them : )Overall, great experience!","No glitches, great experience";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have owned a kindle since they came out.  I just upgraded my first kindle to the 6"" Glare-Free.  I like that there is no back light - easier on my eyes.  I also like that everything I read is on the kindle, no more books at different sizes or struggling to keep a paperback open.  The second most important feature is the letter sizing, I am able to adjust the lettering to I don't have a hard time seeing it.  I find I read more now than ever.  Great product for the price!",Love my Kindle - Glare Free;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Screen could be a little lighter but this is still great! I have never had a e-book reader before so i deciced to start having a new one. As a starting point, i found this gadget very very useful. Highly recommended!",Very nice;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Just really started playing with it but can tell you that it is fast and the screen resolution is excellent. Changed from an original 7"" fire to this and was worried about the size making it tough to read, but the higher resolution more than makes up for it.  Strikes me as a good deal for the price and I'm glad I bought it.","... that it is fast and the screen resolution is excellent. Changed from an original 7"" fire to this ...";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"As someone who loves to read in their free time, the Amazon Kindle has been an awesome product for me. This product is very durable and efficient, as I have already dropped it a couple of times and it does not have a scratch on it. It has been wonderful to have all of my reading materials (magazines, books, and newspapers) in one place. It will also be very helpful for family vacations, and for my parents to take on business trips. It has been very convenient to always have one item where my reading materials are stored. The battery life has also been outstanding, lasting almost weeks at a time. Compared to other products on the market, there is no glare on the screen when you are reading in the sun. This made a huge difference to me as I do most of my reading outside.Technology aspect-I am someone who does not need to have all the apps and games that some products offer with their reading devices, so if you are someone who is tech savvy, this product might not be for you. It is very straightforward and easy to use, which makes it perfect for me, as I have never been very good with technology.Kid Friendly- In my opinion, if you are looking for an e-reader, do some research before you purchase the product. I thought the Kindle was a good value for the price of $79.99, as there are many different Kindle products and competitor products that are much more expensive. This is especially if you are looking for an e-reader for a child, you may have hesitated before because of the price. With this model only being $79, you may have found your perfect product. One bonus is that the screen size is the same as the other Kindle devices, so you are not losing out on that if that is something that is important to you.One thing to keep in mind is that there is no buttons besides a power button. Turning the page is as easy as taping the side of the screen.In comparison to other products, this Amazon Kindle has been perfect for me because it is easy to use, easy to read in the sun, and easy to store when taking it places.",Good Value and Easy to Use;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"This new touch screen is the worst thing I have ever seen.  Sometimes it turns one page, sometimes two, sometimes 10 , sometimes you don't know how many and can't find your place.  Once a tap sent it to the end of the book giving the references.  You can accidently touch a word with your left hand and this 3/4 screen thing pops up  trying to define a word,  etc. and there is no obvious way to get rid of it.The old buttons of the side was reliable.I am throwing this in the trash today.",TURN ONE PAGE OR 10;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"A great product! Light, easy to use and fast. The integration with social networks and Goodreads is pretty useful.I would only change the power button's location. It's not easy to turn on the device with just one hand as the power button is on the bottom.",Great Product;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I got this for my wife who could not understand why anyone would want to read from an electronic device.  She goes through a couple of books a week.  I figured if she didn't use it, I would try it and and give my older model away if I liked this one better.  It turns out my wife loves the Kindle so no upgrade for me.  This makes packing for trips much easier, now she has a selection of books to read and we don't have to carry 2 - 3 paperbacks while traveling.",New Ebook Lover in Training;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Very easy to hold and read even with one hand .  Still getting used to operations, but think that a pamphlet with instructions would have been more helpful rather than having to search it on the kindle.  Did buy one as a gift - think it is a most affordable present for the holidays.",Very easy to hold and read even with one hand;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this kindle to replace an earlier model that I stolen. I can't say I like it better than my old kindle, but it does have some feature that were not on my old kindle. The best of these is that you can set it up so that it requires a passcode to use it. If this had been on my old kindle I might have got it back. My old model used buttons to advance pages while on this Kindle use swipe your finger on the screen. I did not like this at first but after getting using it for a while I find that is ok. The only problem is that on rare occasions it skips a number of pages so you to go back to find your place.",A good replacement for a old Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Reading has always been my passion (I was 4 when my mother started to take me to the library). When in 2013, after many eye surgeries, I had difficulty reading, I purchased my firstKindle Paperwhite. It is wonderful! Being able to adjust type size and contrast and having such a great choice of reading material made such a difference! I may soon may be purchasing another.Plus, here's a little-known benefit for those of us who live where there are frequent power outages, whether man-made or weather-related - you can keep reading when the power goes out! (Does anyone out there remember sneaking a silver-and-black flashlight with sizs D batteries under the cover so that they could keep reading after lights-out???)I think I might be buying another Kindle Paperwhite in the near future.FYI: There are many out-of-copyright books available for free download!",Paperwhite is great for visually- or mobility-impaired people!;;;;;;

Review: No bothersome glare to bother my early cataracts. Totay readable in direct sunlight. Haven't had to recharge the battery since I got it and did the initial overnight charge two weeks ago. Totally Affordable.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"It is exactly what I expected and I'm glad I ordered it. The touch screen upgrade is so much better than the button version. The case also seems sturdier. For an economical and compact e reader, this one meets all my needs!",It is exactly what I expected and I'm glad I ordered it;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Awesome product! Battery last long, easy to use. Great for reading outdoors, you'll need light at all times seeing as its the model that doesn't come with illumination. Take into consideration the size and the fact that its only black and white when deciding the types of books you'd like to read. If you're looking to just read books and don't mind that images are black and white then this is for you. I have a couple of para-cord books that would look better and be easier to follow if in color, but that doesn't keep me from still going back to it time and time again.",My first Kindle and I'm very happy with it. It's nice to get back into reading again.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"It is a great upgrade from the previous version, the touch screen is pretty good, took a minute to figure out a couple of the new features.  Overall if you'd like an inexpensive kindle this would be it.  The only thing that bugs me is that it doesn't have the contact points for an external light like the old one for the lighted case.  Small issue.",Great product for the price!;;;;;;

Review: These Kindles are sleep safe! The blue light from back-lit tablets and e-readers disturbs your sleep and are not good to read in bed. This range of Kindles uses ambient light and won't affect your pineal gland.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this as a replacement for my old Kindle that died. I love the Kindle - the variety of books available, the cost of the books, the ease of ordering and the fact that I can have a library of thousands of books in a light notebook.",Love my Kindle!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought the Kindle after much deliberation at the suggestion of a friend. I had wanted to start reading books electronically, but found that reading them on an iPad or my computer monitor was simply a disastrous notion, as my eyes would quickly become dry, itchy, and tired. I did a lot of research online and saw that the technology behind the Kindle screen was much different, but the idea of a screen that does not keep refreshing itself was odd to me. I thought it would just look like the slow-moving screen of my old Palm Pilot.To my surprise, this device is absolutely amazing. As long as the lighting is adequate, it is just like reading a book. The battery holds a charge for a long, long time, and the software (a detail which a nerd like me cares about) is actually quite full-featured. You can make purchases directly from the device, you can connect it to your Goodreads account, and it even has a modest, built-in web browser. Basically, it includes some completely painlessly functioning online features that make it a pleasure to use. If I buy books on my computer, the next time I open the Kindle it immediately loads the new items into its inventory.The Kindle has exceeded my expectations in every conceivable way.",I love this device.;;;;;;

Review: Easy to use and easy to read through. This version of the Kindle doesnt have all the bells and whistles on it which is exactly what I needed. A library for when I am away from home.  The software on it is straight forward and easy to use.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love this thing. Got it on sale for $49.99 and have been reading more than ever. Don't be fooled by the simplicity and lack of ""premium features."" That's exactly what I was looking for, any more and I can easily get distracted. Battery lasts forever too!",Just Basic is Just Right;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I lost my previous kindle and had to purchase a new one. I thought I was buying the identical product, but what I didn't know is that Amazon had remodeled this item so that it was a little bulkier and, more importantly, felt like cheap plastic in my hands. That last kindle was a little sleeker and had more of a satin kind of finish when you're holding it (which you're going to be doing for an awfully long time if you read a lot.) I would see if I could buy some back-stock of the old model at a similar or perhaps cheaper price if you have the option.Really, the point of this review is to provide Amazon with feedback that they should pay more attention to the feel of kindle in the hand. This thing looks and feels like a piece of cheap junk. It does perform just as well as the previous iteration however, which can't be understated. It's still a marvel of an e-reader, despite the step back in quality.","Works as advertised, but new finish is cheap and unwieldy.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've had my Kindle for a few days now, since the release date, so 5 days total, and so far I absolutely love it. I was skeptical of the touchscreen, but I find that I actually like it much more than the previous Kindle. It has a ""swipe-to-open"" feature to unlock the device, in addition to the button on the bottom of the device.It's not bad, but I feel it's a bit redundant when there's a button to unlock the device as well. It also has parental controls which is a nice touch for those who have kids that like to go purchasing things with 1-click. The set-up is just like the previous generation Kindle Paperwhite, which is very clean and well organized in my personal opinion.The casing feels a bit cheap, it doesn't have the smooth back like the previous generation Kindle did, which I was a fan of. Other than the casing I love the device and would recommend it to anyone looking into an e-reader. I would suggest a clip-on light to go along with it if you're one who likes to read in bed, but don't want to spend the extra money for a built-in light.",Much improved;;;;;;
5.0 out of 5 stars,"This was a birthday present;" I initially did not want one and then my sister gave me my present and oh boy!  I am a book lover and as much as I love hard copies
Review: I have to say
Title;;;;;;: this Kindle is heaven sent.  My husband loves it (he thinks I'll stop by the old fashioned
column4: hardbound type)!""
column5: I'm a believer";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This little device is amazing, granted I've not owned many e-readers.  I'm still very happy with the product, serves my purposes greatly.If you haven't used an e-reader before they're pretty fancy.  They lack the tactile appeal of a book, and permanence, but are a great way to have a whole library at your fingertips.That combined with the ability to email yourself documents makes it a perfect companion product for a student on the go.","This little device is amazing, granted I've not owned many e-readers";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"The kindle replaced a Nook color DX and when it died I wanted a E-Reader that didn't have to be charged every day, All I wanted to do is just read books, the Kindle does that with a battery that lasted weeks on one charge.",The kindle replaced a Nook color DX and when it ...;;;;;;

Review: This is a great product! I just wish i had gotten the one with the back light! I noticed that you are able to read faster bacause you are able to adjust some reading settings and it does foster reading habits overall!

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"It's very light weight, which I like.  I do wish the screen could be lightened so I could read in bed at night without lights being turned on.  So I use my Kindle Fire at night and the e-reader during the day.","Light weight, makes it nice.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am a huge fan of books! I love everything about them, so didn't think I would like a Kindle. I received one as a gift. Now I can't imagine not having this! Love it! It's easy to bring with anywhere and even easier to read in bed. 2.0 out of 5 stars,"I owned a first model Kindle.  It was very easy to use.  It died!  I bought this new model.  I do not like it.  Everything is ""touch"" screen.  Ugh. The slightest touch and zip/wham now it wants to reset the font.  Now what to do?  Answer?  Touch the screen where it (not me!) wants you to touch.  If you should you touch the wrong place and it will zip/wham go somewhere else.  The ""Kindle User Guide"" is also does not answer the simple question, ""How to move back a page""!  Two stars!",I want to buy the old model;;;;;;

Review: The way the display looks like paper is so cool.  The rendering on this is super slow and it makes viewing PDF documents difficult because of the lag between scrolling/pinching and the screen updating.  5 stars anyway because I'm thoroughly enjoying reading eBooks on this.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Dropped my 3rd generation kindle around Thanksgiving, but I was still able to see the page when I increased the font. Then, you guessed it, the blackness spread until I could no longer read nor operate the kindle. I read the reviews for the kindle 7, especially the one and 2 starred reviews, and with no choice I purchased the kindle 7. No need for the backlight or the Fire, just wanted to read.  I was so apprehensive about the newer kindle that I dreaded opening the box. Not sure the people that wrote a 1 or 2 star review actually purchased the same reader because the instructions were so simple, and maybe, just maybe the whole ordeal of opening the box, setting up the Wi-Fi and downloading my books took 15 minutes. Everything worked, the cloud is easy to access. pages are simple to turn. If you are an avid reader, you can turn off the annoying dictionary;" its an option

column7: but when I do I will realize again and again what a great reader this 7th generation is to own!!!!!  PS- the price was right as well""

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"In technical books, the diagrams/pictures don't show up clearly, the zoom out on the diagrams/pictures don't zoom making it difficult to read. It is otherwise built well, very handy, light weight, long battery life, good UI.Making notes also is not that flexible, does not have a pen that comes with it. Could be worth the price,  but look for something better",good UI. Making notes also is not that flexible;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Kindle touch is entry level E-reader from Amazon. This device does not have back light. It does not have any buttons for page turns either. It is, however, a reliable, paper-like reader that meets reading criteria.Note that all kindle ereaders are:-> Reading device only. No sound, no read along.-> Except kindle touch, all others have some form of backlight.-> All kindle ereaders have  6"" gray screenDifferences between kindle ereaders:a. Bezel material. Kindle touch and paperwhite have plastic bezel. Higher end have metal.b. Screen recessed or flush. Kindle touch and paperwhite have recessed screens. Higher end have flush screens.c. Ereader technology. Kindle touch uses older generation technology, which is prone to ghosting.. Paperwhite onwards uses Carta (less ghosting).d. Screen resolution. Kindle touch has lowest resolution screen.Kindle Touch - an experience reading over a year.CONSIt does use an older version of e-ink technology, which does have ghosting of previous page during page turns. Ghosting lasts a few seconds ( < 3 seconds), however, with 'page refresh' it can be minimized to <1sec.Screen resolution is low, and you may see pixalation in fonts.No back light (It may be a good thing depending upon how 'white' paper you like).No page turns button.Touch sensitivity turns multiple pages, if not 'touched' quickly enough.Recessed screen is not flush with the bezel, hence there's a gap between screen and bezel that traps dirt. Device does gather dirt and moss over time.While the screen is not reflective, Bezel that is around recessed screen is very reflective, and can be a distraction in reading.Bezel is plastic and easily scratched.Pros:Amazon ereaders allow access to all of RAM to end user. This means users can use all of 3.5 GB space to store their books.Amazon ereaders work well with online library systems such as overdrive.Ereader is very affordable, and is part of amazon eco-system.If properly taken care of, this is best value for casual reading experience.Between paperwhite with back light, and Kindle touch without backlight, kindle touch has more paperlike screen. If backlight is not important, Kindle touch wins.",Kindle touch experience after using for a year.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"After my original kindle broke (don't leave it laying on a bed for your 7 year old to jump on when you chasing him!!) I debate between getting a regular Kindle or a Kindle Fire.  I love to read and was afraid I would neglect my love for it if I was able to do other things, so went with the Kindle Glare-Free Touchscreen and I love it!!!  I'm glad they still have an option of a reading device that is solely for the purposes of reading.  I never leave home with out!!!",I love to read and was afraid I would neglect my ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"My original Kindle gave up the ghost, and I really only wanted the basic Kindle and was so glad to be able to find it .  The touch screen has been challenging, but I'm figuring it out as I go along - I've already read 3 books on it.",I didn't want anything fancy with new and wonderful things I could do on it.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love this Kindle!!!  I originally had the one with the keyboard at the bottom, but it eventually died. I read every night so I wanted to replace it right away. The 6"" Glare-Free Touchscreen has met all of my expectations and more!!  It did not take me long to learn the basics and I am still learning as I use it. I love the size and it is very lightweight.  I would highly recommend this Kindle if you love to read!!!",If You Love Reading......This is for You!!!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I switched from a Nook to this Kindle, and I am very happy with it (despite having to replace books lol), it is lightweight, easy to hold, easy to set up, the wifi is great on it, and I like the interface for personalizing it, as well as the option to lock it with a password. I got the ad-free version and am glad, it's well worth the extra $$$",and I am very happy with it (despite having to replace books lol);;;;;;

Review: it keeps changing type style and size in the middle of my reading without my doing anything. it is also very hard to get it to go to the correct screen to remove a item from the device. i am just not pleased with the way it controls.
Title;;;;;;: i am just not pleased with the way it controls;;;;;;

Review: I am very happy with this Kindle.  Easy to operate and easy to read.  I purchased a folio case for this Kindle and really like that the Kindle opens when I open the case and closes when I close the case

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love the new Kindle Touch!  I never thought I would use an e-reader, but the Kindle has changed the type of reader I am now.  I can read anytime (even in bed- I bought a simple m-edge light to put in my homemade case).  I can read anywhere- this easily fits in my purse and I can take it when traveling- its so light and compact!  I can read faster- no need to figure out what page I'm on since it stays on the last page I read (unless my sons touch it or I touch the wrong part of the screen)  I can check out library books with just a few steps using the Overdrive system my library has- which has saved time on these cold days.  I can read my lessons for my online class by 'sending' them to my Kindle using the Google Chrome tool (so much easier than staring at the computer screen).  I can access daily reflections/prayers and search for the corresponding Bible readings. I can let my son use it to read a picture book (in black and white).  I can increase my vocabulary and story understanding by using the dictionary tool to look up words.  I can connect with friends and read reviews on goodreads.  I can take advantage of the Special Offers which hasn't bothered me at all.  I've had my Kindle since Christmas and have used it everyday since.  It charges quickly using the USB with a wall charger I have for my phone and lasts a week for me reading daily.  The Kindle has allowed me to read several series quickly and  it is nice to immediately have access to the next book.  I like the Kindle Unlimited, for now, but probably won't have it for long since my library has quite a few books I am interested in.  I also have plenty to read with my Prime membership with the free monthly book from the Kindle Owners Lending Library and the Kindle First program.  I am enjoying my Kindle and look forward to many more reading adventures with it!",Love the KindleTouch and its easy to use features!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Great, small enough to fit in a purse, and the internet connection hasn't had many issues. I haven't had any major problems with this kindle. The only downside would be that the screen doesn't have a night setting if you are reading in a low-light room. It's not completely glare-free, but it is close enough. For any reader, this is the perfect gift for them.",Best Birthday Gift.;;;;;;

Review: Disappointed in my Kindle.  I haven't had it a year yet and already it does not work.  It will not download any books and the battery runs out in just a few hours.  I worked great when I first got it. I would think it should last more than a year before it dies.  Not impressed.  I won't buy another one.

Review: I am extremely dusappointed! I had no idea that I would not be able to change the text on the screen.  Even the very first Kindle that I got could at least change the size of the text and the Kindle Fire that I have been using can reverse the background so that the background is black and the text is white.  I have had vision problems due to my MS for several years and  recent cataract surgery has created even more problems for me due to the lens that was used in the surgery.  I would like to return the Kindle that I just purchased and exchange it for a version that allows text changes and background changes and also have a screen that lights up so I can read in a darkened room. Please advise me as to how to return the Kindle that I just purchased and tell me which of the current Kindles actually meets my needs.I had already downloaded all my books on the new Kindle before I discovered its limitations.  How do I remove my stuff from it before returning it? Thanks.
Title;;;;;;: I would like to return the Kindle that I just purchased and ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"All I needed, my old kindle had buttons and after so many years the letters wore off. The touchscreen is great. Old kindle still works great though if not for buttons. Just the perfect e reader,is all I needed,. Love it!",simple perfection;;;;;;

Review: The device works fine but it has too many bells and whistles for me. Also does not have enough margin on the side of the screen; I hit the screen accidently because of this lack of space to hold the device. Next edition should be better engineered.

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"NO, NO, NO you cannot use one hand with the touch screen, you have to hold it with one hand and turn the page by touching with the other hand.  My old Kindle had the side bar and the keys at bottom. You could hold it with one hand and press the side bar to turn the page....TRUE ONE HAND READING.  You just added ""things"" we don't truly want to increase price.  Bring back the side bar without giving us a $200 price tag.",NOT ONE HAND READING;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've had my Kindle for a few days now, since the release date, so 5 days total, and so far I absolutely love it. I was skeptical of the touchscreen, but I find that I actually like it much more than the previous Kindle. It has a ""swipe-to-open"" feature to unlock the device, in addition to the button on the bottom of the device.It's not bad, but I feel it's a bit redundant when there's a button to unlock the device as well. It also has parental controls which is a nice touch for those who have kids that like to go purchasing things with 1-click. The set-up is just like the previous generation Kindle Paperwhite, which is very clean and well organized in my personal opinion.The casing feels a bit cheap, it doesn't have the smooth back like the previous generation Kindle did, which I was a fan of. Other than the casing I love the device and would recommend it to anyone looking into an e-reader. I would suggest a clip-on light to go along with it if you're one who likes to read in bed, but don't want to spend the extra money for a built-in light.Comment3 people found this helpful. Was t",and so far I absolutely love it. I was skeptical of the touchscreen;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"The device itself is fine.  I ended up with this one because my original Kindle would no longer power up.  What I am dissatisfied with is the customer service and misguided information that I was given.  The screen on this replacement Kindle (that I purchased new when my other one failed to turn on anymore) is the same, but the body is smaller (I was told it was the same size and would fit into my leather case) and WILL NOT fit into my leather case ($65 when I bought it for my other Kindle).  So now I have a Kindle that is unprotected when not in use until I fork out more money for another cover.",Dissatisfied;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"This was my 4th Kindle.  I have been disappointed in this one as the battery doesn't seem to last as long as the one on my Paperwhite, even though it is almost exactly the same except for the back light, which i had assumed would make this last at least as long, if not longer.  With my Paperwhite I was easily able to go a week between chargings, and even then I would have a fair charge left, while with this I get the pop up telling me I need to charge after 5-6 days.  After talking to tech support I turned off the wifi for a couple days, and it still depleted the battery by about half in 3 days.  I have also found the touch screen to be a bit ""touchier"" than my Paperwhite.  If I am not careful it will flip a couple pages at a time, and I have had issues with it leaning against a blanket and popping up the text resize menu.  For reading the screen is just fine and everything I have come to expect from my Kindles, it is just the issue with the battery and the touchyness of the screen that bugs me.  Oh, and make sure you really don't care about having the lit screen.  I got this thinking I didn't really need it, but it didn't take long before i decided I was missing it.  I am going to Best Buy today to get myself a Paperwhite to replace this one (have to get somewhere else because Amazon seems to have the Paperwhite back-ordered at the moment.)","Good, but a few disappointments.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"It came quickly and already set up for me. I love how easy it is to access amazon ' s selection of books. I am kind of disappointed that the wall charger comes seperate, where as the Barnes and Noble Nook comes with one, but over all I'm very satisfied with it!",I love how easy it is to access amazon ' s ...;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Small, light, easy to carry around. I dont find it that much simple to use, for example, Changing size of letters, or even returning to home page while reading a book... Overall is a good deal for addicted readers!",Overall is a good deal;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"It's usable, but after a week or so's solid use am badly missing my old (non touch screen) Kindle. If you still have a usable one & are thinking to upgrade, keep hold of it until you have tried this version for a while. There are 2 main problems for me, both affect my reading experience daily so far:1. Although smaller, it's significantly heavier and fatter than my old Kindle - this, together with the touch screen rather than button page turning, makes it difficult to read with one hand. If you love to read in bed lying on your side (like me), this is a big issue! There's only one (awkward to hold) position you can use, and you can still find yourself accidentally going backwards rather than forwards or randomly changing the text size or exiting the book without intending to.  Sure, a paper book is hard to read with one hand too, but that's what one of things that made the old Kindle so great, and stopped me buying paper books overnight.2. Very easy to change text size accidentally - happens dailyOn the plus side:The searching in Kindle Store is MUCH easier with touch screen than using the keyboard on old Kindle.Still much prefer the old non touch screen one though, just because the ease of use for reading in one hand is so much better.",Miss my old Kindle...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought this for my 93 year old mother-in-law who has macular degeneration. She was worried about using it as she has never used ""technology"" on her own. She loves it - she can make the print large enough to read and we can add books for her. Her neighbor takes it to the library to use the wifi when we add books.",Bought this for my 93 year old mother-in-law who has ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This little device has renewed my love of reading.  I preferred the basic model without the light since I would never read in the dark anyway, so why spend the money.  The text is clear and it downloads the books really fast.  I was amazed at how many books were free through Amazon as well.  I actually like the ads on the sleep screen since they look neat and some will pique my interest.  Easier to hold than a traditional paperback and quicker page turns without licking your fingers.",This little device has renewed my love of reading;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"This came with a 2 year square trade warranty. It sucks and I feel scammed. First, amazon sends a ""voucher email"" with code to activate the warranty. Absolutely no info on how to actual activate the warranty. No link. Then you call amazon and wait on hold and they tell you try squaretrade. You go to their website and try to register but once you say its an amazon kindle it creates a loop where you cannot login , create an account and activate. I then call squaretrade and after numerous prompts they say to call back when they aren't so busy with other calls!Absolute scam.Oh, and I bought this unit because my last kindle died after having it 88 days. Amazon doesn't count warranty from date of delivery or date of activation, they count from the ship date. Would they honor the kindle warranty on the 88th day of use of a 90 day warranty? No. I escalated twice to managers and they offered a $10 voucher off a new one.I would like to provide Mr. Bezos the same ""service"" as he has given me if he'd give me the opportunity.",Lousy service cannot make up for great technology;;;;;;

Review: I had the original version which made it through several trips to the jungles of Papua New Guinea before finally retiring  This one has fewer buttons and is much easier to operate. The no glare screen is really terrific.
Title;;;;;;: The no glare screen is really terrific.;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"The printing press is one of the major advancements in the history of mankind. Prior to the Internet, it was the innovation that allowed for the sharing of information on a large scale. Books steadily became more affordable and were more widely available read.  We had Carnegie who established a a trust for the construction of Public Libraries, where anyone could access the information that heretofore had been limited editions and expensive to acquire. In the United States, reading became the most cherished of educational acquired skills. Everyone read, it was, and continues to be a major exchange media for news, sports, and in many cases advertising . Every so often an innovation comes along that expands the frontiers of Information. The Kindle is simply the next logical step in the evolution of technology. It retains the look, size and feel of a traditional paperback in size and heft, but it is capable of a veritable library within it's small frame and even more so when ""Cloud"" storage is considered. The elements of the screen controls (Font Size and Brightness) are literally at your finger tips. It holds a charge for days, you can hold it in one hand quite comfortably and it's heft is no more than a medium sized paperback. It has many more features, all neatly spelled out on the Information Page at  Amazon. What you are looking for is some assurance or feedback from people who actually own a Kindle Paper White. I never intentionally set out to acquire a Kindle, but after sitting on the fence, and looking at the many readers available I went with Amazon Kindle. Why, it was a gift?  So the decision forme was very easy to make. I have no regrets, not one. It is an easy, nearly intuitive process to learn. I have ten ""thumbs"" but I quickly adjusted to the  feel and touch of the screen. I wouldn't sell it if I was offered the same price I paid.Now if you would throw in a few hundred for it , well I can adjust. I  can also buy another one, pocket the balance, and be quite content. The point is I would buy another one, that's how much I enjoy it. Okay, I won't gush about it. Just buy it, try it, if you read for any length of time, you will soon forget the format you are holding in your hand. Page turning is simply a flick. You only have one page at a time.  I know some folks who were so used to having ""two pages"" left and right, they were actually uneasy about it. They hung in there and both now own a Kindle. They might of purchased two one for the right hand page and another for the left hand page, which would make them at ease, but I never inquired further.  Now ,wishes...well, all books just ought to have the Kindle version available. It ought to be less expensive. Sure it costs less, but  considering the elimination of long term overhead costs you'd think it would be even less. That's it...One, There should be a Kindle format available for each book. Two, Yes we're greedy, we want more for less. But that's my only negative comments about  the Kindle Formatting and Prices. Hardware functionality, A+. Would I buy another. Yes I would. Would I recommend it to a friend or as a gift for a friend, Yes, with no reservations. There is a lot of Media for no costs to the user. A lot of old books, no longer under copyright which are just as true as they were a hundred years ago(and we still haven't learned a thing in many aspects). There are also free programs that convert PDF into a Kindle or Kindle Paper White format. That will open up opportunities even more books for free. One last thing, pictures will be displayed in Black/White/Gray and that tint of CTR. Don't expect vibrant colors. It's different, but again not a big deal (to me).  Try it, I think you'll enjoy it.","Makes a great gift, even if you decide to keep it and give them an old restaurant gift card you haven't used instead.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,I love this device. I previously had a Nook and made the switch to the Kindle since I am a Prime member. I couldn't be more pleased with the device and all the options. So easy to use! The only thing I wish it had (and maybe it does but I just can't find it) is a dashboard with how fast I read books.,"Beautiful device, great options!";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"The operating system is a bit underwhelming, and not the easiest thing to use. The covers of the books are very difficult to read what book it is you're trying to open, so if you don't recognize the picture you're in trouble. Beyond that the device is excellent, I love using in any conditions, though I wish it had a backlight.  I definitely would recommend it. Great ""bang for your buck"".","Beyond that the device is excellent, I love using in any conditions";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"My son loves to read. I always struggle with all the books he carries in his backpack. We got him the is Kindle for his birthday and he couldn't be happier! The backpack is a lot lighter now!He keeps track of his own reading, and I personally love the clues that appear automatically in the reading according to his age.",Best present for my 11 year old son!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Having had a few kindle readers I like this one a lot. Screen quality is excellent, unbeateable I would say. Great battery life. Only drawback is that you can easily flip pages inadvertently as the screen is very sensitive to any touch.",Great device a bit sensitive screen;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is an excellent product for someone who just wants to read, like me. It's light and doesn't bother the eyes like many other devices, feels like reading a book. Also, since I started using it, I've been reading a lot more. 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love it! I never had a Kindle reader before, and was really looking forward to owning one and using it. When I got this one, I used it right a way and really loved it. I was always hitting buttons accidentally while holding it and I don't have that problem with this.  It is smaller so it fits in my purse a little better.  The screen is easy and clear to read on. I m going to take a look at the paper white due to this reason. Although I really love this kindle touch, the unavailability of a lighted case will likely change my mind about it.",I really like it. 5.0 out of 5 stars,"You may argue that you can read it over phone, but the point is that Kindle is made for books. For people who look to build in their own library , it may or may not be worth, but definitely for me, I carry my library with me.",Digital is the way to go!;;;;;;

Review: Not crazy about this model. The touch screen is not particularly sensitive and I find myself having to try twice to turn pages. Also if I bobble it or set it down wrong the font switches from smaller to the largest size. Have constantly had to reset font. Overall this model feels and acts much more cheaply made than my 2 previous e-readers. Wish I had sprung for the paper white.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Kindle e-reader is a fantastic device which is free of any interruptions. There are many who may think about the need of this product especially when there are tablets and laptops available. To understand the brilliance of this product, one has to be a book reader and that too an avid one.Kindle. According to the makers, Kindle is designed as a dedicated e-reader and it make me indulge into my love of reading without the interruptions like email alerts and push notifications.I am simply in love with this product. It has become my companion. What scores for Kindle is that it is lighter than most paperback books, making it easy and comfortable to hold in one hand for extended periods of time.The makers claim that there are Millions of books (including the latest best sellers), newspapers, and magazines on Kindle. Let me tell you this is not true as many of the editions are not free and easily accessible. This said the famous titles will not come free and one has to be willing to spend for books as this is just a comfortable and elegant book reader. Once you buy, you have the e-version of the book which can be referred always.I think this product should be made a national product simply because it inculcates the reading habit which is a priced possession for any youngster who today seems to be lost and purposeless. Less preaching and coming back to the product, Kindle paper-white comes in 3 versions but the basic elementary version has all the features at an affordable price. Kindle is touchscreen and has the typical matte finish which makes it also an eye candy. Its time to get back your habit of reading if you had one and if you didnt then its time to develop one! Lets Kindle.",Kindle e-reader is a fantastic device which is free of any interruptions;;;;;;

Review: I always thought I was a book purist but I really like the kindle.  It's light to carry and hold in your hand while reading.  I really bought it to borrow library ebooks.  This way you can borrow books without the hassle of going to the library.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I previously had an old version of a Kindle so when that stopped working this was a great replacement.  It's easy to use andthe white back round makes the print jump off the page.  I prefer to keep all my reading materials on a Kindle because of the glare factor when reading outside.  Unlike  tablets, it's never a problem.  I would recommend this to anyone.When you place this is a protective case with a cover, it's like reading any book.",Recommended to all.;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"This works very well for my daughter...when it actually works! I love Kindles, and have bought myself two so far. My family and I live overseas in Singapore, so I got my 9-year-old daughter a Kindle in order to get access to books we cannot get here, as well as for convenience when traveling. She loves it, but it freezes constantly and take about a day and many tricks to unfreeze it. She gets extremely disappointed and frustrated when she is in a good part in her book and then the Kindle freezes, meaning she must put it aside for at least a day. I don't know if this is a glitch with this particular model, since I've never had this issue with my Kindles and when I search it on forums I find that many others have this issue, but they need to look into it and fix it. I will be very unhappy if I have to buy her another Kindle to replace this one, which is only 6 months old.","I love Kindles, and have bought myself two so far";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I was a bit hesitant about getting a KindleI am one of those readers that can't read without a pen in hand to write on margins as I read...nothing beats the feel of a book! OAlso, I didn't want to add another device to my life. But after much hesitation, I finally made the plunge and I don't regret it. I love traveling and having all my books in one place is worth it I don't have to carry them around because they're all in my light Kindle. The e-ink makes the read pretty smooth and it doesn't hurt the eyes. The Kindle is a good investment for those of us who travel, do lots of commute, and want to be able to read lots of books.",I love traveling and having all my books in one place ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Lots of nice features, such as X-Ray to remind me who the characters are, dictionary, time left in chapter and book, location, page number and of course, touch page turning .  Plus, it was easy to download books from my first Kindle.  I love it and will be giving it for Christmas (again).","Lots of nice features, such as X-Ray to remind me who ...";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Fellow readers, I went on the cheap for my 2nd Kindle (ages ago I had the 2nd gen new...$300, how times have changed) and couldn't be happier. No buttons?  No problem. We're a point n click society now so it was easy to adapt to the screen tap.  As for ads? Who cares, it's not as if they pop up when you're reading.Battery life: good nuff.Screen: way better than my first one.Wifi only: as if you're in need of downloading that book this instant out in the high desert.  Plan ahead maybe.  Bought my 82 yr old mother one and after a few lessons she was up and running.  If she can do, then I dare say you can.  Have not one moment of regret with this little guy.  That being coupled with my Prime I'm pleased as punch.",Pleased as punch;;;;;;

Review: I do like it and it is so convenient to take along on office visits where I have to sit for a time at times. Fits in my purse so don't have to carry a book along with my appointment book. Easy to use.
Title;;;;;;: I do like it and it is so convenient to take along ...;;;;;;

Review: My first Kindle was the original one --Don't know what you call it but I had a cover with a light.  I had it for over five years not a lick of trouble but then I dropped it in the parking lot. I had to get another one right away so I went to Staples.  My budget only allowed for the smallest paperwhite.  I love the touchscreen and especially love the dictionary and the xray features  The thing about this one is that it is lighter and I am surprised at how much better that is..  I purchased a cover for 15 bucks which I had to have because I didn't want to break my precious Kindle again.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Got it on sale and it is a very good reader.  The only thing it lacks is a lit screen when it gets dark, but I knew that when I bought it.  When I read at night, I use the light on my cell phone to read by.  Downloading books is easy, it remembers where you left off when you pick it back up.  I have used it about a week and am on my second book.  For the money it does a lot and just what it says it will do.  Very nice device, I gave it 5 stars because I find it extremely easy to use and read from and always has my page.  So far it has done everything as advertised.",Got it on sale and it is a very good reader. The only thing it lacks is a ...;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"While I enjoy reading on my kindle, It was very time consuming transferring my books from on kindle to another.  I was also under the impression that the battery time would last me weeks.  I have to stop and recharge every 5 days not weeks.  I do like the way the books go live when you open the cover.  I think I am just confused by all the touch features.",While I enjoy reading on my kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had my last Kindle for years and it was with me through more than 150 books.  Can't say enough good things about this device.  Easy to use and read, long battery life, ridiculously portable, durable (with a case), encourages reading, etc.",Love my Kindle;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I love the size and weight of this unit.  Not being very tech oriented, it took me a bit to figure out that the content from my old Kindle was in the cloud and not on the device, but once I got that down, everything else came pretty easy.  I prefer this unit to the paper white as it is not as hard on the eyes in brightly lit places.  My Kindle goes everywhere with me, and this particular unit is lighter in weight which makes transporting it easier.",A Great New Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"My boyfriend bought me a Kindle for when I get bored at work and I LOVE it! It was very easy to learn how to use it, but then again I am very tech savvy. I would recommend this to anyone who likes to read and doesn't have space to store a bunch of books at. I use it everyday and at night too usually if my boyfriend is playing video games. I do wish I upgraded to the back light one because you definitely cant see much when it starts to get dark outside. Other then that it is very convenient to have for those slow days at work",LOVE ITT;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Kindle it is famous for a simple reason, is the real perfect solution for reading. Now the decision, wich one?The question is, what are you looking for? in this case I bought the Kindle, 6"" Glare-Free Touchscreen.What do I need?, a reading device that can give me hours of good quality pages and an endless book library.This model has everything I need then.In terms of resolution is perfect, now, if you are looking for backlight, well simple, buy the next one, in my case I'm aware that LED light in dark environments can produce headaches, so with this one I'm a totally satisfied costumer.THANKS KINDLEHope to be useful with this review",Tell me who you are and I'll tell you if this Kindle is for you;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Okay, it's a good product, but it wasn't right for me. I was looking for a replacement for a Kindle Fire HD that had frozen up for the fourth time. I was disappointed because it didn't have back lighting and I wanted to read in bed without having to turn on the overhead light. My bedside lamp wasn't bright enough by itself. I still want to have a back up even though my First Kindle came back to life. It seems to freeze up more and more often. (I've had it almost two years.) The Paperwhite is light weight, clear, and easy to read. If you don't care about the back lighting and you want a reader you can carry in a purse or pocket, you'll probably love it. I'm thinking about the $119 model with built in light but I have to wait till I save up the extra money.","Good product, but not right for me!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I got this at a lower than normal price and it has exceeded my expectations.  It does what it is supposed to very well.  Of course more expensive devices are sleeker and have more goodies: color,  back-lit,  and more functions,  but for the price this is exactly what I wanted to read.  If you read during day or with light on,  you don't need the back light,  but I could see that being valuable.  As an entry devicee reader I am very happy with it.",Excellent value for a avid reader with minimal investment.;;;;;;

Review: I decided to buy one when it was on sale so I could check it out.  It's easier to read text with than on a similar sized nexus but it doesn't come close to be as easy to read as a real book.  The display size is too small.  Maybe it will begin to be somewhat close to a book when they get the technology to make the entire front the screen.  There is too much wasted space around the edges in the current version.
Title;;;;;;: doesn't come close to replacing a real book;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"My fiance got this for me as a Christmas gift, and gave it to me entirely too early... And I couldn't be happier. I love the ""old"" style kindle, because my eyes get too tired from backlit versions or from iPads and the like. I like natural lighting and reading as if it's a book. I also love that I can take notes very easily, and that I can scan through them quickly.","And I couldn't be happier. I love the ""old"" style kindle";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Debated with myself for years about getting a Kindle. Have the app on my phone which I use daily. Having received an Amazon gift card for Christmas I decided to finally pull the trigger. Bought the basic model because I'm cheap. Hindsight being 20/20 I should have gotten the ""paperwhite"" because of the light. I'm giving my model a 5 star rating because it does everything as advertised.",No regrets.......but;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"It is very nice and easy to use.  The only problem is that I can't avoid accidentally bumping the screen and that always either changes the page or produces screens to change the type size, give a definition of a word, etc.  So, my reading is frequently interupted to try to tap a clear spot on the screen rectify.",It is very nice and easy to use;;;;;;
4.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchased the new Kindle for my mother. This is an upgrade from her current Kindle, the 2nd Generation ""white Kindle"".We/she is still getting used to the new Kindle;" however
Review: as of now
Title;;;;;;: I see issues with the Wi-Fi connection
column4: as the new Kindle does not seem as responsive and loses the single.  Mom may be set in her ways
column5: but she is trying the new touch screen vs the buttons.The transition from old to new isn't that difficult
column6: in my opinion anyway.  Mom and I are learning together.You can teach an old dog
column7: new tricks!""
column8: I purchased the new Kindle for my mother. This ...";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This was a replacement for one I lost. While the screen is the same size, the overall size is smaller and more convenient. One the other hand, I occasionally enjoyed using the audio output of my previous model.",I occasionally enjoyed using the audio output of my previous model;;;;;;

Review: I even like the box it comes in. I store my Kindle in it and carry it around in my backpack like a actual book.. It's convenient and protect my screen. For reading I just open the box and turn it on. Awesome. I really do love it.
Title;;;;;;: I even like the box it comes in;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Nice little reader that is good for sunny days.  A little flimsy in construction but it serves its purpose, and is priced accordingly.  Since I just wanted a reader, not a tablet or notebook, it is fine for what it is.",Nice little reader that is good for sunny days;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've resisted getting an e-reader, but the deal on this was too good to pass up.  Add Kindle unlimited to it, and it can't be beat!  The only thing it's missing is the back lighting that the paper white features, but add a $10 clip on lamp and it's still a bargain.",but the deal on this was too good to pass up;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have debated getting a Kindle for a long time, but was never sure I wanted to give up on holding a real book and turning real pages. Well, I finally decided to try the basic Kindle, and I am pleasantly surprised how much I enjoy reading on this. I definitely read more now that I have the Kindle. It's comfortable to hold, there is zero eye strain, and overall usability is excellent. Having so many cheap or free books available through Kindle deals has already increased my Kindle library substantially. I bought a Fintie Folio Case and they are a great fit.Screen: excellent, clear, no eye strain, easy to readTouch: excellent, intuitive, responsive, turning pages happens subconsciously nowCasing: good, plastic, but not uncomfortable, maybe would have preferred a little matte finish for gripSpeed: responsive, no lag, page turns do not noticeably flash like the Kindle keyboard I tried out from a friend, which was distractingAs a former Kindle skeptic, I would recommend this to anyone who isn't sure they want to give up on real paper. I am very happy with my purchase.",the Kindle is very enjoyable;;;;;;

Review: This Kindle is fantastic.  I had another device for several years and loaned my device and over a 100 books to a Peace Corps volunteer.  The Kindle is far superior.  I love the way i can change the text settings to larger or smaller depending on my eye fatiegue.
Title;;;;;;: This Kindle is fantastic. I had another device for several years and ...;;;;;;

Review: This is my fourth kindle.  Bought it just because it was on sale and thought I'd  get it to use just for reference books.  Wish kindles came with reference guides as there is always something I don't know how to figure out.  Finally found the user's guide (2nd Edition) doesn't seem to go with the kindle  I purchased  but that's the guide I keep getting so must be the right one.  I want to know how to change the font as I like a larger print.  I found instructions in the user's guide but can't seem to get the right text button on the tool bar - this kindle may not have that capability.  Have enjoyed all my other kindles and sure I'll  enjoy this one more once I figure everything figured out.
Title;;;;;;: I want to know how to change the font as I like a larger print;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm used to a Kindle Fire HD, so the display on this model is not nearly as easy to see  -- for instance, it's not easy to read book covers and I can't read with the lights off when my partner is sleeping. But I bought this model to use for  traveling because of the long battery life, and it's great for that. Also it's tiny so it fits in my purse. I look forward to using it at the beach, since the Kindle Fire HD doesn't do well in bright sunlight. This model is very cheap (I got a discount because of my 2 year Prime membership) and is well worth the price for a back-up, special use Kindle. I'd give it five stars, but I really dislike the pop up ads.",Good for traveling;;;;;;

Review: I love this Kindle! It is lightweight so I can keep it in my purse and have it with me at all times. I previously was using my IPad for reading my kindle app books. This by far is better just like holding and reading the actually book. I'm old school..what can I say.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I like the extended battery life and the screen savers. I didn't realize how much I would use it. I have a kindle fire that I love,  but this one is smaller, lighter, and fits in my purse with ease. The only thing I regret is that I didn't get one with the light.",I like the extended battery life and the screen savers;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love how light it is after some of my heavy tablets.  Its easy to read.  Had it shipped while on vacation, so I enjoyed it while on vacation when I had more time to read.  Bought lots of books and cookbooks.  Thanks for a nice reader.  I love the long battery life.  Wish my other devices had a battery to last that long.",I love how light it is after some of my heavy ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had been considering getting a Kindle product for some time, but was unsure if I would use it and enjoy the alternative to traditional books. First I debated between this version of the Paperwhite, I decided I didn't want to spend the extra $ for what is essentially a light and I have been very happy with this version.  It feels light but not fragile in hand, and reads very well under normal lighting conditions.Downloads via Wifi are speedy and browsing the Kindle store is very straightforward.  The only  downside is now I'm spending a ton of money on books!  It's been a great resource to have, and it really is a good deal.  I highly recommend it!",Excellent Value for Beginning eReaders!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is our third kindle in the house.  We all have one and love them.  They're lightweight and so much better than lugging a stack of books around. And as usual, the online ordering experience was great. Thank you Amazon.",Excellence is par for the course for Amazon;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I did expect the screen to be a little whiter (more like the color of newspaper), but I knew it wasn't the 'Paper White' so I am not too disappointed.Sensitive touch screen which is good, but if you have pets and get hair on the screen be careful not to wipe at it with a finger because it will change your page.was delivered very quickly.",great;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Great value! This is exactly what I expected it to be, it works. The ""e-ink"" or however it's promoted is easy on the eyes and makes for a great change of pace from reading typical digital media. In hindsight, the back light may have been nice with the next version upgrade but I mainly purchased this to utilize the Kindle owners library in congruence with my prime membership.","Great value, very basic, no extras";;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I like the glare-free Kindle and the size is perfect but if you want to read in bed or in a dimly lit area there is no light or way to adjust the screen brightness.  I wish I had bought one with that allows you to adjust the brightness of the screen, otherwise the battery life is excellent.  I have a Kindle Fire HD that I love but it has a glare when reading in certain places and the battery doesn't last any where near as long as the Kindle 6"".",I like the glare-free Kindle and the size is perfect but ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Excellent Kindle. Compared to first generation Kindle paperwhite the screen is super sensitive. It is really enjoyable to use this. Unfortunately, I missed the light and decided to return it.I have given only 4 stars because previous generation kindles are lighter and sleeker than this. Although this has better specs, I feel there is no reason for this to be so heavy (but it is not a brick, just heavier than previous generation).Totally a good buy. But if you have used paperwhite before, you will miss the light ...",Missed the light since I have used paperwhite before.;;;;;;
1.0 out of 5 stars,"hard to read,super touchy, not glare free. a disapointment","super touchy, not glare free";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought for my ten your old daughter who's a voracious reader. 200-300 page books in a couple of days if she likes them. Saving money now! Makes me very happy. Also picked up digital copy of Science News. The Science News needs a bit of tweaking to make the digital copy easier to read but the Kindle is a hit. Small, light and convenient with great wi-fi connectivity. At $59.00, it's almost disposable too. The ONLY problem I have experienced is it's so compact my daughter can sneak it to bed and stays up reading till God only knows! I am forced to do bed checks now for the Kindle. Note: My Kindle came set in Spanish. Fortunately I know some Tex-Mex so I was able to initially navigate through the menu options. I did however finally call the help center for Kindle and was promptly helped with the real ""Spanish"" menu options to change the default language to English. It was humorous too. A middle Asian helping a Tex-Mex speaking Caucasian with proper Spanish. We both laughed several times together and at each other too!",El Kindle es muy bien! Pero mi Espanol es muy mal.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I like it ok.  I gave my old one to my sister.  I like the buttons on the side better to turn the pages.  This one doesn't have buttons on the side.  Other than that though, I like it.  Finding the Home button is a little hard too.  Sometimes my finger are dry or something and I have a hard time getting the home button to work.",Good but Miss Buttons on Side;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This kindle has the same great glare free feature of the former kindles with touchscreen capabilities. Touchscreen works well. No problems there. Overall, I love it. However,  unlike the older kindle versions, there is no external power source for an easy to carry lighted case which means I have not been able to find a case I like as well as the designs that fit with the previous kindles. I like to read before bed. The lack of backlighting is great for preventing eye strain, but zero visibility in the dark without at least a minimal light source. Any case has to have an external light for dark areas which gets a bit bulky to transport.So overall 5 for the kindle. Subtract 1 for having to use an external and usually bulky light source in the dark. Still love it in spite of that though.",Touchscreen good. Wish it had better lighting option.;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I like my kindle, but :  as I have told a number of friends:  the ""home"" tab is sometime hard to reach because the words are so close to the top.  Many times I get a word definition instead of going to ""home"" !  Another very annoying item is the game choices.  On my #3 Kindle I enjoyed the game ""Every Word""  greatly, it was a great ""escape"".  Anyway I have tried everything I can think of to get the game on this new Kindle - no results and the games that are there are either silly or just to troublesome to bother with when all I want is a pleasant, interesting game.  Since the reason I bought this Kindle #4 was because my Kindle #3 died, I expected to be able to retain not just the books from #3 but the one and only game I enjoyed.  Perhaps you can tell me how I might find this game or if you are able to send from #3 to #4 as you have the books I've read.  Thank You.",Kindle Games;;;;;;

Review: Perfect jobs! I have been using Kindle 4 with no touchscreen for 3 years and it's time to change. This device is a lot better than 4th version. Touchscreen make me easier read all my book especially when I want to go on dictionary or highlight any text. Love it!

This is my second Kindle. Much prefer the one w/ keyboard. Easier to find books etc. It was a federal act just to figure out how to change the font size after initial set-up was done. It feels cheap and flimsy-plastic. The one good thing is that it was successful in downloading items from my other Kindle. Pay a little extra and get the better model...my advice.

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"When I bought my first kindle, 7 years ago, it was always a significant savings to purchase the kindle edition vs the paperback (usually more than $6 cheaper to get the kindle version). I practically made back the money in my kindle investment with my savings. Now, I'm on my 3rd kindle and noticing that it's cheaper to buy most of the books in paperback than it is to buy the kindle editions. That is really frustrating, I have a new kindle (which btw is very touch sensitive and flips through pages if my kids touch it while I'm reading, or if I try to wipe a piece of dust off etc) and I'm annoyed at the price of the books (sometimes the savings is 15 cents or its actually more expensive than buying the paperback. LAME.  I give it a 3 star because I still love the convenience of having a new book at my fingertips in seconds, its a major space saver, and Amazon has pretty much wiped out all book stores, so even if I could get to the bookstore, it would take me 30 minutes to get there (and I live in Los Angeles).  So once again Amazon wins.",or if I try to wipe a piece of dust off etc) and I'm annoyed at the price of the books (sometimes the savings ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm one of those people who has waaaaayyyyy too many books. It's getting ridiculous trying to store them all. I have over 300 books! So, a Kindle makes sense! All future new books for me will be on the Kindle, either bought or borrowed from the local library. I love my Kindle! I don't need for it to do anything fancy. It does what I need it to do. All I had to do was go to the library, which offers free WiFi, and I was able to purchase and download a few books easily. Stores books. Keeps my place. And I can download again from the Cloud if something disappears. Light and easy to hold. Much easier than holding a big book. And I read some 900+ page books sometimes. I'm also finding that e-books may be cheaper than paper books. Saves trees too. I haven't had any problems. I will have to charge it more often than it says because I read so much. That's not a problem. I got my Kindle during Cyber Monday deals and got a great deal on it.I am always leery of technology but this is very user friendly. I would recommend this product.",I love my Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I now have 4 kindles.  I love, love, love this one.  Yes, it is strictly for reading.  No games etc..  The big factor and most important is that it really is glare free.  I take it everywhere.  The beach, the park etc..  I was doubtful and ready to send it back if I could not read outside.  I am keeping it!  You will love it and the price is perfect.","I love, love";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first kindle, and I'm very glad I bought it. It feels like it's specifically designed to match my reading preferences.  It's light and easy to handle, the font options allow me to adjust the words to maximise my comfort, and the dictionary lets me look up any word instantaneously.The kindle store puts every book that I've ever wanted to read at my disposal, and offers them in reasonable prices. The daily deals are incredibly useful as well as the suggestions of books that I might be interested in.The access to goodreads is particularly useful to me since it's one of my favourite places to discuss books, and the twitter and Facebook links let me share all the great books that I come across.The kindle has outperformed every other e-reader that I have used in the past on almost every single level.Another bonus is having so many books on one device, which is great for traveling, without losing that magic that comes with good old fashioned books.",A must-have for bookworms!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I never thought of getting a Kindle - this one was a gift. What I can say though is that I love it! I had some doubts for the first few minutes: What am I supposed to do with this? It certainly can't do any of the many things a tablet can for example... And that's precisely the point: it's a great reader and nothing else. I take it everywhere with me: it's light and the screen is great. (And I don't get email or instant message notifications while I am reading, so it's very relaxing!) I give it four stars because 1) the touchscreen sensitivity is ok, but not as good as it could be (although this is more along the lines of a comparison with a tablet) 2) it won't replace my books: I can't imagine flipping between pages 100 and 350 for example to cross-reference text because the interface is still too clumsy (despite many Go To options). To me it doesn't beat a bunch of physical bookmarks you can place in a book.",A very good reader to take with you everywhere;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"My Kindle works great for the first eight months, then my battery quit charging completely. The only time I can use it is if it's plugged into a wall. As soon as I unplugged from the wall, it loses its charge. I'm very disappointed.",Battery did not hold a charge;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am very pleased with it.  I prefer to have audio books, but haven't heard one yet on it as I am reading another one right now.  Do you take the kindle I had where the screen got broken? Or can you recommend where I can send it?  Thanks.",I am very pleased with it;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"It is a lot easier to use than my old model.  I would have liked to be able to download my books that were on my old kindle unto the new one.  Since it was my first touch screen, I have some learning to do.  I think that, overall, I will like it a lot more than the old one.  I am looking forward to doing a lot more reading on this one.",I would have liked to be able to download my books that were ...;;;;;;

Review: This kindle has a glare free screen and no built in light...so it is easy on the eyes and a good break from viewing my bright laptop.  It downloads books in seconds and you can begin reading...so very easy and convenient!  Love this thing.
Title;;;;;;: Should have bought one years ago;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I loved it because I have a problem with my left eye and haven't been able to read for several years, but with the Kindle I could adjust the print and the glare free screen was great.  I am returning it because since I found I can enjoy books again, I am upgrading to one with a screen that has a light so I can enjoy reading in bed if I want to.  I already have read 2 books since Christmas, but am having to stop so I can ship the one I have back and await the new one that I have ordered which won't be available until 1/25..It is really great to be able to enjoy reading again..",I loved it because I have a problem with my left ...;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"This was purchased as a replacement for my 3 yo Kindle.I have to admit, I am very disappointed.  The charge seems to last about half as long, the touch screen alternates between not responding at all and responding hysterically by pulling up random menu items or paging backward and forward at will, setting up my library was very annoying and took about 3x as long as my last one to set up and for some reason, I had to go back and download some of my items multiple times because they didn't stay in memory.It is very awkward to use unless I am sitting and holding it in my right hand.  It's almost more trouble than it's worth.  I would think I just got a ""lemon"", but I bought one for my son and my mom at the same time and neither of them like their new Kindle either.  I wonder if it's a ploy to get me to upgrade to a Paperwhite or Voyage?",I miss my old Kindle.;;;;;;

Review: I don't use all of the features (I'm 65) but I LOVE being able to take my books wherever I go.  The size is terrific and I love the glare free screen.This is my 2nd and best Kindle.  Simple and only for books.  i usually have 2-3 going at once.

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"Not sure if my Kindle's battery is defective but my battery does not last as long as advertised it will not completely charge and the charge will only last maybe a day. Otherwise I love it, I like having all my books in one place, it looks great and very lightweight and easy to use",Battery issue maybe?;;;;;;

Review: Bought this as a replacement for my old one that died.  Would have been nice if I could have re-used my old cover.  Old cover had the light built in. This has a separate light that I had to order; just another thing I have to remember to take with me.
