Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"l like it .  I have a kindle fire which I love,but my eyes water with the glare when I read for a while. Have not put the kindle reader down sice it came in today.  If I change my mind I will let you know.  Easy set up, easy to order books, easy on the eyes!  Happy with my Christmas present to myself.",Merry Christmas to Me;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"While I've anticipated these things since the mid-1960s, I only bought my first one a couple of weeks ago.  My biggest complaint so far is there doesn't seem to be a Table of Contents.  That's always the first thing you come to in paper--and it's VERY helpful.  I am puzzled why it doesn't appear very first thing when you touch the title of an e-book.  The Shopping Cart had no listing for Religious.  I typed in ""Bibles""  and picked up a couple, but there should be a listing for them.  Maybe the Geeks and Literary Critics who design these things don't have much to do with religion, but here in the United States candidates for public office never bother attending an athiest convention and seldom bother with ones on philosophy or literature--but they ALWAYS make it a point to attend churches and make sure the cameras are rolling when they do.  They may not be terribly religious themselves--but they know an awful lot of people are and they DARE NOT neglect that group.  So neglecting them in your shopping cart is a bit of an oversight--don't you think?  Otherwise it's okay--except that for decades now pocket calculators have had solar cells, so how is it the e-book reader neglects them?  There is one thing I would find laughable about the Kindle if it were not so frustrating, and that is the QWERTY keyboard it displays:  One must hunt-and-peck all over the place to find the letters.  I suppose to an unthinking engineer a QWERTY like that used on computers would seem reasonable, but to anyone who understands how and why the QWERTY came to be it is rediculous.  Back when typewriters were first invented there were two basic philosophies on keyboards:  One was ABCDEFG while those familiar with the printing trade favored some form of ETAOIN SRDLU--the order of how frequently the latters were used.  The Problem was that the slow movement of the mechanical connections used on manual typewriters allowed the keys to jam up.  The QWERTY keyboard deliberately slowed down the typist's fingers so that the keys did not jam up.  Since the Kindle does not use jam-prone mechanically-linked arms and since QWERTY-trained human fingers do not rest on the keyboard it would make much more sence for the Kindle to use an ABCDEFG keyboard so that people will be able to find they keys they are looking for.",Kindle Okay--but Neglects the Obvious;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have always appreciated the easy ability to change type size and access word definitions. The additional ability to look up information on names and events etc. is terrific. I understand that it is easier to return to the text you are reading from a side trip to a footnote but haven't used it yet. It used to make me nots to accidentally go through a footnote wormhole. I like to read at the gym while doing my cardio. My first kindle was a great improvement over traditional books, this version is even lighter and more useful.",I have always appreciated the easy ability to change type size and access word definitions;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Amazon got it right here. I have an original Kindle. It was nice to read with, but the buttons were poorly laid out and confusing. 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Doesn't feel better in reading than my old Kindle 3, i.e Kindle keyboard. And what's with the ugly blocky design Amazon? I hate it. Could have been beautiful. For a kindle this price, the resolution could have been better too. The book title covers look so ugly. On the kindle 3, they looked amazing. Amazon could easily subsidize the cost of 'special offers' kindle even more, I am sure they tap into a lot of profit via these ads, this product is literally a handheld billboard with interactivity.Saying all that, its still better for readers who want focus then a shiny iPad.",Meh;;;;;;

I have heard the same comments from other user friends as well.  All in all, I am glad I bought one.",I like it and have gotten used to how it navigates ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I solved a mystery today--a small one but it was entertaining. I hadn't been thinking about it much, having only noticed it a few times before. But it's one of those things that, once you witness it actually happening in front of you, you become more aware of just how many times the thing happened before without your really having taken much notice of it (or, moreover, having any decent explanation of why it happened). My new kindle. I have left it outside before--whether on a table or in the grass I don't know and that doesn't matter--only to return and find that I hadn't read this page, or somehow the font size has changed, or something else is different. Aliens! No. I had it in the grass. Laying there, reading Feynman (of all things). An ant crawled up on it (they apparently appreciate Feynman also) and I watched in amazement, as the thing stepped over letters on the screen. The pages began to turn! The things carry just enough electricity (or whatever the mechanism) that a touchscreen will register their movement as user actions! In the spirit of Feynman, I proved that it's reproducible. (While they're more than willing to lose my page the moment I walk away, it took a frustratingly long time to get a damn one of them onto a blade of grass so I could place him onto the screen.)",Mystery Solved: Why Are My Pages Changing On Their Own?;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I like the idea of 'flipping' thru the pages rather than 'clicking'.  I like the dictionary on this model.  No keyboard on the bottom which was wasted space. Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"This version of the Kindle is light, easy to hold, and easy to read. The features are intuitive and easy to master.  Although the device sometimes seems to get confused between going forward one page and going back one page (tapping the right versus left side of the screen). I wish it had the page turning visual of my previous Kindle, so I could be instantly aware when the page turned the wrong way. Other than that, for less than $100 US, I can carry hundreds of books with me every where I go. At this price I don't really even worry about dropping the device or having it stolen when I take it to the beach or the pool. As advertized, the battery does hold a charge for a very long time. I used it throughout 25 hours of flight and layover time and then read for almost a week before charging. This is the paperback Kindle;" everything you need and not catastrophic if lost or damaged.""
Review: easy to hold and easy to read";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Didn't want a tablet, this was perfect. Plus, the price was right. It's just perfect. I can read outside again, yay!  It's just bad to read at night before sleeping if you don't have a nightstand light.",this was perfect;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Gets the job done. Screen refresh is nice and snappy which I love, but the housing is very flexible and it feels very flimsy as a result. I also don't appreciate the DRM restrictions and the insistence that it be tied to an Amazon account. Adverts for the sleep screen are also annoying. Purchased as a gift for a friend who claims to be clueless about tech (and thus doesn't care about restrictions), and she absolutely loves it.I settled on a Sony PRS-T1 for myself, it feels much sturdier and page refresh rate is almost as good.Both have non-capacitive touchscreens, which was honestly my biggest selling point.",Screen refresh is nice and snappy which I love;;;;;;

Review: I love my Kindle.  I purposely got the one without any back lighting because I didn't want anything to interfere with my sleep cycle since they say blue light can have this effect.  I'm an avid reader and I love the fact that I can look up words immediately.  My two children are home schooled and we use lots of literature-based curriculums.  I plan to get them their own KIndle and buy the books online.  This is probably the best gift I ever bought for myself.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I resisted buying a Kindle for a long time because I could read books on my phone or tablet.  I should have purchased one sooner! It's extremely convenient to be able to define any words you don't recognize by touching the word for a bit.  My only regret is that I didn't get a paperwhite.  The backlit display would definitely be useful in situations where I can't have a light behind me.  I've taken to using an old fashioned book light, and that works fine for me.  At the price I purchased it at, and even the current retail price, a Kindle is a steal for any bookworm.",but sturdy. The e-ink display allows me to read for ...;;;;;;

Review: The print is clear and easy to read.  This senior citizen needs a little more time to get used to it.  So far I am enjoying old books that I had never read and becoming reacquainted with childhood favorites.

Haven't figured out how to archive my books on it. I have some from my old Kendall I want to transfer over. But I do like my new kendall.",its great. Love the touch screen so I can turn ...;;;;;;

This ""new improved"" version is not as intuitively easy to use.  I will get used to it, but miss the ease of my old one, and that pressing a button is definite whereas touching the screen is not.","This ""new improved"" version is not as intuitively easy to use";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"My new Kindle with ads works great!  It is the 7th generation Kindle without a light that usually sells for $79, but I got it for only $29 during a special promotion.  I have used it for about two months.  Very convenient size to take with me.  Battery lasts a long time.",Great Inexpensive Kindle!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have to admit that I was highly opposed to buying a Kindle...old school...love the satisfaction of flipping the pages of a hardcover book.  I never thought that I would get that same satisfaction from an electronic device.  I was totally wrong!  The first book I uploaded was The Game of Thrones Book #1 (yeah, I know...now ancient).  I figured that the enormous paperback had been sitting around way too long - I think it was the number of pages - over 800! - and the extremely fine print deterred me from picking it up time after time.  And, although not the fanciest version of the Kindle, it suits me perfectly.  I have fallen in love with some of its basic features including:  enlarging font, bookmarking pages, online dictionary, and the ability to ""flip"" back and forth between pages.  It not only feels like a ""real"" book, it is so much more convenient!  I highly recommend.",love the satisfaction of flipping the pages of a hardcover ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Really like it although I have hardly learned how to use it.  It fits into my purse so handily that I can take it anytime that I want.  It is smaller than I realized it would be, but 6"" is 6"" so I cannot complain.  In some ways, I would prefer the larger one, but this small one is handy and very readable.",I like my new Kindle;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Love these Kindle for my 'addicted to books' sons.  I bought 2. One bit the dust suddenly after 5 months of use. It will no longer charge enough to stay on..it just shows a blank white unresponsive screen.  We were so upset since we have no more room for books in our house, and the item worked perfectly up until the moment it went blank in my hands  while it said it was 3/4 full of charge. I wish I could exchange it, but no such luck at the moment.",Love these Kindle for my 'addicted to books' sons;;;;;;

Review: Of course this is a perfect Kindle and you can use it for a clock and night light as well as a flashlight in the hostel when traveling. I love my Kindle and it was nice to share the love with my granddaughter.
Title;;;;;;: Of course this is a perfect Kindle and you can use it for a clock ...;;;;;;

Review: The Kindle touch screen is a great reader.I have a Kindle Fire but I needed something to read with when I am outside.The Kindle Touch Screen can be read outside with no glare.I havent used it much yet but I think its a great reader especially for the price
Title;;;;;;: The Kindle touch screen is a great reader. I have a Kindle Fire but I ...;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"The web browser is scary to use, always seeming to want to crash (which it has, but only once).  Wish that it had access to NetGalley as it does with Goodreads... Otherwise it's awesome.  No glare and surprisingly easy to read even with low light.  Battery has lasted almost a week so far on one charge and daily use.",Otherwise it's awesome. No glare and surprisingly easy to read even ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm a Kindle fan. And this little device is always in my list of favorites. I know there are some other models with more features and perhaps better. But living in Venezuela is yeah... some kind of a nightmare. So this one is great and more than enough. The experience of the glare-free screen is really awesome. Responsive, quick, light and useful. Love my Kindle! :-)",Great device!;;;;;;

Review: This has been one of the best gifts I have ever received. Books are so much cheaper and easy to read with this. I read a few books a month and thought I would hate it since I love real books so much. But I have found that I love it very much.
Title;;;;;;: This has been one of the best gifts I have ever received;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I still enjoy reading books, but I will say as someone who travels from California to Chicago as often as I do it is very comforting to know that I have a large variety of books available to me at my finger tips.The kindle is lighter than the majority of the books I read, and doesn't take up too much space. And space is quite a commodity if you are riding a flight with Spirit or Frontier. Trust me you will want that kindle, with your ziplock bag of a carryon.The kindle is also excellent in the sense that it has its own light source. How irritating is it when your seat mate turns on the overhead light and you can't have you 4 hour nap? Luckily the amount of light and lack of glare make the kindle low key, comfortable, and polite. It's guess it's the kind of product you want your kids to grow up to be like, simple, efficient and full of knowledge.Overall, I'd say it's the best part of my flight! I also like that this product looks and feels sturdy, whereas when I'm using an iPad there is this thought that you potentially break the glass.I love my kindle, I can't wait to buy one for my boyfriend, he reads off of his phone and I feel like I am going to change his life for the better.",This Kindle keeps me kind;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love my Kindle!  I mainly use it at night since I work on computers all day long it is nice to come home and read comics books, books or magazines on the Kindle with having to strain my eyes any more than I have too.  I also like the Kindle unlimited, I do wish they had comic books on the unlimited but it could be that I haven't found them yet.",Love my Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This replaces my Kindle3 Keyboard edition that fritzed. I really like the touchscreen, and the ability to keep track of the words I look up. I had originally purchased the Kindle Fire to replace the old Kindle, but found I usually played games on it instead of reading. This new one encourages me to be less distracted. Really glad my wife gave this to me for Christmas :)",I really like the touchscreen;;;;;;

Review: Light weight. I can hold it and flip pages in one hand. Nice for reading when the weather is cold! Easy on the eyes. I like this better than the back-lit models. My daughter bought this for my b8rthday and told me she is getting me a case with a small light so I can read without any other light source.

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"purchase was in response to your website showing various kindle readers ....... purchased this as a gift ........ have reviewed the web pages a couple of times and I cannot see where the advertisement told me there would be no color on this reader ...... hence the disappointment for no color ....... I offered to return this device for one in color ........ recipient said this one is ok, can live with it ....... I, however, am disappointed",hence the disappointment for no color;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Functionality is spot on for a ""refurbished"" unit. I upgraded from a gen. 2 so the additional features are really impressive. The two designations for storage, cloud vs. device, is a welcomed addition and the store ribbon at the bottom of the screen is nice but could possibly be annoying for some. The touchscreen locations for changing pages can sometimes make one-handed use a bit cumbersome but becomes easier with time. All in all a very well organized reader with great functionality and usability making it the best dedicated reader on the market.",Gen. 7 Refurbished Unit: Best Dedicated Reader on the Market;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm hoping this will save you some frustration and trouble when it's time for you to synch up your new Kindle with your home Wi-Fi service.During this process,  right after you select your applicable Wi-Fi provider from the list displayed on the Kindle's screen,  it's going to ask you to type in the ""password"" from your Wi-Fi setup.  Now,  I had made specific note of such a password at the time I installed my Wi-Fi service a few years ago, and was glad to see that I had saved that information,  but when I typed the password into the Kindle as prompted,  it rejected it.  Eventually,  I figured out that what the Kindle was looking for (even though it used the word ""password"") was actually a ten-digit number shown on a sticker right across the side of my Wi-Fi router unit,  designated on the sticker as ""Network Key"",  rather than the password that I had written down.  When I typed the Network Key number into the Kindle,  it was accepted instantly,  and all was well from there.  I hope this will save some of my fellow Kindle-reading friends some head-scratching at the time of setup !!  Beyond that,  the unit performs really well,  and I'm really enjoying it!",A Helpful Tip Regarding Set-Up;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Perfect for traveling. I got the good folks at my library to explain how to download their e-books and it's FABULOUS!Easy to use, easy to read, easy to get new books, way better than carrying the books I want to read in my suitcase! Why did I wait so long?",Perfect for traveling;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've always had 2 Kindles, a Fire and a regular one. My older one die and I was disappointed that the kind I had was no longer available. So reluctantly I ordered this one. Glad to say I am extremely happy with. It is lighter weight than my older one and easy to read at the beach.",My older one die and I was disappointed that the kind I had was no longer available;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"The gadget is ok, but the pages often jump to some sections when touching the screen a little faster. The on/off power button sometimes is not working properly. When I turn off the button, it often still turns on so that it just instructs ""Swipe to unlock Kindle"".","The gadget is ok, but the pages often jump ...";;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"even this replacement kept freezing up.  would not swipe, spent hours with tech support,  even did factory reset.  will not buy another kindle for at least a year till they improve it.  I loved my original kindle with the keyboard, page turns with just a touch of your thumb at the sides and no swiping!",HATE THIS KINDLE;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"It's a Kindle, what kind of review do you need. It's really, really great at one thing, and that's why you get it. Super long battery life even with heavy use, performs well in climates I'd consider ""extreme"" eg: Jungles during rainy season, and High altitude mountains during winter. Just pair it up with pelican style case, and you should be able to bring it everywhere, the low glare screen is what makes it superior to a tablet for reading, and that's probably the reason why you're considering getting one in the first place",Really great at what it does;;;;;;

Review: does all I expected of it and more. touchscreen is nice. password protection is great. light to carry and good battery life. the only minor drawback for me is a slow start and power off. easier to navigate than previous version
Title;;;;;;: touchscreen is nice. password protection is great;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Not at all a bad e reader. Having owned several kindles in the past, this was comparable to one of my earliest models. The features are cool, but reading is reading for the most part. I returned mine ONLY because I do need a backlight. I read in the dark-- often until I pass out. Reaching to shut off my lamp is annoying. So lazy-- I know! If you don't mind needing a light on to read at night, this kindle is perfectly acceptable. I am ordering another paper white so I can have my back light back. (my last one had a pixel go out and I couldn't get past looking at it). All are on sale right now, so the deals are good.",Not bad but not for me;;;;;;

Review: Yes it is glaire free little too sensitive changes font sizes but just a slight touch which I have to keep on changing I'm not sure I would buy it again but all in all it's not a bad reader I bought it to read on the beach and seems to be fine like that I'm having trouble syncing it to my other devices

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Love my kindle paperwhite. It is exactly what I wanted - something that I can use just for books. I have my computer, my smart phone, I didn't need another one size fits all device. Just one to make my life as an avid book reader easier.One thing I must note - I got bad intel from the Staples salesman, who assured me that the screen did light - something I wanted because I travel a lot at night, in airplanes and also read in bed at night. When I got it charged, I realized there was no light. A bit annoying, but I""m living with it.",Love my kindle paperwhite;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"The device works fairly well and is easy on the eyes.  Page turns have a bit of lag, and navigation outside of reading has even more lag.  The lack of a built in light is a bummer.  The navigating the screens and menus are fairly easy, and battery life is awesome.  Bough it during national reading week at good discount, so it was worth what I paid for it.  Full price would be a bit of stretch.","good, but not great";;;;;;

Review: My Christmas present from my husband. I LOVE it! Reading more now that I have all my books with me all the time. I almost got the one with the light and am glad that I did not. It would have defeated the purpose of not staring at a glowing rectangle! This is perfect and my eyes feel like I am reading paper. Great purchase.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"There was a bit of confusion about the kids bundle protection plan but once that was figured out it went smoothly. When you get the email about your promo code start with the protection plan listed on the Amazon site, not at the SquareTrade website. That is where the confusion came. The email I received made it sound like everything needed to be done with SquareTrade. I actually added the 2 year protection plan to my cart on Amazon and used the promo code there instead. Worked fine you just have to do each protection plan separately if you have purchased more than one Kindle. The kids are each going to love their Kindle! Excited for the birthdays to roll around in a few months!",Advice on activating the kids bundle protection plan;;;;;;

Review: This model is definitely a retrograde step by amazon. There are no intuitive buttons and everything is so much more complicated. Why do companies have to try to improve and make a product worse. The early versions of Kindle were so much better

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Great for learning Spanish! I really appreciate the ability to quickly translate a word on the fly, and store the words automatically for future review.In the past, this feature was not well implemented.  For some books it was not even possible to select an appropriate dictionary. (An English-to-Spanish dictionary is not much use for reading Grandes Esperanzas!).  However there has been a lot of improvement, and it is really useful now.For the first time I prefer kindle books to physical books.",Improved features for language learners;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I received mine as a Christmas present and it's great.  I was dubious at first whether I would enjoy using an e-reader or not but it has thoroughly won me over in just the first several weeks.  I use it for pleasure reading and also convert work documents to kindle format and save both my eyes from LCD-induced stress and trees from being turned into printer paper.  I would like to see a little more customization possibilities on the system level (especially regarding power saving features, wifi sleep options, etc.) but I'm sure these will come in future generations and everything essential is already included.  The battery lasts me about 2 weeks with about 1.5-2 hours of reading per day (I read fairly fast and I suspect all these extra page turns per hour are responsible for the slightly shorter battery life than others report). The free dictionaries which are included are a huge added bonus and many classic out-of-copyright books can be downloaded for free from either Amazon directly or from third party collections such as Project Gutenberg.  Works well with Linux (I'm using the Calibre e-book manager). Would highly recommend to others.",Won me over;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Works great, however I liked the style and size of my previous generation Kindle ""Touch"" better. Previous version is thinner (this model is a bit thicker and clunker looking). Also the plastic on this model looks cheaper. The on/off button on my previous model quit working, so I needed to replace. Otherwise this works great and gets the job done.","Meets expectations, but liked the previous model better";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is easy to use even for an older person who is not totally computer knowledgeable.  I did not think I would like it as I love books so much, however, it is so light and easy to use that I find myself enjoying it.",This is easy to use even for an older person who is ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"My wife really likes it for reading her books. Personally, I would have liked to see a couple more capabilities built in like sound and extra memory. Not all of us fully believe in the cloud as an answer for storage.",I would have liked to see a couple more capabilities built in like ...;;;;;;

Review: I have had this certified refurbished kindle for about 2 weeks.  I used it on the beach in The Bahamas and the screen was easy to read.  I also have a kindle app on my iPad.  At nights I read on the iPad and during the day I read on the kindle.  The two of them kept in sync nicely.  . I also bought the Elsse case for $9.29 and it works fine (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00O4S6POY?psc=1&redirect=true&ref_=oh_aui_detailpage_o00_s00)

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"The one and only reason I bought this reader was to read PDF's. Yes it has a PDF reader.  Huge disappointment and actually misleading by saying it works with PDF's. You can't increase the font size to make the PDF readable. It's like taking a PDF article, shrinking it down by 60% and printing it. And I missed the return window so now I'm stuck with it.",Kindles DO NOT WORK WITH PDF's;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Sturdy yet lightweight construction. Ideal gift for seniors or handicapped individuals that find holding books to be difficult. Great ""hybrid"" for those less tech savvy.  Makes borrowing books from your local library a breeze!",The perfect present;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Completely met my expectations. I wasn't looking for a top-of-the line tablet, just a cheap e-reader to see how often I'd use one. Obviously it feels a little cheap because it's pretty much made of plastic, but putting it in a cover makes it seem nicer. I actually like that it doesn't have a backlight because I read a lot before bed and it's easier to fall asleep when you aren't staring into the light for a long period. I got the ""special offers"" one, which is annoying just because the principle of the thing, but honestly it doesn't really bother me that much, maybe because there isn't color or sound. I think it's a good buy if you read the description & know what to expect.I'm also very pleased with Amazon's customer service... I ordered this for the $79 price, and a couple days after it was delivered, it was on sale for $59. I called them to see if I could have the difference refunded instead of returning and purchasing a new one, and the service representative credited $20 back to me with absolutely no hassle. Simple things like that go a long way.",Read the Product Description;;;;;;

Review: Honestly I was skeptical I thought It would be my next cup holder (like my Ipad 3) but this has turned into my most adored and appreciated gadget! All reviews and videos describe this perfectly. Great screen and easy to read. Made for reading.
Title;;;;;;: Great screen and easy to read;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"The Kindle was exactly as described and what I expected.Although it doesn't have a backlight, this was stated in the description therefore I was not expecting that feature to be there.As an older person, I am not too savvy about electronic things, but I was able to charge the Kindle, follow the instructions on the screen, and download books!My Kindle was slated for delivery in February, the date was moved to December.I am very pleased with my Kindle and Amazon.Thank you",I am very pleased with my Kindle and Amazon;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is light and easy to fit in my purse... I can take it with me to read in the waiting room at the doctor or waiting in line at the post office, or any other time I get a minute. I love that I don't have to charge it often and it's easy to use. Great little reader!",This is light and easy to fit in my purse;;;;;;

Review: As an E-reader there was not anything wrong with this device.  I had had a Kindle Fire first and never was quite happy because I could do much more with the kindle fire so when it was reduced and I was able to return and order that I did.  It held a charge much longer then the Fire I had had did.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Just missing my ""page turner"" feature I have on my iPhone Kindle app... :( other than that it's great, already downloaded a great Amazon book and an eBook from the library...can't wait to curl up and read!","( other than that it's great, already downloaded a great Amazon book and an ...";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"My eyes get tired really fast because of the display lights and this Kindle was perfect for me. I feel like I am reading on a paper. This is my first kindle and I totally recommend it. It is easy to use it and the touch screen is good. Be aware that this Kindle has no built-in light, so you can't read it on the dark.",... fast because of display lights and this Kindle was perfect for me;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This seems to be a good reader, but I liked my classic with the buttons better. (I broke the screen on the classic, so no going back. I would suggest NOT just tossing it in the car and then kneeling on it while packing for a trip :(. ) The 7th generation is really light and that is actually a negative for me, but probably a positive for most. The case for the classic plugged into my kindle and had a built-in light that worked extremely well. I'm still trying to find a good reading light for the new 7th gen one. I am beginning to get used to the touchscreen, but I really liked the tactile page buttons and home button on the classic. Still love the non-backlit screen.",Would like built in light... but good for reading.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I don't know why I didn't buy one of these sooner. The ads are very unobtrusive, but I love this Kindle already. Between its light weight and glare-free screen, I can read for much longer than I can on my tablet or my phone, which I'm thrilled with.",but I love this Kindle already;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I got tired of reading on the Kindle App for Android, so I decided to purchase the basic Kindle when it went on sale.  I love that you can select your font type and size;" reading seems a lot easier when you don't have to read small print.  Reading is also easier when there isn't a backlight shining in your eyes.  Battery life is good.  As a light reader
Review: this is perfect for me.""

Rating: 2.0 out of 5 stars,"I am probably the only person in America, who got my kindle, with no back light. It was given to me as a gift, and I had to return it. I read in bed, and travel a lot internationally, so reading in the dark wasn't possible. My friend ordered one for herself and one for me, and hers had the paperwhite but mine didn't. Hopefully, once they get the return, she can repurchase it. I loved the kindle , after years, of going back and forth, because I love to hold a book, so I was so disappointed , I had to return it. But Amazon, was so great about itso I am looking foreword, to really enjoying it in the future.",I loved the kindle;;;;;;

Review: its not as great as a thought it was going to be because1- dosent support arabic book very good2- dosent have a head phone jack3- dosent have audible . idont know how a proudct by a company that dosent support it servicesbut never the less its a good device if you were into books you MUST buy the 7th gen kindleREVIEW BY : Abdullah albahouth @abdallalh187
Title;;;;;;: its not as great as a thought it was going to be because ...;;;;;;

Review: Kindle was great except the language set on it when I received it was Spanish.  Had a little trouble setting it up as I don't read Spanish to read the instructions.  A call to tech support set it all straight and it works fine.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Love it. Easy to read, battery lasts a long time when on airplane mode.Only thing I dislike is I paid for my lockscreen to be without ads, and every time I lock it, the picture changes. I would like to choose ONE wallpaper, and keep it. Not having random pictures as my lockscreen.. It's a tad annoying but I'm super picky.And I wished it had a screen brightness option, I know the paperwhite does.....but it's so much more expensive. Sucks... But if you only read in the day, where there is light, you'll enjoy it. :)Otherwise, it's great!! Can carry it everywhere.","Great, two things though.......";;;;;;
4.0 out of 5 stars,"It seemed easy enough to get started;" however
Review: I can not figure out how to get ordered books on both Kindle's that we own. I can not figure out how to transfer a book from one Kindle to the other Kindle. Is that possible?Since both Kindles are  on the same account
Title;;;;;;: how do I know that a book my wife orders will go to her Kindle and not mine?""
column4: It seemed easy enough to get started";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"As an Apple fan, I was nervous purchasing a Kindle. I read a lot of reviews about a lot of e-readers and was debating between this and the Barnes and Noble Glowlight and tested a lot out at different stores. The Glowlight is constructed horribly, looking childish. You can also easily remove the grey rubber ""band"" that goes around the device that is supposed to protect it.Once I received my Kindle, there was no debate. This perfect little piece of technology is wonderful. I got the $79 version ""with special offers"" and honestly I like it better than not having them. Every time I ""sleep"" the Kindle I get new book recommendations, suggestions for Kindle covers, etc. And the barely 1/2 inch advertisement bar at the bottom of the screen is no bother to me and continues to offer suggestions of books which is pretty neat. I also chose the basic Kindle because I already have a laptop and a smartphone. I got this simply for reading. Having all those notifications for Facebook, email, and so on would just be distracting and not necessary. It honestly helps me stay focused on my book and let's me really submerse myself in the story.It's so easy to read off the screen and the e-ink technology is great. No glare, light weight, solid plastic construction that fits great in your hand, and a simply clean design with millions of books at my fingertips. It's my book-lover's dream and I'm very happy I bought it.","The Glowlight is constructed horribly, looking childish";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"perfect for reading at night since it doesn't have a backlight and won't affect my sleep. I download free books from Project Gutenberg, and they work great on this.",perfect for reading at night since it doesn't have a ...;;;;;;

Review: Having issues with this Kindle. Half the screen is very lite. I can hardly read it and the bottom half is fine. This started a couple weeks after I got it. Am I doing something wrong in the settings? I had my first Fire Kindle for 5 years and never had a problem. Please advise. Kathy
Title;;;;;;: I can hardly read it and the bottom half is fine. This started a couple weeks after I got ...;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"My old Kindle finally died and I got the newest version just recently.  My only complaint is that is is a touch screen.  That is not a complaint against the design, just my personal preference is for the original design with the keyboard and page forward and back as keys.I have noticed that this new Kindle locks up on occasion and has to be reset.","RIP Old Kindle, Long live New one";;;;;;

Review: Its very user friendly...a great joy for book lovers like me... I prefer books to e-books..but kindle transforms e-books to normal books!! Its so easy to read... and does not strain my eyes!! Its like carrying my book collection around in my pocket!!
Title;;;;;;: a great joy for book lovers like me;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I haven't had mine long yet -- still need to figure out the best way to navigate it. But I like the size and was particularly happy when it was easy to read outside in bright sunlight! I also have an older Kindle Fire which I am quite fond of, but decided to get an additional Kindle to function more as a book.",Great so far;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Returned it for the Paperwhite. It's nice but I have to have a built-in backlight for reading.  (Tip: if you have an IPhone, the plug-in charger part will work with the adapter, you do not have to buy it separately)",It's nice but I have to have a built-in backlight for ...;;;;;;

Review: I love my kindle!! It's amazing the antiglare and also the touch screen is enough for reading in less than a week I was able to read 4 books in a row!! I'm very happy with it. But I hope the Internet browser would work better.

Rating: 2.0 out of 5 stars,"As a reading tool, it's much lighter than holding a real book.  At my age, this is important because I am developing issues in my joints, particularly my left elbow, which cause pain when reading.  However, I purchased this for my sons to read and in less than 24 hours and before I was able to figure out how to set parental controls, one of my boys (both under 15) were able to download SAMPLE pornography.  I was not impressed to discover this filth is both so prevalent and so easy to obtain.",Disgusted;;;;;;

Review: Its awesome for what I wanted it for. I can take it outside this summer and read. I couldn't read on my tablet outside. This is just what the doctor  ordered. Its an old saying that my mother used to say. I love it.
Title;;;;;;: Its awesome for what I wanted it for;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I haven't really had a chance to use it much, but so far I would rate it a strong 4 to 4.5 stars. I do like how easy it is to download my books from Amazon onto the Kindle. It is very easy to navigate and adjusting the settings is very straight forward. I will have to update my review as I get to use it more.",I'm glad I bought it!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"It's the perfect size & very light. It's easy to use and the touch-screen response is much faster than my previous Kindle Touch. My old one would freeze up or lag terribly, but this one doesn't at all. The only ""issue"" I've had with it is that sometimes I will accidentally move it or brush something that unintentionally changes the font size. It's easy enough to correct by touching to top of the screen, selecting font size, then going about my business, but the accidental changes indicate that there is some sort of font short cut that I'm unaware of but keep triggering on accident. No big deal!Anyway, I love my Kindle! It does exactly what I want it to do without any frivolities. I wasn't looking for yet another tablet or a device that could do things my iPhone and iPad can already do. I just wanted something that could mimic the book experience. I still love good 'ole fashioned books, but the ease and convenience of this device makes it perfect for travel or extreme in-bed-all-Sunday laziness. If I finish a book, I can buy its sequel and have it downloaded to my device in seconds. It's like magic!",Easy and Up-to-date without Unnecessary Features....It's Perfect!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I really like my e-reader...so far I have read three books and still need to learn how to access books to put on it.  (Grandson set this up for me)  I still have a lot to learn about using it.  (I'm over seventy and way behind learning about this new ""fangled"" technology. Ha!)",I really like my e-reader;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this for my 87 year old Dad who reads several hours a day. I had loaned him my old Kindle 2010  a year ago. He was having trouble seeing the buttons so I hopped online, read the reviews, and decided to go with the 6"" Glare- free unit. It was delivered promptly, I downloaded tons of books, and played with it for a couple of days. I'm glad to say he has mastered the touch screen - the ""tap"" and ""swipe""! He's only called once for instructions.  At first he thought that it was too small, but the screen size is the same, and it is lighter than my old one. Thanks, Amazon!",Bought for dear old Dad;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"You can't wrong with this litter Kindle. Personally speaking for me the experience was like reading a regular book (but even better) since is not that heavy, I don't have wait a week for the delivery of my books, I was able to personalize my reading experience. I paid 49.00 in Black Friday... so I'm more than happy !!!!",Personally speaking for me the experience was like reading a regular book (but even better) since is ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"It's a very great product. As mentioned in the product's description, it doesn't have a backlight but a purchasing a separate clip light will do the trick. Have had no problems using it for the most part, except when utilizing the dictionary function where when you tap and hold a word, it shows you the meaning of that word. Sometimes it would give you a separate word instead of the one intended. In one instance, I think the word I tapped was mended, but I received the definition for the noun Mende.",Great.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have had a Kindle for some time and have been very happy with it, I just got a new one for Christmas. my only small problem with the old Kindle was the lack of a backlit screen. in bright light the old kindle screen is easier to see than the type of screen on a laptop or a tablet but in the dark you needed a reading light. The new Paperwhite solves this problem with a screen that is as visible in sunlight as the old one and has a variable backlight meaning I can read in bed without putting on my bedside lamp....a few points about Kindles in general, first they are better for books that you read through from beginning to end than for books that you leaf forwards and back in like reference books, second the browser is pretty useless for anything other than shopping for kindle books, if you want to browse the internet get a tablet if you want to read books get a kindle.",Like the old one only better;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Good~ I received the e-book. It's nice screen. It is more comfortable than other tablets.I was satisfied. I love it.But, It cannot be used as the device to read the research paper or thesis.It will need larger screen than kindle.Anyway, It is good.",It's nice screen. It is more comfortable than other tablets;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I do like the kindle. I didn't realize when I bought it I could not read at night. At the time I didn't know to look for a kindle reader that had a light. Shame on me, but shame on you for having a kindle without a light. Again more money, I just don' t get it. But I do love the kindle this is my second one. But I don't think I will b e buying another one.That is the reason I gave it a 4 star.",Somewhat happy!!;;;;;;

Review: This kindle is what i expected. I can download books easily and read them. The dictionary is a little advanced to me but i bought a learner's dictionary and it is compatible with the kindle and it works without wifi. I am really happy with this purchase. It was delivered on time.
Title;;;;;;: I can download books easily and read them;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I wish I could use my audible books on it but oh well-- my fault for getting the basic model. Also it gets nearly impossible to read it in very dim light, keep in mind when you buy it, it doesn't have a backlight. Battery lasts pretty well too.",Pretty Good -- IGN;;;;;;

Review: I really enjoy this device! love the no-glare screen. Since I already have a tablet I can use that in the dark. This ereader is perfect for outside and has a super long lasting battery. Easily fits in my purse. Compact and lightweight.  Simple and to the point technology.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Handy size, easy reading Kindle 6"" Glare-Free is a great device for having reading material at hand. It is indeed an easy reading screen on which one can adjust text size, keep ones place bookmarked, and take a break from reading with the place you left off from immediately available upon return to the text. No backlight with this Kindle, but the screen is easy to read with a normal amount of light.","Satisfied with Kindle 6"" Glare-Free";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is really what I wanted in a digital reader. Just a way to read books!  The kindle is a convenient way to access books without dealing with staying connected to the world as is the case with the Kindle app on a tablet. It helps separate work and leisure time.  It is easy to read, though I have had a small problem reading titles on bookcovers. I love the size and weight.",It is easy to read;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought this for a gift. My mom (who was already familiar with Amazon) had it working in 15 minutes, Super simple. I know she has also raved about the battery life. As someone who will use it specifically for reading, this was a great price option for her!!",Gift for someone else;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Printed instructions need to be included with the Kindle to assist the purchaser in getting  things set up.  Since the instructions are only in the Kindle itself, they are not accessible to the first-time user of the product.  Instructions are no good if they are not where someone can see them beforehand!  Someone goofed in not having the instructions where they are easily accessible when the product is removed from its shipping container.  Otherwise, things seem satisfactory.",Instructions are no good if they are not where someone can see them ...;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I just replaced my older Kindle (version 3 w/keyboard), and here are the pros/cons from that perspective:ProsThe touch screen is intuitive and makes navigating much easierthe contrast appears to be sharper and the image quality is betterit's smaller, but not too smallNot too bright so it doesn't hurt your eyes (always good with the basic Kindle models)ConsIt doesn't feel as well made. It has flimsier material that feels cheap and easily breakable. I understand that lighter is better but not if it results in a shorter product life.Slightly thickernot likely to last as long with all the screen touching, especially if it is e-ink.It is too small for a generation 3 cover (to be expected, but now I have to make some alterations to my leather case)If you are looking for something simple that you don't care about kicking around, this works. I am a little bummed at this new Kindle. It's not as solid as the older ones, but it's not awful.*Also, I went from no ads to ads because I thought I wouldn't mind and well, I do. That's my own fault though. If anyone out there is thinking about going with the special offers and has been without it, know this: Besides the screensaver, the ads are a bottom banner even on your home page.",Eh.;;;;;;

Review: This was a replacement for my older generation Kindle.  I love this one as much as the version I had previously.  Easy to use and easy on the eyes while reading during the day.  Not easy to find a lighted cover to fit it for night reading however.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Like the screen, a bit too much tech stuff for this senior to absorb i.e. page numbers, timing how fast you read, etc., a bit much for this senior reader.Still not sure how I get the book to the cloud when I am finished with it. Disappointed that when I asked to remove the promotional items I had to pay over $20 for that to happen. As an octogenarian I'm pretty much aware of what I like to read so reading suggestions are not appreciated and certainly not needed yet I had to pay to have them disappear. Bad policy!!The cord could have been a bit longer when charging the book. The help I received from Gavin and a woman I spoke to the day before I spoke to Gavin were helpful and very patient with this senior's concerns.",Like the screen;;;;;;

Review: I couldn't see my iPad to read outdoors. This little thing works like a charm. It holds its charge for a really long time. You can buy books on it and look up words in the dictionary. It's lightweight and easy to hold. I love it!

Great size. Just so confusing as there are so many with so many accessories.  I ordered a case and it didn't fit. Ordered another style and it fit.Also when I got the Kindle Fire I have my regular Kindle away. Had I known I could not read on the fire I wouldn't have given it away.This new Kindle I got is perfect for reading outside. Especially on the beach.

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"It's fine.  I bought this because I had to replace my 2nd generation kindle (the one with the full keyboard), which I LOVED. I don't like this kindle for a few reasons.  I don't think this kindle holds a charge as long.  Also, I accidentally hit the screen and skip a few pages forward.  The menu is also super sensitive and pops up when you don't need it.  I wish they still made the original with the keyboard and hard buttons to turn pages.  But, this one is good enough.",It's ok;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I was reluctant to get a Kindle since I Have an IPhone six plus, but it was on sale and I was going to be traveling for hours. I bought a nice light but sturdy case for it and downloaded a bunch of books from my library and it's great! Because it looks like a regular page. You need light to read it as it's not backlit, so the eyestrain isn't there...",I finally did it. And I like it!;;;;;;

Review: I love this kindle. I love that it doesn't do movies so my kids don't want to take it from me (yet).  It's great that I can carry so many books with me and read it while the sun is shining super bright. And it is even better when it costs so little.

Amazing!! Feels like reading a paper book. I'm not much of a reader so I ordered this model but now I can't put it down and have been reading nonstop! Makes me wish I ordered the backlight model now heh. You will not be disappointed..
Title;;;;;;: Amazing!! Feels like reading a paper book;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first ""real"" kindle, previously I was using a first Gen kindle fire. I recieved this as a Christmas present and have been using it a lot since receiving it. I have noticed a significant reduction in eye strain and the reading experience, so far, has been great. It is like reading newspaper print. My version has the advertisements, and I have to say they don't bother me at all, which is something I was worried about (they are nonexistent when reading). I haven't experienced any cons. It is a great lightweight little kindle and I like that it doesn't have back lights (it makes the experience much closer to reading print).","Great little device, Ads don't detract from experience";;;;;;

Review: Touch screen responsiveness is not 100% but it's good for what it's designed for: reading ebooks. Battery life is good too.Only real complaint is that zooming does not work to well so larger books(such as textbooks) might need to be split up and read horizontally.
Title;;;;;;: Touch screen responsiveness is not 100% but it's good for what it's designed for;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"A great new design, this basic Kindle is actually far from basic.  It is super light (so much easier than trying to read from my iPad!) and can be held and operated (pages turned) in one hand.  A total win.",New design is light and a breeze to use--A WIN!;;;;;;

Review: The pages in this do not have a light so to read at night you need a book light.  I also bought a cover for it because it is small and I kept touching the screen which brought up menu pages while I was holding it.
Title;;;;;;: Spend the money and upgrade from this version;;;;;;

Review: Fantastic way to read!  I don't like using a tablet as reader because of the LCD screen and backlight that cause eyestrain and effects sleep.  But the kindle makes easy and friendly to read a book in bed or at any time.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I've been wanting a Kindle (or an e-reader) for a while, so when the price went down to $64 I finally got one! I've bought a lot of e-books on Amazon before and all the books synced nicely with this one. This reader is very basic and at first I was looking for a button to make the screen lit up, then realized this version does not have that function :) It's nice and light and it's been working well so far. It is touch screen and the screen can be quite sensitive, and I find the fonts increase or decrease in size with the slightest touch which can be a bit annoying. Overall I'm happy with the reader for basic reading needs (books only).",Good value;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought 2 at xmas sale because of the great price ($59/ea) that day. It's just the basic reader but is an awesome device for what it is.Easy to see text, dead simple UI/controls, and so much easier to control than a book - no creases in the spine, built in bookmark, multiple device sync, one touch page turns...Thought about getting the Fire or the other 'advanced' devices, but I just want the reader - I've got a laptop/tablet for internet and movies and such.Still learning all the extra tools & options like dictionary, highlighting and look-up/reference aids but honestly what makes this awesome is the Unlimited account I got with it - so many books that I already read and love are free or available at low kindle pricing.",Excellent Basic E-Reader. No need for advanced features.;;;;;;

Review: I received this Kindle as a gift from my husband and I absolutely love it! I can't believe it's taken me so long to join the Kindle family. It's truly lightweight and easy enough to carry around in a bag. I love that the screen is glare-free and that it's soft on the eyes. This is great for someone who works a long day in the office (especially if you're staring into the computer screen all day) and wants to unwind with a book in the evening. Paper books are great too but this beats it by a mile with its slim design and feather-weight touch!

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this Kindle in order to expand my reading horizon.  These days, some books are only available electronically, and I wouldn't want to miss out on them.  I enjoy having the choice of all the many text features, from font type and size, line spacing, margin area, and portrait or landscape mode. These make the reading flow well.  Also, the non-glare screen is kind to the eyes.  I've also used the ''experimental browser'' for basic functions such as e-mail and looking at some online only news publications.  It works well for this.  There are still features I'm looking forward to using, such as the dictionary, highlighting and social network sharing of what I've read on my Kindle.  In this basic Kindle, I don't know if it might be possible to have a contrast feature for darkening/lightening screen and/or text.  I'm generally not very adept with tech, but have had no difficulty using this Kindle.  All in all, I'm very happy with it.","Happy with Easy-on-the-Eyes, Easy to Use, Multi-Featured ''Basic'' Kindle";;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"The old kindle touch was much better - if only it didn't die after only 2 years.  I was told that everything on my old kindle would be saved and could be downloaded but my favorite game - everyword crossings - was not and now isn't even at the kindle store.  Also, the old touch had 3g and this one only has wi-fi and it can't be turned off.  Ugh!!!!",Not as good as the old one;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I find it more complicated to use than my earlier Kindle which died.  I probably should have purchased a Kindle Reader instead when all I want to do is use my Kindle for reading novels.  In addition, my books on the new Kindle are scrambled and I had them all in collections on my old one.  The thought of redoing my collections is overwhelming for me.Not a good purchase for me.",Not a good purchase for me;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"My wife got me this for a surprise gift and I just love it!  I had used her older version and problems with the buttons on the sides always getting pressed inadvertently and losing my place, but since this one has the touchscreen its not a problem.  My wife also made me a custom alpaca wool cover for it too, which makes it even better!  Thanks Honey!!!",First Kindle for me and I love it!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I never write reviews, but I'm so happy with my Kindle that it definitely deserves one.I resisted buying a Kindle for years, partly because I prefer reading books the ""old-fashioned way"" and partly because I just enjoy collecting books (especially attractive hardcover editions or out of print/antique books.) Recently, I got a Kindle as a birthday present for my boyfriend - he loved it, and I saw first-hand why. Since getting one for myself, I too have been loving it: it's *perfectly* suited for light reading, or reading in bed! I love that I can get all those novels, ""guilty"" reads and general history books I don't necessary want to burden my bookshelves with at a lower price - I save room, and apparently, I also gobble them up at half the speed and wrist pain (when reading in a reclined position.)So, if you're an avid reader and/or you love the real thing, but would rather stop hoarding paperbacks you end up selling at garage sales a year later (while saving up for beautiful editions of things you want to hold on to for life), invest in a Kindle. Couldn't recommend it more!",Love my new Kindle!;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"what I am frustrated is the warranty setup. I have spent several hours to activate the warranty, with many calls to Squaretrade. They have no  understanding of how it work and online registration for warranty should not that difficult.  If amazon giving coupond why it should not automatically ask squaretrade setup the warranty. Why sending an email with additional discount code to me and make me go through this headache. Totally unhappy with Amazon on this.",what I am frustrated is the warranty setup. I ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've had a second-generation kindle for years and enjoyed it, but the touch screen makes for a much smoother reading experience. I find myself more willing to switch between books and search within a book because the navigation is easier and the rate at which the pages load is quicker. I bought the version with ads, and the ads aren't distracting at all. I'm actually glad I didn't spend the extra money for no ads. I use a case, so I don't really see what's on the screen when I'm not reading anyway.",Touch Screen Makes a Big Difference;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Worth It.This was 100% worth purchasing and I have no regrets about my choice of model. The ads are really not a big deal at all and it saved me a lot of money to go with this version. I've already recommended this to a couple of friends, as I've been very happy with this purchase.",I've already recommended this to a couple of friends;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I was rather disappointed that there is no Text-to-Speech on Kindle anymore. Since my previous Kindle surprisingly came with Text-to-Speech, I didn't check that Kindle no longer has this feature and assumed that it would be a given functionality for all Kindle. Text-To-Speech should be considered to be reinstated, please.",I was rather disappointed that there is no Text-to-Speech on Kindle anymore;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I am enjoying the Kindle very much.  I understand there are Kindles and Fires with much many more apps, but just for reading this is all I need.The Kindle has nice, sharp, black lettering on a white background.  This makes for a good contrast and easy reading.  My eyes are not what they used to be, so it irritates me when there is very little contrast between the lettering and the background.",Beats the choice of grayed out lettering on your websight and emails!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this after my first kindle stopped holding a charge and it seems to be working great. I like the features it comes with like the book information and average read time. This item is enjoyable to use. As long as this one does not have the problem that my first had, it will be a great item.",I like it.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I wanted it for what it was originally meant to be, to be able to read the books I want, without having to use valuable space in my small apartment.  As such, I am already totally satisfied with my purchase.....thank you",I am already totally satisfied with my purchase;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had an earlier Kindle model, which worked flawlessly for several years. I dropped it recently, while on an exercise machine. I replaced it with the new Kindle.  This one is much lighter, and simple to use. I was initially concerned about the ads, but they have not been a problem, as they only display, when the kindle is resting. Everything is good.  No negative, so far.",Everything is good!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Kindle, 6"" Glare-Free Touchscreen Display, Wi-Fi - Includes Special OffersI love this smaller Kindle because of it light weight. I can now read in bed without my hands going numb. I like to put it in my purse so I can read where ever I am. It doesn't have a built in light but I usually read with a light on in the room. If you want a light, you can order a clip-on light.  It is truly glare free and easy on the eyes.",Great buy!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had a book size Kindle previously and was hesitant of getting a smaller Kindle. Because the larger Kindle was cumbersome when traveling I purchased the 6"" Touchscreen. It was easy to set up. All of books were carried over immediately. Reading is now more enjoyable and comfortable. This Kindle, for the price, is a bargain.",It was easy to set up;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my second Kindle purchase. As first look, you can hardly tell the difference between this version and my older one. The size and weight are similar enough. The big difference comes in the touch screen. Being an ipad user, the touchscreen is now more natural to use than the original buttons to turn pages. It's a great product to have in your bag, especially if you travel and need an ultra lightweight device. The Kindle is great for trips instead of my ipad, especially for reading outside.",It's a great product to have in your bag;;;;;;

Review: When I ordered this I was really excited.  When I received it I realized I didn't read all the details and missed the part that said there is no back lighting. However I bought on clip on light for $1.60 and it has worked well.  My granddaughter borrowed the Kindle and is having a wonderful time reading all kinds of books.  I have Amazon Prime and she can get all kinds of books for free.  A great buy on my part and I love it.

Very light so easy to carry in my purse so I always have reading material available.  Downloads are easy and fast.The anti glare makes it a bit darker inside tham I like.  Butonce I read the manual I'll probably find there's  a setting to adjust it.

when i got this i didn't realise at the time it had no back lighting.  so that being said... i bought it to be able to read late at night while my boyfriend is trying to sleep..but can't because i can't see what i am reading... otherwise its ok for daytime or full lighted room use and convenient. i do plan to upgrade to the back lit version as soon as i can afford to.
Title;;;;;;: when i got this i didn't realise at the time ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I absolutely love my new Kindle.  I had a Kindle Keyboard until it broke and was finally able to get myself a new glare-free Kindle.  I prefer this one over the Keyboard.  It's easy to use and you can either swipe or just touch the side to turn the page.  It's very light and compact, so easy to take along with me in my purse wherever I go.  Very happy with my new purchase.",5 Stars for this Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have bought this kindle.but I return it several days before.the package is shipping on the way.but,I'm so sorry that I return the wrong package. There is two watches in it. Can you ship it to my address again.?","Return Wrong package,please ship the package to my address again!thank you,!";;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"Received this as a gift. The VERY dark gray screen combined with the black text and no screen light  adjustment is really a disappointment. Can't figure out who likes this dark stuff. You wouldn't buy a book or magazine like this! Maybe mine was defective?  Maybe on a beach in super bright glaring sunlight it has a benefit. Not so at home, trying to read in the dead of winter in the middle of the day. I just do not understand this product! Cannot return it except for an Amazon gift card. Do your homework BEFORE naively opening the box!  Save your $ and read stuff on your iphone instead.",The VERY dark gray screen combined with the black text and no screen light adjustment is really a disappointment. Can't figure o;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This Kindle is great. I bought it as a gift for my eight year old daughter. She enjoyed using my older kindle but I thought I would need to explain the touch screen. After having it in her hands for less than a minute she told me ""This one is so much cooler than yours."" She has had no problems using it and loves it.",This Kindle is great. I bought it as a gift for my ...;;;;;;

Review: I bought the Gen 6 to replace an older Kindle that had started having problems. I love how easy it is to turn a page. The longer battery life was a big selling point for me. I only have 3 stars because of the lack of audio component. I love to. Listen to my books when I'm on the go and for the blind I know that was a great feature. I don't need it lighter nor do I want to spend a small fortune on a Kindle Fire to get what should be a standard feature. I would have given the Gen 6 five stars if they had not removed it.

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought it on Nov 27, 2015 to give as a gift for my sister in law. She started using it in January, and by the 2nd week of February, the screen already stopped working. At first it was intermittent -- stop and go -- then it just completely stopped working. No wonder the warranty is only up to January 31st. I guess they knew it would stop working after only a few weeks.",Broken in just over a month! Screen stopped working;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Overall the Kindle platform is excellent for reading both articles and books. The e-ink display is adequate for reading in daylight, however if you plan to read in the dark it is hopeless due to no back-light. On the subsidized version with ads, it can e somewhat annoying due to a very small variety of ads and thus repetitiveness. I enjoyed the integration with Goodreads. Compared to competitors like the nook, the kindle has a huge advantage in terms of selection and also price. I recommend this device to anyone who loves reading and wants a device that can store all their books in one place.",Overall the Kindle platform is excellent for reading both articles and books;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"9/10th of the way reading a book and the reader freezes. Attempted to rest  the reader..everything... I may have it working again, don't know if it was the book???or the reader, frooze on page 312. I have deleted the book... Maybe i will check it oout from he library so I can finishe reading it. lol",Frozen;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"6"" E-ink (with page buttons on the side) seems to have died in approximately a year. 'Worked well & satisfied until then. It raises 2 questions: 1) why buy the same brand/company that had such a short life? 2) is this what can be expected w/ the more costly units? If so, it makes me re-think if a dedicated e-reader is for me at all - as opposed to a tablet or other option. Seeing the new units are tough-screen only does not encourage buying another.",Died in infancy;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I received a Kindle for my birthday. At first, I was a bit skeptical but it's turned out to be one of the best presents I've received in a long time! It's so easy to carry everywhere and takes the monotony out of daily train travel.This is my first Kindle and I'm not familiar with the features of others, but the glare-free screen really does make it seem as though you are reading a real book and the touch-screen display makes it really easy to turn the page when your hands are occupied.The step-by-step set-up procedures take the stress away for the technologically-challenged (like myself) and before I knew it I was all set-up with my first book purchase! Highly recommend it!",I was a bit skeptical but it's turned out to be one of the best presents I've received in a long time;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Cheaper quality than I expected- it feels like a mix between a late 90s computer and a etcha-sketch, as the image of the previous page often lingers when you change pages (mostly on the store, rather than books). But it's light, I can download free ebooks from the library, and I don't get distracted from reading by opening other tabs, so it works. Plus I managed to get a pixelated dot on the screen that won't go away within a day, so I doubt they'd take it back. Overall, I'd probably do more shopping around next time, as it didn't feel worth the price, but it works and was nice to not lug books traveling.","Fine, not great";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I love having a way to take my current book with me without carrying it everywhere.  I'm not experienced enough to use it by myself, but am almost there.  The library has been my source, since I am technologically impaired.  I haven't been able to shift it to the chapter I'm on, since I'm reading from the hard copy at home.  There may be a way.  I'm a hands on person so I avoid printed directions.  That's strange, considering that I am never without a book since I've been in the second grade.  I am 68, so u can see the reason that it is an adjustment for me to have something other than a book itself in my hands.  I really wanted the Kindle for trips.",I love having a way to take my current book with ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought two one for my husband and the other one for me. Both of us are very, very happy with them. They are small and can fit easily in my purse and can be taken everywhere. And I really love how you just touch the page and it turns. What a great kindle and I'm very happy with what I bought.",very happy with them;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm one of the people that a color LCD screen on a tablet will bother me if I read on it for very long.  I've used a 3rd generation Kindle Keyboard before, but there is no good way to describe difference in the ease of use and responsiveness of this Kindle compared to it.  It seems as fast a tablet without the eye strain.  The controls are well laid out and very intuitive to learn and use.  The virtual key board is far better than the old physical keyboard.  And last it is small and lighter and will fit in a coat pocket.  I love it!!",HOMERUN!!;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I have to have a non-blue screen reader to read before bed so when my original Kindle broke I bought the more expensive Kindle. I thought it would be most like my first Kindle, but it was not. I do not like the touch screen set up. I can't go back when reading newspaper articles (to the previous article, not to the previous page) and my hand often hits something it's not supposed to and then the thing jumps around and it's harder to shop for new books. So I returned the expensive Kindle and got this one and the experience is almost identical.  Might as well pay less money.",I thought it would be most like my first Kindle;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Though the screen is clear, you can't brighten the screen.  Therefore on a dark airplane, it is tough to see the screen. Other than that is is very solid and rugged construction.  The touch screen features are also nice with the dictionary, option to flip between books and the ability to remember your place. If the brightness was better I would have given it a five star review.",Not as bright as I had hoped.;;;;;;

Review: Got the Kindle free after rebate when bought a laptop from staples. Battery has good charge and I like the amount of free or cheap books on Amazon. Got Grisham book on sale at Thanksgiving but is was a disappointment but the Kindle is not.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have owned the original Kindle key board and purchased the Kindle Fire 7 inch as an upgrade. However I just wanted a dedicated reader that didn't have a keyboard (which was time consuming) so when the new Kindle Touch 6 inch 4G came out, I had to jump on it. You can read in direct sunlight  and the screen remains glare free, no eye strain. The pages turn effortlessly and you can adjust the font as you read so no need for readers. It's small and compact , fits easily in your purse or in a wide jacket pocket. Holds hundred of books and can download a book in seconds. It does not light up, which isn't a problem because you can purchase a light to attach when needed or purchase a case with a built in light. With the new Kindles you will get the advertisements as your screen saver. The older Kindles had a few portrait options for a screen saver. The battery life is exceptional, you can read for hours everyday without charging. It does not come with a wall charger, the previous model had the wall charger included. The Kindle Library is extensive with hundreds if not thousands of free books to chose from. Kindle Touch has a special feature were more then one person can use the reader. For example when one person sign in it will show that person there personal library and vice versa for other readers. I paid $59.99 on sale during the holidays, I would have paid the regular price of $79.99 because it is well worth it and this Kindle will not let you down.",What's  not to love about the Kindle Touch?;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I never thought I wanted an e-reader, but was given this as a Chrstmas gift. I was suprised how much I enjoyed reading on it. The glare-free screen was easy to read with no eye strain, like I feel when being on a computer screen an extended period of time. It is light weight and easy to hold while reading. No fighting to hold some pages open like while reading. May have liked a light so I could read in bed without disturbing my husband, but would not give up the Glare-Free screen for a back light.",I was suprised how much I enjoyed reading on it;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Had the old Kindle and this pretty much made an improvement since it's faster, smoother and easier to operate. Typing in this couldn't be easier and would totally recommend to people who would want to upgrade their old Kindles or someone who wants to buy it for the first time.",Great improvement over the previous versions;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I don/t really like this Kindle - am used to the one with keyboard.  Had a hard time finding books I have ordered and can't figure out  how to ""archive"" the ones I have read.  Very disappointed in this device..",I don/t really like this Kindle - am used to the one with ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I just got mine today and I love it !  I love reading and this was just the perfect eReader for me . It's very light and small , I can take it anywhere & it's easy and simple . I totally recommend this eReader ",;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I loved (and still love) my old Kindle and wanted one as close to it as I could find. This fits the bill perfectly! I use mine strictly as if it were a book. I love that there is no glare and I can read it on the beach or on the boat. No pages to blow. The font is adjustable for my husband with low vision so he can read again, too! What a joy!",I loved (and still love) my old Kindle and wanted one ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"great little kindle. I have a Fire, a Paperwhite (my absolute favorite) and this one I keep in my purse I love it, it's small and lightweight.  No backlight but it's perfect for what I am using it for",Great little Kindle;;;;;;

Review: I really love this kindle. I love reading and this makes it more convenient for me with my busy schedule. It's easy to hold and I like that it doesn't have a light. My eyes have gradually worsened from overusing my phone so the break from the backlight is appreciated. It's just like a normal book and you can read that in the dark. I can only recommend that you order a case with this. I have two cats and even though I kept it in the box when I wasn't using it I noticed that cat hair was accumulating along the edges of the screen. I would buy this again if I had the need.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Overall it is very nice and extremely light weight, but trying to bring up the menu tool bar to access settings isn't not too easy, since you have to press and hold the very top edge of the device and wait for it open, gets frustrating when it thinks you are highlighting a word or phrase, they should have given it a dedicated ""Home"" button that would take you to the menu bar, or the home screen, if you have big hands it is almost impossible to open up the menu bar to access settings.",Overall it is very nice and extremely light weight;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"So far, so good!  Easy to activate, easy on the eyes for reading.  I wanted something inexpensive for travel, so if I lose it I won't have to cry!  A long battery life will be good, too.  Still testing that.",Basic unit does what I need!;;;;;;
