4.0 out of 5 stars,"A fantastic device. Not perfect but for the price it really doesn't need to be, it does everything you need it to if you want to read. Minus a light to read at night. The response is great, the load  times are fast and you would be happy if you are considering it.",A fantastic device. Not perfect but for the price it ...;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Thanks to all the informative reviewers who go into such great detail, and really help folks to make informed decisions about buying a new Kindle.  I have a question for folks who have one of the newer Kindles (either the 'plain' ""6 inch touchscreen display--the $79 model, or the newest Paperwhite). One of the things I loved about my plain old kindle (the older one without keyboard, with built in light) was the ability to read WITHOUT being online, in ""airplane mode"".  So no annoying pop up features and such interrupting my reading.  I know Amazon proudly touts all the fabulous things the latest and greatest Kindles do with wifi, but unless I'm downloading a book, wanting to look up a word, etc., I really don't want to be online.  Can anyone tell me if the newest plain Kindle and the Paperwhite both (or either) have ability to turn off wifi for reading a book that has been downloaded??? Thanks for any info--",Question about wifi;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"The minimalistic design and accessibility make this e-reader a fantastic investment! It does not, however have the features of a dedicated tablet. It was not made for that particular purpose and is solely focused on providing the customer with the ability to read books.",The minimalistic design and accessibility make this e-reader a fantastic investment! It does not;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I like that it is simple to use.  I like the glare free screen.  It is lightwight, smaller than my last Kindle, easier to carry around.  Love the cloud feature.  I also bought the booklight and that is really nice and compact along with it.",I like that it is simple to use;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Does everything I expected it to do. I have an old and failing model with keyboard and button page turn. The battery is now on it's last life and has to be recharged frequently. I prefer the tap screen and the increased battery life (no more wondering whether it will last long enough to get me through my own or my husband's medical appointments!). I like the non-glare screen and the fact that I can read with ease in direct sunlight. I never read without a light on in the room, so this basic model is perfect for me.",Basic and Perfect;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchased this at the urging of my sister-in-law who is much more tech savvy that I am. We are going on a lengthy vacation later this year and I did not want to have to lug around a huge bag of books on our trip. This device was on sale but I delayed purchasing it and when I went to order it was back to its original price of $79.00. I still think it was a good deal for me because I have already read 2 books and I've been able to carry it in my purse when I want to take a book with me to an appointment. It is lightweight  and relatively compact. An English teacher at heart, I DO prefer a 'real' book but the ease of the Kindle is great in certain circumstances.",A Great Purchase;;;;;;

Review: Fabulous! Love the e-ink. The e-ink has always been my preference for my kindle since I live in Florida and do a lot of reading on the beach. Very pleased with my purchase. I love kindles... So convenient to have several books on one small device.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Overall, I really like my Kindle. It is the first handheld electronic gadget I have ever purchased.  I am still getting used to how it works but so far so good.  I hadn't thought about it being black and white only so the book covers look pretty bland and the children's picture books don't look so great on it, but I have read a few short books on it and like it overall.",Works great;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I feel like there are pros and cons with this device.I love the idea of an e-reader, and when I purchased this e-reader, my thought was to use it with Amazon Prime which we had just purchased. I thought that if I bought the reader with prime, that you have access to billions of books.Untrue.What the websites don't make blatantly clear is that most of the books you want to read aren't available in prime. And you only get to check out one book per month. That makes a BIG difference. Now if you want to get a subscription to kindle, you can have access to more books. But you are gonna spend 9.99 per month to still not be able to read all the books you want.As far as the reader goes.I do like it. It is easy on the eyes. And very simple. Nothing fancy. No headphones. But, don't buy the reader with specials. With specials means that there are annoying ads on your lock screen.So, I figured out a way to not pay for books and check them from the library. It's round about and not simple.But it's free.And I am cheap. I hope amazon doesn't take that away. I am keeping the e-reader. It's so light weight in hand, that it is enjoyable to use.",Hope this helps.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"LOVE! LOVE! LOVE! Love my Kindle!!! This is my first kindle that I have own, so I don't have any previous ones to compare it to, but even if I did I would still love it. I am very excited to have my books store in this device , which saves me space on my shelves. Also, I got more excited when I found out that you could get book loans from your public library and have the books downloaded right in to the device. How awesome is that!!!! What an increideble invention!!!",LOVE IT!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I liked this reader so much that when I misplaced my existing 6"" Touchscreen Kindle, I immediately bought another. Of course I found the missing one so I will be able to enjoy reading that much more. Our family has only two sets of eyes but, three touchscreen Kindle's now.",One wasn't enough.;;;;;;

Review: It's awesome! Instead of spending heavy amounts on hardcover books I can now buy e books for very low price.Some books are free online.I bought it for my grand daughter. I recommend it for all who like to read.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Light, and compact enough to go into any midsized handbag. It's perfect if all you need is books to read without the hassle of their weights. Just remember that if you don't entirely shut it down, it does slowly drain the battery, but since all the functions it has is that of a e-reader, the battery does last very long.If you need more functions like that of a tablet, then I'd recommend to skip this and the Fire and go straight for a tablet/iPad instead.",Thousands of books without the weight and bulk;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Did not expect to like it as much as I do - but the reduction in eyestrain is pretty amazing. Just getting acquainted with the world of Kindle-formatted books is introducing me to some fun new authors. I've resisted e-books, but am definitely enjoying them now.",Did not expect to like it as much as I do - but the ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is an amazing value IMO. But I bought it for one purpose, to use it with my dji drone as a video monitor. Kindle is an amazon product, so it doesn't come set up to use google apps. I knew this, and had planned to try hacking google play on to it, since amazon sells dji drones and amazon fire tablets, it only seemed right. It worked after much brain strain and trying to download things that the fire said I couldn't download because my device wasn't configured to download this kind of stuff. I am very happy with it, and may even try a game or two, but I don't think so. Buy it, you can't go wrong.",This is an amazing value IMO;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"The background seems a bit dull compared to ""normal"" books. Otherwise, it is very good at doing what it says, that is being a book reader. I have already loaded my books and have started reading on it.","The background seems a bit dull compared to ""normal"" books";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Picked this gem up as a Christmas gift for my father. My mom and I finally swung him around to the digital side of literature. He'll never totally give up on physical books. But, he now realizes how much additional reading material he was missing out on. Thank you for continuing to make this user friendly version of your popular reader. You saved both his sanity and mine. My father enjoys his kindle and uses it everyday.",My father loves it.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love my kindle! Bought this one for my 9 year old daughter. It encourages reading. Kindle is easy to use. I was afraid it would take me a long time to master. Took me about 5 days. It took my 9 year old less than 1 hour!!! It is also convenient to buy or borrow a book and read it immediately. I will not buy certain types of books at the book store, but will buy and read the same in my kindle. Kindle is a great machine!!!!",Kindle is the best!!!;;;;;;

Review: I have an older Kindle ereader but this one is great. I love the touchscreen and it holds a charge longer and has more storage. It is so clear in sunlight or regular light. I was lucky to get it for $20 off and it is so worth it.

I love my Kindle. It's still small so it's like reading a book. It's great to have storage for books I am waiting to read. The only thing I don't like is that I still have to use my book light at night. Not a bad thing but I wish I could have afforded one with a light.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I received this Kindle for Christmas.  Was not expecting what I received.  This Kindle is amazing.  Cannot get over how it can show so many books and you can read Samples of whatever book you are deciding to read.  The Flashcards are great, for increasing your vocabulary.  The battery life is long, and the Kindle is so portable you can take it with you wherever you go and you have reading material available.  There is so much more to learn to do with this little gadget.  What a fabulous gift to give to anyone;" I had no idea how nice this thing is!  Love it!""
Review: What a surprise this Kindle is!";;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Love the unit, but the programming still doesn't provide a way to keep the books in collections from being listed on the main screen.  Since I have over 590 books current, it makes it time consuming to find the book I want to read without going through many steps to find the one I want.  I appreciated the old system where I could store collections as I chose and have a smaller list to contend with!",Love the unit;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This kindle functions great and is perfect for travelling. Its light and you can borrow lots of books off your local library and load them on the device (not to mention buy books on Amazon). The screen is not back lit, so your eyes don't get tired from staring at a screen - it is very much like a book. I have to say I love books and wouldn't trade them for anything, but this kindle is a close second when it comes to reading paraphernalia.",This kindle functions great and is perfect for travelling;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"It arrived very fast and was partly charged.  It was easy to set up and came with a kindle guide book installed.  While it is not as fancy as my fire, it does what my husband needs in a reader.  Because the text can be enlarged, he has enjoyed reading again.  This will be a wonderful item to take on our vacation.  It is not lit from inside and at night he needs a light.  We knew this when we bought it and it is fine.  This item met our expectations.","For a reader, this does the job.";;;;;;

Review: Love it. It fits nicely in my bag. It is user friendly. Very little to no glare. Please note there is no way to adjust brightness.  You will need a book light or lamp in poorly lit rooms. I am extremely happy with my purchase.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Clean-looking, easy interface, no more need to attach to a computer, a lot of good books available without additional cost because of my Prime membership, and a beautiful screen. Everything I want an e-reader to be, nothing I don't.","easy interface, no more need to attach to a ...";;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"My 5th original Kindle died. The only glare-free option offered to me at a discount, as a very loyal Kindle user, was this second rate copy. Who ever thought that an interface that involves rubbing ones oil-laden fingers across your reading screen was a good idea? I know tablets and touchscreen smartphones are the most popular around. That still does not make them a good idea. Touch-free is available for WII and other devices. Also, it would really be nice to have a way to synchronize my replacement device to get all the contents and subscriptions from the dead device with ease rather that one at a time.I will be looking for alternatives.",Loyal Kindle User Severely Disappointed;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is the second Kindle product I have owned. Purchased it primarily to use as a reader because of the ability to use it in brighter light. So far it seems to be a good choice even though it is not as easy to use as the other Kindle I own. Hopefully in time I will understand it better. The help provided by Amazon has been great so I think it will get easier as I learn more about it. I really like the light weight of the unit. Makes it more like holding a paperback book than the larger/heavier Kindle I own. Plus, it is easier to take with me when I am going somewhere where I might want to use it. I've only had it for a couple of weeks so I don't know how it will be long term but right now I am very pleased with my purchase.",So far it seems to be a good choice even though it is not as easy to ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love reading from this, helps with eye fatigue since it does not have a backlit background. I have not had any issues with bookmarking highlighting or turning pages, I only wish that it had page numbers at the bottom instead of PCT read so that I would know if turning the page whether or not I have skipped a page.","It's Basic, but I love it";;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Disappointed in Amazon ""Help"" more than with my new Kindle (7th gen, 6"" Glare-Free Touchscreen Display).  Amazon USED to have superior service;" sadly no more.My issue is that games/active content that I had bought for my old Kindle (2nd gen) don't work on my new Kindle when I specifically asked that question before I purchased the new Kindle.  I LOVED my old Kindle
Review: but the paging has gone haywire
Title;;;;;;: so I contacted Chat and asked them to make a recommendation.  I only had 2 requirements:  love the screen on my old Kindle so wanted the same screen (nothing lighter or that lights up) and want to be able to play the games (Brain Trainer
column4: Scrabble
column5: (EA) Solitaire
column6: etc.).  The guy immediately recommended this Kindle.  I pointed out to him that on my old Kindle I had a physical keyboard with a control button-- which is used to play the games but didn't appear to be on this new Kindle.  He put me on hold to check and came back confirming I would be able to play the games.  Great!  But WRONG.  Multiple emails
column7: chat sessions and phone calls
column8: and frustrating days later
column9: I finally got the truth:  my games/active content won't work on this new Kindle.Now they did reimburse the cost of my games
column10: but as I pointed out to them to no avail
column11: were bought when on sale or for free and for me to buy new versions of games that will work on my 7th gen Kindle
column12: I won't be able to for the amount they were refunding me.This whole thing could have been avoided if Amazon's personnel was properly trained (knowledgeable) on their products.I could almost understand one individual making a mistake
column13: but unfortunately for me
column14: I ended up emailing
column15: calling and chatting with multiple individuals who couldn't (or wouldn't?) directly answer my questions . . . which makes me a very unhappy customer.Now my actual experience with this new Kindle is just okay.  The """"touch"""" function needs some fine tuning";" paging doesn't work as expected all the time (could be operator error).  This is going to be a challenge because the tablet is small:  I'm going to have to train myself not to accidentally have a finger or part of my hand on the screen when holding it because that does impact the """"touch"""" functionI love the """"Smart Lookup"""" (dictionary) and """"Vocabulary Builder""""-- brilliant ideas for word nerds like me!  (I need to experiment more with """"Word Wise"""" and """"X-Ray""""";" might enjoy them too.)Page numbers are nice
column16: but I initially was confused by them because I thought a page was skipped-- page numbers relate back to the paper book's physical page so the Kindle's font size can impact whether you display more (or less) than a physical page.I haven't found the """"Voice"""" (read aloud) function on this Kindle and maybe it doesn't have it . . . which would be disappointing because I did enjoy that on my 2nd gen Kindle.In some books I've never read before
column17: sections are highlighted-- I haven't figured out why . . . but it's not going to stop me from enjoying reading on my Kindle!  :)""
column18: Amazon Customer Service is now Horrible!  Most Games/Active Content don't Work on this Kindle";;;

Review: Thought I would never enjoy using a Kindle for reading but this is GREAT. Fits easily in my purse so I always have something to read. I am on a fixed income so I especially love being able to download books from the library. Why did I wait so long to get this?

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"It gets glare, you can't adjust the brightness (if you can it's very hard to find), lots of books are $10 . But otherwise it's great and I love it, much easier on your eyes and very convenient. I love the pictures it shows when you turn it off and it has great battery!",It's mainly great but a few minor annoyances.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This was my first Kindle and I love it...enough said. With the Prime membership its even better to borrow books for free. The battery life is great, it's light weight and very easy to use.( I wish I could have been paid to say that.)",This was my first Kindle and I love it.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Love this already! I am using it for passing the time while commuting to work. It's small, light, easy to use. Either you can't adjust the screen brightness, or I'm dumb and can't figure out how. But I have to have lights on when reading to see the screen.",why didn't I get one sooner?;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Although I still prefer books, this is a great little e-reader.  There is no glare, so reading outside on a sunny day is no problem.Very lightweight and portable, so it is a great alternative to a tablet for reading.",this is a great little e-reader;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I really like it. I researched it and knew what to expect as far as features. The ""offers"" are really unobtrusive. I think next time I will upgrade to one with a built in light. With the whispersync I just read on my cell phone in the dark and use my kindle for daytime reading. It does feel fragile and with two young children in the house I feel like I have to hide it. The official Amazon cover would be nice but seems expensive in comparison to the price of the actual device.",I really like it. I researched it and knew what to ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had one of these that was stolen. Point here if it happens to you and you want to stop who ever swiped it from using same, just go to the Your Account section and pull up Lost or Stolen and zip it is taken care of. Now for this Kindle, as I said I had one and liked it very much, so we ordered this new one. It is basically the same as the old one except there has been a major change in loading new books and deleting them. I like the idea of showing the book cover rather than the shopping list of old. The fact you can go right in and delete book without the hassle the old model had is for me a great plus. Being a senior citizen the lighted screen is sure a plus for these old eyes really like.",Great Kindle;;;;;;

Review: This is a great kindle.  I wanted an e-reader that I could read just like a book and not have it give me a headache.  It is perfect for reading.  The only thing I didn't like was that I couldn't really tell how far into the book I was.  I am a huge book lover and I love to feel a real book and turn the pages.  This kindle gets close to the real book look.
Title;;;;;;: This is a great kindle. I wanted an e-reader that I could ...;;;;;;

Review: I love it.  It was a surprise Christmas gift.  My old Kindle was great but it has been having charging problems and I cannot read Kindle on my I pad when I am in the sun.  I really like that I don't have to press a button or swipe to turn a page.
Title;;;;;;: I love it. It was a surprise Christmas gift;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I received this Kindle as a gift.  I have read books on my laptop so I thought a special ""toy"" just to read books was unnecessary.  I was wrong.  I really enjoy reading books on this Kindle.  It is small enough to be very portable yet extremely easy to read.  The font is easily changed.  The glare-free screen is truly easy to read and is not subject to glare or reflections.  Downloading a book is simple and fast.  A great experience all around.",Wonderful gift;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Until this new Kindle Touchscreen, I have always given 5 star ratings to the three (Yes, three, this is not my first Kindle e-reader rodeo and I found some of the reviews I read to be quite condescending!) previous Kindle e-readers I have owned. I have been extremely frustrated with the sensitivity of the screen when touching it to turn the page and with the constant and truly annoying changing of the font due to, it seems to me, just breathing a little too hard. I generously give this one three stars. Amazon, please consider adding a lock to keep the font from changing so randomly and frequently. One reviewer stated that he/she had to change the font 100 times in two days of ownership. I find it necessary to change mine 100 times in an evening of relaxing and reading before bedtime! Something also needs to be done to correct the sensitivity of the screen when turning pages.",Frustrated Kindle Touchscreen User;;;;;;

Review: Great. you get the books fast.. and cheaper.. although i'm old school.. I like to actually have the physical book.. those books that are milestones..how to win friends...think and grow rich..etc..i buy the actual book.Its a great device.. as marketed

I have seen the Kindle before but never bought one. I had received the one I have as a gift. I just love it. Easy to download new books it's light and so easy to get comfortable in any position to read it. I definitely would recommend this.
Title;;;;;;: Great! Why did I wait so long to use one?;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Now in it's seventh iteration, the Kindle still reigns supreme as the e-book reader of choice for millions of users. It is easy to see why. The e-ink display is easier on the eyes than backlit LCD panels and works without glare or reflection in direct sunlight. Downloading books is simplicity itself - just a single click on the responsive touch screen. It's small size and light weight make it a pleasure to read wherever you go.As an Amazon Prime member, the functionality of the entry-level Kindle is fortified well beyond it's low price point with tens of thousands of books in the Kindle Owner's Lending Library that can be borrowed free of charge each month. Add a Kindle Unlimited subscription, and you have access to more books than you could ever imagine!",Still the Best Choice for Reading;;;;;;

Review: This is my second kindle...I wore out the first...a light weight way to carry books and read! Last Christmas I gave one to my each of my grandson's (ages 11 and 15)  and they using within minutes...best present ever.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I originally purchased a Kindle Fire 7"" tablet, thinking I could use it to read.  I didn't do my homework as it is no good for reading outside.  This is just what I needed--it carries easily and is perfect for reading outside.",Just what I needed;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this kindle with a discount. Everything is nice. Touch screen makes it so much easier compared with the model before. The only problem is that sometimes it's a little slow and there is a lag when I press something. But considering the price and the basic model as it is, the product is definitely worth the money.",Everything is nice. Touch screen makes it so much easier compared ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had (and still have) a first generation kindle. I prefer a non-backlit screen. It's easy on my eyes since I have to be in a well lit area to read. The battery life has been excellent. I've had it about a month and I still have 40% battery left. Granted, I haven't been reading a ton but, the battery life over the first generation is astounding. This is a great simple kindle which is what I really wanted. And it's so light! I can hold this and read comfortably for hours. Books also download onto my kindle super fast. What can I say, I love kindles and this one is a great kindle for the price.",It's easy on my eyes since I have to be in ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"It's perfect! Been using it every night now, and I started reading again. It is so light, compact, and easy on the eyes...really it feels just like  a book. Unlike a paperback, you can put it down and read without using your hand to hold the pages. It does process faster compared to an older Kindle. Battery life is amazing. The *only* thing I would change is to have a backlight on this, but not having a backlight makes it feel more like a real book, so that's okay!",It's perfect! Been using it every night now;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"The E-reader is okay.  It is smaller and lighter and fairly easy to navigate.  I bought it strictly for reading books and it serves that purpose.  I do not like the fact that I cannot adjust the screen brightness. I find it very difficult to read in low light, even in the day time. I don't use it frequently because of that.",E-reader a disappointment;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I'll be honest, it has taken me a long time to come around to switching to digital books... I always said it would be the death of print and I like the smell and feel of paper. That being said, well worth the trade in weight on my daily commute, easy to hold, not the easiest to navigate, that will most likely come with time. I would definetly recommend buying a protective case to give it that overall book feel. The battery is insane, I've only charged it once since I bought it. Overall, smooth transition to digital books.",I was skeptical...;;;;;;

Review: Love the kindle! Received this as a gift and was slightly hesitant to start reading on an e-reader but after spending time reading on the kindle it was a very quick adjustment and I don't even notice anymore. I would recommend this to any avid reader as it is extremely convenient to purchase books (they download in an instant!) and it will also eliminate clutter in the household (so slim you can bring it everywhere). Great gift and I would recommend this product!

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This was an Easter gift for my 12 year old daughter who is an avid reader.  She LOVES it!  I love it because with both of us reading different and sometimes the same material, it saves precious space in my home. I stayed with the standard Kindle rather than the Fire so she would be focused on reading and not on apps and games.  It serves its purpose... a tool for reading only, which also makes it very affordable.",PERFECT!!;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Overall I like it.  It's not, for me, as easy to navigate as my 2nd generation Kindle but I'm sure I'll get used to it.  Also, there are advertisements on it which I hate.  But the size is good, and reading on it is pretty nice.",Overall pleased.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I judge that it is a little small for arthritic hands.  I prefer my original model that had the page turner on the side...it was much easier for me.  Unfortunately, after approximately 6 or 7 years it gave up and I had to buy a new one.",I judge that it is a little small for arthritic ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I love being able to sit outside again and read. I also love that it's easier on the eyes than a tablet. There is no glare, so there is no eyestrain. On the down side the cord is way too short. Also, while Amazon says it holds a charge for weeks but with the way I read I have to charge it every three days.",I love it;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought for my 11 yr old. Seems to be just right, at least I have heard any complaints ;")May be I should qualify that...I actually bought the wrong one. I wanted one that was back-lit.  However

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love it. Have both Kindle app on tablet and various Nooks. I bought this because some of the book deals are Kindle only and I like variety. Easy to use, easy to read even outside in sunlight. Just added a cover.",I love it. Have both Kindle app on tablet and ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Definitely a good decision. Worth every inch of the price. The dictionary function was useful, especially when reading vocab-rigged or foreign language books (in my case, French). There are a Wikipedia function and an experimental web browser, just in case one needs it. Both work just fine. I did not buy the paperwhite because I already have good lighting (+ I enjoy reading in the sunlight). It is remarkable how this product did not cause any eye strain for almost three hours straight. However, I do recommend resting your eyes every once in a while.",Definitely a good decision. Worth every inch of the price;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I started with the Kindle Keyboard and loved it, but I broke 4.  The glass was very fragile.  My sister gave me a Kindle touchscreen for Christmas.  I fought using it for months, I wanted my Keyboard. I finally HAD to use the touchscreen, and I am converted.  This is not fragile. It does not require a cover just to keep from breaking the screen.  The weight is nothing, the battery lasts and last.  It charges fast. The resolution is good.  I would really like to have 3G, but it is not required.  I personally own 2 working Kindle Keyboards , 1 working small Kindle and one large Kindle color tablets. All are really good products, but for reading books the touchscreen is unbeatable so far.  Good work Amazon.","I started with the Kindle Keyboard and loved it, but I broke 4";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Miss my old basic Kindle reader with the side pressure page turner.  A personal preference sincethis one works perfectly.  Maybe a bit too easy to turn pages by accident, but excellent display,with clear and legible print choices.",Maybe a bit too easy to turn pages by accident;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This device more than met my expectations. My old Kindle froze on me and I couldn't unfreeze it, and this one is a perfect replacement. I take it with me everywhere now to read my books. I love it and would buy another one when I wear this one out.",Great Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I got it because it is cheap and has twice the memory of my previous kindle. I paid $20 extra to avoid having the advertisements;" I HATE the advertisements. It is a bit heavier than the old kindle - not much
Review: but noticable. But the additional memory makes it well worthwhile.""

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this kindle on a Thanksgiving deal for $50 and received in two days. A very quick delivery, and I rate 5 stars for the service category.The product packaging is very good, this kindle comes with no wall charger, but with a USB cable. The cable can be used to connect to a laptop to transfer content and/or charge the kindle. No wall charger for a $80 product is certainly a minus, but it is not a deal breaker as kindle uses a micro USB port, so it is not hard to find a charger. Any micro USB charger would work just fine.  For goodies I give 4 stars.Like any consumer electronic item, this review discusses Hardware, Software and Eco System (content you use on the kindle)Hardware: The kindle is nicely built with hard plastic and is light weight, but feels durable. The Kindle feels great in hand and you certainly don't need any protective cover, so please don't waste money on cases or covers. I said hard plastic, yes the kindle made with  hard plastic ( e.g: PVC plastic pipe), but not soft plastic (e.g: Nokia smart phones). So, the kindle aesthetics are bad and it looks very cheap, however the device doesn't feel any cheap in hand. The bezels are wide enough for a nice grip and the device is comfortable to hold. The design is very minimal and it is a good thing. It just have a power button and a battery charging LED indicator. The LCD display for reading is fantastic. It is certainly not like reading a paper book, but it is a very nice way of reading e books with no eye strain. Make sure you have ample light on Kindle screen. Rating: 4 stars. [hard plastic and lack of wall charger ate 1 point]Software: The software of Kindle is very top notch. Just touch a word, it shows the meaning and how to use it with an example. The same word is added to a list [ Amazon calls it Vocabulary builder], so that you could also check it later. There are lots of useful features to make you a better reader. Everything is great on a Kindle, except the advertisements. The screen always shows an advertisement when you are not using the device, so the screen is never turned off. Amazon claims it doesn't use battery, but I will discuss that later.  These advertisements change based on your amazon activity and your computer browser activity [know how cookies work?] The truth is your device is an advertisement display for Amazon.Rating: 4 Stars [ Get rid of advertisements on Kindle - we buy these to read, not to look at advertisements]Eco System: Eco System is nothing but, what you can buy to have on your Kindle. The e books and cases for kindle etc..There are couple of E book standards, such as epub, PDF, ibook (Apple's), docx (Microsoft word document), azw ( mobi based format). Amazon uses azw, which is based on mobi ebook standard. epub is widely supported ebook format, however everybody now also supporting Amazon's format. Your local library may also supports kindle format, but almost all ebook libraries do support epub format.Being said that, it is not hard to find a book on Amazon, so you are covered. If you want some old classic books for free [not protected from patent, as these books matured the time duration], search Gutenberg project on your computer. This website do have lots of good ebooks in kindle format, so you can download and email to your kindle e mail account to read on Kindle.Rating: 5 starsI would recommend this product to buy.",Piece of Art;;;;;;

Review: I had the very first Kindle given to me as a gift but after all these years had to replace it.  I love the size and weight of this new model.I did not need the extras of the Kindle Fire or a tablet--love this just for reading books.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I LOVE this kindle, because my son never wants to play on it because it can't download games! I love the ability to have any books at my finger tips! The ONLY thing I do not like is it not having a light, so I cant read in the dark.",Missing A Light but still love it;;;;;;

Review: This is smaller and lighter than my original Kindle.  It is easy to read and small enough to carry in my purse.  It took a small amount of time to learn the new commands that are logical and easy to use.

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I know a lot of people love this device and will be mad at me for this negative review, but for me personally, this is a solid one-star item. The display was just too dull and dim. I know it doesn't have a light. I know that. I wasn't expecting one. But I was expecting something I could easily read when I sit under a lamp. So many reviews made it seem it would be that way. Well, it wasn't. It was like reading faded printing on old discolored paper. For me it was a literal chore to read on it. I hated it. I wanted to love it. It was only $59, it was touch-screen, and there's so much free content to read with it. But I hated it. I truly hated it. So back it goes...",I wanted to love it...but just the opposite;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm still getting used to this product, going from a full kindle with the full internet and everything else with it is a big change, since having a warranty won't cover the cracked screen from a crazy person throwing it and breaking it. This is going to take some getting used to but I definitely like this product and it's a good replacement.",Pretty good.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"There are so many improvements over my earlier version that it is hard to describe.  This is almost a replacement for a paper book, except it doesn't smell right - yet.  It is much lighter and very convenient.",There are so many improvements over my earlier version that ...;;;;;;

Review: I am enjoying my Kindle. It has its advantages. No more piles of books everywhere.I wish there was a light I could switch on.Some of the fonts are unreadable because they are so faint and grayed out.It would be nice if I could deepen the font color where that is happening.I must say there is something really special about having a good book in my hands that I can skim through.Probably why I never got a Kindle until now.

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought it for my son (6 yr old). It has so many famous book series and he is loving reading on Kindle. Easy to setup and understand for kids 4 yrs and up. The screen is glare free (like a paper), navigation is easy and touch is super smooth. It is also a great device for grown ups.",Great gift for any kid over 4 year !! Loving it !!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I received my Kindle E-Reader as a Christmas gift from my son.  I have other devices to read on but this is the best that I have ever had.  It is absolutely perfect when I just want to read.  No gadgets or pop-ups or interruptions.  The pages are clear and the color is perfect for reading outdoors.  I love this device.  It is quick to download, quick to go back to where I was and fits perfectly in my hand.  I have always been an avid reader and thought for sure I would never put down that ""real"" book for a device.  I was so wrong.  I would recommend this device to anyone who just loves to read and read and read.  I couldn't be happier with it.  If you enjoy reading and reading a lot, this is the one for you.",I have other devices to read on but this is the best that I have ever had;;;;;;

Love it! Would definitely recommend this to anyone that wants to read and not carry around a bunch of paper backs/hard covers! The screen is fantastic and the battery life is long. So glad I finally found something digital that doesn't hurt my eyes when I stare at it for long. *Five Stars*

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"The Kindle, 6"" Glare-free Touchscreen display meets my requirements. It replaces my original Kindle with buttons. The size is comfortable and easy to hold with one hand. You have to be careful holding the device, not to inadvertently touch the screen accidently changing the page, sometimes forward, sometimes backwards. I love the books available too. Lots of books I've got to read now. Don't always love WiFi.  Nice weight and not cumbersome to hold.  Easy to use.  Very happy, except for missing the cool graphics.  If I can figure out how to turn the artwork graphics back on I'll be over the top happy.  Very nice product.",Love the Kindle and the books available;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Really wanted the paperehite with its light and increased DPI, but convenience store at the hospital had these on sale for $58, no tax. There kids have one each. Is surprised how easily I fell into reading with this device. I've gone from  reading none  to three books weekly. With whisper-sync, I can listen to a book in the car with audible on my phone then pick up right on this device where voice stopped.",Is surprised how easily I fell into reading with this device;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"The only problem I have with this product (and it's kind of a big one) is that if you're reading something with a lot of hyperlinks in the text (i'm reading a travel guidebook, which has links to both websites and to other parts of the text), it can be very difficult to NOTclick the hyperlinks when you're just trying to turn the page. I wish there were a separate area of the screen dedicated to turning the page where you could tap your finger and know you weren't going to hit a hyperlink and have to find your way back to the text you were reading. Incredibly annoying.Other than that, I like it. Good battery life, good anti-glare.",Incredibly annoying. Other than that;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"My husband bought me this for Christmas, and I love it! I can read my text books for school on here, and it is simple to navigate. Since I am a ""real book"" lover, I am glad to know that an electronic device feels like a real book.","It even satisfies ""real book only"" reader";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Honestly super satisfied. I bought this because I have a lot of textbooks for college and it's a lot cheaper, and a lot more convenient to carry them around on your kindle rather than having actually copies of huge books that are heavy and encumbering. I'm very pleased with it, I've been using it non stop since I received it. You can also transfer PDFs on it so it's useful if you have certain charts or documents that aren't books but that you need to have with you at all times. I would recommend buying a case/protection for it though, as I left it unprotected in my bag the first day and the black borders got a bit scratched.",really useful;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"The kindle surpassed my expectations. This is my first E-reader, I am amazed at how much it resembles the printed page. It is so much easier to read on than a tablet. The availability of Overdrive books is huge bonus for me. I am incredibly happy with my kindle!",Superb!;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I need to upgrade my old Kindle but do not want to give up text to speech feature which I love when driving.  Will this ever return to the Kindle, I bought a Fire but just can't read it sitting in the sun and it's a pain having to carry 2 with me and sync the books I am reading.  3 stars only beause I miss this feature!",Miss text to speech :(;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"My name is Readz Alot.  And I am a biblioholic.I had held off on buying any sort of e-reader for many years.  I like BOOKS.  I like holding books and handling books and reading books. I like being able to flip back 20 pages to check a fact, or flip forward to easily see how many pages are left in the chapter.  I like being able to quickly skim a section that is less interesting and move on.When this Kindle went on sale just before Christmas, I gave in and bought it, figuring I'd mostly use it for free e-books from sites like Project Gutenburg and Pulp Archive and, in general, for books that are completely unavailable or outlandishly priced in physical format.That is, indeed what I have, mostly used it for. I've purchased only a handful of books from Amazon's kindle store, and most of those still fall into the 'old and hard to find' category. Others are 99 cent megapacks.  And that that purpose, I mostly like it.  Though it does have all the downsides listed above.  It's hard to flip back to check a fact.  The 'time to end of the chapter' is often quite inaccurate, and doesn't work at all on many free-books.  And, probably not the Kindle's fault, but some free books simply don't seem to work well in the Mobi format, and end up looking like gibberish on the screen.The biggest downside though is the battery life.  One of the things that finally tempted me to buy it was the claim of 'weeks'/'up to 4 weeks' battery life.  Hah.  While I rarely read for more than 1-2 hours a day (I also, of course, continue to read physical books), even with the wi-fi off, I'm down to half a charge within a couple of days.  ""Up to"" is right.The other downside is that, for a biblioholic, the temptation to add 'just one more book ... it's free/only 99 cents' is so powerful.  I now own more physical books that I'll probably ever have time to read, AND more e-books.  Ah well.","""Weeks of battery life?""";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am very pleased with this purchase! This device is perfect for reading. I got this as an alternative to backlit tablets due to eyestrain, and distractions, there's too much to do on an iPad that keeps me from  reading! I love the compact size, and light weight - this is much easier to carry anywhere!",Very nice device!;;;;;;
5.0 out of 5 stars,"In our family we have multiple iPhones and iPads;" but
Review: for the beach we must have our Kindles!  I have tried to enjoy my favorite book on the beach or near the pool with the Kindle app on my iPad.  Between the glare and the constant worry of water or sand exposure it wasn't worth the hassle.The Kindke is glare free making it a breeze to read in bright sunlight with or without you sunglasses. While not water or sand proof
Title;;;;;;: the Kindle comes in at a much lower price point making damage a little easier to stomach.""
column4: Made for the beach/pool!";;;;;

Review: Love this Kindle actually better then my Fire HDX to read outdoors. The no glare on the pages is amazing. I highly recommend this Kindle if you like reading while you are outdoors. Thanks once again Amazon.
Title;;;;;;: Love this Kindle actually better then my Fire HDX to ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought the new seventh generation Kindle, 6"" Glare-Free Touchscreen Display, Wi-Fi - Includes Special Offers to replace my aging Barnes & Noble Nook Touch. Don't know why I never bought a Kindle years ago.",Love My New Kindle;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I have been a kindle owner for over 3 years now.  I have been extremely happy with my first kindle.  You see, I am an amputee.  I lost my right arm in a car accident.  I am also a person who uses a bus to commute each day to my job in Seattle.  So receiving my first kindle as a gift from my sister was a big advantage because of the awkward struggle it is to try and read a paperback or hardbound book with only one hand.Recently, something happened and about 80% of my screen stopped working and the display has a random collection of pixels showing that never change.  I contacted Amazon and reported the problem.  You promptly sent me, and charged me for, a replacement kindle.Well, I have to tell you that I am very frustrated.  My former kindle was a kindle keyboard.  What was most advantageous was the buttons on each side of the device that would page forward or page back.  The buttons being on each side meant that you could easily use it with one hand, whether it be the left hand or the right hand.I realize that having only one hand puts me in a small group of your customer base.  I further realize that having only a left hand is further minimizing my needs into a smaller demographic of e-book readers, but here are my observations: The black portion of the device that constitutes the frame can easily be held from the back, but then I cannot reach the screen for the required finger swipe. I can pinch the black case between my thumb and fingers, but that leaves my thumb as the only finger that can swipe or tap at the screen to change the page. Releasing the device to change the page makes the device balanced on my remaining fingers, so I am anticipating that this device will end up being dropped to the floor much more frequently than my former (and much more useful) kindle device.I do understand the futility in hoping for a de-evolution of your kindle line, and I am not ignorant of how few leftys there are in your customer base.  I just needed to clarify why I will be looking across the market of readers to see if there is a better device to meet my particular needs.  I do want you to know that if this situation did not exist, I would remain a satisfied kindle customer and user.",Not all chsanges are good for me.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought 3 of these units.  The first is to replace my keyboard kindle, that broke.  The second two are for my children.  We all 3 got the kids package with the protector, warrenty, and no ads.I prefer having the buttons to turn pages, it has been an adjustment getting used to the touch screen.  It was also a little difficult to set up the kids, so that my adult books were not on their screens.All in all, these units perform as expected, but was more of a difficult transition that I anticipated.",slightly difficult transition;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am a new user of any type of reader so I don't have a lot of expertise and haven't fully explored all the options yet. Having said that, I find the device extremely handy. I love not having to drag a book along. The Kindle fits right in my purse. I have it with me all the time. I love it.","I can read it in my favorite chair, while waiting in line for something";;;;;;

This small scratch will cost me a brand new kindle...which I am not likely to buy because I do not want to feed into the cycle. The customer support used to be great but policies must have changed recently because the customer support was terrible. That the only option is to buy a brand new kindle or sucks it up.

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have been reading Kindle books for years on laptops, and I tried a tablet and my phone for a while, too.  I needed something to read before bed, and I learned that this regular Kindle without a light is the healthiest option.  It has a great touch screen and it is very comfortable and lightweight.  I think this is a much better option for reading books.  It's also free from apps, texts, and other distractions.  I recommend it.",Excellent for reading books before bed;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I went from a 2nd generation Kindle to this one and I love that it is smaller and lighter.  I am having to get used to the touch screen as I seem to frequently hit an area that brings up miscellaneous info, but admit to not having read the User's Guide.  I like that the book cover turns the book off and on quickly.  Some reporters did not like the plastic cover but I am OK with it. Truly glare-free!",... a 2nd generation Kindle to this one and I love that it is smaller and lighter;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"The Kindle is fine, But it's the Kindle unlimited that's misleading at best.  When you say unlimited, I read that as being open to anything out there, which this program is not. Seems like you pay the money up front and the selection is older than books at my local library. Sure wish they could have made it truly unlimited as it was advertised.........................","Watch what you sign up for, not always what it seems";;;;;;

Review: This was a gift for my Father who is 89.  At first while he was getting used to it he liked it.  After a few weeks he realized the more he used it he found that he had to maneuver the Kindle around to eliminate glare.  It became a nuisance trying to adjust the way he held it constantly.  He was unable to read it in his room due to glare from the lamps.  We were able to return it in exchange for the Kindle Paper-white which is so much better.  He can read wherever he wants.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchased my new kindle on prime day after my 2nd generation kindle bit the dust after getting squished on a road trip (RIP dear Kindle friend) I was insistent on not getting a ""Light Up"" or back lit version because the whole reason I love the kindle is the real ""pages"" look the the e-ink provides. After receiving my new kindle and setting it all up, I am thrilled with it!! I hope that the touch screen doesn't lose its calibration, but other that that I don't see any reason I won't love my kindle for years to come the way I did my old one.","Didn't want to replace my 2nd generation Kindle, but glad I did!!";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"My wife gave this to me as a Christmas gift, and it is so enjoyable. The interface is very easy to set up and use right out of the box.  This is my first e-reader, and the e-ink display is very easy on the eyes compared to a LCD screen, and the battery life is amazing.  My first use constituted twenty-three (23) days of reading (averaging 45 minutes per day) following a full charge using a micro-USB port.  It's definitely something I would recommend to others, and it lives up to the technical specifications detailed on Amazon's website.  Great product!",Amazon Kindle E-Reader;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this Kindle to replace my Kindle Keyboard, which finally failed after years of use. I like the new Kindle. It is lighter and more compact than my old keyboard version. The touch screen works extremely well and I am very satisfied with this new Kindle. I have read more and enjoyed reading more since I started using the Kindle. Amazon has a great selection of inexpensive e-books to choose from and I have been delighted to find old classic mystery and adventure books available. If you want to surf the net or watch a video, get a tablet. If you want to read, get a Kindle.",I like the new Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This Kindle is my second one.  It seems to be working okay, but my first one worked good from when I purchased it in October 2014 until it suddenly quit receiving any wifi signals in August 2015.  Since then I can no longer download library books and can't order Kindle books.  Since I can't find a link to report the failure I ordered a new one and it seems to work fine.",but my first one worked good from when I purchased it in October 2014 until ...;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I have always switched back and forth between using tablet (iPad) with Kindle App vs using Kindle. The device itself (specially during the thanksgiving holidays) at under $50 was a very good bargain. Its small, the text is extremely legible and the touch is quite responsive, specially when you take into account the context of what you are doing. However, the problem is in the typography. I don't know much about the book ecosystem to know where the blame lies in terms of publishers vs Amazon. But there shouldn't be any good reasons why after almost 3-4 revisions of Kindle they still fail to put print quality typography on there. Yes the format is different and might have to be typed differently, maybe layout has to be different .. but publishers should have those tools by now,","Hardware is great, but typography still sucks";;;;;;

Review: The Kindle is fine. The leather cover is not as nice as the one I had with my first Kindle. Not as sturdy as the new cover has a cloth piece to hingle the front and back covers together instead of a leather one like my previous one.  The whole cover just feels cheap....not what I expected from  Amazon.Thank you.  Bernie Malman
Title;;;;;;: The Kindle is fine. The leather cover is not as nice as ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this on sale for $49.  I wish I had bought two.  I already have a Kindle touch so I am familiar with how this one works.  This kindle is much faster than the touch in that it connects to Amazon almost instantly.  The controls like home command are all on top of the screen.  The battery does seem to work longer, but I have not owned it for enough time to truly test this.  This Kindle works well and the operation is smooth.",The controls like home command are all on top of the screen;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I like my new Kindle, however, I could download games on my Kindle Generation 2, and this one does not allow games to be downloaded.  I miss doing Scrabble on it between book readings.  I would not have purchased this particular Kindle had I known.",I like my new Kindle;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I wanted a way to browse web articles that was safe on the eyes. However, the experimental browser does not support many websites well, especially reddit. Modern web design is incredibly low contrast on the kindle screen, and there is not a reliable way to adjust for that contrast.","Reads ebooks, not web articles.";;;;;;

Review: It's perfect for reading. It doesn't light up (just like a real book).  I had to convert my files from the epub format but a great free website sends epubs to your Kindle for free.  It's so much lighter than a real book and it is easy to hold while reading. Perfect size to fit in any bag and for traveling. Battery lasts for days and days.

Rating: 2.0 out of 5 stars,"I loved the older generations because it was just a simple e-reader. Unfortunately, I had an accident with the older one and now they don't sell the same one anymore.  First off, I don't like the touch screen, I seem to accidentally turn/highlight something constantly - I like to read before I sleep and even the blanket brushing it sets it off. There is no case for it that has a built in light - again because I like to read at night before sleeping. If I wanted something that had all the bells and whistles then I would have just ordered a tablet.I wish they would bring back a simpler e-reader.",Bring back a simpler e-reader;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Kindle is a good e-reader with a touchscreen display that reads like a real paper with no screen glare, even in bright sunlight. It is light weight and has excellent battery life. One of my observation is that there is a very slight delay for the text to appear when we move from a page to another. I have seen this only in kindle e-reader. My Ectaco reader does not have this delay. I personally prefer a much bigger e-reader which I believe will make the reading much more easier. Overall, it is a good reader for the price.",A good reader for the price!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"In the week that I've had my Kindle E-Reader, I have fallen hopelessly in love with it. It honestly might be an obsession! Switching to the nook from this, I found the display SO much easier to navigate than the nook. Also, the E-Reader is perfect for someone who, like me, just wants a kindle for the book aspect. I don't need something to watch movies on, or plays games with. I just needed something to store and read eBooks on, and the E-Reader met those needs fantastically! Also, I have found many FREE book I have enjoyed, and the prices of the books reasonable and somewhat cheaper than buying hard copies, ordering off a website, or even purchasing off the nook. Would totally recommend to anyone who's looking for a simple, yet dashingly perfect, eBook reader. ",Beyond Satisified;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This was an unexpected Christmas present and I once said I'd never allow an electronic reading device like this in mu house because I love to hold a book in my hands and turn its pages. After learning the other features of the Kindle, I was wrong about it and I look forward to using it a lot.",I was wrong...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love this reader. Compact, light weight, anti-glare and touch screen and fabulous anti-glare screen for outdoors. The best value for money. I borrow a lot of books from the library, and love to download in Kindle format, which I find easier than EPUB format. Would recommend this reader in a heartbeat. However, if you want to read at night, the screen is not back lit on this model, so you will need a small book lamp.",You can't go wrong with this reader.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I preferred this over the Kindle with the bright screen as this looks more like ""paper"" from a book. It took a little time to get used to, but I take this baby every where! It's dangerous because you can download books whenever, wherever.",Love it!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"[Update 3 November 2014. It's been a month and I'm happy to report my son has frequently read using this simple Kindle. He's still reading physical books from the library, but we've purchased several books from Amazon on this device and he's quickly and happily read through them. Due to the little 'smudge' that developed on the screen, I've put this in a case, and I hope no more smudges appear. Battery life has been awesome in comparison to LED devices, and nobody has had to interrupt their reading to find a charger, and it's been fully charged maybe 3 times in a month.]I bought this value-priced Kindle to solve a problem. My 9 year old son loves to read;" he will tear through a Harry Potter book in a couple of days. But
Review: he has no interest in reading on a regular tablet whether it be one of the iPads in the house
Title;;;;;;: or the Kindle Fire HD. Something about the experience
column4: basically staring at a white lamp for hours
column5: keeps him from enjoying it like he enjoys traditional paper books. Bu... Read more""
column6: Great
column7: Once You Start Reading""";;;;;

Review: My Sister in law visited us from the US and gave me one as a gift. Awesome really nice I was using a normal Kindle before and had to have a light that ate batteries and found it super frustrating having to change batteries in the middle of the night.Well done Amazon truly an amazing product and so easy to log in and all my books are saved in the cloud so it was seamless to retrieve them and read quickly.
Title;;;;;;: Truly an amazing Product well done Amazon;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"It is everything I hoped for.  As a senior citizen, I wanted something useful and easy to operate.  I am not a technical person.  I wanted something that did not require a background in computer science.  I love to read and I wanted something that would allow me to have books without taking up space for bookcases in the house or require recycling some to have more available room.  The user guidebook is on the Kindle.  (Do not expect a separate paper guidebook.)  The guidebook is clearly written.",Everything I Hoped For;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Well... I bought my Kindle on thursday 11th and the order arrive on tuesday 16th. I mean the shipping is really fast, even when u live in the end of the world, like me.I'm really happy with my new Kindle and above that I'm so so happy with the attention of Amazon, really. The attention is excellent, anything that you need, they WILL help you.I had some questions and I contacted them between chat and they helped me and resolve my questions.The Kindle is perfect, I loved it.THANKS AMAZON;")""
Review: like me. I'm really happy with my new Kindle ...";;;;;

I gave it a four star rating because I am still learning about the Kindle and what he has on it.  I will eventually like to purchase some books but until I take/have the time to learn more it will be a while yet.  I think it will be a great asset for me.
Title;;;;;;: I will eventually like to purchase some books but until I take/have the ...;;;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"Display to dim to use in anything but brightest environment.  After long discussion with the first customer service agent when I inquired how to increase the brightness, she (Cath) passed me to a second agent (Tejaswi) whose first question was whether I was trying to trade-in a Kindle.  Obviously, he hadn't read any of the preceding chat.  Then he wrote,  ""A member of our Kindle specialist team will be the perfect person to help you with this. Let me connect you to a member of our specialist team. It will only take a moment.""  I was then transferred to the ""perfect person"" to help me with my problem.  That ""perfect person"" (Syed) then asked me ""You want to reduce the brightness in your 3rd Kindle?""  So much for perfection.  Customer service was abysmal.",Cant use this device in less than great lighting.  But it's still better than Kindle Customer Service reps;;;;;;

Review: It's really a fantastic and uncomplicated way to read books. It almost looks like a genuine book page which is what makes it such a great reading experience. Having your entire library at your fingertips doesn't hurt either.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Miss my old one. I had one of the original which I broke. I am getting used to it. Like the touch screen as when I read kindle books on other devices they are touch screen and I used to touch the screen on old one and then remember that doesn't work. Ha. There does seem to be a little more glare than with old one, but not as much as with my other devices.",Pluses and minuses;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"For someone like myself, that reads 1500wpm, this is perfect. I never run out of books to read. I love that I can carry a small lightweight tablet with me, instead of big bulky books. I'm ambiguous about not having the actual physical book, because I will reread them. But every appropriate available space in my home is book occupied. So not accumulating more is good in that aspect. I like that I can highlight certain passages, and share them on Facebook with my friends. I haven't found a single negative with this product. Very very pleased with my Kindle.",I'm in love;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I had a Kindle that I loved and carried with me all over the world!  This one doesn't have the same format...the buttons to change pages are different (there are no buttons)...and I'm having a terrible time adjusting to  this. I am 75 years old and don't own an Ipad or Smartphone where one sweeps their finger across the screen to change pages. Furthermore, I don't like not knowing the page # I'm on (% read is one step better than useless) but the old Kindle was the same way.",I had a Kindle that I loved and carried with me all over the world;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Great if you want to feel like you're still reading an actual book. Lightweight and fits easily into an averaged sized purse. Also, you can wear non-touchscreen gloves to use the touch screen which is something I was worried about when purchasing - super happy!",GREAT! Feels like I'm reading an actual book;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm a creature of habit, so when I lost my old trusty kindle...I expected something 'greater' with my new investment.  The love of a touchscreen....big deal....Takes some getting used to and a bit of a hassle going to cloud & coming back.... it also comes on when you uncover the screen (don't know how it does that, but it does);"  would rather just push the 'on' button when I want it on...The readability is really not better than one of the original kindles....  So
Review: perhaps I'm being harsh
Title;;;;;;: it works fine.  It's just not better - imho""
column4: The love of a touchscreen";;;;;

Review: I like reading on this more than I expected.  Glare free is a slight overstatement.  It is kind of like coated paper which has a slight glare if the angle is just right.  It definitely is better than a phone or tablet screen and you can change your angle slightly to avoid any slight glare you can see.
Title;;;;;;: I like reading on this more than I expected;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I love this little Kindle...2 things would have given it a 5 star rating. 1. I'd love to be able to ""shelve"" my books in collections, like you can on other brands of ereaders ( I made collections on my Kindle keyboard and when it updated it wiped them all out..took me forever to put over 1000 books where I wanted them.)  2. I can't find a reasonably priced case for this anyplace local.",I love this little Kindle;;;;;;
4.0 out of 5 stars,"I like the build of this eReader. It's very lightweight;" the sides are flat and a bit wider than on the Paperwhite. The plastic on the back is a bit rougher as well
Review: but I think both of these features combine to make it easier to keep a steady grip on the device
Title;;;;;;: as well as making it feel more durable. The text is nicely dark
column4: though a few of the fonts could be a shade darker
column5: such as Palatino. The wide selection of fonts is nice
column6: however. My only real complaint
column7: and the reason I did not give the full five stars
column8: is the fact that the font sizes are too limited and range from basically way to small to way to large
column9: with only one size that I was actually comfortable reading with. Other than this tiny flaw
column10: though
column11: I think this is a solid eReader that is well worth it's price.""
column12: Low cost
column13: High quality""";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a great gadget, thanks to the Amazon team that help me to get it,  it is so amazing to be able to get so many books in this light Kindle,  reading is a big part of my life and I love it, and getting the keyboard by touch is fantastic, the letters in my old Kindle were getting erased.Thanks againElizabeth S.,","This is a great gadget, thanks to the Amazon team that help ...";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchased this Kindle to replace an old (2nd gen) device.  Very happy with the size, weight and features.  Really easy to use - but do suggest reading through the user guide to learn about all this device can do.",Another Excellent Product;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I don't like having to touch the screen so many times just to turn the page in the Home Device or Cloud settings.  If I could touch the screen just like I do when I'm reading a book would be wonderful.  Other than that I really like my new Kindle.  It has a lot of options that are going to take me a while to learn, but I'm looking forward to it.",Page turning;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Pretty awesome reader.  No light, but the e ink display looks enough like a paper book that I think to myself ""real books don't have lights either"".  Good size for the device.  Great reading platform.",Good size and great reading.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I had an older gen Kindle but my dog literally chewed it up one evening when we were out, so I got the newer gen and I'm glad I did. I do like that it's touch screen, but it's bigger and bulkier than the older gens with buttons. However, it does weigh less because now I think it's more plastic. With a cover on it looks like a book, and that ads aren't that annoying.",so I got the newer gen and I'm glad I did;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"So far so good. I have a kindle fire that I really like but needed something I could read easily outside. Also, reading on the backlit fire for extended periods of time would hurt my eyes so this small kindle has worked well. Battery life is great. Screen is a little too sensitive but I will get used to it. All in all, for what I needed it for, I am happy with it.",So far so good. I have a kindle fire that I really ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Several years ago I bought a Kindle Fire. I still like it BUT reading out of doors with a Fire is virtually impossible. Now when I download a book I download to both devices so when I read on one it is ""synced"" to the other.  I also like the lightness of this Kindle. This Kindle does not come with a power adapter, but if you already own a Fire, that power cord will work just fine.  If you are looking for a cheap device to get you started or one to supplement your Fire this is the one for you.",Different Strokes (er KIndle) for Different Folks;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love this thing!  It's great to throw in my purse and go!.... I bought it when Amazon had it at a limited offer special price of $59 with the advertising software on it.. (hey,.. its a very minimal application).....and I decided it was too good of a price to not jump in.... it's simple and I don't mind the very small annoyance of the advertising. .. I love the touch screen to turn the pages. .. I can't understand the folks that would rather have the antiquated version with physical ""buttons"".... a simple ""touch"" of you finger turns the page... forward or backward......I ordered a nice leather book style case for mine......and,...I love this thing!",This Kindle is Fabulous!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I JUST LOVE IT.  IT'S COMPACT ENOUGH TO CARRY IN MY MEDIUM SIZE HANDBAG.I ENJOY READING FROM IT INSTEAD OF HOLDING A LARGE, HEAVY BOOK WITH MY ATHRITICHANDS.  THE PAGES ARE SIMPLE TO TURN.  THANX!!",I JUST LOVE IT. IT'S COMPACT ENOUGH TO CARRY IN MY ...;;;;;;

Review: This is a nice simple e-reader.  It is pretty lite weight and easy to handle.  I bought this because I was sick of reading on my tablet. the glare was bothering my eyes. I like the touch features.  Previous versions had the back and forward buttons on the sides. The swiping motion is similar to a tablet and is easier to manipulate. It functions exactly like the kindle App for my tablet with the ability to browse the Kindle store and purchase books.  It does not have a back light.  You will need a clip on light if you want to read in the dark.  I knew this when I bought it.  It is cheaper to purchase a clip on light and read that way then it is buy the next model up (paper white).
Title;;;;;;: This is a nice simple e-reader;;;;;;

Review: I broke my first Kindle and wanted to replace it with like kind so I could use my cover on it. I accidentally ordered the paper white. Take into consideration that I am 72 years old. So far so good. There is a steep learning curve for me but I am enjoying the new Kindle.
Title;;;;;;: ... my first Kindle and wanted to replace it with like kind so I could use my cover on it;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I had the kindle touch for a few years, loved it, but recently broke it (rocked over it with a rocking chair).  I decided to order the updated version of the kindle.  So far, it works pretty similarly to an older touch kindle.  The one thing I don't like about this product is it is a little boxy, and the plastic feels really cheap compared to the kindle touch.","Works just like the old kindle touch, but feels plasticy and boxy.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Needed to replace my Kindle, as the original was destroyed along with its protective case by my rescued dog.  This edition is excellent for my reading purposes and small enough with the case I purchased to be hiding from the aforementioned canine in my purse.  An additional thanks to your customer service representative who laughed with me about the loss and answered all my Kindle questions!",Just what I needed;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Its a great little device. The battery seems to last forever and the screen is crisp and legible in all conditions. I do wish it had a backlight and that I couldnfind the appropriate accessories more easily, but that's what I get for not choosing the next tier.If you need a dependable, light, function focused device at a low price this is the one for you. (The ads are kind of annoying spring for the no ads version if you can)",Its a great little device;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"It's my first  kindle, Am so happy I bought it. Easy to use, it makes reading books more enjoyable. one surprising issue, I wasn't  expecting  the fact that I have to buy the charger separately!! Thats sounds  awkward",Am so happy I bought it;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love that I can read outside with no glare!  For anyone wanting to read in a dark or dimly lighted room, do not buy this particular Kindle. This Kindle works like a regular print book and is read when light is available. I am thrilled it is strictly an e-reader, so the kids are never begging me to download games to it. Now if I could just figure out how to retire very early and read all day....",Perfect for me!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"It's a nice reader, but I still need to learn how to use it, I like it! I need to learn how to keep my books in a place when I'm done reading them. Just in cast I want to go back and reread them or sale them, or donate them. I have to continue to read the kindle user's guide.","Kindle, 6""";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a great Kindle. It is lightweight and easy to carry. The Glare-Free Touchscreen Display ensures I can read for hours without a headache, much like a traditional paper book. The touchscreen is responsive and easy to use. The one thing the Kindle lacks is in the structural quality. The hard-shell is a plastic I can imagine cracking after one drop on a hard surface. If you intend to travel with the Kindle and don't want the screen or body to crack, definitely buy a case.","Lightweight, Easy-Reading, Needs a Case";;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"It did not share my notes to Facebook like my Kindle Paperwhite Keyboard did.  This new one is somehow connected with Goodreads and formats the post with items that are not correct.  (Example.  When you high light a few lines to post with your comment is always assumes that the high lighted section is a quote by the author and will say 'John shared a quote by Don Won'  Although Don Won is the author of the book, but the high lighted section may be far from the quote of the author.  It also has images associated with the books that post that are not really that accurate either.  It is also too small to handle and could not get used to the smaller size.  I also missed the audio feature I had with my Keyboard model.  I sent it back and found the old Keyboard Paperwhite model on Ebay for $40 and it is like new.  I could not be happier.  It is too bad they do not make the Keyboard model anymore.  My first one;" the screen died after two years.""
Review: It did not share my notes to Facebook like my Kindle Paperwhite Keyboard did";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have always enjoyed reading, since the first days that I gained the ability. I've wanted to read everything in sight, but I've always found that taking a bunch of books everywhere with you is bothersome, they take up too much space, and it grinds on my sense of order to have my books scattered about. With this device I have them all literally at my fingers tips;" a tap
Review: swipe
Title;;;;;;: and click away. And what's more
column4: I can't even describe to you how much I like reading the e-ink screen. Combine the potential for thousands of books at your disposal on one device and a screen that feels so natural that you wish paper books looked as good
column5: and you have one heck of a product.""
column6: I like this so much better than I do paper books!";;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I've got an HD7 as well and enjoy it, but the e-reader is still the best and closest thing to an actual book.  The device is very light and has great battery life.  If you do a lot of reading the display is a nice feature that doesn't put a lot of strain on your eyes.",Like reading a book;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I got my kindle as a Christmas gift because my dad knows that I love to read. It's really lightweight and small, so it's nice for travel. However, there are a couple of things that bug me a little. One of them is the lighting. Although it's glare-free, you can't see the screen in darkness. I like to read in the car, and sometimes it's night outside. I did get a reding light for it though, so that helps a little. Another is the fact that it doesn't show page numbers when I read a book. There is the percentage of the book that you've read so far and a location number, but I still would rather see page numbers.One thing that I was really happy to see is  that I am able to access Goodreads from my kindle. I had recently got an account on the site and was disappointed when I couldn't get the app on my iPod because of its version. However, you do need wifi to access Goodreads, along with most of the other operations on the device (besides reading books/materials that have already been purchased and downloaded). Over all, I am very happy with my kindle, and have added a lot of books to my wish list!",Overall Great Device!;;;;;;
