If you're a little more picky and want something fancy, do not buy this kindle.",I think this is a great BASIC kindle.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"An O. K kindle coming from the kindle fire.. Would have purchased the kindle paper white for the additional $10 had I realized that there's no backlight. This limits my nighttime reading..Don't mind that it's even black and white, the no lighting is killing me!!!",An O. K kindle coming from the kindle fire ...;;;;;;

Review: Love it!  It is so light  - a pleasure to handle and read.  The fonts are awesome and help my not-so-good eye sight.  Being glare free is soooo good!  I read for pleasure and past time and love having a line up of books ready all the time.
Title;;;;;;: Love it! It is so light - a pleasure ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This basic Kindle is very good. I'm reading books on it now and it's battery is lasting quite well. Thank you, Amazon!",This basic Kindle is very good. I'm reading books on it now and it's ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my Kindle. I have only started one book on it, but I have downloaded almost 100 already so I can just keep on reading. I love the size, the light weight and that I can carry a variety of books with me without taking up the space.",love it;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought for husband, but he hasn't uploaded anything on it yet.  Is reading the Kindle instructions.  I commend him for that.  I still don't know how to TOTALLY turn mine off, so it won't bleed my battery dry.","Bought for husband, but he hasn't uploaded anything on ...";;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Some other reviewers are bashing those of us who prefer the ""old"" button page turners. That's OK, it's a preference, but I still like the buttons better, and for me the old one was easier to navigate.",but I still like the buttons better;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This kindle is the best just for book! It's small enough to fit anywhere and really nice for reading at the beach, or anywhere outside! The battery from just buying it lasted over a week and I read everyday. I would highly recommend this.",This kindle is the best just for book;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"This device is a piece of junk. It should not be sold.  I had a very early Kindle (with a physical key board and speaker). It died and I was offered this with a small discount as a replacement as my original Kindle was 5 plus years old. I regret paying even $40 for it.  First,  I already have a big investment in Audible books, which I love. However, I was NOT TOLD that this piece of junk has no SPEAKER!!!! Thus my audible books are no good to me. Second, This device is much harder to hold than the earlier models.  If your fingers just slightly brush the left side of the screen you go to the preceding page and if you happen to touch the right side then you go forward. This is a huge step backwards from the early Kindles where you had to touch an actual, real button to move back and forth. Third, this device is far less intuitive to navigate that the early models. Again it is vastly, poorly engineered, should have never been released. It has  badly damaged the brand.",What a pieve of junk!;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Lighter and easier to hold than a book, even a paperback.  Fairly easy to use, although it does take a bit to figure out all the ""how to's"".  Great for the beginner.  Great for us, book lovers with very little space to store books!",Fairly easy to use;;;;;;
5.0 out of 5 stars,"I only wish I tried this sooner! A real breakthrough in reading, with font choice and margins. Screen is also great.",Kindle Reader;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my second kindle.  I love them.  I love to read, almost anything.  Reading fiction relieves any stress by taking me away to another time and place.  I am really impressed by the touch screen at this price.",I love them. I love to read;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Amazing, the kindle unlimited selection is a little weak but I love the fact that I can email pdf's to it. Also the fact that reading it in the sunlight is no problem. I can't wait to read it by the pool!",Love my new Kindle;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"The OS is a pure nightmare. The synchronisation is nearly impossible. We were trying to load it up with books for the kids for traveling. Turns out that NONE of the books were actually loaded - only the preview picture.The management of each kids library DOES NOT EXIST on the kindle, and must be done on the computer. Again, a brain dead aspect when travelling. The kid system is actually totally dumb. Obviously, they NEVER had a kid. I can't decide if it was designed so an adult can keep the kids out, or what. We bought this as a Xmas present for a kid ... and gosh - reading on a laptop is easier for him!Thanks Kindle for letting my kids down, miles from any internet connection, and NO book to read.",The kid system is actually totally dumb. Obviously;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Worked as advertised although I returned mine as I didn't like that I couldn't use it in the dark. Sure, you can't read a book in the dark as Amazon says but this is an electronic device. Touchscreen response was a little slow but can't expect that fast of performance from a $59 device. Ended up returning & purchasing a Kindle Fire 6 HD which I am happy with so far........and reading in the dark.",Can't Read In the Dark;;;;;;

Review: I chose this kindle because of the type of screen (no back lighting). I look at a computer all day for work and wanted something that was easier on the eyes. This kindle definately fits the bill. Great product for the price.

Slower than mollases. Operating problems. Have replacement coming tomorrow. I don't know if the problems are particular to this unit or are widespread through this model. Paperwhite is different software than this model. Paperwhite will be purchased if replacement is NG.
Title;;;;;;: Slower than mollases. Operating problems. Have replacement coming ...;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have barely had time to use it, but the text is clear and easy to read. I will experiment more next week. I purchased it because soon I will be publishing an e-book, and I wanted to have the same experience my readers will be getting. I believe they will be very happy, as will I.",My first Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Great product. Light and easy to hold with one hand and great battery life. E-ink technology is best for long hours of text reading, easy on the eyes compared with using backlit lcd  panels found on tablets, smartphones, PCs etc.",Great for reading;;;;;;

Review: This is my first Kindle and I am truely enjoying the experience.  I particularly enjoy the ability to  look up words I am not familiar with immediately with no disruption to the story that is unfolding.
Title;;;;;;: I particularly enjoy the ability to look up words I am not ...;;;;;;

Review: This was a present to myself from myself with a whole lot of love. I do love this kindle and I love the fact that I bought it for myself with my own money. It is so nice to have when you travel or have to haul yourself around with a load of stuff. It is lightweight and easy to handle and such a nice invention. Thank you to whomever invented it. I wish I had purchased it a long time ago.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Great device without all the bells and whistles. The only thing that would be nicer, is if the screen had options if lightness,  so if you need to use it in a darker room you could see it without turning a light on in the room.",Great device without all the bells and whistles;;;;;;

Review: I'm very frustrated trying to work it.  My old Kindle with side buttons was all I needed.  Do you have any of the old ones left?  I only use it to read books.
Title;;;;;;: I'm very frustrated trying to work it. My old ...;;;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm sad I cannot get a new Kindle that's as easy to change pages as my old one. I never had to lift my thumb. This one as well as paperwhite,not only do you need to swipe the page but you have to be right handed because you can only swipe on the right hand side of the page.",Buy only if right handed;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"i bought this as a gift for my wife. so after buying this, i tested it to check for any possible defects. it's good that i never found any issues on the device. for reading e-books, i think this is superb! there's nothing else better than kindle when it comes to ebook reading. your eyes will never get tired/painful, and yes you can read long enough until you drop, but the battery won't drop and it won't let you down. =)",it's good that i never found any issues on the device;;;;;;

Review: Nice cheap kindle. Buy a cover! I brought my first one to the beach and it was all scratched up from the sand.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my fourth kindle in four years.On two, the screen broke.  One was clearly Mt fault, the second was not so obvious why out broke.I got the Bright to replace number one. I didn't like it. I got a headache from reading with it, so I have it to my wife. She doesn't mind it.If I need light to read, I use the kindle app on my smart phone.So my last kindle is the one that you swipe, but the screen is not backlit.I like it so far. It's also a bit thicker than the previous kindles;" maybe that will protect the circuit board for the screen better.""
Review: I didn't like it. I got a headache from reading with ...";;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,I don't love it and I don't hate it. My husband got a good deal on for my Christmas presents so that is a plus. Also I like that it's glare-free for me to use outdoors. I will say after using the Kindle app on my iPhone it's hard to adjust to the screen not being as bright. Overall I like it for outdoor use and when I'm taking a bath.,"Nice, but needs some advance settings";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Exactly what we expected from the description given.  Love the glare free screen.  Fortunately we had read a review that reminded us the power cord was not included, so had ordered it at the same time. Happy with this order.",Love the glare free screen;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"This is the third Kindle I've had. None have lasted a full year. All three have had the same problem - all of a sudden, for no discernible reason, the bottom half of the screen freezes on whatever happened to be on screen at the time (either an ad or text). And it won't clear, it won't go away. I've tried everything to fix it. Ok, I tried everything to fix the first two. This one, I'm not even bothering with it. It's trash. I'm not buying anymore. My DIL has a Nook that she's had for years with no problem. I'm off to look at getting one of my own. So disappointed but with cheap imported Chinese garbage, I don't know why I'd expect these things to actually last more than a few months.",Third one to die in just under 2 years.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first e-reader and I love it. Nice size, easy to use. This one is not the back-lit model, but I decided I didn't need that for the difference in price between this one and the back-lit model. Couldn't be happier.",This is my first e-reader and I love it. Nice size;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Here's the thing: this might be fine for someone who reads a bit, or a kid who wants a new toy, but when I purchase a ereader, it should be good at doing the one thing I purchase it for - READING!If I wanted a tablet, I'd use my iPad or get a kindle fire.Perhaps they should create a new reader called the Bookworm, just for us obsessive readers :)Maybe a simple audiobook reader for those into audio or text to voice called the Storyteller :)When you make an entry level item that tries to do everything, it often does nothing really well.Annoying that you can't have buttons anymore *without* a lit screen (I work on computers all day) and have a touchscreen that is not needed to enjoy reading a book. I am forever touching the screen and changing pages accidentally. If someone wants to swipe/touch to page turn (why go backward - I can do that with a real book or iPad/tablet) there could easily be a toggle to turn off the touchscreen. As an avid reader of 3-4 books per week, here are my requirements in a reader: no touchscreen or toggle touchscreen to avoid accidental page turns; if you must have a touchscreen
Review: tapping anywhere on the screen should advance pages (how often do you go back
Title;;;;;;: honestly); going backward should be out of the way button
column4: say at the top; I shouldn't have to swipe to page turn on an ereader or app
column5: dude
column6: it's an ereader
column7: not a real book
column8: changing pages is the thing most likely to interrupt the flow of a story
column9: especially when I accidentally backs wipe or highlight something (I'm a reader not a student
column10: highlighting is unneeded for my purposes); highlighting and other functions should never be accidentally triggered; browsing and purchasing new books should be possible from any reader or app i( I am looking at you iPad kindle app);" should not have to get a lit screen to get standard features like buttons! Should be able to read in the sun and with uv sunglasses.""
column11: Do the designers read with a kindle
column12: or just play with it? Different kindles for different audiences."""

Review: I love this Kindle. It's so simple and easy to use. No glare keeps me from getting headaches the way I normally do. I'm probably going to purchase another so the husband and I don't have to fight over the one.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Awesome, love the easy touch screen and the fact that there is no glare.  Makes it easy to read everywhere.","Awesome, love the easy touch screen and the fact ...";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this Kindle to replace my 2011 version. This newer Kindle is not quite as slim or light weight, but it still very purse-friendly. The touch screen feature is a welcome addition and makes turning pages much easier.",Excellent version of lowest-priced Kindle;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Just received this yesterday and had a ball looking around in it for some reading material.Being VERY unfamiliar with this technology I am exploring and asking questions of all that have a Kindle.Will be using for years to come I am sure.Can not do a recommend at this time, since I have not had the chance to really get to know it.",Enjoying the fun of reading anywhere!;;;;;;

Review: good buy - I bought the kids bundle for myself - I don't need the light and wanted just a plain e reader.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first e-reading device, and I love it. It's far more portable and convenient to take to work and read during my breaks. It's extremely light, and small enough to fit in my hand bag. The display is perfect, the letters are as crisp as actual print.",and I love it. It's far more portable and convenient to ...;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I ordered the 6"" Kindle so that I could read outside in the sun. I have a Kindle Fire and it is impossible to read it anywhere but inside. Perhaps I am comparing the 6"" to the Fire but it seems a little flimsy and cheaply made. I also ordered the case to go along with it and it is not very sturdy. It does suit the purpose and is an easy read in the sun. I was pleased that all of my books transferred from the Fire to the 6"" easily. I have not tried to download any new reading material, but the process seems similar to the Fire...hope it works as well. Overall, I would say it is okay if all you want to do is read outside. There is no backlight so you wont be able to read at night in a dark room. To get that feature, you will have to spend more money on the paper white Kindle that will be released soon.",OK if all you want to do is read outside with no glare;;;;;;

Review: I have my old kindle can I put my old books on the new one? How can I put the right time on the kindle?

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Nice upgrade to my original Kindle with the keyboard.  Easy to use, syncs quickly with my other Kindle.",Five Stars;;;;;;
5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my Kindle!  I can now have needle craft patterns, recipes and reading material at my fingertips.",Five Stars;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"It turns on a lot without me touching it but I am going to get a case for it soon, so that shouldn't be a problem.  Otherwise, just as easy to use as my last Kindle, but with awesome touch screen that I have to get used to!",just as easy to use as my last Kindle;;;;;;

Review: Product exceeded my expectations. I like being able to change fond size. When my eyes get tired I can increase font size. Screen image is sharp and contrast is crisp. Downloads are quick. I recommend this product

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Great device! Easy to use but a bit difficult getting  accustomed to the touch system, even though I use an iPhone all the time. Review: This kindle won't let me register. It keeps saying the login info does not match any Amazon accounts on record. But I will use the same info on my computer and it will work. I gave this kindle as a gift and they can't even register to buy books.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Great!! Love the touch screen My first Kindle has the button on the bottom, the touch screen is super!",Five Stars;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Absolutely fantastic device for my seven-year-old daughter. My only complaint is the advertisements in the display in the lock screen. There is no way that I have found to remove them, nor are all of them appropriate for my daughter's age.","Great for reading, but...";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is the best thing could ever happen to my daughter, perfect for people who loves to read no matter where they are. Furthermore, it's a great tool to encourage reading in children and young adults.",Just perfect!;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,Convenient to use. Very light and very sharp characters. Easy on the eyes. Love it. The only thing is that it's kind of awkward to tip the side to flip the pages if you are holding it at the bottom with one hand.,"Good buy, love it!";;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"It is good, but with the screen not being able to turn it makes it hard to lay down and read. Also it maybe ""no glare"" but there's still a glare and you have to be in good lighting to be able to read...","It is good, but with the screen not being able to ...";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,I like this item. It's very handy and fits in all of my handbags. The only thing I do not like about it is that the display is a bit dark. I cannot find any brightness controls on the device so I had to purchase a clip on light to go with it.,"Great device, but a bit dim in the display.";;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"It was fine, however, I probably should have went for the Fire model, which has more features for 20% more costs.Otherwise, I am reasonably satisfied, except for not being able to adjust the screen brightness for daylight reading.","It was fine, however";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I like the functions, but it feels too much like a toy ... I feel that reading is a serious activity, but this kindle kind of makes it feel like you are playing video game.  I loved the original Kindle (with keyboard);" mine broke after a few years (the screen went bad after I took it hiking) otherwise I would not have replaced it.  The touch screen of this new Kindle is good

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"Lightweight, easy to use. I miss having a background light so if you are used to that you might want to go up to paperwhite despite the extra cost. Moves a little slow between screens. Very basic but perfect for travel and reading outside. If you have the money do paperwhite instead.","Very basic, but functional";;;;;;
4.0 out of 5 stars,"after learning how to use with local library staff, I am enjoying the light weight and ease of use.",My first Kindle--I like!;;;;;;

Review: Touchscreen is awful. Messes up page navigation all the time. Get something with physical buttons!

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"If it lasts it is a great buy. I guess some of the bad reviews are because they rearranged the touch screen differently but I didn't use it the old version so for me no problem at all.Pros: great price, easy set up, small, light weightedCons: need light to readFor the price you really can't ask for more!",all in all a great buy!;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"good value for the price, only drawback is that it lacks a backlight (as stated in it's description) so you need to read it under the same lighting conditions that you would need to read a regular book.",good value for the price;;;;;;

Review: First Kindle had problem.  Exchanged was hassle-free.  Dealing with Amazon is always a pleasure.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I upgraded from the original Kindle.  I really like the touchscreen, and the ease of adjusting.",Better than before;;;;;;

Review: My series one was good but this version of the Kindle is great! I really like the touch screen.
Title;;;;;;: Nice update to the original units.;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Just spent 7 days on the beach and this kindle was great. While everyone was trying to turn the pages of their book, one swipe and I was on to the next page.  Highly recommend for anyone who loves to read outside in the sun.",... 7 days on the beach and this kindle was great. While everyone was trying to turn the pages ...;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I often use my smartphone to read books -- with a 5-6"" screen, most smartphones are great for this purpose now. And I use a program called 'screen filter' to significantly darken my phone screen beyond its typical minimum brightness. This isn't a bad solution. However, the phone's screen is still a little brighter than I'd like but any darker and it would become difficult to read.I'd read about the Paperwhite's back light and it sounded like that'd be a great solution. A very subtle back light I could use and maintain easy readability. Even though the device is much slower and less responsive than a phone, and much physically larger, and has no physical buttons that you can use to turn pages as you can with a phone's volume buttons, I thought it would be worth while for the back light.When Amazon had their prime day sale (more like prime day fail, am i rite guys?) I grabbed a kindle that i'd been considering for some time. The way they set up the sale, you are expected to hurry and buy without thinking and without looking at the product, but i'd already considered it and knew i wanted one, so the price seemed like a great opportunity. Unfortunately, Amazon removed the single killer-feature that this thing had and i was unaware.""Buying"" books on kindle can save you money even though many prefer the physical books. Keep in mind you do not own ebooks and there have been several instances of Amazon taking away people's books from their devices, and removing their accounts, such as the instance of Linn Nygaard. Amazon reminded users that they do not own ebooks they purchase, but that they only have a license to view them that Amazon can revoke at any time and they've done so historically without any explanation to the users and in many cases without any potential recourse.This device would probably be nice for reading books outside. For my purposes, unfortunately, it's inferior to a mobile phone in every way.","No backlight, not a great replacement for reading on smartphone at night";;;;;;

Review: I sent this back because of the screen not being bright enough. A good many extra lights to attach or the light that comes with some cases will use those expensive tiny flat round batteries. I would have spent a fortune on those tiny batteries.
Title;;;;;;: The glow of this attraction didn't last long.;;;;;;

Review: Very happy with the Kindle.  Straight forward e-reader - easy to use and comfortable to hold.

Super disappointing. I loved my old Kindle and am just not into the touch screen. It's also completely infuriating that there are NO case options with a light. My old Kindle was the very basic model and I had a basic case with light. Apparently Amazon would like to force users into the more expensive paperwhite at this point. Considering returning.
Title;;;;;;: Super disappointing. I loved my old Kindle and am ...;;;;;;

Review: Awesome reading experience! Wish I could actually customize the lock screen on the device :/

Rating: 2.0 out of 5 stars,"Good quality and nice screen, but file support is not that great. I wish it supported .epub",Two Stars;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"spent a long time with Amazon support before I could get it registered. This was a Christmas present for one of my children. Amazon support couldn't even figure out which Kindle I had. The first support guy passed my over to a ""specialist"" who then had me put in the serial number AGAIN and then had me go through the device again menu system to put in the same serial number AGAIN. Apparently the one they sent out to me wasn't the one that was registered to my account. I could understand the problem if we had purchased from a third party, but this was purchased from Amazon. Common Amazon logistics !. Nothing worse than buying a present and spending 2 hours on Christmas day trying to figure out why it won't work..",Nothing worse than buying a present and spending 2 hours on ...;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I miss understood the description, this one does not have a back lit screen. wish I would have spent a little more for that option. but this unit is a good one for daytime reading. if you intend to read in bed you will have to have the light on. The battery life is amazing, Ive had this just about a month and have only charged it the initial first charge.",good unit;;;;;;

Review: It was hard to use and the quality of the screen was horrible. I returned it a couple of days later. It also wouldn't connect to kindle to buy books. Don't waste your time. If you want a tablet pay a little extra and get the better one.

I got this for my hubby because he doesn't read often so thought another paperwhite would be a waste.  WRONG - should have gotten the paperwhite.  This one just isn't the same quality and it's full of advertisements.  Not at all what we expected.
Title;;;;;;: ... read often so thought another paperwhite would be a waste. WRONG - should have gotten the paperwhite;;;;;;

Review: I have a very nice tablet.  The Kindle is much easier on my eyes.  I can read longer without my eyes getting tired.  I am impressed with the battery life!  I only charge the Kindle once every other week.
Title;;;;;;: I have a very nice tablet. The Kindle is much easier on my ...;;;;;;

Review: I bought the Kindle to replace my physical books. However from day one I realized that the default brightness of the screen in ambient light is very poor compared to a paper book. The Kindle requires quite a lot of ambient light to be easily readable. Is there any comparison to what the brightness levels are compared to the paper. I know printing paper have brightness standards and that plays a very important role in how visible the print is in ambient light.  The screen is almost grey and not white as  I would have liked it to be. Hopefully future versions of Kindle will fix this brightness and improve readability in limited light.
The touchscreen feature does not always do as instructed and requires numerous attempts.
Really like it but I will need to get a light at some point. Very easy to use. Im happy.

This works great but I really should have bought the next size up. I'm getting older and making the letters bigger only means more page turns. Also... no backlight and I've yet to find a good cover with a built in light. I tend to read after my husband is asleep. A light would be handy.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love it, it is exactly what I expected. Very light weight. Easy to hold while reading. I use it when I am at the pool with my grand-kids my kindle fire was hard to use because of the glare and this is perfect.","I love it, it is exactly what I expected";;;;;;

Review: This is just what a 10 year old boy who would rather play video games needs.  He reads!

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchased this e-reader to replace my kindle keyboard.  It's a very comfortable size for extended reading periods.  I found it a little difficult to understand transferring my collections and books, but with helpful assistance from Amazon I worked it out.  The only negatives I've found. 1) screen is too sensitive.  Font is often changed without meaning to change it.  2) I am used to using the page forward & back on the sides of my old kindle, now I sometimes page back in error.",It's a very comfortable size for extended reading periods;;;;;;

Review: So far I love it. Very lightweight and easy to hold one handed. Very easy to setup. Only complaint which is minor. You would think by now they would add a light feature to read in dark. I mostly read in bed and solved issue with clip on light but would be more convenient if built in

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a disappointment.  I find this new Kindle awkward to use, the screen is difficult to read at times, and having the ad come on when it is turned on is really aggravating - it is not easy to get rid of it.  I am returning it and getting the Paperwhite.  Without the ads.","Not recommended, at least not for me";;;;;;
1.0 out of 5 stars,"I want to send this item back ,It doesn't read out loud. I need to know how to send this item back.","I want to send this item back, It doesn't ...";;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"Out of date, this is like using a Palm pilot. Yes, thank god, it finally has a touch screen, which it should have had five years ago, but the software is old, the resolution is poor and the feel is cheap. The screen also jumps between high contrast white and black when changing pages. Overall, it's very stressful on my eyes. Amazon really has no excuse for making such a poor product. They really need to upgrade this basic kindle, especially for the price. I returned it and will continue to use my library.",Out of date;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"Very upset, just 4 months in my kindle will not charge, this is to do with the connection at the top? Will not take any chargers with narrow piece , even though I have charged it many times before. Now I believe it was a waste of money",Now I believe it was a waste of;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"It is not glare-free when using an LED book light, but with some adjustment that is very easy to work around. Otherwise this has become my favorite kindle device.The touchscreen is nice and responsive, and my eyes can read for hours on this device. With my kindle fire or the kindle apps on my smartphone my eyes get tired faster.This was a gift. It was really nice to be able to pay Amazon the extra money to get rid of the free offers.",My favorite kindle thus far.;;;;;;

Review: I have had my Kindle Fire for about 4 yrs now and I am just now having to replace it because it will no longer charge! I have truly enjoyed my kindle! If you love to read then I recommend this product 100%
Title;;;;;;: I have truly enjoyed my kindle;;;;;;

Review: Good. But little bit useless :)I mean we do not use it a lot as other devices

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"It is easy to use, holds battery power for weeks!, and is light weight.  I love it!",Five Stars;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"This item worked for about 3 months, then started making up its own mind about whether to turn a page or what font it wanted to display. Turning it off and then on again doesn't help. Closing it and using my Nook for a couple of books allows the Kindle to rest sufficiently--or come to its senses--for half an hour or so, then it's up to its old tricks. It's a good size, and when it's functioning, does exactly what I want. However, it's frustrating to have to stop a book in the middle, read something else somewhere else, then come back and try to remember characters and plot. The problem is intermittent, and frustrating.","When it's good it's very very good, but when it's not...";;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm still learning how to use this new Kindle. I do not like the way the menu shows which books I have available., and I have to read up on how to erase a book after I have finished it. those are just matters I have to learn to adjust to. I have adjusted to the swipe screen and find it easier to use than anticipate, and I like the clarity and easy to read screen.",OK so far;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"This device is hardly an improvement from the former button-model Kindle.  In its fervor to join the touchscreen craze, Amazon designers created a vastly inferior, user-unfriendly product.  Far more difficult to navigate than its simper predecessor, users can no longer see their owned books in a sequenced listing, but must conduct a tortuous search jumping from one screen to another in a futile attempt to locate the screen on which the system has randomly placed a title. Shame on you, Jeff Bezos!",TERRIBLE DESGN;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"We are definitely an Amazon family. The addition of this new glare-free kindle keeps my little one learning on the go. The only feature I wish it has is a text-to-speak feature, so it could read to her.",Great for the whole family!;;;;;;
5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my Kindle, and the fact that it was delivered on a Sunday is unbelievable!",Five Stars;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"IT IS INDEED GLARE FREE IN OUTDOOR OR DIRECT LIGHTING BUT IS DIFFICULT TO READ IN REDUCED LIGHTING.  MY FIRST KINDLE FIRE IS GREAT IN REDUCED LIGHTING BUT NOT GOOD OUTSIDE, SO IS THERE NO KINDLE THAT HAS BACK LIGHTING FOR INSIDE AS WELL AS GLARE FREE OUTSIDE ?",MY FIRST KINDLE FIRE IS GREAT IN REDUCED LIGHTING BUT NOT GOOD OUTSIDE;;;;;;

Review: Pages are difficult to turn when reading a book. Right margin needs more space.

The instructions were written back to front and I had to search for the items I wished to understand. Not really impressed with this Kindle as I find it hard to place my books in the order that I want. Also touch screen is overated.
Title;;;;;;: The instructions were written back to front and I had ...;;;;;;

Rating: 2.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a far inferior product to my previous Kindle. There is no button on the device to press to take me back to the home screen. There is no connection for a case that comes with a built in light (and of COURSE there is no option for backlight). I am extremely disappointed with Amazon's design for the ""new"" generation Kindle. Don't buy it. Unless you honestly can afford only the cheap option. Because that's what this is. It's a cheap piece of ****.",Inferior design;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"The 6"" Glare Free Touchscreen Display is another beautiful Kindle product. But I am having a hard time operating it. I downloaded my books from the Cloud and it looked great. Then I went to another field and I'm still there. How do I get back to the screen that shows me what books do I have on the Kindle?",Confused right now about how to use it?;;;;;;

Review: Purchased the new kindle as my old one quit working and used it all the time. I have 2 issues 1) books are now stored in a cloud and are no longer seperated by archived and unread so have to search through 165 books to find the books i have not read. 2) tried to read a new book while camping and due to no wifi/internet access could not retrive from cloud so no book for 4 days. Only suggestion from kindle was to check on my old kindle to see which book's were not archived. If i could do that would not have needed a new one.

I like it for reading.No glare screen so you can read for hours. It also has dictionary installed and will be up automatically when you select a word.I just hate the Kindle Store when access from Kindle. It doesn't show different genres of Kindle books that I might like. Just because I bought one or two romance novels doesn't means that would  all I ever want to read. I still prefer self-help books but those nearly never came-up in my search in Kindle Store. I am also not able to choose that category when looking for books.I look for Kindle books and buy them from my laptop.
Title;;;;;;: Love the Kindle. Hate the Kindle Store.;;;;;;

Review: It will freeze up nd you can't turn pages. You can not point to a word and get instant definition. Very disappointing. I want my buttons back. Since my Kindle fire can be depended on I am just going t use it. Dennis

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Easy to download, use, read & understand. Fast shipping! In great condition.",Wonderful e reader!;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"Cold weather equals not working.  Also, as an aside, what is up with the random rescaling of the fonts?  I'm a bit annoyed I bought two books to read and I did get through the first one, so it's not that hard to deal with the occasional rescaling of font size - though that's annoying, but on my second night on the porch here in Michigan - it's about 20 degrees, which is way above my cold point, but the dang thing literally froze up.  If I bring it in the house it reacts again, so I don't think this unit is defective, but I didn't get touch gloves for Christmas to hang out in the house.  I also worry about dropping it, as I like to drop my paperbacks at my convenience.  I guess I'm glad I have it (I didn't buy it) when I traveled overseas.  This little gentle thing is OK, but I guess I'm confirmed in my love of used book stores - shucks though, I like having cheap internet books handy.  I will certainly use this (especially until I finish this book) but I'm rather pissed off that I can't use it outside in winter / cold weather.",I'm a bit annoyed I bought two books to read and I did ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I was told ""The instructions come with it.""  NOPE!  You have to KNOW HOW to use a Kindle in order to LEARN HOW to use it.  Dumb, huh?  Not me!  I have a college degree,and I am a Pro PhotoShop Wizard, but no eReader Knowledge. WORTH the struggle  But, what of?  WHAT OF!!  The sheer ingenious of this ereader BLEW ME AWAY!!  I have downloaded FREE books from BookBub (highly rated!) to my PC.  Then I read HOW-TO download my entire Folder of my eBooks to my Kindle IN A SNAP!  Or a choice of downloading only one at a time,  But WHY would 'ya? (lol)  'Cause this great gizmo can hold a bi-zillion.  My poor aching hands don't protest at all to this light, LIGHTER THAN A PAPERBACK , easy to use & enjoy KINDLE.  I had to read with a light on before, 'tis no big deal to not have the PaperWhite, and this deal was irresistable!  LOVE MY KINDLE..","Finding the HOW-TO, worth it!";;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I can't rate it because I couldn't charge it.  It was a gift.  I wanted to download a book for the recipient.  I gave it away, probably wasted $60 as the recipient is not computer savvy, can't see why they would be able to charge it if I could not.  INSTRUCTIONS ARE ON THE DEVICE WHICH WON'T CHARGE.",No Instructions DEVICE (Kindle)  WON'T CHARGE;;;;;;

Review: I had a Kindle with the keyboard at the bottom - so I'm still learning to use the touch screen. I wouldn't be without my new Kindle. Even though my fingers go to the right edge and left edge to turn pages yet; I only have to unlearn that and get used to the swiping for page turns. The reading and lack of glare are excellent. And it's a little lighter.Thanks for a great product!
Title;;;;;;: The reading and lack of glare are excellent. And it's a little lighter;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"It has an add on the screen unless you pay money to have it turned on. This is a add subsidized device. I don't mind it but I hope it does not cause screen burn in. Its a great device, I am still getting used to touching the screen in the right places but its not too bad. If I don't use it in a while I have trouble remembering how to get main menu up. Books with lighter or pencil pictures or drawings like the heads first oreilly books don't display well but if you have an issue just return the book to amazon. All the negatives aside its great, its easier to read on here than a regular book, good text spacing and adjustable font size. Its cheap so I am not worried about it getting stolen.I will say the cover for it is really expensive. You might want to get a higher version which has more covers available at lower cost. For like 10 - 20 more I could have gotten a better kindle and a really cool cover instead of a black one. The black one I have is nice but its basic. Plan ahead.","Good, but make sure this is the one you want.";;;;;;

Review: Good Device but I am wondering how to reboot this kindle if left in the heat too long. My other kindle was able to do this because it had a push button for the off switch but this new kindle has a button on the screen which won't help me if it is fried. But a good read anyway.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"It's really nice device for reading. Very handy, easy to use, paper like screen, battery holds charge strong, touchscreen gestures are intuitive. If you read a lot, this Kindle reader is great choice.",It's really nice device for reading;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"The screen is a little small.  I don't like the fact that you can not turn it off.  It is very hard to access the screen to change things, because you have to carefully touch just the bare minimum outside of the screen.  My 3rd kindle decided to die.  I bought this one thinking that it would be simpler, and maybe last more than a year, but I am disappointed with my decision.",Not as good as the fire version.;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am a writer and self publish through Kindle. I use it to proof read my books and it has features such as ""save your place"", ""highlight text"", and other cool things that make it easy to use for this purpose. Love it!!",Proof read with this Kindle;;;;;;

Review: I was looking for a newer kindle like the original Kindle. This was a major disappointment. Too many changes to the diplay format makes this the worst Kindle to ever hit the market. I gave this one away hopefully they will like it.

Bloody awful Kindle - too difficult to control - virtually impossible to change font size without a degree in computers!Why do Geeks continue to develop items that can only be understood by Geeks?If there was an alternative item available with the original specifications I would throw this in the rubbish-bin and buy it!

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"I have the worst concentration and I hate reading. I forced myself in buying one of these so I had no excuse to avoid reading and honestly its the best thing I've done in a while, top selling points for me is that it totally eliminates any distraction and its very easy on the eyes as oposed to staring a light bulb all day (any device) you can write notes, word wise and x-ray. I can't leave home without it, that's how bad I like reading now.",I have the worst concentration and I hate reading;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I paid 49.99 for this model, it's good for this particular price, after using it for a long while, I'd say that I wouldn't pay 79.99 for it.  It's rather difficult to read if you don't have very sufficient lighting, and I find the contrast on the screen varies, the font on the upper part of the screen is darker than the bottom part, which can be annoying.  Also, don't expect the edges of the fonts to be sharp and clear, you will be disappointed, it's a budget reader.",If you have a tight budget...;;;;;;

Review: Reading on the Kindle is easier on my eyes than reading on my iPad.
Title;;;;;;: So pleased with my new Kindle;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"don't let the price fool you this is a well crafted reading device with all the software pluses that the paperwhite and voyage have minus the light. Nice dark text and flawless and quick page turns, if you want a solid reader look no further...",Nice dark text and flawless and quick page turns;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Bought this to read in the sun and it is fine for that.  no frills but don't need them as I only use it to read outside. The only reason I rated it 4 was because it does not automatically sync with my Kindle Fire HD which I use the most.  I have to manually sync it, sometimes several times, before it goes to the most current page read..",... this to read in the sun and it is fine for that;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"None of the Kindle e-readers support audio anymore! Unlike the older versions which supported audible audio books and mp3, now one is forced to buy a tablet to listen to audio books. Sadly, many people including myself, find tablets inferior to readers for actual reading. Tablet display creates far greater eye strain than e-ink.",No audio support!!!;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I wanted an E-book ,not a damn complicated POS. Some damn techno geek had to go and make it harder to use. Inadvertantly touch the screen and you loose your page , or bring up some useless info you don't need or want. If there was a way to bring my old one back from the dead I WOULD. Not happy with it.",or bring up some useless info you don't need or want;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Much easier to use then the button navigation Kindle. Small, lightweight. Only issue so far is that none of the advertised lighted cases for a Kindle Touch fit this newest version. I have returned two cases so far and checked a few stores. No luck yet. (There are no contact points on the back of the Kindle and therefore the case needs to have its own power source).",Kindle better than button version;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"It takes me forever to find my library. I tap the screen to advance the screen because swiping screws everything up. I'm really confused with how to use the device. I spend more time fiddling than reading. I do like the large print feature, when I can figure it out. And then, to apply using it on the next book. I admit, I'm not an up-to-date techy. I still live in a cave.",I do like the large print feature;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this Kindle for an elderly friend who had been using a prior version which had ""died."" This Kindle doesn't offer the Home Page and Menu like the old one so it is harder for her to manage her books. She needed large print. The largest is too big with too few words on the page;" however
Review: the next to largest is a bit too small....Is going to take some adjustments!""
Title;;;;;;: "" This Kindle doesn't offer the Home Page and Menu like the old one so it is harder for her ...""";;;;;

Review: Great product  Long lasting battery.  Clear and easy to read.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"First one died, I figured that I would be buying a new one but I called and after some very efficient tech help amazon replaced it. I love the service and I really love my Fire. I mean I really love it.",Love it;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"Buyer beware! Amazon adds a default yearly charge to your amazon account (kindle subscription fee) simply for using the kindle unless you opt out. I'm unaware of any other technology company that does this with their devices. I feel cheated by a company I've used for years, liked and trusted.",Buyer beware!;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"Product failed in a few months, one of two kindles that failed in a month. We're on a world tour and now have no Kindle device, no access to Library except via phone app. Terrible experience with customer service, hours on the phone, refusal to ship replacements overseas, lame and false excuses given. From my experience, these are not good products.",Bad experience with product and service;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,Received my new kindle yesterday and yes it is very easy on the eyes. However I deducted 2 stars because after paying for an ad free Kindle I still can not change the screensaver and can not change the order of my books the way I want them to appear. I'm really unhappy with that.,"Kindle  6"" Glare- Free Touchscreen.";;;;;;

Review: Finally a device that can be read out in the sun. Thank you.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Very practical and comfortable, easy to use and nice design.",Five Stars;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"The version of kindle is the thickest among all generations of kindle. My friend has the previous generation which is with buttons on each side of the kindle. That one is the lightest weight. The processor is little faster but a touch-screen doesn't really make this generation more advanced. I don't recommend this generation with 79$ regular price. If you really want it, get it with 49$ holiday sales. Other e-reader like kindle paperwhite or voyage are better in term of weight and function.",Heavy weight than any kindle generations!;;;;;;

Review: I was a little disappointed with this kindle. The screen is not very well lit and there's no setting to make it brighter. I have not used it outside yet. I also don't like these new updates and the quantity of them. Trying to move a book off the device and to the carousel is unclear. I'm afraid I'm going to erase it due to the options giving.
Title;;;;;;: Screen is too dark. I'm glad I only paid $49.;;;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"Hated it.  Sent it back in exchange for a Paperwhite.  It was hard to read and I definitely was going crazy within the first day.  The Paperwhite is much, much better for not much of a price difference.","If you like squinting, this is the Kindle for you";;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"The worst experience with Amazon Ever. I purchased first kindle for my young reader. Received as usual. Very slow interface and touching the screen was x-Ray as best I can describe it. Called customer service, I was explained that this was a defective item and issued pre placement. Replacement had exact same problem. Returned Both within a month, but never was issued my refund bc ""I was issued a replacement!"" 80$ to garbage. I am reconsidering renewing my Amazon subscription. Very disappointed. Worst customer service.","Worst experience with Amazon, poor product and awful customer service.";;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"The Kindle 6"" Glare-Free Touchscreen is better than I had hoped! Now, instead of packing bulky books, this reader takes up hardly any space and is very easy to use. I also love that it stays charged for days!",Small reader packs a HUGE PUNCH!;;;;;;

Review: I had the original Kindle and managed to crack it... I love the new one! I will probably buy a cover to protect it from its predecessor's fate - my elbow. The ease in navigating has really been improved!

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"I am now on my 4th kindle after experiencing the dreaded ""screen freeze"" again. You might wonder why I keep buying this device given the lack of durability? The answer is simple. This is the ONLY e-reader that does not have a backlit screen. I am an avid reader for work and pleasure and cannot force my eyes to do more ""screen"" time and the kindle really does replicate reading paper. That's why I LOVE my kindle! It is almost constantly within my reach and usually in my hands.Sadly, the non-backlit kindle is now a touchscreen. While this is good for highlights etc., I am constantly having to turn it on and off to keep from having multiple unintentional page turns. I will adapt to this change, but I have written this review to talk about the new interface.I have always appreciated that the kindle comes with a cloud for archived items and that I can access my content from my computer, my tablet, my phone, and my kindle. The portability is wonderful.However, on my kindle, I need to organize my current reading (which is large because I use it for reference works too) ON THE DEVICE. This is now difficult and awkward. I can see my previous collections in the cloud, but why can't I simply move them to the device? Having to search for and then move each title individually is tedious and frustrating and really shouldn't be.Come on Amazon - get it together. I would be happy, as a power user of your product, to help you make this better. Please.","Love my kindle, but 6th Gen interface NEEDS IMPROVEMENT!";;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"Pro: Very portable and easy to operate. Screen is perfect for reading in any type of lighting. Battery life is great. Much lighter that carrying hard copy.Con: They do not disclose that some e-books will not work. I bought a textbook about C++ programming that works on my PC based Kindle application, but does not work with the Kindle reader. It could be because of the lack of color but it does not state why. This was the first book I tried to read and I was very disappointed to see it fail compatibility. At this point, I still don't know for sure which books are compatible until after I buy it. Not cool. The readers page numbers are not synced with the books page numbers. That results in the book index becoming almost useless.Update: Despite what they claim, there is no compatibility information on textbooks at the time you buy them. To date, not a single textbook has worked on this device. I do not recommend for students. Waste of money.",Warning: Many e-books do not work with the reader.;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I love kindle, I love Amazon. The only reason that I did not give this kindle 5 stars is due to the following: no cases are available with the built in light. My husband and I ordered two of these believing them to be back lit. They are not. My husband doesn't care so much about a case with a light. I do. I read in low light, or in places where more than your average room light will simply not due. The cases that are currently available have these cheap clip on lights. Can't do it. The old kindle I have now has a case with a built in light.. I'm in love, yet alas, it is getting old and has dim/dark spots showing up on the screen. This makes me sad sad sad. In closing, I have to send this kindle back for a paper white which is more expensive, yet I have to believe it will be worth it in the long run. Amazon: you come out with a new kindle, WITHOUT a light, make positive you have a case with a built in light READY to go! In fact sell them together!","I love kindle, I love Amazon";;;;;;

Review: I was on the phone for 30 minutes trying to activate this Kindle. With a representative who had a heavy foreign accent I could not understand and  made me feel like an idiot because I did not understand his technical terms. Enough I returned it today.
Title;;;;;;: With a representative who had a heavy foreign accent I could not understand and made me feel like an idiot because I did not und;;;;;;

Review: great. holds a charge forever. easy to use. love it.

I liked the book  that describing how to use the  kIndle but  for  US  that don't know  any thing about electronics I wish there were more explanation  such as  how to borrow  books  from kindle and our local libraries and  what the aberrations mean. I would like to see the same screen  on all the  kindle  fires so like people like me can use  It out side I can't  use my Kindle Fire when I'm out side.  Thank you kathy
Title;;;;;;: I liked the book that describing how to use the kIndle ...;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Only because I didn't investigate, I didn't realizere are it was only a reader , I thought I could have solitaire too. I was also disappointed that I could not read in dim light there are no brightness settings.",lightweight reader for being outdoors;;;;;;

Review: Disappointed that no instructions came with this unit. I had to spend quite some time finding this particular Kindle on my computer so that I could print it out and learn how to use it. Would not have ordered it had I known what I was up against.Bill Shefrin
Title;;;;;;: Disappointed that no instructions came with this unit;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I give it a 4 because I don't like the home screen with the book ad's at the bottom. Also, I haven't figured out how to turn off wi-fi yet on this new one. I know I'm going to enjoy this Kindle but I sure miss the 2nd Edition that I used for 9 years.",I give it a 4 because I don't like the home screen with the book ad's at the ...;;;;;;

Review: It will change font size without any input from me.

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"This is an excellent tool especially for traveling. I bought this for my son for his school reading homework and he's in love with it. My only complaint is that it can be a little slow, other than that it functions well.",Bought this for my son.;;;;;;
5.0 out of 5 stars,"Perfect handheld ""book"" device. Easy read.",Five Stars;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I have kindle on my phone, it is handy. I like the Kindle's  bigger screen, it reads better and when I use the Kindle, I am saving the battery on my phone. I give it a 4 star because when I turn it on, I get advertisements for a lot of books I don't want. If that could be turned off, it would be a 5 star.",Can I turn off the adds?;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"This was a replacement for my old Kindle Keyboard reader, and it is pretty disappointing. It feels so cheap. Like hollow hard plastic. It is very thick too, so I can't fit it in pockets I used to fit my older Kindle. I'm also disappointed that Amazon has clamped down so hard on jailbreaking. There are a couple tiny things I'd love to change, and none of them have to do with stealing books. All I want to do is add my own custom screensavers, and more importantly, adjust the page turn touch zones on the screen. I have a habit of putting my thumb squarely onto the screen to hold the Kindle and this causes all kinds of menus to pop up on this thing. It would be fine if I could resize the page turn touch zones. I'd gladly pay the extra $20 to remove ads, if only I could load my own screensavers and make some interface tweaks.",Seems like a downgrade...;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I HAD TO PURCHASE THIS ITEM WITH AN APPLIED CREDIT FROM CUSTOMER SERVICE. I HAD A GENERATION 3 WITH A KEYBOARD AND INTERENET ACCESS.  MY PREVIOUS KINDLE WAS WORKING WELL UNTIL AMAZON TOLD ME TO DO AN UPGRADE. AND I GOT A MESSAGE THAT SAID KINDLE  NEEDS REPAIR.  THE TECHNICAL DEPARTMENT COULDN'T GIVE ME A FIX TO GET IT WORKING AGAIN SO I HAD TO SPEND MONEY TO GET A NEW ONE. TO GET THE KINDLE LIKE I HAD, I WOULD HAVE HAD TO SPEND $150+ AND ALSO BUY A COVER AFTER CUSTOMER SERVICE GAVE ME A CREDIT.IT IS OK IF YOU ARE STARTING OUT WITH THIS KINDLE AND HADN'T USED ONE OF THE NICER ONES. IN HINDSIGHT, I MAYBE WOULD HAVE GOTTEN A PAPERWHITE SO I CAN READ IN THE DARK. BUT THEN I WOULD HAVE HAD TO SPEND MORE AS CUSTOMER SERVICE WOULDN'T GIVE ME MORE CREDIT AND I REALLY DIDN'T NEED A NEW KINDLE EXCEPT FOR THE UPGRADE MAKING MY OLD  KINDLE UNUSUABLE.I ALSO HAD SOME FREE WORD GAMES ON MY KINDLE THAT I CANNOT FIND IN THE KINDLE STORE SO CANNOT PUT THEM ON MY NEW KINDLE. I AM GOING TO TRY TO RESEARCH TO SEE IF I CAN FIND THE GAMES ON THE AMAZON WEBSIGHT AND TRY TO LOAD THEM BUT HAVEN'T GOTTEN THAT FAR YET.I ALSO HAD AHIGH QUALITY  LEATHER COVER WITH A LIGHT WHICH WORKED WELL WHEN I WANTED TO READ AT NIGHT.  NOW I HAVE A $30 COVER WHICH DOES NOT HAVE A LIGHT AND CANNOT READ IN THE DARK. THE QUALITY OF THE COVER I RECEIVED IS FAR BELOW WHAT I HAD..",A FORCED PUCHASE FOR A KINDLE REPLACEMENT;;;;;;

Review: Was what I expected and perfect for what I need

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"My Kindle is a boon to me!  I have loved to read since I first learned in the first grade.  You see, when I was a kid, or child as you may prefer, there was no kindergarden. It was about , actually it was, 1938, I was 6 years old.  I am now 82 and have retained my love affair with books.  I lke that it has its own light source and I do not have to chase the light from the lamp. I am widowed and don't have to consider anyone else when I read into the wee hours.  I guess I don't have to tell you, I am having a ball.  If my eyesight doesn't fail me I will probably have my kindle in my hand when I pass away!",I love my Kindle;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Fast one day shipping ! Perfect for children reading , so they can not search internet & play game on this basic kindle. But , not able to adjust screen lighting.  Set up an children account is confusing .",Good reading tool for kids;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I am enjoying my Kindle very much.  I have noticed no glare, the glow light works very well - we were without power one evening and I was able to read when there was not much else to do but go to bed. Wi-Fi is enabled and the Special Offers are not intrusive.  I find it comparable to my Nook and my Kobo e-readers.  I like all three.  My only problem is that I can't remember on which reader a particular book resides.",I like all three;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I have a kindle fire and for the most part, I am delighted with it but for one drawback. It tends to freeze up often. When it does, I have to power it down, wait a minute and then reboot it. Of course, more often than not, when it reboots, it does not start up exactly where I left off. In essence, I have to go hunting for the page. I do not know why it does this but it is getting to be very frustrating!!! Maybe I should just get a Barnes & Noble Nook. Or just go back to reading the hard copy books. Amazon dropped the ball this time!!!!!!",Constant rebooting;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I used to have a 5th generation kindle.  It was thinner, more comfortable and I totally prefer the buttons to touch screen.  My daughter and I are fighting over the remaining 5th generation we have.  This new kindle is a big step down in my opinion.  Please just bring back the cheapest 5th generation kindle.",more comfortable and I totally prefer the buttons to touch screen;;;;;;

Review: The changes in this Kindle Touch from the Kindle I had for five or more years are disappointing.  I am not a techie and the cloud thing messes with my folders and my mind.  Why can't you people leave things alone.  I had to buy a new Kindle because I dropped the old one too many times.  Now I have to find out how to make the new one do what I was used to or get used to a new thing.  I liked the size that I had.  I liked being able to put read books into folders of my own design.  What I had was what I had.  Now I have two places to deal with and one of them takes things and moves them.  Stop it!!!
Title;;;;;;: I liked the size that I had;;;;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"I have been spoiled by the Kindle Fire HDX, but I was looking for something lighter weight and longer battery life for travel. Fine if all you want to do is read. Review: My second reader and I love it's simplicity

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"It is nice,  the touch needs to be improved","It is nice, the touch needs to be";;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"All's well, except for not being able to adjust the brightness of the screen.  I've tried to find a way to do it, but it doesn't seem to have that feature.  I bought this one for my husband.  My other Kindle, labeled as my #3, has the adjustable brightness available.",Brightness of screen not adjustable.;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I really don't like this product because it is inferior to all the other kindles. No text to speech, no MP3 player, no Audible books. The advertisements all over are ""Audible audiobooks can be purchased on Amazon or Audible and listened to on your Kindle Keyboard, Kindle Touch..."" This is a kindle touch and I can't do that. The comparisons between the kindle devices doesn't show this loss of functionality either. If you want a basic book reader then this is fine, if you want a kindle then forget this one!",I hate this product because it is inferior to all the ...;;;;;;

Review: Excellent! Great condition. Worth the buy

Like size and weight.  Pages do not always turn when should.  Title of book does not show when reading.  Location difficult to read.  Advertising popups distracting.  Various screens show up seemingly without volition.  Despite size and weight feel old Kindle functions better.  Regret neither Kindle provides an alphabetical directory to quickly locate a volume but have to scroll thru the 400 volumes to find the one you are looking for.  Would not re commend this product.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Works as avertised. My only complaint is the touchscreen is a little to sensitive in that it moves from my page when my finger or hand is close to screen, but not touching and when I touch a word word for the dictionary I get a differnet function then  the one I want. Its as if my finger is too big. This is when a small font is used. Other then this itworks great to date.",Other then this itworks great to date;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Allows access to Wikipedia access just out of the package.  You have to make the effort to set parental controls!!!  I was looking for a safe, kid friendly device so my kiddo could read lots of good books without the hassle of setting up parental controls. Yes Wikipedia contains lots and lots of trashy images i do not want my young child exposed to.","Still requires you to set up parental controls, else your child can stumble upon adult content";;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first e-reader, and I'm still getting acquainted with it. I find it very easy to read, and I like the page-turning feature a lot.  I also like the size and weight (like a feather!), and I will really love it when I travel.  I find it very awkward to turn off, and I'm never certain it's really off. I would like to be able to make the screen a bit brighter, but I can't find that feature anywhere. I particularly value the ability to download books -- I live a distance from any book store -- and the downloads happen in a flash. I am not crazy about the pop-up ads for books and other products, and I find it difficult to get rid of them so I can actually read my book. I am very happy to have an electronic gadget that's dedicated to just one purpose -- reading. I guess my jury's still out.",I find it very easy to read;;;;;;

Review: no regrets... glad i got it on sale!!!
Title;;;;;;: glad i got it on sale;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I really enjoy this reader.  It's light weight, easy to hold and carry as apposed to my iPad.  Great to put in my purse to read on the go.  I would have given it 5 stars if it had back lighting.  One of my main reason for purchasing the reader is so I can read in bed but now I have to purchase a clip light to be able to do that.  I had read a couple reviews that said there wasn't back light but I just assumed they were wrong, they weren't.",Great reader but...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchased this version after I cracked the screen on my Kindle Keyboard. I didnt want to part with it but I thought this would be the most economical option instead of replacing the screen. I was pleasantly surprised how much I loved this new version. Although it's quite smaller than the Kindle Keyboard, it's compact enough to fit easily into my purse without taking up too much space. I also love that you can read with one hand and not have to put much energy in changing the pages. As lazy as that sounds the convenience is nice.",I was pleasantly surprised how much I loved this new version;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I was disappointed that at this generation level it would not be ""back lit"" or have a way to read in the dark....Also, there is no cover with a light I can buy that works correct with this kindle, they are too small-even Amazon couldn't help. So I feel it was kinda of a waste of money as I can't read it at night unless I have another light source on.",Disapointed;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I wish I hadn't purchased this.  My first Kindle was the keyboard version.  I own a Kindle Fire now but I thought I wanted the easy-on-the-eyes screen.  So, such fond memories I had of my first Kindle.  This current Kindle --6"" glare free touchscreen--doesn't deserve the name. They've now made it so light that it feels cheap and puny. Why do people think they have to keep messing with something that was fine to begin with?  I LOVED my keyboard kindle....easy to understand, easy to operate.  I didn't realize how wonderful it was to push a button and actually get a response.  This touchscreen has nearly made me swear sometimes.  I touch here, I touch there....nothing. Or, worse, it's completely what I didn't want.  I'd send it back but frankly, it's more trouble than it's worth.",Why do people think they have to keep messing with something that was fine to begin with;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my Kindle. I would be lost without it. I even crocheted it a little sweater. Is that weird? It is perfect in every way, except that it might be a little too touch sensitive. I'm sure there's a setting somewhere to address this, but I haven't yet found it.",Would be lost without it;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"This was a gift from well meaning children.  Unfortunately I read at night and prefer a screen with a back lit option. 3.0 out of 5 stars,"I have always refused to get an e-reader, but my friend gave me one.  I'm still trying to get used to it.  It appears to be easy to use, and I have downloaded some books onto it. So I now find myself having to purchase a clip on light for the kindle. The size is perfect and light weight. I also brought it recently for $59.00 so I won't send back. It's always good to read before purchasing so I definitely can't blame Amazon on this one. Just disappointed.

since these have a touch screen they don't do to well when put in a waterproof bag. I use ziplog bags. Review: I like the Kindle but very disappointed that I cannot find a cover with a builtin light like my first Kindle.  The builtin light was very convenient when reading in a car or in bed at night. I am now regretting my purchase.

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"I'm not buying any more of these contraptions--they dissolve like alka seltzer tablets. They only seem to last a year or two. I had my next-older version of this one freeze on me twice and that was my second one bought last September. The first one I bought in March 2011. So this is my third one. I don't buy the claims of how many books they hold, especially since I only have a couple hundred titles and I think that's why the second one froze on me--indigestion. And one thing this one is missing is a manual of some sort. I had to stumble my way through this one, trial-and-error, before I could access the book I had tried to download to Kindle Numbah Two when it froze, so I came here for another download of the book to this new one when it showed up. They also really need a manual so you know which part of the screen you touch to get what result.",I Don't Know But What I'm Better Off With Paper Books;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I don't often write reviews, but I must say how disappointed that the manufacturer placed the power button on the bottom of this reader.  Who doesn't like to prop up their reader against a surface to read hands free?  Well, I guess the product designer.  Whenever you try to prop the device, put it on your lap and rest against your knees, it turns the device off.  GRRRR.",but I must say how disappointed that the manufacturer placed the power button on the ...;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I was reluctant to make the switch to an e-reader, but I had already started to use the kindle app for books on my phone and tablet because it was just so easy. As a person, like many others, that doesn't like to stare at a screen like that for a long period of time, but still wanted the convenience of an e-reader, I thought I would give this a try. I absolutely love it. The battery lasts forever. You can hold it in one hand. In fact, it easily fits in my inside coat pockets for taking it on the go. I still read plenty of hardback books, but I must say, when I'm reading a book on this I get through it a lot faster (partially because it's so portable). As for the screen, reading on this feels just like reading from a book because there's no back light and the technology doesn't require the image to refresh continuously. It's truly a still image, so it's easier on the eyes. Highly recommended. Enjoy!",Should've purchased this sooner!;;;;;;

Review: I'm reading more now than ever!

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I kind of miss the keyboard! And I find it slightly difficult to get back to the homepage and navigate due to the touch screen. 1.0 out of 5 stars,"DO NOT CHANGE THE BATTERY ON THIS KINDLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  And buy the extended warranty if you don't want to completely waste your money.  I had an old style Kindle a number of years ago and for a long time it did fine.  When the battery pooped out, I was able to buy new ones and change them and the Kindle worked fine.  (the Kindle batteries suck BIG TIME, but that's a whole other issue).Then came this new Kindle.  I had high hopes that it would be even better than my first, but I hate it.  It is horrible.  But I did have the presence of mind to buy the two year extended warranty, and I am so glad I did, because this Kindle crapped out on me after just 1 and 1/2 years.  So I did what I thought you were supposed to do, I got on Amazon and bought a new battery and changed it.  Well, now the Kindle does not work, and when I called to see if something could be done, I was told that changing the battery was considered ""intentional damage"" to the Kindle.  Nowhere are you warned that you should not change the battery.  Since I bought the battery through Amazon, they are going to be nice enough to replace the Kindle, which is very kind of them because I am as disgusted as I can possibly be with this Kindle version.  Now it looks like I will be getting another one, but you can bet when it no longer works I will not be trying to change the battery.  I cannot say I recommend this Kindle version, it has been user-unfriendly on a number of levels.  But I will recommend the extended warranty.","FOR THE LOVE OF GOD, DON'T TRY TO CHANGE THE BATTERY, EVEN THOUGH AMAZON SELLS ONE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!";;;;;;

The touch screen interface feels clumsy, less quick to respond than the older side button presses and overall the case felt much more cheaply made, flimsy, and budget.  However, will grant overall a faster load, ability to scroll through my kindle library faster, and very competitive price. column7: ruined my holiday.I ordered another one
column8: at a significantly higher price (it was the same model

5.0 out of 5 stars,"After one day of local help, and three days totaling over two hours on the phone with Amazon technicians, I was FINALLY informed my Kindle wasn't working right (right before I returned it and told them to keep it permanently). Since I've gotten one that works, it's been smooth sailing--at long last!I was looking for an e-reader (for reading only) that would be easy on my eyes.  I believe that I chose correctly in purchasing the Kindle 6"" Glare-Free Touchscreen Display.  I've also learned (by error) that if you want your battery to last longer than a week, you need to take it off wi-fi and put it on airplane mode.Yes, you too can download books from your library in they're formatted for Kindle and you have the proper instructions to do so.","Rough Seas to Start, But Now It's Smooth Sailing";;;;;;

Rating: 2.0 out of 5 stars,"Unlike my Kindle Fire, this Kindle is not user friendly. It certainly doesn't have an easy touchscreen -- it doesn't work all the time and once in it's hard to navigate. Also, I can't seem to close down the Kindle. Unfortunately, I wasn't able to save the Kindle wrappings or I'd send it back. I expected more from Amazon. I ordered the Kindle 6"" because it is lightweight and small and I wanted it for traveling. I would not recommend this item. But, love my Kindle Fire.",Not what I expected from Amazon;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I had to replace my Kindle Keyboard after 6 years of dedicated service.  This kindle was on sale during the Prime anniversary and a good deal at $30 off.  I read mostly at night before bed. My kindle keyboard had a beautiful leather cover with a built-in light that tapped the battery on the kindle. No need to charge anything but the kindle, and it all folded up nice and flat for travel.  Can't do that with this model. This kindle has no external light solution other than a chunky clip-on lamp with a separate battery. One more thing to carry around and have run out of battery power.  Fail. Looks like I have to buy a back-lit kindle as they no longer produce a model with the ability to tap the battery.  Or buy a used kindle keyboard.",Not the best option if you read mostly at night.;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I know, I know. Everybody says to read the specs before you buy, but this one was given to me as a gift. I was reading my Kindle books on a tablet until I received the Kindle, and about a week or two after trying to adjust to the screen in dim grey tones, I gave up and went back to the tablet. As much as I would like to support Amazon and their products, I'm not sure this entry level reminder of early-80's computer monitors is for me, and judging from the reviews of other Kindles, I may just stick with the tablet. There's no reason Amazon can't afford to be on the cutting-edge with these with the number that they sell. My best use for this one is to tote it with me when I'm out and about and might have to wait in a very bright room.",Acceptable device for an avid reader;;;;;;

Rating: 2.0 out of 5 stars,"Here's the thing: I loved my Kindle.  Loved it!But before you buy you should know that Amazon will do very little to help if your Kindle dies outside of warranty, which by the way is ONLY ONE YEAR.  I don't know about you, but I take good care of things.  My Kindle lived in it's stupidly expensive case, was never dropped, never exposed to water - heck, I didn't even load it up with too many books.  But suddenly it started freezing while I was reading, and then it wouldn't turn on without being fully charged, and then it wouldn't turn on at all.So I went to the help forums, and found that others were experiencing similar problems.  Several people mentioned that the case was a problem: the paint on the little hooks used to attach the case to the Kindle wore off, exposing the metal and interfering with the Kindle itself.  When it got to this point everybody on the forum said it was time to call customer service.  So I did.What will Amazon do to make right the fact that their product was faulty, caused in part by another Amazon product?  Because it's outside that one year warranty they'll generously give me $12 off the purchase of a new Kindle.  I might as well have just waited for some dumb sale to go on.  Are you kidding me, Amazon?????Anyway, just wanted to let y'all know that you'll fall in love with your Kindle, it will die, and you'll just have to fork over even more money to Amazon to basically flat-out replace it.","I love you, Kindle.  I hate you, Amazon.";;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this as a gift for my mom but she's had nothing but trouble with it shortly after she got it a year ago. Since the Kindle needs to be present to troubleshoot I gave them my mom's phone number and ask they call her which the rep said she'd do immediately, but no one has yet. It's  been a very frustrating ordeal  for a product clearly defective.  It's a shame Amazon is so good to replace or refund other's items, but when it comes to one of their own products, it's the run around.",Defective product and not much help getting it fixed;;;;;;
