4.0 out of 5 stars,"I only gave it this many stars because I do not own this one yet. I'm considering buying this kindle soon because my old kindle doesn't hold a charge very long due to it's 6 year age. I love my kindle, which is the 2nd or 3rd edition. I use it 3 or 4 times a week. I carry it everywhere. I am devastated that I am in the market for a new one, but the features of this kindle reflect the features of my current kindle, with a few added perks and upgrades. I love that the price is extremely affordable. My family wants me to splurge on an iPad but I keep telling them that I only want an e-reader, specifically one from Amazon. I am leery about the touch screen since I prefer my non-touch screen kindle, but if I decide to purchase this kindle it will be something I will get used to quickly. I am currently in my senior year of college and I have used my kindle to read for my classes. I add PDF's on my kindle and read homework and bring it to class, which impresses all my English professors. I can confidently say that when I desperately need a new e-reader I will purchase this one from Amazon and continue to enjoy books, both paperback and digital.","Not Yet, But Soon";;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this Kindle to replace my old, beloved Kindle 2, which was dropped and damaged beyond repair. The new unit is great! The screen is the same size as the old Kindle, but it's overall much smaller, since the keyboard function is now ""on screen"". I never used the headphone jack, or the spoken word function, so I don't miss those at all. Battery life is excellent, and I prefer e-ink to backlit readers. The purchase also included one month of free Amazon Prime, so it was a good buy.. Another new touch is a choice of several fonts, along with the usual text size options. 1.0 out of 5 stars,"First year of having the Kindle Fire is great! I really enjoyed it and made full use of its potential, but after the first year it went downhill. The battery life became shorter, as in every other hour I had to plug the kindle onto the charger. Wasn't too bad since there are outlets where I normally sit, but then it got worse. It started powering down when it hit a certain point, normally this is good, it saves power and keeps it from totally dying, but what makes it bad is that it started powering down automatically at 30%, then 40%, then 45%. It continued on until I got absolutely fed up with it, this morning I read on it for around 2 hours when the charge hits 70%. And it powers down. These Kindles are not designed for long term use, they are designed to last until the next ""New and Improved"" model comes out with a bigger price tag. Which will overall do the same thing. I would advise those thinking about getting a tablet to get a surface or an Ipad instead of a Kindle fire, they will milk you of your money on all of the new models and you will get the same headaches out of it. All they do is add more bells and whistles.","Made for one year, then have to get new model.";;;;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"I would be happier if this reader had physical page turn buttons and the other buttons that my Kindle 4 has.  The ideal reader would allow me to set sleep time, and to disable the touch screen or to disable the buttons.  The ideal reader would also have lighting that would be adjustable in color.  It could be red or it could be variable shades of white from 2700k to 6500k so you could keep yourself up late if you choose or you could let sleep take you by going 2700k or red only.  The ideal reader would have a micro card slot so I can have more books.  The ideal reader would read epub format as well as the various formats that Kindle uses now.I started with a Kobo touch so I am used to having more control over my reader.  If it was not for the fact that Kindle has a better selection and frequently better prices than Kobo I would stick to my old Kobo touch.  Nook is between Kobo touch and Kindle readers for user control.  If Nook had a better selection and better prices then I would go to Nook more often when I want to buy a book.  I like Kindle better only because of greater selection of books and better book prices.",My second Kindle and fourth E-reader;;;;;;

It doesn't even give you the number of pages or number left in a chapter.  Other than a percentage  you have no idea where you are.  I won't recommend this to a friend or maybe the more expensive versions are better.",Kindle brings no joy;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"I was skeptical as to if I would like a kindle or not, and while I thought about getting the Kindle Voyage or Paperwhite, Im glad I just got this simpler version. Its basically like a library you can carry around with no frills or apps or anything like that. When I read, I just want to read and this is great for just that. Rating: 2.0 out of 5 stars,"The Kindle is great as an ereader, but it inhibited my ability to sleep well. You wouldn't think it would disrupt your circadian rhythm but it does. For me it was not possible to use an e-reader at night and get a good night's sleep. I have tried the following: basic Kindle, iPad, Macbook Pro with flux, Windows laptop, but all strained my eyes at night and prevented a good night's sleep. If you are waking up in the middle of the night wide awake say at 2am or 3am (like I was) then blame it on none other than the electronic screen in your face, which you are likely using too late at night making your brain think it's daytime. If you want to read, grab a real paper book. Through great discipline, I have avoided long term contact with screens after 7:30pm. I have been able to sleep again, like I used to before the age of screens screens in your face and everywhere. Sorry folks, there is no e-reader to turn to at night and think you will sleep well. Real books is all I can recommend. I've tried everything else.",Kindle & other screens & sleeping well.;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"Beware!! This new Kindle is a major step back from the old Kindle Touch which looks just like the new Kindle.  I bought the new Kindle to replace my 3 yr old Kindle Touch.  The old Touch stills work but I have to reboot it several times a week.  There are two major deficiencies not in the old Touch.  The new Kindle does not support the 3G communications mode.  You have to  be attached to a Wi-Fi.  But to me, the  biggest issue is that the new Kindle does not support what Amazon calls Active Support.  That means you can not execute interactive games on this new device.  The main reason that I bought the new device is to get the games without having to reboot all of the time like my old device.  The ad for the new Kindle does not tell you that.  The compare chart for the Kindle and on e-reader versions do no tell you this.",Beware you can not run games on new Kindle as you can on old Kindle Touch!!;;;;;;

Rating: 2.0 out of 5 stars,"I like how the product functions, but I despise the advertisements. They put banner ads at the bottom of menu screens that take up valuable real-estate on a small tablet. Full screen ads appear when the tablet goes to sleep. It just feels intrusive.I also can't fathom why the FREE app for PC is devoid of advertisements, but the product I paid for includes them. Just weird.EDIT: Apparently only Kindles that were purchased at a discount have ads. I purchased mine on Cyber Monday for $50. I had to pay what was discounted off the original price ($20) in order to remove the ads. So Amazon just duped me into paying full price. Without the ads, the Kindle is great.",Intrusive Advertisements;;;;;;

But at this price point (80$ with ads!) I have come to expect a lot more from a device. An 80$ tablet can do sooo much more and still have all the kindle app bonuses as well. So personally I was disappointed.",I was dissapointed.;;;;;;

Review: It still has glare when I'm trying to read at the gym.

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I really like it. I have the Kindle reading app on my laptop and several books already. It's nice to be able to have something smaller to take with me to read with. If I would have known, I might have bought the one with the back-light. But for $59, it was worth it. I only gave it four stars because I bought it at Staples on sale. It had a $20 instant rebate (and a $30 Staples card) so it was $59. Later, I discovered the $20 was a promotional deal with Amazon to put ads on it as screensavers, etc. To get them off, you have to pay the $20 bucks. I can live with it, but I think it should have been spelled out that the $20 instant rebate was a promotional deal. I never had an instant rebate come with strings!","Good Reader, Shady Promotion?";;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"When my second generation Kindle died, I decided to ask for this one for Christmas after reading the reviews.  I like its small size and portability as well as the ease of finding definitions.  The touchscreen generally functions well, but not consistently.  Sometimes it changes font sizes without my input and turns pages with the slightest brush of the surface.  That is, unless I have to touch it repeatedly to get it to go to the next page.  Also, when I have closed the cover, sometimes the book is on a different page when I return.  True, this was inexpensive.  I guess you get what you pay for.",You Get What You Pay For;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I just don't understand this product at all.  Imagine many are buying it expecting a backlight (paper white  - the one with the backlight - is the best thing ever). Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"This is my first e-reader and so much more convenient than using kindle for pc on my computer, although that is pretty good too. 2.0 out of 5 stars,"Received as a gift and waited too long to try it so it can't be returned. I'm not a fan of the whole concept of reading devices. Rating: 2.0 out of 5 stars,"They should make this clear: There is NO backlight on this Kindle, so you can't read the text without a lot of light in the room (kinda like a real-life book). Or you can buy a lamp for it and look especially psychotic trying to read a digital etch-a-sketch with a flashlight. Returned, but Amazon pocketed $5 for shipping despite the fact that I have Prime. I might try the Paperwhite, but there was ultimately nothing impressive about this ""normal"" Kindle for me to justify paying more for what I'd expect with the baseline. The cheap and bulky design, ugly interface, the jolting page transitions, and you have to pay more to not have it come with commercials... it really does feel like something you'd see in an 80s sci-fi movie: a cheap prop with seemingly futuristic capabilities for 30 years ago (yet laughable by today's standards), and yet a complete satire on where our technological culture is heading/is right now.",Would have been way cooler in 1982;;;;;;

Its the major flaw keeping me from gifting these handy things and nearly caused me to return mine.","Good Battery, Annoying Font Changes";;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"Love it EXCEPT I HATE that screensavers are ads! I use my Kindle as an e-reader, not to shop. I am on a fixed income and look at emails on my computer for more/new ebooks. In addition, when I registered and got to the option to join or skip joining a limited period of taking amazon prime, the option to not join (in tiny letters) would not register no many how many times I pounded it. Thus, to complete registration, I had to click join. Then to get out of automatically being charged $99 after the free period, I had to log into my amazon account, manage kindle, and opt out. I really dislike this kind of marketing stuff. If you are offering the option to opt out, it should work and be obvious--same size and offer to join.",Not thrilled;;;;;;

So now I out the money for this kindle plus all the books I have purchased for the next 6 months + all the other books I have purchased for enjoyment about 6-8 books a month. What am I to do? I loved my kindle fire I had before but it got too filled up with having books, music etc. So I bought this to just put my books on & when done reading them I put them back out onto my cloud. 1.0 out of 5 stars,"I use the reader as a reader only. It is a different size, so my cover and light no longer functions properly (I bought a new belkin light which is fine).2. The touch screen is VERY SENSITIVE and you accidentally touch it with bedsheet or anything and suddenly your font changes size or the dictionary pops up or whatever. This is my very main complaint on this reader.3. The ads suck. I didn't want to give an extra 20 bucks to not have ads but the ads suck, and you have to click past them every time you fire it up.4. Firing it up is not easy. The button on the bottom that fires it up is very small and hard to use.It is just a poor design for a reader.",The touch screen sucks;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"Very disappointed with Amazon. I guess this is my first 1-star review, but it's well deserved. They sold this old technology Kindle with a coloured cover in a U$99.99 ""kids bundle."" I decided to buy (two of them) because I thought it would be a real KIDS bundle that would come pre-configured with some kids configuration, maybe some pre-loaded content or, at least, an easy to follow process that would make it a KIDS device. Bear in mind that these are my 5th and 6th Kindle devices and I am above the average in terms of ""tech-savviness."" So I can assure you that this is absolutely a regular Kindle, with no easier config to kids whatsoever. The only KIDS flavor is the coloured cover! To make things worse, 2 days after I bought them, they reduced the price of Kindle Paperwhites to a lower price than this one. I then decided to reach Amazon via chat to register my dispointment (I rarely do that, bcs I don't have time to waste, but I really felt betrayed and knew ther WERE customer centric). So there I spent 20 minutes chatting with some very polite CRs. When I was with the second one, called Apoorva, who is a Kindle specialist and who the first one, ""MJ,"" said would be the perfect one to take some action to compensate me, she said she was having technical issues and was not able to access my account. There I realized I was in trouble and the whole thing was going nowhere... But since I was in this process for so long, I decide to get this call from them to try to finish what  had started. Wow, what a bad experience! Yes, they made it worse! A clueless guy called, who could not hear me well, nor follow anything thru, not even the simplest rational (yes, I did have to start telling the whole story again, which was already transcritpted in that chat log, bcs he could not access it, even though I had logged in to that previous chat: technology is not Amazon's forte!). Well, going nowhere except for the fact that I decided I would return the devices and waste a bit of more time to make this review. IMHO do NOT fall for these bundles and, if you are an IT guy, do NOT hire Amazon for B2B, bcs it seems their technology cannot support even their customer service.",Kids bundle?!? What a bad joke! Do NOT fall for it;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I hate it. I loathe it.  It makes me want to abandon Kindle all together.  Whenever they ""improve"" something it means improve shareholders' share, not the customer's experience!  They took away text-to-speech previously.  Now they took away the little plug on the side to insert in the protecting folder that had a built in light.The device feels like cheap, $1 Chinese plastic. (Compared to the slick sheen feel of the previous keyboard version).  The touch screen is so ""touchy"" that it turns the page if you sneeze (literally, I'm not kidding!!!).  And the frame is so narrow that you can barely avoid touching the screen, therefore inadvertently advancing (or rewinding) the page.Disgusting, cheap crap.  I might need to go back to the library and have real books.  Thanks for NOTHING Amazon Kindle!! Phew!!!",I would've given 0 stars if possible;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"To be clear: This review is not about the product, as the products we purchased for our kids remain in their original packaging until Christmas. This is about the HORRIBLE email information relating to activating the Squaretrade Warranty that came with the Kids package we purchased. The email comes from Amazon.com, but - as I found out after an hour of time on chat and telephone with near-useless Amazon.com Customer Service - you have to go to the Squaretrade site to activate it. Unfortunately, Amazon doesn't provide a link to the correct page on the site. I had to search for the site, and couldn't determine where to go to get this warranty. I finally got someone on the phone with a clue. This gal then tells me the Amazon Customer Support people were wrong. She stepped through the entire convoluted process with me. Even so, she was confused about which warranty came with the devices and we wound up working by trial and error only to demonstrate that the warranty promo codes don't work.I'm now having to wait for new, supposedly valid promo codes so I can go through this painful process again.Amazon: This ""process"" is well below any reasonable standard of expectation, and you ought to be ashamed of yourselves for rolling it out to your Customers!UPDATE: I received an email from the very helpful Squaretrade Customer Support person giving me exact instructions on exactly how to ""purchase"" the correct warranty on Amazon.com. It did in fact work. Now I have to wait for emails from Squaretrade to activate the warranties. After nearly 2 hours of my time being wasted messing around with useless Amazon.com Customer Support people, my problem gets resolved by someone not employed by Amazon. Unbelievable!",Good Luck Getting the Squaretrade Warranty Activated!;;;;;;

Numerous times, I am trying to go to the ""home"" page, and it will not respond.  I wish my old one was still working.",Also less easy to use;;;;;;

Review: I love it!! I was so excited when I got this for Christmas. My other touchscreen Kindle from about over a year ago kept freezing up on me & was so slow. This one is great & I love the glare free.

Review: Reasonably priced and comes with useful touch screen capabilities.Battery life is excellent making it a good alternative long usage reader vs. A tablet with Kindle software installed.
an excellent reader.  touch screen and on screen keyboard are major pluses.  does everything well.  the 'special offers' are no problem and they keep the cost down.  very happy with the purchase.
I got it on deal and I can see why it's so cheap. Black and white screen which makes the covers look weird but that's nothing. It's good for its pourpose and I love that there's no notifications.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"loving it so much, I like that it's  touch and have features like goodreads and vocabulary builder.super amazingYou can check out more reviews on my blog - http://bookwormiejoss.blogspot.com/",super cool;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Had to buy a kindle in order to read certain e-books. Didn't want to add more tech. to my possessions, but this item works great. For other beginners, I suggest inserting a small written manual.","If it's OK for me, it's OK for you.";;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"It's a little hard getting used to the touch screen (versus the older Kindle that I have), but it's light weight, and easy to use. It's small size makes it really easy to take with me on the go.",and easy to use;;;;;;

5.0 out of 5 stars,"Simple, but this in my opinion is how an ereader should be. Lightweight, weighs less then a lot of paperbacks I have read and fits easily in your pocket, well my pocket at least. One of my favs.",A++++++;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"Disappointed with the lack of instructions.  All new Kindle users are not already familiar with it, so either you find someone who already uses on or it just gets put in an out of the way place.",No instructions.;;;;;;

Review: Love being able to go outside in the sun and read! Great to read at the beach! If you want the battery to last longer and you won't be using wifi put it on airplane mode. And it'll last forever!
When I first looked at kindles I thought I would never like one that wasn't back lit.  I love this kindle.  It is really easy on the eyes.  Just like reading a book.Highly recommend.
Title;;;;;;: ... first looked at kindles I thought I would never like one that wasn't back lit;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"I have had different brands of readers, This is the best one I found for the  price. It is very easy to set up and use. The display is clear and doesn't hurt your eyes as some of the other have.",This the best one I found for the price;;;;;;

4.0 out of 5 stars,"I have bought several Kindle user manuals, but still do not know how to use any Kindle features. Why in the world doesn't Amazon publish a REAL user's manual so I can learn how to use my Kindle?","I have bought several Kindle user manuals, but still ...";;;;;;

Review: I love how it feels like a real book. Small enough to carry around to the gym when running on the treadmill. Great bang for the buck. I will be be putting the Kindle to good use that's for sure!
Title;;;;;;: I love how it feels like a real book;;;;;;

Review: It's just what I've been wanting. The amount of light is great for reading in bed without disturbing my spouse. The tutorial is excellent for getting started. I'm very pleased with this product.

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"My old (probably first generation) Kindle was starting to split and the characters were worn off the key pad, but I loved it. I like this new one and hope it lasts me as long and serves me well.",Like it;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I purchased this during Prime Day to give as a gift. Well, right out of the box - it doesn't have a charger! My friend doesn't have a computer so it's useless. I figured I could always just give her one of my leftover chargers that I had around the house but then it says you need wifi? Since when does a Kindle need wifi? My old ones don't. Back it goes",Back it goes;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I have one of the first generation Kindle tablets and because screen glare and late night reading was a problem at times, I thought I would try a dedicated Kindle e-reader.  In the frenzy of Amazon Prime Day, this seemed like a good deal and I readily bought it.  As soon as I tried it though, I was very disappointed.  The screen was so dim and lacked contrast that I could hardly read the page in the middle of the afternoon.  Then I was shocked to discover there's no way to adjust the screen brightness.  It has no light!  My main objective in buying this was to reduce eye strain but the strain is worse than with my old device due to its inherent dimness.  I went back and read the full description and sure enough it does disclose there is no light.  Another buyer may like it just fine but for the money, I feel this is an inferior product.  First time ever, I'm making an effort to return an item.","Not as expected, screen display is very dark, no contrast";;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"Instructions not friendly for this user.  I am not a tech person but I'm able to work a computer, microwave and camera. The instructions seem to be based on knowledge of a Kindle device that I do not possess.  I wanted to know about free books I am able to access on my Prime subscription and eventually found out that I had access to 1 book on the list per month.  It appears that I will need to spend a lot of money each month as I read a lot! I gave up searching for helpful information after more than an hour of frustration. Do I need to go to the local Library to load books on the Kindle?  If so, I might as well order books through their system or check them out from the stacks as I have always done.  My daughter loves her Kindle and encouraged me to get one but it cannot replace physically searching for and reading a real book that I hold in my hands. Other than learning to read, no other instructions are required with a book.",Rather Hold a Book!;;;;;;

Review: I love my new kindle. I use to have the kindle with the little keyboard on the bottom. so far no problems with this new version. Just have to get use to the new touchscreen and the home screen.
I have a 2nd gen Kindle that this one replaced.  This is the perfect size and weight.  I can slip this in my purse to take it with me.  It stays charged much longer than my gen 2 did.  Love it.
Title;;;;;;: This is the perfect size and weight;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Excellent deal via Amazon promo, but the screen is so dark. I knew it wasn't lighted, but this is pretty dim. Ended up finding a Paperwhite on eBay for great price and it's much easier to read!",Excellent deal via Amazon promo;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I had an old keyboard kindle that I inherited from my dad. I mostly liked it and for straight book reading it was fine. But trying to go back and forth between books, or even inside books (like a bible) was a nightmare. I thought this touch kindle would be better. And it is easier to navigate inside the bible, that's certain. And with some credits and a gift card I only paid $25 for it. So I guess I shouldn't complain. But I had Every Word on my old kindle and I liked playing it for a few minutes at night before I went to bed. No Word Games on This Kindle. And if I'm wrong about this, please tell me, because I'd like some!!!! But on all the games -- even the ones you have to buy -- this 7th generation kindle is never listed as an available device. Sigh... Plus I liked the old screen savers better than advertising for books that I don't necessarily want. You get what you pay for.",No word games here;;;;;;

Rating: 2.0 out of 5 stars,"So far I do like it. But I am still somewhat disappointed and of one thing. Yes! Because there is no way to lighten the screen.I snapped this up on Prime Day, and it had big and bold KINDLE PAPERWHITE HUGE SAVINGS. That was the heading. and i read about the paperwhite a few weeks before and one of the selling points was the backlight.Now on Prime Day, I get to work and I see I have a little less than 10 minutes before times runs out. Mind u there were other possibilities to buy a few times for the day. But seeing PAPERWHITE... liking what I read about it before... wanting to buy... time being a constraint... I clicked on the lower of the two prices and scanned through some details, it comes with special offers which to date I have no idea what they are, but made me even more interested, and before anyone in work could see what I was up to, I purchased.I am not one for such rash decisions... unless maybe I see a good buy, but talk about bad decision. I just personally think it was not just me, or else I would have provided a better rating, but rather it was false advertising. The solution I am now faced with is to pay more than double (because I got it at a discounted price) to buy the Kindle paperwhite. Still wrapping my head around everything.",Feeling misled;;;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"I would never ever buy another one of these.  My family has had several,  After variable amounts of time, once only 2 weeks, the screens invariably break.  This happens even if the device is in a protective case and without hitting it or any other trauma.  Amazon knows about this defect, when you call customer service they admit it is a frequent problem.  But they will not replace the screen or replace the device if it is past the warrantee date, even though they know the devices always fail without any abuse.  I think it is planned, they get to sell more readers this way, because you have no choice but to replace them.  This had been my experience with a total of 6 of these, for multiple members of my family.Do yourself a favor, don't buy this unreliable product.  The initial experience is ok, but they don't last.",I would never ever buy another one of these. ...;;;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"What a piece of crap. This is the worst thing I've ever purchased from Amazon. I am so very disappointed both with the device and with Amazon's lies.First of all, the screen is so dim that it strains my eyes within about 2 minutes. It's a low rez screen from the days of the handheld Nintendo games from the 90s. I feel like I'm looking at blurry black text on a grey screen. I suppose there's a more expensive version, but even the inexpensive version shouldn't be this bad/dim/blurry. Even though it's a sub-$100 device, it shouldn't look like this.Furthermore, Amazon's marketing of this product is exceptionally misleading. Well, that's being generous. THEY LIE. On the Kindle page they say you can listen to books - except this device has no audio output. You can download the app on your phone, but even when downloading books that are supposed to have ""audio companion"" the option never appears on the app so there's no listening option. I tried 5 different ones that supposedly had audio. None provided the option of listening. There was never an icon that allowed me to switch from book to audio. In short, there are seemingly NO audio books you can get through their ""unlimited"" Kindle subscription. It's a flat-out lie. Shame on you, Amazon.So I end up with a device I can't read and a subscription I can't listen to. Thus this piece of trash is currently headed back to Amazon for a refund. I suggest you stay away.",Dim Screen and Misleading Marketing = RETURNED DEVICE;;;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"I got this Kindle shortly before traveling extensively.  I wanted a reader that wasn't backlit so that it was easier on my eyes.  When I got it, I ordered it with a case that had a built in light.  Amazon stated that the items were frequently purchased together.  The case was perfect - the light was built into the case and ran off of the Kindle charge, so no additional batteries.  HUGE reason for me buying the Kindle.  Well, the case did NOT fit the Kindle that it is 'often purchased' with.  Not only was I not able to find a case with a light that could be delivered in time, I was unable to get ANY case that would fit this model in time - on Amazon or in a local store (even stores that also sell this model).  Without a protective case and a light to read by, there was no good reason to settle for this model.",The case was perfect - the light was built into the case and ...;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought this for my 86 year old mother. While I find it rather easy to use, my mom has a very difficult time. She is constantly getting stuck and not knowing how to back out of the situation. My one star rating is due to the difficulty and usability for elderly people. Amazon should consider the elderly in the design process.",not good for elderly;;;;;;

Review: I was a little disappointed by this kindle. I did not realize that you can't read the screen at night. I used to have a Kindle Fire which worked like a regular tablet. You can read day or night. With this Kindle you can read in daylight or in a well lit room. In dim light it's difficult to read. In the dark it's impossible. Half of its usage for me comes from reading at night. The first night I tried using this I was using the flashlight function on my iPhone to shine a light on the kindle. I'm thinking of returning this and getting the Paperwhight.The description did not specifically say you couldn't read in the dark but it didn't say you couldn't either. I wish Amazon would be more forthcoming in their product descriptions
Title;;;;;;: If You're A Bedtime Reader Then Pass On This Kindle.;;;;;;

Rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars,"The Voyage is big step up from lighty one. The pressure sensitive page turners are quite handy. The screen is great. However, there are a few things to wonder about: My fingers are quite small, and I find myself wondering how someone with big hands can hold this device. It would be much better if the black plastic edges were a mite thicker so I could pick up the Kindle from the side without turning a page when I don't want to. I know they're wanting to make the device smaller... This Kindle also keeps resetting the reading progress (back to how much time is left in the chapter) all by itself and sometimes I find it's turned ten or more pages at once. Haven't figured out how or why it's paging through the book like that yet.",Not quite there;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"Husband bought this as a gift for Christmas! I loved it until it started getting dark outside, Oooohhh, nooooooooo, , THERE IS NO BACKLIGHT!!!We had discussed the light and both having vision problems and decided on the backlight before ordering. He thought that's what he was ordering, the mid price model, during the Christmas sale, where they were $20 off.The lengthy description needs to be clearer regarding not including the backlight up front close to the purchase price. Unless one scrolls down to the chart it does not state NO BACKLIGHT clearly anywhere. We went to a local retailer and purchased the Paperwhite model that we wanted originally later that week.  He was disappointed at Christmas for not getting the right item for me. I tried to read with it anyhow but just could not see it. Somewhere in the description the need for the backlight to read at night even in bright home lighting needs also to be mentioned.Also, the $14.99 adaptor is a common adaptor most folks have around anyhow. Save your money. The charging cable was included.Hopefully, I won't have any hassles in returning both. Just wanted to purchase the right product in the first place. Needs to be simpler ordering the model you want with a simpler clearer description.","NO BACKLIGHT!!! Put in big letters up front, please seller!";;;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"I have a Kindle Keyboard 3G and love it.  The forward turn button is starting to not work all the time. It has a light setting that you cannot shut off.  You cannot shut the paperwhite off either.  You can put it in sleep mode but the second you touch the case or move it, ever so lightly, it comes back on.  I would not recommend this to anyone and I'm sorry I wasted my money on it.  I put it away to have when my other Kindle's button finally went so it's too late for me to send it back.  Since people seem to have such a high opinion of it on here, maybe I'll sell it to some poor schmuck who didn't know better, like me.  I even bought a very good leather case with a book stand for and can't use it now.  This whole experience has NOT been a good one for me.",I have a Kindle Keyboard 3G and love it. Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"What a great epic work! Hard to read, but the descriptions of the era, or the battle of Waterloo etc. are just fantastic. (I could have gone without the description of the convent and the nuns though). As in other classics, those descriptions take a bigger part of the book compered to the actual plot. Overall a great book by a great author.",What a great epic work;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I am not a fan of this e-reader at all and I'm surprised by all the positive reviews. It's so basic I'm not sure what the point is. For people who are used to backlit LCD screens (that would be all of us, I think), this Kindle is way too dim and there is no way to increase the brightness. In the old days when we read paper-based material all the time, this would have been fine. But now that I have a smartphone, laptop, and tablet with backlit screens, this Kindle feels old-fashioned and inconvenient--I no longer need or have extra reading lamps for my other reading. There is also some shadowing when you turn the page which doesn't happen if you use the Kindle app on a tablet.  The screen is really small too. In its favor: it's lightweight, battery life is supposed to be long (since it is not lighting up anything, that's easy to understand), and it should be glare-free in direct sunlight. So as a backup travel ereader when you go to the beach, this is ok. But I wouldn't recommend it for anything else.",Very disappointing;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I will not buy a Kindle again. I have the Kindle 6"" blk. I purchased it in March and it pooped out in August. The screen imprint froze onto the screen. They sent me a new one and alas it has pooped out again. I charge it and it says it isn't charged, and it won't find my network even though I can get onto internet on computer fine. So I had to download my books via cable. I also restarted the Kindle 3 times and turned it off for the night. I also charged it for 3 hours. That was fine with me, but it won't charge, so I am screwed.I called Amazon and they had me turn off my router...which doesn't make sense since my computer gets onto internet fine. She had me turn off Kindle and now I can't get it to turn back on. They are sending me a new charger, although I don't know how that will fix the problem with it not recognizing my network. Also, my old charger worked fine 2 weeks ago.I will try the new charger but am fed up with the Kindle product.Will try Nook now.VERY DISCOURGED!","Only lasted me 5 months, 2 times!!!";;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"It arrived with no light icon on the toolbar and after a lot of haggling with Amazon reps in what sounded like the Phillipines. This was a replacement for a Kindle paperwhite that broke down after 15 months.  They tried to sell me one for $59, proclaiming this was a $40 discount.  The confirmation receipt indicated this was for a refurbished rather than a new Kindle, something not disclosed during my interaction with the reps.  The confirmation arrived simultaneously with an Amazon offer for a new Kindle for $59.  It took 1-1/2 hours of call time to finally arrange for the return of the on its way refurbished model for the new reader. When the reader arrived, it lacked the lighting icon, meaning I have no way to change the backlighting.  Poor service all around.",Shame on you Amazon outsourced customer service;;;;;;

Terrible customer service Amazon! I purchased 3 kindles on Black Friday for three of my kids for Christmas. On Christmas morning one of the touchscreens did not work. We tried trouble shooting and nothing worked. After a month of attempting to contact Amazon to get a replacement I was sent a REFURBISHED kindle. I purchased a brand new (defective) kindle and after a month of begging was sent a refurbished kindle to replace it.

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"I have not really got to use it a lot. But since this is a Christmas present from Santa to my 7 year old, the first thing I was asked to do is to put the ""active contents"" on, e.g. crossword games and chess games. But to my frustration, I didn't get to complete the task in 5 mintues. The research that followed told me that this version does not support ""active contents"" which really puzzled me. Why??? Crossword and chess are really educational and good for a break from reading, I would think. I simply don't understand why this functionality is taken away. Now I ended up giving my paperwhite to my kid and I'm taking over this inferior product. Not happy at all! If it were not from Santa, I would definitely have returned it!",Crossword and chess are really educational and good for a break from reading;;;;;;

3.0 out of 5 stars,"I don't like it as well as my first Kindle, which was also the lowest priced one, all I need since I only read library books.  The old had a cover which was part of the device, this one requires you to buy one.  My old one opened to the home page or the page of the book I was reading, this one opens to ads which apparently I can only get off the device if I pay $15.  Don't want to pay not to use a feature so I'll hope I don't order anything by accident.  Old one had a slightly larger actual screen as I recall and an actual button at the bottom which you pushed for the home page, this one does not.  The one problem I seem to have with either is that if you accidentally skip pages, you don't know where you were and there's no way to get back except to go back one page at a time until you recognize something.  That's a rather tedious process.  Wish the pages were numbered rather listed on one side as a percent of the book read and whatever that number on the left is.  Despite my comments, I do like having a Kindle as I'm a very fast reader and this way I can actually not worry about finishing a book before I get home to get another.",Likes and Dislikes;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"Do NOT buy the ""Kids Kindle Bundle"" as a gift.  It appears to be a sad ""bait and switch"" offer.I bought the ""Kids Kindle Bundle"" as a birthday gift for my little granddaughter.  One of the things I particularly liked about this package gift was that it included two-years insurance coverage against issues that might happen to a kid's first electronic device, and not just insurance against device defects.  BUT THERE IS A CATCH!  I AM OUTRAGED!On other Amazon electronic products, the insurance is activated as soon as the product is shipped to the buyer.  In the case of a ""Kids Kindle Bundle,"" however,  the insurance can only be activated after the device is connected to an Amazon account.  All this must occur within a 30-da period or else Amazon does not back its deal, EVEN THOUGH THE INSURANCE COVERAGE ALREADY HAD BEEN PAID FOR IN THE KIDS KINDLE PACKAGE.Their solution?  Take the Kindle away from the child.  Mail it back for credit and start all over.  Not much of a ""Happy Birthday"" to a little child. She loves using her Kindle and is so proud of it that we can only hope it comes to no harm.  If it does, it certainly will be replaced with a device from a different producer.","NO GRAMMA! --Do NOT buy the ""Kids Kindle Bundle"" as a gift!";;;;;;

Review: I have owned a Kindle keyboard for years now and love it. My husband would like a Kindle for Christmas. I am shocked to find that I can not buy him a Kindle without a touch screen. I decided to go to Best Buy to see these newer Kindles. The touch screen stinks for reading. This device is cheaply made plastic and far inferior to Kindles of previous generations. Kindle is now off the gift list. Hope my old Kindle keeps going because I would never want this pos.

Rating: 2.0 out of 5 stars,"I am not that happy with this model. I would have preferred the 4G - the wording of 'built-in wi fi' is a little misleading. The touch screen interface is not that easy to use requiring reading all the menu items to get started especially to download items to the home screen from archives. Overall, I liked your earlier models much, much better, but I'm still using this as I like reading with backlit screens - whether the paper white or a tablet - even less.",I am not that happy with this model;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"It is a disappointment! Despite buying the case, it doesn't stand so you have to hold it like a book.  Okay, that's not so bad. My biggest problem is that it is not in sync with my other kindle.  That is, if I read on one the other doesn't respond and keep pace. So I could be on chapter two on one kindle  but only on chapter one on my new kindle. This doesn't work for me since I share my third kindle with my husband. He plays games and checks face book.I'm sorry I bought it.",It is a disappointment! Despite buying the case;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"there is no way an average person can figure out how to use the Kindle.  What happened to easy Kindle?  I'm trying to find an old version that a 3rd grader could program.  Do you have any of the original version left, where you push buttons to turn a page, find your books, etc.  I can't even bring up the books I bought on the old system.  I'm stuck in the middle of a boring book. HELP",Three Stars;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I ordered kindle2 Paperwhite on Sept 20, 2014. $119.00. It has been nothing but trouble. I will probably go back to my kindle one and continue to use it.This kindle 2 paperwhite changes the font size whenever it wants. turns the pages whenever it wants making me leaf back through many pages to find out where I was. It turns itself off whenever if feels like it. There are more problems with it but I just don't feel like sitting here going through them. I am going to try to read the 5 books I downloaded to it and then just throw it away. The first kindle is wonderful. I should have stayed with it. If I do get another one I sure hope it is better than the # 2 or I might just stay with #1. I am sure most of the Kindles are great but as luck would have it I did not get a good one.",Bad Kindle #2 Paperwhite;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"The absence of directions on how to start using the Kindle was really frustrating.  In addition, even going to Amazon.com's website on ordering free books for the Kindle was frustrating: when asking for the device used, it did not offer the choice of different Kindles or describe how to transfer book content to the Kindle adequately.",The absence of directions on how to start using the ...;;;;;;

Review: it was for my daughter she seems happy with it
Great little reader for the prime book rentals

Rating: 2.0 out of 5 stars,"I bought a kindle a few years ago. I had cause to complain about the web browser. Whenever I downloaded my local newspaper and press article mode it keeps downloading over and over. Recently, when the menu button is depressed, it will take a frustratingly long time to appear. reading books on it was almost perfect.. Believing the machine was defective I bought a new improved model which promised touch screen facility, improved dynamics, and most of all an IMPROVED WEB BROWSER. Boy, was I disappointed! This machine is far worse than the old one when it comes to web browsing  Imagine, the bookmarks that were downloaded with it from the Manufacturers simply don't work.It keeps blinking and downloading over and over. options in the menu button takes quite a while to appear many times. However, once again the reading books is quite a pleasure. When it comes to reading a book or a down loaded article it works quite well. I bought this machine so that I can down load my local news papers to read. I am aware of charges to be incurred for certain sights, my comparison lies with my computer and tablet where I get most of the important news. some companies give a synopsis of certain articles and you are asked to sign in to read more. In case of the E reader,  I am regularly getting the message Application Error, Try Again. If I try again the same message comes up. These pages will download perfectly in any of my computers or tablet.","KINDLE 6"" TOUCH SCREEN";;;;;;

Review: A lot to digest for someone my age(74 3/4). I will try it for a few weeks but I think the kindle that I already own is much easierto use and not nearly as complicated.Thanks for asking
Title;;;;;;: A lot to digest for someone my age(74 3/4). ...;;;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"They sold this Kindle to me along with my prime, so I could get free books under ""Kindle Owners' Lending Library""well guess what, It no longer works, and they want $9.99 a month under a new program.Scam folks, bait and switch, which everyone needs to know about.Do not buy.",Kindle Owners' Lending Library is gone and they want $9.99 a month now;;;;;;

Review: When purchased I did not realize it required Wi-Fi to contact Amazon for book purchase.Having a very hard time accessing xfinity Wi-Fi in my current location. Want to use xfinity because I'm a Comcast customer.

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"DO NOT BY A KINDLE TOUCH.  It is the most dreadful eReader you could possibly own.  Nothing on it works properly.  Page turning sucks.  Paging thru your titles sucks (it opens books wile trying to turn pages).  The entire touch interface is glaringly flawed,I WILL NO LONGER BUY KINDLE PRODUCTS!  I will be using Calibre to convert all my titles to EPUB and move away from Kindle!",KINDLE TOUCH A HUGE STEP BACKWARDS;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I was so excited about receiving my Kindle, I love to read.  Friends of mine have older models and they love it.  BUT I feel you should better inform the customer that if they do not have wireless service it cannot be used.  I called for help and was told I can purchase books to my computer and download them to my Kindle.  Was sent instructions and watched your video.  Would not work.......Totally frustrating.  The price was great at 59.00 until I got wireless installed just to use the Kindle it was not worth it, not including the adaptor I bought just to charge it.  I would have paid a higher price to get a Kindle that came with the wireless already installed like my friends have.  Totally disappointed.",I love to read;;;;;;
5.0 out of 5 stars,"The best ""book"" I've ever purchased.",Five Stars;;;;;;

Since I enjoy reading after going to bed at night, this Kindle just doesn't do it for me.",No light on the Kindle 6;;;;;;
5.0 out of 5 stars,"For those who love read, this is for you!",Five Stars;;;;;;

Review: A lot to learn but think it will be great

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"Do you know this Kindle doesn't have a light?  I didn't and if you look at the description it doesn't mention it unless you do a side by side comparison on a whole different web page.  Without the back,light it's very dim to read in ordinary dull daylight and impossible in a darkened room, camping, airplane.  Make sure you check this out.  I've purchased several other kindles but this is the first one I've run across without lighting.  It's going back.",No Lighting. Too dim.;;;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"It was great when I got my first kindle (with the keyboard) but the screen cracked. It was really good when I got my second kindle and to protect it I got a cover with extra padding as I knew the screen was fragile, it cracked. It was good when I got my third kindle which I treated like a delicate, fragile, likely to crack at any moment piece of kit. Guess what? It cracked, no I never dropped them, or flexed them but I decided that as good as I found them for reading (they are hard to beat) I drew the line at number 3 shame really, that's life, get something good but it's just not good enough",It was great when I got my first kindle (with the keyboard) ...;;;;;;

Review: I was really disappointed that there is no back light to read in bed at night.  That is the whole reason I bought it.  I guess I should have read the details better but sitting in my room reading with my phone flashlight makes no sense.  I may as well read from my phone.  The device is lightweight and the battery lasts forever.
Title;;;;;;: I was really disappointed that there is no back light to read in ...;;;;;;

Rating: 2.0 out of 5 stars,"No, I though It had a build in light.",Two Stars;;;;;;

Review: I love the size its perfect for work.
Much improved over old kindle. Great!

Not a fan. Didn't send it back because at some point someone in the family might use it. It's not backlit so I can't read while trying to get my daughter to sleep. It has a blinking like refresh that I'm not fond of as well. I'll just stick to my iPhone/iPad
Title;;;;;;: It has a blinking like refresh that I'm not fond of as well;;;;;;

Review: Very disappointed that there is no audio facility.  My last Kindle was used mainly to listen to books as I drove.  I spend 50% of each work day in my truck and had the last Kindle connected to the speaker system.  I received this new Kindle as a gift and although the functionality of reading of books is better I am disappointed that the oral listening function was eliminate.  I now will try my smart phone as an audio reading device but I will not use Kindle on it.  This is my way of letting Amazon know of how disappointed I am in the decision to remove the audio function.

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"This is a complete SCAM. The fact you have to pay $20 to have ads removed is absurd. Also with so many of the same books for purchase on the site, why is it you can find those same books for free on the internet? The quality of this product is so cheap I expect it to break on the first drop. I don't know how people can actually say they like this.",I don't know how people can actually say they like this.;;;;;;
5.0 out of 5 stars,"beautiful, lightweight, easy to use.",Five Stars;;;;;;

Review: The worst thing is that it didn't have a light & I had to use a lamp to read in bed. I also had trouble downloading a book from my local library. I had to use my desktop through a USB & it still didn't work.  I returned this item for a Kindle Fire witch is so-o-o-o-o much better.

There is no brightness adjustment on this model. If you need or want this option you are out of luck. i have an older version of the basic Kindle and it was on that one. I had to return it and order the Kindle Paperwhite for $40 more. That feature should be on all models.

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"Unable to view screen in living room light;" which makes it worthless. There is no way to make the screen brighter

Review: Such a convenient way to read now!
Great product and prompt delivery.

My daughter is an avid reader and loves this Kindle. The price was great around Christmas time. The only downfall with this model is there is no built-in light. We remedied that by buying a case with a light. It was far more economical than buying the newer model.

Review: Perfect size for taking anywhere.

I ordered this to replace a Kindle that I had left on a plane and I was a little surprised to find the back cover on this version of the device is hard plastic.  Being that this is a product that by design is held in your hands when it's being used it's a jarring change from the previous models.
Title;;;;;;: Hard plastic back needs to go!;;;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"I rate this a forget it!  I use a Kindle primarily because I have poor eye sight and can enlarge the print for reading.  This enlarged the book print, but I could not read any of the cover information and could not tell what books I had on my carosel.  The small hand size was also ackward to hold.  I am returning this product.",I use a Kindle primarily because I have poor eye sight and can enlarge the print for reading;;;;;;

Review: upgraded to the hd7 with the agreement to return this. when i went online to return this said too late. took forever for these to actually arrive....hd7 is fine but now i have this collecting dust.....also bought the paper-white kindle. all these were gifts for others......offered to give this away free and the person turned it down after looking at it and said they will buy their own hd or paperwhite.
Title;;;;;;: can't give this away for free.;;;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"This Kindle is the most infuriating thing I've ever owned -- and it is my 3rd Kindle!  I loved the first 2 Kindles.  This machine is the devil incarnate!  First there is the touch screen which is strange enough to learn, but okay, I can manage it.  Then there are the constant ads -- BEWARE!  Even after I paid the additional $20 dollars to take the ads away, I STILL HAVE ADS CONSTANTLY and suggestions that take up half my screen.  So basically I paid $80 bucks for ADS ALL DAY ALL NIGHT NEVER ENDING ADS!  I am ready to toss it or return it, but then how do I read my books? AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL -- if I could put fewer stars, I would!UPDATE -- I am not changing this review.  I have changed my kindle so that it has fewer ads on it, but there are still ads.  I have been through hours of tutorials  and online discussion groups -- I needed this?  And the upshot is I want to read my books, so I am living with the ads.  Yes, I found the place where you can turn the ads off, but only some ads.  There are still recommendations and the off screen is not James Joyce or Emily Dickinson -- no, it's a Dyson ad for a vacuum!",Unbelievably AWFUL AD Machine -- I paid money for this??????;;;;;;

Review: Stopped  working but Amazon was great about replacing it. Called on Saturday and had my new one on Monday. Hope this one works better.
Title;;;;;;: Stopped working but Amazon was great about replacing it;;;;;;

Excellent for my erotic reading.

Review: I still don't how to make the screen a little brighter it's too dark! I've called tech support twice and I'm still not satisfied. I will most likely return for a differ t kindle. It doesn't have a brightness button and that bothers me.
Title;;;;;;: Needs brightness button on kindle paper white;;;;;;

Rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars,"Love it, nothing else to say!!!",Five Stars;;;;;;

Review: Just an ad for Amazon products.

I loved my old kindle. So I decided to buy a new one. I am really excited to get it. I have amazon prime so my package should take two day excluding sundays. I ordered this on 12/27 and was expecting it today 12/31. Well it is not here and I will not be receiving it until 1/2  because ups does not deliver on new years day. You dropped the ball on this one amazon. Maybe if you would have shipped it Monday instead of yesterday it would have arrived on time. Also this is not first time this has happened.
Title;;;;;;: With amazon prime it would be nice to receive it on time.;;;;;;

Review: What happened to WHISPERNET?! I have the previous kindle and (not that it needs replacement though ive had it for about 5 years) but i wanted to have the touch. Ive been researching in the hopes of finding theres a whipernet available version but it doesnt seem to be the case. :'( i will never get rid of my current 5 yr old kindle!

This is mostly my fault I imagine. I want to get started but I find the directions on how to start confusing. Right now I'm stuck on being connected with Wi-Fi. My Kindle was a gift. I am an  older user (85) and often find electronic mechanisms more difficult to operate than younger persons seem to do.

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"No matter what the advertisements say, THE ONLY ADVANTAGE FOR E-BOOKS IS CONVENIENCE.  Otherwise, the longed for process of getting a book, opening it, reading the blurbs on the  covers, reading  across pages, jumping from page 9 to 153 and back, is JUST NOT AVAILABLE. I would not consider using an eBook even for school texts.. I can't underline or comment on the side! I am not a Luddite, I am curious and accepting of progress, but eBooks is not it, because there is so much more to books than convenience!",this is progress... or is it?;;;;;;

Review: Seems difficult to use - NO INSTRUCTIONS providedYou must have  some kind of knowledge  - I sure can not figure how to use.Guess it saves money to not have instructions in the box. Need to go online to chat with someone everytime you have a question

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"Extremely disappointed both with the device and support.  It is completely non-functional.  I received Kindle (7th Generation) less than a year ago however it was purchased 1 year and 2 weeks ago so is no longer covered under warranty.  Barely used it and it has been handled with care.  Amazon offered that if I sent back the device they would give me less than $5.00 credit toward the purchase of a new Kindle.Screen locked up; went through all the online steps to troubleshoot;" then after almost an hour on the phone
Review: with very long silences on the other end
Title;;;;;;: it could not be pinged and they had no other suggestions.  Have had a Sony eReader for nearly 10 years and it works perfectly
column4: so will go back to using it.""
column5: Extremely disappointed both with the device and support";;;;

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"The Kindle is everything Amazon says it is.  I have an older one, the one with the keys and no light.  It's getting on, nearly five years old now, and I'm starting to experience reduced usage time because the batteries are slowly dying and there is no way to replace them.I have over a hundred titles on my Kindle, and it is a pleasure to use.  I like the ability to look things up and make notes....So why only three stars?Last week, the last bookstore in town closed for lack of business.  People weren't interested enough in paper books to keep it open.  Paper books, anachronisms of the first degree: no batteries, no massive storage, no handy portability for more than two or three titles.And no need for anything but a pair of eyes to read them.That's why my faithful Kindle only gets three stars.  It let me be lazy and cheap and move away from books and into electronic storage and a screen...that once the batteries are down, is unreadable.Yes, it's okay.  What it encouraged me to do...  wasn't.  Yes, buy one: you might as well. Real books are going the way of dinosaurs.Just pray nothing damages our electronic data storage or we're literally up the creek and we won't know how to make a paddle.","Kindle, Wonderful and Terrible at the same time.";;;;;;
5.0 out of 5 stars,"THIS IS GREAT ,BOOKS ON TAP.",Five Stars;;;;;;

2.0 out of 5 stars,"I am still trying to figure out how to bookmark on my new Kindle. However, I did mange to find my opened book after I closed my kindle for the night.  Now I also have to learn how to put a book, when finished reading it, into the cloud.  Lots to learn.  So for now, I give my new Kindle a 2 star rating.  Actually, my old Kindle is much better.",my old Kindle is much better.;;;;;;

Review: Just needed it to light up

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"My kindle is a few years old and I loved it, but the screen broke (opened my case one day and half the screen was blank) and the only way to read the books I bought is to buy a new one. I'm going back to traditional paper books. If a paperback gets ruined it's only $3 to replace not $80.",Fun While It Lasted;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"I am not happy with this reader.  I should have researched better, but thought I could read at night but can't without a light on.  The dicrispiton said no glare can read in any light.  It was my error to not search further.  I didn't start using my reader till after 30 days so couldn't send it back.  I don't use it very often.",Not Happy;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"we purchased 2 of these for our children who love to read and we can't keep enough books in the house for them. Unfortunately the low low price This review of 1 star reflects the quality of the product. One unit came infected with malware right out of the box purchased as new thru Amazon Prime and was unusable. The second was difficult to set up browsing at our local library but once I found a round about way I was able to check out books. I discovered that even though a library book is checked out Kindle still requires you to set up an account (including personal information) in order to read a book that is not associated with Amazon. The book belongs to the county library not Amazon. This reader was purchased for a child who does not have an Amazon account and does not need one. The screen was difficult to read and the refresh rate was horrible. Any slight touch on the screen cased it to blink, flash and break up. I would not suggest purchasing this product even if you are tech wavy, it's just not worth the effort. We are a big Amazon family and purchase products regular from them and plan to continue. I am just very disappointed and a bit shocked they would support a product as poor as this.",very dissappointed in product;;;;;;

Review: Awesome product! Thanks!!

Perhaps I'm missing something as to how to manipulate the visitbility of the screen, but if not, this is a drawback in my view.",It's very light and easy to read using one hand;;;;;;
3.0 out of 5 stars,"The Kindle 6"" Glare-Free is nice. However, my previous Kindles had text to speech. That I miss.",Three Stars;;;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"First the battery needs to be constantly recharged if you are using the backlight, which is most of the time.  The unit does mini-freezes constantly when trying to play simple games.  When reading you have to consciously avoid toughing any part of the screen or you will either turn a page back, forward, or most usually find yourself in a ""menu"" that you have to spend time getting the heck out of.If you have large fingers, trying to point to a single word for a definition invariably results in your highlighting a whole section of works, so you have to lose more time exiting that area.While touchscreens may be OK for cell phones, they are a complete disaster for e readers.  Games such as Every Word become impossible to use as one advances to new levels.  The letters become so long a line at the bottom that you often trigger hitting the margin, thus moving to yet another menu you don't want.  One would think Amazon would have tested this inane system of book reading and game playing before sticking this junk on the world.I sorely miss my old reader that had the tabs on the side for advancing each page, that pre-loaded words into Every Word, that made editing, etc. simple.  Now it is a complete, utter disaster.  Shame on Amazon.",Worse Product in their Line;;;;;;

So, if you are sitting in the sun all day and want something to read on, I suppose this is the product for you.  Otherwise, spend the extra bucks for the Paperwhite. Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"I used to LOVE my Kindle until I realized that Amazon does not really care about quality of user experience.It is very difficult to send feedback, so if there is a problem with the way the system works, a specific feature, etc. there is little recourse, and it seems that Amazon intentionally makes it hard to find. There are lots of problems with the system. Read below for some examples...The touch screen (and lack of keyboard which makes typing slow and tedious) is horrible and imprecise and I detest it. I have sent Amazon feedback and requested that they continue making the Kindle Keyboad, but they have phased out all non-touch models anyway. For many people a touch screen is just not a viable option, and for me it is highly annoying--like when I lean over and strand of my hair brushes the page and skips two chapters ahead completely losing my place in the book (WTF!) making it extremely time consuming to get back to the page I was on without accidentally reading ahead and spoiling it. It is especially horrible when that happens in books that have very long chapters, or have sections and chapters and have been improperly formatted by the Kindle system. If dust gets on your screen, or a hair, or something that can't be blown off with a breath, you will have to actually turn the Kindle off to remove it, or risk hopelessly losing your current page.The Kindle App for Android is pretty bad, too. Definitions are rarely displayed properly, and when they are it is only the first few words, so you have to click and wait for it to load the full definition if you actually want to see word origin or anything useful. Also, the pop-up could be decent if you could then highlight a word within it and it would show the definition of that, BUT there is actually no way at all to look up a word when viewing the definition of another word because things cannot be highlighted to view definitions from the page it takes you to! It is INFURIATING, and the only way that I can see to send feedback is to go through Amazon.com and email or call from there.There are so many negatives, and outright glitches that just don't get fixed, but there is also a HUGE deficit of useful features that could be easily integrated into the system. Connection with Google Drive for example would be an excellent way to organize highlights and notes (which are almost useless in the form that the Kindle stores and displays them).Recently my Kindle has been telling me that I can't open more than half of the books that I have purchased from the Kindle... because ""they are registered to a different user"" and I am not looking forward to, and don't have time to figure out why that's happening.I have been more and more disappointed with Kindle over time, but I hope they read this review and actually start trying to get on track again. If they don't read this review, then I hope Google reads it and picks up the torch!",Here's to hoping they actually read this;;;;;;

Rating: 2.0 out of 5 stars,"I had high expectations, and I realize that for fifty bucks I shouldn't have. The screen is not white like in the picture, more like grey. When you turn the page there's no fancy animation, just a black flash of the screen and then you're on the next page. Doesn't work with all books. I bought it for college, and my hope was to read my Java textbook with it because the physical book is HUGE... Couldn't read it because it wasn't compatible. I figure that's because of the pictures in the book. Does not display any color, and you can't read at all in the dark. Battery life is amazing, I'll give it that. Left it on for weeks and it was still running. If you want to just read basic books with no pictures in them, and aren't expecting actual tablet quality, this works just fine. If you want to read something with pictures in it... it may not be compatible. Don't buy with high expectations. It's pretty slow and blinks at you when you try to do anything with it. But, you can read books with it. Just didn't fit my purpose. Luckily it's only fifty bucks so I'm not super mad.",Didn't fit my purpose.;;;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"It's a good thing this is advertised as having no glare in bright sunlight, because you will need bright sunlight to see the screen.  It is impossible to read in a dim room -- or on a dim plane, or any other dim place where you'd like to enjoy the convenience of an e-reader.  Forget reading in bed while your spouse sleeps, unless you want to buy a battery-eating clip-on light. The screen isn't even bright enough to read in a room with the lights down somewhat low. You'll need a reading lamp. I saw the comments about ""no light,"" but for some reason I thought it would have a basic brightness control setting in the menu like the Kindle app on my phone (which also doesn't have a physical light). Nope. No light means no back lit screen, no brightness control.I enjoy using the Kindle app on my phone when I travel or wait in an office somewhere & thought I'd treat myself to a real Kindle with a bigger screen. Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"Really, Amazon?  You took away the battery connection?  REALLY?!!  I'd really like to smack someone upside the head with this thing. Except the lighted case is for the 'old' kindle touch and not the 'new' kindle touch, because some genius decided to not include the connection pads on the new one. I don't like reading on a backlit screen, especially at night. It strains my eyes. I'm pretty sure there are eleventy billion other people who feel the same way. I'm sure, at some point, a third-party manufacturer will come up with a working lighted case with it's own power source. I'm pissed that it's completely unnecessary and kind of a jerk move. Rating: 2.0 out of 5 stars,"I was very disappointed with this gadget. It isn't any brighter than previous Kindles, and it is the devil to use. Half the time I can't figure out how to get to more than half of my books. For my money, and I have bought seven Kindles though right now I own only five, the 3G is far and away the best, except for the drive capability of the Kindle 1, which allowed the exchange of several different data disks. That allowed me to put all my cookbooks on one disk, all my pulp fiction on another, all my religious stuff on another, and so forth. If Amazon came out with a Kindle that had the good points of the Kindle I and the good points of the 3G, I would dance with joy . . . and I am 71 and have a bad back and bad knees.",Doesn't Live Up to its Promises;;;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"DO NOT BUY A KINDLE! I bought a Kindle Paperwhite device to download a txt book and when I tried to purchase it, I was only allowed to download it to either my Android or Mac device (via a Kindle reading app). When I contacted an Amazon customer support rep (Ryan) to find out why, I was told that each Kindle device has limited access to only the Kindle materials which each publisher allows. I was outraged! This is false advertising on the part of Amazon's marketing team, which suggests to buyers that by making a purchase, they will have complete access to the wide assortment of Kindle compatible materials and do not overtly forewarn of the device's limitations. So buyer beware: if you buy a Kindle product, you may or may not have access to the Kindle material you want to purchase digitally. You're better off just downloading the free app to an alternate device and saving your money.",WHAT A RIP OFF!;;;;;;

I would have taken that blindly but guess what, I feel the marketing tacting uxed to upsell me is not the ideal customer service we are accostumed to. I just want the same basic I have or an equivalent, I can buy it new for $75 on your site! ""We are sorry sir, those are not an option for replacement but you can buy a fire for $300+ or a paperwhite for $150 which are a great value. Rating: 2.0 out of 5 stars,"The Seventh Generation Kindle was my first. I bought it, because my tech-saavy son recommended it., knowing that I was not enamored by the expensive iPad, wanted a device mainly to read books, and saw no point in paying hundreds of dollars for functions I did not intend to use.I guess you get what you pay for.  The Kindle I bought for has turned out to be profoundly disappointing.The so-called ""glare-free"" screen is all but invisible except in the brightest and most direct light.  Brightness cannot be adjusted, and it is not even remotely readable at any angle other than head-on.  Do not expect to use this device on airplanes, in bed at at night, or sitting in your favorite chair in a dimly lit corner.  You will go blind if you try.Then, there is the software, which (strangely) is inferior to the apps Kindle provides for other devices.  Do not expect this Kindlle to be as responsive or as precise as the Kindle apps on your iPhone, iPad, or Mac.  It will be anything but.The bottom line is this: I returned the Seventh Generation Kindle and bought the Paperwhite instead.  At least I can read the Paperwhtie.  Other than that, there is little difference.",because my tech-saavy son recommended it.;;;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"I have a second generation Kindle that lasted two years with very, very light use.  It was fine when it was new, but now when I try to use it, whether or not it will actually open is hit and miss, mostly miss.  It wants to reboot almost every time it's turned on and occasionally it will reboot in the middle of being used.  Sometimes, it magically turns itself on without being asked to, which, of course, runs the battery down so that the next time I pick it up, there's no juice.  Amazon help has given me instructions on how to reboot using the charger, but that doesn't always work.  Even if it did, who wants an e-reader for which one has to carry the charger at all times.  A friend of mine has a Fire that refused to take a charge a few days after the 1-year warranty expired.  She bought an I-Pad.  I'm buying the cheapest version Kindle available only because I've already paid for a large number of books that I haven't yet read and some others that I've read but want to keep for reference.  If I weren't so invested in books for it, there's no way I'd buy another KIndle.",Kindles are junk;;;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"I love my old, basic-model Kindle, and I've refused to buy any higher version, as much as I covet the Paperwhite display. And do you know why? It's not because I'm cheap. It's because I HATE TOUCHSCREENS. I want to press physical buttons. I do not want to get my greasy fingerprints all over the very same screen I am trying to read. And now you've gone and taken the buttons away. It looks like when my current Kindle dies, I'll be shopping for a refurbished old model and not buying new, even though I'd willingly pay a premium for the buttons I want. Do you hear me, Amazon? I WILL PAY MORE MONEY IF YOU TAKE THE TOUCHSCREEN AWAY. Keep that in mind the next time you decide to ""upgrade"" your merchandise.",BRING BACK THE BUTTONS!;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"My original kindle has been stolen, so I read the reviews here, and found that I will not buy another kindle until Amazon brings back the page turning buttons, and the buttons to select items on the screen. I don't like touch screens and I don't care why other people do. The only value of free speech is to disagree with all of the people who are wrong. The touch screen on my kindle fire is extremely annoying because the artsy-fartsy frisco designer insists on tiny buttons one fourth the size of a normal mans' finger, even when there is plenty of room for much larger buttons. Art, or is it hubris, has trumped function. It seems that Amazon is beginning to acquire the habits that drove General Motors to bankruptcy;" they want you to buy what they want to sell instead of selling what you want to buy. I don't have to have a kindle. I still want one

Rating: 3.0 out of 5 stars,"I have been considering purchasing an e-reader for a few years now, however, each time I read the reviews and consider all the additional pieces, such as cover, charger, etc... that I need to buy, I have finally decided to just purchase my books one at a time.  I still like the idea that I can open a book, turn to my book-mark and continue reading where I stopped.  If I come to a word that I don't understand I can grab my Webster's Dictionary and look it up, wow...I never have to worry about my book running low on battery power and so long as I pay the energy bill each month I usually have plenty of light to see the pages..  I can also pick it up and carry it anywhere and even drop it without damaging it and, my book does not come with any Unwanted Advertisements or useless warranties to purchase.  One more important item to consider is that I can either keep my book, pass it on to a friend, or donate it to charity. In short, this is just not for me.",By a Real Book!;;;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"I don't really understand the use of this thing. You can read a book on this thing and literally nothing else. The screen was far too dim indoors to be of practical use and there was no way of changing it. I also don't see why you wouldn't just buy the book. Most people only read one book at a time anyway, so why do I need my entire library at all times? We bought this for my mom, and we want to return it immediately.I have to give Amazon credit for this one. They took a device with 90's technology, slapped WiFi on it, and charge $70 for it. I had a Palm Pilot fifteen years ago that has more functionality than this thing. I'm not anti-Amazon in any way. My sister has a Fire HD and loves it, but you are far better off buying something else even if it costs you a little more.",Get Something Else;;;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"Would give this negative stars if I could.First of all you have to load the books from your cloud account one at a time, and I have over 1000 books so it took 12 hours. Even loading it in 10 book blocks takes that long. They really should find some way to assist customers with this but just say ""Sorry"" if you ask.Second, I found that my ""Active content"" GAMES would not download to this new 7th Generation Kindle so I called to see where to find the Games for this generation. I thought perhaps I would have to switch to Aps like the Fire instead of the Active Content, or something like that.  YOU WON'T BELIEVE THIS!  The 7th Gen ""New"" Kindle DOES NOT DO GAMES OR ACTIVE CONTECT OR APS OR ANYTHING!  JUST BOOKS AND DOCUMENTS!  My 4th Gen even does Active Content!Apparently this 7th Gen Kindle is not as ""Evolved"" as the 4th Generation that I have been using for 2 years. To be honest it looks and sounds just like the old ""Touch"" that they dropped over a year ago for being too behind the times. They say it isn't but it works the same way and has the same limitations. But, even the Touch did Active Content for Games, etc.Anyway...look out...I just got stuck and can't return it fast enough. This leaves me with a dying 4th Gen and no where to go, but somehow a ""downgrade"" just is not going to do it.",Does not do Games like the old ones do.;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"QUESTION...trying to decide which kindle to buy for someone else. I have a keyboard kindle and my son has a fire, so we are well versed in kindles. My question is this....is there a lighter case that you can buy for this version of kindle? All the cases for the ""7th generation"" kindle (which I assume this is) are very specific to say that they will not fit older version kindles. However, none of them have a built in light. The only cases I can find with the built in light are for the 5th generation kindle.  I am having a very hard time determining 1) will a 5th generation compatible case with built in light will fit this kindle, or 2) is there a case with a built in light for this version?  Any feedback would be much appreciated.",Question about cases;;;;;;

Rating: 1.0 out of 5 stars,"Top half of my screen is frozen all of a sudden. Tried restarting multiple times and the issue persists. I have used this for about year and a half. At best, they could offer me another kindle for $87.One of the supervisor even told me that the device lasted for 18 months and I should be happy about it! There is not guarantee that even if I buy another one, I may not run into the same issue.My device has always remained in the case from Day 1 and I haven't dropped it or abused it. Sorry, if this is the quality of the product I don't think I'll buy another Kindle again!",Very disappointed that when I called customer service;;;;;;

1.0 out of 5 stars,"My husband purchased the Kindle 5 for me as a Christmas present 2 years ago.  I was very sick at the time and only just got around to using it.  After using it for less than a month, the screen randomly broke (no physical impact).  I have heard stories online of many others having this same experience, so it's clear there's a design flaw with the screen.  However, Amazon refused to provide a replacement, saying the warranty had expired (regardless of the fact that the device has only been in use for a month).  In the past, my experience with Amazon customer service has been exceptional.  Disappointed to see that their commitment to customer satisfaction is waning.",Design Flaw but Amazon Refused to Replace;;;;;;
